product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: We love the camera but had a lot of difficulty setting ...
review_body: We purchased a Foscam about 6 months ago. We love the camera but had a lot of difficulty setting it up on our own. The instructions are not written for non-tech davy individuals like ourselves. We called Foscam support and there was a 20 minute wait but it was definitely worth the time. John was very helpful and fixed our problem with ease. He connected to our computer remotely and was able to do it without having to try to explain it. I definitely would not have been able to understand it. We recommend this camera and the Foscam support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Saved Grandma but camera died after 2 yrs
review_body: Worked for 2 yrs as a 'granny cam' and saved her after a fall. I was able to scan around until I found her on the floor unable to get up. I summoned help. Yes the installation is infuriating and hopeless to talk not too savvy computer people through remotely. But my main beef is that the camera died after 2 yrs of light use ... display degenerated into vertical streaks then nothing.  Exactly after 2 yr coverage window provided by my Citibank card, clever engineers. The other 3 Foscam cameras are going strong, the 2 older/lower res models after 3 yrs. Sigh, I guess I'll buy another one because there is *still* no competitor at reasonable (<$100) price that is more robust. If I had time, I'd tear this crap down to figure out what fried.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Stay away from this company. There are others on the market with a much easier installation system. Hours and hours of time spent on the internet attempting to learn how to setup this device is plain silly. After 8 hours of on and off attempts,  it still does not connect correctly. I'm going to toss this junk in the trash and go with someone else.  If you want a baby monitor this is your device. If you want to remote view your home on a smart phone forget it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buy the newer model if you want all the listed functionality.
review_body:
Like some of the others have said, it can be a pain in the butt to set up and I am pretty technically inclined. After an hour or two with some youtube videos and some forum searching, I got it up and running and connected through one of the apps.

Unfortunately, according to the manufacturer, this is an older model that is lacking in some firmware upgrades - without which leaves the camera lacking some needed bug fixes and usability. Which irks me just a bit, since I didn't know this prior to purchase.

I also couldn't get the thing to take a picture and email me upon motion detection either - despite hours of tinkering, reading, and testing.

I gave it three stars, because it is nice to have for live viewing and the pan/tilt let's me see multiple rooms in my house from a single position.

If having all the bells and whistles doesn't concern you, then it may not be bad for the price. Otherwise, buy the newer models.

review_body: Setting up Foscams is not for the novice user. I happen to be technical and have dealt with Foscams in the past so I was able to get the camera set up and working. It worked great as a monitor in my baby's room until it died after 2 years. I expect these cameras to last longer. The camera is out of warranty and their US Support team was not helpful. Have had other models that lasted longer. I only recommend this camera if you don't plan to use it very long.  Update: Stupidly, I ordered another one of these cameras hoping they improved the design. After less than 4 months the "new" camera died just like the other one. Seems to be related to losing wifi connectivity. Don't waste your money!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Pros: + Very easy set up. + Has survived outdoors (under an awning with no weather casing) for more than a year in extreme conditions. + Works with all IP Camera software I've tried so far including iSpy and WebcamXP (On Win 7 and 10).  Cons: - Not powered directly through ethernet. - BIG PROBLEM: Anytime the cameras sensor is exposed to any light remotely bright (IE; sidewalk on a sunny day) the camera freezes and reboots. This is NOT an isolated problem and has yet to be fixed. Do yourself a favor and find another option for the money.  UPDATE August 22, 2015: I updated the firmware as requested, and the camera still freezes and reboots when the camera sees a bright light. I cannot and will not ever recommend this camera until Foscam decides to do the right thing and recall of these cameras that are affected and replace them free of charge. There is no reason this should happen.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Initially had some difficulty setting up,camera for remote access from outside home network. Working with Walter, at Foscam customer service, we were able to make the necessary changes to allow for remote access in about 5 minutes! These procedures, while not overly complicated, are not clearly explained in the Foscam installation guide. The steps were not difficult, but not intuitive enough for a reatively tech savy customer to be able to undertake successfully without help. Walter said he performs this same level oh help,for the same issue many times a day!
Overall, very satisfied with the installation and performance of the Foscam camera!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: High end hardware, low end software, interface and exposure to unknown third party
review_body: I had such great hopes for this product, I'm VERY tech savvy so I was able to set this up quickly and easily myself. But, once off my own wifi network it was impossible to get on. I went through trouble shooting etc. I was never able to get the sound working, they want you to download a random piece of software from an open source third party generic website. This made me VERY uncomfortable, why isn't it included in the software for the device? They do offer a 1-800 number for free set-up help! Wonderful offer, but I'm not comfortable calling a stranger about setting up my camera into my home. One of my tech friends was able to hack this in under 10 minutes and see into my home. The camera it's self is very high end, solid and works well. You can easily move and change views with the online interface even if it is really low rent. You def get what you pay for in terms of software, shame since the hardware is high end.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Nice camera for indoor use. Not built to withstand outdoor use. I use it in my garage to keep an eye on my tools and motorcycle. Also works great as a nanny cam. Suund and picture is good and the Foscam app for iPhone is excellent. Also works with MobLinCam app and Blue Iris.

It has a WPS button and I found it easy to set-up with my router that also has a WPS button. The image is more than adequate for my purposes and it connects well via wireless wifi through the garage wall about 40 feet away. Longer distances might require a cheap range extender. The only thing it lacks is an on-board memory capability.. The e-mail on alert works well, although it can false alert if you have the sensitivity up. I cannot port forward, so I cannot control this remotely. The e-mail alert works fine though. A good camera at a decent price. We'll see how it holds up over time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not too bad to setup, great value
review_body:
To start with, I do not have a computer or IT background. Prior to this camera, I had no idea what port forwarding was or any idea how to setup a webcam. Despite this, I went ahead and purchased this camera, and so far I have not been disappointed.

I purchased this camera recently for use as a baby cam. I was initially apprehensive due to all of the cautionary reviews on here regarding the difficulty of set up. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was not that difficult to set up for both home network viewing, as well as outside viewing from a DDNS site. For home viewing, the setup CD included with the camera was easy to get the camera up and running.

For external viewing, the Youtube video by AwkwardHamster was excellent. I followed this video and easily created my own site for remote viewing. Picture quality is good, and the sound is ok. The two way audio leaves a lot to be desired, but from my limited experience shopping around, the price more than makes up for this camera's shortcomings.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Set Up Is Not User Friendly If You Aren't Tech Savvy
review_body:
My camera arrived yesterday and I had the tech team remotely install it on my computer. After being on hold for almost 20 minutes and then the install took about 30 minutes, my camera was all set up for wireless at my house and was working well. That part was great! At the end of the call I asked the tech how to set up the camera so we could view it from our smart phones and I was told to Google it. There are two people in my house and neither of us are tech savvy at all. We "Googled" and "Yahoo'ed" all night, but are still clueless. I'm afraid/ashamed that we have watched several videos and are still not be able to figure out how to set this up. We do not need to watch the camera from inside our house since we are already there! I will call tech support again tonight and if they aren't willing to help us, this camera will be promptly sent back.

I would love recommendations from anyone regarding a user friendly camera even if the price is much higher. A camera that we can't view when we are out of the house is worthless to us.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Did some research and figured out that the power adapter is bad. Called the manufacturer and asked for the replacement ...
review_body:
The speaker failed working after a week. I did'n not pay attention, because I was not using it that often.
A few months ago the camera failed working. The red light in the started blinking. Did some research and figured out that the power adapter is bad. Called the manufacturer and asked for the replacement because the camera is under 2 year warranty as their website stated.
First they told me that there is only 1 year warranty. Then I have pinpointed their website where it clearly states that the part has 2 year warranty: "the FI8910W has an upgraded and higher quality external housing as well as an included 2 year extended warranty".
http://foscam.us/foscam-fi8910w-white-wireless-ip-camera.html
Now they are saying that the warranty is for the camera and not the accessories?! The power adapter is not an accessory it's a part of the camera, it's a part of FI8910W, you can not use the camera without the power adapter.
The guy I was talking too was from india named "harry foster", and you think I believed him?! :)
Then he wanted me to email my receipt, but told me afterwards that they won't send me the adapter even if I do so, that's
Very cheap manufacturer!!!!
Stay away from them!!!
If any per fails, don't waste you time checking for the replacement under warranty, just buy it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: 3rd grader could design better software however hardware seems solid
review_body:
Ok so I have had this for a year now but never took it out of the box to set it up thinking of the hours it would take to set it up. My fears came true as it took a long time to get this thing working to my needs. You should be able to get video streaming in 5 mins, but its the other things (email alerts, alarms, motion detection, video recording etc) that are really bad design.I will start with the cons and then mention the pro
Cons:
Really terrible user interface
The software that comes with it, the active x controls that you need to enable to use. The fact that in order to have full functional editing you can only use internet explorer. Firefox and Chrome just outright dont show some of the basic options.
Did I say the UI is terrible. Let me qualify it has nothing to do with the aesthetics. Pure functionality is so unreliable. You will have to browse through forums and quick google searches to get the fixes from other users.
Downloaded the latest firm ware but it does not help with the UI issues a bit.
Alot of good options are listed in configuration and device management but there is no simple or intuitive way of enabling them.

Pros:
Video Quality (640x480) is decent and flows decently on wifi. (bare minimum expectation since that is what the product is supposed to be)
Night vision is excellent.
Range is decent on a G router.
So far no failure noted on camera rebooting (as some users have reported)

Overall, I am very disappointed given that no effort has been spent for a professional or at least predictably working software. The hardware seems fine, the camera rotates and all remotely. If you ok paying the money purely for the hardware and willing to spend time figuring out the hacks to get the most functionality out of the product, than go for it.
Otherwise I would recommend trying something else.

review_body:
After two days and countless hours of trying to get this to work I finally got it done. The setup instructions are horrible. Apparently in order for you to remotely view the camera it has to go through your internet router. If you have two routers you have to use port forwarding to see your camera remotely from your phone. I'll save everyone who is having difficulty the hassle and attach the link I used that finally provided a solution. http://foscam.us/forum/can-t-connect-cameras-remotely-using-netgear-router-fios-t4298.html

Other than that, the camera is great, especially for what you pay for. If you want a camera that is truly plug and play though, without the hassle, I suggest Dlink.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: For $50, reasonable.  But not for the unitiated.
review_body:
I bought this for my mother so she could keep an eye on her cats while she is on overnight trips. The setup is definitely not the most user friendly, it involves going into router settings. If you are getting this for somebody who has only the very basic computer skills, they will most likely have extreme difficulty setting it up. I was able to set it up for her in about 30 minutes though. Having only basic understanding of networking/port forwarding, I was able to figure it out with only a little bit of trouble. Still, this is definitely NOT "plug and play".

Once it is set up, it works pretty well. It is nice to be able to remotely change the orientation of the camera and to also set it to "auto scan" a room. However, the frame rate is quite low. I also attempted to setup the audio capability, but the directions were quite vague and I didn't feel like bothering.

So with all of its shortcomings, I still give this a 4 star review because of the price. There are clearly other camera products that are more user friendly and have better performance, but for $50 I believe this company delivered on my expectations.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Beautiful little camera. Amazing quality. One of our cats was 'doing things out of the box', but which one? as we have 5... So, a camera was the solution. After reading many reviews, I picked this one https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B006ZP8UOW/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0
Setting up on the network was a snap. I am using one of my old laptops using Ubuntu Linux, and set it up, first using FTP to test, but I configured Ubuntu so it records the stream from the camera, but only when activated through motion. Logged into the camera directly to make sure the area I want is visible. When we go to bed, I turn on on the recording program.. It switches to night mode automatically, and , as stated, only records when there is motion. The quality is amazing. clear as day, and barely uses any hard drive space for the videos. If something happens at night, I just have to review the videos to see who was the culprit..Very happy, amazing quality, fast shipping and a very reasonable price. Have had it now for several weeks, and it has been performing beautifully. Strongly recommended.

They have been very reliable - I half expected to see some issues reacquiring the network particularly after power outages/reboots. I access them on average once per day, and once have I been unable to access one of them (the other was still working so I knew the network was up) and then it seemed to have corrected itself after a couple days.

They were a little tricky to setup - initially one had some difficulty connecting to my wireless. I would just start the setup over and eventually it worked and no issues since. I use the fosgate free ddns service and that seems to work fine.

review_body:
If you buy this after reading the negative reviews, then it's your own fault that you just burned $60.
It took my brother and I several hours to get it to work, and that was just barely. We were never able to get the app to work, so it's useless as I specifically needed it to watch my pups while I am at work.
If you have a basic knowledge of computers, you won't get this to work at all. And if cannot get a wired connection to your laptop or whatever you use, then you won't get this to work. I have a Surface Pro that is wireless and no ports for ethernet cables. My brother had to bring up his laptop and connect everything through the router first.
Do NOT believe all the reviewers praising the call center. They won't answer any questions; they just demand to remote into your computer. No thanks, I'm not letting some rude stranger remote into my computer. I ended up hanging up on the guy.
Wish I could give this a negative review.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Had it for a weekend, and returned it as basically useless for my application
review_body:
The firmware revision (the newest at the time), which did not allow going back to a previous version, would not email pictures out if motion was detected. Kind of worthless as I was setting the device up in a spot that has had numerous break-ins. I have another Foscam Wireless IP Camera (FI9821W V2), that works great for this purpose. I had bought the FI8910W thinking I would save a few bucks, but all it did was waste my time.

Spend the extra money for the higher definition of the FI9821W V2. It is an H.264 Series camera, giving better compression ratios than the MPEG variety.

Foscam cameras generally seem to be of high quality, but for me at least, the firmware updating procedure is somewhat difficult. None of the firmware updates are dated, but rather cryptic version numbers. For instance for my FI9821W V2, the latest firmware update is 2.x.1.119, and it says "At least 2.x.2.8 is required to update to 2.x.1.119".

When I look at my camera, the Application Firmware Version is 2.21.1.143
and my System Firmware Version 1.5.2.11

Okay, you tell me if my firmware is old, or new..... I am thinking that the people that work in the labs bringing this firmware up should actually sit down with someone that lives in the real world and come up with a simpler way to name these updates, like oh maybe using dates in the description.

I called Foscam support and they said hard reset the camera, so I hard reset and went through the entire config process again.  Within 12hrs both were no longer available over wifi.  Unfortunately these are going back, I need something a bit more reliable for security, but even then 12hrs and having to reset is not good for any purpose. review_headline: Spend the extra money and buy the newer version.
review_body: I Had the camera for a while and didn't get a chance to set it up until about a month ago. I spent A lot of time trying to figure out why the camera didn't work outside of the network. Issue, I set the camera to use the Static IP but after about 2 days it would crash and the setting would revert back to DHCP. I have update the Firmware and the UI to the latest version but the camera(s) are still crashing(revert back to DHCP). This has been going on for 21/2 weeks. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This Foscam is a good companion to a home security system to remotely view home interiors from a remote location.  I also own an older Linksys cam but I like the Foscam much better because it has better sharpness and a pan and tilt feature with infrared LEDs. I set a static IP address so it's easy to find on the network. Use port forwarding on your home router to send Internet connections to the camera if remote access is desired. If you just want it as a baby monitor there's no need for Internet access.  If you do set up remote access by all means use cryptic passwords so that outsiders can't sneak inside, virtually speaking.  If you aren't familiar with setting up network devices you may want to get someone who is familiar to help you. This has other features such as motion detection and the ability to take photos from the remote viewing screen. see the Foscam website for complete information.

review_body: The camera worked great when I was at home but I could not get it to connect remotely.  I read how to access remotely and also watched several videos and still could not get it to connect.  I thought I was purchasing something that would connect easily as some of my other devices. (Example:  I have a thermostat that I can look at and change no matter where I'm at.)  It was too confusing for me (static IP, port forwarding, DDNS-way over my head!) and read on the Foscam forum that several people have the same issues.  The problem might be with my router, ISP or that I'm not smart enough but I'm extremely disappointed that it was not as easy to set up as it describes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I wanted a cheap camera I could use in the garage for an extra set of eyes. I want to someday get one of the devices to open/close my garage door via my smart phone, but I'm too OCD and would want to see with my own eyes that the garage door was closed if I ever used one of these devices. I didn't want to pay a couple hundred for a camera that would be in the garage so I got this one.

The camera is great! The pan/tilt is amazing and I can see everything. I'm taking off a star because the audio is a little weak. The picture is not super clear but you should already know that from the specs.

I'm not taking off stars for setting it up, but this is amazingly hard. Like WOW, hard. You should probably be a Rocket Scientist if you want to do it on your own. Wow wow wow! I let my pride waste over 10 hours of my life trying to set it up on my own. I could not get the port forwarding to work so I could only see it at home. I watched several youtube videos and read forums and blah blah blah. I even watched some kids video on youtube about my router, I was determined to set this up myself. Wow, impossible. Finally called for help and the tech help was great. Walter? (I'm bad at remembering names) was able to fix it very quickly and now all is good. I'm not ashamed to say I needed Tech help because OMG this is super hard and impossible to do on your own.

My problem with port forwarding was this: I have a Netgear router and I set up everything like they tell you on the forums and FAQ, etc. I checked my ports via port checking websites and they all said my port was not open. What I didn't think about was I have cable internet and my modem has a built in router that I have never used. You can work with your router all day long but it won't work if you don't also change settings in your cable/dsl/etc modem! I wish I had read that somewhere!!

If you want a basic quality camera for watching your baby or an area of your home, this should be good. Just go straight to Tech to set it up and save yourself time. If you want high quality, DETAIL, clear images then go with Nest Cam/Drop Cam, Canary. You pay more for the detailed image and unbelievably easy setup.

Oh, and I had to also watch videos and read forums for setting up motion notifications and email. I hope if you are reading this you get the picture that this camera is a lot of work to get working but is good for basic viewing once set up.e, this should be good. Just go straight to Tech to set it up and save yourself time. If you want high quality, DETAIL, clear images then go with Nest Cam/Drop Cam, Canary. You pay more for the detailed image and unbelievably easy setup.

Oh, and I had to also watch videos and read forums for setting up motion notifications and email. I hope if you are reading this you get the picture that this camera is a lot of work to get working but is good for basic viewing once set up.

review_body: I tend to give out a lot of five star reviews, not because I'm easily pleased but because if an item worked as advertised it deserves the stars. This camera is exactly that. It was little tricky to set up but not too confusing for someone who doesn't understand the nuances of remote forwarding, like myself.  Within an hour I had it set up for viewing through our home network and another hour later one could watch via a smart phone several states away. I find the picture is quality enough for what I paid. The controls work well on the computer at home, and a little slower on the app on the phone.  The night vision works great (hello little deer munching in my garden) and the camera works well for use in the house (hello kids jumping on the couch). I haven't set up the recording aspect yet, so when I've done that I'll revise my review. Meanwhile, it does everything I've asked, as advertised, and for what I feel is a fair price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Don't expect a secure camera, and never upgrade the firmware
review_body:
I had this camera for 2 years and the entire time I had it set up so I could log into it from my phone to check on the dog alone at home during the day.

While it worked great, it was famously insecure and I finally caught a login that looked dubious in the camera log (which is to say, it wasn't obviously from me), so I decided to upgrade the firmware.

Huge mistake.

I uploaded the correct firmware version to the camera, and used the most careful possible method -- which they caution you to do repeatedly since getting it wrong will straight brick the camera -- and that worked fine. The camera was sporting the new version.

Unfortunately once my login cookie expired I was permanently locked out of the camera. The reasoning is as follows: because my old password doesn't meet their new password requirements, which by the way, are arbitrary and awful, it won't log me in.

Here's a summary of how the login code works: grab username from input, grab password from input, make sure that the entered password meets the following regex: /((?=.*\d)(?=.*\D)|(?=.*[a-zA-Z])(?=.*[^a-zA-Z]))^.{6,12}$/
For the lazy that means it will reject a password of '$5rlK4vZIr 8.#k' but thinks 'Password1' is just great.

... Now, this isn't being tested on password change mind you, this is on an attempted login. What were they thinking?

I could go on for ages, but suffice to say: the update that made the camera 'secure' also made it impossible to use.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Came in handy in less than a week
review_body:
I am very pleased with this product. I bought it after I noticed some things missing around my house. I set up an FTP server on my computer and had it set to snap pictures of movement. 3 days later, I found pictures of one of my sister's friends. I reported it to the police, gave them the photos. Needless to say he's in jail. Anyway. Enough story time.
Pros:
It's compact

It looks nice

it includes hardware to be mounted on a wall or ceiling (i didnt use it, i just hid it on a bookshelf)

It's a breeze to set up if you know how to port forward and how to find the MAC address. (FTP is a different story, some routers don't like it)

It takes good enough pictures to provide evidence.

Has an app, and the camera can be adjusted remotely

IR nightvision works amazingly. My basement is the full length of my house (around 50-60 feet) and every single thing is illuminated well, it probably reaches much further because theres a glare on the back wall opposite the camera, but i havn't had a chance to test that.

There are plenty more pros, but those are the big ones for me. Now for the cons.
Cons:
Using the app to access the camera remotely can be a little sluggish.

If you arent familiar with your router settings page then it probably isnt super user friendly, however mine came with a card that would allow me to call a technician and have them set up 1 camera for me free of charge.

I also included a picture of it on my shelf with an airsoft gun for scale.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We got this camera to use as a baby monitor, because we were unwilling to pay what baby monitor manufacturers ask for, without adding value. We are very pleased.  The set-up is not as intuitive as a baby monitor, since it requires plugging it in to a PC to add the wireless network configuration and some security settings (user/password, which you should always change as Foscam's default passwords were infamously made public by hackers some time ago).  Once it is working, it does its job. You can access it from any PC connected to the same network, move it around, enable/diable night vision, etc. You can even ask for emails to be sent upon movement/sound detection. Foscam itself offers a DNS system so you can access your cam at a pre-determined web address from anywhere in the world! (or disable such feature if you are privacy concerned). I found that feature useful when we went away for a trip and used the camera at the front window to monitor traffic from/to the house (I was expecting valuable packages to be delivered while away!).  As a baby monitor we use it together with TinyCam Monitor (Pro) app on our Android phones, and it works like a charm. We can check whether the baby is asleep without having to enter the room and risk waking him up. The app does offer a lot more functionality, but I don't think it is fair mentioning those here, since it is the app's merit and not the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: After many hours cannot figure out how to use it. Nothing "quick" and "easy" about this product unless you work in computers
review_body: Well, if I wanted to sit at home and watch myself on camera this would be fantastic.  Unfortunately I want to be able to access the camera while I am AWAY from home. This however, is apparently impossible to set up if you don't know anything about DDNS, port forwarding and a million other foreign topics and acronyms. After spending hours and hours trying to learn all of this jargon and attempting to fix all the appropriate settings I still cannot figure it out. The user manual is not at all helpful because there are too many different products out there for them to cover.  Plus, you have to adjust settings on multiple devices and websites and for someone who doesn't know computers or the inner workings of the internet it is nearly impossible to figure out.  First there is your internet service provider settings, then your router settings, then the camera settings, then you have to set up a new account on some website like no-ip, which I can't figure out how to use even after reading all their FAQs and customer support sections. Then there is your firewall and after researching that I still have no idea how to stop that from blocking my camera. I read up on port forwarding and thought I set it up properly but nothing is working. I give up. There is nothing "quick" and "easy" about this product. The manufacturers clearly were not talking about the average consumer. SOOOOO FRUSTRATED!

review_headline: We use this as a baby monitor and love it. Using the basic web browser interface is ...
review_body:
We use this as a baby monitor and love it. Using the basic web browser interface is pretty easy but if you want to use all of the features (like wifi and mobile app viewing) you will need some working knowledge of things like 'IP addresses" and "port forwarding" to really make it work well. While hundreds of apps claim to integrate with this camera, my experience is that only a couple work well. I use "Foscam Viewer" and love it.
Pros:
Inexpensive, IR 'nightvision', pan/tilt, wifi, ability to expand with multiple cams
Cons:
Difficult setup, needs to be reset sometimes when the power goes out

review_headline: Save your money - Difficult to setup and App is unstable
review_body: My advice would be to spend the extra money for a product that is easier to set up and has a well supported App.  The instructions for setup are horrible.  Set up was painful.  The instruction manual is 15 pages of setup and caveats for setting up ports, DDNS locations, etc.  Unless you have 90min of spare time and a background in IT, do not waste your money on this product.  In addition, I purchased product as new and it was clear that the product shipped was used.  The products already had names on them! The default names should be anonymous and the product I received was labeled as garage cam.  In addition, the manual does not inform you of the app to download.  You are left to guess among the plethora of Foscam apps on the itunes store.  Save your money and purchase a high quality Smart camera that does not require a background in IT, 90 minutes of setup, and has a stable APP.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Emailing motion detection events has bad flaws
review_body:
I bought this along with a similar Tenvis model. At first I though this was better as it seemed to offer more settings, but after setting it up to deliver images via Gmail I noticed a terrible flaw. Unlike the Tenvis, which will send a continuous flow of images to your email account when the camera detects motion, this Foscam model only sends 6 images right away, and then sends nothing for about a minute. During this time, you could potentially be missing out on important action that you want to see.

Scanning the Foscam forums, it would seem the only way to get around this is to set up FTP, but that would be quite an inconvenience for several reasons, the main being that I don't see an easy way of getting free online ftp hosting and a local ftp server is out of the question.

I also noticed the picture quality of the emailed images was poorer compared to the Tenvis.

Perhaps the Foscam is better in some other respects compared to the competition, but for my needs it's a no-brainer to stick with the cheaper Tenvis.

review_headline: Many Features and Worth the Price
review_body:
I use 4 of these to monitor my apartment. I paid around $70 each when I got mine. I have them setup with motion (free motion detection program with a lot of features) on my Debian server. For the size of the antenna on these, they have a good wifi connection distance (paired with my Asus AC-87RU). Night vision looks very well and automatically switches within a second of the room(s) being dark. I don't currently use the full potential of these, but am considering using the mic/speaker. I have them setup so I can see all of the cameras outside of my network (i.e, anywhere with my phone or other device).

Helpful links when I had set up motion for the first time:
http://www.lavrsen.dk/foswiki/bin/view/Motion/WorkingDevices
http://sirlagz.net/2013/02/12/quickie-getting-motion-working-on-the-raspberry-pi/
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1897786

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Ultimately, I had to return this model. It was very difficult to set up and it's not true wireless because it has to be hooked up to a router, and the way my home is set up, my modem is in my room--not an ideal place to put this camera.

The difficulty alone of having to 'port-forward' and set up all these crazy ip address things was enough to make me want to return it. But that's not really the worst of it.

I discovered that you can't even use this unless you're at home, on your wifi. The whole reason I got this setup was so that I could monitor my kitties while I was gone for the weekend... and I wanted it to be in the living room. Now I know why it was relatively cheap.

I downloaded a couple different apps to try logging in while I was away and I never could. That's when I read up a little on blog posts with people having similar trouble. Ultimately, it does say that you can't do it in the instructions.. not without some other crazy know-how anyway, or paying for it through a service.

Just too much trouble. It's basically a glorified web-cam, but not even that good considering no one else can log in and see you.

Pointless.

The only saving grace to this was their easy return policy. I do thank them for having that as an easy-to-do task.

review_headline: This webcam is great. I'm using it with Zoneminder and it was ...
review_body:
This webcam is great. I'm using it with Zoneminder and it was a very easy setup. The IR LEDs work great at night. The only problem is when light is around the point that the photocell will activate/deactivate the LEDs. The camera will toggle the LEDs annoyingly every few minutes or so, which throw off automatic motion detection and leads to false events. The camera will go through a little cadence when it first powers up and then it will leave it pointing straight forward. I wish it would keep track of where it was pointed when it powers on and return to that position when it is done with it's initialization. I have to wait for it to go through its setup and then point it back to where it was previously before I can leave it unattended.

Otherwise this is a great panning/zooming camera that easily works over wi-fi. Just plug it in and re-aim the lens when it's done with the setup and you're good to go.

review_headline: Spend the extra money and get something better!
review_body: So I’m usually very tech savvy and this thing took me a pretty decent amount of time to configure. It was a little tricky at first but once I got it up and running through my web browser it was working just ok. Its not as clear as most other cameras I have seen. One problem I encountered when having this camera is that for some reason it tends to switch the URL camera address on me for no reason. I use some other program in order for it to record the front of my house. I have it enabled to record only when it picks up movement. Sometimes you can't even make out a person’s face. At the end of the day I would have spent the extra money to get a better quality camera. Also one last thing for some reason this camera always like to disconnect from my network and ill have to refresh it by unplugging then replugging the power then opening it up on my computer. I actually caught a robbery in progress in front of my house and wasn’t able to hand in footage to cops because the thing wasn’t connected. Don't listen to these other good reviews on here a lot of them are just written because people are supposed to get back some rebate.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice Camera, but programming can be an issue.
review_body: The surveillance camera is attractive and works well using a computer on a wi-fi network.  However, it's not exactly "plug and play."  The picture on the box depicts a smartphone controlling the camera.  Accessing the camera outside the network requires either a "static ip address" or a dynamic address with "port forwarding."  If you're not familiar with either of these terms, then you won't want to purchase this for use outside of your home or office network.  On the other hand, if you intend to use it as a baby monitor or on-site camera, it should work just fine.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buy from a different company, you won't regret it.
review_body: If you don't have customer support on speed dial, it's not worth a penny. I smashed mine with a hammer after 20+ hours of trying to upgrade the firmware and relocate the camera to another wireless connection after 1 1/2 years of middling service. Good riddance. Foscam refuses to have their IP camera tool signed by microsoft and so Windows 7 won't even let you install the camera even after turning off every security feature it has. Save yourself the headache and buy a camera from a company that has a working relationship with microsoft.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This Camera certainly met expectations for the price I paid. The picture isn't super great, but really good enough for indoor local monitoring. The IR portion is excellent.
Set up was super easy. You can go on Foscam website and watch a tutorial and set the camera up while watching.
All in all, very happy.
One note, Internet explorer Active X settings are a little weird. You may have to play with them a bit for remote viewing.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam FI8910 Installation Tech Support is great!
review_body:
These Foscam IP cameras are difficult (impossible, maybe) to install on your own. I know because I tried to install two cams myself a year ago and nearly went crazy. But Foscam now provides free lifetime tech support including for initial installation. You just need your router, the camera(s) ready to connect to the router and give power, a computer online with the same router (thru which they access your system settings), a telephone to call Foscam support and a tech like William who helped me. He had both cams operating within about 10 minutes and was very professional and knowledgeable.

Note that if a camera goes down for some mysterious reason, you should just immediately call Foscam tech support because they are the only ones who can fix certain things.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Security Risks - Words to the Wise
review_body:
Camera worked well enough, but a word to the wise - IP enabled cameras are highly susceptible to hacking. It you're security conscious (as you likely are buying this camera) then please be aware you're putting your wifi network's (and every other connected device's) security at risk by installing these easily breached portals. Likewise, the smartphone apps that provide access to uploaded images, etc. similarly expose your phone to intruders. You can find more info on security risks and threats on the internet.
My recommendation is if you chose to use these security devices, you should consult with a professional networking expert before installing them - or, only use them within the network (do not connect them to the web, but only to a PC that's on the network as well).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam security cameras + 80# German Shepherd = All quiet on the home front!
review_body:
These cameras give me the peace of mind of knowing that my family and home are safe. I can "tune in" from anywhere in the world. Using the audio option lets me shout at a suspicious person. Guess what, they ALL look up at the source of the sound, and bingo you have a clear date/time stamped video/photo of their face(s)! Once these cameras were installed, the number of untoward events around our home plummeted. Our 80# German Shepherd takes care of any "slow learners" who cannot take a hint and move on. As an added advantage, any interaction/exchange between our dogs and people who shouldn't be where they are all get recorded in a very clear (not HD) video which protects the dogs and us from any legal repercussions. The camera even recorded a delivery truck (with unit number, driver's face, and license plate) scraping the side of my car--which reduced the negotiations with the driver's insurance company to how quickly can you write the check.

These cameras have already paid for themselves; and Foscam tech support is always available and easily reachable. I have no complaints what so ever about these cameras!

review_headline: Had some issues and so included my setup steps
review_body: How to Set up Foscam 8910W and 9821P wireless cameras for Windows using IE Had some issues keeping cameras on line and viewing in Blue Iris after upgrading to windows 8.1 – this is what I did and the settings I chose and I have good access now.  I did a “restore factory settings” after upgrading to 8.1 and completed all the following steps (tried to keep them sequential in order to be easy to follow as I found all this out through hours of research and trial and error): Exclude the Blue Iris folder (C:/Programs/BlueIris) in Anti-Virus software and if you can, also exclude the IP address for your camera(s) - (Avast – settings, troubleshooting, redirect setting, add URL). Complete any troubleshooting on the wireless network you are going to use for your cameras. I have 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands with different ssid (name); Foscam cameras work on 2.4 with b/g so I set that network for the cameras and use everything else on 5GHz band. Windows 8.1 renamed my Ethernet connection same as wireless; I found it easier just to rename my wireless networks in my router and reconnect my devices.  Update: There is a simple registry fix for this I've since found and used - google. Was having an issue with my wireless disconnecting and now it hasn’t for quite a while. Install IPCamera.exe to desktop and install IPCWebcomponents.exe (web plugin for Windows). Plug in camera power and then Ethernet cable to router. Double click IPCamera.exe tool on desktop and it should find your Foscam camera. Double click on your camera and install the plugin when prompted. Sign in (you’ll have to change your password).  Admin is login with no password. Choose Active X mode for IE. Probably have to re-log in after installing the plugin. Update: If you have problems installing the active x control: I added the camera IP address to IE's compatibility view, closed the browser, reopenedIE as administrator and typed camera url to log in rather than using the tool.  I was able to install active x and log on camera.  Logged on as usual since with no problems. Update System Firmware then application, and plugin (you’ll have to reinstall at next logon); follow instructions on Foscam support site; they’ll send you an email with all update after you go to the support page and enter your name and email.  Complete updates with Ethernet connection, not over wireless. Complete updates then log back in using IPCamera.exe tool on desktop. Once you can see your camera, then you can disconnect Ethernet and complete wireless. Go to settings and make any adjustments and remember to submit or save each change as you make them. You can change the name of your camera (I used location). Set time zone, sync to NTP server, set daylight savings if necessary and advance time 60’. Ensure a static IP address if you don’t want any problems.  It’s easy to do and, according to Foscam, it’s better to do it in the camera settings than in router settings….just uncheck “Obtain IP from DHCP Server” and change the last set of numbers in your IP address.  For example, 192.168.1.xxx to 192.168.1.x.  Your router IP address is probably something like 192.168.1.1 and if you look in your router settings you’ll see that your router will assign numbers from 192.168.1.2 to 192.168.1.265 or something close.  You’ll want to change your router settings to assign numbers from something like 192.168.1.11 to 192.168.1.265 so you can use the lower numbers (except for “1”) to assign to your camera(s).  That way you won’t have to worry about future conflicts with your router assigning your camera IP to another device. On your computer, use Windows Key and “R” (for “Run”), type cmd, then type ipconfig to get your Subnet Mask, Gateway, and DNS server. Change HTTP port to 8090 and any additional camera would be 8091, 8092, etc. Check the box for using wireless LAN and scan for your network; make sure the computer you are on is using the same network or you may have problems (I did and ended up fixing some network inefficiencies when doing troubleshooting on why my cameras kept going in and out).  Complete the network info and security key for the wireless network. I did select UPnP settings after reading a troubleshooting blog. For 8910W, I did disable “go to center on boot” in PT / PTZ settings so that my camera would not scan the room everytime it booted. For 9821P it’s under PTZ/Start-up Options – disable startup. After setting up camera and if setting up more than one Foscam camera then do select the other camera(s) in the multi-device section; the software will fill in all the blanks except logon and password – you’ll need to fill those in. I have mounted the Foscam FI8910W on my covered front porch so it’s protected from direct element and it’s been raining and humid almost non-stop; it is mounted up high and upside down so I had to flip the image in the camera software – find the setting just to the left of the video feed.  It’s been there about a month with no problems.  Used a much better mount (sold on Amazon) than what comes with the camera: VideoSecu 1/4" x 20 Threads Swivel Security Camera Mount 2-6 Inch Adjustable Universal Pan Tilt CCTV Camera Mounting Bracket with Ceiling Clip 1BO. Mounted the FI8921P inside using the regular mount – it works fine.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have had this camera since January of 2014. I have a home office about 40 feet from the front door. I usually beat any service people and or delivery people to the front door. Also since I have a "No Soliciting" sign on the front door, I can Email the police a photo of the Solicitor resulting in 3 arrests from would be burglars pretending to be solicitors. Since the camera is motion sensor activated it will take a photo and Email my phone. I recently updated the camera and Roy Martin, remoted into my puter to fix a firmware Wi Fi problem, excellent support for a Sunday night! I plan to purchase a later model of this camera sometime this year. The only draw back of this camera is, I have a arched window above the door where I mounted the camera. Since the camera is mounted behind glass I cannot use the night vision feature since the LED's reflect back off the glass. Since my house is all brick there is really no place to mount the camera outside, other then that an excellent camera!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: ... price and what I need it for it's almost perfect. The IR LEDs are super bright and the ...
review_body:
For the price and what I need it for it's almost perfect. The IR LEDs are super bright and the picture is pretty clear for 480p. It works really well on my phone, which is what I primarily use it for. It has the ability to upload images to an FTP server, affectively allowing the server act as a pseudo DVR. It takes fine tuning of the motion sensing and, unless you want to piss off your ISP, your own server but it works great. My only complaint is how it wants to reboot itself every other day or so. A minor issue but pretty annoying.

And, for anyone concerned about security: as long as you set a password to you camera (as well as your wifi), you should be perfectly secure.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Decent camera, but not buying again
review_body:
Bought this in January 2014 from Amazon. I thought that it was just a little bit wonky and that maybe my wireless or even the AC power in my house was causing the camera to reset every so often. Then, I realized that it only happened during the day and only when a particularly "busy" set of sheets was on the crib (that it was looking at). I went to Amazon, saw the reviews saying this was a manufacturer's defect and realized that was the problem.

Allegedly the defect was resolved in October 2013 yet I purchased a clearly defective camera in January 2014. I am past my one-year warranty so there is nothing for me to do but vent my spleen on the internet.

Other than the fact that it resets occasionally, it is a decent camera.

Also, Foscam (Leo from FOSCAM especially) if you are reading this: STOP WRITING PHONY REVIEWS! It is unethical and pathetic. I probably would have just gone ahead and bought a new one to replace my faulty old one if it weren't for this sleezy, shameful behavior.

I am now on my second one, because the first was a USED one! Where on the Amazon description does it say this was a USED or REFURBISHED model?! I found it out when I went to set up the camera software on my computer and the camera already had a name where it should have said "anonymous". So, after 25 mintues waiting for an available tech support person, and then 30-minutes of them remotely setting it up, I thought I was good to go.
Nope, my connection has now dropped and I can no longer connect through my computer OR my iPhone app.

review_headline: Works fine. I have several set up to email me ...
review_body: Works fine. I have several set up to email me photos upon motion detection. Nearly all the photos I get when not home are when the light is in between two modes--daylight and evening--and it's deciding what mode to use, so the in between light triggers it to send me a bunch of photos that vary from lighter to darker of the same scene at the nearly the same moment.  Also, don't expect it to capture moving objects well--photos of someone walking is blurry--only when they pause the image is ok.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Hardware at a Great Price
review_body:
I have been using this camera as a baby monitor for about two weeks now and it works very well. The audio is crisp, the night-time picture quality is great, and the price is excellent. Also, this unit does not kill my wifi reception unlike most 2.4 Ghz baby monitors.

Yes, this unit does have some limitations:

First off, you have to be a tad technical to get it setup. However, there are great guides that step you through the one-time setup process. Make sure you change the default settings to add a strong password (especially if you set it up so you can view it while you are away).

Secondly, the Foscam software is pretty bad. Logging in to camera with Internet Explorer is pretty good (though, you may need to tweak your IE settings to run the ActiveX scrips). However, logging in with Chrome requires an odd plug in if you want audio. Logging in from an Andriod phone with the official Foscam app is a joke and did not work at all. I tried about 3 other different third-party apps, all of which worked right away. In the end, I ended up getting tinyCam Monitor PRO for $4 for Andriod which works very well (especially for audio).

Third, the built in speaker is pretty horrible (but it does have a 3.5 mm audio out jack), but I don't see many people using this.

Despite the limitations, the hardware is great. The build quality is also pretty high. I was mounting this to a tripod and accidentally dropped it 6 feet onto a hardware floor and it still works perfectly fine (there is only a small mark on the unit).

review_headline: I am giving 5 stars for the tech support, ...
review_body: I am giving 5 stars for the tech support, in particular the technician I worked with, Walter. I frankly do not see how Foscam can provide the level of support they do for such a low-priced product. And I suspect for most purchasers tech support will be needed. The challenge is to get the camera and your router to talk to each other. I had to go back and forth between Foscam and Time Warner Cable. Foscam needs to take over your PC to change the settings. Some people will not want that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The camera is excellent, especially the support that I received. I purchased the camera a year ago, did some initial setup, and really forgot about it. Last week, I found the camera and decided that I needed to install the camera on my iphone. The first problem I had, was that I could not reset the camera. I called Foscam and after working with a technician, we decided that the camera was defective. I returned the camera, and had a replacement in a few days. Isn't that nice? It took some time to follow the quick installation guide and I got stuck a few times. I called Foscam several times. The response was excellent. In particular Lisa Anderson was amazing. She took control of my laptop and did the installation completely She is the best. On fact, all the technical support folk were wonderful; but Lisa provided the best service that I ever had.

and had it working on my laptop. I decided that I really needed to watch on my smart phone I put the camera away and forgot about it. One day, I decided to follow the instructions and call when I needed help. Lisa

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I use these as 'Baby Monitor' cameras. They work GREAT!! Better than any traditional video baby monitor. I use three of these with an app on my iPhone, Ipad and laptop computer. I use 'Baby Monitor for ip camera' by Tiny Solutions,LLC.
Not the easiest camera to set up, but once they are, they work great. I love that I can pan the room, tilt up and down, etc. It does not have a zoom feature, but you can zoom in while using the app, just as you can make any picture bigger. I love that I can set it to run in the background. I set the squelch level and receive an alarm if any noise is heard.i have not tried the two way audio, but the app allows for its use.
The night vision is pretty good. You can definitely see what is what. Daylight camera image is great!
Nice to have when the kids are upstairs playing.
I've tried some of the knock offs, and while they work as well, (when they work) they are more hit and miss. Definitely worth the price difference.

review_headline: Good camera but difficult to set up
review_body: Audio and video on camera is very good. Pictures received are very clear. However the camera is not easy to set up. I was able to get it working while in my house but had difficulties accessing the camera from another location, especially when using my tablet or smartphone (both android devices). Tech support consists of waiting on hold for more than 30 minute only to be told to watch some YouTube videos. I finally got it working but it requires a No-IP service to make it work, and that has to be renewed every 30 days or pay for a subscription. I returned the camera and will shop for something that will work as advertised.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great hardware, but don't expect to view it away from home without another $50 investment
review_body: Purchased this camera a little over a year ago to monitor my pets while at work. Camera worked fine for about 5 months, with automatic alerts and remote access through the provided DDNS that came with the camera. Then suddenly, the DDNS shut down. I can't access it from anywhere. Tried contacting customer support, they said it must be the camera. I pinged the DDNS about a dozen times, no response, it's down. Not a single person in support was willing to look into the status of the DDNS which tells me that Foscam must be shutting these down to save money or push for paid tech support. I let them remote access my computer to try to fix it and they came up with nothing. The real kicker is that once customer support failed (because they wouldn't just fix the DDNS) I tried to set up port forwarding and just access it through my IP, still nothing. Whatever they did to my camera, nothing works now. The camera is essentially useless. No email updates, no remote viewing, it's just a lump of hardware sitting on my ceiling unless I feel like forking out $50 for a DDNS that was supposed to be included for the life of the camera, and now I'm not even sure that will work with whatever support did to its innards. 2 stars because the hardware is great, but it's a piece of junk as far as included online access features, which is the whole reason I bought it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good hardware, crap software ruins the experience.
review_body:
This seems like a good camera. Hardware build quality is solid. It works when logged into directly from the web browser. However, neither the box nor the website tells you that you must be running a Microsoft Windows PC to completely set this product up. You can remote into the camera from the IP address assigned by the router, but anything after that, to include use of the official Android app, will require a Windows plugin to set up (a happy .exe from FOSCAM's website).

There are about ten different FOSCAM apps in the Google Play store, all from different publishers. The Android app linked from FOSCAM's website (blue cloud icon in the Play Store) absolutely WILL NOT connect to the camera, no matter what IP address/port combination you set up. The new app wants you to scan a QR code, which is nowhere to be found on the camera. The new app requires that you to register through the FOSCAM website and download an EXE which works as the intermediary for IP forwarding. There is no way to set this up manually in the new app. Come on. This is 2015. Why are we still requiring Windows to operate?

For now, the only solution for remote viewing is to use your web browser (on the computer or phone is okay) and log directly into the webcam. You can also try one of the dozens of other webcam viewing apps from third parties, all of which work better than the official app. What a waste of a good product.

review_headline: Installation/Setup was somewhat tedious, as camera needs to reboot during setup more ...
review_body:
Works well as described in the manual. Picture is OK during day and night without need for manual adjustment. Can monitor and control the camera from a laptop through Wi-Fi router and through Internet. Installation/Setup was somewhat tedious, as camera needs to reboot during setup more than once, and one needs to follow exactly the steps described in the Manual, or one can get stuck with no connection to camera.
In summary, everything works as expected.
The only limitation is relatively short Wi-Fi range. Works 25 feet away from the router with separated by one external wall , but I could not get Wi-Fi connection through 30 feet distance 3 internal drywall walls .

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
purchased 4 Foscam cameras including an outdoor camera. They all worked BUT inconsistently. What good is having security camera's if you have to reboot them by unplugging them or using the reboot button? Try to do this while your away from home or on vacation.... so in my opinion (we are an apple family) these are NOT easy to work with. On top of that- Foscam Customer service is piss poor. You will NOT get any support from Foscam if you purchase through amazon. They only support camera's purchased from their site. I was told by a Foscam Representative that Amazon is an unauthorized seller of Foscam products. (Go figure that one out) I repeated this several times to the rep and he repeated it back to me - I even told him that I was going to hang up and call Amazon and basically that was the end of the conversation with Foscam. Needless to say, I returned all the camera's based on Foscam support PLUS the inconsistency in the camera's reliability staying connected. There has to be a newer upcoming company that can produce a better camera at a decent price point without comparing themselves to Foscam. ----

UPDATE; I discovered on the apple site that they offer a camera called "Canary"- so I purchased one to try out....wow! what a difference. has everything build right in including a siren that you can activate remotely if necessary. I purchased a 2nd one on Amazon (do like Amazon!) Needless to say, so far so great. Now I'm continuing my search for a decently priced outdoor camera that maybe can pan, tilt, zoom, motion, send alerts... ummm- is this possible? anyway, when I find it I will review and let you know. For now, good luck to us all and goodbye

review_body: I bought this for my garage and it ended up standing guard at my front door area.  I even set up the DDNS and use the FTP setting to upload pictures to my router drive.  I has "caught" a few pictures from people coming up to the front door while I was away.  Mostly the mail and paper delivery.  But recently it caught a guy who apparently was just a door knocker who wanted to sell something  while I was away.  The pan and tilt feature is useful when you are using this camera remotely.  I view it occasionally at work to view my front door.  Kind of interesting to watch when you are away.  Very good security.

review_body: I do not tend to post anything on Amazon, but since I rely on the reviews to decide if I should buy a product, I thought it would be helpful to others if I posted a comment regarding this product.  I think this company has the right idea, but this product is not user friendly, and has too many issues such as a terrible app.  The app is filled with issues, mostly it freezes and provided an error messages freqently.  I wanted to use it as a security camera or at least a reliable device to see what is happening at home, but since the app is so bad, I am unable to use it and will be returning it tomorrow.  The best part of this company is the customer service.  I spoke to Richard and he was very helpful, got the device to work immediately, but unfortunately, it is not reliable and needs updates to it.

Kenneth Thompson at Foscam just stepped up and OWNED it and didn't stop until it worked. Tons of things were "off" with the properties for some reason, but he got it working. So now, I love BOTH of these cameras. Thank you Kenneth!!

review_headline: Great if you can get it to work.
review_body: I got this camera to use as a puppy cam.  Hardwire had the camera up and running in minutes.  Picture was great and many apps to choose from to make it work.  However, if your not a wireless router expert, steer clear of this item.  I spent two days reading the wed site looking at videos and calling for help.  This thing is way to fussy with routers, will not run on 5gHz, will not run on WEP, may other Will NOT RUN items as well.  Gave up and got a Tenvis which was up and running wireless in 5 min.

review_headline: No hi-res by today's standards, but for $50 great toy and possibilities.
review_body: All the motion controls are available through web browser on iPhone, iPad *IF* you don't mind having two tabs open to the same camera because some controls are in one server mode and some controls in the other server mode.  640x480 is kinda lame by today's standards, but for fifty bucks you can't go wrong.  It runs on 5vdc so I think I'm going to play with a 12v car battery, solar charger and modify a USB cable (5v) and USB car adapter to see if I can't put these out in my yard where there is no power but I still have WiFi coverage.  The Two Way audio - I can't make it work.  You have to install a plug-in from VLC.org, but the link doesn't work and I can't locate it.  And I'm a software engineer for pete's sake.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: DON'T BUY FOSCAM TO MONITOR ANYTHING IMPORTANT TO YOU. USE IT TO MONITOR YOUR GARDEN, THAT'S ABOUT IT.
review_body: Foscam cameras are glitchy, difficult to install, difficult to maintain, the app sucks and crashes all the time (sometimes the picture locks up, leaving you thinking your kid is asleep when in reality she got sick, threw up all over herself, and is screaming at the top of her lungs while you are relaxing in the kitchen), the sound randomly stops working, camera resets at random, customer support is poor. The built in wireless is terrible, I ended up wiring directly to a separate wireless router to improve reliability. I suggest spending a little more money on a high quality camera and get a third party software package to monitor. It will cost a little more in the long run, but you will save yourself hours of headaches.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great but one, single flaw really needs to be addressed
review_body:
Such a promising camera at a very competitive price. Everything, literally everything, about this camera works wonderfully except the software. Virtually no software I could find, be it the iOS app provided from Foscam itself, or even a number of paid 3rd-party iOS apps that work with this camera and others from the App Store will play uninterrupted streaming video from the camera for very long. As others have reported on various internet forums, the video and audio steam starts up fine but after a period of time, the stream dies, and ends up leaving whatever app is playing it in a locked up state. This translates into having to manually reset/reload the video streaming app from your device every 10-15 minutes depending on when it decides to die out.

It sounds like this problem is actually with the firmware software that streams video from the camera itself so if that is true, if they would update it and solve the issues, then this review could easily be 5-stars. Until then, I've returned my camera and have gone with a much more expensive Dropcam, which while it does all the same things that this camera does for a LOT more money, at least I can watch the video stream infinitely without having to notice the app needs to be restarted manually.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera works good. Picture quality is very good
review_body: Camera works good.  Picture quality is very good, I don't want to waste bandwidth on megapixel cameras.  Took a bit to set up mainly because of my particular configuration.  I wanted to be able to monitor on a phone or tablet, in house as a baby monitor and really wanted the audio.  I had a hard time getting an app that worked, it seems there are different apps for different Foscam cameras, then I had to find one that allowed audio.  Bottom line is it works good and was an interesting puzzle to get it doing what I wanted.  Using phone (on Wi-Fi) I can listen to audio from camera, have not tried to talk through the camera yet, and I can pan and tilt the camera.  Very happy with it.  It works wireless but I may hard wire it just to ensure there is no interference or connectivity issues.  The wireless router is downstairs at the opposite end of the house from the camera and seems to work as advertised.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Works good. It does have some issues with going in and out of NV mode depending on the light conditions and it is a little loud while making the changes. That said the camera functions good and I have several of them around the house. I use most of the features and have not experienced any issues with the Black cameras. I also have one white and it has issues with lighting. It will reset often and I believe this is due to light penetrating the case as it will constantly switch between NV on/off for a couple of minutes before restarting. When I put it in a dark environment it works fine.

I use one as a baby monitor and the sound pickup is better than any other monitors I have seen. It sits about 15 feet away from the bed and I can hear my child breathing or any little sound.

I would have given it a five star if not for the issue with my white camera. The web interface is a bit awkward, but once you learn it works well.

The setup is pretty easy with just reasonable computer skills.  You connect them with an ethernet cable to set them up, and then they work fine wirelessly.  You will need to forward the port on your router, which is not hard to do.  Good picture, good low light ability, and easy mounting.

review_body: So complex, so hard to get help, I finally said, "forget it"!  I spent most of a day trying to do this myself.  I have done a lot of technical/computer stuff for years so, I figured I could handle it (I was wrong).  I learned my lesson on purchases that I have a problem with to not mess around and send them back as the clock is ticking and soon, you can't send it back and you'll be stuck with it.  Don't buy this unless you have a computer science degree from MIT, and even then be prepared to have trouble.  I'm not kidding, I would just say no to this camera unless you enjoy a huge challenge and have tons of free time.

Our camera is outside in Minnesota under an overhang and has survived the first winter.
If you have problems w/ the set up just call Foscam for help. It will save you a lot of time and trouble. They really know their product and they're very patient with dumb questions.
