product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I know nothing about computers and figured it out!! It was a little difficult setting up, but once my wife and I spent about an hour on it we figured it out. Both of our phones go right to it with the free app you can download and it works great for our baby monitor (phone needs wifi connection).
The only issues I have is when the sound and microphone are on at the same time the speaker on the camera will start to squeal. Not good for a sleeping baby.
Other than that it works great and has a really good picture.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The hardware for this stuff is relatively generic, and the firmware/software provided by foscam is decent but not great. They get a good rating in the end because they are better than their competitors for the price.

I love the pan/tilt feature, and the IR mode works well at night.
Wireless seems to work fine.

I have hooked these up to my QNAP NAS units and they work well. The way I have it set up is to use the built in software to capture an image and email it to me on a motion alarm, and also record for a few minutes after the alarm goes off to my local NAS.

Minus a start because the software if decent but not great. There have been security issues with remote login on default accounts that have been fixed and I still think they don't have an HTTPS login mode (or at least they didnt for a very very long time).

For the price (you shouldn't pay more than $50-60 for this (even 2 years ago when I bought it) it does the job.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: So easily hacked, it's not even funny
review_body:
This camera out of the box is extremely vulnerable to getting hacked. That means anyone can take over your camera and watch you (or your baby!) from wherever they are without you knowing. Not to mention they can listen in on you AND use the built-in speaker to shout obscenities at your baby. Apparently there are people in this world who have nothing better to do.

I wouldn't trust this company at all. All I see in their forums and on their site is trying to sweep things under the rug. See this post for example:
http://www.forbes.com/sites/kashmirhill/2013/08/27/baby-monitor-hack-could-happen-to-40000-other-foscam-users/

You can tell just by looking at their interface how little care went into the software for this. Sure, the first thing the manufacturer will say in response is to update the firmware, but:
- That doesn't fix all security issues (connection is still unencrypted, for example)
- They make no effort of telling you that you need to update the firmware. It's posted in some obscure part of their site, but you don't get an email or anything like that if there is a firmware update. Again, just careless.

And, by the way, changing the default username/password is not enough to protect yourself. There are many ways around the rudimentary password checks.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: it's great. First tech guy couldn't get it to work ...
review_body: After the 2 hr phone call with tech support to get this hooked up, it's great.  First tech guy couldn't get it to work for me, then told me to unhook my modem to reset.  Well of course that disconnected my phone!  Had to call back and wait another 30min to get through.  Such a pain, but was finally able to get it to work, along with the app on my phone.  Picture is really good.  Just as good as my security cameras on my house.  Love the ability to move the camera around to adjust viewing angle.  Good buy for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Best investment for a parent's peace of mind!
review_body:
My husband and I LOVE this camera so much we are ordering at least two more. We're using the one we have already purchased as a baby monitor for our almost two year old who was spending nap time taking her diaper off and getting into trouble! Silence is never good if you can't see your little ones! Now I can peep in and see if she is asleep like she should be or if Mommy needs to intervene. We would also like to purchase one for our toy room which is on the main floor and one for our basement as well. With three kids, you can never have enough eyes or peace of mind, but the foscam definitely helps. The pan range on this thing is phenomenal. I can scan every inch of her room, and set it to where I can not only see her asleep in her bed, but out the doorway into my bedroom where my 8 month old sleeps.

Cons: -Had to call tech support when we couldn't get it to connect wireless but the tech support guy was amazing!
-Foscam doesn't have a dedicated app for Windows phone so I have to use one call CameraKaze to access it, its still free but there are
ads unless i pay $5 to remove them, and I cannot make use of the microphone with the app. Hopefully foscam will remedy this soon but if not it is still an amazing device

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: It's a great little camera that works perfectly.  I have a Samsung s5 with the lollipop operating system and the foscam viewer app works great. It also works on the s3 too. The setup can be a little time consuming, but the online foscam self help videos are very good. The written instructions are from the United States. . product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great but a pain to set up
review_body: I followed R Tickle's setup instructions and that worked great except for one thing. The password cannot be more than 12 characters long. This caused random disconnects and reboots where I would get locked out. After about an hour of resetting the device, I finally tried a short password, and it became stable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I got 3 of this, returned, but before jumping into conclusion why i gave this product a 4 star i'll explain why.
The camera is very well made, looks really cool, the only problem i had was installing the camera to have access outside my network, which means accessing it from anywhere using iphone, tablet etc etc... Setting the ip in order to do was kind of difficult. I followed every step and even watched a few videos showing how to. But i might had trouble because i don't have an linksys or apple router, reading reviews from others i finally came to a conclusion that is much easier if you have one of those, unfortunately i own a different router. Anyway i ended buying the FI9821P plug & play. I will write a second review after i install it and have it running

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a pretty good IP camera. We bought it to use as a baby monitor. It is a little larger than I realized, otherwise it is just what I expected. It was easy and straightforward to setup, the power adapter has a nice long cord on it and we have not yet had any connectivity issues (been running for about 2 months now). Status lights on the back were too bright for our children at night, but we solved that easily by covering them with electrical tape. The night-vision lights on the front are dim enough that they don't cause any issues. Setting up out-of-network access has proven to be much more difficult than the in-network setup. It is not an important feature to me, however, so after spending several days trying to get it to work I gave up on it. Overall I think the camera is well-priced for the quality.

Note: I had heard there were some security concerns, but after checking into it I found that the main issues were resolved a while back with a firmware upgrade so I never had to worry about that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Thde company should renew the site certificate
review_body:
It's an Ok camera, the image is not really good quality BUT is Ok for the money.
The image freezes from time to time and is hard to change the location were the recorded movies are saved.
The real downside is the settings you have to do in order to be able to see something. If you are not a computer savvy (like me) could be really hard to do it and it's time consuming.
Basically you cannot see anything because the IE 11 in Windows 8.1 won't let you download the necessary Active X Control due to the expired certificate of the site.
Had to change a lot of security settings in IE, which can endangers your computer if not reverted to the original settings, I could set the camera properly but now I started to have problems with IE which stops working from time to time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: You can't beat this camera for the price.  It's easy to set up, has a ton of features, and there are several free phone apps that can connect to it.  I bought this instead of getting an over-priced baby monitor.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works as expected, happy with the results.
review_body: Wasn't too bad to set up, and I'm not the most savvy tech owner. But I have a head on my shoulders and common sense to go with it. Just took it one step at a time, went fine. We bought it to figure out which cat was peeing in front of the kitchen sink cabinet and why, and... We did. You'll get a lot of false alarms if you turn up the sensitivity and have your computer record any time it senses activity. But if you don't, you'll probably miss stuff, especially if you're watching small creatures like babies and pets. I only used what came in the box, I don't have any other software to manage cameras better, but this was great for our needs. I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to give it a try.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is the best of the 3 foscam cams I have. It has the best Wifi strength, fast movement, clear audio, easy administration, and has handled the elements from being out on my porch for almost 1yr. I picked it up refurbished and it has been great for the price. I just got the TinyCam app for Android/Kindle/FireTV, and that app is really making me like the camera even more, as it makes it easy to access/control the cams for a pretty complete home monitoring solution (3 cams cost me $190 + $3 app == better cameras & cheaper than Comcast home security).
If I had a farm or warehouse or some large property that I wanted to keep an eye on remotely, I'd get a bunch of these and have the whole place covered. (and it'd be fun to set up!)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have to say that I really do love these cameras. I have two, one upstairs and one downstairs and they work great! I use IP Cam Viewer Lite on my Android phone and I can check in on our pup and the house in general any time I want.

While the quality could be higher, they do exactly what they say they will do and do it well. If you configure them properly on your network and are familiar with port forwarding, they are a breeze to setup. If you're not technology savvy, have someone who is help you out.

Ive had these for several months now and no problems whatsoever.

review_headline: POORLY Advertised as simple to set up
review_body:
Misleading in my opinion. It says: Foscam is designed to work right of the box - simply connect the camera to your wireless network, setup port-forwarding and away you go.
Let me tell you it is NOT ready to go. If you do not have any experience with port forwarding then the instructions will do nothing but confuse you. They talk about static and dynamic address and if you have a dynaminc you need to sign up at noisp.com which comes with its own confusing mess.
I fooled with this for 4 hours with no success. I could get it to work on my browser in my office but not with the app. The app comes with no instructions that are of any use or tell you what settings you are suppose to use. Save your money and buy a dropcam. Your sanity is worth it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, no issues with setup.  Recommend this as a baby monitor!  Returned my Dropcam!
review_body: I'm not a a tech guru but have set up a few wireless routers before.  The videos on Foscam's website guide you through the steps to set up the camera, connect it to your wireless router and do port forwarding.  They seem to be easier to follow and better than the instruction manual with the camera.  The installation CD includes setup for my Mac, and it is also available on Foscam's website.  I had no need to call tech support!  I'm using two of these with the "Baby Monitor for IP Cameras" iPhone/iPad app from Tiny Solutions LLC.  They work great and the app allows you to see more than one camera at once.  I have one camera connecting to a wireless router that's connected to the internet so I can access the camera from anywhere (it's password protected).  I have another camera set up in a second house on a wireless network, but I don't have internet access there so I only have access inside my home.  My wife thinks the quality of the daytime picture is better than the Dropcam (non Pro version) we returned, I think it's about the same.  The night vision is clearly better!  The delay on the Dropcam was about 5 seconds, with this it's only about 1 second.  This is likely due to the Dropcam sending their information out to their cloud service, then back to you (it won't work without an internet connection).  Pan/Tilt is slick and works with the app we use.  No baby yet so I haven't mounted the camera with the articulating mount included in the box.  Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great baby cam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Love this. Set up at home was super easy
review_body: Love this. Set up at home was super easy. Getting it to work on my iphone 5 and work computer was a little tricky. But if you google, cant view foscam in ip camera over internet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iHTxuYa3Kzo . Just follow the easy step by step and you done. Now I have NO knowledge of software, mom of 2 and trust me when I say plugging something in and praying it works is the extent of my setup knowledge so if I was able to do it so can you. I love that I can talk to my dog and when my older son comes home I can make sure he is doing his homework and even chat and listen to him. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this product. My coworker is so jealous because they paid $135 for another type of camera and they can not chat or move the image to look around the room. :-)

Great inexpensive camera! The camera is pretty easy to set up, in a few mins you can have it up and running within your network. To access remotely, it takes a bit longer, specially if you have never done port forwarding.
The picture quality is very good considering it is not HD. Sound is horrible, but i was not really interested too much on sound.
The motion alarm/email feature works really well, no complaints there.

review_body: Purchased the FosCam Fi8910W; great price. Setting up the camera via ethernet cable was very easy but I was having problems setting up wireless access. I called the 800 number and spoke with Walter, within 5 minutes he had me up and running. Very professional and waited on the line to make sure everything was fine on my end. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A Cheap Option for Home Monitoring - Does The Job With No Frills
review_body:
First off on some of the configuration talk: This camera is fairly easy to setup. The instructions make it pretty easy to understand even if you are not super-technical. Some details are a bit vague as far as port forwarding and some other router configurations. This is intentional as there are a lot of different types of networking hardware. I would suggest you supplement the Foscam instructions with instructions from the manufacturer of your modem.

That said, this is a great product for monitoring your house while you are away. There are some more advanced options of recording that I don't utilize. I mainly access it on my smart phone ("Foscam ip camera app" & "CamViewer" are the two apps I use after testing several - both free) and do have alerts setup via email during certain hours. It works without a hitch.

The interface does have a few bugs but nothing that does not have a work around. Also, the sensitivity for alerts tends to be overly sensitive so that I get emails for clouds casting shade on the window or when the IR option comes on.

I did a lot of research before purchasing this model so I got exactly what I expected in this machine. It's what I needed with no frills.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Not as easy to set-up as they claim...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Once set up properly, works as promised. Read instructions thoroughly first (and watch videos). Requires a static ip to view
review_body: A little tricky to set up -- took me several tries and several hours over a couple of weeks, as  I bought this in order to help check in on an elderly relative and could only visit for a bit each time  - but once we got it working, it does what it intended to do and even more.  The key missing instruction, which can be garnered upon watching the videos alluded to in the instruction booklet, is that in order to view the camera from an offsite location, you must have a static ip address, or obtain one through an outside vendor (or for free through them). You also must understand how to create a specific port for the camera on your network. All of these instructions are clearly reviewed in instructional videos, so be sure to read up and visit the links ahead of time in order to save time and aggravation. While trying to get this camera set up for external viewing, I was frustrated enough to buy an alternate one from a different company which offered instant set up without having to do the ip thing. While that one works as promised, the Foscam camera remains my favorite, as its ability to utilize infra red, and move the lens around the room, were vital to my needs.  The sofware interface is a bit clunky, but for the price, I can't believe I am able to check in on my relative on a regular basis and know what their needs are.  The software is also available on iPhone/iPad.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

The pan, tilt and zoom features are also very helpful. two of the cameras have night viewing capability. It doesn't record but you can set it up to send pictures to your email when it detects motion ( also a pretty painful process with my gmail account)  The picture quality is good enough and I think the audio capabilities are of decent quality. Also, you can only do the audio stuff using Internet Explorer with an audio plug in.

This setup is not for the faint of heart or computer challenged as I am.  It actually took my friend to task!  As stated, once connected, they are easy to access and maneuver allowing us to see a variety of views.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera itself seems to work OK. The basic setup was not difficult. The issue I have with it is that it really doesn't do what they claim. If you use Chrome as a browser (which definitely works best with this camera) you don't get all the control functions for the camera. If you use Internet Explorer, you do get the Active X controls for the camera. Which would be fine if they worked well, but it doesn't. There is a big lag in the pan and tilt function and the browser crashes if you go to \\"full screen\\" mode. Also, the audio does work with IE, but it does not work with Chrome. They tell you to download a plugin to be able to use audio in Chrome and Firefox. I downloaded the plugin and it still doesn't work with Chrome. You can hear audio with Firefox, but there is a lag in the pan / tilt function with Firefox. So, if you just want a basic pan and tilt camera - without audio - and you use Chrome - then it's OK.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: I read a lot of reviews stating that this was difficult to hook up. Mine was up and running in 3 minutes. While i hear that foscam customer service is a nightmare, if you have an average knowledge of computers this is a walk in the park. Foscam has a youtube channel that makes it SUPER easy to hook up for visual learners. The picture quality and nightvision looks great, I didn't need sound in my case so cant really help there. I am on a mac and had no problems at all with setup which was a concern of mine.

I was connected to a technician named Max and he did a remote install and my camera now works perfectly on my wireless router, as well as being able to use it remotely from the apps we installed on our I-pad and I-phone.  We will be buying more cameras to add to the network because we can now see and talk to our kitty when we are not at home.  Thanks to Max and Foscam for their GREAT customer support!!!

review_body:
This is one of my first reviews of a product on Amazon. I had 1 Foscam Camera that I have had for several years with excellent luck. I just purchased 2 more of the Foscam Cameras. I was having a difficult time getting all 3 cameras to sinc. with each other. After some time of trying, I still couldn't get them to work together. I called the 800 # for tech. support. I got in contact with Samuel Brown from Foscam support. Samuel took remote control of my computer and within 10 minutes he had done what I had been working on for hours.
I am happy to say they all work great.
If you purchase a Foscam Camera and aren't computer savoy and have a problem getting your cameras to work, call the Free 800 # they will do all the proper hookup for you. I can't say enough good about Foscam support and tech Samuel Brown.

Thank you very much!!!!!!!!!!!!
Al Nordstrom

review_headline: First IP camera, works as expected
review_body:
This is the first camera of this type but so far so good.

I have it set up indoors to take snapshots when it detects movement and ftp those up to a server. I've heard of others that have used it outside provided that a good shelter is available. I haven't attempted this because of the lack of a power outlet where I'd like to put it and I haven't had the time to add one.

I wish it:
- could run off of battery power
- allowed you to set the file name dynamically, it saves to a filename like 78A5DD034C86(005gyeu)_1_20150131134526_7742.jpg, I wish the file name was just the timestamp, there is a place in the config where you can set a filename but I saw no info on how to append or use the timestamp (e.g., set to save as filename "foo" and it would save to the file "foo.jpg" meaning every upload would overwrite the existing file)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I would've given 4 or 5 stars for the product, but I have to drop it down a notch due to the amount of work required to properly set this camera up and enable remote viewing. In my civilian job, I'm a software developer. I say that because the installation of this product required some skill that the average person may not possess. I have a 2Wire router and use DDNS with port forwarding. This shouldn't be a burden to any device. It's fairly straight forward, however, setting it up was difficult. D-Link has a much faster solution and is far less complicated than this camera.

Pro's:
Remote viewing, once configured, is solid.
Alarm/Motion detection is sufficient.
Image is sufficient
IR mode exceeded expectation
Pan/Tilt is sufficient

Con's:
Installation is not a turn-key process. You better have a good understanding of your network configuration. If you have to google the following words then you might want to consider spending a little more for a dropcam or a d-link/linksys sort of solution:

DDNS, UPnP, Port Forwarding, SMTP, ADSL, DHCP,DNS

If those words mean nothing to you, and you purchase this camera, then be prepared to learn some new things. I'm not saying that's a bad thing. In fact, I wish more people understood this stuff (especially my parents) so they'd stop calling me every time their wi-fi flakes out. ;)

Best of luck!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam is NoScam Camera works wonderfully
review_body:
Great Camera if you want any sort of house surveilance. I put my camera in the front door and found the installation, setup, and durability to be amazing. The camera is literally a plug and play kind of camera. I followed the instructions and got my camera to connect to the network within minutes. Then, I fiddled the alert system and the motion detection sensitivity to find the perfect balance for the camera to detect people walking up to the door, but not a random leaf flying through. The great thing about the surveilance is that you can not only broadcast the sound of the environment your camera is in, but also broadcast your voice through the camera. This is quite a useful feature if you want to watch your pet or something that requries your voice. Furthermore, I can set the camera to have certain areas to turn to as a preset and alternate between presets which will make the camera a robotic watchman. This is pretty useful if you have a large area to scan and need constant surveillance.

Cons: The one con I have with this camera is that the motion detection, although it works all the time, doesn't have a setting for the camera to record say 30 seconds after detecting motion. Instead, the camera will take about 7 shots and and send them through email to your phone. This is a problem since you are missing certain seconds where people may have done something that you missed. However, it is a problem that isn't that significant. Secondly, the camera cannot change the orientation from portrait to landscape and vice vera. If you want to hang your camera at an angle, you will have to suffer the rath of tilt head syndrome where you can't rotate the video feed so you have to tilt your head to the side in order to watch the video. This is a problem for me since I have my camera basically at an angle so it can see the widest area. The last problem is that the camera will detect motion when the camera switches from night vision to day or vice versa. This is most likely a setting issue, but I found that the motion detection setting that i have that works best has this problem. It isn't that big of a deal since it's just 2 extra emails a day. But, it's still a problem.

Verdict: this camera is a great camera for basic surveillance of the house indoor or outdoor. Although if you do do it outdoor, make sure you have a cable that is long enough as well as wifi signal and protection against snow/rain/water. Easy to set up and easy to use. 4/5

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Make sure to secure the camera, but otherwise excellent
review_body:
We have added 4 of these cameras over the last two years, as well as one of the HD models, and actually prefer these over the HD foscams, due to foscam splitting the audio-video substreams on the newer HD models.

The two-way audio, night vision, and integration with my Synology NAS units make these perfect for basic home monitoring and real time access from anywhere.

For security, taking a few simple steps to secure the camera helps immensely if you want to be able to access the cameras over the internet outside your home.
- Make sure you have up-to-date firmware from foscam.us/firmware
- Change the default port for the camera
- Change the default username
- Change (of course!) the default password
- Pick a good/secure dynamic DNS provider

For mobile apps (for Android) I prefer Foscam Viewer (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ipc.newipc)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good starter camera.  Poor Colors.  Reasonable IR performance.
review_body:
For a starter camera, this is pretty good. Its best to spend as little as possible to get started playing with IP cameras -- there's a lot to learn and its best to learn with a small initial investment. Having said that, I have bought three other Foscam units and this camera has the worst image quality. There's something about the IR filter that doesn't seem right and the colors are just horrible. Not sure if that's just my unit or a common issue, but don't expect good colors from this camera. The night quality is pretty good, for indoor use since things are generally pretty close.

The pan/tilt performance of this unit is better than the other, higher image quality, Foscam units I have. I suspect a lot of that has to do with the lower bandwidth of this camera, but it has less lag and seems to move more smoothly than more expensive Foscams.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great cameras. Pan and Tilt functions nicely with controllable ...
review_body: Great cameras. Pan and Tilt functions nicely with controllable speed and good viewing range. The included mounts are a bit bulky however. Infrared viewing range is decent, although I would like to see an option to operate in IR mode without the IR flood lights. I mounted mine outdoors and although they are not weatherproof, you can buy (or perhaps craft) a weather proof enclosure. I put some plastic shrink wrap on mine and they've survived two heavy rains so far. Set up is simple if you have knowledge on how IP cameras and networks in general work. I can see this being a bit more difficult for the less experienced. Remote access functions nicely, I use No-IP.com for my DDNS and I can access my two cameras from anywhere.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera is great. Offers some really good features for the price. Clarity and options are way better than my belkin netcam. However, setup is a painful process. Takes way too long. I do like that it has 3rd party app support though.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great product, would like a better Android app or ...
review_body:
Great product, would like a better Android app or more viewing options. It has decent IR vision, though the cut off to turn switch on IR could be turned down a little since it has good enough low light to not need IR sometimes. The connectivity is nice and easy, just connect via LAN port and set up wifi if you need it.

I like that this doesn't have an app that lets you access it from anywhere though I understand why people would want that. I use it as a baby monitor so I only need it while I'm at home. If I wanted to see my kid while away from home I'd just set up port forwarding (be sure to change the username and set a password!). One note if you do that though is to remember that it is not a secure connection so don't try to access your camera from an untrusted network. A VPN would be best.

On their Android App, I would like a better battery usage. It would also be nice to keep the sound on when you turn off the screen.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Range for camera is terrible. Unless it's sitting on top of your wireless device, don't bother getting this. It ends up timing out and resetting constantly. Also, the web application does NOT provide audio support. Spend a little more money and buy something made of better quality.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I'm glad I have the camera
review_body:
This is my first and, so far, only IP camera, I bought it in order to gain access to the free DDNS hosting that comes with the camera, and supposedly, comes with most, but not all IP, cameras. I don't really need a video cam. I mostly just need to have my DHCP External IP address emailed to me whenever it changes so that I can log into my Smarthome hub. OK, that said, I'm glad I have the camera. It comes in very handy.

Setup is not that hard if you know a little about IT and Internet functioning, configuration, and protocol. You need to know your external and internal IP addresses for your modem/router. You need to know how to log into your Internet modem/router, and you need to know how to port forward. You need to know your email server settings. I'm no IT geek genius and I was able to figure most of it out. What I could not figure out I had the tech weenies at Foscam do for me through a shared computer link. Perfectly safe if you're a residential owner. I wouldn't advise doing it if you're a CitiBank VP or Hospital Administrator or if you're a big wig at the NSA.

Maybe I can save you some trouble right now and tell you the simple mistakes I made and maybe, just maybe this will save you some time and/or a phone call to Foscam.

In Basic Network Settings, manually plug in the camera's current IP address, DNS Server, Subnet Mask, Gateway, and the HTTP port that you're assigning to the camera (Foscam recommends 8080 or 8090). MAKE SURE the 'Obtain IP from DHCP Server' is unchecked.

Go into your Internet modem/router and make sure you port forward this port (8080 or 8090) to the camera. Different modems have different dashboards and configurations so it helps to have the make and model number of your modem handy. Just Google 'port forward make-model#' and follow the directions. You will need to know your user name and password to get into the modem/router. This is usually not the same as your network name and password, unless you never changed any of them.

Next, use an online \\"open port\\" checker to make sure this port is open. You'll need your external (public) IP address for this. You can get this three different ways, online from whatismyip.org, by typing 'google my ip' in any browser search window, or by going into DOS or OS and looking at a screenshot of your network config file. If 8080 or 8090 is open, your next step is to try and log in locally with your internal ip. If that goes well, try to log in from somewhere outside your LAN.

Set your ddns service before you set your email settings. And change your username and password last.

If you want to have Foscam set it up for you, call them and a techie will remote access your computer and set you up in about 3 minutes. Don't expect a lot of chit chat or instruction.

Last but not least, I had a real problem logging in remotely and getting the pan and tilt to work. I was sure there was some kind of network or broken link/socket problem. Turns out, I was tapping the control buttons once and waiting for a response. You have to click and hold to get the controls to work.Next, use an online \\"open port\\" checker to make sure this port is open. You'll need your external (public) IP address for this. You can get this three different ways, online from whatismyip.org, by typing 'google my ip' in any browser search window, or by going into DOS or OS and looking at a screenshot of your network config file. If 8080 or 8090 is open, your next step is to try and log in locally with your internal ip. If that goes well, try to log in from somewhere outside your LAN. Set your ddns service before you set your email settings. And change your username and password last. If you want to have Foscam set it up for you, call them and a techie will remote access your computer and set you up in about 3 minutes. Don't expect a lot of chit chat or instruction. Last but not least, I had a real problem logging in remotely and getting the pan and tilt to work. I was sure there was some kind of network or broken link/socket problem. Turns out, I was tapping the control buttons once and waiting for a response. You have to click and hold to get the controls to work.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great product! Everything works. Comes in a nice package, I liked the matte-finish body. Very easily configured to wireless internet - you need network cable(comes with it) first time to configure wireless WIFI. Easily setup other configuration from laptop using \\"Server Push Mode\\" , never bothered about \\"ActiveX Mode\\". The best apps to access from smart phone are \\"Foscam Viewer\\", provides easy access to pan camera, etc. but there is no way to communicate with camera speaker and for that you need another app \\"IP Cam Remote\\" app and easily communicate with camera Audio. I wish if I could do everything from single app, anyways...I don't mind. I even tried motion detection and worked perfectly, but note that if you have special characters in your password it will not work though the test email will. I believe that's a bug. I also configured DDNS and can access camera from outside my WIFI. Overall I am happy with the product and recommend others.

review_headline: 2 cameras, neither does what they should
review_body: This camera looks great and sounds like it has all these great features. Unfortunately, few of them work. The video works fine as long as it is plugged into the router, but as soon as you disconnect the cable and try to get the wifi working, it stops. I never could get the audio to work even one-way, much less two, even when it was plugged in. The day and night vision are actually pretty good on this camera but it's not worth having to run cords all through your house so it can stay attached to the router. I called their customer support, they were friendly and certainly tried to help but even after remote accessing my computer to try to get the camera to work, it wouldn't. So they told me it was defective and I should send it back and get another one. I returned it to Amazon, got another one and the same problems cropped back up so I returned the second one too and am back at square one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good not great, but they do the job, and for the price are deserving of 5 stars.
review_body: I would say that overall for the price-especially the Amazon warehouse deals price (I ordered three of these open box through Amazon Warehouse deals for about $47 each. The cameras seem to be as good as new, and so far work fine), they are deserving of 5 stars. If you want a cheap camera that does the job, this is probably the one.    They are relatively easy to set up. The first one took me about 30 minutes to figure out. The second two I was able to set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture quality is good thought not HD, and the night vision feature is pretty impressive. I can see my baby clearly even when the room is pitch black!    My main complaint is that the available software kind of sucks. The official Foscam software is useless, and barely worked. uFoscam is a 3rd party app, and the best I was able to find for iPhone, was easy to set up, but the interface is very crude, and not the easiest to navigate. Though that being said, it serves my purposes of having three cameras in my home to monitor my baby and nanny when we are out. I can view all 3 cameras on one screen, and can move the cameras, and turn night vision on and off remotely. Also like being able to talk into the camera through the app....though mostly used to freak out my wife when I'm not home. I haven't managed to get any desktop software to work yet for monitoring all 3 cameras on one screen but I haven't tried too hard. Haven't managed to set up recording yet, though I think there is a way. Also motion detection in the app is not very well implemented.    If you have a bigger budget I'm sure it would be worth getting more expensive cameras, but if your budget is limited, these do the job just fine. With any luck, better software will be available for these cameras in future.    Overall, good not great, but for the price deserving of 5 stars.

review_body: This is the first security camera I have ever bought. I did not want to spend much until I found one that was easy to set up and worked great. I found it on my first try. This thing is great. It took only minutes to set it up. I downloaded the software, plugged it into my router and started it. the picture came right up. review_body: I use this as a baby monitor and it is great. So much cheaper than the regular video monitors. A little tricky to set up with the app, I use this with my old audio baby monitor though. The audio on this camera is either ON or OFF and doesn't have the function to only come on when noise triggers it, which is a bummer. Regards,

tony Cariddi

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera, complicated firmware update led to headache.
review_body:
Okay, so this camera I got to monitor a disabled family member who needs 24 hour care and I still have work to do to support myself.
The camera worked fine for a while till I updated the firmware which seemed to break the device, it worked wired but not wirelessly which is really important to the use of it.

Turns out this thing has another number on the bottom which is important to firmware and you should be VERY cautious when updating. This was the infuriating part which almost made me return it. I wish I had the guide that I found online that helped me fix this but make sure you pay VERY close attention to that serial number on the bottom of the camera-not just the model number.

On to the camera, the picture is grainy and passable quality which is fine for what I and I figure many would use this device for. You can tell what people are doing and has enough detail to make out what is going on. One thing that bothers me is the refresh rate says it's 60hz but it's clearly running 30 or less FPS. While I don't need 60fps, seeing that refresh rate and the actual rate the wireless is delivering feels a bit like a lie to me.

All and all the camera works well, you can easily pan it to look around and use the mic to hear if there's anything going on/anyone hurt. I just recommend you take care in updating the device's firmware and only tackle this thing if you're tech savvy unless you have it wired up.

review_headline: Decent camera that does its job.  Will buy a better one in the future.
review_body: Reasonably priced and does its job ok.  Resolution is fine and the camera is quite stable.  Initially bought it to check on the family while away for two months.  Now, it is primarily used to check on my birds while at work.  I have caught him once through the camera sneaking out of a cage door that had been accidentally left open, and I was able to call a family member to put him back into the cage before he wondered around and hurt himself.  The major negative is the audio not working at all.  **Beware** of hackers.  In the first month, we didn't set the password, and we noticed a few times the camera had shifted on its own, meaning someone had hacked in.  All in all, it is a decent camera.  In the future, I would pay more for a more sophisticated one to check on an elderly family member.

review_body: Don't buy this. Listen to the reviews. First I couldn't even get it set up, took a whole day, part of which I spent an hour on the phone with customer service (total s***) half hour on hold, only for the guy in INDIA tell me I needed a new ethernet cable (the one from the box, he decided it was bad) that was not the issue in the end. Then when I finally get it set up i realize I HAVE to be connected to a wifi network and can't access via LTE or 4G, have to download a third-party app on my phone that I had to PAY for, then I can't get sound on my laptop I have to download a third-party plug-in, and the link provided for this plug-in links to a service that no longer makes the plug-in. NOW I'm on my trip hoping to view my home and cannot access the camera on any device or machine. I have all the regrets with this. If the camera still doesn't work when I am closer to home and at work next week I'm returning this waste of money.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is the review for the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black). I had one that stopped working. Everything turned pink. Amazon replaced it very fast. The new one is working great. The night vision on this camera is amazing. The setup is not very difficult. I just found some videos on YouTube that walked me through step by step how to set it up. I set up port forwarding so that i can access the camera from anywhere. I debated about getting the newer version of this camera, but i don't need full HD, and its hard to beat this price. I just wanted to be able to see if someone was in my house and check in on the dog. For those purposes the video quality is more than sufficient. I can easily distinguish peoples features from way across the room. I downloaded the IPhone app, and now i can check the camera anywhere from my phone. This comes in handy to make sure the dog has not eaten our house. I have yet to use the two way audio so i am not sure how well the speaker works.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera came with a CD and who has a CD player anymore in their computers?  I waited more an hour to speak with Foscam tech support and they instructed me to download software which would not work.  I would warm anyone to avoid this product as getting it set up is very difficult, and tech support is incompetent and can barely communicate.  Also be careful who you buy products like this from.  I bought this on Groupon and their return policies are so restrictive that I'm stuck with two cameras now that are non-fuctioning because I simply don't have the time for hours and hours of poor tech support.  Message to Groupon- I will be shopping for goods now through Amazon where they have enlightened and consumer friendly return policies.

However, I called the tech support hotline and Kevin was able to set up the camera for me through wireless remote.  I greatly appreciated his service, he was very friendly, polite and detailed.  He was very patient and showed me the features of the camera.  He even showed me how to view the camera from my iphone.  I think it could be very difficult if you set it up on your own, so just give the tech support a call and they will give you the full support.  So far i love the camera, it's very clear and easy to use!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A great camera - especially for the price
review_body: We ordered a 2nd one after installing the first one.  It was really easy to set up.  We opted to use the embedded DDNS and change the default port from 80 to something unique (for security).  The default installation gives you a website (something like xxxxx.myfoscam.org where xxxxx is unique to the camera itself) but Foscam does not provide a phone app to view the camera.  I am using IP Cam Remote on my Samsung Galaxy 3 phone and it works perfectly.  If you change the port, the website would be xxxxx.myfoscam.org:yyy (with the colon and the yyy being the new port).  You also have to set up port forwarding on your router.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not a bad cam been using it since Aug 2013 BUT even ...
review_body:
Not a bad cam been using it since Aug 2013
BUT even after updating to current firmware (11.37.2.59 and UI 2.4.10.11)

1) Drops WiFi signal - easily confused if there are lots of wireless APs nearby - have to reposition antenna until you get max signal to your AP and minimize others. Can take a while.

2) advertised as being wireless N - not happening - I can only get it to be G and if I set my router to N only.. cam will not connect so it is NOT wireless N (false advertising or bad firmware)

3) unable to get it to connect to mfgs DNS so had to do 3rd party

They are sometime slow to respond to the tilt/pan/zoom features and often will give me an image when I hit it from the browser, but that doesn't seem to update. Overall, I have several of this model and the earlier ones seem to give me less trouble than the later ones with respect to the delay I mentioned above.

I had to call their tech support on one camera once and the support tech logged in to my system remotely and configured something I was unable to configure. While he was there, he went ahead and took care of another camera issue I was having as far as config goes with a router off-site.

I give them 4 stars because, overall, I use these everyday and they work correctly a lot more than they don't, they had great tech support, and for the money, how can you beat them?

review_headline: Disgusting firmware, poorly written, looks like something put together in a week.
review_body:
The only reason this gets 2 stars instead of one, is that the hardware is pretty good. Unfortunately, these people took OEM hardware and RUINED it with the firmware and management software they wrote. Terrible, TERRIBLE usability and management. The application they distribute for MacOS is v0.0.0.1 (yes, you've read correctly, sounds solid enough to ship for production, right?) and behaves as such. I hope I could figure out who work on this to never, ever hire any of these people. Could never get it to work on WiFi. It's never clear if the static IP address or DHCP setting applies to the ethernet port, the wireless interface, or both.

Oh, and they cherry on top: the screenshots on the documentation show Linksys logos all over the place. At least make an effort to hide what you're stealing from.

review_body: These are great cameras at a good price.  We use several to look at our home while on trips.  They can also send pictures and do videos when alarm is triggered due to motion or sound.  While these cameras can support sound, on Macs this is not as seemless as on PCs.  Still, these are far cheaper than anything I've seen in brick and mortar stores. Be safe and change the default password and check for firmware upgrades.  There was a bug in some of these cameras that permitted access without a password.  It was fixed in my cameras.

review_headline: The camera (hardware) is good. However the problem comes from the user manual ...
review_body: The camera (hardware) is good.  However the problem comes from the user manual and installation guide which are VERY POORLY WRITTEN (I truly believe the authors of these manuals didn't get sufficient trainings, the company is a small LLC company).  I spent so much more time than I thought it could be. ActiveX control code for IE11 of Windows 7 does not work, eventually found that I have to disable the security under IE setting to BYPASS SECURITY check from Windows 7 (the certificate expired a few months ago but they didn't recertify the software).  It works now but I feel tired.  Words to FOSCAM folks: please keep improving this big weakness and attract more customers and make them happy.    I emailed the problem to them on Friday, they got back to me on Sunday night and Monday with new plugins in a link which they claim can solve the problem. I will try as soon as I can. I hope they will update this in their official website to avoid issue to others.  ------------------------------------from FOSCAM support----------------------  We have released new plug-ins to resolve the issue of not getting the certificate installed on Internet Explorer, you can download them here:  IPCWebComponents-new.zip  All HD cameras for version 2.x.1.10 and later    IPCComponents-2342wjx.zip  All HD cameras for version before 2.x.1.10    DVM_IPCam.zip  For all MJPEG series  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

review_headline: Never did get it set up right
review_body:
Poor customer service. Technicians never could get this working properly for web access. I finally gave up calling after about 9 tries. And every time they wanted to do something they'd have me take it off the wall and plug it into the computer. The last technician told me everything would work fine "now." What he didn't tell me before we ended the call was that they'd set it up ONLY for in-home access over the wifi, and NOT in a way I could access the camera from the web. The ONLY part of it that works properly is that it will automatically take pictures when it detects motion and will e-mail me the photos. As expensive as it was, you'd think it would be a bit easier to set up, or they'd have better customer service. It has been about a year, wish I could return this or find someone that knows what they're doing and woud set it up properly.

Once I save up some money, I'll definitely go with some other brand camera for a different area.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent IP Cameras for the price, works great on my Wi-Fi locally or via the internet anywhere in the world ;>)
review_body: I ordered two of these for same day delivery, arrived early in the evening and started putting things on my Wi-Fi network and also via the internet for viewing anywhere in the world.  First, these cameras, in my opinion, are excellent for the price!  The color is very good and you can adjust the motion to move the cameras vertical and horizontal faster or slower.  The directions are straight forward and I didn't have any trouble putting things on my network.  The Wi-Fi setup does take a little understanding about your router.  If you understand how to set port forwarding on your router, the setup will be a snap.  I have an Apple Airport Extreme, the newest N version and setting up a port forwarding is very simple.  These cameras come with port 80 as their default but I highly recommend putting the port to a higher number, I put mine on the 2,000's for each one.  First you will hook the camera up to your router via the RJ45 cable, included, follow the instructions to change the port forwarding number on the camera, you'll be able to see what the camera is looking at right away with the included software, very straight forward.  Be sure to know your routers password to make adjustment for Wi-Fi setup and you'll be good to go.  Now, having said all that, I will tell you it took me less than 15 minutes to set each of these cameras up on my Wi-Fi setup and also via the APP for viewing locally and anywhere in the world again, with the port forwarding setup.  I do understand where some have had problems setting these cameras up, knowing your own wireless system, setup and password, makes things a lot easier but there can still be glitches.  Your router will restart when you put in a new port forwarding and you can also setup a static IP address  for each of the cameras you have, again, it is listed in the easy instructions.  The nicer APP for iPhone and iPad was $5.99 on the Apple APP store, there was a free one but had limited setup so decided to get the better one and glad I did.  Now we have local and distant viewing of our upstairs and downstairs, with just two cameras.  The motion is very smooth and unless you are standing right next to the camera while it is moving, you can't really hear them at all.  I can't attest to the quality of the audio since I haven't used that yet, I can tell you that the video and color are excellent for a non HD camera, I am very pleased with these cameras!  The night vision worked great, total darkness last night and I could see great in each of the rooms where the cameras were located.  I know there are better cameras out there, most cost twice or more what these cost, in one case I looked at an HD IP Camera, the price was over three times what each of these Foscams cost, those were HD cameras and I can image the high quality of the images they produce, but I wasn't interested in that, I wanted a couple of good quality, good color cameras with full range of motion to work with my Wi-Fi and be able to check the house locally or from anywhere in the world, and that is what I got.  So far so good, happy with the quality of these IP Cameras for the price!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great indoor IP camera for monitoring traffic.
review_body:
This camera feels very solid and works great. We use it to monitor our three car garage to see in/out going traffic and as a security piece in case someone would break in. I use this in conjunction with a QNAP NAS, so plenty of space and the QNAP has some monitoring software.

The camera can email you special events like when it detects motion or sound. This is a nice feature since I know within minutes if some unauthorized access happened. It gives a great piece of mind when traveling.

The quality of the night vision is great, but when it takes a picture of someone on the other side of the garage (100 feet) it is very difficult to gauge who it is. That is why the NAS does take 720p footage. If that is important to you, you may want to look at a higher resolution camera.

One final note. I installed in in an unheated garage. The temperature in that garage has dipped already a few times to 20F and the camera kept working without dropping signal.

review_headline: Excellent quality image. Nice remote access features.
review_body:
I initially bought one of these cameras for use at the office, as there had been some reports of break-ins in the area. Some of the main features that I was looking for included pan-tilt, auto-focus, motion detection, wireless access, smart phone control and viewing capability, and email alerts. This camera had all of those features that I was looking for.

I've now had it for about two months and I am pretty happy with it so far. I downloaded the IP Cam Viewer app for my phone and iPad, which works very well. I also use an old iPhone basically as a solid state DVR, which is running all the time. It has the option of being set up for certain hours or for continuous use. It can also record only upon motion detection. I set it up to record continuously from 6pm to 7am. With how much memory my old phone has available it is able to keep 3-4 days of storage at any given time.

My only complaint is with the email alert system. I haven't been able to fine-tune the motion detection sensitivity to send emails when there is actual motion activity inside or outside of the office. If I can somehow figure out how to fix this problem I would give it 5 stars without any reservations.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Hit or Miss - both cameras and support
review_body: I purchased two of these cameras; one in Feb and one this month.  I had been trying for months with the first camera to get the DNS (free w purchase) to work.  I tried many troubleshooting steps in addition to tapping the expertise of my brother who is a network expert.  I reluctantly tried Foscam tech support.  The first thing she requested was remote access which I declined; she then was stuck on port forwarding even though I confirmed that it was setup and working properly.  She was obviously reading from script and would not budge.  I kept bringing her back to what I thought was the issue but she would not budge off of port forwarding issues.  I disconnected from her and tried again to contact support.  (In my years of experience in tech support, rep surfing is sometimes the only way to get proper help; I expect 1 good tech support rep for every 3 calls made).  I was lucky with the next support person I reached.  Instead of phrasing my issue that I could not get my DNS to work, I instead asked if the Manufacturer's Domain in the DDNS Service Settings should be blank.  This worked.  The rep asked me to very firmware version and when she confirmed it was the latest version, she told me that the camera firmware was faulty and required replacement.  The only issue is that they required me to send it in and be without it for an unknown period of time.  This camera was purchased to check in on an elderly family member who recently had surgery.  Even without the DNS working, I am able to view using iCam app on my iPhone which uses the internal IP address.  I then requested advanced replacement from Foscam (since my return period with Amazon had expired) and provided my credit card info for authorization.  I emailed not once, not twice but three times and have received no reply.  I decided to purchase a second camera for myself and set it up the same day I received it and it worked without issue so I know that the blank DDNS info is the cause of the issue.  Not only are the cameras hit or miss, but so is the support.  I have worked in tech support for over 15 years....be wary of reviewers indicating that support is great....no company has spot on tech support 100% of the time.the cameras hit or miss, but so is the support.  I have worked in tech support for over 15 years....be wary of reviewers indicating that support is great....no company has spot on tech support 100% of the time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Things I liked:  - Cheap  - It does seem to have a lot of configuration/customization options  - Motion detection schedule is very customizable  - Good documentation  - Can save the configuration to a backup (*.bin) file    Things I don't like:  - Web interface is clunky and slow unless you're accessing via desktop on a local network.  - The overall video quality/detail is not that great. It's not easy to make out faces for example, which seems essential to me. If you know who the person is already, you could tell it's their face. If a stranger were to appear on the video then it'd be hard to exactly identify them from what you have.  - The motion detection is primitive. It seems either too sensitive or not sensitive enough. Something like switching lights on/off will set off motion detection, despite an option available which claims to reduce false positives from light changes. Expect at least a week of tweaking the sensitivity options. Even the IR lights turning on/off will trigger the motion detection.    Works fine, and good enough for a entry level security camera for home.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A lot of issues there, but it all works now
review_body: I just got my Foscam. I am definitely computer savvy, but not an network expert. This is my first surveillance camera experience, After some struggles, I finally got it running on WiFi. The wired ethernet, was no problem.  The WiFi setup was helped a lot by the simplified WPS. Make sure you have a WPS enabled WiFi router.  I have also been able to setup the ftp upload service. I have my own .com domain ($1.89 per month), so that helped.  But the email alert system still do not work out for me, and after reading some Foscam blogs, it seems like there is a lot of issues there. Most users have problems, obviously depending on the ISP and/or your gmail etc set up.  Setup manual seems to be pretty complete, but when working with details, there is a lot of things that are not explained enough, or you have to be an experienced installer.  So for now, the Foscam is not my favorite in WiFi mode, since system fails to make the email alerts.  That might be a different issue if Foscam is connected to a DVR/NVR  I will try to keep updating my experience with this Foscam    A couple hours later...    OK  I have made the camera to forward email alerts now, and it works great.  But I could not use the gmail smpt, so I used my own domains email, hosted by one.com in Denmark ($1.89 per month is a steal btw). I contacted the 24/7 chat line, and the technician told me to use port 2525, and not to use any Transport Layer Security...  And Voila, it works great...  Seems like the camera is using a unusual protocol or something, that makes it fail on standard ports  I can give the camera 4 out of five stars now, the lost star is for the poor manual....

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice camera, video quality is very good for the ...
review_body: Nice camera, video quality is very good for the price. I use an android app to view the camera on my phone. The pan tilt functions and presets work very well. The only setting that's missing is one for adjusting the threshold for the IR switchover. In certain lighting conditions the camera will consistently switch between daylight and night viewing. When it does this there's a "clicking" sound. That sound is made when the camera switches the IR cut filter in and out. In most cases I reposition the camera via panning to change what the camera sees and the clicking usually stops when the camera settles.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: what they don't advertise is that you can only get firmware updates for their products if you agree to get spam email pretty muc
review_body: Camera works as advertised. It really is an indoor-only camera since it would crash/reset when there is too much light.    Why only 2 stars? Well, what they don't advertise is that you can only get firmware updates for their products if you agree to get spam email pretty much every day. There is no \\"search and download\\" on demand or anything like that. You have to endure a constant bombardment of advertisement email for each and every model, they ever made or may make in the future.    The product is OK.     Edit after Foscam reply: Changed to 3 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice network camera for the low price
review_body: Nice network camera for the low price. It's not as good as my HD cameras (Hikvision & Vivotek) so it's not fair to compare these to this Foscam. The Foscam's picture quality is fine for baby or pet monitoring or just keeping an eye on what goes on inside your home. This is an indoor camera but I see some reviews mentioning that some are being used outdoors successfully.  I wouldn't recommend putting this outdoors even though it would work for the short term simply because the camera is not weather proof. It would be only a matter of time before humidity dust & rain would get to the inside of the camera.

review_body:
Good camera - easy control, not bad bad pic quality.
IR LED clicks when the light is just dim enough. It might be a little annoying.

The biggest issue...
No https means you are transmitting your login password to the camera in plain text on the network or internet. I strongly recommend you change the default port.

If I have known about the lack of https I would not have bought the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: THE WORSE PRODUCT AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT EVER
review_body: THE WORSE PRODUCT AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT EVER!! Do not waste your time or money on this piece of junk. The reviews on Amazon are fake and I should have heeded the warnings from other reviewers who had a similar awful experience. Just to speak to the tech support, you have to wait on hold for 45 minutes to an hour and once the tech support is on the phone with you, you have to wait while they try to figure out what is wrong with the product. Each time, the same problem persisted and each tech support person assured that the problem was fixed but the same problem (remote access failing due to remote address keep changing) was never resolved. I am so angry that I wasted hours of my life on this useless, cheap junk. Even when it was working, the visual and audio were terrible quality. The movements were not at all smooth and the background noise made it impossible to hear anything people were saying. I strongly advise you to heed the warnings and read the negative reviews. There's no way that the positive reviews are real - this product is a complete waste of your money and time. Amazon better give me a full refund and not give me any trouble with the return!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Absolute junk. Do not buy this piece of cheap... camera. The software is garbage as well as the hardware. The tech support is also terrible. This device has a problem with resets. It will reset randomly so recording over a long period of time is useless as it will stop recording and reset its position. The software that comes in with it will have lots of presets that may help this problem but expect to do hours of tinkering to get this to work. You have to use internet explorer to use ActiveX which is the only mode in which it will allow you to record using a browser.

After googling I'm told that the defect that I have with my particular camera is a manufacturer issue but I have lost doubt of having it fixed due to the terrible support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

Love this camera. The picture is fantastic. It was easy to set up; I can view on my PC or phone. My main use was to view my front yard through the living room window. I've had lawn ornaments (like Christmas lights) stolen from close to the house. But it
doesn't work well looking outside through a window. I tried turning off the IR lights and placing IR lights outside but still can't see too much. Inside they work great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The resolution isn't all that great but if I wanted that I should have gotten the HD one.  I did attempt to set it up myself but had to call tech support and have them do it for me. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy enough to set up.  It took me about 15 minutes.  If you have a hard time you can call support and they will remotely set it up for you as well.  I use it as a toddler monitor since she is now out of the crib and in a toddler bed.  It would also be good for anywhere in your home as a security measure.  You can access it from anywhere!  When I am at work I can log in from my cell or work computer and see what is going on in my home!  If you have a babysitter or nanny, this would also give you some added sense of security knowing that you can monitor what is going wherever you are at!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Even though there's all this hype about the hacking, we still use this.  Very affordable. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good indoor IP webcam with some wireless quirks
review_body:
This is a good indoor IP webcam with some quirks. I tried to set it up with a static IP address using a wired connection and that worked OK. I then tried to set it up with a static IP address using the wireless connection. No luck. The camera kept freezing and I had to repeated power cycle to get back the connection.
What did work to get a static IP assigned to the camera over the camera's wireless network adaptor is to use my Linksys router's IP address reservation with the camera's wireless IP MAC address - this is working well.
The 720 HD works great and the IR cut filter will audibly click in and out as the lighting in the room goes off and on.
