review_headline: Works great. The instructions that come with the package will ...
review_body: Works great. The instructions that come with the package will be complex for the average user so find a tech buddy to help set it up.    I didn't use the CD included at all. I just connected the camera with ethernet and entered in my wifi network... I also changed the default login and password. I have a router so I port forwarded the port I use and it works wonderfully.    The great thing is that the unit has a website on the bottom of it for easy access. You can give that link to family/friends. So far, the unit is working exactly like I wanted.    edit: I wanted to add that I've been using an IP camera app (free version) from app store on my phone and it works great with this camera. I'm really happy with it all.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is great.  I get a clear picture and was easy to install on my computer.  There are youtube videos that walk you through how to install the thing to your computer.  Doesn't work well if you have it looking out a window with a screen over it at night.  Works fine with a screen over the window during the day. The night vision is really good.  If you want to video tape and review the footage later, be aware you are going to have to get your own software to do that.  The camera doesn't come with that. There is free software available on the internet.  The one I use used to be called Vitamin D.  My camera was used to catch a cheapskate neighbor who was putting garage in my trash can every week.  I was able to get video evidence and pictures to present to my HOA board.  The camera worked great for my purposes.  Justice was served!  lol

I finally gave up and returned them. the FPS is about 6 if you are lucky, otherwise it floats at around 4 over wifi. However the idea of having cameras were very cool, so I spent bit more money and got hikvision cameras (top of the line chinese brand, which work GREAT). I also replaced one of these with another camera (Geeya 801c) which works well and much faster. That has it's flaws too though. I would suggest if you're going to get one of these, you spend the 20-30 more extra dollars and get something better with h264 maybe.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Only for the most technically savvy to install and set up, otherwise give it a pass
review_body: Unless you are a network guru, run, don't walk away from this camera!  I read some reviews saying how difficult it was to set up.  Then I saw some youtube videos that made it look not so bad.  I should have heeded the reviews!  This thing does NOT install itself.  I can't get the IP Camera Tool to find the camera IP address when the thing is hooked up to my router.  The instructions are useless, written in broken English in large part.  The tool just shows a blank page, no IP addresses.  The manual says if the IP addresses don't show up automatically, then make sure the DHCP is enabled and MAC address filtering, firewalls and anti-virus are turned off.  What the heck is a DHCP?  How would I know if Mac address filtering is on or off? None of that is explained or discussed. Turning off the firewalls and anti-virus is as far as I know.  Anything else requires an advanced degree in computer tech.  Unless you know what that junk means, steer clear of this turkey.    Step one is to plug it in to the outlet and your router.  Check.  I couldn't make it through step 2, use the IP camera tool.    I bought this camera at a charity silent auction, it had never been used.  Now I know why.  Too bad I wasted my money.  I can't even return this thing.  Dropping it off a tall building is looking like my most attractive option.    Three hours of my life have been pissed away, trying to get this thing to work.  I'll never get that time back, and there are so many productive things I could have done instead.  Supremely frustrated.    Oh yea, only giving it one star because Amazon won't let me give it none.    Additional comments.  After writing above, I texted a friend who has a couple of these.  She told me she had to have her brother who works in IT set it up for her. It was not easy or fast for someone who works in IT. She also suggested looking on the internet for an IP cam viewer.  I found one on CNet and tried it. No go.  I then went looking for others.  After about the 3rd download (I actually think they were all the same program, just different sites offering it), and with the non working IP camera tool still up, I somehow managed to cross proton streams and got an image through the camera.  I was able to pan and see my cats milling around, wondering what I was doing up at 1am. At that point, I copied all the information the camera tool had, that is the missing IP address and all the other techno babble. I then tried to untether the camera from the router and the whole thing crashed.    I spent another 2.5 hours trying to recreate the accident that got the thing to work, and this time I even tried using the camera IP address I had just found.  No go.  I finally gave up at 3:30 in the morning.    The only thing I have to show for all this effort is 3 hours of sleep and I'll be cranky all day at work.    I can't say it enough, while the camera might be OK, the software and rigamarole to set it up sucks big time.  Avoid this thing at all costs.  I'm going to look for a plug and play IP camera from some other manufacturer.

review_body:
I am pretty new to the whole security camera field. I do not have in depth knowledge of the types and qualities of various security cameras. Saying that, I have found this camera to be quite good. I think the picture quality is good for a $65.00 camera. You can pay much more for a security camera and I suppose the quality of the picture would be better.

The overall setup was pretty easy. It will be more difficult if you do not have any background in IP routing and protocols. I was able to get to work correctly and also able to get it accessible via the internet.

One note though. On my windows 7 computer the included software did not bring up the cameras IP address as stated in the documentation. I had to go into my router to find the IP address. Probably just a glitch on my side. You will need to know some IP protocol information or have a friend help you install the camera.

Otherwise works great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I really like this little camera
review_body:
I really like this little camera. It has a very decent picture (considering it's not HD) and I love being able to pan and tilt it remotely. I'm using it to keep track of a rescue cat who recently adopted me. He showed up on my property starving - literally. That was 3 months ago and now I've got him back up to full normal body weight and he is doing great. He's just getting used to a cat door I put in and since I'm away from home a lot I wanted the ability to see him coming and going. This camera works great for that.

HOWEVER, set up is not for the faint of heart. I worked in IT for nearly two decades and it was a real challenge for me. Admittedly, network infrastructure wasn't my area of expertise, which is where the issues were in setting this camera up.

Getting it to work on my local network (LAN) was not so easy because (after lots of head scratching and about 45 minutes of trying and trying again) I read something somewhere about making sure the security protocol that the WIFI router was set to matched what was expected by the Foscam software. In the Foscam software there is a drop-down box to select which security your router is using, and none of the selections matched what mine was set to so I had to reset my router to a security protocol that Foscam understood (WPA2-Personal with TKIP and AES).

That resolved that issue and I was able to view the camera from home, but I couldn't access it when I was away from home. After a lot of fooling around with my router making port forwarding rules (failed) and then virtual server rules (also failed), I finally discovered the problem was with my Internet Service Provider, which had a router behind my router that blocked all internet traffic that originated on the WAN (in other words, nothing could get to my router that wasn't a reply to a request that originally came from my router).

I called my ISP and asked them to stop blocking my access. They said they would, for an additional $10/month. Wow. An additional $120 per year just to look at a cat once in a while? I don't think so. So I was basically screwed. I ended up doing a workaround involving a remote access program called Teamviewer (free for personal use). The downside is that I have to remote into a laptop I leave running at home and then access the camera feed via that computer. This works because my laptop advertises its presence via Teamviewer so when I connect to it I am essentially replying to that, so it gets through my ISP's firewall. I'm still researching ways to bypass that so I don't have to leave a computer running at home, but haven't found a solution yet. This works great in the meantime though.

Another issue is that I haven't been able to get the audio to work yet. Both IE and Firefox say I need to install a plugin from VLC, which I did, but it gives me an error. I haven't spent any time trying to resolve that yet because I really don't need the audio, but thought I'd mention it for those who do.

P.S. I discovered Teamviewer when I contacted Foscam support to help me set this camera up, and that's what they used to remote into my computer to make changes. They weren't able to resolve the issue with my ISP's firewall, but seeing how Teamviewer worked gave me the idea to use it myself just to get this thing online.. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good IP cam for the 50$ range
review_body:
Great camera for the 50$ range. Purchased to be able to monitor our dog while at work. I will probably purchase a second for weather monitoring and etc.

The camera works well and set-up was easy with a dynamic IP as long as you know how to log in to your router (and/or modem) and forward the ports needed. This model does have its own DNS built in (from Foscam) in order to work with dynamic IP's without having the need to sign up for dyndns or no-up services. You will want a static IP set up in the programming of the camera though.

Multiple log-ins can be set up including administrator (full rights), controller (controls but no setting changes), and guest (view image only).

Image seems decent in both IR and full color.

The activeX (internet explorer) web control interface is better than the push mode (firefox, chrome, etc). In activeX you can display multiple cameras in a grid as well as record to .avi video file directly from the web control. Push mode is lacking both of those functions. (see images for both examples). I wish the web control had designated buttons for the presets rather than a drop down and go button, this makes switching between presets slow and cumbersome.

Lost one star on review for having to use IE for full web control functionality as I do not use IE for anything else. Otherwise recommended as a good IP cam at a decent price.

review_headline: I do like quality of and the PTZ
review_body: So far after 3 days, as far as I have gotten is downloading the software and viewing the camera with the ethernet cable attached to the router. I can't get any sound, nor can I get the phone app to work. I do like the clear video quality, especially the night vision, and the PTZ controls. The night vision is unbelievably clear. However this is really taking up a lot of my free time trying to get the audio to work and my phone app to work. Before I make a decision to send them back, I'm going to keep trying for about a week. Otherwise I won't be able to use the cameras for what I intended to use them for. I'll update my rating later. When the reviewers say it's tough to set up, take them seriously. I'm considering hiring a professional to come in and finish setting the cameras up for me but honestly I'm hesitant to spend the money. They make it look so easy on the youtube videos. I just knew I'd be able to make this work on the first try. The price is nice as at $55 each. One other thing I forgot to add is it comes with a wall mount and screws so there is no need to buy aftermarket wall mounts.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Check Foscam's support forums BEFORE you buy.   More problems than you can shake a stick at!  Glad they don't do NAS!
review_body:
Wow, I Purchased the Foscam f18910w , and anyone that has read any of my past reviews on technology knows I have a deep technical background and often can go in to intimate detail about issues I run in to. In this case it simply is not worth my time.
If you scan their forums for the f18910w you will see many people, some with other foscam models in addition to the f18910w are having problems with disconnect upon connecting to the forward port, or even disconnect on the local LAN!

My problem is even simpler. Sending a email alert. Now I know it is not a gmail, or yahoo mail problem because I am sending the mail out my own working SMTP gateway running on a server I have in "formerly The Planet D4" data center in Dallas, now IBM owned, and I sent all my email through the SMTP server. I have enabled SSL on port 469, TLS on port 587, and no security at all on port 25. I can send emails through all the ports, and the IP of my server is within my own domain, which is one I own through godaddy.com...

Setting up the email is simple. When TLS didn't work, I used simple No encryption, and just log in port 25 with user and password.
The TEST does not even succeed. Not an entry in the log. So of course I spanned my Cisco 3064 switch port the camera was on, and looked at the trace. The Foscam f18910w is sending out a handshake, the SMTP server replies, and that is the end of the trace. The Foscam than resets itself completely and I have to log in again at the fixed IP I gave it.

I suppose for $70 I at least expect it to be able to handle sending an email alert! That is the point of using motion sensor ability to send an alarm if it can't even send to a SMTP email server? All I can say is "Check the companies "Support forums" before you buy! I am sending this POS back. Suppose I will have to use something like a NETBOTZ like I have been doing in data center designs for years. They are more costly, but they have been around for two decades and they just work. Tested by hundreds of data centers for two decades.

There is NO WAY I would trust this to monitor my infant. Firmware issues, protocol problems, this company seems to be a mess. That is really too bad.

review_headline: Great camera. Setup was very quick and easy
review_body:
Great camera. Setup was very quick and easy. No issues connecting to it over wired and wireless. I had it up and running on my wireless network within 10 minutes of opening the package. I was able to add it to iSpy and remotely control it either directly or through iSpy. I am using it for security, set up to record when movement or sound is detected.

Pros:
- Cheap for what you get
- Flexibility due to wireless capability and tilt/pan
- IR works well
- Tilt/pan is smooth
- Comes with adjustable wall mount

Cons:
- Bigger than expected. Not a big deal for me but could be for some. I was expecting it to be about 2/3 the size. Not great if you want something inconspicuous.
- Image quality is low. Its not terrible but not great either. It should be sufficient for security or baby monitoring if you don't need to make out facial details or other smaller details.

review_body: I just knew when the offramp opened up and they renovated that old gas station down the way that a sea of suburb was soon to follow. When it was just me and my pup Whistler, I didn’t need to worry about anybody trespassing, because everybody new everybody, and everybody was old! Now Whistler’s as wrinkly as me, and this rural forest’s now a big city town, and you need to be sure you’re keeping your loved ones safe from trespassers. Time was, Whistler could smell em from a mile off and chase em back to their houses, but nowadays he couldn’t chase off a determined squirrel, much less someone his own size. Easy installation and USB compatibility, and now I know when anybody’s on my lawn. I recommend pairing with a remote control noisemaker to really scare off those who think anyone’s property is just some personal playground!

review_body: I'm giving this 4 stars because for the price, the video quality, sound quality and panning ability are hard to beat. It was a bit of a pain to get set up. It took a few hours until we were able to see video from outside our network, but we did get it to work, and it works beautifully. The speaker is clear and works well, but the mic is pretty terrible. We have a small mic that we use with a small video camera that we plugged into the jack, and it works great. We travel a good bit, and we use this to check on the first floor of the house and to do a head count of the cats while we are gone. If you want something that reasonably priced to keep an eye on your house while you are gone, I couldn't suggest this camera more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Does the job for monitoring children and WOW-talk about customer service! :)
review_body:
WOW! ERIC HILL IS AMAZING! I bought these cameras thinking, "Ok, I'm an intelligent person. I can't install these myself." WRONG! I was so lost right from the start :( I made the dreaded decision to call customer service-right? Admit it-no one wants to have to call. Well, I was pleasantly surprised! Eric Hill helped me out, didn't judge my lack of techno intelligence and got everything worked out with no problems! I am highly impressed!

As far as the actual cameras go-So far so good. I am using these in my children's bedrooms and I mounted each in the corners of their rooms. I can clearly see their beds. The night vision is beginning to come on and I can still see quiet well. As far as the quality of the picture goes-I can clearly see what my children are doing (i.e. are they in bed or playing?) however, (from the corner of the room) they are not clear enough to be able to see if my children are breathing. That's one of the only negative thoughts I've had thus far, "Man, I wish I could zoom." My other, yet unanswered, question is, "Am I going to know if this freezes and I'm looking at an old frame?" I'm not sure. I'm hoping the camera has some sort of mechanism that will turn off the viewing from my side if the camera stream is frozen. I suppose I'll find out. As far as the distance from the router goes- our router is downstairs and I have both cameras upstairs. We have 10 or 11 foot ceilings. One of the cameras seems to be picking up quite well. The other I'm not so sure about yet. This might be more of an issue with our cheap router rather than a reflection of the camera quality. Also, I downloaded the app for my iphone and though it has terrible reviews I think it will do the job. It will be nice to be able to log in when I'm at work and want to check in on naptime.

So, day 1 and I'm giving these cameras a 5star rating when considering the price. Are they the most amazing cameras I've ever imagined? No. And would I expect that for barely more than fifty bucks a piece? No way.

For the price

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: After a few months I have become disappointed in every FOSCAM purchase I've made.  On the positive side, their GUI good looking and is easy to understand and use.  Other webcams costing half the price sometimes show Chinese characters by default (but there is usually an \\"English\\" button to change the GUI language). The Foscam GUI is clean and in clear English.    On the down side, their firmware is notoriously confusing.  You must disclose personal information to get updated firmware, and it's really easy to flash the wrong image, resulting in a brick.  I would not pass an undergrad computer science student's project with their firmware design and implementation -- it's that bad.  Also, customer service is a black hole.  Questions go in, nothing comes out.    I have two Foscams, and each of them flicker/flash IR all night.  With no discernable light source in the room, the IR lamps flash bright, then dim, in a never-ending cycle all night.  I've also noted a click (perhaps that's the IR board???).  Very bothersome.    I'm sticking with ELP and KaiCong cameras for now. ELP are hard to configure, but have great picture quality.  Read Amazon reviews of KaiCong  -- price does not necessary reflect picture quality.  The Amazon reviews will help you find the gems.    UPDATE (NOV 2014) -- After posting this review I was contacted by Foscam to replace the webcam, something I appreciated.  Before I could send the webcam back, my 2nd FI8910W webcam started acting up.  I wasn't sure what to do, so I thought about it for a while.  My decision -- put both FI8910W webcams on the shelf.  Getting replacements of the same model could prolong my aggravation if I have problems down the road.  I do not want anything to do with FI8910W's anymore. (On the fun side, I'm thinking about replacing the optics with a ELP-IP1881, keeping the webcam's rotate and pan/tilt motors; the end result may look like a frank-n-cam, but it'll have good optics and a good motor base for remote adjust.  Justan idea, but it might work).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Does what is has to do!
review_body:
Before I bought this IP Foscam wireless cameras I found it hard to decide which camera I had to choose; this camera or the HD version listed here: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F3KWZW8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeASIN=B00F3KWZW8&linkCode=as2&tag=newcams-20&linkId=6MPEHAZAGL3FCI54

Eventually I decided to first go for this version because it seemed good enough to me. Maybe in the future I will also buy the HD version. Ok so now about this camera; for me it was relatively easy to set it up. You can set it down and, with some technical tweaking on the router, have it operational in minutes (some router and DNS understanding is helpful, but the installation book gives details). Have it email you when it detects motion, or have 2-way conversations from your iPad, iPhone, or PC. Excellent iPad app allows full control. Pan, tilt, but no zoom. Remote zoom and focus would make this perfect, but would also probably double the price. Night vision works great. Keep an eye on your place when you're out of town. Check in on Mom and Dad to make sure things are okay, get emails if there's motion when you don't expect there to be. I use an android app called IP Camera, which works well. You can't use the APP they mention in the paperwork unless you go all the way and get a control HUB. Browser controls vary with the browser. IE will give you the most versatility, but FireFox and Chrome also work, with varying degrees of success. The iPad app is the best. Intuitive controls and speakerphone. In one word: Awesome!

review_headline: It worked fine for a couple of days but it happened again
review_body: I purchased this back in April of 2012.  It worked well, I never experienced any of the freezing or random rebooting that was mentioned in another review.  However, after 2.5 years of being plugged in, it finally died. I noticed I was unable to connect to it last week and decided to reboot it.  It worked fine for a couple of days but it happened again. I've since tried to reboot it and it no longer goes through it's boot-up routine of panning the camera around. I figured maybe it was just the camera part having an issue but it doesn't even show up on my router's client list anymore. Just two or 3 of the IR LEDs are a faint red. I plan on taking it apart, maybe a fuse blew. I will update if I figure out what went wrong.    edit: The circuit board definitely has a burnt electronics smell to it but I cannot see any damage. To be fair, it was never plugged into a surge protector.  I am going to purchase the FI9821W V2 as a replacement and make sure it is behind a surge protector.    UPDATE: I received the FI9821W and hooked up the power supply to the FI8910W I thought was dead and it powered right up. Apparently these adapters have a relatively short lifespan. I have ordered a replacement power supply and will keep using it as a secondary camera.

review_headline: I love this, great for people that love gadgets!
review_body:
I'm having too much fun with this, even though I'm just watching my fan spin haha. Sure, it takes some tech smarts to setup but get over it. If you know how to log into your router and you have youtube then it shouldn't be too bad. If you're not sure how to login to your router, don't bother buying this till you do. If you've never dealt with ports and IP's it will be a bit of a challenge for you but you'll feel accomplished after you do.

Lots of great apps to monitor from, I can record my house, audio, pan, tilt, etc. all from my phone. The bang is worth the buck, for this price you really can't beat it and the quality is pretty good, I'm not shooting the next transformers I'm monitoring my house. I can make out faces, audio, etc very well.

The stars will drop if anything changes or this thing stops working but for now I'm a guy that likes his tech toys and having a blast with this thing.

Oh, and it comes with a mount, so you can wall mount it and you can invert mount if you need to and just invert the picture.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to set up locally, but a little challenging to get set up for remote access
review_body:
Works great. The local access to the camera (same network) was easy. This installation for remote access is a little difficult, but it works as advertised when you get the settings right. I am using this remotely with my iPhone. Here is an overview of the steps I had to do:

1. Set up the camera using the wired Ethernet and defined the port (i.e. 80, 8090)
2. Define a static address using my router so it is the same every time it is powered on.
3. Configure the router to allow the port to pass through firewall
4. Removed cable and rebooted (now in wireless mode)
5. Since cable modems use dynamic IP addresses, I used a 3rd party DDNS (no-ip.com) to forward the port from my camera
6. Install app on iPhone and configure

review_headline: This thing is near impossible to use.
review_body: This thing is near impossible to use.  For the average person installing this and getting it to work wirelessly and remotely is just not possible. I do not recommend based on that. I am still working on getting it set up by searching for online tutorials. When I finally get it setup I feel it will be worth it but this is not user friendly unfortunately.    Update: Following the advice on the foscam support site I changed my http port or whatever it is to 8090.. now the camera is offline and not working at all. I am not an IT person, but I didn't realize I would need to be in order to use this product so after a weekend of small successes with it I'm back on square one (which is ready to throw this out the window!) any help would be accepted but my expectations are so low at this point...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It's amazing. I used it as a sort of nanny cam to watch my pets & pet sitter while away on a trip. I love the walkie-talkie action so my pets can hear me. Works great when paired with the Foscam app. However I recently changed my internet provider & now I have to reinstall everything but I'm having difficulty remembering how I did it the first time around. The installation process (to be able to access it away from your network) includes getting an outside host. Kind of complicated. If I could get some clarification on this it would be 5 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Quality control is out to lunch, or maybe on a smoke break...
review_body: Third defect in a row. I'm sick of returning it for another lemon. I had good 8910s in past but now this like the other two 8921s has a serious video defect. This one can not control brightness, it is ok, then dark, then real birght, cuts back again, then brightens slowly. It repeats this behavior every 5 seconds. It is not related to the IR function. I have upgraded to the latest firmware. It started doing this about a week ago. I've heard of others having this problem. FoScam doesn't listen or doesn't care anymore. They used to make cameras that worked and made my a believer. I wouldn't buy their cameras (anymore) to watch a dumpster, which is where they belong. [companies do watch dumpsters sometimes] Why does Amazon endorse these products enough to sell them firsthand? After so many RMAs it cant be profitable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: as long as I'm on my home network I can see everything just fine from my pc and laptop
review_body: Well, as long as I'm on my home network I can see everything just fine from my pc and laptop.  Unfortunately I bought it to be able to monitor the cats when I was out of town, and I 'm having terrible time trying to access it from outside.  I've gone through the routines for setting the ports etc in my router, and changing the settings on the firewall, and all the other things that Foscam, ATT and various help sites have said to do and I still can't get it to work.  This has been going on for months (I only have just so much time to devote to it).  In addition, one of the units fell off the table and the antenna broke off.  After an extremely confusing and garbled live chat session with a rep, I learned that I can have a new antenna sent for free, but can't work out where to send the request.    When I'm on the home network, I am very pleased, and am very hopeful that someday I'll be able to get it to work externally, but for the moment I remain unsuccessful.    Update 15 Oct 2014    This is an update to my review above.  Foscam customer service were very prompt about responding to the above review (which I honestly hadn't expected).  When I finally had time to respond, I promptly received a call from Salah, in their support area, who was extremely helpful.  He took control of my screen and stuck with the problems until we finally had them resolved.  I am able to see the feeds from both cameras while not on my home network.  He was very patient, as fix after fix didn't work, but he persisted and we finally got there.  I was very glad for his help because the setup proved to be just as squirrely as I had suspected.  And then he took the time to search out an app that worked on my phone so I could use that as well.  I was very impressed.  And grateful!  The rating is 4 stars instead of 5 only because of the hitches.  I am pleased with the cameras (can spy on the cats now) and very pleased with the service.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: And I don't have a lot of patience for things like port forwarding dynamic versus static IP address excetera excetera
review_body: OK, I cannot speak to the quality of the camera- I was never able to set it up. So that is what this short review is addressing. I am A quite technical person in program computers. But I did find the camera difficult to set up. Probably because I don't have a lot of time now I have a newborn! And I don't have a lot of patience for things like port forwarding dynamic versus static IP address excetera excetera. I am sure if I or you took the time the camera can be set up quite adequately.  But I do not want to take the time. There are several other cameras on eBay and Amazon which are just as inexpensive as this one or even more so that do all the setup automatically with a wizard. So why bother? Unless you enjoy this sort of thing I would go with another camera. I bought this camera because the reviewed audio quality of the camera was superior to many others that were reviewed. This may be true,  I do not know. Regardless it does have an audio in jack which will accept a microphone, perhaps a noise cancelling microphone which might make this camera much better than other ones. I bought it for use as a baby monitor , and the previous camera I bought had a lot of background noise and hiss which made it unuseable at night. so if u have the technical know-how , tome and patience and want (possible) better audio quality, go for this one. else go for one that has an automatic setup wizard.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Meh - I'll spend the extra $$$ on something else.
review_body: I am lucky that I understand some basic networking. But for any average computer users or new users, this product would suck. Application is horrible. But once you get it going, it's cool. Bang for the buck. But when trying to use the wireless this one crapped out on me. Losing connection gaining connection. Not sure what happened, but after the poor interface and network troubleshooting - I gave up and sent it back. I felt like there were a lot of issues with the wireless on the camera.

review_body: Excellent little IP camera. My first one's motor broke when I dropped it when attempting to mount it, so it isn't that durable; however, the replacement works great. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Horrible UI, they design a horrible setup so you have to call them
review_body: I am not an IT expert, but you should not have to be in order to setup a ipcamera.  I am pretty tech savy, and still I had to call their support tech, have them dial into my computer, to set up the camera.  Then, at the end, he sent me to this site to write a review and use his name in the review.  Hmmm, I wonder if he got a comission off of that?  It is completely uneccessary, they make this product not work so they can \\"fix\\" it, and have you give them 5 stars.  If this product would just work in the first place I would of been much more satisfied.  Never buying from Foscam again.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: For the money, these cameras are outstanding!!  I have three that I use to keep an eye on my pool when I'm away (neighborhood kids had a habit of partying there when I was gone), security for my home and keeping an eye on my elderly mother if she doesn't answer the phone to make sure she's OK.  I just use my iPhone from where-ever I may be and instantly can monitor in real time.  And you don't have to pay a monthly fee to the phone company!  There's no downside to this purchase.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not bad at all for the money, FOLLOW the directions and it will work!
review_body:
I have had NO issues with this model. I bought it in December and am ordering 2 more. In fact I found it easy to set up, esp when one just takes their time in setting it up AND in reading the directions. I am astounded at the negative reviews where it almost sounds like something was blown way out of proportion.
When you have to qualify what you do for a living as a reason for why you know something failed, that doesn't really qualify your reasoning to me as anything more than a blowhard.
This is not a plug and play device by any means, but for my money, I think it does great. Also for anyone who might not know it, typically the IR on any device cannot see through glass. It just can't. If you want something that works well and do not have a lot of money to do it with, this is not a bad option at all.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Have had 2 of these cameras installed for about a week with good results thus far.
-The image is grainy at times, especially when low light but IR hasn't kicked on automatically yet, but otherwise have been very happy with it.
-The image quality is great considering the cost of the camera.
-Pan/tilt motors and gears are very quiet and allow a very good range of motion.
-Minimal lag time if the viewer is on a fast network (4G or Wifi). I only seem to get 2-3 FPS delayed by about 2 seconds over 3G.
-I found the web setup to be pretty easy despite the directions being oddly worded at times.

review_headline: Near impossible setup, then it was great!
review_body: Great quality, I love it so far. The biggest downside though is the set up. I am normally pretty good with computers and accessories, but this was so hard to get going. It took forever to set up wifi (had to end up using WPS, which eventually worked) and I was only able to use the audio with the Phone App (which is the easiest way to use the camera) or on Internet Explorer (I tried safari, chrome, and firefox first). Be patient, plan for some difficulties, and then love the device for live streaming.

review_headline: Add to Trusted Sites?  Yeah, right !!!... lol
review_body: I guess for the money, you get what you pay for with this camera.  It does what it is supposed to do, so I guess you can't ask for the moon.  I would, however, like to ask them to make it more user friendly in regards to capturing live video.  I continuously get the popup window saying I need to add the IP address to my trusted sites in order to record, and I have done that many times and in many ways and still get the popup and no recording.  In User settings, I can't even change the Alarm Record Path without it telling me to go ..... myself.  But I can at least remotely rotate it and see what I am looking at very well, so I guess I will have to live with that and not try to catch any recordings.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not useful as a security camera
review_body: I returned this product. Other than the quality being worse than I expected, most likely because of the complexity of the scene I was trying to capture, the device would spontaneously reboot and crash at least once per day, making it useless as a permanent security cam. In addition, all of the options for publishing motion detect images were unreliable, and were so slow to respond to movement that I would often miss the actual event. For example, as the mailman walks up to the door, the device has about 20 feet of the mailman walking to get its act together and snap a picture. Instead, the very first image is of the mailman's face just past the edge of the screen. Another reviewer has commented that there might be a crash/reboot defect caused by complex scenes, and I suspect I was running into this defect.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is my very first review. And I am only doing it to tell you that Foscam indeed has faulty products and they do not stand behind them.  My camera has a reboot issue and it is simply unusable.  I waited too long to have it repaired within the warranty period (because I thought I had done something wrong).  Nevertheless, when I contacted Foscam for help, the only "help" they offered was to tell me that I have to buy a new one.  I was beyond the warranty.  My fault.  I know. But here's the funny part.  I didn't ask for a new camera free of charge.  I asked for help (And I have the email to prove it). I am an engineer and could have fixed it if they gave me the instructions.  However, they didn't offer any help of any sort.  Any reputable company would have at least attempted something. And after reading through the reviews, it seems quite evident that many people have received faulty cameras...and even then...the repair process is quite a hassle.  Thumbs down, Foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: So pleased with F18910W audio 2-way cam to monitor dad, home, pets...
review_body:
My dad is disabled and gets around slowly. After hearing a few crashes from the pets, I decided on this two-way audio cam to check on dad. The booklet with instructions is for Windows OS or MAC OS. Since I mainly use Android compatible tablet & phones, I had to dust off my old PC laptop with Windows XP. The camera comes with a software CD, installation guide, network cable, screw on antenna, plastic mounting bracket with screws, and 5 foot long power cord. My home has fast internet wi-fi so setup was not bad. I really relied on the booklet, but needed extra help from Foscam's technical support. Foscam Rep named Jack assisted me by assigning a new static IP address for the camera. After setting it up on my old PC, I accessed the live camera feed a couple of times and then changed the password from default. Then I installed several free Android apps on my cell phone and tablet to view, pan/tilt and even monitor sound. One free app is Foscam US.

*** The most important thing I learned is to use the "ec###.myfoscam.org" address (instead of the actual IP address 168.###.1.###) to access the camera feed. It is listed underneath the cam, so I enter this on my Android viewer apps so I can access live video while AWAY FROM HOME. Otherwise, if I use the cam's IP address, I can access feed near my home wifi only. Thanks to Foscam technical support Felix Anderson for this tip!***

I also got IP Cam viewer's upgrade for to enable wireless remote talk for my tablet and cell. I prefer the quick access using my Android portable devices rather than my heavy dinosaur PC. My Foscam camera is small, dome shaped with a good base so my cats can not knock it over. The quality of the live view is great and now monitor my dad in my living room. I did buy a second cam for the covered back porch. So I can see my living room & pets even during the night. I can also share the cam info and password with a sibling to check on dad. This Foscam cam for about $65 is so worth it because it gives me peace of mind. UPDATE: Still very, very happy with cams. Talk to dad when away from home using IP Cam Viewer Pro by Robert Chou app on Android devices. Always remember to change the default password that comes with the camera to avoid unwanted peeping jerks.bout $65 is so worth it because it gives me peace of mind. UPDATE: Still very, very happy with cams. Talk to dad when away from home using IP Cam Viewer Pro by Robert Chou app on Android devices. Always remember to change the default password that comes with the camera to avoid unwanted peeping jerks.

Any way was playing with it last night and I couldn't connect to the wireless (besides I was drunk, LOL) woke up this morning and decided to give it a try. I have Verizon Fios router and after reading around googling I was able to connect it right away with only one single thing, change the protection to WPA2. and now its working fine. Sorry wont give a 4 stars because of the speakers but other than that awesome product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Don't know why all the negativity about set-up, I admit it's not plug and play, but once you have a basic knowledge of networks and you can follow instructions I don't think you should have much problems. I used the CD and did the set-up using Internet Explorer (!!!), which worked quite well for this application. Once you scan for your network, all the fields should fill in automatically. Then using the supplied IPCamera program, you have to right click on the camera IP to disable the DHCP in order to set the static IP address so that you don't have to keep editing it (you can also do this in the Device Manager but you have to know subnet mask etc). Haven't tried accessing it externally yet.

I also use IPCAM VIEWER from Chou, because I am accustomed to it. It has the 8910W already there too, and gives good PT control, presets as well as switching the IR on/off. The IR lights aren't that bright which is good for baby monitoring. The video in dark areas using IR is excellent.

The camera itself doesn't have optical zoom, but you can screen zoom on your apps since the picture quality is quite good. Foscam gives you a plastic mounting stand, so check that out before you buy an external one. Also I went ahead and bought two power extension cables - glad I did because the original one is short. For $65 USD I think it's pretty good, will definitely work for my purpose.

review_headline: TECH SUPPORT RECEIVES A ZERO FROM ME
review_body: I HATE HATE the Tech Support which is why I am returning this camera on Monday. Was on hold two different times in excess of 25 minutes, both times tech had access to my computer for 20-30+ minutes to help me with set up and fix remote access. Once, I was on hold for 34 minutes and tech came on and said "Everyone has left for the day, call back tomorrow"! Couldn't get email alerts with the motion activation. Test email worked but that was it. Talked with my internet provider, I was told that my Port Forwarding should be fine too. DONE!!! Which is a shame because I actually liked the camera, well.... as long as I was at home watching on my own computer. Unless you are a total computer geek or have a degree is computer science, I would NEVER recommend a Foscam. I will be purchasing something else.

review_headline: If you buy this camera, save yourself lots of time and headaches, spend an extra $29 and get a Foscam router!
review_body: This camera works very well for the price. However, I did spend a huge amount of time trying to connect the wireless system. I called Foscam tech support and they were helpful, but nobody could figure out the wireless router access problem. As a last resort I decided to try a new router or router extender. I purchased a Foscam model FR305 wireless router for $29 hooked it up directly to my Actiontech 1000 router and both of my cameras hooked up perfectly with no more problems. I would highly advise anyone who buys a Foscam camera to spend the extra $29 dollars and buy the Foscam router, it will save you a huge amount of time and headache.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
There is a lot of mixed reviews and I hesitated a lot before buying this unit. So far so good! Like other reviewers stated, you will need to set your router properly to allow port forwarding. The installation is a breeze. Had no problems whatsoever. I setup the camera to send an email when it detects movement. I've been using this for a month now and it rebooted once on its own. Other than that it works great. I can monitor my small shop at all times. Night vision is good.

I wish I could adjust the numbers of pictures taken and the time span of pictures taken when it detects a movement. This is the only reason I did not give it 5 stars.

I would not hesitate to buy another one. If the unit stops working at one point, I will edit this review to let you know.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera but falling apart after 2 years
review_body: I have really liked these cameras and have owned 2 for 2 years now.  The customer service is very good, I had a problem with one and had to send it back and they sent me a new one.  It lost two stars because both cameras have now lost the ability to use wireless connectivity.  I now have to hard wire the cameras and even that is starting to fail.  The speakers have gone out on both it just sounds like static when you talk and the mic has also gone out so I cant hear anything anymore.  When these worked they worked great but I don't know why after two years they are falling apart.  Never been used outside and they just sit and are not moved around.  I hope the new ones are better. I would buy the newer cameras because foscam gives you a free domain name so you don't have to use dyneDNS or other DNS providers.  Easy to setup and the motion detection feature is awesome.  Great little camera if it had a longer life it would be perfect.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice little unit for the price
review_body: This was much simpler to set up than I was reading in the reviews. So, I find that Firefox works well but you need a plug in to hear sound. IE seems to work ok for sound however it can go into a funky mode every so often and you have to shut down the browser. On the smart phone the FOSCAM ap works ok but of course slow to respond when moving the head around. I find that it does not like to be too far away from the wireless router. Picture is fine as one would expect day and night. If you want to speak to someone I am not sure volume is loud enough to hear across the room but up close it will work...Overall, a good buy if you want to pan around to see what is what. review_headline: terrible product, no audio for Macs, awful customer support
review_body: We bought this intending it to be a baby monitor. After two weeks we're returning it to Amazon. We tried to use it with our Macbook. But we found out only after we tried to set it up that the software supplied by the manufacturer does not support audio on Macs!! What kind of hardware made in the 21st century does not work with Apple products?? And what kind of webcam does not have audio?? Also the Foscam customer support was utterly unhelpful. Trying to get this product to work has been an extremely frustrating unsatisfying experience. We would not recommend it to anyone.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great budget camera. If you can find these on sale and you need a budget camera, I would not hesitate to grab these. However, if you need/want HD picture (or a really clear picture for that matter) look elsewhere. The cameras do everything they are designed to do. I have them attached to my Synology Surveillance Station and they work really well. My only reservation is that the picture quality is a little grainy. However, this is not rated at 720p or 1080p so this should be known before the purchase is made.

I would recommend this camera and would definitely purchase again.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Despite Description, Does Not Support Recording On Macs/Cloud!
review_body:
Pros:
i. Easy set up for local network viewing over wifi or ethernet.

ii. Excellent camera with excellent technology; very quiet and superb controls over the telemetry (remote control).

Cons:
i. Almost impossible to set up local recording. Does not come with local recording software, and the unique protocol Foscam uses are different from industry standards. Thus, when attempting to use a 3rd party recording application, e.g. Xeoma, it just does not work properly.

ii. Foscam does offer their own remote viewing and recording, cloud-based service (https://www.foscamcloud.com). Spent 4 hours trying to configure this service for the camera. It never worked.

iii. The representative advised me that the recording software that it comes with, 'Blue Iris' is not compatible with Mac computers. They have too many bugs in the software! I wish it had stated this on the product description.

iv. Foscam technical suport was a complete waste of time. Based in India, so the line was terrible and the representative knew less about the technology than I did. He then proceeded to request remote access to my computer. When I declined but asked if he would talk me through his checks and solutions, he agreed, but it validated my suspicion about his lack of knowledge. He proceeded to tell me that Foscam has a problem with the cloud service due to over-subscription, but then said that the browser-based service in question does not work well with Macs. When I questioned whether he meant the safari browser vs. another, and offered to change browser, he changed his analysis again, and asked me to hold while he checked with his supervisor for other ideas.

In summary, I was delighted with the price and the technology, but was left very disappointed that Foscam has not thought about how one should be able to record with its cameras. Not only has Foscam gone against common industry protocols making its cameras useless for 3rd party recording software, but its own service does not work.

I am sending this back. What a shame! An American product let down by a lack of forethought as to its intended uses. What's the point in having an IP camera that can't record images, let alone be accessed remotely?!d party recording software, but its own service does not work.

I am sending this back. What a shame! An American product let down by a lack of forethought as to its intended uses. What's the point in having an IP camera that can't record images, let alone be accessed remotely?!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great picture for the price. Beware, if you plan to use this on your smart phone from anywhere, you'd better be familiar with port forwarding on your router. It's not difficult but some routers don't make it easy. That's not Foxcam's fault, though. I did find a third party app on the play store that I liked better than Foscam's own smartphone app, but again, that's not a big deal. The Foscam app works fine, I just like the other one better. I'd tell you what it is but can't remember right now and can't be bothered to look it up.

You can't beat this camera for the price. I think it compares favorably with much more expensive IP cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I use this camera to monitor my basement when I am on vacation in the summer. It rains a lot where I am, and I'm paranoid about the basement flooding.

I used the mounting hardware to mount it in the basement and then I used the software that came with the camera to configure the connection to my wireless network. Them, I gave it a static IP on my home network and forwarded the port so it could be accessed from the outside world. I also used the Dynamic DNS service to make it easy to connect if my public IP changes (which is sometimes does). I then used the Foscam Mobile app to view the camera remotely from my Android phone. The app works, but could use an overhaul.

So far, the camera has been very reliable. I love how I can move it around from anywhere in the world with a push of the button. I can also hear what's happening around the camera.The setup process can be somewhat intimidating for someone who isn't extremely computer savvy, but it's worth it to learn how to do these things. They only make life easier!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Cam is OK, but the software and DDNS needs work.
review_body: The camera, for the price, could be better.  The resolution needs to be bumped up (only 640x480), the controllability needs to be improved via the available software, and if they're going to advertise free DDNS service to view the camera they're selling they certainly should provide a better guide for the implementation of that service.  That said, once it's all hooked up the camera does a good job, you can see fairly well and point it where you like.  The wireless signal is pretty good and there was no difficulty getting it hooked up to the router, either via WiFi protected setup or via Ethernet cable.  The differing web views for the camera are handy, but unfortunately only one provides access to the camera config settings.  The smartphone view does NOT have access to camera settings. you have to use a different page that is very inconvenient to view (too large for phone, have to drag/zoom the screen around to see).  To sum up, the camera is about 3.5-4 stars, but the software and setup is only 3 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
1)Nice camera for the price. Using instructions in the book and those offered here by other reviewers , i had it set up and running with remote internet viewing in 15 minutes.
2) I dont have a fixed IP so I set it up email notification of IP address... Im lucky.. my IP is rarely released or refreshed,otherwise a DNS service that could cost a couple bucks a month is needed to resolve the changing IP
3)Regarding camera operation, I set the camera to pan mode and it would stop panning after a minute or two and require me to start the pan again]
.I called Foscam support and was told that panning could not be set to auto,, and panning can only be done manually.
4) i wasn't impressed by their support - gal with a very heavy Indian dialect who spoke too fast..had to stop her and ask her to repeat often.
Also,had to turn internal mic off...all i got was the whirring of the internal motor while panning.. but i guess this isn't a real problem if the camera doesnt pan automatically
5) Using Foscams android app on smartphone - works great, but beware...will use a lot of data while on a mobile network.so limit usage or find a hotspot

review_headline: Great baby monitor replacement!! Very Happy with Camera!!
review_body:
Gave up buying baby monitors as the charging capability on the monitor component consistently failed after 2-12 months following purchase even with name brand ($200+ units). Went with the Foscam F18910W and have been VERY happy.

PROS: Picture quality is very good, Video feed can be accessed from anywhere, night vision capability is excellent,
CONS: Setup is a little more complicated then typical baby monitor offerings BUT as a person working in IT it only took me about 30 minutes to get working. Have to buy additional component for Audio capability.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Video works great. Two-way audio is garbage
review_body: Video works great.  Two-way audio is garbage.  You get such a strong feedback loop when doing two-way that it is useless.  If you only want to listen, it works fine.  Just don't plan on having a conversation with anyone on the other side of the camera.  Do a quick search and you'll find a lot of people that had the same problem.  If you just want an inexpensive camera that you can pan around with, this is great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I paid $65 for this camera and I am blown away at what it can do. I can drop it anywhere and have pannable security and backups of interest to my web servers in the cloud. Setup was easy: navigate to the camera IP, first via ethernet to configure it, then you can access it via wifi.

It didn't have secure ftp, so I just ftp the files to a local file server then relay them to the cloud in a private location - this works amazingly well.

That it has IR night vision allowing you to see in the dark is extra credit in my book.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have been using this camera for over a year now as a baby monitor and am very happy with my purchase. I actually purchased another to use for my newborn. I use this camera everyday and downloaded an app to connect it to my phone. I'm able to see my son in his room and the night vision allows me to see him clearly when the room is pitch black. I like the microphone on the camera because it is very sensitive and picks up the slightest sound. I also like the two way communication because I am able to talk to my son without being in his room. The two way communication helps tremendously when he's just gotten up and I'm in the middle of cooking and can't get to him right away. I have had the camera freeze on me a few times, but it resets itself quickly and I haven't had any other issues. Also, the setup was very easy and I was able to set it up in 10 minutes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Seriously, do you really want to drop $200 on the top selling baby monitor [[ASIN:B00F9FCW7K Dropcam Pro Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera]]? Save that green for the diapers your kid will blow through (no pun intended) over the next few years and pick up the Foscam instead!

Setup: Sucked on a mac. Yes, it includes software and instructions for setup, but they're pretty much worthless if you're on a Mac. Now I'm no IT guru, but I can work my way around my home wifi network well enough... This installation however put me through an intensive 4 hour course on networking that was death to suffer through but probably qualifies me for any Tech job I want now. seriously this was a beastly process that kept me up until 2:00 am 'cause dang it I had to show the Mrs. what kind of man she married! The cd that comes with it installs a useless tool on Macs that attempts to give you the rest of the info you'll need to proceed with setup, needless to say, other reviews decently cover the process of how to get this baby filming, but I can post my nightmare process if desired.

Let me tell you though, the setup is worth it! This bad boy saves me from so many trips into the kiddo's room at night it's not even funny.

Usefulness: did I mention how much this has changed my life? Sleep? Yeah I get that now. We busted this out at a time when our then 4-month old started moving around the crib too much for comfort for her overprotective parents. Just buy one now.

The app: the strength of this thing comes in it's connectivity with your smart phone or your computer. The Foscam app itself is useful enough, but get the free \\"IP Cam Remote\\" app for your android device and you'll be rocking out to the sweet tune of your baby's silence all night long! Some apps won't let you stream the sound in the background, but the aforementioned Cam Remote app lets you bask in the glory of your $60 deluxe baby monitor setup while texting your friends that you never see anymore. Be warned your baby will sound like C3PO (sans British accent... unless your from Great Britain) with most of these apps, but it's clear enough to hear 'em yelling for mercy from the clutches of sleepiness.

Style: the red ring of lights gets nice and ominous at night, but the unknowing/trusting baby can't get enough of it.

Overall: way cheaper than a true \\"baby monitor.\\" Let's you spy on your kids from literally anywhere, and verbally remind them of such at a moment's notice. You'll be IT certified by the time you figure out how to set this up, but trust me, the freedom is worth it!ever see anymore. Be warned your baby will sound like C3PO (sans British accent... unless your from Great Britain) with most of these apps, but it's clear enough to hear 'em yelling for mercy from the clutches of sleepiness.

Style: the red ring of lights gets nice and ominous at night, but the unknowing/trusting baby can't get enough of it.

Overall: way cheaper than a true \\"baby monitor.\\" Let's you spy on your kids from literally anywhere, and verbally remind them of such at a moment's notice. You'll be IT certified by the time you figure out how to set this up, but trust me, the freedom is worth it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Picture quality is great but setup is tough and audio is sketchy
review_body:
This is a good value compared to the other IP cameras but it does have some issues.

First, you really have to know a bit about wireless networks and IP addresses and routers and stuff to set it up, or you can spend a few days pulling your hair out trying to figure it out like I did. The port forwarding is not straightforward so go find your most tech savvy friend or relative to help you out.

Second, the apps for using it are not great, unless maybe you want to pay. I've only tried the free ones for my iPhone and they're ok at best. Of the 5 or 6 that I've tried I've only been able to receive the audio on one and none have enabled me to send audio from my phone to the device. Moving it around can be frustrating as well. Plus I have my doubts about the security of using Jo Schmo's app to see into my house.

That said, it's pretty reliable once set up correctly, the picture quality is very good and the night vision is a neat extra.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It's ok, if you want to sacrifice picture quality for panning and tilting.
review_body:
Decent quality camera. You do get what you pay for. The camera itself functions great however there are some things that annoy me which is the reason for the missing stars.

Positives:
- Brand, they are a big brand so customer support "should" be there as well as firmware and software updates.
- It pans, zooms, without having to manually adjust the camera. For the price, this is a good feature.
- Ease of use and connectivity. I was able to get this up and running quickly. Added it to my xeoma server.

Negatives:
- If your down with continuous clicking this is for you. The clicking is loud and annoying. If the light adjusts from the curtains and my AC unit, it clicks on and off all day. IR relay is so loud.
- The picture quality could use some work for the price I had paid for this camera. I didn't have the expectation of having HD quality in a lower resolution camera however the quality of the video / photos seem to be well, mediocre. It's 2014, my macbook pro has better picture quality and it's designed to be a laptop not a camera... Seems the camera is a bit behind in technology.

The moving functionality of this camera via panning and tilting are the highlights of this camera, unfortunately the picture quality is mediocre. Your iphone camera will have much better quality... Being the device is designed specifically a camera, it's way behind on the most important part of the camera, picture quality.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I now have 6 of these cameras spread over three different locations. They work wonderfully, especially paired with the new Foscam app available from the App Store. I use Apple AirPort products and so setting up port forwarding was a breeze. I haven't tried out Foscam's new DDNS service yet but given the recent outage from noip.com I may have to give it a try. I receive email alerts with motion or sound alarm triggers and my only complaint is that the alarm trips when the camera switches itself into and out of night vision (IR mode). For the price these cameras meet all of my needs and are a great value!

I would like to put more of these outside, but the enclosures cost as much as the cameras! So it would be nice to get a weatherproof version of this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great price for so many features!
review_body:
I very rarely write reviews, but I am so pleased with the features this ip camera has for the price, that I just had to share my experience. This camera has night vision, which is great if you want to monitor with no light, and it actually does excellent! I put the camera inside a window looking out, and when the infrared comes on at night it reflects on the window and blinds the camera. Since I have plenty of light at night I've been turning off the infrared manually every night, because I haven't found a way to turn it off permanently. I'm not too concerned about it because I will eventually move it outside (not exposed to the elements, but not behind glass). The quality of the video is better that I was expecting from a camera that's wireless, with night vision, pan and tilt, e-mail notifications, motion detection at such low price. I was hesitant to buy it, but I'm glad a took a chance.

I have to admit that the setup is a bit challenging for someone who is not familiar with how routers work and how to achieve port forwarding, and networking in general. I didn't have to call for tech support, but the videos on the foscam.us website really helped me grasp the concept of the setup. I started watching the videos before I even received the camera, so when I got it in the mail I had a basic understanding of what I needed to do.

I just wanted to add one more thing: my internet provider issued me a modem/wireless router combo, but since I have a nice router that I wanted to use, they disabled the wireless router part of their modem, so I had issues with port forwarding: I opened the ports in my router, but canyouseeme.org kept saying it was still blocked. I called my provider to ask them if they blocked that port on their side, and he proceeded to tell me that they didn't but the modem/router combination did, so I would have to either open the port on both THEIR router and MY route, or go to their local office and swap it for a regular modem. I opted of the stand alone modem and once I did the ports were opened and everything worked great.

If you're thinking about getting this camera, please take the time to watch the setup videos on the foscam website and do not rush through the setup, otherwise you will get frustrated with it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice IP camera, good value for the price
review_body:
I bought my first Foscam FI8910W because my EnvisaLink IP alarm alert module only supports four Foscam IP camera models and this was one of them. I liked the FI8910W so much I bought three more over the next few months. If my security alarm goes off I get an alert on my cell phone and can now see what is happening inside my home in real time. The built-in camera software allows you to access and control the camera over the Internet from anywhere.

Setting up my first camera was a challenge because I had never done it before, but the next three only took about ten minutes each. I used the included IPcamera software to assign specific IP addresses and port numbers for each camera, and to upgrade the firmware before doing anything else. Foscam has some helpful setup videos in the support section of their website so I didn't have to call customer support for assistance.

Here are a couple of tips I discovered. If you don't want the camera to point at the ceiling on reboot then go to Device Management, PT Settings, and uncheck the \\"Go to center on boot\\" check box. If you don't want the little green LED on the back of the camera to flash all the time, go to Device Management, Basic Network Settings, and uncheck the \\"Network Lamp\\" check box.

A couple of things I don't like about this camera are that the IR LEDs are visible in the dark, and the annoying click when the IR-cut off switches from daytime to night vision (and sometimes back again). Overall I am very satisfied with these cameras. The speaker and microphone are weak, and the video is not crystal clear, but for the money they can't be beat.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have five of these cameras that I've bought at various times over the last 2 years or so. They are a good value and have good features for their price range. I run two of them as baby video monitors, one as an indoor security camera, and I run two of them outside (way outside their environmental operating spec ranges - sometimes down to -5°F, sometimes up to +100°F, sometimes in the snow, sometimes covered in bird poop) in motion detection mode to capture images of people coming to my front or back door.

They are internet connected, can upload images to an FTP site, attach them to emails, have scheduled motion detection alarm times, can be panned and tilted, have 2-way audio (not very good quality, but neat nevertheless), and support wifi and wired ethernet. And there's a multitude of apps out there for iPhone and Android to control this camera.

One negative is that they are supposed to support UPnP, but I've never gotten that to work on my all-Apple network. I don't know if it's the AirPort stuff getting in the way or if the UPnP doesn't work, but whatever. I actually prefer to manually configure my routers.

Two things would make this camera better: PoE so you can put them in remote locations and a zoom lens.

Anyway, it's a bargain for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
When I bought this camera it was pretty cheap, like $45. Is it worth $45? Yes -- As long as you aren't expecting something that you just plug in and works.

A couple of things to note:

1) When you plug it into the router, it may not show up in the Foscam IP scanner. I thought I had a bad camera until I realized that their software just doesn't work. To initially find your camera, use this tool: http://www.advanced-ip-scanner.com/

2) Quality isn't great. If you have it set 15-20 feet from a doorway or someplace you want to monitor, you can probably see the face of someone clearly enough to identify them. Much further than that and you're going to be SOL.

3) The built in motion detection is highly sensitive to changes in light, even on the lowest sensitivity setting. Not a huge deal, but can get kind of annoying if you keep checking your phone because of motion alarms.

4) The alarm services (in which it emails you 6 pictures on motion / sound detection) seems to always miss the "good parts." So if I'm testing it out I enable the alarm, walk outside, wait a minute, and then walk back in through the door. It takes 6 random pictures, so there is no guarantee you're going to be looking at the camera when it takes a picture. After I did this a couple of times, I found that the pictures were identifiable about 50% of the time.

-- Solutions to topics 3 & 4: I recommend using a program like iSpy to monitor the camera. It's software is more advanced than what is built in.
