product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Camera, just difficult to install as a novice
review_body:
I bought this camera last year. I am a novice at computer stuff. I struggled for about 2 weeks to get it to work. I was under the impression that since I bought it on Amazon and not directly from Foscam that I have to pay for technical service. I chose to attempt it myself. Im pretty sure I got it to work by luck. Once I got it to work, its a GREAT camera. I used the app to log in remotely, but that too was extremely difficult for me. Again, luck and help from the NO-IP representative got me thru that. The pan tilt and zoom is crystal clear. The alarms work perfectly. I use it to keep an eye on my dogs. The only down side to this camera, with no fault of the camera is the set up. Although Foscam has detailed videos and good instructions, I found it to be extremely difficult. Even after watching the videos multiple times, I still have no idea what an IP or a DDNS is.
I recently had to change my router, so I am without the camera working and I am probably going to hire someone because I can't figure it out.
Its a great camera. If I can hire someone that can re-install the camera on my new router, I will probably get a few more because they are great cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works fine for me, but not for the casual PC user IMO
review_body:
Works fine for me since I have background building computers and configuring routers and networks. What that helped me with as understanding the directions. Even so, I still had a few issues and had to walk away from it for an hour, then return and check all my settings and restart my router/computer. MY hangup was getting it to be viewable from the internet. It setup perfect and fast on the internal home network. But I was stuck on the internet thing until I took a break.
I didnt have to call tech support. I followed the directions step by step,. Its not HD, but I just wanted to get the whole process figured out before I invested too much money in it.
At this point, I'm ready to add 3 more cameras. I've got the hang of it. The picture is quite reasonable for non HD. The camera pans and tilts nicely. Very easily mounted on my garage wall I'd say maybe 75' from the router and behind 3 walls, out in the garage. Connection appears perfect.

My last advice is if you think you have all your settings correct, CHECK them again, restart your router, then restart your computer. Follow the directions line by line. You should be good. I've only had this an afternoon, so I'll update if anything else comes up. Be patient.

UPDATE July 7: Just installed my second camera. It was a breeze. I now have two going on my phone, tablet, and tower computer. The software that comes with it works nicely. It does all I need it to do. Allows multiple cameras and viewing from the internet.
Setup is really EASY. When setting up to view from the net you MUST do these things. Assign a port number in the setup page on the IP cameratool. You can assign almost anything. Try 8000, then make the next camera 8001, and so on. NOW, you have a camera with an ip address that is YOUR home IP address followed by :8000 or :8001. That now becomes the IP address of the camera. Go to Starbucks. Type your IP address in with the colon/port number (your ip:8000). There you go. You get the login screen. Log into the camera.
If you want to use the software that comes with it, add the camera with that SAME number.
I admit I was a bit stumped on the first one, but after playing with it for a week, then adding the scond camera, its a breeze for THOSE OF YOU THAT HAVE SOME CONCEPT OF NETWORKING!!!!!! If you dont, either hire someone or dont buy this camera.

UPDATE: I've since added 3 more of these. And as I said, if you understand what you are doing, you'll be fine. but it is NOT for the average non networking person. You MUST understand how to allow ports through your router IF you want to setup viewing from your phone in a remote location. I use an Android app called IP Cam Viewer Basic. You have to pay 2.99 if you want to use the sound and mic features. Well worth it. The app is excellent. I would not advise the Foscam app as they try to bait you into another app that requires you to "login" with an email. No thank you.
I am completely satisfied with the price, setup and use of these cameras. Just ordered another anf a friend of mine ordered one based on my recommendations.e camera. If you want to use the software that comes with it, add the camera with that SAME number. I admit I was a bit stumped on the first one, but after playing with it for a week, then adding the scond camera, its a breeze for THOSE OF YOU THAT HAVE SOME CONCEPT OF NETWORKING!!!!!! If you dont, either hire someone or dont buy this camera. UPDATE: I've since added 3 more of these. And as I said, if you understand what you are doing, you'll be fine. but it is NOT for the average non networking person. You MUST understand how to allow ports through your router IF you want to setup viewing from your phone in a remote location. I use an Android app called IP Cam Viewer Basic. You have to pay 2.99 if you want to use the sound and mic features. Well worth it. The app is excellent. I would not advise the Foscam app as they try to bait you into another app that requires you to "login" with an email. No thank you. I am completely satisfied with the price, setup and use of these cameras. Just ordered another anf a friend of mine ordered one based on my recommendations.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: There are better cameras out there
review_body:
Considering the leaps and bounds by which technology has grown over the past few years, this camera is outdated. Very difficult to set up and get running, and we could never get the images to show up on the internet; the only way we could view the camera was via our home network, and outside of that it doesn't work at all.
The instructions are outdated and recommend that you set up a "free" hosted web page to view your live video -- too bad the company Foscam recommends no longer offers free hosted web pages. Buy a dropcam or the like -- you'll be happier.

I use foscam viewer after setting up a domain to reroute the camera Ip Ports. All and all, good purchase

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is exactly what you pay for. All the capabilities listed on the cameras description work. The video quality is viewable, but not HD obviously. The audio is pretty rough, but, again, works.

Took some time to set up the port forwarding so you can view wherever. My suggestion (if you do not know much about port forwarding) is to call the tech support right away. They link into your computer and go through the whole process for you. I wasted a few hours on my own, whereas it took the operator about 20 minutes. If you do end up calling tech support, my operators name was Ralph Mendez, and I would highly suggest him.

Overall I am happy. It is an inexpensive camera, and there were no surprises.

review_headline: Product quality and customer service is questionable.
review_body:
I bought 2 Foscam camera for my home. The first one had to be returned under the 30 day warranty because it came out of the box defective. I ordered a new one to replace the one I returned. I'm not sure if its the replacement camera or the one I bought originally but one of them failed to work after 3 months.

I contacted Foscam via their website about returning the camera. A week went by with no response. So I called their 800 number and I was told to send a direct email to the RMA dept. The direct email worked and I was given an RMA number.

I paid $10 to ship the product to their repair center. Guess what happened? They added salt to the wound by informing me that I would have to pay the $7 shipment back.

The camera works ok (after spending 2 days setting it up with my network) but beware of the quality and customer service. If I didn't have so much time invested in setting up to camera, I would buy something else.

review_headline: I am NOT a computer novice and this thing is crazy difficult to install
review_body:
Let me start by saying I have been installing my own computers, networks for myself and numerous friends and family members. I am by no means an expert but I get by just fine with routers, printers, software installs, webcams etc.....

I get the Foscam Fl8910W camera for the goal of being able to view my home when at work or out of town. For the last 3 hours I have pulled out whatever hair I have left and finally have given up. I have boxed it back up and will be returning it for a refund.

The manual is terrible and it feels like it expects you to have a masters degree in computer science.

If you are not already a computer network expert, do not buy this. If you don't want to go get a haircut but rather pull your own hair out than this is for you.

Fin'

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: requires a little extra effort, but works great
review_body: I gave this camera a try based on all of the reviews.  From reading those reviews I was aware that it might require a little extra work, and it did.  I watched the various set up videos from Foscam on YouTube, and was able to set the camera up twice.  Twice because after the first set up I was suddenly unable to reach it from outside of my WiFi network.  After the second set up, I believe the first time it went down was due to my internet provider changing my IP.  Setup includes the basic setup and control, which included updating the firmware (be careful to choose the correct firmware to replace the one currently on your camera).  Then you can set up the camera so it will can work wireless, and this isn't much different from connecting your smartphone or laptop to your wireless network.  The third set up allows you to view the camera from outside of your wireless by setting up your router to port forward.  This will allow you to view the camera from an internet browser anywhere, or to use an iphone or android app to view the camera.  I am using IP Cam Soft to view the camera, and it works great.  So it's not plug and play, but the extra effort makes using the camera that much easier.  I have it set up to email me when motion is detected, which was another video from Foscam.  If you have the patience, this is an inexpensive IP camera option to help you keep an eye on things.  If you are using this camera and you suddenly can no longer view it outside of your network, check to see if your provider changed your IP address.  So far it has been well worth my investment.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Though they are not that cheap, these cameras are worth the investment. The pan/tilt feature is really helpful, and the quality of the video is sufficient for you to check them online or on a mobile device. The voice feature (which allows the user to hear the room being monitored, and to talk to back to it) is not as good as I expected, so I would not recommend the camera to someone that would really need this feature to work perfectly. I never tried to use it as a baby monitor, but would suspect that within the same network (and using your mobile device as the monitoring device) it would work better. For home monitoring it is definitely worth buying.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: so i received this camera FI8910W  today from amazon. and i tried setting it up. it worked fine till i reached a point where it said scan in wireless settings. It didnt scan after trying several times. Called customer care, spent 2 hours. They basically do a set list of things. they try. 1.) Disconnect your antenna, network cable and power cable. Reboot again after reconnecting everything. Didn't work. Next tried firmware upgrade. Did that, didnt work. Next tried hard resetting the camera, didnt work. Finally after 2 hours she gave up and said camera is faulty. I called again to get another opinion. This time the rep remote logged in my computer and basically did the same things again. Didnt work. After one hour he asked me to replace the camera. The first rep didnt give me any ticket number or anything .. just said email replacement. The 2nd rep did give me a ticket number. I have emailed them. Will update here how it goes further.    UPDATE : 3rd-September-2014  So the camera was promptly replaced. And the 2nd camera works very well. No hassles. Worked from the word go. It's been more than 2 months now and we use this camera everyday. Hasn't stopped or given any trouble. It's a little effort to set up the camera first and to update the software but after that it works smoothly. We use it with our apple and android devices. So initially the Foscam app for phone didnt work and I thought it was faulty and i got this app \\"ipcamsoft\\". Works very well for free with a  small adv on top of screen. It doesn't let you talk back though. Later I figured out that just changing from high def to standard def makes the Foscam app works. Now I use Foscam's app and it works perfectly fine. It lets you talk back. The only thing it tells me is that it cannot do is record my video. But for that i have the other app.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you try to set this up using Chrome browser, it apparently corrupts the password, so you can then no longer access the camera and will have to do a factory reset and start the setup all over again. Foscam knows about this and has known for at least 2 years because it's mentioned on their forums, but they have not taken any steps to warn their customers or fix the problem. If you set it up using Firefox, then the password goes through ok.

The user manual in general is not clear and is confusing and misleading and nearly worthless. I've had to set up the camera about 5 times so far. I'll probably eventually return it because there's no reason for it to be so difficult to use. The company doesn't seem to have an interest in making their product easy for consumers, so I can only imagine all the horror stories about dealing with their customer support are valid.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is my first wireless camera purchase. I am very happy with it. The picture at 640 is great but motion detection can miss someone walking in front of it. I lowered the quality to 320 and the motion picks up everything just fine. At 320 the quality is still plenty fine for identifying people which is what I bought it for. When motion is detected, it records a minute long AVI file that is roughly 15 MB.

The included software must be running on your PC to save video. The software can be locked with a password to prevent shutting it down (although I always lock my PC and password is required to unlock).

Night vision works great as well. You can easily identify people.

This camera is awesome, fits my needs perfectly, and with all these features I am surprised at the price. I paid $62.

Being able to view remotely with my smart phone works flawlessly as well. I used No-IP for dynamic DNS service. It is working as expected and was easy to sign up for.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Absolutely unreliable, incompetent customer service, will never buy Foscam ever again
review_body:
Bought a second one to replace the first Foscam following multiple failures (unresponsive, had to unplug and reboot repeatedly at 1-2 week intervals, despite their supposed firmware fix). Foscam charged $7 for a return fee, then never sent the replacement... Then the second one followed the same failure pattern.

After weeks went by, I finally called and was told the replacement hadn't been shipped because I hadn't forwarded the email to Foscam that showed I had paid the $7 fee. That's right, after I paid Foscam the $7, someone else at Foscom had to be notified --by me-- that I had paid that $7 before my RMA replacement was shipped. After that mildly irate phone call I was told they'll be sending it today. I guess that means I'll end up being the proud owner of two defective Foscam products.

This is just another good example of how trying to save a nickel can often end up costing a dime. There's another one-star review here where I saw \\"....If the camera is pointed at a scene with too much detail (trees, grass, wood grain, window screen, etc) the camera will fail by either freezing, displaying black or rebooting...\\" So I'm going to try a Dahua camera (IPC-HDW4100S). One problem that I'm sure it won't have will be to freeze and fail like a Foscam if I point it at a tree that has too many leaves.

review_headline: Resolution not great but good for a general monitor
review_body: I believe this is now an 'older' model, but it works fine for what I'm looking for which is knowing if someone else has gone in my shared garage space at my apartment complex.  It *might* be good enough to identify a face, but I can't say that for sure.  It did once seem to reposition itself (I'm pretty sure that no one got in and moved it) which made me wonder what was going on - maybe a power outage reset??    The setup was easy enough following Foscam's instructions.  Once setup by ethernet, it connects to a WiFi connection and can be controlled through a web interface.  I've set mine up to upload a picture to my website whenever motion is detected and that functionality seems to be solid.  I then added an index script to make an instant gallery of all the pictures in the folder so I can go see if there's been any movement that I don't recognise.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good Camera for Basic Viewing and Security
review_body:
Preface: My camera experienced a reboot and freeze when I maxxed out the contrast to "6" from the preset of "4". I noticed no picture quality difference so I returned the contrast setting to 4 after the reboot.

I am finding this 640 x 480 quality camera perfect for basic surveillance and security. It has an excellent mounting bracket and utility/control program. I mounted it on the ceiling upside down. The daylight picture quality is adequate and the nighttime infared (doesn't work through windows) is surprisingly good IMHO for such a relatively cheap camera that has two way audio. The 270 degree rotation plus the up and down range provides an ample range of view. I was able to figure out how to setup remote viewing by using the port forwarding instructions provided on the website. The wait for tech support was surprisingly short. I actually was able to speak to a live person from some offshore help desk. My questions were pretty basic but I was able to get everything setup and running with a matter of a couple of hours. I had to hop in my car and drive to an internet café to confirm the remote viewing. I couldn't confirm remote access in my house. Doh! I followed the security advice and purchased a DDNS provider for $19.95 per year to get a unique web address (no need to make things easy for hackers that flock to the free Foscam DDNS site). The basic utility that allows you to setup users with ADMIN, OPERATOR, or VISITOR levels of access along with their passwords is pretty straight forward. All this for about $70 plus the $19.95/yr for a unique DDNS. In short, I am pleasantly surprised how easy it is to do this for such little money.

Additional note on the Freezing Issue: The Contrast is set to 4 and it works fine (backyard/garden/trees view). I experienced the freezing and reboot when I set the contrast to 6. It gave some warning signs when part of the picture started to freeze. I set the contrast back down to 4 when it rebooted itself. Given that I saw no discernible difference between a contrast of 4 and 6 (looking through a window to the outside) I am not concerned. The indoor picture quality is acceptable. Given the slow internet in my area and my desire to add additional cameras, I am happy with the 640 x 480 quality. People looking for HD video surveillance should look elsewhere.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera works great, the setup was really tricky, but the customer support was great, Ralph Mendez had me up and running in less than 10 minutes !!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: a great first IP cam, but definitely not for commercial applications
review_body:
I put mine in the chicken coop (didn't realize it was an indoor only camera). As a nerdy-tech guy, i was able to run through the camera's settings in about an hour. The video quality is so-so, but delights me as I'm just checking on my chickens as I confuse them with the camera's subtle movements.

*THE KEY TO REMOTE VIEWING* is setting up PORT FORWARDING on your home router. Google/youtube it.

Also, create a FREE DYNAMIC DNS account (this gives you a free web address that will automatically point itself to your home's network from anywhere on the internet, it's a permanent link that self-updates to your current IP address at all times). Enter said account login/password into the Foscam's settings (you'll see it when you get there). I use NO-IP(dot)BIZ and it has never given me down a problem. My Foscam is rock solid, running via WIFI access on a 200' extension cord to the back of my property.

review_headline: Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt with Two way audio and night vision.
review_body: This product is fantastic for the night vision and setup was not too difficult. You have the option to set up your own IP address for the device (which I have noticed this only works on my home network and nowhere else, not event my phones 4g network), the best method to view outside of your home on other networks is to use the DNS service. Foscam has its own assigned to each camera and this was easy to setup. I called customer service to confirm that this is required and in fact they said it was in order to view from outside networks. I am only having one major issue and it is with the audio. I have a microphone in the 3.5mm input and I still hear horrible static noise in whatever product I use to view my camera from. I viewed  a tutorial on how to fix this option and it was required to buy a longer antenna. I called Foscam and they were unable to provide any assistance with this issue, aside from the audio problems it works really well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I wanted to set up a multi-camera surveillance system. After much consideration, I decided to start with this camera. Not one of my smarter choices, as it turns out. First of all, in order to use all of its features controls, you must use Internet Explorer. Firefox and Chrome will operate some, but not all of them. Secondly, while the camera does have infrared capabilities, the default setting is ON. You can manually turn it off, but any time the camera reboots (such as during a power loss), the infrared comes back on. I wanted to install one of the cameras so it was aimed through a window into another, dimly lit, room. Without the infrared, the camera did an adequate job of showing an image of the room. With the infrared on, there was nothing but a huge glare off the glass. Like most products imported from the Far East, the included instructions are a mess of gibberish and broken English making setup a challenge, especially if the user is not a tech wiz at routers, port forwarding, and networking. You can remotely view the camera over the internet on a smart phone or tablet, however the Android version of the Foscam app falls short of the mark. Don't waste time on it, there are other third party apps that do a much better job. Getting assistance from the web site is a waste of time. They devout a lot of space to marketing information about all of their products, but next to nothing in the way of on-line help. Calling the tech support phone number is like watching grass grow. Two different days, waiting over 30 minutes each time, and still no live person to talk to. Email is no better, after three days, still no response. That was the final deal breaker for me.

In summary, I only gave this one star because there was no option to give it Zero stars. Even that may be too many.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
JUST RECEIVED THE FOSCAM TODAY AND TRIED TO INSTALL MYSELF BUT NO GO. CALLED FOSCAM TECH SUPPORT AND SERVICE AND GOT FELIX ON THE PHONE. HE HAD ME UP AND RUNNING WITHIN 20MIN. GREAT CAMERA AND REMOTE SERVICE IS JUST WHAT WE WANTED. ONCE AGAIN THE SUPPORT AND SERVICE GIVEN BY FELIX WAS OUTSTANDING!!!
HE DESERVES A RAISE FOR HIS SKILL, KNOWLEDGE, AND FRIENDLINESS.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this camera about a month ago. Tech support helped me to set it up for remote DDNS access. It's different for internet explorer and for chrome. It works sometimes and does not at other time. There is no foscam app for Ipad. The one listed do not work. I have been calling tech support for remote access problems almost every week. They do help, but you have to wait a long time to be connected in line. Its continuing problem. That's why I am revising my rating to two stars. Looks like they have software problems, which should be fixed to make this a better product

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this camera even after some bad reviews. I set it up and was quite simple if you follow the instructions. The camera works well for indoors. Resolution is good but you should expect low resolution for the price (you get what you pay for). Regardless of the resolution it is still clear while the camera is panning. I am able to use the IP address with the port number at the end to view
camera(s) from work or Smartphone. Would I recommend this camera? ABSOLUTLEY!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This company has the best tech support. I talked to Mark and he was a great help. All there techs are very helpful and knowledgeable.
I have four of the FI8910W cameras Camera are great for the price. Great for an indoor cam to watch a pet, baby, or elder. If you want a security camera - you might want to get a cam that can pick up more details then this cam does. For the price and the free tech support, you can not beat it to watch over your love ones.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have now owned this camera for 3 months and it has been nothing but issues for me when connecting through Wifi.

Connecting it through ethernet cable isn't an issue but the wifi repeatedly gets disconnected and is unstable. The main reason I bought this camera was for the wireless feature but that proved to be nothing but trouble.

I was extremely disappointed that the camera had a lot of good reviews and I thought I would not have issues myself but when I looked online I found that a lot of people had the same issue.

If you connect it through ethernet the camera works great and I love that but once you go wifi it has trouble.

Foscam's customer service was pretty good about replacing it but it still did not work even after I switched over to a 9dB antenna.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and...
review_body:
JUNK....JUNK....JUNK DO NOT BUY Camera has problems with WiFi reboots. These problems are well documented. When the camera does connect it's as slow as a 56K modem and I have Cable internet I know it's not me. There is no real help for this from Foscam just the typical try this try that monkey motion.....I'm giving up on this too much time wasted already. Bought it for a present for my daughters birthday so by the time we set it up it's outside the return window.
JUNK JUNK JUNK

EDIT EDIT EDIT

OK so now I have to eat \\"Crow\\".

The main problem with this issue is that the router has to have WiFi set to \\"G\\" only if it is in the \\"mixed\\" mode there are issues that cause rebooting, slow performance and probably other problems as well not noticed by me. After changing this setting on my router (Linksys) I now have both of these cameras operating for several days now flawlessly with no rebooting.

With this in mind if I need more cameras I will definitely consider this type again.
I apologize for the previous review.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this camera as a cheap form of security for my house.  Camera works fine, but since it is infra-red you can only view video of outside the house during the day, but at night all you get is a reflection back to camera.  I tried to get technical support for this product but they never responded to my emails requesting help in setting up recording times.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Don't waste your money on this crap.
review_body:
I installed this yesterday and have already spent more than 2 hours on the phone with customer "service." I use Mozilla Firefox, and at first it seemed to work fine. Now, every time I try to run it, Firefox crashes. If I keep trying to get it to work, my system crashes into a blue screen. This has NEVER happened until I installed the Foscam software. After waiting on hold for over 30 minutes, one of the Foscam reps got it to sort of work using the mobile app/cell phone settings, so he claims it's perfectly fine. He had me uninstall and reinstall Firefox, and it has the same problem of CRASHING EVERY TIME I TRY TO RUN THE CAMERA. This is a piece of CRAP!
This has been a total waste of time and money. As soon as I finish writing this I'll be calling in for a return label and sending it back.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This device works when programmed by an expert. In no way is it usable by an intelligent but non-expert purchaser.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Never worked well and a recent FW update killed it/ It's now in the trash
review_body: It's an inexpensive webcam, worked just ok for a while. I've had it for 8 months. Video quality was low-res but that's what I bought it. Had issues with wireless dropping in/out, had to use wired for a decent connection. I would never rely on it for security, used it as a toy pet watch cam. Pan/Tilt seemed to work ok. Last FW upgrade completely killed it. Won't do it's normal power-on dance and won't connect via hardwire anymore so I can't go back. I tossed it and am looking for a replacement at the moment, won't go with Foscam again.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is fairly decent, here are the pro's:
Has pan features
nice bracket for mounting
daytime color, decent night vision
low price

Con's:
Audio doesn't work, at least with my setup, I think you may need external speakers and mic, would be nice if they sold those
Some browsers need plug-ins to allow you to see video
Not HD
lag on movement
Saving video doesn't seem to work

If you are looking for a cheap ip video camera, this is the ticket, but if you want a high end video, I would not expect that out of this camera

Update: I would have to say probably stay away from this camera, it constantly loses connectivity.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I got 2 versions of this camera last year and liked them a lot so when I wanted a 3rd one, this was my first choice.
Unfortunately the firmware (x.2.55) shipped with the 2014 model is buggy and the camera crashes when setting an admin password -- by default these models come with an empty admin password (really?) and the first thing the web UI does is ask you to set one. But when I do so, the camera reboots and becomes unresponsive. Updating the camera to the latest firmware didn't solve the issue.
Maybe my model is defective? -- it seems such a basic feature that I hope it doesn't affect all their new models, or are users not setting any admin password?
I've tried to contact Foscam via their website's form and via direct email and no reply from their support. I also found someone reported the exact same issue 2 months ago on their web forum and that didn't get any official reply.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Mine works great, no problems. If you are not at least network literate, it would be a hard instal. As long as you already know how to get your IP address and what it is, you should be fine.

I'm an advance computer user with more than thirty years of experience.  I am not willing to invest more hours trying to set it up.  I will return this and replace it with a true Plug-n-Play model from another manufacturer.

review_body: I have had these cameras for approximately a year now and have had no problems with the cameras themselves. I am, again, impressed with Foscam's tech support.  Thanks for all of your assistance and keep up the great work!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very happy I bought this camera
review_body:
I bought my first Foscam FI8910W camera about 1 year ago and was really happy with the purchase. Last month, I bought a 2nd one. Both these cameras serve my needs very well and have been working very efficiently. No problems since day 1.

From a security standpoint, I made sure that I have done whatever I can to make it a secure connection and can't be hacked (strong password etc.). Don't set this up as per the manual and CD it comes with. Do a custom install by going into your router and cam settings and do not use the url this company asks you to set up to access the camera remotely. There is a setting to disable this within the camera device management section. Another reviewer for this product has explained how to do a custom & secure installation of this camera. I followed those instructions.

For remote access via my iPhone, I use the Foscam Pro app, which works very well.

To sum up, set this camera up the right and secure way and you will not be disappointed. Solid product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Forscam and Amazon Prime, 5 Stars without hesitation!
review_body: I purchased this product as supplement to my newly installed Home security system. The existing system has outdoor cameras covering all outside doors. I found an app for my iphone (ICam) for $4.99 that would allow me to turn my existing computer USB cameras into security cameras and display them on my phone. Being the geek that I am, this turned into experimenting with wireless cameras in other rooms. After reading several reviews it came down to Airlink101 and the Forscam F18910W.  I purchased one of each to compare. The Forscam came first so I worked on the first. It was so easy to configure that I decided not to even spen any time on the Airlink.  Besides the Forscam was om Amazon prime so it came in 2 days as apposed to over a week with the Airlink. When it came to figuring the camera to work outside of my local network, I decided to call tech support instead of spending hours on my own. I spoke with John Davis at Forscam in India. He was one of the best techs I have spoken to in a long time. He was easy to follow, professional and curious. Above all he was knowledgable. He was patient an allowed me to create screen captures along the way so I could create instruction for installation of the next three I decided to add. I highly recomend this product as well as Amazon Prime. I have since returned the Airlink and besides the hassle of dealing with the vendor, I had to pay $3.00 in shipping to get it and $17.00 to sent it back!  Never again will I buy any not part of Prime and not handled by Amazon. Thanks Forscam and Thank Amazon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love the camera, it's exactly what I wanted and what I expected.  The only reason it didn't get a 5 star rating was that it was too difficult for me to install.  I had to pay someone with a bit more technical ability but it's up and running and I love it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Mark helped me reconnect my cameras. Support like this makes me happy to recommend Foscam cameras to all my friends. These cameras and a great value for the price and the technical support is the best in the industry.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this camera about 6 months ago and set it up without any issues. Then recently, I started having issues connecting to the camera over WiFi. I contacted support and worked with a very helpful technician, Eric Hill, who took the time to go through and find the issue and correct it. It was not an easy issue and took over 30 minutes to resolve, but Eric did not try to rush me off the phone and he made sure the issue was corrected prior to hanging up.
The camera itself is great. I love being able to access it from my Android phone, my iPad, or my computer. Video quality is what you would expect and the ability to hear sound is great. If you are looking to be able to speak back to whomever is in the room, well, there is much to be desired in that function.
On a side note, DDNS service is included out of the box, so you are able to access the camera remotely without incurring any additional charges.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It an amazing camera for the price.  Foscam's support is excellent.  Only the basic setup to your wifi network is easy.  Port forwarding for your router will likely take support from Foscam.  It is not easy.  Blue Iris software is excellent, but also not intuitive or easy for the initial setup.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera was 4 or 5 stars until the night vision stopped working. The support online for this product is absolutely terrible... I suppose you get what you pay for but I was expecting this to at least function with it's basic features for a year or so. This issue is pretty well documented online, but I just didn't think it would happen to me.

When everything was working properly, this camera is everything I wanted. Tons of apps and software for viewing, pan and tilt, and nightvision. I was getting ready to buy 4 more I liked it so much.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I will start with the good:

There are a huge number of IR LEDs on this thing and as such the low light picture is really good even among other cameras of the breed.

Everything else is bad:

The color picture is greenish and awful.
Even with a high link and throughput connection, the audio quality sounds like a walkie-talkie conversation with someone in space.
I think I am a very talented network person, this camera was ridiculously complicated to configure.
Once configured, it would sometimes drop the network connection. (typically resolving itself in a few hours)

For those more technical among you this is the process that I went though to configure the camera:

Connected directly to the camera using an ethernet cable. Unable to find it.
Ran a network scan and located the camera on a different subnet than advertised.
Manually configured the IP, Subnet and port
- camera reboots with the new config
- post reboot the camera disappears.
- ran a network scan and found the camera on a different subnet with the original IP I had assigned. It is worth noting that the subnet the camera switched to with my IP was not a valid subnet and could not ever have possibly worked (WTF Foscam?)
- logged into the camera on the new subnet and changed the subnet
- camera rebooted and worked until it started intermittently dropping from the wifi network.

The camera is cheap compared to its competitors. I ended up going with a Trendnet with fewer LEDs that is 100% better in terms of setup and support. I paid double the price ($110) and I am happy to have done it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Is my first IP Camer and It is everything I was expecting, very easy to configure, excellent gadjet. I reccomend it

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not user friendly in recording mode
review_body: I bought this camera to monitor a room not record at first.  My priorities changed however and I needed to record motion video.  Unknown to me at the time of purchase, this model can't record when using Firefox as a browswer because Firefox does not support ActiveX.  I tried using Internet Explorer which does support ActiveX but the camera does not work at all.  It will work with Google Chrome but again, will not record video.  The two other Foscam's I have do record video using Firefox.  I wish I'd never purchased this one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: While this is a bit confusing for a techno-challenged person to set up, I do indeed love this. Wonderful and inexpensive security device.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: This camera is just OK. You cannot rely a 100% on it
review_body:
The camera itself it’s not something you can trust in. It needs to get a reboot every once in a while; maybe every 4 or 5 days. Otherwise it just stops transmitting. You can even see the green light on the back (the one that means that there is a data flow between the device and the router) stops tilting. There were many times when I went out and I couldn’t watch my home because of this. I know friends with other cameras that have been working for hundreds of days, or even years without any stop whatsoever.

It takes at least some medium knowledge in computers to configure the camera and the Router. But that’s not the problem.

Some things that are remarkable on this camera:
- Night Vision works great even in big areas
- Motion sensor works very well. It gets it almost every time
- The eMail alert on motion is great!
- The field of view of the lens is pretty decent. (not too narrow)
- The presets you can configure for the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera has been connected to my Diskstation for about a year. Its connected through a power line ethernet connection. I never trusted that wireless would work as well so I never tried it that way. I cannot comment on camera software or setup as the Diskstation controls all aspects of the device. The hardware is flawless in that regard.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: As others mention, set up is a nightmare if you try it on you own.  Spent hours,  the manual is not well written and could haved been written step by step.  I then called customer service,  was waiting a long time, then called back the next day.  The tech was patient and helpful.  Set everything up in about 15 minutes.  I really recommend having them help the setup.  I was then able to set up my second camera in about 5 minutes on my own.  The product view is good  I am using it outside  (its not securable) to monitor a vacation house and pictures are clear and the tilt swivel features work remotely.  I do recomment this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: The best value in IP cameras
review_body:
The camera is fairly quite when moving and the IR has pretty good range at night. The two way audio is super cool and both sound and picture quality are great for my application (baby monitor). I get good WiFi connection all over the house and yard (seems better than my laptop even). I use this with the tinyCam app (android) and my Roku (forget the channel name) and it works great. My only gripe is that when talking through the camera it sometimes cuts off the first and last few words and there is a noticeable delay (with both the browser interface and the tinyCam app). You can avoid cutting off words by waiting a couple seconds to start talking and holding the button a little while after you're done.

Put a temperature probe on this and it would be an amazing baby monitor.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good value, little tricky to set up
review_body: I had some trouble with the port forwarding, but eventually figured it out.  Would have given 5 stars if instructions were better.  Otherwise, the picture is decent, and night vision camera works too.  I was a little leery after reading some of the other reviews, so far so good.  I would recommend this, but be prepared to educate yourself about port forwarding.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Hmmm...its a good camera, but be careful..........
review_body:
So, yes, Foscam makes decent cameras. However, read the specs as you may want more out of it than what it delivers.

The big issues for me after having this camera for several months are this.........

- Be careful of the firmware updates. If not applied correctly, the WIFI option will be lost forever.
- The control interface is like a visit back to the 1990s. It is clumsy, often obnoxious and non-intuitive.
- After a few months of ownership, I am seeing degradation in the mechanical aspects of the camera. I expect failure at some point.
- I am just guessing here, but it seems the vid quality took a back seat to the mechanical aspects (pan, tilt etc).
- There is no zoom.
- The resolution is limited to 640x480
- It is bulky and hard to mount.
- It is very conspicuous.

So overall it works, but it could be so much more. I am glad I bought it at the time, but will re-consider buying another.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Amazing value for money, but this isn't 'plug and play' ...
review_body: This IP camera is absolutely amazing value for money! Within less than an hour, I was up and running with remote viewing/control capabilities and alarm notifications set for sound and motion. Picture quality is surprisingly good too - it automatically switches to Night Vision in low-light conditions and has a general high level of detail. There's a definite caveat that applies to all IP webcams - you're going to have to be ok with getting inside the configuration of your Router. I found a useful guide in the instructions for my Apple Airport, but I still had to understand that the camera required a fixed IP address, and had to figure that out (it's not rocket-science at all). Ultimately many of the common questions can be answered with a simple web query, so someone probably has the answer. Overall this is highly recommended, but be aware of the technical requirements.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: well it's lambing season and I got tired of going out to the sheep barn every couple hours(night time too) so why not get a camera to do that. fan effin' tastic! the wifi is in the house and the camera is in the sheep barn(wood framing, metal corrugated walls and a full shingled roof, 2 windows and a door) mounted upside down & backwards so the status LED's can be seen at a glance(for power & wifi connection and it has  "flip" & "mirror" options to right the picture on the view screen) in the far corner about 100 feet away from the router(Netgear WNDR3400v2) and the signal was at 91% with a very good picture,(not HD but give me a break it's only $70). the camera had to be rotated 180* to get full coverage inside the barn so the status LED's aren't easily visible anymore and now the antenna is jammed in the back corner so the signal is only at 50% but surprisingly that didn't effect the picture quality at all(a real testament to the camera). so if you have any outside critters(or anything else) to watch over don't spend a bundle of cash, this works great. also, there isn't any zoom but you can zoom in on your browser page. one more thing, my computer is pretty old so it doesn't connect to my plasma screen but my BLUERAY PLAYER(Samsung) has a web browser on it so now there are sheep on the tv. oh yeah, my wife's KINDLE can see the sheep from her night stand so no more trips out in the middle of the night! AWESOME!  the most important thing is the tech support for a wireless connection, I just couldn't get it to go, but a few minutes on the phone with RYAN in TECH SUPPORT and all was well(he WAS GREAT)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Pleasantly surprised by these although it can be hit or miss depending on which software you get for iPad, iPhone, Android, Mac or PC. I use uFoscam on my Mac and iOS devices. It gets the job done. Would like more precise noise alerts and push notifications on the app but I use Pushover.net's iPhone app and an email from the Foscam for motion and noise alerts.

review_body:
I was initially happy with this product until the update. Setup was easy and I mainly used the motion alert option and it worked well. I decided to upgrade the firmware a few weeks ago and its doing some funky stuff. Its no longer able to utilize the motion alert and after four days or so the camera would start moving randomly by itself. I initially thought it was someone hacking into my system or a power failure, but I don't that's the case since I've changed the password several times already and a power failure happening every four days or so seems unlikely.

Support is poor. I sent two emails already and no response in two weeks. I've tried to do the live feed option in which it allows you to view your camera on the internet, but that was more complicated and it failed. No exact instructions given by Foscam for latest modems. You have to rely on the forum/other users for help.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
So I was reading a forum where, at least what sounded like a person from Foscam, said that "these camera's were not intended to be a baby monitor, but people are using them for such." However, the box shows them being used to watch babies, hence, they are marketing them as baby monitors....anyway, it seems that for some reason, the FI8910W does not work properly for some Android phones, my wife and I have S2 Skyrockets and the app works fine if you are watching video and listening to audio with the screen on, but as soon as you turn the screen off, the audio stream stops. This is obviously a problem if you are not within earshot of a screaming baby. The other problem we had was when you try an speak with the two way voice communications, the software doesn't automatically mute microphone on the camera so you end up getting feedback and eventually the camera is screaming like a dying hyena. My wife started laughing like crazy when I tried asking if she needed help and the camera was just screaming electronic cuss words at her. I had no idea what was going on until I heard it myself when I was close by the camera.

Anyway, because most people will skip over the blurb above, here is a quick summary.

Pros:
Picture quality will do
Night vision is pretty good.
definitely quiet movement.
application is mostly user friendly. (I'm pretty tech savvy though)
sturdy build.

Cons:
Audio stops on some android phones once screen is turned off.
Lack of muting on camera side when using two way communications causes horribly loud sounds coming from camera.

If Foscam could fix these two bugs and make this camera more reliable, it would be a great inexpensive baby monitor.

Note: My sister has the step down from this version and has had no problem with audio issues above. But, given my experience, I can't give this a very high rating.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have had this camera up and running for about 7 months now and I like it a lot. But, there have been some issues...
Pros:
1. Video quality is great for surveillance; don't be expecting to record and HD movie
2. The night vision works great and reaches to the end of my driveway and into the street a little
3. Set up was super easy and it is very customizable
4. Pan and tilt functions work flawlessly
5. Wireless connectivity is an added bonus

First of all, I know that this is and indoor camera, but I have kept it outside for over 7 months with now issues. To protect it from the elements I mounted underneath the eve of my house so that no rain can get to it. It has survived the winter (dropping well below 15 degrees) and the summer. I started out having the camera connect to my network wirelessly because it was convenient, but I the quality of the video suffered a little bit. I then hard-wired it to my router and then the quality was perfect! I've only had two issues. First, the wireless module stopped working (It would not find any networks). It may be because I had it outside and the cold messed up the wireless module, but I already had it hardwired so it didn't matter to me. The only other issue that I have is the FPS (Frames Per Second). I use a program called ISpy to record my camera. I started noticing that the FPS was very low with this program (It was 4 FPS). I asked Foscam support about it and they said it has something to do with the way they program their cameras. They said they would eventually have a fix for it, but nothing yet. I managed to get the FPS up to 15-16 on the ISpy program and that is satisfactory for me!

Cons:
1. Low FPS with some 3rd party programs
2. Wireless connectivity

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The picture quality is not HD! (at least not anywhere near 720/1080) That is the biggest thing to understand when ordering.

Update the FW/Web UI first and then set up all your settings. Back that up.

The scheduler is nice but seems to have conflict when you set it up on a PC and then edit it on the Android App.

Use DynDNS to get your stream anywhere. Android app is very nice/easy to use.

It is GREAT as a baby monitor/pet monitor. Will it identify burglars? Possibly. Most of the time it just catches people I know as they enter my apartment so I already know there body type/face. I have not tried it on unknown people to see if I could make them out after the fact, and frankly I hope I don't ever have to.This provides me a small piece of mind when I am at work and my Fiancee loves being able to remote in and see our dog/cat wherever she is. I would buy again but I will definitely go up a model for better picture clarity (yet larger price).

review_headline: Great camera.. setup could be easier
review_body: The camera works great.  I can't believe how well the IR lights work at night.  When it's pitch dark you all you see is a black screen.  Turn the lights on and you see everything in the room (I'm using this indoors).  My biggest complaint was the hoops you have to jump through to get it to work from outside your network.  It would be nice if Foscam had some kind of assistant that walks you though the port forwarding and had a DNS server that worked automatically.  Once I got it set up, it worked fine.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great so far!  Just what I was looking for!  Easy to set up.  Loaded an app on my phone to access from anywhere.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: If you want a camera that works 25% of the time, then get this
review_body: Bought this to use as a baby monitor.  Setup took a bit longer than I'd like, but gets easier each time I perform a reset on the camera.  I've tried several differnet apps on my iphone, ipad, and old andriod phone. (I've spent over $20 on apps)  All experience the same thing, so I know it's the camera.  Sometimes it works great, but then connection will drop and it can take anywhere from 30-60 minutes to get a good connection again.  Then it drops again shortly afterwards, cycle repeats.  Rarely will this ever work for 60 straight minutes.  It's not consistent and provides no ease of mind, especially at night when I'm trying to sleep because I have no way of knowing it's not working without picking up my ipad or iphone.  I even bought a wifi repeater and tried using that.  Same issue.  When I called tech support, their simple answer is perform a hard reset (button on the bottom) even though I'd already done that.  I've tried google to find answers.  I've updated firmware, etc.  I'm not sure how this camera gets such good reviews. I'm also not sure how people keep saying tech support (and giving their name) was a great help.  Seems like bogus reviews if you ask me.  I was hoping this would work because I'm expecting another baby and wanted one for his room as well as my 2 year old.  I've been trying for 2 months to get this thing to work and I'm about ready to give up because I'm wasting too much time!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Liked it, so I bought another one!
review_body:
I bought a Foscam FI8910W and was able to readily get it connected to my home WIFI. I had trouble getting it configured so that I could view it via the internet on my iPhone. I called the tech help line and got a live person within a matter of minutes and they quickly solved the problem. FYI the iPhone app is $5.99.
After using it for a couple weeks we concluded it worked very well so we bought a second one! It remotely pans left to right, tilts up and down, zooms, has infrared for at night, and has audio. Be sure to call the techs if you have difficulties, they are quick to answer and will have you up and going in short order.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It has worked flawlessly for me for everything I expected, with one caveat. (This was warned about in one of the featured reviews.)

If you set the camera to full resolution (640x480) with the standard brightness and contrast under bright outdoor conditions, it causes the camera to crash and reboot (especially when panning).

So, normally, I keep the camera set to 320x240 (it lowers the bandwidth used by the cameras, too). I will perform any panning in the low res mode, then kick up to full resolution once pointed at my intended subject.

However, I find that if I lower the brightness and/or contrast, I can keep the camera set to full resolution without any crashes.

Tips: If you are going to use this camera for bright, detailed outdoor viewing, keep it in low res, or lower your brightness to 5 and/or your contrast to 2. Then, you are golden.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Cumbersome to install. Technology is out of date. Not able to manage with cell phone or tablet. NEED a CD driver (gack!) AND after a while.....Asks for security log in to your computer hmmmmm do I smell a potential for hacking????
Now that I am stuck with it (I bought it last year). Think I will just stick it in a window as a decoy....

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera for the cost. Few minor working issues, but nothing horribad.
review_body: This camera is fantastic for the cost.  It has pan/tilt, infrared, speaker and microphone built-in.  There is an Android app that works from the local network, but does not work with port forwarding thru the router.  It also has a web interface that does work on both the local network and port forwarding thru the router.  From time to time it will reset, which causes the pan/tilt position to randomize, but the web interface has a control to fix it (presets don't seem to work when this happens.. in that they don't auto-move to your preset position when it goes funky, like it does if there is a power loss/reset).  It also stands on its own, and is about the size of a grapefruit.  To set it up, you need to plug it into a router... you cannot plug it directly into a laptop (requires DHCP server for setup).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The reviews warning about technological difficulties are correct - if you're not ready to have a few frustrating nights wrangling your router's settings, get another camera.  If you're a tech-pro or patient, this camera is great.  I use it to keep an eye on our place, and it's easy to control from a mobile phone.  The infra-red works great.  The wide angle combined with the pan/tilt gives you a massive view.  Does what I bought it to do!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I like the definition and overall function of the camera and you can't beat the price. The directions are just ok. They don't tell you that the default log-in is "admin" and "password" which would be good to know. Customer service was great and they solved any questions I had.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is very easy to set-up - in a matter of minutes you can get it online and functional.

I want to point out a few of the features that I found to be very useful.

Once setup on your local network (LAN), you can access it from many devices (I have successfully accessed it from a chromebook, a Kindle, an iPhone, an iPad, a Debian Linux pc, and several Windows 7 laptops.) You can control pan and tilt from your PC (or other device) as well as change the administrative settings (with a username/password.)

The device can, on alert, send images to e-mail accounts or if you set up a FTP location, to a folder on a FTP drive. The alert can be on motion and/or sound. I have tried all of these options with success. I have found for me that the e-mail on alert is best to my liking. You get an alert and a picture as soon as a motion or sound triggers it.

Another feature that takes a little more technical skill to set up is the ability to access the camera from any location on the internet. The setup on the camera is fairly easily but on your router, you will need to modify settings to allow the camera to be accessible through the internet. In normal operations, your router would block these type of access attempts as a security measure. You can selectively allow allow open ports to access the camera and keep your LAN secure. There are decent instructions in the manual that makes this setup easier. I also tried this function and it works great as well. It is very nice to be able to look over your house when you are away from home.

The infrared works very well also for night pictures.

The picture resolution is as stated in the specifications. If you want a higher resolution image, you should look at the more expensive version of this camera.

Last point is that there are several free apps on the apple store for the FOSCAM that allows you to view up to 8 cameras. If you have an iPhone or iPad, these making viewing multiple cameras very nice and an improvement over using a browser.

I have had the camera for about 6 weeks - I am pleased with the operations and functionality. If this is your first use of an IP camera, this would be a good choice and great value for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The IR cut filter is all too welcome. The video quality of this model is far superior to earlier revisions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Purchased the camera back in 2013 and it worked for a few months. Out of nowhere I started to have issues with this cam connecting to the wifi network. It would connect for a few minutes then drop the connection and about 30 minutes later it would reconnect itself. I thought that maybe the antenna was bad so I bought one of extended onmi antenna and the problem still exist. I then proceeded to update the firmware in hopes that it will solve the problem but the firmware update made things even worse. Now the camera would not connect to wifi at all and the advertised free dns disappeared with the firmware update. Spending hours going through Foscam's website, I noticed that there are many other people in the same situation as I and Foscam have not replied to any posts requesting assistance. Now I realize why this camera pop up as discounted so many times.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: quick telephone support by Irish.. Love the remote control and viewing, Foscam elephone support was terrific and very fast to answer my call,  Very helpful support.  I am using this for baby monitoring.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I'm impressed.  Lots of bang for buck, 5 stars
review_body:
Just received this item today and I'm very happy with its capabilities especially for the price.
In addition to the required stuff, they include a CAT5 cable and even a nice wall/ceiling mount.
I like the SR-71 matte black finish, seems to be designed and built well. The pan/scan capability is smooth and excellent.

It took me just shy of 2 hours to get everything 100% setup, config over wire first then connect to protected WIFI, setup static IP with non-80 port, forwarded port in the router, setup DDNS, install and setup iPhone app to connect from outside the firewall, setup/test alarm schedule plus email notifications and image upload.
It's got a great menu... whatever you want to setup, it's in there. Whatever information you want, including logs of each time the unit noticed a sound, it's there too.

If I had one wish for this cam, it would be a higher image resolution (as in 1080p). I would also expect such a thing to be more expensive.
I also have a Tenvis on the way, it will be interesting to see how these two guys work together software-wise.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is a great camera. We have a lake house in Maine and we can monitor the house from our Phones or Tablets anywhere in the country! The picture quality exceeds all expectations and the listening feature is awesome.The quality is excellent and it performs perfectly. I would give it five stars, but after a major power fluctuation, I had to redo all the wifi and internet settings. I contacted their five star service department and  a tech named Mason helped me out, he had it back up and running in 15 minutes! Great support,  great product, buy one, you will be very happy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Despite previous firmware issues, a good experience so far.
review_body:
I bought this camera about a month ago for use with an iSpy server for home security. I was a little wary due to the reviews, but now I'm ready to declare, I like this camera and it's been working for me so far. Bought almost 2 months ago.

This camera runs 24/7 and it has provided faultless service. I have received notifications regarding firmware updates but have not installed them yet. I'm currently on firmware: 11.37.2.52. I'll have to check the forums to see if there are any issues with the updates.

Never forward things like this over the internet. You should always remote in using an encrypted connection before connecting to the camera, whether it's a VPN on your router or using Teamviewer to get on a computer at home, then viewing the camera. The lack of security is not worth the convenience.

I was already using iSpy before I purchased this camera so I have not bothered with whatever software/monitoring/alerting it has. I have used the web interface locally and had no problem getting the sound to work to listen.

I would like to put this outside under a porch, but not sure how it'll hold up, I guess the only issue it could face would be due to humidity? That and thieves or vandals, I read that if you have it behind glass, the IR doesn't work. Lame.

One major problem is that I am now addicted to looking at my house when I'm gone. I constantly want to pull things up and check the cameras (even though I have alerts set). It's too much fun to play with the camera and move it around... it could really affect my work if I get more of these cameras.

I'll update if there are any issues with the camera in the near future, but I give it a thumbs up. I noticed there was a new version of this camera, but I have the one in the picture, I'd like to paint it up and make it look like the minion from Despicable Me.

We bought this instead of a baby monitor by friends who have it and love it. They helped us set it up (after confessing a friend who set theirs up is a computer programmer, and then confessing the sound doesn't work). The camera is great, when we can see it on our devices. It worked on our computer almost always, after about a week it would stop working on our phones or tablets, then we would reset the IP addresses and it kept happening. I tried to re-route my router, and spent many baby-nap-time-hours trying. Never worked. Then a few weeks ago it stopped working on our computer. I just spent 2 hours trying to set it up again and I keep getting error messages. I think you have to be some sort of computer guru to get this to work.

In short, I have been complaining for a year that we should just have bought a simple sound monitor that is user (foggy-brained new mom) friendly.

Save your spouse from hearing you complain, get an actual baby monitor.
