product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bought this camera a year ago (March 2013) for light surveillance (take a picture and send it to me if motion detected), which it advertised that it could do easily.

Well, I was able to set up everything on the camera just fine, including port-forwarding to be able to view/manage the camera from outside my home network. However, I could never get this one feature to work and gave up on it - I don't require a constant, real time image of my front door. I should have been more disciplined and returned it when I had the chance.

Now that I'm getting a dog and would like to monitor her, I'm going to give it another try - I don't think I'll need an 'intruder alert/snapshot' with the new dog, but it would have been nice to have that functionality which I'd originally purchased it for.

Who knows - maybe I'll spring for one of the very impressive DropCams that my colleague showed me - but I can't stomach the idea of paying for this basic functionality twice. Wish I'd just sprung for it the first time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Security camera that doesn't provide secure communications
review_body:
I bought this camera and found out it's insecure, so returned it. The main source of insecurity is the fact it can only be accessed remotely using http basic authentication, which transmits user name and password in cleartext over the wire. Anyone with a packet sniffer can get your password, and start observing you while you are in your own home. Once I realized this limitation, the only place I could safely put it was in my crawlspace, to watch the mice activity. I decided to return it instead.

Other than that, I also had plenty of trouble setting up the email notifications (never worked). Note that it's just a .3 MP (megapixel) camera, and most of hte others in this price range are 1 MP and above. For reference an iphone 4s has an 8 MP camera. So the resolution is poor to say the least.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Beware if you want more than a baby cam
review_body:
Bought this camera to keep track of a condo I own when I'm not there.
Thought according to everything I've read that this was a very easy or at least not super hard camera to setup on the internet. Well B.S.

FIRST:
Their live chat is non existent. I tried over and over to get someone to answer their live chat that comes up every 2 seconds asking if I want support threw chat.
Second
I'm not computer illiterate not a genius either but I'd say above average. The camera comes with a domain that is from foscam well That didn't work and yah port forwarding is setup I've went threw step by step several times over setting things up since it's usually just some stupid thing you've missed even reset it to factory default settings and started fresh twice with no luck.

I don't know if the dns they give you for the camera is a feature they eliminated or what.

Then they say in the directions that you can go to a third party site they give you and use theirs if you want. Yah at 20 bucks a year and even then I don't know if it's the camera or their site so if I pay the 20 bucks it still might not work.

The camera seems to work decient picture is no bad as long as I'm using the wireless or cat 5 and if I could get the internet part to work without a nightmare it might be worth what I paid. Right now I'm ready to throw it across the parking lot haven't been this pissed at a product in years.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera; difficult to set up
review_body:
I purchased two of these. They are great cameras; however, the set up for port forwarding and email alerts are crazily difficult.

I contacted Foscam support team for assistance with port forwarding (allows you to view the cameras anywhere there is internet) and setting up alarm alerts when there is motion detection. The port forwarding was successful and easy for the tech guy, but the alarm alerts set up was difficult. Jake Taylor, the rep couldn't figure it out. We kept receiving error messages. He then said that he would have an Tech Manager contact me the following day. I still have yet to hear back from them since. It is now the second day. I will keep you posted if I do or do not hear from them at all. My plan is to return the cameras if I do not hear back from them or they will not be able to help me set up the email alerts. While the cameras are great, they are useless to me without those email alerts unless you will monitor the cameras 24/7.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera only works when it feels like working. The main reason that I purchased it was to view my house from my android smart phone. The Verizon connection changes every month, so you must keep re-programing it which is a hassle. Also there is a lot of static when you try to speak/communicate. If your going to use your smart phone with this item.......beware because it uses a huge amount of data.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

With that said you only need to be a part time nerd to get this guy going so it s your best choice.  It has all the features you need and the performance (pic quality, reliability, etc) is very good.  I would definitely buy another one.

review_body: This is the third camera of this model I have purchased. The camera is great. The software could be more user friendly. It took me awhile to determine how I needed the camera to be set to my requirements. The camera is a great value for the price. I do recommend it and I would not hesitate to add an additional one if my requirement demands a 4th camera.

review_body: Ordered 2 returned 2. Messed with these things for a few days before deciding to return them. I had done alot of research on which camera would serve my needs of security, I only wanted to monitor my home while i was away via my phone. One reason i chose these was not having to sign up for a cloud service. Turns out my Belkin router will only let me use a service they recommend which cost after the free trial. Now that's not Foscams fault but i feel it should have been noted at some point. As for the cameras they were no where near the quality i expected and the image quality was bad after about 15 to 20 feet away (from the camera i put in my living room i couldnt even read the writing on a box that was in my kitchen about 13 feet away , So unless a thief sticks his face right up to the camera i doubt if i could even get a good look. So back to the drawing board.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
[[VIDEOID:moHPPWR2VI6QKQ]]I purchased this camera because I have a special needs child with Prader-Willi Syndrome. Prader-Willi is a genetic disorder - people with PWS have an insatiable appetite and cannot control themselves around food. If you came to our home you would find our all the food in our house under lock and key.

My wife and I wanted to leave our 12 year old PWS child alone for a bit, but wanted the security of being able to watch the kitchen to make sure she did not eat (even with the food under lock and key). It was very easy to set up and configure. I already have a Synology NAS, so I connected the camera and set it up to record when it identified movement.

Little did I know that this would also catch our 9 year old son trying to take the laptop up to his room after his bed time. As you can see from the video, I did not hide the camera and he knew right where it was located. He made a wise choice and only displayed a little bit of attitude.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera/software/browser login all work great and do exactly what it says it'll do.  I actually use mine through ninja blocks.  It is also compatible with zoneminder.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I tried a few days to get this item to work on Mavericks. Thinking there was some trick that I must have missed. The first part, I purchased this like new off Amazon, with a few minor imperfections. When it came it had no installation CD. I went to the foscam website, thinking perhaps like other customers, they might help. Those reviews must be bots, because in a week I have yet to find any customer service rep available by chat. I called in but they couldn't really assist me with connecting me to someone via chat to screenshare or anything else another reviewer said. Maybe they were lucky. I wasn't. So there aren't really any tutorials for this model and maverick and I eventually gave up. Amazon will not send the installation CD, and the ip find tool just never worked once. So I sent this back and got the plug and play 21P. There's zero information about the 21P's, its all 21W and I was hesitant.

software for mac is only the IP tool on the CD. But I plugged the thing in my router, and viola, it appeared. And it was pretty easy after that. I still have a sneaking suspicion that there's software out there that gives you one price and then after you purchase you see lower prices. I'm still convinced this is the case, with this particular 10W purchase, and had to buy one a double the price just to find one that worked on my mac. The 21P works great, but don't put it behind glass for the night. I don't know what on earth you would use to use the IR at night in a case, none seem to offer any help case wise and renders the feature completely useless. The browser software does not accept USB camera's that I can figure out. IP addy or not. But it does accept multiple camera's for the 21p if you do not wish to convert a usb that I'm aware of. I never got to see for the 10W :(/ I used evocam, and i got usb, FaceTime and this camera up and going. Plug & Play is the way to go.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased 5 Foscam IP cameras last year, and they are affected by the faulty sensor issue extensively published by other customers.

However, I just read the response from Foscam willing to replace these products. I just contacted FOSCAM-US customer service, and was told to send them an email, and that within 24 hrs I would get replacements.. Sounds too good to be true, but if that's the case, I will be willing to review the rating and give it 4-5 star.

I like these products, but the malfunction of these sensor renders these cameras useless at times.

Also, their power supply is very weak at best, already had to replace two of them.

Otherwise, very good products for the price.

Will see what type of response I get from FOSCAM..

I am not requesting money back, just want to get good working products without these faulty sensors..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Opened the box and watched the video that came with it spoken by a aweful accent 1/2 Chinese / 1/2 British and fully not understandable. Fortunately I am able to figure out what I need through reading the forums. From the looks of it, I am not the only frustrated person who can not get the wireless to connect. I have 3 access point, one on each floor of my house, and this camera can not connect to any of them. Forum suggest get on my knees and pray to what ever god I worship and hope it works. Unfortunately I don't pray to any god, therefore it didn't work. Long story short, I got a dud and I am in good company. So I am returning it.

Specifics on my wireless if anyone is looking in the future and curious if their hardware is compatible.
I have a Verizon N router that can with my FIOS.
I also have a Cisco E4200, 2.4Ghz in mixed mode, and WAP2, and 5.4Ghz in N-mode olnly and WAP2.
I also have an Asus AC66U, same setup as the E4200.

While it is hard wired into the router, it is able to get an IP and I can see video. But when I setup the wireless, it never gotten an IP and never connected to any router. And unplugging the Ethernet cable rendered this camera useless.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great $75 webcam.  Don't expect a Mercedes for a Hyundai price.
review_body:
I find this to be a great webcam. It's resolution is pretty good. At 640X480 resolution, the frame rate I get over the internet is very low, down at 5 fps for my MacPro and sometimes 1 fps for my Samsung Notepad. But as I said, don't expect a Mercedes for a Hyundai price.

The controls from the webpage works pretty good. You can set options, and do controls okay. My Android phone uses a paid Foscam App and IPCam (for free) which works much better in terms of control layout. But you don't need to pay $2.99 for an App. The benefits are marginal.

Set up was pretty easy. For those that have had trouble probably didn't read the instructions. The only tough part was setting up the Verizon Fios port forwarding. It took at least 5 minutes to do a Google search to figure it out.

I have dynamic DDNS service, but used the IP address and the 4 digit port I set up. It's been a week and the public IP address hasn't changed. I was starting to use the public IP forwarding service, but figured that for the infrequent times that my dynamic IP changes (I got it a month ago, and hasn't changed yet), that when it does change, I'll just cross the bridge when I come to it and change the IP address when I log in.

You can turn on the IR light remotely. You can control the camera direction by clicking on a control and on touch pads, swipe with your finger. There are 8 preset positions which are great, and you can set it to automatically sweep vertically or horizontally.

A great feature is a motion sensor that when triggered, will send by e-mail 6 pics from the camera. I use it with my security system.

There is a feature that periodically allows video to upload to an FTP service, but Verizon doesn't allow FTP hosting so I haven't been able to get it to work. But, from your app or webpage create snapshots and videos.

Finally, the apps allow you to view several cameras at the same time. I haven't triedit because I only have one cam, but since several apps have it and you can view one window which the other(s) with no signal, I assume it should work.

In summary, it has great features and it seems to work well. If you want an inexpensive camera that can work wirelessly and over the internet that has a host of practical features, this is it. If you want a professional grade camera, this is not for you. You need a camera that costs hundreds of dollars. I think it's not fair to give a Toyota Camry a lower rating just because it doesn't have the features and performance of a Bentley.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works but it's plagued by software issues and bad support/documentation.
review_body:
Typical clone product.

After much effort I don't have a reliable security system. External and internal software crashes or is not compatible with the latest Mac OSX software as suggested. I have no problems with any other software on my computer. Some blame goes to bad external. security software for the Mac.

Amazon called me with concern about the number of items that I return. I try to take the blame. But some items just don't work well. Amazon is a great company. Some products just aren't up to par.

I will order a name product and if I have the same problems I'll come back and make appropriate comments.

PROS:
1. Cheaper than the name brand products.
2. Good picture quality during the day or at night.

CONS:
1. No proper item details and specifications. The extension is around 8 feet and it includes a wall/stand mount so don't by accessories as suggested by Amazon or user comments which are ill advised and wrong.
2. Firmware is not up to date. The upgrade is not easy for a non-techy person.
3. Provided software doesn't work well. Can't monitor externally even though I have good bandwidth. IP locator crashes.
4. Incompatible with external monitoring software. In all fairness most of the issues could be with them.
5. Black color is cheaper but uglier (I should blame myself)
6. Amateur support video from Foscam website
7. Bad documentation. No good quick start guide.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Relatively easy to set up within your local WiFi and can be readily viewed from any computer or smart phone on the same network. But if you want to access it remotely through the internet, you will need to be comfortable with changing the administrative settings on your existing WiFi router to set up port forwarding. Instructions for doing this were actually pretty good, though.

Colors are not true but that doesn't bother me. The night time infrared is pretty awesome. You can also remotely capture and record stills and video through your computer or smartphone control panel. You can send sound to the unit via your PC microphone, or monitor sounds in the room with the camera's built in microphone. We use it for security and to monitor our pets when we are not at home.

All and all, I am pretty pleased with this unit. I ordered the unit in black, but I received white. Other than that little ordering problem, I think the camera is well worth it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera worked great for about 3.5 weeks then the camera out of the blue started panning around the room uncontrolled. It was another few weeks before my husband was back in town to try to fix it. He is a tier two electrical engineer that specializes in computers could not fix the issue. After reading other reviews, this is common and known problem by Foscam. We have tried all the "recommended" ways to fix this issue without any success.The only way to keep it from panning the room is to break the camera so it will stop moving.

We were about ready to purchase 7 more Foscams but extremely glad we did not or we would have really been out some serious money.

If someone comes up with a fix later that works for us, I will change my rating. But as of now, it feels like we held $80 above a flame and burned our money. What a waste.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I had to return this camera because it suffered from the same defect that a lot of previous reviewers had noted. In my case, if I point it outside, even with brightness turned down very low on the camera's settings, the camera's firmware crashes, making a manual reboot necessary and not capturing any images during that time. This is obviously a problem since that is precisely why I bought the camera, and I don't want to have to constantly worry that pointing it at the wrong kind of scene might cause it to malfunction (and what if I'm away from home and can't reboot it to "fix" the problem temporarily?). I had a similar problem with a D-Link camera that I bought, and I'm still looking for a suitable camera that doesn't have this problem. I thought I would be lucky with this one; I was not. It was also unable to connect to my WiFi (and I don't even have spaces or odd characters in my SSID or password), so I was stuck using Ethernet.

The small subset of this camera's features that I was able to explore seem in line with other cameras at similar pricepoints: optional recording on motion detecting, ability to e-mail images or upload to FTP server, and so on. Unfortunately, because of the major problem I just mentioned, I didn't get to test these features much. It also seems to be missing the ability to record actual video instead of a series of JPEGs, but that also seems pretty common with less expensive cameras like this.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Had to get a replacement, but it's now solid
review_body:
I purchased the FI8910W camera, and was very excited after I installed it. It worked very smoothly using a local Web browser on my laptop, and it worked very well using one of several Android apps remotely from my smartphone.

Unfortunately, it suffered from a known issue described elsewhere in these reviews: When the camera was pointed a a very bright scene, it would reboot causing it to go offline for a while, and then go through its initial "pan around everywhere" routine until it would finally settle at the first preset. I had it pointing at some dog crates near a bright window, so it would just continually reboot and reboot rendering it useless.

I contacted Foscam Support, and they quickly diagnosed the issue. The fix was to get a replacement camera. I was still within the Amazon return period, so I could return it for an exchange, otherwise I could get an RMA from Foscam directly and have them replace it. Given the number of occurrences of this issue here on Amazon, I had no guarantee that a replacement from Amazon would not have the same issue, so I opted for the RMA directly from Foscam since they assured me that the replacement would work properly.

I sent it back, and in about a week, I received a replacement. I installed it, and it now works reliably pointing to the same bright scene that caused the other camera to fail.

I'm giving it only 4 stars because the camera did have a known issue, and I did have to pay extra shipping to send it back for the RMA. But other than that, I have to give this camera very high marks. I highly recommend it, and if you have ANY problems, by all means contact Foscam Support--they are rock solid in resolving issues with their products.

review_headline: Great camera, but it's missing a very important feature!!!
review_body: This camera has a great price for the quality of video and audio. The main letdown is the control panel which varies from Explorer to Chrome to Mobile. Each one with less features than the other. However the big miss here is the patrol option. This camera will only let you patrol horizontally and/or vertically, but not to your presets. If you are not able to patrol through the preset spots then why even bother to let you set them??? The importance of presets is for you to choose exactly which places are you most interested in watching, so to let you select them but not patrol them is plainly nuts. Hope they figure this out soon and may fix this major let down. Has a much better experience with D-Link cameras software.

review_body:
Let me say that if you are a proficient network administrator, *maybe* you could get this to work. For the rest of us - including the day-to-day computer-savvy types who can normally download apps, install plug-ins, etc. - this thing doesn't work. Also, despite advertisement on the box to the contrary, this DOES NOT have two-way audio for Macs.

First, I tried the instructions. Got one step in, and they didn't work. To Foscam's credit, their customer service is 24/7, and they picked up relatively quickly (the first two times). Each time I called, we solved for the very next step. Hence, after three calls (the 3rd one was a ~25 minute wait), I got it to work, only by their tech support VPN'ing in (each of the 3 times) to my computer, installing and configuring plug-ins, including a plug-in (VLC) to *separately* operate the audio (1 way for the MAC, two ways for my android phone); audio never worked for the iPhone - maybe it could, but I was out of patience for a 4th call. I lost more than 4 hours of my Sunday to this piece of junk.

It worked for about 16 hours, then stopped for no apparent reason. I tried obvious things, such as re-booting it, re-booting my router, but I'm going to return this.

I'll get a regular baby monitor, and live without remote IP.

Bottom line: you (90+% of you) will not be able to get this to work without multiple calls to their Tech support line, and even then, it may also die.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've read a lot of the reviews for this product, and having owned it myself for over a month now, I felt compelled to say something, if only to debunk some of what is being discussed. The "most helpful critical reviewer" makes a very valid point, and if that problem is persisting then heed his advice, but it is one that many of the people who negatively reviewed this camera are not coming into contact with.

I purchased this camera for home security purposes and as far as I am concerned it performs flawlessly. The live feed, motion detection, infrared functionality, silent alarm system (as well as the SMTP mail server functionality), free DDNS service, and FTP upload all work as intended. The main reason that I'm docking a single star for this device is because the setup can be excruciating; a reboot of the device is required following every major change made to its function, and if you're enabling all of the above settings like I did, you'll be rebooting this device many times during setup. The device is also slow to connect to a wireless network - the instructions suggest waiting up to a minute for it to connect properly before attempting to access it - but once this waiting period is over it responds rapidly and as it should.

The main problem with this device seems to be the fact that its webUI is not very user friendly. This is true to some extent, but once you start meandering into the realm of do-it-yourself home security, some tech knowledge should be a given. Docking stars for an item too complicated for you to use seems somewhat foolish; the functionality still exists, but because the users here seem to be unable to delve into it they are saying it's a lousy product, which is untrue. This also applies for firmware upgrades. Yes you are required to upgrade two sets of firmware for this camera to get it to work as best it can, but this is no different than updating drivers on a computer hardware, or installing regular updates on aPC. As time goes by firmwares age and need to be replaced, this is a fact of the technology age we live in. I would be upset with a product that DIDN'T require you to update firmware out of the box, because this means, among other things, that they've likely stopped updating the firmware, and the functionality of the device is not being optimized.

I have also read reviews that complain about the DDNS service offered to you through the device, claiming that they felt it was unsafe. Registering a DDNS is not unsafe in and of itself, primarily because knowing about the DDNS does not give somebody access to your home network any more than knowing your IP address does. This is also ironic, because the DDNS functionality is probably one of the easier things about this camera to configure, yet the people here having difficulty configuring the camera were upset about its inclusion. However, accessing this camera via the provided DDNS is not the only way to do so remotely, because as anybody who has registered a DDNS knows, it simply reroutes a customized web address to your IP address. I use another DDNS that I already had registered to access my cameras, and simply leave the one that came included with the camera deactivated. All of the remote functionality is exactly the same.

I mean no offense to other reviewers, but I felt that my experience with the camera needed to be cataloged. If you are technology impaired, this might not be the camera for you as so many of these other reviews have experienced first hand. If, however, you are fully capable of managing your own home network and router via a webUI and understand the basics of port forwarding, I'm confident you'll be able to unravel the mystery that is the FOSCAM FI8910W, assuming their quality control issue has been reigned in (having not come across that issue myself, I can't comment on it here).

review_body: I bought this camera to keep an eye on my place when I'm away from home.  It does take a little knowledge of computer network setup to make a quick install but the installation guide that comes with it does a pretty good job of walking you through set up if you have never done it before.  I can now check in on my place from my iphone or ipad anytime. It also allows you to listen to the sound around it and speak through the camera if you have a fast enough connection when monitoring.  The software included takes a little to learn but works well once set up.  I would definitely recommend it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this camera for our alpaca building, so I could keep tabs on what goes on out there with our animals. Our building is probably 150-175 ft. from the house, so I liked the idea of wireless viewing AND the night vision. BUT...between the metal walls/roofing of our building and our router location (in our basement - for various reasons not easy to relocate), we could not get a strong enough signal (even with a range extender placed upstairs) to go wireless.

So we purchased 250 ft. of outdoor rated cat5 cable ($45 including shipping, which was less than the cost of the range extender I'd purchased, and later returned). We ran that out to the building (buried) and the camera works just fine. The night vision works well, the colors of day vision are true, and the sound carries easily. As far as I know, this is not an outdoor rated camera, but I have it up in the rafters, well under roof, so I'm hoping it will be fine. Time will tell. My husband keeps saying he wishes it had a zoom feature, and I agree. But for the price, I think it's a pretty good deal!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Makes baby sleep training and safety so much better!
review_body: Tired of being ambushed by what I thought was our sleeping baby, we installed this camera.  I wish we had gotten it ages ago!  Now I can see clearly if she is wide awake and ballistic, or just very noisily falling asleep.  Since getting this camera, there have been numerous naps and bedtimes which I would have interfered with based on the sounds from the monitor, but being able to see what she's doing has given her a chance to fall asleep on her own without me messing her up.  Makes me wonder if part of her sleeping troubles now are because I went in too often before she had a chance to get herself settled.  Also, good for safety as she rolls herself onto her tummy and gets stuck there and very mad.  Great for knowing when to go in and when to let her work herself out!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body:
I LOVE this thing. It was a bit complicated to set up. I recommend doing it BEFORE baby comes as you have no time to do anything once baby comes :) It links to my phone with the foscam app. I can see and hear whats happening and talk on it even when I'm away from the house. The only annoying thing is I can't get the audio to come up on my computer.
Highly recommend as a baby monitor. The night vision is super clear too.

I just purchased another one for my kitchen so I'm able to see who makes the mess while I'm gone. I also like the sound quality. And the fact that I can take a snapshot with my phone. The only thing I'm having trouble with right now is getting hookup with my ipad but that's not really a problem it's just that I need to update my ipad and things will work. Buy this camera you won't be disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Okay for monitoring by PC but doesn't work well by iPhone
review_body: I was optimistic about this product because it connected to my WiFi very easily and within a few minutes I was able to use the camera via my laptop. However, when I tried to then connect it to my iPhone, to be able to use the remote viewing capability -- wow! What a nightmare! First, when you try to access the Mac version of the instructions on the included DVD or on the website, that section has may things that refer to a Windows environment. Huh? The process of porting your iPhone to try and connect to this webcam is ridiculously difficult, and even after 35 minutes on the phone with the Foscam tech support person (who had to take control of my Mac temporarily), it didn't work. But that didn't stop the tech person from trying to convince me to go into Amazon while he waited, and give him a good review! I admire this person's spirit, but it came across as quite pushy, especially since he wasn't able to get the unit to work properly. It was very difficult to understand the Foscam tech support person, due to a very heavy non-English accent. I'm sorry but that's the fact, and it definitely made the process harder. So in summary, I ended up returning the unit because I can't afford to spend anymore time messing around with a device that was evidently launched ahead of it's time.

review_body:
Either I am missing something, or this is the worse designed IP camera I can think of.

I bought my Belkin Netcam, set it up, ran their software and was up in 10 minutes, able to see it from my iPhone, iPad and the net via a website.

Not this piece of crap. Oh, the camera is working well and I can see it on my WiFi network, but having to fight with my Cisco DPC3825 DOCSIS 3.0 Gateway, which is very typical of Cox network's, is enough to make me throw this thing against the wall. Why is a company so enlightened with their IP camera business making it so difficult. Why am I having to fool with some other company's hardware to get your hardware to work? Maybe I am missing something and if so, I apologize, but I'm going to take a baseball bat to something really soon.

review_headline: Edited: Foscam support has gone downhill
review_body:
I have purchased five of these, and originally I left a 5-star review for the products and the service.

Something has changed, now the service is terrible. I'm sorry, but not everyone is an expert at port-forwarding and dynamic IP addresses, and five different people there refused to help me. Originally, someone there was excellent (his name was Calvin), but everyone else there has been terrible. As a result, I have five cameras I can no longer use. So... unless you are an expert at networking or know someone who is, you may want to reconsider this product. Not because the product isn't excellent (because it is), but because you won't be able to figure out how to use it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works great, at a cheap price.
review_body: I purchased this to monitor my dog when he was sick, and I was away from home.  This little camera works great.  I was able to monitor my dog via my iPhone over 4G cell network using Safari or Google Chrome.  Connect the camera via a network cable to configure the WiFi setup, then you never need the cable again.  Has built in infrared lights that work great in the dark (black and white picture).  Over 4G using the controls to move up/down, left/right do not work really well (network is too slow), but there is a button that allows you do an automatic left/right complete scan.  That is what I normally use, so I can scan the whole room with the touch of one button.  For the price, this is a great camera.

review_body: Anyone giving this less than 4 stars must not understand computers.  These are the easiest cameras I have ever worked with.  The picture could be better but that's why they cost so little.  Those people giving this a negative review need to open their wallets and buy the better version.  You get what you pay for and these are perfect for home monitoring.  My company makes security software for corporations so I know what I'm lacking about.  If you are looking for a home monitoring  system to watch your house while your away, your baby in their crib or wondering what your dog is up to while your at work this is the camera for you.  If you want to monitor your house to be able to read the license plate of passing cars spend more money on the megapixel foscam and you will be all set.  These cameras are easy to set up, easy to monitor on an iPhone, iPad, computer or any android device.  Anyone saying anything different either has a broken camera, which of course could happen, no company is perfect or just doesn't understand how to set it up and needs to RTFM or watchtower he videos which couldn't be any easier to follow!!!!!!

review_body: I use this as a video baby monitor and it is much cheaper than an actual video baby monitor and the plus is I can look at it on my iPhone/ipad through an app. The picture is very clear as well. The only downside is the set up was beyond my capabilities, HOWEVER, their tech support is AWESOME! They just remote in and get it taken care of without me having to do much of anything. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, great price, great customer service
review_body: I bought this IP camera to keep an eye on my dogs. Just curious to see what they are up to during the day while I'm at work.  I wasn't able to set the camera up myself, but I called the 24/7 Foscam customer service and the technician, Ralph, did an awesome job.  He was able to log in remotely to my computer and set up the camera for me while I watched. The whole process took maybe 15 minutes.  The only weird thing with him logging in remotely was that he asked me to login to amazon so that he could write this review himself...I really don't think it's a good policy to write your own review. Other than that, the camera works great with the $6 Foscam iPhone app, and I'm able to check in on my dogs at any time.  I like the camera so much I just ordered a second to cover a different part of my house!

review_body: I have only had this a few days, and so far I think it is a great cam with a lot of features, especially for the money. I am fairly (at best) tech savvy, but needed some help in setting up some of the more advanced features. I found the Foscam tech support to be helpful and responsive after an acceptable phone wait. I needed to call more than once and the two techs I spoke to , (Thomas and Marshall) were both very helpful, and were able to get everything up and running for me.

review_body:
I was really worry while thinking about the configuration process, I have some tech knowledge but not a lot and some reviews scared the hell out of me. Took the risk and bought it. Configuration process for the camera itself (network and then wireless settings) was a piece of cake, open the port from the router to see the camera from internet caused me some pain. It was not that easy but I'm sure you can find some good videos in youtube like I did.

Camera works fine and no reboots so far. It is really a foscam IP camera and not a knock off product. It also has a foscam DDNS number/configuration so you don't have to pay Dyn DNS.

I must say that I've never had any problem while buying directly from Amazon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This was given to me as a gift for the baby room.  The picture is good, the night vision clarity is acceptable, and the sound is decent.  I like that I can check on the baby from anywhere on my phone, too.  Also, you can take a screenshot (or video clip) on your phone or laptop of something that is being seen on the camera.  Setup is a bit tricky but the tech support is very thorough and thoughtful.  Thomas helped me configure my new modem/router this time and he was extremely helpful.  I've called once or twice in the past and the wait time was about 20 minutes each time but once I was connected, the person on the line was always very knowledgeable and professional.  This is better than the so-called baby-cams on the market for a much better price.  I can't speak about the tech support on the competition but Foscam's is impressive.  On a side note, I believe this was the brand of camera used to catch the home invader that assaulted that woman in her home in NJ a few months ago.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam 8910w a great product for little money.
review_body: I bought this camera from the great reviews and let me tell you they were correct. I watched a few videos on YouTube so setup was a snap. I use the Foscam App on my iPhone and iPad and it works great too. I work in IT so port forwarding and setting up a domain address was something I have seen before though never done myself till now. Turns out it was very easy with my Asus router.    This is a great camera. Highly recommend you buy one. My only complaint would be the alert pictures it sends by email are way to slow to capture anyone that moves past the camera and doesn't sit in front of it.    Update 10-30-2014  I now have three of these cameras. The all work flawlessly and I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a good quality IP camera. I do not understand all the posts on it rebooting and having poor wireless range. I suspect most of the issues with jerkiness and loss of network connection are caused by cheap routers not the camera.

I wanted to have the two way audio to scold my dog if he was doing something he wasn't supposed to but it doesn't work. The picture quality is great though.

review_body: Only have had this camera since the beginning of February. This camera was easy to setup. I did have to play with the wireless settings due to my network in my house doesn’t broadcast. I didn’t purchase the additional antenna cause I wanted to try it with my router and it works flawlessly.  It really opened my eyes as to what is capable of these cameras and I will be adding more. I do wish you could adj exposure etc. I will update after a few months.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam F18910w Impressive Little IP Camera
review_body: I bought the camera to use as part of a security system for my home.  The instruction booklet was concise yet provided everything needed in simple and direct instruction to get the camera installed on my wireless home network.  Being able to view the camera over the internet was trickier.  After trying the instructions and methods in the instruction booklet I was still not able to access the camera from my 3G cell phone service.  I called tech support and was pleasantly surprised that the wait time to speak with someone (Michelle) was less than 15 minutes.  Michelle had me download an app that allowed her to reset the configuration from her computer and I was up and running in 20 minutes.  Although this camera is new, it appears to be well made and for a security camera has a great picture and features like recording, audio, snapshot that I would expect to find in much more expensive cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: you most likely will not be able to view this remotely
review_body: This is the first review that I have put on Amazon, and I am only doing it now to warn everyone out there.  Foscam does not tell you that you are only able to use remote access if you have a static IP address.  If your residential ISP only offers a dynamic WAN IP address, you will have to subscribe to a DDNS service to provide you a fixed host and domain name.  The booklet offered two companies and both required an annual subscription.  This was not disclosed in any of the descriptions that I read here on Amazon for this product.  It will be going back.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have two of these. I bought the 2nd after I got the first. I have them in my garage and in another house that is usually vacant in another town. I can check on that house and swing the camera around to see the thermostat setting to make sure the heat is ok there. I must admit they were both hard to setup on the internet and I am pretty computer savvy. Luckily you can call their customer service and a tech will log onto your computer (you give permission) and adjust the setting for you, it takes them about 5-10 min and then it works. Love it !!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: OK As Long As you Use Internet Explorer
review_body:
I was excited to get my new Foscam FI8910W wireless camera. Upon opening the box I was pleased with the look and feel of the hardware. I plugged it in and was able to successfully configure the network interfaces. The picture was OK and perfectly acceptable considering that it is VGA resolution with a CMOS image sensor. If the software was a nice as the hardware (again...considering the price for the hardware comment) I would have rated the camera 5 stars. The problem came when I tried to really use the camera with my browser of choice (Firefox).

I found the camera to work acceptably well with Internet Explorer. The web interface for IE uses ActiveX for displaying the video. It was pretty snappy and the video was OK. When I tried the "server push" interface which is intended for use with other browsers the camera "bombed" Even though the computer and camera were plugged into the same 100MB network switch the user interface kept freezing up. I tried this with multiple computers including a 3ghz quad core windows 7 box but the results were the same. Sometimes when panning stopped the image would retain motion blur from the last frame sent (I think that they use MJPG downloads for video). The "killer problem" with this device is that after a short period of use, the video stops working all together and there is an icon of a "broken document with an X " where the video should be. Once this happens the device has to be rebooted to get it to work again. I tried it on several computers with the same results so the problem was definitely with the camera.

I contacted Foscam support and their technician logged onto my computer remotely and when I showed her the problem she said that the only way to fix it was to run the camera at 320X240 resolution or to use internet explorer.

I really wish that this had worked out for me because I still like the camera design and ergonomics. Sadly, I just boxed it up and returned it because I don't, won't, and can't run Internet explorer. Furthermore even if I could run IE I can't count on everyone who will onto this camera to do the same.

So...if you are the sole user of the device and always use internet explorer I could recommend this camera. Otherwise, don't buy it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Works great and easy setup.

1) Do NOT install the software on the CD.
2) Connect the camera by Cat-5 wire to your router.
3) Login to your router (via browser) and find the IP address assigned to your camera.
4) Login to the camera at that IP address (via browser) and IMMEDIATELY turn OFF the DHCP.
5) Give your camera a fixed IP address on your network and fill in the subnet mask with what you normally use.
6) The Gateway and DNS fields should normally be the IP address of your router.
7) Fill in the SSID, encryption type, and share key used by your wireless network.
8) Pick a 4 digit number to use for the HTTP port number. (I have no idea what "Network Lamp" is so I left it checked.)
9) Disconnect the Cat-5 cable and re-boot the camera.
10) Re-login to the camera at the new fixed IP address to verify that everything's working.
11) Login to your router and set a port-forwarding entry to map to the fixed IP address and HTTP port you gave your camera.
12) Use the "What's My IP" site to find your outside IP address.
13) Enter your outside IP address and HTTP port number into a browser and verify that you can get into the camera from outside your house.
14) You're done.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works well for indoor use, terrible for outdoor daytime use.
review_body:
I purchased this despite the very well documented issue with complex scenes, hoping that I'd receive a working version.

After first setting it up the evening I received the camera I was pleased to see it working well inside my home and excited to test the night-vision via the infrared LED illumination. Over-night the camera worked well and I had a new-found insight into the nocturnal life of our cat (bathing, sleeping, occasionally running like crazy).

The next morning, before work, I setup the camera to point out of a front window as I wanted to monitor the mailbox and various deliveries throughout the day. Once at work I connected to the camera to see what was going and was confused to find that I'd get a few frames of video and then lose connection. I initially blamed this on my phone and the WiFi signal at the office, as when I got home in the evening the camera was working perfectly again.

It wasn't until the next day that I was able to observe the camera first-hand running during daylight. When the camera was facing the interior of the house it worked fine, but as soon as it was panned to point out the window it would immediately freeze. I was able to easily repeat this by holding the camera and manually pointing it out the window. Every time the bushes and grass came into shot the camera would freeze displaying a black frame. If the camera was quickly pointed away from the window it would recover and start streaming video, and once pointed back outside it would immediately lock up again.

The only way I was able to operate the camera while pointing out of the front-window was to reduce the resolution down from 640x480 to 320x240. Once the resolution was reduced the camera worked perfectly, but the resolution was now so low it was impossible to identify anyone via the footage.

When not freezing due to complex scenes the camera and it's PTZ mechanism worked well. When pointed out the window it failed dramatically.

This camera didn't work for my intended use, I've now re-purposed it for use monitoring the interior of our home during the day and night. In this role it works perfectly.

All-in-all this camera works well if you play to it's strengths.

PROs:

- Cheap
- Wireless
- Pan-Tilt-Zoom functionality
- Two-way audio

CONs:

- Completely freezes and reboots when displaying complex scenes
- Quite noisy image
- MJPEG is a horribly inefficient compression method which uses way more bandwidth than needed.

The only reason I gave this three stars instead of less is that when running inside the home it works as expected.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have 4 of these cameras plus one 9821W and one 8905W outdoor and a 9804W outdoor on order. Three of the 8910's are outside under an eve and I have not had any problems after changing to a longer range router. I had a good dual band router but one camera kept loosing signal and rebooting. The camera worked perfect closer to the router so after replacing the router I have not had any problems. I am using Blue Iris software instead of the built-in software. I set up all cameras with fixed IP addresses and unique ports, and all are connected to surge protected power sources. Easy setup using the IP Camera tool software that comes with the camera. I have satelite internet and DynDns service to connect remotely to the Blue Iris web server on my computer with excellent results. The audio works good from the camera to the computer and iPhone but have not tried it the other direction. Great price, great features, and reliable so far. I have only been using these for a few weeks at home but several have been in use at work for two years with very few issues which were limited to earlier versions. I recommend this camera to anyone interested in setting up their own cameras without a larger investment.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

Not sure how anyone with little to no experience in computers/technology could do this. Once set up though I love it. I got an app for a couple dollars to make it easier and quicker to check in on my home. I recommend with caution and a suggestion of making sure you have HOURS to deal with this. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: WARNING - DO NOT PURCHASE FOR VIEWING OUTDOOR OR ACTIVE SCENES
review_body: I have been an Amazon customer for many years and I don't think I've ever written a product review.  I am compelled to write one for this product as it is a piece of crap plain and simple and my hope is that if you have a project similar to mine (bird watching, pool area monitoring, etc.) you will be spared the frustration and stress of trying to make this camera work.  I just now read a review that tells me exactly why I see the problems I have been dealing with for weeks: bad firmware that places the camera firmware/hardware in an unknown state during which you'll pull out your hair trying to figure out what it's doing.  Black screens, frequent resets, etc.  Now certainly one could say "well you bought an indoor camera for an outdoor application" but it should not matter if the camera in in a weather tight housing (heat not an issue, at least not yet).  Wireless or wired ( I tested it in every possible configuration), the results are the same .... too much going on in the scene and the camera firmware goes belly up.  I've never tried to return anything to Amazon as I've been satisfied with all of my other purchases.  This is WORTH the hassle of boxing it all back up and taking time to ship it back.  I'm going to try and complete my project with another brand of IP camera, however I'm done with FOSCAM mostly because of the company's apparent lack of integrity: you just don't continue to manufacture and ship products with known defects like this.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The latest model (FI8910W) is easy to install and connect to the home network. Just use the installation disc that comes with it. If you hate reading instruction manuals like I do, instructional videos by \\"AwkwardHamster\\" on YouTube will help tremendously--he provides excellent step-by-step instructions that even the ordinary tech noob can follow successfully. I got mine up and running, and connected to my network as well as my iPhone & iPad in less than 30 mins (it helps if you watch the videos ahead of time).

Also, for iPhone/iPad users, I highly recommend downloading \\"FoscamPro\\" (a paid app). It is THE BEST app to use for this unit (not owned / affiliated by/with same company). Comes with audio support that normally is a paid in-app service when you get the free IP cam apps. A breeze to use!

I bought my first foscam last Thursday and received it the following day! Ultrafast shipping! I'm so happy with its performance that I just ordered my second one today, and can't wait to set it up!

Two thumbs way up!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love this thing i use it all the time i put it in different locations around the house it was hard to set up but once it got running it was awesome

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Cameras are okay BUT service and support are HORRIBLE
review_body:
I have ordered 8 of these particular cameras and 1 Foscam FI8919W Wireless Outdoor and my feedback/review here is based on my TOTAL experience with a) the cameras b) Amazon, and c) Foscam

I'll start out by saying that I bought the Foscam cameras based on the reviews that I found on Amazon; I have not tried any other cameras so I can't really compare against other manufacturers. Based on this, I feel that the cameras are of good quality for the price you can get them for here on Amazon. I have seen the same cameras priced much higher elsewhere, so I'm glad I bought my F18910W's on amazon.com.

The cameras come with a disk that installs a couple of different software utilities ... one of which is: Foscam IP Camera - I spent well over 2 hours trying to get this software to work and finally emailed support - they were absolutely no help at all and told me I should use Blue Iris software (which is a $49.00 program that they sell). The Foscam IP Camera software does not even come with any documentation or help files. After trying to find anything of relevance on the forums and YouTube, etc. ... I gave up and purchased the Blue Iris software (more on that on my Blue Iris review).

I did have a hardware problem with one out of the nine cameras and Amazon took care of this immediately upon receiving my email regarding the problem. I LOVE amazon.com ... they never fail to take care of any issues i have with anything.

Now let me give you a little advice; don't make the same mistake that I made ... I was using one of the Foscam FI8910W to monitor my front yard/street. Because it was not an outdoor camera i had it inside just pointed out the window. Well, at night the IR (infrared) lights reflect off the window and the view is awful (extremely distorted). So I decided I would order the FI8919W outdoor camera. HERE'S WHERE I MADE MY MISTAKE ... I was given a coupon code that gave me a 10% off discount if i ordered the camera from the foscam.ca site, which I did, and I saved $16.50 off of the $165.00 price. WHAT A MISTAKE that was ... ordering from the Foscam.ca site. I checked the status of the order every day and it kept showing 'Processing' ... after a week I phoned them and was told the camera had already shipped and i should be getting tracking info shortly. Another day went by ... same thing ... phoned them and was told the camera shipped but still no tracking info. Then I emailed them and was told that the camera had not shipped and it was backordered. I told them I was furious at being mislead and to cancel my order. Within a half hour I received confirmation that they 'had just shipped' the order. I told them I needed this camera days ago and to expedite it ... they said 'too late' can't do anything about it now. O.M.GAAAAWD!!!! What a horrible company. I only wish I would have ordered this camera directly from amazon.com as I would have received it within two days (I ordered it on Jan 29th and according to the tracking it will not be here until Feb 13th). I am so disgusted with this company that I will never deal with them directly again ... and I wish i could find a comparable product just so I don't have to support their company again in the future. Their tech support is horrible, their user guides are non-existent, and they intentionally mislead me.

So in the end, let me say ... the cameras are okay; amazon.com is awesome as always; foscam.ca is the most unprofessional company I've ever dealt with. In the end, if you buy their cameras you might want to check out their configuration videos at:
foscam.us and search for mjpeg-setup-videos

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: UPDATE: Still using this almost two years later, and still no problems. One thing I did notice that sometimes my ISP will change my IP address periodically. While this will not affect local viewing from your network, you will need to change your "away" viewing by changing your IP address to correspond to your home router on your device or computer (eg, whatever IP camera apps you might use). This literally takes a minute or two, and you'll be able to see your camera again. Still will recommend, especially now that there's a $30 price drop from when I putchased it.  If you aren't using the camera as a wireless and strictly on your home network, you can "plug and play" and use the camera out of the box. However, if you are using this as a wireless IP camera that has a good picture and sound, it is definitely worth going through the port-forwarding setup. I don't consider myself tech savvy, but as intimidating as getting online and wireless sounds, it's not difficult. You will need to do your research (like being able to access the software inside your router, which can be found using Google-Fu), and follow the manual. Have patience, and it shouldn't take more than 20-30 minutes, even at a slow pace.  One thing that you need to remember once you set the camera up is that you'll have two ways to access it. From your home network, you'll use your local IP address, and while you're out, you need to use your internet IP address.  There are a lot of ways to get frustrated, but relax, and you'll get through it.  Once it's hooked up, the camera itself is very clear and has a microphone built-in, so you can listen while monitoring. It also has inputs and outputs for a microphone and speakers, so you can also talk through the camera to people that are in the room. I use IP Cam Viewer Lite, and I can listen and talk through my iPhone. I hooked up a small speaker to the camera so I can "speak" to it. Sometimes the audio may cut in and out, but that dependsmostly on your connection to the internet from your viewing device.  I haven't used the email alerts for motion-detection, so I can't comment on that. Bur for the money this was a great buy, and I would buy another one when I need to. I've had the camera connected for about 7 months now and it still works just as well as when I purchased it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: This is not a network ip camera
review_body: For the money the video is pretty good for 640 by 480. Pretty good night vision I thought also. However they advertise this as a Network Ip Camera but after talking to my Tech guy as to why I cannot add this camera to my IP recording software I already have is he told me this is actually a web camera not a true Network ip camera. He said if the only way you can view camera is with a web browser that it is simply a web camera. Shame on company for advertising as a Network IP camera. If all you want is a camera to Pan and Tilt and view from internet it is a great camera. Remember it is NOT a Network IP camera and is limited to what a web camera can do.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: After reading few reviewers who were complaining about poor customer service and were doubtful about reviewers praising the customer service reps, I nearly decided not to buy this camera because I know I will need their service. I’m satisfied with the camera so far after using it for five weeks. I call customer service to help with the setup after I was having few issues setting it up. I realized latter that following instructions in the small manual that came with the camera is more helpful than reading all the reviews giving different ways to set it up especially if you are using Verizon wireless router. I called customer service and spoke with Michelle Smith. I’m adding her name to the review because I realized other reviewers were right in commending the reps for dedication to customers. She remote onto my computer and setup everything in less than five minutes. I call customer service again one week later after I bought a new computer with bigger memory so I can have a dedicated computer to record videos from the camera. The cam was recording but I could not find the videos on the computer. Another rep helped me and in all cases the wait time was less than 4 minutes. I’m rating this camera 4 stars because it has no zoom features. Its however worth the money.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Beware the buggy Web UI and the potential security issues.  The camera itself seems pretty solid, but because of current and past issues with the Web UI (e.g., the ability to bypass authentication in previous versions), I recommend not making your camera publicly accessible (i.e., don't use port forwarding on your router to allow direct access from the Internet).  I personally use the SSH tunneling feature of JuiceSSH on my Android device to connect to it.  This requires more set up and probably isn't something that the average user is going to be able to easily accomplish, but, again, please be cautious about allowing direct access to devices like this from the Internet, especially if it is in your home.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This little camera is amazing for the price! Got it hooked up and working via wired ethernet using the instructions it came with. I took off a star because instructions on how to set it up on Wifi (wireless) were hard to find and did not come included. However, a short youtube video and a google search pointed me in the right direction and I finally got it working with wifi. Love this thing and for 50 bucks it simply can't be beat.

Pros:
Email alarm alerts
Motion sensor
Sound sensor
Intercom mode (if you have some words to say to the crooks...or if you just like messing with your wife or pets : ) )
Night vision
wireless
PT

Cons:
Horrible setup instructions for wireless
Only decent app available for iPhone was $5.99 (Foscam Pro)
Had to setup a no-ip account (not necessary but helpful in maintenance)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera works well, setup took some work.
review_body: Once I got it set up, this camera is awesome!  Can check on my dogs anytime by using iphone or ipad apps or on any computer using the ip address and port for the camera.  Just know that for someone who is a complete tech novice, you will probably end up calling customer service for help at some point.  Basically there are 2 steps in set up: 1) get the camera on your wifi, and 2) set up port forwarding so you can view the camera's feed when you are not at home.  I followed all the steps in the manual to get the camera set up on my network, but I still couldn't get it to work wirelessly.  I called customer service and within a few minutes they had that working for me.  Getting the port forwarding to work was tougher.  Since I have a router from my cable company I had to use the IP address on the side of the router to access the router settings, and through some digging online I figured out how to set up port forwarding for the camera through the router.  I finally figured out that to view the camera using apps or using web browsers when not at home that I have to use my home IP address followed by the port number that I set up for the camera. Now everything is great.  I can even turn on the mic in my iphone app and talk through the camera when I'm not home, or turn on the audio and hear what's going on!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good quality camera very hard to set-up
review_body: I bought this camera after returning the summer infant wifi camera. The picture quality and panning ability of this camera is fantastic! The reason I'm giving this camera 4 stars is because it can take a whole day to set-up and configure the camera. I think you have to be technically savvy to get this camera going.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I love IP Cams. Great for home security, etc. Baby viewing. Many uses. Be aware that if you intend to view these IP Cams remotely (iPhone, smart phone, remote internet connection) that you do need to know how to port forward from your WiFi router. Not a huge big deal & can be done easily, but with security of the connection in mind - MAKE SURE you do it right. Instructions are in broken english so they can be challenging. However if you, or a friend, has some knowledge of your WiFi internal settings, you can do it. There are a few good YouTube vid's on setting these up. They are better than the instructions. Also good tips on the FOSCAM site. You you've never tried them, you HAVE to get a few of these IP Cams. So much fun viewing what is going on an a few rooms of your home when you are away.

However I'm not sure the HD cam's are worth the extra cost or bandwidth/response time remotely. I also bought the higher priced FI9821W V2 2-pack and they work well. I'm not sure they work ENOUGH better to make the trip, but they are HD and that seems like a must have right?

This low def version has acceptable quality and IR operates about the same as HD models. Not quite as wide angle as the HD cams. In anything but perfect light the HD cams don't really come into their own. Often where you choose to place the cam, you have less than perfect light.

I'm glad I have the 2-pack, but don't automatically shy away from these lower def ones. They are pretty capable. Software available is good. Tried them all. Steer clear of the FOSCAM smart phone app. You may find it in the App Store, but I don't think even FOSCAM recommends it. It doesn't operate all the controls of the newer IP cams, and somewhat limited on the older ones too. I ended up with LiveCam Pro and find it just what I was looking for in an iPhone app.

I've only had them a few weeks, so I don't know if they will hold up. We'll see. I like what I have so far and am tickled pink Ipulled the trigger and bought these.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Thx for you help Calvin! You were patient and took care of all my questions promptly :) Hope to not need support again but if I do I am confident I'll be taken care of.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Image quality is "meh" over wired connection, and a bit worse on wireless no matter how close it is to the access point. Night cam works fine and movement is pretty quiet but the cam can't serve up video at its full resolution and audio at the same time without stuttering - at least not over wireless. I haven't tested it wired with audio.

The firmware download is a needless pain in the neck where you have to give them your email address and then - I kid you not - they email you links to the individual firmware files. As far as I can tell you will have to re-hit the registration link every time you want to check to see if there is a new version. Would not recommend this to anyone that wants audio or a reasonable UI.
