product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The directions and video say different things on the set-up. I consider myself pretty computer-savy, but the directions were confusing. After spending a few hours trying to set it up, I called Foscam. I had a difficult time the first 2 times I called (was on hold for 30 minutes, then they hung up on me). The 3rd time I called, someone was able to set up the wireless remotely but his directions were different than what was listed in the booklet.  However, the 8090 port was blocked on my internet. I called my internet service and was not able to get the port opened. I spent several more hours browsing the internet to try and unblock this port without success. I finally gave up and am returning the camera. The set-up should not require this much time and effort.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Customer, Good Camera, Poor Distance
review_body: Kate in customer service (very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful), walked us through the wireless set up.  The resolution and movement is nice.  The wireless distance leaves a bit to be desired.  Advertised 300 feet; however, we moved camera under 100 feet and had issues with reception. I love the camera and customer service, but the jury is still out as to whether it performs more than 50' from the modem, even with the large antenna.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Awesome - check your qos, and watch YouTube.
review_body:
Giving a 5 star rating because the product exceeded my expectations, which is tough, being an it professional for 16 years.

For those debating purchasing an IP cam, or are not satisfied with its quality after setting it up, make sure you have as good as a network setup as you can afford. When it comes to IP video, most of the time, it's not the hardware, rather the qos of the network fueling the hardware.

For corporate video conferencing, good qos means high end routers, gigabit switch ports, dedicated high bandwidth comm circuits, video/voice traffic isolation, and even data compression. All of this costing at least 1k per month, depending on the level desired and budget.

Now, Since these options aren't typically available for the home, we're limited to what our Internet service providers offer. Mostly being that of increased Internet bandwidth. For optimum, it's 'ultra', and for fios, it's 'quantum'. For me, for just an extra $6 per month, my Internet speed service was essentially doubled, which is a no brainier. Also look into static ip services, and higher end modems or routers if offered by your ISP.

I also keep my IP cam hard wired, which contributes to higher connectivity stability and performance. When wireless, there are several new things to consider for qos, so be weary of problems specific to the IP cam's wireless connectivity vs. hard wired.

For those having issues even getting it up and running, or for those who want to research instalation steps before your IP cam even arives, which is what I did, search for your ip cam model in YouTube. You will find several videos that walk you through the initial setup for local viewing and separate videos for advanced setup for remote viewing on your wireless devices.

Just some general notes:
Make sure you have installed the latest firmware before settin up remote access.
Heavily password protect your ipcam and router before settinup remote access.
Setup the IP cam with a static ip address(i.e. don't let it use DHCP settin.
Don't setup the ip cam on port 80, use a different port.
Inbound audio works very well., but for baby monitoring, I will depend upon a separate audio specific monitor for when I'm sleeping.
Feedback is received if a remote device plays back inbound audio when near the IP cam. Which is expected. Move the remote device away from the IP cam mic.
Viewing concurrency works well (I.e. multiple remote viewers at the same time.). I tested two.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Calvin was very helpful during my problem. I would recommend this camera to others.  The video quality is awesome.  Great!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is an amazing gadget. I just wish it were simpler to configure and that there were better software tools to make use of it, particularly from mobile or hand-held devices.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have a bit of networking and programming experience so I just tossed the instructions aside when I opened the box. Everything network-wise follows common standards, and it only took a minute to get up and running. If/when setting up static IP addresses keep in mind there are two different MAC addresses, one for the ethernet connection, and another for WiFi.

Video performance has been best via the Foscam Android application for us. Followed by Internet Explorer on the laptops/desktops. It's usable, but frustrating in other browsers compared to the performance in IE and more so the phones/tablets.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good camera.  Not the best quality image, but very easy to set up.  I have recommended these cameras to friends.

review_headline: Piece of Crap With No Real Technical Support!
review_body:
I have used two other network cameras from 2 other companies. Both are much clearer to view and much easier to use. I called tech support for assistance. I was told 22 minute wait time and number 15 in line. When it got down to one minute and 3rd in line it began to reverse until I was told 3rd in line with a 25 MINUTE WAIT TIME!!!
I called from another phone and THE EXACT SAME THING HAPPENED!!!
I am not kidding! I don't believe they even have a tech support!
I am returning it and going with one of the other 2 network camera companies I currently use.
Beware!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Love the Camera - Good tech support for Novice users
review_body:
This is my first Wifi Camera. I was a novice when it came to Port Forwarding & DDNS. But it only took a little while and some help from Foscam tech support to get everything working.
It is important to also have a good Router on your home network to make the camera work seamlessly.
Some router (like Asus) even provide DDNS service for free so if your ISP provides dynamic IP you have no problem.
Love the 'Foscam IP Viewer' for my phone as well (Make sure to get the one by Foscam). Important: Change the default from HD Definition to Standard definition in the App - otherwise it will not connect to this camera and will just time out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy setup.....works great as a baby cam
review_body:
Good:
I'm moderately tech savy and the setup was super easy.
I did not install any software at all. The cameras were configured through their own web interface in about 15 minutes. I spent another 10 minutes configuring static IP addresses through my router.
When I was ready to access them away from home network I spent another 10 minutes configuring my router and the camera's for port forwarding.
I found all instructions on the internet--most of them on Foscam's site.
I ran Ethernet cable, but the wireless performance has been so good that I never bothered hooking it up.
I mostly monitor with FoscamPro on my iphone--it supports 2 way audio, pan+tilt etc.
I also run an XBMC HTPC (RaspMC) and setup streaming to the TV (*.strm)--so I can check on the kids through the TV, my iphone, any computer web browser etc.

These replaced a broken baby cam, that was more expensive and totally inferior.
I work a lot and it's great to "check-in" on my little ones from anywhere anytime.
I have 2, and will buy 2 more in the near future.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice cameras and simpler operation - but ...
review_body:
The camera hardware and built in software are above average for cameras in the price range.
After testing the built in software I don't really need the additional software from Blue Iris, but the camera listing did not make it clear that the built in software already had most of the same functions. The functions//features from Blue Iris are just better and handle more cameras simultaneously.
Now for my MAJOR gripe. There are bugs in the built in software / firmware. The manual is abysmal! The mistakes are glaring and it required 2.5 hours of trail and error configuring, hard resets and testing to get it to work. Two and a half hours I will never get back, but it was the level of aggravation it caused that is burned into my memory especially when this could have been simply fixed by QA testing and proper documentation.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: If you've purchased the FI9821W, don't purchase this item, it was a let down. Aside from the obvious differences in resolution and MJPG v H.264 this is a real problem child. Yes, it can run at at a high 20~30 fps (max setting), but good luck getting it to work at the optimized state. It reboots itself CONSTANTLY when I'm viewing it remotely (yes I've read that you can reduce framerate but A) REALLY should I have to reduce the quality of what the advertised framerate is? and B) The remote app I use doesn't allow for framerate adjustment at the app/camera level). I initially returned the first one I purchased thinking it was defective because of the constant reboots, but nope after a bit more research it's a terrible product defect that the manufacturer is well aware of and hasn't fixed. Before you assume I haven't done my homework, yes I have the latest firmware, UI, etc. But it just really isn't a great product. I would recommend purchasing the FI9821W BUT then Foscam still wins because you purchase their more expensive product. Anyway you cut this, don't purchase the FI8910W.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Just recieving my FIRST of any kind of webcam/security cam. My first thoughts is that the camera is really nice, clean look! however I spent the first two hours trying to figure out how to install my self and find the camera IP address...Then another hour on the phone with tech support.
About an hour or so we finally diagnosed the camera to have bad hardware from the factory. So, my first camera will be returned and hopefully camera two wont have this or any other issue.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I volunteer for a small, shoestring-budget dog rescue that is spread out across 4 buildings and 2 acres of land. I bought a couple of these cameras so that our rescue director can keep an eye on the puppy building and the kennel room while she's working on her computer, arranging adoptions. It gives her peace of mind to be able to watch over the dogs during off-hours. For $65 with Amazon Prime free shipping, this was something that I could afford to buy as a donation and the rescue is making excellent use of them.

I installed \\"IP Camera Viewer 2\\" on her Mac, from the Mac App Store - and \\"Foscam Viewer\\" on her iPad. Both apps were free and work great (although the Mac app doesn't support audio from this camera, it's still a great free app).

I did review the lengthy negative app regarding issues some users have had with the camera. I take reports like this with a grain of salt - First, it's an inexpensive camera - I don't expect MILSPEC hardware, and I'm willing to make a gamble at this price, as compared to other IP cameras that cost a LOT more. Second, working in the customer support industry I know a lot of minor issues can get blown WAY out of proportion by a small group of vocal on-line users. Third, I am comfortable & confident with Amazon's return policy.

I've had zero problems with the cameras, working great for a week so far but I'll update the review if I find any significant issues.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:

Sometime when trying to connect to the camera via IP address webpage, it won't connect unless you turn on/off the camera.
Because this camera has some connection issue, I don't trust it can be a reliable camera to keep.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice camera but not for the faint hearted
review_body: I bought three F18910W cameras.  As others have said, it is not a 1-2-3 set up.  But I weighed my options of going for the $199 Dropcam, which I bought my daughter and hers was easy to setup or saving $130 and going for the Foscam.  Since I needed three of them, I figured I would save $390 and besides, I like learning new things with tech so I decided to go for this one.    Some differences of Drop Cam and Foscam.  1. Drop Cam easy to set up vs. Foscam - let's just say its challenging  2. Drop Cam is smaller and does not rotate - Foscam not only rotates around the whole room but when you access the camera from  your iPhone, just by touching the video and swiping your finger you can move the camera remotely.  3. Drop Cam is set up from their website.  My daughter just popped the CD in and it took her directly to the website to finish setting up her cameras.  - Foscam runs off a CD.  Now this is where some information would help for those who are trying to set this camera up.    Setup -  The setup instructions say to plug the camera in power then the router.  Did this but had trouble opening the exe file and having it pick up the camera. Once it finally did pick up the camera it shows you the IP address of your camera. ex: HTTP://192.168.1.25 and then I sat there wondering what to do since the setup instructions shows a picture of an interface popping open.  This did not happen.  Called Foscam and was told my wait was 25 minutes.  While waiting I figured I would try to type this address into a browser.  At first it only worked in I.E but then I got it opened in Firefox.  Once in there you can change the camera name and your password.  Then I was told to change ports so there is no conflicts.  Now I am working on the alerts.  When I go to set up the Alerts and click on the choice to have motion detection and press submit , I come up with \\"400 Bad Request Can't parse request\\"  I am still working on this problem and will update this review when I figure out what that problem is.    Now let's look at the software.  You will have to update the firmware first then the software second.  I am using an iPhone 4 and an iPad 2 for the software.  I downloaded both the free programs they have and both of them work fine on the iPhone but not so consistent on the iPad. I have iOS 6.1.3 on both.  Not sure if it's because I have little room left on the iPad and more on the iPhone but there is more inconsistency on the iPad. I will be upgrading to iOS 7 with more storage so I will update this review.    ------------------------------  Update 1/29/14    Called Foscam for support twice.  Both times the service was very professional and polite.  The first one, definitely from India was very hard to understand but he had the patience to stay with me an hour on the phone.  I allowed him to take control of my computer and he also could not get my camera to set the alarms.  He asked if he could do it from his computer and I gave him permission.  He was able to set the alarm from his computer so he said it was definitely something on my computer.  So then I had to get the other cameras programmed to send me email alerts and after disabling all my antivirus software and K-9 patrol, it still didn't work.  Then found out that in order to set the alarms, you have to click on the \\"Schedule\\" and then click on \\"set All\\" then it worked.  So I am not sure if it was a combination of things or if just this one thing made the difference.    I had updated my firmware and software but this support person said they just release another update a couple days ago.  This seemed to make a difference.  I was able to use the ipCamera.exe file then click on the camera's IP address and the browser did open.    I noticed that other posters stated that the support person makes you sign onto Amazon to rate them.  Well, this is how they work.  After you get done with the problem the support person must be instructed to ask where you bought the camera.  If you say Amazon and they are still in control of your PC, they literally try to sign onto Amazon for you and lead you through the process. I notice he went directly to my browser and typed in Amazon then attempted to go to the review site.  Since I do not have Amazon sign on automatically he asked me to sign on.  I politely and firmly told him that I would do it when I had time.  So saying all that, and without any pressure from any support person, I would still give this camera a 4-star rating for both the camera and the support they gave me.    The second camera couldn't be seen on my network so I called Foscam support and it took him about 5 minutes to figure out what was wrong.  Wait time was not as long as I had feared.  Embarrassingly, I typed in the wrong password to my router.  Of course, I thought it was right but I must have left something out.  This is just a note in case someone else doesn't see their camera on the network and they think that the password is correct.    The third camera wouldn't even start.  Again the support person took control of my PC and attempted to get the camera going by restarting and resetting it.  Nothing happened.  He immediately said to return the camera and they would replace it.  So I am working on that now. BTW, this one asked to rate them on Amazon and I told him I would do it later and he just let it go.  Never tried to sign onto Amazon for me.    Foscam gives clear pics in the dark and clear pictures in the light.  I love being able to remotely move the camera around from my phone and I would recommend this camera.  I think that Foscam must have read the reviews and are making great strides in trying to upgrade consumers experiences.  _________________  Update 1/30/14    One camera was defective.  I had a choice to return it direct to Foscam but I would have to pay the shipping since I did not purchase it from their site or return it to Amazon.  I am returning it and asking for a replacement because I am very pleased with the other two camera's.Just a note on the software:  I found the free Foscam software to work just fine with my camera's.  There was a suggestion to try the Foscam Blue Iris Pro.  If you want to try that software you can download a trial version off CNet. [...].

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A lot of positives - but I sent it back
review_body:
I had high hopes for this camera. My cats have been doing a whole lot of things they shouldn't be, and I was hoping to do a little sleuthing to suss out the culprit(s). This did not turn out to be the camera for the job.

On the positive side, the build quality seems good, at least externally. Unpacking and setup was reasonably straightforward, and within half an hour I had established a WiFi connection to the camera and was viewing images. The image quality is excellent, even using the night vision. I had no doubt that if I could catch one of my felines in the act, I'd have no trouble discerning which one it was.

For a few hours, things went well. I was using a freeware program to record snippets of video whenever the camera detected motion. However, I noticed about 6 hours in that the recordings had stopped. On troubleshooting, I discovered that the camera was no longer on my WiFi network.

Figuring that maybe it was too far from the router (although it was only about 20' away, max), I repositioned the camera just on the other side of a wall from the router. The total distance was less than 5', with only one thickness of wall between them. Even at this distance, the camera dropped off the network again after 3 hours. The only way I could revive it was to power-cycle it. After three days of this, it's gotten to where it will only connect intermittently, even after doing the unplug/plug shuffle.

Either there's a problem with the antenna or the internals. Either way, if you're willing to lay wires, you'll probably like this camera. I was not willing.

review_headline: Best value for a Pan Tilt wireless camera when used with the BI software
review_body:
For less than $66 with prime, this is a no brainer. I have replaced all my wireless cams with foscams, and I've had a few, Panasonics BL 131CA, Linksys, Astek Moles, . At that price point, you can't beat the quality and features. I have put them outside under eaves they are so affordable. The mobile app is nice they as they have upgraded the UI and it looks cleaner. The two way audio is a neat feature and works pretty good, I talk o my kids at home because they are not allowed to pick up the home phone. the web interface is basic and has some alerting features although I don't use them. I use the Blue Iris software.When paired with the BI software to centralize and manage alerts / recordings, it's invaluable.

Check out my review. here of the Blue Iris software.
http://www.amazon.com/review/R1UJP9315C03RT/ref=cm_cr_dp_title?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B008YD80KC&nodeID=541966&store=pc

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It does the job, great features for the price.
review_body:
You'll see three main themes when reading these reviews:

1) You need to be an IT professional to set this thing up!
2) There's a firmware flaw and Foscam will not honor the warranty.
3) Works great and (insert random American name) at support was great and used remote access to get me up and running.

I have two of these now and setup is not difficult, as long as you have general understanding of networking and how to access the settings of your wireless router. This camera is not for the technology averse. Do not buy this if you don't know what Port Forwarding/DDNS/WAN/LAN/etc are.

I have no doubt there is an issue with these cameras involving sensor overload. I have also not experienced these issues with my setup. They are not pointed outside, or at a window. These are installed in interior rooms as baby monitors and work great for that purpose. I've got two of these cameras for $130 total and use smartphones with a 3rd party app to access them. Similar cameras marketed as "Baby Monitors" will run you at least $200 for one camera and a handheld unit.

Many of these reviews are likely bogus/incentivized, especially the ones who talk about people like "Irish" etc. from Foscam using remote access to setup everything.

These are not HD cameras. The picture in a lighted room is pretty good, night vision can get a little blurry, but still does the job. Pan/Tilt work really well on LAN, can be a laggy on WAN, but that's to be expected.

Bottom line, I'm happy with what I have for the money.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, even better features, only drawback is set-up and software...
review_body:
I've had this little camera for quite a bit now, I bought it primarily to keep an eye on firearms and check in at home while I'm away, an addition to my home security and alarm systems.

The camera itself is pretty great, great value, and the features work exactly as you expect for them to.
Well, the talk and listen feature was not what I thought, but it still works in its own way (you can only listen OR talk, cant do both, think of a walkie-talkie type function)
The camera resolution is pretty good, and motion detection and IR work fine, the remote movement with phone apps lags a bit, as does the video (this kinda varies with each app) but it was anticipated so there's really no negative remarks there.

So as you might imagine, the only thing left to complain about is the software and the pain that it CAN be to set up.
Really, if you skip the "oh this seems simple, how hard can port forwarding be, even though I've never done it..." mind set, and actually call the good folks at Foscam, you can have this little bugger set up and goin in no time.

If you however, decide to try this yourself, and have never messed with your router settings and things of that sort, I recommend you reconsider, and have a tech remote access your computer and help you out.

The software Foscam comes with and requires you to use, even some of the Foscam apps, seem lacking, not very intuitive, and sometimes defeat the purpose of having these cameras.
A simple function, like On/Off push notifications for motion detection is missing, and even some the PAID apps don't have it.

But really, third party apps and software kinda make up this slip up, and you still have the rock solid hardware that really makes for a sweet working little IP Cam.

All in all, I'm more than likely to buy another couple of these and really set up an nice indoor IP surveillance system with these Foscams. I'd recommend them.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Returned two of these--reboots if pointed at bright window
review_body: I wish I had read Mr. Reberry's comments (see Jonathan E Reberry on July 14, 2013) before buying one of these. Since I didn't, I ended up rediscovering that the camera reboots--or shows blank video--periodically. Thinking it was a defective unit, I return the first one and got a replacement. Same problem. I spent an hour or more with tech support--and read Mr. Reberry's comments while on hold. These cameras are very limited in what they will tolerate. I let Foscam tech support control mine remotely, and they confirmed that the scene from the window was too detailed for the camera, so it failed. Their solution was to reset the image size to that of a large postage stamp, and slow the pan and zoom controls. This "solution'' was entirely worthless to me--I couldn't see what was being monitored. They recommended that I upgrade to the FI8919W, but I see the Mr. Reberry says it probably has the same problem. I'm going to look for a different brand. Foscam seems to use its customers as beta testers without telling them.

once it's up and running it's amazing!!! you can get an app on your phone (i like the FosCam Pro, like $7 or something) and you can do anything, record, speak into the camera, listen in, pan and tilt remotely and so on.

i'm using this to watch my dog when i'm at work and it's given me a peace of mind to see that he's not stressed when i'm gone and to see what he does. i got to watch him destroy my slippers))))) and i'mable to tell him to stop and watch him freak out now knowing where it's coming from.

anyway, an amazing cam
also, i haven't used it but there's a setiing to get notified when there's movement.
quality is good, even with no light. when no light it's black and white but you can see everything.

i'm pleasanlty surprised, i thought for the price it'd be a piece of junk. it's not.

review_headline: Bad security / Flawed reset / Horrible support
review_body:
Tried to reset camera after someone appeared to remotely access it and not able to log in anymore. After trying several times called support and was greeted with a message that sounds great but never actually routes you to a person. I actually called at least 6 different times and the counter goes up instead of down.

How can I be the 7th caller on the line if I started the call as the 4th caller? This tells me that they really don't want to answer my call. Now this is bad enough but if you hold for long enough you get kicked out of the call. When you call back in you get a message telling you that all switches are busy or something like that.

So does the camera work yes it does. The reason for the one rating is the hacking, bad reset switch, and horrible support. The horrible support is really what drives it to a one start rating. I would actually give it a worse rating if I could.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera for the price, be a great baby monitor and has other capabilities!
review_body:
Bottom line: Yes, I would recommend it. For inside the home viewing while your phone or tablet is connected to your wireless network (as a baby monitor for example) it is a piece of cake! It isn't 100% plug and play for viewing while you are outside of your wireless network, but it is definitely doable so read more below.

Why I bought it: I bought this camera as a supplement to my home alarm system. Essentially, if I get a call from the alarm company, I'd like the ability to pull up my cameras and see if anything looks out of place or God forbid, someone is in the home. I am currently using it to check in on a dog we are fostering for a local rescue! I have also used to to check our basement for any leaks/signs of water during very cold temperatures. The possibilities are endless. I am receiving another one from Amazon today.

The good: $65-ish camera that has pretty good image quality, night vision, and can be viewed from almost anywhere. Free (or cheap) apps allow you to check in on your home or child with relative ease. The mount that comes with it is not bad at all and no other components are required for a basic installation.

The not-as-good: I'm a fairly tech-savvy guy, but my weakness is network settings, router configuration and port forwarding. That is required to set up this camera for viewing it from outside your wireless network. Now, do not let that discourage you, because there are some great youtube videos by Foscam themselves and a guy that goes by AwkwardHamster on how to do this. Also, buying from Amazon you have tech support from Foscam if you need it.

Overall, great camera so far. I've had it since Christmas and use it multiple times per day. I plan to continue to add more cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: After three months of usage - I can't recommend it
review_body:
Product sounds promising, but there are several issues I ran into that are showstoppers:

1) Reboots. Unti seems to lose internet connection and/or reboot often, it then goes into search mode. This issue is pointed out in a lot of the reviews. The search mode "wandering" can be overcome by setting a position on start up, but that brings up the next issue.

2) Night vision. There is now way to turn off night vision permanently. You can turn it off, but the default is set to "on" when the unit reboots, which is often. Why is this an issue? I used the camera for keeping an eye on the yard via an inside window - so the night vision coming on would create a glare and render the unit useless. Emails to support (which were responded to quickly) revealed that they can't fix this issue, so beware if you have thoughts of using it to monitor your yard via a window at night.

3) Bad JPEGs. Unit is now creating pictures that are unreadable on my mac and iPhone. This happens about 20% of the time.

I wish the unit worked for me, but unfortunately I cannot recommend it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Was going to buy one until.....
review_body: I was seriously considering getting this Foscam camera. But then I read the reviews. I have decided against this purchase because in certain circumstances the camera will quit working, and their customer service sucks. I can wait, until things improve!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have been using this camera for a month. Feel like it is more for fun or casual use. I can't really count it as a security camera.

Things I like:
1) Does what a very basic security camera does, including remote access, motion trigger, email/ftp upload;
2) Cheap

Things I dislike:
1) ~20% of the time, it generates unreadable jpeg.
2) Not very reliable motion alarm. I set the sensitivity pretty high, but still it loses some frames during the motion (by loses I mean the captured images are supposed to be emailed or uploaded)
3) The image quality/resolution is too low (I know this is not specific for this camera), it only captures 640x480, You can't really use a 640x480 image to tell anything. Today even the cheapest phone takes better picture than that;
4) Some settings are not preserved after reboot. Each time after reboot, I have to manually re-adjust its angle, lights etc.

Overall, if you are looking for a security camera, move on, look for something better.

UPDATE: after a few more weeks of using, I decided to further downgrade it to 1 star.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We use this to monitor our baby's room. It is great. It works very well with our IPad "Baby Monitor HD" app and for our Android the TinyCam Monitor Pro. It has been very dependable. We did hard wire it in to our network using a Solwise ethernet over powerlines setup. I didn't want a Wifi transmission so close to our son. That has been very stable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buyer Beware - Buy another product instead
review_body:
BIG BIG BIG. FOSCAM claims that they have a DNS server built into this cam. What they don't tell you is that it does not actually activate till 2016. What kind of weirdness is that? Tenvis has a a built in DNS that works out of the box when you port-forward. Which you have to do for any IP Cam you wish to access outside of your home for those that don't know what a port-forward is.

To be sure I was getting the better device I order 2 of this Foscam Wireless Cams Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and 1 TENVIS JPT3815W Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring as well. I can tell you from real-world experience, you want to go with the Tenvis one.

Yes the manual looks better on the Foscam but my God it is a lot easier to setup the Tenvis than this Foscam. I bought these to place outdoors in a Foscam outdoor dome and I could barely connect to either FOSCAM cams. Tenvis connects all the time, changing or setting up WIFI on the Tenvis in the advanced view is "Simple Stupid" if you have a laptop or phone and you have connected to wifi you will know what to do it with the Tenvis. It's is called an IP CAM for a reason. Most people buying want the option to view these cams remotely or at the very least set them up on their WIFI network with ease.

The Tenvis has a better UI - User Interface for actually viewing the cam than the FOSCAM, once again simple stupid. People that buy loads of IP Cams do not need bloatware or GIGs of software just to access their cam FOSCAM ships a big CD with loads of software but that does not justify the price and the crappy device.

Initialization: When you send power to a device and the time it takes that device to power-up and be ready for action. FOSCAM slow, one of the 2 FOSCAM cams I got took sometimes over 5 mins just to get discovered on the network after it's rotations

As far as specs go. They are identical in terms of features Tenvis more so with the actual working DNS server that lets you view your cam from outside your network without paying for a third-party DNS.

I am ending this review with this, I am actually returning both FOSCAM cams and getting 4 Tenvis cameras for my house. At $20 cheaper per unit as well.

I hope my review helps whoever reading make the right decision on these FOSCAM cams. They are pretty crappy compared to their competition.

Cheers...

The best they can offer is to download a \\"shareware\\" VLC to get audio. It s*cks! there is a 1-8 second lag for voice even when both camera and mac are within my local network, and you need to open one stream for VLC and one for the Foscam monitor.

How hard is it for a company to add in Mac Audio support? When they do, I will bump it to a 5 star.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great for keeping an eye on your pets!
review_body:
My friend has 5 cats and has 4 of these cameras installed throughout his home. He uses his iphone and ipad to check in on them. I thought this was a genius idea, so I bought one to try out. The only reason this product gets four stars instead of five is because installation can be tricky. I got about 80% through the installation and then had to call my friend who is an IT specialist. He was able to walk me through the rest of the process. This camera is pretty sweet. The smartphone app lets you control (pan/tilt) the camera, turn the infrared lights on/off and even listen and speak through a two-way microphone. I can now check on my pets (and, more importantly, my home) from anywhere throughout my workday with the click of an app. Warning: it can be a little addictive. I just ordered another camera to place in another part of my home for more coverage.

One piece of advice: If you have a limited data plan, the streaming video eats up data like Pac-Man. So, if you are planning to set your ipad/iphone up like a permanent security monitor, make sure it is connected to a wi-fi network.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Wont record video to FTP Site
review_body:
OK so this camera has quite a bit of functionality for the price. Watch the you tube videos and read the manual before you open the box. The set up isn't really that bad. Port Forwarding is actually pretty simple. Took me about 1.5 hours to get it all working using an ASUS RT-N66U Router and a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0.

For the ASUS RT-N66U just go to WAN/Virtual Server-Port Forwarding. Enable port forwarding to \\"yes\\". Leave the Famous Server List, Famous Game List, and FTP server Port unchanged. . Specify the port you enterred on the camera in Port Range and Local Port, Find the camera in the Local IP dropdown and select it, hit the + button, then be sure to hit the \\"Apply\\" button, The router will process and reset and then you are all set.

The RT-N66U can also be used as an FTP Server to save your \\"still\\" images following a motion alarm.

But, with that said, however, this camera has one huge limitation.......The camera will not push out a video file to an FTP Site upon motion alarm, with all COMPUTERS OFF.

Upon motion detection alarm, the camera will:
1) Send an email with still pictures attached, Computer on or off
2) Save 60 seconds of video file (.avi format) to a local hard drive \\"on your computer\\" as long as the computer is TURNED ON and you are logged into the camera via Microsoft Internet Explorer or a 3rd party software (Blue Iris, ispy, etc)
3) Save still pictures (.jpg format) to a FTP site at a user specified interval. Computer on or off.

If you want the 60 seconds (or better yet duration selectable) of video file to save to an FTP site, with the computer TURNED OFF, when the motion detection alarm is triggered, no cigar! I would give this camera 5 stars if it could do that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent product, you save 100's by doing port mapping yourself, instead of expensive ipcams.
review_body: I have tried many ipcams, the most expensive ones I found were only expensive because they basically build expensive software that does port mapping for u. Well, if you have a 14 year old son, nephew, neighbor etc, that can follow step by step instructions for port mapping, you will realize it is an awesome product. Obviously, you have to have a dedicated computer, tablet, or phone, to run an application that will capture video, as this product doesn't have a hard, drive. Dvr, or sd card. People that have written bad reviews probably didn't know that this is like a tv with no TiVo, u can watch all you want, but the camera needs something to store the data. They do offer a newer model with sd, but for the price, might as well use an old laptop with an upgraded hard drive. Discard the disc, download the latest software from foscam.us, keeping in mind that this only modifies the network, and so on data on the camera itself, and they offer a very basic web app that allows you to view and control some features. But you can get software or apps that have way more options like speed it up (about 4 times faster). Youtube people, if you don't know how to do anything, use YouTube, more than knowledge, the key now days is knowing how to ask the right question.

That is, they need to make a one button setup cam and show all the iPhone carrying people what they're missing. My system is the envy of all my friends who have aging parents.. As of now, they are the camera of tinkerers.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Ok...I tried to ask my questions in the Q&A section but it exceeds the number of characters allowed so I'm hoping I might get some help via reviews.

I ordered two of these cameras as a Christmas present on excellent recommendations from a techie friend who said they were easy to set up. I am now aware how inferior my tech knowledge is after trying to make these cameras work for a few hours last night.

Here is a rundown of the basics.

2x FOSCAM FI8910W cameras
Verizon FIOS home internet, wireless
Mac OSX Mavericks
iOS7 - iPhones and iPads

I purchased the cameras via Amazon.com from Warehouse Deals, Inc. and they were listed as refurbished (so used but back to new). One of the cameras did not come with any instructions or the software CD - bad customer service on the part of Warehouse Deals, Inc?

Last night we tried to set up the camera using the iPhone app. That did not work so we plugged the cameras into the router and tried to connect that way. We both have new mac laptops so we no longer have a CD Drive in our house so we could not run the software from the CD included in the camera boxes. I tried downloaded the IP Camera software from the FOSCAM site and it was able to pick up the "Anonymous" camera on the network and take me to the IP page to start ActiveX. Once I clicked on ActiveX, though, I could never get the "Device Management" portion to work (I would click on it and nothing would happen; "Javascript:administrator()" would appear in the lower left of the browser window. I used Chrome, Firefox, and Safari and had the same results for all three. Cookies are enabled in all of the browsers. Internet Explorer is no longer supported by Apple so that is not an option for us.

After these tries, we went back to the iPhone app. The app would sporadically 'find' the camera but settings could never be updated. It would drop the camera then find it again. And we would get an error notification that the user name and password were not correct OR we exceeded the number of devices on our network. We checked the devices on our network and that was not the problem.

We gave up in frustration at 1am last night having made NO progress or having any luck at all in making the cameras work. The cameras would cycle through its motions but we never got a picture from it in any way.

This morning we discovered through the iPhone app that each camera has an odd user name that we did not set up. Now we are curious if this means that our refurbished items were never restored to factory default and we don't have the old user name/password so we can't login because of that...?

For the price and capabilities, we want to keep these cameras and get them set up...I just need some help from the interwebs to step me through the process like I've never touched a computer before.

Thanks!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Wonderful for the money. Ordered another camera. Would highly recommend for the quality and ease of operation. Can order in white and black.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Image quality is bad, view angle is narrow,
Access from outside the home is impossible no matter what you.
I tried everything, Dynamic DNS, opening ports and forwarding protocols, .. everything.
I can see it in the same LAN but once you get out of the house ... just forget about it.

USELESS camera, be away.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: great even in low light. set up for external monitoring is a bit of a pain but it works pretty good

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I gave it four stars because it performs very well for its price. I previously used a very similar Trendnet camera for several years. Before that a Panasonic. I mount them outside (against instructions, of course) in the heat (Phoenix) but under the patio roof. The extreme temps may shorten the cameras' lives but they work fine for years.
The Foscam's color is better than the Trendnet so now my backyard tree leaves look green in sunlight, rather than gray. Still gray, of course, in infrared light. The infrared illumination and imaging works very well on this camera. The mounting hardware is improved. But putting the "working" light on the back of the camera makes it useless once the camera is installed overhead.
I use the free Foscam domain address for internet access and that has been trouble-free. Now that I have a smart phone I particularly enjoy the ability to check on my house anytime, anywhere. I have the camera send me regular photos via email. The photo "motion triggering" has not worked as well for me as the Trendnet did. I have to investigate that further.
I really like this camera but advise anyone who isn't knowledgeable about wireless setups (IPs, etc.) that you may need help with installation. Or maybe some time on the phone with the Foscam people - I didn't call them but others online claim they're very helpful. Absolutely use a fixed IP address on your intranet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: awsome tec help they did all the work for me
review_body: Bradley helped me a lot getting my new camra set u. it is now working really well and I love it

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I am really impressed with the capabilities of the camera both in day light and night, after my first attempt to install the camera with included software and instructions was unsuccessful i contact FOSCAM technical support. Bradley logged into by computer configured both of my wireless routers and then proceeded to walk me thru the install of both of my cameras. He also helped my with downloading the Ipad and Android applications for remote wireless access. If if were not for Bradley i would have returned the camera and gave up. Thanks for such great support. Ed

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This product is incredibly unreliable. When it functions properly it does everything as advertised but unfortunately seems to have a glitch every few weeks prompting another (or multiple) time consuming call(s) to Foscam. I've tried to be patient for 6 months now, but the latest crash is the last straw. At this point, $99/year for dropcam cloud storage is a small price compared to the hours of wasted time spent troubleshooting. Do not buy this camera, it is a giant time suck and one of the most aggravating piece of electronics I have ever owned.

As a side note, at the end of a number of troubleshooting sessions, Foscam tech support have insisted that I login to Amazon.com and leave a positive review which leads me to be skeptical of the high number of 5 star reviews.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam 8910W PT IP camera. NO zoom
review_body:
received through my prime account on time. Got it out of the box and installed immediately.
Just followed steps according to manual, very easy set up.
Got confused when doing Foscam app on my smartphone, finally decided to call their tech support and bingo they guided me through. They went remotely into software and got all done.
Their techs know what to do. Tech's name was " Geese ".

Very satisfied. Can't go wrong for the price for a indoor IP camera like this one.

I will purchase 2 more soon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this because I didn't want to spend alot on a network camera till I learned more. This is a good learning tool. Within three days an IP address from Taiwan had hacked in and accessed the camera. The NSA isn't alone in spying. You need to upgrade the firmwire immediately and lock down your router's firewall. Don't give this camera any access to the internet unless you need to view remotely. I used port forwarding on the router and got it to work remotely. The motion alerts worked.  I got it to send pic to e-mail though it wouldn't work with my ISP's SMTP server. I got it to FTP pics to a local server. I got the camera to work with zoneminder software fairly well. The camera will lockup if there is too much motion with a bright detailed view like a bright sunny day. I guess this is really an indoor camera. I can find a use for this camera, but I'll be buying something better to monitor activity around the house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great remote camera, we use it all the time to keep on eye on our house and pets when away.  My only complaint is viewing the camera remotely with my MAC and getting the audio and mic to work.  It works great on our IOS devices, but does not function (audio and mic, video works fine on the MAC - to be clear) on the MAX OS X Mavericks (lots of internet chatter about this failure of the product on the Web).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This was a Christmas gift for my son and has come in handy already to watch the activities of his 2 greyhounds while he is at work. I think I need one now. Happy New Year!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body:
I love this one. It can be daunting to set up. But dont worry, you can do it.

I can now watch the cat, and my house, from anywhere in the world.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is wonderful, I've been looking for a security camera for my home so I can look from my iphone anywhere I go for free and this fits my budget. There are many security cameras out there but you have to pay a monthly fee to access your camera on the go, this one once set up it's amazing.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It's good and it's one of the best
review_body: It's good and it's one of the best, easy to handle and, it has good resolution and good pictures. However it does not detect voices very well

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not much of a security camera
review_body:
I bought this on a groupon about a year and a half ago to be used as a security camera in attempt to aid in the capture of any intruder that may come into my home.

Pros:
-Can pan and tilt using software.
-Infra-red nighttime pictures.
-Takes pictures when motion is detected and uploads them to my FTP site...with caveats that outweigh this Pro.
-Support experience was acceptable.

Cons:
-For some reason I had to change the wifi radio channel on my router to get this to work on my wifi. No idea at all why that mattered, but it did help.
-Dangerous to set up port forwarding to the camera as passwords are sent in plaintext. I didn't do so for this reason, which means I can only watch a live video feed when I'm already in my house.
-Needs to be rebooted once every 1-2 months, then the pan/tilt needs to be reset manually using the software.
-The automatically uploaded pictures to an FTP site is a great idea, but I'd have like to had seen a way to set it to automatically delete pictures older than X days or something like that. I had to delve into the world of cron jobs to set up a job to do this for me so my FTP site doesn't fill up.
-There's no real happy-medium for the motion sensing sensitivity. If i have it on a 7, it doesn't sense me walking by until too late. If I have it on a 8, I get 100s of pictures with no one in them on my FTP. So, I'm stuck with the 100s of pictures with no one in them.
-Motion-detected pictures cannot be cached on the camera. What this means is that I cannot set the camera to take pictures after motion is detected more than once a second, as the first picture has to be fully uploaded to the FTP site before the next picture can be taken. I think it fully logs out/in to the FTP with every picture upload, so it can take a full second for the full process to occur. This means walking towards the camera for about 20', then around a bend and up my stairs results in a single picture of me walking towards the camera (albeit only about 50% of the time due to motion sensitivity issues), one of me making the turn, and one of my back as I walk up the stairs.
-The picture quality is not good when used as described above. I'd liken it to the stereotypical picture of bigfoot. If I stand there and stare at the camera it's a good picture. When moving around as any intruder would, the motion blur is horrible, even with the "motion compensation" setting turned on.
-Cannot do motion-sensed videos and then upload them.

So, considering those cons, this camera just isn't very useful as a security camera. I'd estimate if a burglar came into my house, I'd have a 50/50 shot of getting a picture at all of the front of them as they walk up/down the stairs. Even then, I'd give it another 50/50 shot that the picture would be clear enough to be at all useful in apprehending them.

I'm most likely going to buy a Dropcam HD and pay the $99 annual fee to record everything in HD. This will solve all of these issues.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera works great following Foscam tech support
review_body: I had some difficulty connecting the camera to my network and spoke with John at the Foscam tech support desk.  John was able to resolve my issues and I was up and running (Thanks John!).  The camera is now in position and running well.  The camera movement is easily controlled and the picture quality is beyond what I would have expected for the price.  I have yet to get the audio working using my Firefox browser, but feel I can tackle getting the add-in on my own.  Overall, I recommend this product as a good value.  One word of caution, it does require some computer skill to access a home modem/router to configure, but I assume all cameras would have this similar issue.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is great.  The price was very reasonable for the features this has.  The only issues I've had with it are the audio feature.  I haven't been able to get it to work with my Mac.  The program keeps telling me I'm missing a plug-in which I've downloaded several times with no luck.  It's probably just a setting issue that I need to research further but I wouldn't say that part is plug n play.  I do love that I can check on my house from my phone.  It does work with IOS and Android.  Overall I'm very happy with my purchase.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love this camera!! I use it to check on my Grandchildren when they are sleeping or in another room from me. It could be a clearer picture but it does a good job. You can even take a snapshot from your phone and share it. You may even be able to take a video. I need to read up on that. You can pay $2.99 a year for audio, but you get one minute free without a subsciption. You can monitor your house also, when your not home! I wont be without these cameras!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bought this camera just to keep an eye on the house she we are away. In response to all of the reviews stating the set up difficulty, do not worry!!!! When you buy from a Foscam authorized dealer, you get free support. I called and the customer service rep Andrew was most helpful, remoted into my PC and within 1/2 hour I was connected, had wifi working and was able to view on my phone and tablet!!! The support offered was wonderful and I took full advantage of it.
Camera picture quality is about what I expected, good not great. Very easy to pan and see an entire room. The buttons are very self explanatory for operating the camera on your pc or tablet. I am pleased with my purchase and if the only thing holding you back from buying is the fear of set up, don't worry....just call the tech support and they will do it for you!!!! I did attempt on my own but had some issues with one part that prevented me from seeing anything on my pc.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: setup is a bit tricky if you're not IT savey and have never interfaced with your router or a DDNS before. But YouTube videos walk you through everything you need to know. Setup took me about 30 minutes and it works great. Take some time and adjust the sensitivity of the motion sensor alarm or you will get about 100 emails an hour if you don't schedule your away time on the device management page. Overall very satisfied. Will be purchasing another for my apartment out of state.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Awesome little cameras here. You can set them up to send pictures of what's going on to your email or an FTP server. Since they have motion detection, you will only receive them when something moves on screen.

I'd like to comment on an annoying little problem with this feature though. The motion detection is very, very sensitive. Even moving light across the screen, like when a cloud passes by, triggers the motion detection, so if you have it set up for email, you will be swamped with these emails in no time.

I set it up to send pics to an ftp folder on a Raspberry pi, there are methods to record video/audio using one but I haven't had time to fiddle with that yet.

There are Android apps and I'm assuming iOS apps as well, which you can use to see and move the cameras remotely. They have support for dynamic dns services like no-ip, so make sure to read a little about that and basic networking before diving head first into setting up these cameras for remote access.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've owned my two Foscam cameras for over a year now. I absolutely love them. They are the most affordable cameras with pan/tilt technology you will find. My best advice if you're trying to set one up is simply call the toll free 24/7 help line and they will walk you through each step of the process. It took 5 minutes to do and I've not had any problems since. I can check the house at work or on vacation...any time day or night and I don't have to pay a monthly monitoring service. And the sound and motion sensors just add to the product value. I highly recommend this camera system!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Cameras with DSP Problem Still Sold
review_body:
Returned our third FI8910w camera with the DSP defect detailed in the other review. Bought from Amazon. Latest firmware does nothing to fix the problem. We have four other 8910s and five 8918s purchased before the defect was introduced early 2013, they're good cameras for the price.

Come on Amazon, send the defects back to Foscam and start shipping the fixed ones. This is simply wasting everyone's time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I picked up two of the cameras to monitor my new puppy for fun. I got one from Amazon and the other directly from Foxcam (they had a sweet one day deal). I'm pretty savvy with the technical network stuff and had no problems. I made of couple of simple mistakes along the way during setup, but figured out where I went wrong pretty quickly. I found the written instructions (read them after I had everything working) were very clear and would be useful to someone without much technical skill.

I set my camera up for remote monitoring. To do so you do need to be ready to log into your home router and make some configuration additions (1) create static IP's and (2) assign port numbers to those IP's. Remote monitoring works surprisingly well. I hard wired one camera directly to my router, its too far from the wireless router to get a consisten signal. The second camera I connected wirelessly. There are no performance differences. If you have a good enough wireless signal, that's the way to go.

The camera image is clear and the colors seem reasonably accurate. One camera is mounted inside monitoring the inside, the other under a large eave monitoring the outside. The eave is big enough that the camera won't get wet. So far its working fine even though its and inside camera.

I did experience the famous buffer overflow / endless reboot problem. My outside camera is aimed at trees with high detail. Its the high detail that blows up the camera. I contacted Foxcam and they now have a software fix. Foxcam RMA's my camera and within less than two weeks I had the camera back and now it works perfectly. Problem solved. I recommend the camera's for simple monitoring.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Service by Calvin at Foscam customer service
review_body: Calvin at foscam fixed my connection problem right away-nice job! My app for my Iphone was not working and he connected remotely and fixed the problem and knew exactly what to...very easy for someone not tech savy as myself.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
calvin was very helpful in getting my camera software installed. couldnt have done it with out him.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: If you're running windows 8.1 the software will not work and Foscam support will tell you that the camera management software is having technical issues (bull****) and they suggest you use the browser access.  I bought the camera for the ability to tilt / pan and for the camera software that Foscam claimed it came with, if i wanted basic camera features i would have stayed with the two linksys cameras i had before. After speaking to the support tech who wanted to access my pc remotely to make it all work,  i was imformed that if i wanted i could purchase Foscam Blue Iris professional security cam software.  Really!!! Not happy with the advertising that Foscam gave this camera... they were just better off selling the camera with no software at all. If i cant get it to work i will be returning it and never buying another Foscam product again

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: My husband had the idea to buy one of these as a baby monitor and it was a great decision. It was easy to set up and works perfectly in our son's room. We can see him from our computers or our phones at any time. The quality of the picture is excellent, even in the dark, and it picks up sound very well. I'm so glad we bought one of these instead of an actual baby monitor and we can use it after we're through with it as a baby monitor as a security camera for our house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Had the camera for over 6 months. The image is great, we really appreciate the ability to access it from anywhere in the world.

I recently experienced a problem when I changed my network's password. I did not think of the camera and lost access.... I called Foscam's customer service, and Marshall was able to access my computer via a software called "team viewer". He proceeded to reset my camera and re configure it to my network.
Outstanding support when I needed it!
Highly recommend this amazing product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Product works great and wish I had bought more. and I will do so in the future. If any issues there are videos on youtube. BUY

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Picture is not good. Adapter is faulty. Usps didn't deliver.
review_body:
I got it from amazon and usps did not deliver. Package got lost and they made me drive 2 hours for pick up locations. Still nothing. Anyway. I contacted amazon and they resend another one and this time I got it. Just remember:

USPS DOES NOT HAVE REDELIVERY OPTION. I talked to the USPS delivery guys and all of them said, redelivery is a lie and they NEVER redeliver. You might consider paying few more bucks and get it via different carrier.

Anyway. I got it and installed. Works well with no problems after I re-soldered the adapter socket and replace the charger. Unit itself works but adapter and female socket were faulty. I didn't want to waste my time and ask for reship.

Pros: Cheap. Does what they claim. Every feature that company claims exist and you can do lots of things. Best thing no-ip DDNS that comes as default option.

Cons: Adapter is broken. Quality is bad. Like old time cellphone cameras. 10 feet, you are not gonna tell whom you are looking at. Sluggish.
Also I needed update the firmwares and had many problems with GUI (web interface). After downgrading the firmware I managed to make it work properly.

Ask questions, I will be able to answer here.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very nice camera, great customer support!
review_body:
Purchased 3 of these along with Blue Iris to monitor my home. While I was not able to personally set everything up for wireless use, I called Foscam up and an employee named Judy Rose was able to set everything up.

This is a *real* review and not something purported by Foscam, I can assure you. I am able to check these cameras on my phone whenever I'd like (via 3G), very happy with the purchase

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: this camera came with no software and will not work. P would not suggest buying it for any reason. no way.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Using this as a nursery cam.  Easy to set up.  The image quality is great.  It has two way audio which is great!  The grandparents and aunts and uncles are excited about being able to check in.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is a really slick little camera for the price and easy to work with. In under 30 minutes I had it connected to my wireless network, a static IP assigned, and was controlling it from my Android phone. The night vision is pretty amazing, much better than I expected. My ISP (Mediacom) assigns routable public IP's so I was able to setup port forwarding on my router and connect to the camera remotely. The built-in web UI is ok but there are some good free apps out there that offer better interfaces. My favorite is called IP Cam Remote, it's easy to setup and allows you to view and control multiple cameras. We'll using this to check on our baby as well as a little home security while were gone.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: able to view on Firefox and viewing away from home on mobile device
review_body:
took me 2 days to figure out and set up and config my first camera. if you dont have any experience with tech its going to be difficult without help.

follow the instructions from the amazon reviewer on the front page from there its easy

primarily using the cameras to prevent theft.

for those who wish to view their cameras away from home once you Port Forward (have my set on port 80) ur camera for your router
go to [...]

and type that ip address into your browser and it will take you to the Foscam login page to ur camera hope this helps

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Ok, so connecting over the internet, and not wi-fi took a call to customer service; however, they answered within 10 minutes (they had a count down and kept updating me where I was in line), and did all the work for me (they connect over the internet, and move your mouse around.... odd at first, but worked well.... and my IT department does the same thing, so no biggie). The customer service was great... an no, I'm not paid by foscam to do this review. I live in Denver and have left plenty of reviews for random crap throughout my time on Amazon. So, back to the camera. This is an indoor only camera. Do not try and use it outside, unless it's a completely shaded area. Mine would black out when in the direct sunlight; however, it works fine in the front yard, where its shaded throughout the day. The audio works good, but not great. I can watch my wife grill, and make annoying sounds at her while she does it. :) She's beginning to hate the cameras. The reason it only works good, instead of great, is due to the sound echoing over and over again after you say something, unless you turn off the sound. Basically, the camera hears itself, and plays what it hears. But for pete's sake, it's a camera, not a surveillance device.... or maybe it is a surveillance device.... eh.... It is rather fun to listen to people at your front door when ever you don't answer.

The PTZ works well. you can make it go fast, or slow. Just play with it until you find the right method.

I ordered a outdoor, stationary camera for the backyard, so it will work in the sunlight. I'll leave a review for that, once it comes in.

SOOOOOO in short, call customer service and have them hook up the camera so you can connect over the internet. I did it after I hooked it up over the wi-fi, which was easy to do with the CD provided and tutorial. Call customer service, and you'll love these camera's.

UPDATE:

The camera's have a known flaw inthem, and MUST be sent in to get it replaced. If the wrong light hits the camera, or it's just bright where the camera points at, the camera resets, and continues to do so. It constantly resets. Once you send them in, they work fine; however, you have to pay for shipping and a fee when you send them in. Sigh. They have an \\"auto pay,\\" button for the fee/shipping cost. almost set up like a scam. Just saying.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
