product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The details of this product need major improvement. If you want to be able to talk/listen from a non-admin account through a web browser, you can't. The apps for this camera are very poorly designed. Foscam doesn't have a polished app they designed themselves. They recommend one that costs 6 bucks. Apps do not offer all the features this camera has, so there's really no point in having them if you can't use them. Also, difficult to install. Takes forever, and instructions are unclear. I will either go without an IP camera or wait until the dropcam becomes more affordable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Complicated to set up. If your not computer/IT savy... skip it! I have spent days trying to figure it out and I surely cant acess the video feed remotely... especially using my smart phone. The only place I can use this camera is in my own home sitting in the same room watching myself. The help/tutorial is useless. Save your money and just get a DOBERMAN PINCHER!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is awesome! Using the included manual, setup was pretty easy and very well detailed. I bought the camera to keep an eye on the cats while we are out of the house or on vacation. When we're on vacation I miss not seeing them for weeks at a time.

After connecting the camera to our wireless network, I used the included mounting bracket to mount the camera by where the cats eat and hang out most of the day. All of our TVs are wireless and connected to the wireless network and we are able to watch the camera's video from any TV in the house using any web browser. The pan and tilt feature works seamlessly and the infrared night vision works great as well.

It worked flawlessly while we were in France last month. I was able to see perfectly fine streaming video on my TMobile Samsung Galaxy S4 using the Foscam app while we were traveling all over France. It sure helps that TMobile has free international 3G data! Even while on the TGV from Paris to Rennes at 200MPH I could see the kitties on my smartphone. That, in itself, says a lot for the Foscam app and this camera!

The camera also e-mailed still images of movement, such as when the pet sitter would come over or the cats playing in view of the camera. The two way audio feature is a great addition and works very well; although I could do without it. The image quality is not high definition but hey, this is a $70 camera and for that price you most certainly are getting quite a bargain.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: My experience with the Foscam FI8910W
review_body:
I do not work for Foscam, Amazon or anybody else involved with my purchase. On my network I have 2 $250+ Panasonic P&T camera's and the Foscam FI8910W. For 1/3 the price I'm getting the same features and as far as I can tell the same quality image. The Foscam actually gives me a better picture than my Panasonic-BL-C131A camera and about equal to my Panasonic BL-C230A.

I'm on a Mac and because i was familiar with setting up WiFi camera's because of the 2 Panasonic's I had previously, had very little trouble with setting up the Foscam. I did not need any help from Foscam CS. I'm hardly a tech person. I'm 78 years old and not supposed to be able to set up a TV remote let alone this Foscam. :)

View my camera's here. [...] Name=user, Password=password.

All 3 camera's are capturing video through windows, but the Foscam also is pointing out through a window screen and that's the lines you see.

review_headline: This is a great camera for the price
review_body: This is a great camera for the price. Upon arrival, setup was a piece of cake. I got stuck with the software setup and I immidiately called the toll free number on the back of the manual, few seconds later a foscam representative came up, remotely accessed my computer and completed the software setup in less than a minute. Marshal( representative) delivered a great customer service as he performed his task of setting up the software. Upon completion, Marshall gave me some guidelines on how to access my camera remortely using other device such as iphone and so forth. He also went way out of his way by recommending the type of app I should download. All I can say is: GREAT PRODUCT AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

There is a brief lag in the video which might be caused by how far the device is from my router.  I would like to try it over Ethernet but that is not feasible at the moment.  I use this with the Foscam Pro app from the iTunes store which works with both iPad's and iPhones for $5.99 [...]

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This cam is awesome for the price. Crisp and clear and well-made. I got about half-way through the set-up and got stuck. I called Foscam support and got Kate. She was great and remotely took control of my computer and completed the setup, explaining what she was doing along the way. Looking forward to really dialing the remote system in so I can leave my home and feel safe while monitoring it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera returned because it died within 48 hours.
review_body: The picture quality and ease of setup was very nice. I also liked the ability to turn off the infrared lights. However the camera quit working after less than 48 hours. Several attempts to reset the camera were unsuccessful. Camera has been returned and purchased Tenvis cameras with same features minus the infrared switch for half the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Worst product I've purchased. Out of the box the camera was doomed to fail. Plugging the camera into the router the camera flashed red and not green like the instructions say. Followed the instructions and ensured that the firewall, MAC filter and anti-virus were all disabled. Attempted to do several hard resets to the camera with no avail.

After an hour of debugging, I was able to get the camera to change from a flashing red light to a solid red light. Was able to attach it to my network but for only a few seconds. The camera never readjusted nor re-aligned as it described in the instructions. The network connection would only flicker as it wasn't able to fully connect to my router. I completely reset router settings - twice hoping to clear out any settings that I may have changed.

I contacted the Foscam customer service and that was experience was similar to asking a 5 year old questions about Alegbra! Requested a refund after owning it for 4 hours!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought two of these a couple of years ago to monitor the comings and going whilst we were on vacation.  The cameras themselves are top-notch. Clear picture, good movement, etc.  The problem is with the setup, hence the low rating.  These things are an unbelievable bear to set up. Nothing should be this difficult.  It is entirely possible that in the two years since my purchase, Foscam has improved the setup instructions -they must have or you'd see people drop kicking these things into the street on a regular basis.  I am in IT, I has read that these were difficult to set up, I figured that meant for the lay-person.  Guess again.  At my wits end, I called one of my IT buddies up, told him I was in over my head and asked for his help.  He came over and spent hours, many hours over multiple sessions getting these set up and even then, I don't think it's quite right, but it works, mostly, so I'm not messing with it.  I actually came to Amazon today to look not buying different cameras because these have proven to be so frustrating.  While I was here, I decided to write this review.  These are great cameras. The installation is a hellish nightmare.  Caveat emptor.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Pros:
1. Does everything promised! Great addition to my home security setup. Easy to setup, HD quality recordings
2. Sound detection is useful where motion may fail
3. 2-way audio is useful

Cons:
1. Motion detection is pretty weak. I have my lights on a timer and it goes off when lights switch (which is anticipated, I guess)But playing around with the sensitivity settings doesn't do much here.
2. Would be great to get a video clip around detections rather than just pictures
3. Better iOS app needed

I have found an open source recording software that works well, and an Android app that is able to monitor and control the cameras very well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Amazing for the price. Quality is way above X10 stuff that a friend has. The setup is easy and the video ig quite good. The infared is amazing in total darkness.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Difficult to setup and not truly outdoor resistant
review_body: Were difficult to setup had it not been for previous owners having posted online. Was not able to setup on a MAC at all so I used a PC. Non of the MAC tools worked. I wanted a 'true outdoor' camera but these are not truly outdoor. I have to keep them inside on a side table by the windows and therefore my view is limited. In this type of use, they keep adjusting themselves with the outdoor light changes and I have to keep readjusting the lenses. What this means is that when the light changes outside, it takes motion photos because it detects light changes and shadows. Then, it goes back to where the light source is and takes photos of the sky instead of remaining where I want it. I work with computers (for a living) and understand networking, ports, etc. so for someone with little or no knowledge, they should get something more user-friendly or get help from a friend. I am going to try to get some more advance setting to adjust the timing on photos and also see if I can finally get a free dns name so I can get a true remote view. At this point, all I have is still photos sent by email vs the ability to see live video from a mobile device. If I figure that out, I'll try to repost.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

I love the ability to move the camera around though there is no zoom.  Plus it has excellent night vision.  It was a little hassle to set up the connection with my computer but afterwards it was easy to use.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Baby monitor - Foscam and Dropcam comparison
review_body:
Foscam and Dropcam are both great cameras but have different uses.

Foscam's resolution and frame rate isn't as high or quick as Dropcam but Foscam pan & tilts, which Dropcam cannot do! So if you're looking for a baby monitor and you place your baby in different areas of the room AND occasionally need to use it as a security cam then Foscam is the winner. This tilt and pan comes really handy because if you hear your baby crying but can't find your spouse or nanny then you can move the camera around to see where the they are.

But if your camera is stationary and need a 1-minute setup then you can't go wrong with Dropcam. Dropcam is super easy to setup and use but the fact that I can't tilt and pan is a bit frustrating at times.

So for baby monitor, hats off to Foscam :)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Quick and Easy basic setup, would like encryption
review_body:
I got this setup in less than 30 minutes and then spent 30 minutes playing with it and put it straight to use to monitor my dog while I'm at work.

Picture quality is very good. The night vision is very good. This is indoor use within 10 feet that I'm basing this opinion.

I have not tried any of the advanced features yet, like motion detection with SMS alerts, or FTP upload or other recording/streaming options. But I plan to.

To set this up for remote viewing you need to be able to open a port in your router, which is very simple but may be intimidating for non-technical folks. Rather than relying on the included manual/software, go to Foscam's website which has videos and individualized instructions for different routers.

Setting up Dynamic DNS was easy if you already have an account with one of the well known service providers like No-IP. The camera automatically uses your No-IP credentials to keep your IP address up to date. No need to run a separate Dynamic DNS client on your computer.

My only complaint is that I would prefer that the output stream could be encrypted. Though I suspect there is a way to accomplish this with third party tools.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Irish was an excellent helper. I really appreciate all the help today. The camera picture quality is better than I expected.. The remote access  is wonderfull..My main purpose for using this camera is to monitor my Ashley puppy when we are away from home.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works as intended. This is my 3rd camera from this company. I highly suggest these cameras over buying the $200+ baby monitoring systems seen in stores. My only suggestion, mount the camera if it's going to be anywhere near the baby crib. The first camera (FI8918W) I bought two years was casually placed on the corner of the crib to watch my baby. Over the last two years my baby has knocked the camera down numerous times. It still functions, but the speaker and video don't work anywhere near as good as it did new (picture is fuzzy/grainy and you can't hear the speaker unless you stick it in your ear). I relegated the slightly dysfunctional camera to the dog room and bought two new cameras (one for current baby and one for baby on the way). New camera is mounted to the wall above the crib and does a perfect job while being safely out of reach from baby.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good attempt, but not functional due to networking issues.
review_body:
Good attempt, but not functional due to networking issues.
I have mixed feelings about this camera, but after the latest firmware upgrade, I'm about to give up on Foscam.

One recurring issue that I've been patiently putting up with is slow response of its Web interface. It takes half a minute for the interface to respond. Pressing camera Pan and Tilt (PT) arrows have no effect on the camera until you press up, down, left or right few times, then the camera moves too far, you have to press the opposite arrow few times to get it to move, then again, it moves passed the point where you want it to be pointing.

Second disappointment is the image quality. You could see general contours of people and objects, but the detail is somewhat grainy. Perhaps quality image is not something that should be expected from a sub $100 camera.

Third disappointment is that audio only works in Internet Explorer (IE) and only if you install a Foscam ActiveX control. My position is that I'm not installing ActiveX controls, which have full access to my computer from a Chinese company that I absolutely do not trust to have any control over my computer. So, this means no audio for me.

Fourth issue that makes this camera simply unusable, at least in my settings is the networking. Wired network that should be rock solid stops working every 1 to 2 days and requires the Ethernet cable to be removed and plugged back in before video stream resumes. The WIFI doesn't have this problem, at least when the camera is close to the WIFI router, so one camera that is inches from the wireless router and within a cable reach of an Ethernet switch is using WIFI. However, the camera that is 50 feet away, where I do need wireless connection, acts bipolar when it comes to maintaining that connection. First, it doesn't connect to the WIFI router, unless I connect a PC using Ethernet cable, immediately select \\"scan\\" for WIFI, re-select my WIFI SSID and select\\"apply\\". Only then it would connect and stay connected. However, if I change any settings remotely, then \\"apply\\" them, the camera reboots and doesn't reconnect to WIFI. This requires me to repeat the laptop kabuki dance. The final straw was the latest firmware update (11.37.2.54), the further (50 ft away) camera refuses to connect to WIFI at all. When I select \\"scan\\" in the Wireless LAN Settings, my network is visible, but selecting it and applying that selection doesn't result in the camera actually connecting. If I bring the camera physically to be next to the WIFI router, it works fine. One more data point is that my iPhone displays full WIFI signal strength next to the distant camera, never has an issue sending or receiving data with its internal WIFI antenna, so it is clearly not the signal strength issue. While the Foscam camera with upgraded 9Db antenna that is about 10 inches long, doesn't work.

In conclusion, this camera is a good idea in a good looking package, but either the electronics inside or the firmware makes this camera unusable until at least the networking issues are addressed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy to set up but the wireless connection kept dropping out.  Even at less than 5 feet away.  I couldn't use this.  I thought maybe it was the unit but I got a replacement with the same result.  I thought it was my router, I tried another one with the same result.  I'm staying away from Foscams.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: incompatible with  max OS X 10.6 or later & iphone
review_body:
Sadly the manufacturer feels the need to lie about compatibility. If you have a mac, beware. I am told there is no way to send/receive audio with our desktop operating system, Mac OS X. Apparently 10.6 versions or later are not compatible with the plugin needed for the audio. Unfortunately I only learned this after paying a tech to setup the camera (over 2 hours which I paid for after investing 2 hours of my own time setting it up as directed and it failing to work wirelessly). The video comes through but isn't high quality.

When viewed on an iphone, audio apparently isn't an option. It's impossible to hit the correct arrow consistently to pan the camera in the desired direction. If you zoom in on the controls, you then can't see much of the video. It's a dumb flaw.

I'm sad I wasted my money, and far more importantly, my time on this dishonest company's crappy camera. Booooooooo.

On a positive note, is has a pleasant texture.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to set-up, good quality images and many extra features for the advanced user.
review_body: This is a great camera that is easy to setup and has several options that you can configure. You can be up and running in minutes if you go with the basic settings. With a little more know-how you can configure additional settings like schedules, alerts, ftp upload and a dynamic DNS URL. The quality is as one should expect for a non-HD camera. Images are good in both day and night modes. It also includes two-way audio.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works Perfect with Ethernet! No other camera in this price range with same feature set!
review_body:
I was very nervous about buying this after poring over the reviews. Many have warned about Foscam being a shady company, Many warned that their BBB complaints were very high. There also seems to be a lot of people that complain about the wifi.

The BBB complaints seems to be true. The Company doesn't appear to work with anyone, again, based on the number of BBB complaints. As far as the wifi goes, well I can't speak to that because i've never used it.

What I can tell you is I have loved this network camera! I've only used it with a hardline network connection. With this type of connection I've yet to have any problems connecting to it. The picture quality is decent, if you're expecting HD you'll be disappointed. The Audio quality isn't great but gets me by just fine. I'm using this as a baby monitor, and it lets me know when he crys!

The Foscam android app SUCKS. If you're looking for a good Android/ Apple app, Check out "IP Cam Viewer". It's been on android longer than apple, its more mature for those android devices.

I am an engineer by trade, so i consider myself tech savvy. Saying setup was a piece of cake is unfair, it's all relative. However, if you're unable to get it setup, don't give it a bad review. It doesn't mean its a bad product, it most likely means you're incapable of the task. Everyone knows someone who is technically inclined, give them a call.

For the money you can not beat the feature set this camera gives you. If wifi is your only option, my review may be of no use to you. BUT, if you have the ability to run a network cable to it, do it!

As far a con's go, it has a built in speaker that allows you to send audio to the unit. This worked once or twice, then it I think the speaker blew or shorted out.That being said, if you require this ability, the camera has audio input/outputs so you can use your own mic/speakers.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy to install on Windows 7 & 8 and works really well in light and dark.  Just read the instructions prior to installing.  Just using on internal network at this point, but may try going external.  The ability to adjust the camera remotely is great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works as advertised and dont buy into the negative hype on setup, watch YouTube videos!
review_body: For the cost item performs well. Some folks gave poor reviews because the setup is complicated. It is but you can access an unlimited amount of YouTube videos that will literally give you step by step visual and verbal instruction. After setup I got them working on my iPhone and they work great on 3G or wireless. I can pan and tilt remotely and I recieve Alarm emails within seconds of the trigger. I actually installed two outside under patio coverings and they work well. Temperature has gotten down to 14 degrees F and I didn't have any issues. Night vision goes out to about 30 feet and within that range is very clear. If you want a distance further than that at night buy the outdoor versions they will go much further.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this camera to keep track of certain items that have grew legs and walked away.  It was pretty easy to set up following the directions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This product is junk. If I could give it no stars, I would. Unfortunately too, I waited too long to return it, and now I am stuck. Despite having upgraded the firmware and the web UI software, the camera still has a mind of its own. Sometimes I can access the web UI, and sometimes it says that the web page cannot be displayed, despite being on the same LAN and trying from at least three different connected devices. I am an IT professional, and I have take all the normal troubleshooting steps. The camera goes on and off on its own, and it randomly scans the horizon even though I set it not to. The problem is definitely with the camera itself. I have tried from multiple browsers, from multiple OS', and using multiple technologies (e.g. activeX, server push, etc). Furthermore, on multiple occasions, trying to view the camera display in IE on my Win7 machine using ActiveX, the entire compute froze up, not just the web page, but the entire computer. I had to reboot and lost any unsaved work. These problems reflect poor programming and poor QC on the part of Foscam. If you want something reliable, I suggest another manufacturer. I only review things I get if they are really great or really bad, and this thing sucks, by far the most disappointing purchase I made from Amazon. I think, based on another review, that Foscam has had a bad production run on this camera, and they are refusing to address it, which a reputable, trustworthy company is supposed to do.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

It does not connect to WiFi nor via Ethernet. 8910W. The camera is still within the warranty period (bought on August 2012) and I will try to exchange it with Foscam, hopefully the exchange process is smooth and not a nightmare like other reviewers have mentioned. I'll update my review once I get an exchange. I also have another 2 foscam different models, but now I have no idea how long each one will last.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Excellent technical support - stepped me through the process very quickly. It's a great camera for the price. The picture quality is also fantastic. Also, set-up for remote access was simple, again with the help of their technical staff.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: This is a solid product that delivers
review_body:
I read with some trepidation about the level of IT savy required to set this up. Particularly port forwarding.

I got on their web-site and they have pretty helpful videos on setting it up. My only complaint with the videos is they tend to wander off the main point with a lot of \\"...oh by the way...\\" sort of comments.

Bottom line is I had this setup and running, complete with port forwarding in about 45 minutes or so. I'm not a geek and it wasn't that hard to do. Just preview the videos and follow the written setup instructions.

I find the e-mail alerts to be the real security value. This was the most tedious portion of the setup as i had to dig around in my e-mail app to get the setting my ISP needs to get an e-mail sent.

I'm using Wi-FI in an area that is about 20' from the Wi-FI router so I can't comment on reviews that stated the WI-FI is not so good.

I like the motion detected alerts but I found the sound alerts to be way too much for the location we have it setup. If our dogs barked or a door slammed you get an e-mail. It is easy to engage or disengage the alerts.

Overall, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

UPDATE:

Today, Dec. 30th, the camera seemed to be defective. It lost it's motion alert e-mail feed, repositioned it's camera FOV and just seemed to have failed.

I got e-mails from it that showed it's internet IP address but I couldn't connect on my iMac using either the local IP or the internet IP address.

On the iPhone I was trying to connect via the internet IP and it was NG as well.

As a test, I jumped on my work WIN 7 laptop and tried to connect using the internet Ip address. Bingo all is good and solid. I re-aimed the camera.

So, I rebooted the iMac and now all is well for it and the iPhone. Solid connection is now happening on both local and internet IP's. Further it is now sending updates when there is a motion alert.

I have no idea why my iMac getting funny would impact it operation but that seems to be case.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is the greatest!! It took me a long time to figure out how to set up the two routers.. but the trick is make sure the router from your provider is in a  pass through mode to your wireless router then all works great!!! This is actually one of two that I have and it acts as my security camera. Motion and sound detection instantly emails me photos of whats going on in my shop when I am not there. I have even caught a couple of people stealing items.. I can also have it set up to where I can watch at anytime from my cell phone or from my computer anywhere in the world.. Cant say enough..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Such a hassle for not much reward.

First off the FPS on wifi would never go much above 5fps which wont even pick up people walking.
The Wifi range is silly to the point of being useless.. my laptop has 3out of 4 bars and the camera will barely connect.
THEN it will disconnect.. and have little to no reliability. I was very frustrated to and ended up moving the camera 5 feet from the router and it still disconnects multiple times a day for no reason(and wont reconnect). I also updated the latest firmware and got 1 extra fps and the same amount of disconnects.

This thing is a $80 project.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have purchased four of these cameras and spent countless hours trying to get them to function properly. One of the died within the first month and I bought another to replace it. Configuring these units reminds me of the early days of laser printers (when one had to install software and hardware fonts) or the early scanners (with horrible OCR results) - these are not ready for prime time. Lots of glitches, lots of steps, lots of things to do when there are problems. In short, these are not for the squeamish or for anyone looking for a simple and fast and reasonable monitoring solution.

Of the three cameras now in my lineup, two are transmitting video, but cannot be rebooted. One is not recognized by the wireless router and is off line. In other words, all three cameras have issues which I have not been able to resolve. Rather than throwing more money and time down this rat hole, I think I will wait for the market to mature and better devices to be introduced.

If I get it running properly I will update my review. It has possibilities and I already have apps on my cell and tablet that, theoretically, will allow me to see what is going on at home.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I would say its just OK...so far.
review_body:
My experience with this camera has been generally good...so far.

I originally bought it as a possible front door camera for my 80+ year old mother but set it up at my home first to see how it might work for her. I liked the idea that it has 2-way audio available, could be remotely aimed and being wireless might be an easy install.

Setup was fairly easy and I found it worked on Windows, Android, and Apple products with suitable apps. The integrated IR LEDs are bright enough to illuminate maybe 50-75' out from the camera when its dark.

I pretty quickly decided that this should probably not be used outdoors unless extremely well protected from the elements so I ordered a Foscam dome enclosure for it. One of the first problems I encountered when going into the dome with this is the IR LEDS light up the inside of the dome and wash out the field of view completely when they are on. So I put black electrical tape over them, not wanting to do any mods like disabling them that might void the warranty. I then needed an external IR illuminator and assumed that because I can see a small amount of visible red from the installed LEDs they were probably 850nm. However I didnt want to buy anything until I could conform that 850 was the right choice and ther seemed to be some disagreement on forums about what was best. So I bought a small sample of clear encased T 1/3/4 "100ma" 850nm, 890nm and 950nm IR LEDS, all rated at about the same luminosity on axis at 100ma and with roughly the same directional characteristics. I set up a test board with one of each mounted and biased each to operate at the same luminous output as the others based on the published current versus luminosity. I was easily able to see thru the camera that the 850nm was the best choice as it produced about twice the brightness of the 890 and that twice the 950 with this camera when it was in "IR On" mode. It was dark otherwise. Side note - the 850 LED doesproduce a slight visible red glow where the 890 and 950 do not. This is not a mystery, its just a characteristic of LEDs. They produce a primary wavelength light and bell shaped sidebands of longer and shorter and longer wavelength light. It happens the only output we can actually see from any of these is the red which is on the shorter wavelength sideband of the 850 LED. I bought an inexpensive 850nm illuminator to mount outside the dome and that works great.

Now to my main criticism and the main reason I decided to not install this for my mother to use at her house. The wireless connection (802.11 G) is just too slow making the operation of the camera pan and tilt very hit and miss. Sometimes its immediate and sometimes its....never. And it is usually somewhere in between. Maybe 802.11 would be fact enough. A wired LAN connection is much better, but whats the point in the extra costs of the built-in wifi if you have to wire it up. Anyway I just couldnt see my mother bothering to deal with that.

Another weak spot is the sound from the internal speaker or an external speaker/amp plugged in to the camera. I would guess that a lot gets dropped somewhere between the mic on the smartphone/tablet/desktop (I tried all and, with Android 4.2, Win8, and IOS) and the speaker (its likely at the camera) because it is mostly not understandable. The other way - mic on the camera to all the above is much better, at least its intelligible.

So, I am hanging onto this unit and mounted at my front door in the dome. As it happens getting AC power there is easy but running a LAN cable nearly impossible. My mother in going to get a fixed mount, no sound POE wired camera - at her house running a LAN is easy, getting AC power to it not so easy.

review_headline: Almost returned it today, had the lable printed and everything...
review_body:
Great camera...For those having problems with the reset issue, the lens adjusts, adjust the image so that it is sharper or duller depending on your application, it appears it's also an aperture of some sort.
The higher/sharper the focus, the more of the on board buffer is used thus causing resets.
I figured that out this morning after the camera working since day one suddenly kept rebooting.
After adjusting the focus along with contrast and brightness I now get 15 fps hard wired at 640 resolution, running blue iris pro.
Enjoy it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Low cost remote surveilance or baby cam, takes some effort and tech know how to set up
review_body:
When the baby was on the way I started looking at video baby monitors and was shocked at their prices and limited functionality. My inner geek took over and I figured there must be other solutions out there that would meet my requirements and beyond. Compared to an equivalent Motorola or other brand video monitor this comes in about 2-3 times cheaper depending on fluctuating sale prices. Granted, the dedicated models usually come with no fuss set up and a dedicated viewer monitor. But with some elbow grease, this will do that and more like remote viewing via iphone/Android apps or any PC that's connected to the internet. It also has pan and tilt so you could effectively see 270 degrees horizontally around the camera. The camera tilts upwards too but has a limited angle downwards; probably because its own base would impede visibility. I've mounted two of them upside down to alleviate as the apps and pc settings allow you to invert the image as needed. I also liked the idea that these would see a repurposed life as security cams after the initial baby years.

Video Quality
Max supported res is 640*480 and on my wireless N network I seem to get 10-15 fps at best. I'd consider this good enough to monitor the overall situation but you won't be seeing razor sharp detail nor fast movement; it's enough resolution and frame rate to smoothly capture someone walking across view. Night vision is excellent and I have no issues seeing over 10 feet in each room in total darkness. In other words, I can see clearly if baby is stirring, awake, and of course actively looking for us.

Audio Quality
These camera's offer 2 way audio and in practical terms that means it transmits audio from the room it's in and also plays back audio out of a speaker. Yes, it's like an intercom. The catch of course is that in order to talk through the camera, your pc must have a mic built in like many modern laptops already do or your Apple/Android device has to have a mic input too of course. There are mic and speaker input/outputs on the back but I've found that I don't need them as the mic sensitivity and speaker volume are fine for both our living room and nurseries.

Setup
So decent video and audio, but what is it like to setup? The Foscam.us site has improved A LOT and now they have youtube tutorials to guide you through as much or as little setup as is needed for your use. I only went through initial camera setup, wifi network setup, but left motion alarms, FTP uploads, and other advanced features alone. I just wanted to be able to watch what's going on remotely. The first camera took close to 2 hours to set up as I clumsily jumped between googled guides I found, Foscam's website, and my own Wireless Router's port forwarding settings. The 2nd and 3rd camera's were set up as quickly as 20 min once I became familiar with the process steps needed for my use. The website or cd provides a utility to identify the camera's ip address so you can navigate to the camera's web interface via a webbrowser and configure from there. That's all you need if you just want to view video within your wifi network. Remote access will require you dig into your router to set up port forwarding, and a web host like no-ip.org becomes a desired feature so you can just type in a web address instead of your public ip address when remote. There are instructions how to do these things and none of them are hard it just takes time to follow along.

Install
Camera comes with power cord, plastic wall mount, lan cable, and external antenna. The mount is serviceable and with the proper screws you can mount easily on drywall. Note that the camera unit is pretty big and not easy to hide or blend in decor. it's the size of the chunkiest early generation webcam you can imagine. The one advantage of dedicated units is that you could take them with you to other people's homes and since they are locked to a particular viewing monitor you'd be set up in minutes. These camera's rely on broadcasting their signal via wifi so unless you're up for redoing setup while travelling it's probably best to consider these as permanent installations at home.

Apps
I view my camera's on both IOS and Android platforms. On android I use tinyCam Monitor PRO, to me it has the best layout on Android and is worth the $5 I spent on it. On Iphone, I use Foscam Pro which had the best mix of layout and functionality up until the latest update. Their app team is still trying to squash bugs but it's already on its way to become the top Foscam viewer app again. With these apps, I can remotely view and take video's and/or pictures that are saved to my mobile device.

Alternatives?
If all this setup sounds daunting to you, I would suggest looking into Dropcam product offerings. They offer streamlined setup, better video quality, but no pan/tilt functionality and cost about 2x.

I had to use a Windows 7 pc to make the Foscam FI8910W work.
------
After a couple of weeks and wondering what is going on since it seems to reboot OFTEN and emails me the IP. I called support and they were rude and not helpful. I reset back to factory and now when I have motion detection on I get \\"Disk operation error and can not continue recording\\". Since it isn't saving to my computer it has to be internal to the camera so I tried their web chat. The first person came on after 5 to 10 minutes and I typed my problem and was immediately transferred to another person. I had to retype my problem and then she dropped me. She came back and I typed my question a THIRD time and didn't get any response. After 15 minutes she dropped me. Support from this company, bothe phone and chat, sucks. It seems like no one there wants to deal with these problems so I am going to return the foscam and purchase another brand.
FROM MY EXPERINCE I WILL NEVER PURCHASE ANOTHER OF THEIR PRODUCTS.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Decent image but frustrating setup - Wireless OK with fixed router channel
review_body:
Before I get into the entire story let me say that the only way I could get a stable wireless connection was to have my router channel set to a fixed number and not \\"auto\\". With that simple change a frustrating couple of days became better ... hope it continues.

I purchased this model to replace one of my Linksys WVC80N cameras that had become erratic. The first camera I received would not \\"scan\\" for available wireless networks so I returned the unit and ordered a second camera. This is where Amazon shines ... simple returns and replacements.

Although I'm no expert, I have set up 4 other wireless cameras so at least I have that experience. I followed the instructions but was unable to get a reliable wireless connection. By reliable I mean that I could occasionally get wireless connected but any changes, e.g. passwords, port, etc., requiring a reboot interrupted the wireless link and it could not be reestablished. Resetting and going through the entire process again would sometimes result in a wireless link but it was fleeting. I contacted Foscam support and they were able to establish a wireless connection via remote management of my PC. As best I could determine they did nothing different from what I had been doing so I didn't have much hope that it would be reliable. When I queried the tech about the probability of the connection remaining stable when I needed to adjust a setting or move (unplug) the camera, the tech responded that I could always call back. I considered asking him to stay on the line while I relocated the camera but by that time I was about done with the tech and the camera.

Of course when I moved the camera, I lost the wireless link. While searching the postings on the various sites I thought I had read that the camera has an issue with the router channel being set to \\"auto\\" ... lost the citation so I can't post it here. But I gave it a try ... finding an unused channel in my area and voila the cameraconnected and has remained connected through changes and reboots. I certainly don't know if I can make a valid assumption that this is cause and effect. I may decide to go back and reset the router to \\"auto\\" and see if I lose wireless ... but I'll give it a day or two.

Way too many 5 star reviews by people with only 1 review ever posted ...

As to performance: Image is better than my Linksys cameras, pan/tilt work fine, IR gives me usable image. Haven't seen the hw/sw glitch when high contrast or high res images are viewed. Works well with Android app IP Cam Viewer by Robert Chou.
