product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very bad. The high resolution filter does not work!!!!!!!!. It will freeze up if you use the 640X 480 filter. Stay away from it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I was actually impressed and didn't think I would be. For the minimal cost, without any extra software or bells and whistles, it was easy to use and very functional. The night vision works much better than expected, too. Before I get into more minutia I'll just say that I would recommend this product. For the price you can't beat it.

The only major downsides were that:

1) You will need to know how to port forward though your home firewall (you are using a home firewall right??) if you are wanting remote access. The instructions looked like they would be useful to someone not familiar with this concept but I thought it was pretty straight forward.

2) It doesn't support HTTPS (secure web) access. This is a major outage and a feature that should be added to the camera without the need for more fancy management software. In order to achieve this I experimented with an HTTPD reverse proxy setup on my home server as well as the use of Stunnel but both of these methods require a running computer in the home and some intermediate knowledge of such things. It is not something I would even attempt to instruct my parents into doing for instance. The HTTPD method did work fine but you will lose the 2-way audio capabilities (as the camera uses a different communication path to setup the audio channels. I had mixed success with the stunnel method but some of that may have been the application I was using on my smartphone. it did occasionally work though. If you use camera management server software however I'm sure this problem is resolved for you.

All that said several Android applications work great with the camera (directly to the camera or though the HTTPD reverse proxy and stunnel). The motion sensors appear to function flawlessly and it's nice to be able to adjust the sensitivity. I do wish they would have documented how long the cameras will FTP images once the motion sensor has been tripped though (about 40 seconds is what I've found), so the documentation could be a little more technically detailed. The e-mail and FTP actions when tripped worked well too.is what I've found), so the documentation could be a little more technically detailed. The e-mail and FTP actions when tripped worked well too.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
great camera and the night vision is also good. the pan and tilt function helps to cover alot of area.
it's a great camera for the price

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Outstanding value for what you are receiving.
review_body: Built to last and easy to setup. I needed a reliable system that is flexible to use on my iPhone, iPad or workstation from work.  I can keep an eye on my house from anywhere in the world.  Outstanding value for what you're getting.  I hardwired the system to ensure maximum resolution without distortion.  I'm buying two more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy set up and great quality
review_body: Purchasing, install and set up were all a pleasant experience.  I made a phone call in for technical support and was assisted by Irish who immediately and efficiently assisted me in getting my wireless configured.  Definitely recommend!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was nervous given other feedback I read about this camera, but will say after doing a firmware upgrade, the camera has performed flawlessly.  One word of caution: If you purchase this camera, make sure you are buying the version that supports wireless N, not just B/G. There was a mid-cycle rev on the camera that is not apparent unless you read carefully, and both are available for sale on Amazon.  I would have rated this 5 stars, but the app available for IOS is not well polished, which required a purchase of a separate app for my IOS devices, uFoscam.  I am very pleased with that application for iOS monitoring.  My primary use for this camera is to monitor my 8 week old son in his bedroom, and has been working flawlessly.  I purchased a second one for my family room, which is expected any day.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not recommended by this user…outdated hardware/software (appears it was created in 2002).
review_body:
It's not that the device isn't capable of working as advertised it's that this is such an outdated piece of technology. This reminds me of everything wrong with tech i.e. - printers fall under the same problems. As soon as I saw a CD to install, I was disappointed. I kept hoping the product would prove me wrong. After the CD 'install' (which is really only a link the IP address of the camera), it requires you to make a direct connection to the router to set it up which is laughable and sad. THEN, it proceeds to use the browser as the only option to view! I still haven't seen the point of the CD…ugh. I then configured and setup the wireless options but only to realize you need an outdated plugin (by the way plugins are outdated anyhow) for the browsers to hear any audio…again, also not on the CD. I tried convincing myself that being able to control the camera from my computer was worth it and I'd grow to like it more but after staring at so-so resolution and realizing there wasn't free or official smartphone app, I gave up. I'm returning it. These companies are way behind the times of today's tech. I definitely would not recommend this unless you have a need for a full security system and prefer these cameras to be all hard-wired (meaning connected directly to the ethernet cables) and you have no intention of using a smartphone to view.

Though I'm aware it wasn't created in 2002, the software truly reminds me of tech from that time. In the days of amazing free or $0.99 - $10 software on mobile devices and computers alike for instant download - these companies should be ashamed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam customer service for Foscam Model F18910W is steller
review_body: Customer service is stellar.  Kate provided my tecnical help.  I found it easy to follow the instructions to set up the camera, first connected via ethernet cable, then via wifi.  When I tried to set up my Comcast routher to allow remote access to the camera on my smart phone, I ran into problems.  After struggling to make it work for many hours, I finally called Foscam tech support.  Kate worked with me over the phone to solve my problems.  She was very knowledgable, and now I can access the camera from my smart phone.  I'm very pleased with Foscam technical support, and expect to buy more cameras from them as the need arises.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had wonderful technical support from Sarah Johnson!  I called in with a camera set-up question.  Sarah accessed my laptop remotely, set-up what I couldn't, helped me get the camera set up on my phone, answered all of my questions, and I was on my way.  Total set-up time was about 15 minutes.  Super easy and awesome technical support!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Defective sample of an otherwise good camera.
review_body:
I have several of these and love them. They work well for the purpose intended. If you wish iPhone or droid video quality, this is not for you. It is your basic VHS+ ( 4 you ol' timers who remember vhs tape) camcorder video, 640x480 res.

Now the reason for 3 stars is, I received a defective camera that slipped through the cracks. The speaker stopped working after 15 minutes and the right half of the image is badly out of focus (my other cameras are fine).

I hope this is not typical of Foscam, I have read disturbing things about their quote lack of qc.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This thing is awesome! The only problem I had was setting it up. When it comes to computers I am very proficient but needed a specialist to do this for me and get a wireless set up going. I don't necessarily need it but it's so super cool that I have to keep it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This thing is pretty sweet except I had a problem with the internal speaker blowing out when I tried to talk through it with the 2-way audio. I got a replacement through Amazon and the same thing happened again with the replacement unit. I was able to talk for about 3 seconds before the speaker went silent. When I plug into the audio-out jack, I can hear the audio but it is extremely crackly on both units. I don't know whether to try for a 3rd through Amazon or through Foscam or to just give up and keep it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Excellent quality camera. Both night and day images are very clear. Installation into your local network is pretty straight forward and simple. Setting up the camera for viewing over the internet requires using a dynamic dns account and also requires a pretty good knowledge of setting up a static IP and port forwarding on your modem/router. After setup is complete, I personally use what I consider the best android IP camera app, IP CAM VIEWER by Robert Chou. This superb app along with this camera provides the flexibility to turn the IR lights on/off, along with motion detection, audio, contrast, brightness, etc. I also recommend the Blue Iris software to provide monitoring and recording on a computer. Also a superb application.
For this price, I highly recommend this Foscam camera. I bought 3 of these and set up cell phone video monitoring for my sons.
Final tip, make sure to change/add a password to the admin user for security purposes, otherwise your system will not be completely secure.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: excellent foscam tech support from Calvin
review_body: excellent tech support directly from foscam. You can be dumb like me and use this great camera.  great product. I have 2 cameras and plan on getting more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: So far...love the picture...don't love the set up
review_body: Love the night vision and the set up is pretty easy until you get to the remote access/port forwarding craziness. Unless you are super tech savvy, don't try to set up the remote yourself. Just call the company tech support and they'll remote in and do it. I spent the entire evening last night trying myself, because generally I'm able to figure these things out and take pride in doing so without resorting to calling for support. But, this was way beyond me...I tried to channel my inner Penelope from Criminal Minds, but it wasn't happening. But, in about 10 minutes Andrew got me hooked up. I'll update this after I have a chance to use it more, but based on the first day of use, I'm happy with my purchase.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Unable to set up and tech support completely WORTHLESS, at one point told me that fact that I could not set it up was \\" not their problem \\".
Sending it back, now it is their problem.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Cam - Great service from Foscam - Ask for Calvin
review_body: Had issues with camera for first couple days.  finally got Calvin on the phone at the Foscam 800 number (which is open 24 hrs).  Use Live Cams Pro from Eggman technologies and it worked perfectly.  Thanks Calvin and Foscam.  I will be ordering more soon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works really well except for the two way audio. Easy set up and use.
review_body:
I really like this camera so far. It took me 20 mins to set it up, forget the installation software and follow the instructions in the review by R. Tickle on March 29, 2012.

The video quality is decent, I am able to hear the audio around the camera, the only issue seems to be when I try to talk back from my phone or browser, the quality of audio from the speaker on the camera is bad.

The IR feature work really well and I am able to see in almost total darkness. The other cool feature is that you can set up the camera to email you when your IP changes.

Overall very pleased with the product especially at the price point.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very nice IP Camera, for the price it gets all you need. The configuration for remote access was pretty straight forward. The internal mic is not really that great though, it captures a lot of static, I haven't tried the 2 way audio option. And for its price it does all I was looking for. I can now check the live feed of the camera on my galaxy. You will need a third party app to use it with a phone.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very good value for the money for an indoor visible/IR wireless camera
review_body:
Very good value for the money. The camera works well, with good pictures, decent microphone and marginal speakers (but hey, it is a small unit). What really cinched it for me was finding the iSpy Open Source camera software, which turns this little device into a very-well priced monitoring camera (see [...] for the software).

Be aware that the IR illumination will reflect off glass, so if you want to use this to look through a window, make sure you don't aim it straight at a window (i.e. perpendicular to the glass) or all you will see is glare.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Best price for a baby monitor.
review_body: Works really well, higher quality, lower price than other baby monitors. Easy to set-up once you figure out what you need to do, and as long as you set some security, no problems with "Hackers"

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The camera itself is pretty cool. It works well. The image is better than I expected, even in night mode with the IR lighting. Where this purchase went totally off the rails for me was that I never got the Blue Iris Software which was \\"bundled\\" in the price I paid. I did get a cd to load, but it wasn't the right one. After 2 months of constant calling to get the recording system restarted, they finally stumbled on the fact that I never got the software! In fact, it turns out I never got the darned receipt for the order! So, I called to get the software today, 10 hours ago, and they told me I would get an e-mail in one hour. So I went to work, came home TEN hours later...to guess what? No e-mail! I call again. They finally sent me the copy of my order (yes! Two months after I received the product!) THEN they tell me where to download the software. But now I have to wait for at least another day for the keycode!

DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM DIRECTLY FROM FOSCAM. THEY ARE ENTIRELY INCOMPETENT, AND DO NOT PLACE ANY RESOURCES INTO FOLLOWING UP ON CUSTOMER ORDERS!

A day later, and still no keycode. They tell me it will be another 24 hours. They will not allow their cowardly \\"supervisors\\" to speak with customers. They say it will be 3 -4 hours when I explain that I am going to protest the charges. This company is a sham and filled with liars. And none of them speak English worth a darn!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Everything I expected. Works flawlessly. Great horizontal range. I use this to check up on my dog when she's home alone. I can even talk to her, and hear her through the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Recommended but with a word of advice
review_body:
Considering the number of reviews of this IP Cam, I suppose my review is really not necessary, but here's my two cents.

The picture quality is great in daytime & nighttime (IR) mode. It's great to be able to tilt & pan. The built-in software is fine for use with your computer's browser(s) but I really like using TinyCam Monitor Free with my Smart Phone and Tablets. I wish there was a version for browsers.

The only issue I've had is that from time-to-time it can't be accessed. Some times a power down/power up will fix it and once I had to use some basic DOS commands from my Windows 8 computer to get it going. Usually it will come back to life on its own but it's disconcerting if you're relying on the cam for remote viewing and you can't reach it.

The mounting bracket give you lots of mounting options. I didn't have any issues setting up the Cam with my router with Port Forwarding but I have better-than-usual computer skills.

In all, even with the occasional dropouts, based on the price/performance ratio I give it 4 stars and may purchase more units in the future.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera with easy to install instructions for someone with moderate technical savy.
review_body: The camera has performed exactly as I had hoped for overseeing my vacation home. Instructions for installation were clear and I installed it myself in a relatively short time. I'm not currently using the audio function but may activate that in the future.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
original firmware v11.37.2.49 & app v
updated firmware v11.37.2.54 & app v2.4.10.7

installed Foscam's Client SW to manage camera on XP. that app wouldn't update firmware. it just returned \\"reboot\\", so i reboot but no update. so i used Foscam's IP Camera v1.0 app, and it would allow me to update firmware and appware.

now i can't access the camera. IE returns invalid login credentials, IP Client returns \\"Timeout!\\". i have pressed \\"reset\\" for 30+ secs /power-off/on per directions. didn't help.

prior to firmware upgrade i set the camera's name/ip via MAC address at DHCP server for wifi and ethernet respectively, but this camera assigns its own name, \\"ipcam-\\" regardless. i couldn't seem to fix that either.

of course now i can't access the camera after the firmware update.

update 11.04.2013
i emailed tech support. i was able to reset the camera. i logged into the camera as the reviewer here, [R. Tickle on March 29, 2012] suggested. i used Chrome on a Win7 machine this time. didn't use the Foscam sw. didn't use DHCP. for now, i have the camera configured minimally with eth0. it has sent test images to my Synology 1512+ via FTP to specific volume via user/pw auth on the Synology. so that's working. i can see images.

in all fairness maybe i didn't hold down the reset button correctly and the camera is now functioning while on ethernet connection. i'll try wifi tomorrow. its to go into a bay-type window to view front door area so i hope that memory bug mentioned isn't on this unit.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good customer support with Calvin help I was able to set up my camera.  Camera works perfect good combination of price and quality.  Many thanks. Beck.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is better than expected. I have 2 and use it to monitor my dogs. I Can watch from chrome or IE and also from my Android phone . Love the tilt and pan feature. I am an IT pro so for me setup was easy but unless you are comfortable with routers and port forwarding you may want to get help or try the online support for help setting it up . Will be difficult for the average person.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Beware of excessive exterior background motion- camera will freeze.
review_body: I purchased this camera with the intention of using it to monitor outdoor activities.  My house is surrounded by pine trees but unfortunately, this camera could not handle the motion of the numerous trees.  The camera would be stuck in a loop of freezing then resetting itself.  When pointed indoors where the surroundings are much simpler- the camera works fine.  I had to return it as indoor surveillance was not why I bought it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Calvin from customer service with Foscam was great, got my camera set up quick. The camera has a good picture, and moves silently. I would recommend this camera to a friend for sure.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: For an inexpensive IP PT camera, this one fits the bill
review_body:
The setup was interesting. I read the most helpful review about not installing the software but going by those steps I was only able to get the camera to work with plugged in Ethernet. I setup the port forwarding on my Apple Airport Extreme but the camera wouldn't recognize the network.

I went to [...] and downloaded their IP Camera Tool. I configured it through that, rebooted, and now it works great!

The camera quality is ok for remote viewing/monitoring. Night vision is good. The two-audio is practically useless, even plugged into Ethernet. It's distorted terribly and it has a big delay. Getting audio FROM the camera though works fairly well. Granted, I was using an iPhone app to communicate through the camera on an LTE connection so take that as you will. It could have just been a bandwidth issue.

All and all, for less than $100, I couldn't ask for a better IP camera. We're using it as a baby monitor but I may get another one to mount outside in a case for security too. The motion email alerts (which if you use your cell phone SMS email just comes in as a text to your phone) works great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Awesome IP camera for the price.
review_body: We got this camera to watch our dogs when we are away.  The image quality could be little better but cant beat the price for sure. I use the Foscam app on the iPhone  to connect remotely which you have to buy, but it is a 5-star and very polished app. It is worth it.  When assigning a static IP address to the camera,  make sure to specify your DNS settings correctly; otherwise,  the email server will not be able to connect successfully.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is terrible.  The camera loses its settings and won't connect.  Thinking it was an app problem, I purchased several apps to try to fix the problem...that didn't work.  I am returning this cam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I own 3 Foscam cameras, all popular models.  They all are awful and unreliable.  Two of the cameras are via a wired connection (one will only work at all this way, won't work on wireless - should).  The FI8904W (wired connection) will not stay live.  It is not a network problem.  It works for a few hours, sometimes an entire day, but always loses the picture.  Most times I can access the web setup, but no picture will show.  Sometimes, if I unplug and replug it it, it will start working, but who knows for how long.  Very annoying.  A surveillance camera isn't worth much if you can't see the image!  The other wired connection, FI8916W does pretty well when wired, but still often restarts and does it's panning thing.  Also, it is supposed to be wireless, but it will not pick up and hold the signal unless it is 2-3 feet from the source.  The other thing with all 3 Foscam cameras, is that they cannot take any brightness at all!!!  It will knock out the FI8904W completely and the FI8916W and FI8910W will keep restarting over and over and over again if it is sunny and bright outside.  Again, not much help from a surveillance camera.  The FI8910W has decided that level 4 on the brightness control is just too much for it.  The area it is viewing is shaded, but it still doesn't like level 4.  Now, it is working, but it is so dark, it is hard to see clearly what is going on.  I will never, ever, ever buy another Foscam camera again.  I should have heeded the warnings of previous review and posts.  I have 5 cheap no pan, no tilt, 930L DLink cameras that just sit there and work.  They may not have the highest resolution and you can't pan or tilt them, but they always work.  Nothing phases them, not even the sun!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: awesome technical support . Picture quality of the camera is good and it has a good night vision. I can remotely access the camera outside from my network using my android phone. Irish from foscam remotely connected to my system and do the settings for my camera. He is very helpful in setting up the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: For the money you can't beat it.  Does a good job easy to set up and if you have problems just contact their support staff and they will help you.  I can monitor my home away from my cell phone (galaxy note 2).  Can activate motion, just like an alarm system so that it will send me an email alert.  Better than paying for an alarm home monitoring service every month.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: The second Foscam FI8910w camera dead within 1 hour
review_body:
This is the second Foscam FI8910w camera. The product is unreliable and displays typical ignorance of its designers and programmers. It is difficult to start the connection, it requires hardwired connection and a special program just for that. Normal 21st century ways do not work. The entries in the programming menu are not written in standard english and not written with standard logic. They are better than in some other products from the far east - but still not comfortable.
Most Pan and Tilt cameras have the Center button - this one too - but it does not do centering - it sends the camera into a frenzy, the lengthy dance to all corners. Good if you want to test the camera, but not every single time. Changing settings, most of the time, forces camera re-boot which includes the lengthy dance too. You need a lot of time to program this thing. And after you think you are done -- the camera will do time-outs, i.e. loosing the picture with an error message: e.g. \\"Fail to connect to device:Disconnected by the device\\" or similar. One camera displaying this behaviour died within 60 days, the other within 1 hour. The WiFi section must be from junk manufacturer.
This is occurring regardless of firmware version. The newest version xxxx54 does not fix the problems. I reported several firmware problems to Foscam months ago. Since then Foscam firmware was changed 3 times and nothing got corrected. It is now xxxx54 and still crappy.
Foscam technical support is unresponsive. Out of several problems reported only one time they had an answer for me - the camera comes with PRE-SET capability turned off by default - why? - for what reason?
If you go on chat with support people - you will get connected to an agent who will not help you but will send your connection to another agent which usually will not pick-up the call before you run out of good will. Or you will get a really great advise - waste some more time and send us an email with problem description and receipt and maybe we will send you RMA, after which you may send us your camera and maybe we will send you a refurbished one that somebody else complained about, so now we will play lottery and maybe you will not notice the same problems that the other person did.
But it might be helpful to know that telephone agents can connect to your camera using Teamviewer and make changes in the camera setup if possible. This of course does not fix the WiFi hadrware problem.
When it works - the picture is rather good, but during the transitory day/night period the camera's infrared filter will loudly click repeatedly waking whoever does not need awaking, will alert anyone in vicinity and generally fail to stay silent. The Foscam official technical support reply is to turn off the night vision -- are they serious -- really?

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: works great and functions wonderful. love that I can check on my house from anywhere . and with a built in microphone you can usually hear if someone's home even if you cant see them.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The reviews are pretty accurate - one of the things Foscam has upgraded is their support - trying to configure it was like trying to learn Farsi BUT when I called Tech support, they linked right into my computer and configured it in about 10 minutes so that I could watch on-line, on my phone, on my ipdad, etc.

It's a pretty decent product with good imaging, the ONLY problem I have is when my wife chimes in and says "hello" while "spying" on me at the office. She can hear me, but half the time her voice cuts out. That was the only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars.

Otherwise, a pretty decent product with excellent tech support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Had high hopes for this product as the replacement for Panasonic webcams that haven't been updated in years.  The software interface is very non-friendly and non-standard.  Don't expect to use this camera for a motion detection alarm for your home as every time the light changes in the room it thinks it's a motion alarm.  This is because it uses the image to image comparison to detect motion rather than an infrared detection.  Of course it's too late to send it back to Amazon so I basically have a doorstop...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I received my camera last week, and so far I think it *could* be a cool system. I can watch my kids through my phone and communicate back and forth with them when they're home. That's cool. The problem is that the motion sensing and emailing functions don't seem to work for me. It will sense motion, and it will send email, but it sometimes sends emails when it detects motion, though it never attaches snapshots from the camera when it sends email (it's supposed to send 6 at a time).

I've been in IT for 15 years so I'm pretty sure I'm doing it right. Part of the problem is that the documentation is old and/or confusing. For example, in the documentation online, it says Gmail, which I'm using as my email provider. won't work. However, in the web UI it tells you how to set up Gmail.

I bought this camera explicitly for the purpose of monitoring our home while we're away so to me, the product fails to do the one thing we wanted it to do. I sent an email to Foscam support, so hopefully they'll have a solution so I can give this camera the stars it deserves.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Hi. I've had my foscam for about a week now and it's a terrible product.  I specifically purchased it to take pictures of movement to monitor my house.  All the pictures are nearly delayed and miss the action.  The pictures show a late image of a person then all the remaining pictures are blank.  It's almost as though the timing for the photo is off or late.  Either way, this product is not worth ALL the time, effort and money I've spent on it.  Furthermore, it was complicated to set-up and I continually had to reset the camera to \\"factory settings\\" while trying to connect the wireless feed.  VERY FRUSTRATING.  DO NOT purchase this product, spend a little more money and get better quality.  Trust me it's worth the peace of mind and sanity.  I'm returning it Monday.  Good luck. jmm

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
setup is a chore, you have to plug a ethernet cable into the router and run a software package from an included disc. the setup is not very user-friendly and the documentation is extremely poor. Once you go through wired setup, you can set the wireless parameters, and it works --- only until you disconnect the power. When you plug in the camera again it will not reconnect to wireless. Who designs a wireless camera that can't be unplugged to move it around? mind-boggling.

Very stingy 30-day return window as well, so now I'm stuck with it.

Also, it does not say here, but Foscam's site says if you plan to use an indoor camera t look out a window you;re out of luck, the reflection from the IR lights off the glass will blind it. Didn't get a chance to see if that's actually true, because I can't unplug it without losing my wireless connnection!

This is the worst purchase I've made on Amazon for probably three years, and I buy a lot.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this camera about three weeks ago and started going through the process of setting it up with the instructions knowing full well I would be calling technical support. I absolutely despise talking on the phone and the thought of spending hours trying to get this camera to operate the way I expected and wanted it to was nagging at me for days. I finally called this morning and got right through to Amy Lopez. Amy was helpful, knowledgeable and kind. She helped me finish the set up of my camera, finish the set up of port forwarding and also helped me with the set up on my phone over the ip cam viewer basic. I would bet money that I'll end up calling technical support in the future and can only hope I get Amy or someone as helpful and kind as her.
I'm hoping I'm not in the market for another camera in the future but if I were, I would buy the Foscam. Obviously I haven't been using it long enough to say whether it will continue to work and work the way I want it to but so far, so good with tech support!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Let's face it, this is not a professional level camera, but it's not nearly as expensive as one either. The pan/tilt work well, the zoom is digital, so it's grainy, but what can you expect for the price. The night Infra Red (IR) works well, illuminates around 25 feet.

I have two of these mounted outside (even though these are clearly noted as indoor cameras) under the eves of my house. So far no weather has adversely affected them, but they've only been up a couple of months. I also have them wired with cat-5 ethernet cable, so I am not relying on the wifi capability. (I tried it with wifi at first, but the distance I could place the camera was fairly limited).

Overall for the price, good cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have been using this cam for several months now and could not be happier. Setup was easy and they are very dependable. We have ours setup to send us emails with motion detection. I am an Android user and I use the Little Cam Pro app to access the cameras. Foscam does have its own free app , but I prefer Little Cam Pro. I would definitely recommend these cams.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Opinion: Nightmare to set up for mac users
review_body:
The following is an opinion based on experience with this item.

For Mac Users

Pros: Camera works. Decent resolution.

Cons: Nightmare to set up for Mac users. I called Foscam tech support and was on the phone with an \\"expert\\" for over an hour. The tech support specialist was barely able to get it to work. He encountered multiple issues. The firewall on my router had to be disabled for the camera to work properly.

Additional software is required to record video on your laptop. You cannot record remotely.

Setup for Mac users is very cumbersome. You may have to purchase additional software depending on what you want to do.

Setup may be easy for PC users, but not for Mac users. Expect to spend some time setting up this device. You may be on the phone with tech support for a long time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: good value, good camera, worst support
review_body:
I don't want to discourage anyone from getting this great value of a webcam.
The camera functionality is good and stable and offers useful features at a undeniably great price.

For the most part everything works well and there is a some very good help files in the Foscam forum written by 'TheUberOverLord' there are even developer API's and utility programs for the technically inclined.

There are also some excellent end user programs that are not front and center on the forum.

however.. if you encounter an after sales problem and contact customer support I hope you don't have the same experience i did.
The chat app opens and a Foscam agent answers then ignores you..
then they transfer you to another agent...
who then transfers you to another agent...
who transfers you to customer service who doesn't type anything at all.
These 10 minute waits add up and this has happened on 3 separate occasions.

I've now given up on foscam support.

Please be aware, I'm a good customer, im not rude or anything, and when i have tech support encounters with other firms they are usually useful, sometimes they even solve the problem and sometimes they don't, but Foscams customer support is simply an unacceptable waste of time and an insult to the customer.

I'd still buy another Foscam camera because they are that good and a great value, but I sure hope I never need tech support.

I took off 1 star for the pathetic customer support. please note that this is regarding FOSCAM support from the manufacturer and NOT amazon or the vendor that is selling the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Hardware DSP design flaw -- good camera, don't buy it yet!
review_body:
As of Oct 2013 most versions of this camera have a known hardware problem. Foscam has reportedly fixed this but older cameras are still in the pipeline and being delivered to customers, myself included. See discussion thread here: [...]

I have an FI8918W which is the predecessor, and I like it a lot, but the image quality is terrible compared to the FI8910W. I like everything about this camera, but it isn't yet clear how to be sure you get one of the fixed ones. I am returning one today which I received last night, and I expect to return the second one I ordered last night. Unfortunately I also returned my 8918 thinking I'd swap it for an 8910 and now I'm not sure what to do.

While I would prefer to buy from Amazon, I plan to contact Foscam directly to learn whether I can buy a fixed version as I intend to buy seven or eight of these. A real shame, apart from this issue, it really is a great device and a TON of functionality for the price! I'd four-star this one without the DSP bug.

Edit: Foscam support offered to pull four units and test them and flash them with the DSP fix before shipping to me. Unfortunately, straight out of the box they locked up when pointing at a scene that I knew would crash the earlier cameras. So in addition to not being able to trust the cameras, I can't trust support, either. I guess I'll shop elsewhere.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is an awesome camera.  Works great for watching m kids. The support there is second to none. They took care of my set up and then when I called back with a problem, Sarah, got me back up a running. Thanks.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: No BS--The Customer Support Was Really Good And It Works Great!!
review_body: There is a LOT written about this camera and this company.  I'm just a regular guy who wanted to install a wifi camera for my kitchen and playroom area. Here is how I see it. Foscam is very defensive right now because of a lot of bad reviews and accusations of some falsies (reviews). There are trying really hard to get it right--based strictly on my experience. I agree with the previous customers that connecting with the included cat 5 cable is the quickest way to get an IP address and \\"get it working.\\" I was then able to follow the manual directions and get a wireless connection.  The big pain in the process is port forwarding--I wouldn't even bother trying--just call them and they will remote in to your computer, change some router settings and then a pin hole will be created to allow your camera to be viewed by any device and any computer in the world. It took me 10 minutes to get this done from opening the box to hanging up the phone.  Note: they will encourage you to buy the Foscam App for iPhone ($5.99) while on the support line and will help you configure it--while I didn't really want to spend the $5.99, I rationalized I had a tech support guy set me up for free--glad I did it. This camera works well and I love the presets that give you 10 or more views at the push of a button.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've had this camera for a couple of months now and today it finally went totally dead. It hasn't worked as advertised from day one. I was having to unplug and reset every few days to get a picture. The wireless worked fine when only a few feet from the router so I purchased the optional antenna and no better. This morning the picture was in shades of green and yellow; this afternoon it is total black. I have rebooted, reset and still nothing. I have seen a lot of good reviews, maybe I just got a lemon. It was $70 wasted and my confidence in Foscam is zero. Buyer Beware!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: So, I spent an hour or so under the impression that the camera was broken when it arrived. It worked, somewhat, but seemed to drop connection intermittently. I realized that if you take the web-panel off of port 80 you'll get flawless performance from the camera. The quality is meh, and the angle is not wide at all, but it's pretty good. The mounting hardware it comes with is actually really awesome. All in all I'm happy with my purchase, but I took one star off for the annoyingness of having to figure out the port issue. C'mon Foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very good picture quality.  Iphone ap works well.  Slightly difficult to set up but, excellent customer support.  Thank you Irish!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

The device feels solid and there is no blinking lights, however you still get the evil red eye that is the IR.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Do not use in environments with...lots of colors....
review_body:
Just throwing in my 2 cents - had two of these and a few Foscam FI8905W outdoor cameras all set to install, tested them at home (in my fairly drab house) and they worked fine. Went to install them in a colorful environment and they all failed - they would boot up, go thru the calibration sequence, and then reboot.

Seems to be the same problem mentioned here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R30GQV3F3C8KGX/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B006ZP8UOW&linkCode=&nodeID=&tag=

I wouldn't bother with anything from this manufacturer, I'm returning all Foscam products I bought.

Save yourself some time at the expense of getting something that isn't manufactured by a buncha injured horses.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have researched much about a substitute for a baby monitor and this camera takes the cake.  Setup easily and has more features than any other camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: spotty issues, then stopped working after 2 weeks
review_body:
could not connect via wifi
network would occasionally drop at first
after a couple of weeks, can no longer communicate with unit. going to return this one. perhaps its a fluke
will update review if next one works.

Update: 2nd one stopped working after 2 weeks. The good news was that there were no spotty issues. Bad news is that it is just as broke. with this one I made sure to plug into a power strip because I was worried perhaps that power fluctuations caused the previous problem..

Not impressed. I've been reading all sorts of reviews with people saying that foscam dumped these terrible units on Amazon and that their new ones might work better. Whatever the case, two tries is enough frustration for me.

For what its worth, they both stopped working at night..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: You can put lipstick on a Pig, but it's still a pig
review_body:
Setting up the camera is damn near impossible. The instructions that came with the F18910W Foscam are totally unclear, likewise with the installation video which comes on the software CD. The people at the Foscam technical support (Foscam.US/remote) can only assist to a point. These same people also said that you can not control the camera from an iPhone (on this point they are wrong). I have managed to get camera to be able to be controlled from the iPhone app, it took a bit of unorthodox thinking, but it can be done! It took me nearly two weeks to get the camera up and running on my network. You need the Foscam Pro + Audio APP for the iPhone (price $8.00). The people at the Foscam technical support have no knowledge on how to get the camera controlled from the aforementioned APP. Foscam Pro + Audio APP is a third party APP and not sanctioned by Foscam. Unless you are a MCSE or you have a degree in computer science you will probably be unable to get the F18910W Foscam up and running on your network without a great deal of assistance, beware.

The camera itself works as advertised. The entire reason for me getting this camera was so I could monitor my home from my iPhone 5, eg, turn on and off motion detection, turn on and off sound detection, turn on the IR, etc. Foscam can not help you in any way with the iPhone APP.

I have the camera setup to send me alerts to my iPhone when something is amiss (it only sets off the alarm when I receive email from a particular camera address, it also saves the image data to my iPhone. Would I ever want to setup another surveillance system, I'd rather get poked in the eye with a sharp stick.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works OK - Decent Images for non HighDef camera
review_body: Camera works OK and does the job -- Getting connected to the router was not easy -- Foscam support is spotty -- I will eventually buy the HighDef cameras to replace these 2 -- Foscam REALLY needs to upgrade the camera programming and the software that runs on it

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great for monitoring your pets inside the house. Easy setup with disc included. Foscam app for iOS is a bit expensive but works great over wifi or cellular.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: quit working in less than 30 days
review_body: I use to install cctv. I know these cameras very well. I purchased 2 from these guys in April 2013. I didn't even hook them up until the middle of Sept 2013. They lasted maybe 30 days. No warranty, even though they say there is one. The focus on one won't focus. Yes, I turned the lens ring. The picture won't come up on the other one. The Foscam itself is a good camera for a simple view. I purchased another one from the manufacturer. Much better image quality. I suggest you buy directly from manufacturer, there is a 2 year warranty. I should have known better.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice unit for the price. Works well, but. . . .
review_body:
. . .you really need to know your way around your router and have a decent understanding of port forwarding.

I have 4 of these cameras in use now and overall I'm pretty happy with them. I bought the first two when they cam up for sale on Woot a while back and added the 2-pack from Amazon a couple of weeks ago. I use them for home security and as \\"Kitten cams\\" for the wife when she is away on business and suffering feline separation anxiety.

Prior to getting the Foscams I was using a couple of Astek Moles. Comparing these the Foscams have a slightly wider field of view and their IR \\"night vision\\" is head and shoulders above the Moles.

These are indoor cameras and can not be used safely outdoors but I do have 2 mounted on windows viewing well lit areas outside the home and they work well under these conditions.

The CONS:

The built-in web interface sucks! The design is actually quite nice but the implementation leaves a great deal to be desired. The thing will give you various errors when attempting to make simple changes to the config, often requiring a reset and reconfig and some playing with the sequencing of the set up, the browser you use or, how you access the device's web page (Directly through your LAN, via the WAN through the forwarded port or putting the thing in the DMZ and hitting it directly. And despite repeated tries and a couple of calls to tech support. I have yet to be able to get the multi-camera view working utilizing the built-in interface.

Foscam's tech support is hit or miss at best. And their standard answer seems to be reset the device and if that doesn't work, send it back.

Having said that, once you get past the above issues and adjust for the camera's foibles, they work well once configured.

After testing a number of remote apps on my various android devices, I wound up going with Blue Iris on my desktop and it's associated Android app. It was well worththe $10. It works very well with the Foscams and fairly well with the Moles.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This thing is great. A theft in front of my apartment prompted me to put one of these up to deter/catch any thieves. I have it set up to automatically E-Mail me whenever it detects motion along with pictures. My only beef with it is that the connection it maintains to the DDNS is pretty choppy. I can connect to it fairly reliably, but the connection goes in and out, especially when sending movement commands. This could probably be fixed if I used a wired connection instead of WiFi. Other than that, the thing delivers GREAT bang-for-your-buck.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Quality images. Semi difficult to set up, requiring trial and error processes and looking many thing up on the internet. Can't beat the usefulness of this at the price it is going for.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: Device reboots every 10 -15 minutes.  Very unstable and poorly developed product.  Worst purchase I've ever made on Amazon. Google Foscam and BBB before you buy.  They are located in Houston and have a D rating with the Better Business Bureau.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I must say at first I was pretty frustrated with the customer service. Wait time is pretty long unless you call at 5:AM. After a few calls I was up and running. Parker from Foscam customer service was the most helpful.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Hidden Costs and Poor Tech Support
review_body:
Overall, not worth the trouble. I returned this camera for two reasons:

Foscam Tech Support was not able to figure out how to make this camera work on my home network even after two calls.

To use this camera you will need to create a DNS host account and understand how to configure port forwarding on your router. The DNS host service, recommended by the Foscam installation, requires a $25 dollar annual fee. While there are other alternatives out there, I find it a bit disingenuous to say there are no hidden fees when the user guide directs you to a service that is not free.

Also, be aware that the setup for this camera is not for the average person. The setup is significantly more complex than installing a modem, printer/scanner or an external hard drive. Foscam does provide a DVD that walks you through the process step by step. But configurations they walk you through are generic and are not likely to match your home network in many cases. You will have to reconcile the differences between your setup and the setup on the DVD. In my case, even the Foscam Tech Support people were not able to do this.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
We got these cameras to check in on our puppies (6 months old and 8 months old) since they have never been left home alone yet. These cameras work great, once you can figure out how to set it up. Turns out, our router frequency had to be adjusted. I called Customer Service the first night and I don't think they have many people working at night because I was on hold for over 45 minutes and was still the 7th person in line. I figured they might have more staff working during the day and since most people are at work during the day and probably not setting up their cameras, they might have less calls. I was connected to Albert within 2 mintutes of calling and he set up the wireless connection for both of my cameras and even set up the IP forwarding so that I could access the cameras remotely through an Android app called IP Cam Viewer Basic. He helped me set up the app as well. He was so polite and nice on the phone! One of the best customer service experiences ever, once you can get through.

The cameras themselves are awesome! It does exactly as they say. The pan/tilt function works well and the picture is pretty crisp and clear. I am able to see exactly what is going on and the responsiveness is good. I have not tried out the sound yet, but am looking forward to seeing how our puppies react when they hear our voice when we are not there. The app on the phone does not allow voice unless you upgrade to the pay version. We will see if we decide to do that. All in all, I highly recommend this product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was originally having a problem identifying the camera on my network, but I called the tech support line and got excellent support from Michelle. She accessed my network remotely through a secure access point and completely configured my camera and even the port forwarding feature for remote access using my phone or tablet while I watched and learned. I think I can follow that for future configurations.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
So this product is a remote controlled webcam. It also happens to have lots and lots of features. But, first and foremost, it is supposed to be a remote controlled webcam. Since I can't pan or tilt without the webcam crashing, which restarts and resets the camera, then this is basically a plastic orb with lots and lots of features.

Beware and move on. Surprising to see such poor software on a production device from Foscam.

== EDIT ==
Appears that others have this problem. Do a Google search for \\"foscam reset dsp\\". Some are saying that Foscam cameras will reset if the amount of detail and light is too great for the camera to handle.

review_body:

My intent for this camera was to just watch our baby from the confines of our home within the range of our home network and not anything further. It is a bit challenging to set up if you would like to set up the camera to be visible globally. I did not take the time to figure this out.

review_body: The camera works as advertised. It was a good value because evidently a newer version has been released, and this was a closeout of the older version..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: For a wireless camera, the wireless performance is anemic at best
review_body:
The camera performance on a wired network is quite decent. On a wireless network, problematic, to be generous.
I have other Foscam models as well as clones. None have given me the grief that this one has.
First, one cannot simply add in one's SSID and shared secret, in spite of those standard options. No, you have to scan, then select the network, then the shared secret previously entered works.
Wireless performance is horrible. Figure ping times between 400ms to 1900ms and loads of dropped packets, regardless of range to the access point. Mine came with the high gain antenna, so I then tried that.
Performance was barely acceptable then, but no other wireless device in the house could then compete with the excessive signal strength.
If I put this outside, I'll have to run a cat5 line to it, otherwise, it'll never work for me.

I'm putting it in the dining room and I'll run a cat5 line to it.
I'm just shocked that Foscam is selling such a lousy performing camera! Their other cameras are quite good.
Optical performance is good. Pan/tilt work well when wired, uncontrollable when wireless.
IR performance is excellent.
Wireless has enough power, as with the high gain antenna, it drowned out my network. So, I have to wonder what is wrong with the receiver. This isn't new technology, this kind of issue should never occur today.

Update: Took the unit outside, distance to wireless access point was around 20 feet. Connects to the access point, but barely and can't handle any IP traffic at all, even with the high gain antenna.
I opened a ticket with Foscam. They can't fix an issue if they're not aware of it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this in Dec 2012 and it's Oct 2013 and now it does not work.  I was selling my home so I wanted a nanny cam via wireless. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

UPDATE: i decided to move one of the cameras and unplugged it, when i plugged it back it all i got was a blinking red light.... i thought the camera blew but when i plugged it in to another power supply it started working.... product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It is cheap but you get what you paid for
review_body: I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy this if you plan to use WIFI.  I bought 3.  Initially I started with WIFI.  If you pay attention, the camera will auto reboot if WIFI signal is weak.  You will notice it because IR will auto turn on.  Alert email sent out will have corrupted pictures.  I found out and run a ping monitor.  It reboots 20+ per day.  One of camera kept reboot and died eventually.  I finally connect one camera to wire.  It works fine.  So if you plan to use WIFI, think again.  I have another camera connect to a WIFI bridge where is the same place as camera. Then camera runs fine.  So their WIFI sucks!  Don't be fooled by 802.11n support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this to monitor my front yard (through the front window) so I could see what is going on while working in my basement office. The thing I like best about the camera is that it is self contain. It has a web browser built in (to be used for configuration) and doesn't require a desktop application to work. You just plug the camera into the network. It needs to be hard wired initially to get it configured. Once configured it can work via hard wire or wireless.

The video quality is very good and very responsive. I have had some cameras that had several second delays which is annoying, this is real time. I used the iPhone app to control and watch the camera. Note, the free version of the app does not allow you to pan and tilt. I splurged on the $3 app that allows full control of the camera. I like being able to move the camera around with my phone and iPad.

When not at home I access the camera via VPN so I can't comment on setting up the port fowarding, but I image if you know basic networking that wouldn't be hard.

Overall, I was impressed at how well the camera worked. I may purchase another.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This model as well as others MJPEG cameras from Foscam have known issues with defective sensors in cameras manufactured after December 2012 so I suggest you do not buy them. The problem is that the sensor can become overloaded by scenes with even moderate brightness, causing the camera to lock up and require a reboot.

This means the camera has a really good chance of becoming useless during the day time when brightness increases, overloading the sensor.

There is a >80 post thread on the Foscam forum detailing this issue. I repeat - DO NOT BUY FOSCAM MJPEG cameras at this time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought one of these and tried it for a few days and then bought two more for more coverage of the house.
The wireless part was easy to set up, but the remote access setup was somewhat difficult. I called Foscam support both times and got through quickly and after given them permission to access my system they setup all three up in short order. I also had rebooting problems and soon discovered it was only happening when I had it outside on the porch looking outside on sunny days, moving the same camera back in or putting it in the shade stopped this. I guess these are for indoors and don't do well in bright sun light, but they make outdoors ones for that. I'am accessing all three from my smartphone while at work. So with good support this was a good entry level camera for me. Haven't played with the sound too much, but there may be some quality issue there. They all email me pictures when motion is detected which is nice.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought 2 of these when they were on Gold Box for a day about a year ago. I have them setup as baby monitors and they are outstanding. They cost less than a baby monitor with stand alone display, and I can see all my kids on one screen in my iPhone or iPad. I also have the ability to pan and tilt if they aren't in their beds. The IR is very good. The image quality isn't the best, but for the intended purpose they work great. I have no trouble with the 2 way audio. Again, it's not home theater quality but it doesn't need to be. I want to know if the kids are quiet and be able to talk to them if they aren't. I bought 2 more cameras in Feb 13 and again have no problems with them. I am about to order a couple more to start monitoring more of the inside and outside of my house. These things are simply an outstanding value.

They took a little tinkering to get all set up, but once it is done it has been 100% reliable. I love that they provide you with a remote monitoring method if you don't receive a static IP from your ISP. Fortunately I have never had to deal with their customer service, which seems to be what many complaints are about here. I would highly recommend these over a traditional baby monitor. There is really no comparison.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this as a replacement to my EASYN Camera that came in DOA. I bought this to use as baby monitor for my 2 month old daughter. This camera has been on since i bought and it is working great w/o an issue.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I like the camera but hate the instructions.
review_body:
I set the camera up in my house so you can view the picture with my home network. there were a few minor issues, but that is to be expected. The picture is good and the control work good as well. You have to pay for the full app for you phone. I think that sucks. The problems started when I tried to set up the remote access through the web. You have to subscribe to a web host for a minimal charge in order to be able to view your camera remotely from the web. The instructions are very vague and the quality of the instruction video that is on the install CD is really poor. It looks like they took the picture with a toaster. You would think a camera company would have a pristine video. Well it has been two weeks and I have played with it a few time, but still no luck. I have two weeks to get this set up as I wanted it to check on my house when I go on a extended vacation. I just don't get why they have to make things so difficult. I am no dummy when it comes to computers and networking. If I do ever figure this thing out, I will probably buy one or two more to spread out in my house.

Update 11/9/13: I called Foscam and they remoted on to my computer and set up the web browsing for me. Turns out that I had done everything right, it is just that you need to use a different network connection to view your camera over the web than the one the camera is on. They should state this loud and clear somewhere. Also, you do not need to sign up to a web host to get access. Foscam gives you a free connection. The remote app works great over WiFi or a wired connection, but is very sluggish and slow over a cell connection. I used this while we went on vacation for two weeks. You can set up alarms so when the camera detects sound or motion it will email you 6 pictures. Got worried one AM when it showed people in my house. Turns out it was the cleaning lady who got the dates mixed up. I was not able to figure out who was in the picture by sight, but when I put two and two together and figured out that was her normal day, I could see it was her. So, the picture could be better. I ordered a new one today for the bedroom. It is supposed to have a sharper picture, I will let you know.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: the camera is not easy to set up and in fact I put 2 on the same router and only 1 would work wirelessly, so that was a problem.  I set them to send photos when there was movement.  It worked for a while, then I turned that function off when someone was in the space for an extended time and then turned the function back on when they left.  However the alarm function didn't work at all when I turned it back on.  I rebooted it, updated it.  Did everything I could think of , and still, it does not send and email that the alarm has been triggered nor does it send a photo of what triggered it.  So the camera is just about worthless to me now, but I can no longer send it back as the warranty time is short.  I am going to look for another maker.  Do not bother with this one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Harry Foster, foscam.com, did a fantastic job remotely setting my Foscam up so that I now can watch it and control it from my Samsung Galaxy4. Great job. Took maybe 20 minutes to complete the whole process from start to finish.Thank you! Love the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
