product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera, when it doesn't reset itself
review_body:
First. I highly recommend you read R. Tickle's excellent review of this product. It is spot on.

Now to my review. Camara works great when it works. WIFI is very solid considering I have it all the way out in a detacted garage. Of course I have an ASUS AC66U wireless router/blowtorch, so that helps :)
I have it set to send my snap shots via email when movement is detected in my garage (thugs in my neighborhood like to kick in doors to garages) and this works great... if not filling up my inbox... which I just delete. I have the sensitivity set to the weakest setting, which curbs the false reads.

Anyway, it has worked great for about 2 months after which the camera appears to have developed a reset glitch. Every 3-4 days, the camera will pan from the saved position toward the ceiling of my garage... well, that's no good.
I've checked for new firmware in a hopes Foscam might have addressed this issue. No Dice. I'm on their latest, so there is nothing I can do there.
Instead I have to going into the web based settings and pan the camera back to the desired position. I save the position, but it never saves.... again, a firmware issue.

So, while it works, this is not a \\"set it ad forget it\\" device. I will replace with a stationary unit, perhaps the Foscam Foscam FI8904W.
Thanks

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I called tech support since the camera would respond to the software:
After 20 minutes I was told the cable included with the camera was defective and I SHOULD GO OUT AND BUY ANOTHER CABLE..
After explaining thy should replace cable I was told to snd them an Email requesting cable and to inclue contact number so they could call and arrange to send cable.
Next two technicians had unhooking and re hooking the cable (that really not defective) to my computer and to my router .. I was going from room to room attaching and reattaching for 1.5 hours..

Finally they said the camera was defective and outlined a time consuming and bizarre procedure to return the camera. When I mention I had purchased via my return problem was solved.
Thank god I purchased via AMAZON

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: FosCam Support, Setup, and Easy of use
review_body: Harry Foster helped me setup my FosCam in minutes.  It was amazing.  I was able to connect it to my home wifi and it works great.  Now I am able, thanks to Harry, video my home at anytime on my Samsung Note 2 Android tablet.  Harry was very nice, patient and pleasant to talk to.  I HIGHLY remote this camera and the support team that comes with it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Awesome Camera for the price and features
review_body:
I really like this camera and decided to finally write a review. I now have two cameras (one black and one white) that I purchased when they were on sale for 69 dollars.

The setup is easy if you are viewing the cameras on your home internet but a little more difficult if you want to be able to view them away from home (ie a smart phone, Ipad or another computer).

I will not get into the setup as I think it is explained on these different reviews. However, if you have problems, there are various YouTube videos that will guide you in the right direction. Having said that, it is intimidating to get it to work right, but once you do, it is quite rewarding. The problem is really just dealing with stuff that you do not do on a daily basis; such as port forwarding, setting up a free IP provider, etc. I spent some time before I finally was able to get it right. The setup video that comes with the camera helps but there are some better YouTube videos out there.

To test to see if you have it right, you should download some free apps and then use your 3g or 4g on your smart phone or Ipad, etc. to see if it works, otherwise you will just be seeing the camera on your home network on those devices.

What is amazing to me is that you get a nice clear color picture from this camera; you are able to rotate it remotely; take pictures; record video and set up an alarm to take pictures at various times if the camera recognizes a visitor or intruder. It also has sound and I can talk to someone and hear them with audio enabled. Really unbelievable features for a reasonably priced camera.

You can set up the alarm for the camera to work at certain times of the day right from the included software. Many times I leave for work in the morning and when I arrive at my office, I have about five pictures that arrive by email showing my vehicle leaving the house. If someone comes to the house and I am at the office, I will receive an emails showing pictures of them arriving. The camera also has an option to snoop for sound which triggers the alarm. If you have your computer on, it will beep if you so choose.

My camera works out of my window and so it limits my ability to see at night with infrared. However, I also have one in the basement and the camera automatically adjust to the dark and I can see everything in total darkness.

I am hoping to set up an outdoor camera in the future, but right now I am extremely please with the price, features and quality of these cameras. Great buy in my opinion.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Irish from Foscam tech support was very helpful in getting my camera setup. Irish just remote into my system and basically set everything up. Can't get much easier then that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent product, a few firmware quirks, but SNEAKY SPAMMERS!!!
review_body:
I really hesitate to write negative reviews, especially for decent products. I also hate when people rate products poorly for reasons that are not the product or the company's fault. I struggled with this one because the product itself is really decent. I've had these cameras for a while to watch my pets when I'm away and I've even got some for friends. They do the job well and you don't need to be an expert to get it to work. I've updated the firmware once and unfortunately it required me to manually input the IP address instead of using DHCP but no big deal.

Now for the reason for my low rating: Business practices and customer service should figure into ratings so customers are aware of the total package. I can't speak for customer service since I've never had to use it but...

There are many review that cover this product itself, so I'll leave that alone. The biggest problem for this device for me comes with their email communications. Having the latest firmware updates and patches for an IP camera for me is as important as operating system patches. If you don't want someone taking advantage of a security flaw and viewing your cams, you should update them. Therefore, I've signed up for Foscam's firmware updates email list.

Unfortunately, they take advantage of you and I receive at least one sales pitch or promotional email from them every day. I specifically did NOT sign up for that list. The list I signed up for was the firmware updates. It is NOT COOL to take advantage of your customers by spamming them while holding the carrot of security firmware updates over their heads. Even FREE antivirus software definition updates don't spam you just to get updates. Do you hear this Foscam? NOT COOL!!!

You have disgraced an otherwise 4+ star product. I don't even read your emails anymore unless they say \\"firmware update\\". (and I sincerely hope that doesn't mean you will start putting \\"firmware update\\" in youremail subject lines just for me to open them.) For a while, I was OK just deleting them, but this is getting ridiculous. PLEASE, reverse this inappropriate and disturbing business practice! I'd rate this one star purely out of emotion, but it is an otherwise decent product, so please do yourself a favor and stop ticking off customers who just want to know when there is an important update. I'm willing to bet most people buying these cameras aren't corporations with large needs. You're not selling bathroom tissue or paper towels where customers are going to say \\"Gee, I'm really glad I got that coupon for another camera in my email, I was fresh out!\\" Make a good product, they will find you...the power of the Internet...use it for GOOD things only, not to spam your customers!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
All features advertised work well. Many reviewers have done a great job. I followed Tickle's step-by-step instruction and the installation was a breeze.

In order to do the remote monitoring outside your house, you have to configure your router to allow you to get into your home network. The port forwarding setting is a task which varies from router to router. You will have to be a little network savvy in order to get this setting up. For example, I have a TrendNet router. The manual did not explain how to perform the port forwarding. I searched on internet and found an instruction which did not make 100% sense. I had to make a small guess and made it work.

The best feature of this product is that, once the feature is turned on, it will email you your IP address if your network provider changes your IP address. During my recent trip to Asia, my IP address was changed 4 times. I could access my home network with new IP address. If there would be a hacker to my home network, he/she could not get in after IP address is changed. This makes me feel much better to open up my home network a bit. Still, as soon as I got home, I deactivate the port forwarding setting in my router just to be safe.

The motion detection works well when I set the sensitivity to 5. I have a lamp which is turned on and off by a timer. The motion detection detected the light change and emailed me a series of photos. This is a good assurance feature. I get to see the photo twice a day even there was non event to let me know the Foscam is working hard to watch my house for me. When I got home after the trip, I triggered the motion detection. I was pleasantly informed via my email that my home was invaded with my pictures in there.

The resolution of the camera is not very high. However, I had to set the resolution even lower in order to view it via my DSL which has limited upload speed. So, practically, I am limited by my internet connection. This makes me think about switching to other internet provider.

I highly recommend this camera. Yet, you need to know how to set up your router to take a full advantage of it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bradley did a great job of helping me setup my Foscam Camera. He was very helpful
and knowledgeable. He was able to do the setup quickly and assist with setting up
email notifications to my Android.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've first bought a Dropcam and returned it, and bought this Foscam. If you are in doubt between the 2, here's what you should know.
Buy the DROPCAM if:
1) you don't want to waist time on set up - it's play and play, and the FOSCAM asks you to configure DNS and other complicated stuff that a normal consumer should not have to worry about
2) You just want to view the video from Ipad, Iphone or Android device. Their app works fine, but just for these devices, nothing more
3) If you want the ability to ZOOM
4) If you don't mind paying a subscription every month if you want to record the videos
Buy the FOSCAM if you
1) If you want to remotely rotate your camera and have a 360 view
2) If you want to access the video from any device, any browser or PC, not just iOS and Android
3) If you don't mind paying extra to configure a DNS (30 bucks per year)
I chose the FOSCAM because I can control the camera remotely and if works with a variety of 3rd party apps on Windows devices. The set up is a nightmare, but the tutorial video gets you there if you have patience. Both cameras has a good night vision and alerts, and both cameras have 2 way audio (the speakers are bad in both, in the FOSCAM you have the option to plug your speakers and mic)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Amazon Sent a Broken Camera, Foscam Replaced in 2 weeks
review_body:
I have NEVER written a negative review on amazon.com in the six years i have been shopping on here, but this camera is the exception. Let me just say that the install software is garbage and did not detect this camera on my girlfriends house where i was installing it. I \\"chatted\\" online with a rep who decided she was unable to help me and referred me to telephone tech support. called the 800 number and waited 15 mins. i allowed remote access to my girlfriends computer and after 45 mins she stated she was unable to connect the camera with the uverse network. (GF running windows xp). so i take the camera home where i attempt to install it at my place to test. Running Windows 8, the IP Camera Tool could not locate the wired camera connection here either. I downloaded Blue Iris and was able to run my webcam to Blue Iris but would not detect the Foscam. I attempted to give it a fixed IP by disabling the DHCP but unfortunately ATT Uverse requires DHCP for television and is impossible to disable this through your network. I know this camera is working as it is night time now and you can see the network cat5 plug flashing & the IR lights are on. All in all, i will never ever buy a Foscam again. What is more expensive, an $80 camera that doesn't work or a $140 camera that does?

**Update October 29th***

I contacted Foscam after nobody could help me get this camera to work and they had me return it as it was believed it was a hardware problem (i bought a brand new broken camera). Foscam sent me an \\"RMA Form\\" to print out and fill out and went to the post office to send this back to Foscam. I am still not happy about having to pay $12.95 with USPS to ship this non-working camera back. Within a week, I received an email with a new tracking number and Foscam sent me back a new, working camera. I received the camera within a week after that. My initial reaction to this camera was that it actually worked when I plugged it in. I installed it using a combination of following the instructions on the installation disk and via Youtube videos. Setting up the free DNS through NoIp dot com was easy. all in all, it took 4 hours for me to completely set this camera up. However, if I had to do this again, it would probably take me 20-30 mins.

The camera is pretty functional. The night vision works extremely well and this camera has great features. What this camera does NOT do well is take decent photos. I have been testing this camera for the past week and any movement causes the pictures of someone to be blurry even with the motion compensation on. Which means, you better hope that if you are unfortunate enough to have someone break into your place, they move extremely slow and occasionally stop to say cheese to the camera (and hope it is at the exact point when the camera is taking the picture). This camera also functions less than desirable when pointed in the direction of any light source, including a window or sliding glass door even with the blinds closed. During the afternoon, sunlight that hits my closed blinds is enough to disrupt the camera from decent photos. With the alarm setting, camera kicks off false alerts due to any change in light sources. ie. a partially cloudy day. And if you are a Google Chrome user like me, you better get comfortable going back to Internet Explorer, as the camera software uses Java and only fully functions with the use of IE. with Chrome or Firefox, you lose half the features including multicamera, frame rate adjustment, all audio functions, video recording, time stamp features and more. I love using IP Cam Viewer on my phone where I can see my place from anywhere that has cell phone data connectivity (unfortunately for me, i use Sprint so that means \\"wherever I can get cell reception\\").

All in all, as a security camera, this camera is brilliant in letting you know someone is in your place when you're not home, however, it is not going tobe very reliable in giving you a clear picture of a persons face. All in all, this camera has its shortcomings but it serves a purpose. As long as you are aware of this cameras limitations, if it still continues to meet your purpose for it, you wont be disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It is rare that I take the time to review anything. I like to purchase things on amazon and mozy on my way continuing life.

however, I will add that after reading a ton of these reviews, and then reading the subsequent comments questioning the validity of the reviews, I would have to question them myself.

I bought the product, then, per their instructions, updated the firmware after setting it up.

I followed all the videos and whatever else provided, setup the dns, and wireless, to access the camera away from home.

shortly after I discovered that the firmware upgrade made the wifi connectivity sufferable at best. I can no longer get full resolution, which results in a tiny 320xsomething small like 160 screenshot, entirely useless for surveillance.

I contacted foscam, and this was the response from tech support. broken english and all,

\\"
In the first, I doubted there was a reboot issue when light is too bright and the environment is very exquisite (light is very bright and has many grass and trees).
In such a special environment, the picture size may beyond the DSP buffer and camera will reboot.
However, you mention it will also happen at night.
It may caused by the drop wifi issue, please wired connect it to have a test.\\"

basically, this 'amazing' tech support rep told me at first that the reflection of light and grass(detail in general) would cause the camera to have issues. He then tried to say it was due to the camera being outdoors.

he finally settled on it being a connectivity issue due to the wireless...

what is the point of buying a wireless camera if the wireless does not work?

nonetheless, I ordered a replacement (quick service by amazon, running the ball on foscam's screwup), unfortunately, the replacement camera had even worse range...

at 10-15 ft away, I would lose signal to the camera, even at the lower resolution.

I was afraid to update the firmware on this, to make it possibly any worse.

its a shame because the price is right, if the camera worked. I can even deal with the crappy mount. Just get better anchor/screw setup and you wont have any issues, that is, if you can get the camera to work with how you need it. I couldnt.

foscam does offer a signal booster antenna, but based on the reviews, the signal booster is entirely useless as well. I think my ultimate resolution to this problem will be to return the new camera as well and go with another brand period.

Foscam's reply to all of this, as a general statement, was that amazon sellers sell a 'knockoff', so they do not provide support..what a shame.

its very rare that a product in the top 5 of any category happens to be so low quality..would not recommend this as a wireless camera at all..I guess it would be ok for wired purpose but then why spend the money towards a wireless camera at all?

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bought the camera a few months ago and seemed to work fine. For the last month though it reboots constantly during the morning, when I have sunlight in my front yard. The camera is not directly in the sun, but the general environment is quite bright.

I dont see this company doing the right thing.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
**BUYER BEWARE**

Foscam selling known defective cameras!

I've ordered a total of 3 Foscam cameras (1 from Amazon, 2 from Foscam directly). So far I've received one from Amazon and one from Foscam and both have been defective.

Besides physically connecting the camera, the first thing I did was update the firmware and web UI to the latest version. I would then put the camera through a couple of tests. The issue I had with the camera I received directly from Foscam was that it would stop responding when I was manually panning. I contacted the Foscam technical support to aid me with the issue. The agent determined it was a hardware issue and recommended I issue an RMA for it. Fair enough, I don't expect every camera coming off a production line to be perfect.

A few days later, I received the one I ordered from Amazon late in the afternoon. As with the first one, I updated both the firmware and web UI, connected the camera to my network and proceeded with testing the rest of the camera's features. The camera worked fine and I was very satisfied with the results until the next morning. I live in a tree lined street and this particular morning the sun was shining bright and early. I go and check on the camera and it there is no picture. I reboot it and the video feed appears for a few seconds and it reboots again and again and again.

Since this was the second defective camera I received, I decided to check the Foscam forums and see if anyone else has the same issue. To my disbelief, I found a 49 page thread outlining the exact same issue!

[...]

Apparently the issue appears when the camera has to process a \\"sunny scenic image\\" and the only way to fix it, without physically opening and soldering a cable, is to have the DSP re-flashed by the manufacturer. Over 140 cameras have been documented in this thread to have this issue. Keep in mind that only a small percentage of owners actuallywill go to forums and even a smaller percentage will post their issue.

If you look at the fist post on page 25 of the thread, Foscam has known about this issue since the beginning of this year and has yet to acknowledge it publicly.

Here is an excerpt from the post I mentioned above:

\\"For the issue that MJ cameras reboot when light is too bright and the environment is very exquisite, our engineers find the reason and provide the solution. The reason for this issue is that if the environment is special (light is very bright and has many grass and trees), the picture size may beyond the DSP buffer. It can solved by flash the the DSP driver of the sensor board. Please contact your reseller to have repair.

Have a nice day!\\"

When the product is up and running, it is a great and responsive camera. I'm just appalled at the practice of this company.

I will update this review when I receive and test my outdoor camera and RMA camera from Foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Audio DOES NOT WORK with Mac according to Foscam Tech Support
review_body:
The downloadable 'updated' manual from the Foscam site says that installing \\"UFoscam.app\\" will allow for 2-way audio support. Every review I have read about this app says this is not the case. I would love to review that program, but if it does not work for the dozens of persons who did buy it, I am not going to spend $7 to buy it. I can review the audio function when using this camera right out of the box however; audio is NON-EXISTENT. When you click on \\"audio\\" the video cuts out and says I need to install VLC player as a plugin to use the audio function. The problem? I already exclusively use VLC as my default player. In other words, the audio DOES NOT WORK on a Mac unless you use a crash-happy browser like IE. **When I used PC my IE would crash daily. Maybe they fixed that since 2011.**

The camera Pros:

Love it. It is small but provides excellent bright day, cloudy day, and absolute blacked out night video. At night, the inside of my house is so dark, thanks to my blacked out window treatments, that my Rotty bumps into things. This camera sees it all! Also, when the camera pans and tilts there is ZERO sound. I even stuck my ear next to the camera while on the \\"patrol\\" setting and could not hear the motor working. Excellent for covert and clandestine surveillance. The patrol setting is a function where the camera will automatically pan (or tilt) from one directional stop all the way to the other in both axis'.

Cons:

No Audio. Not only cannot I not use the audio IN function (to my MBP), I cannot use the audio out either (to the camera from my MBP). So, as a baby monitor, this is useless unless all you want is a camera. I know that some will retort and say \\"Just use IE and the audio will work\\" - NO. This camera is advertised as working with Mozilla, Safari, Mac, IPod, Ipad, and Iphone. There is nothing on the Foscam site (except for angry customer reviews) that even hint that the audio is only supported if you use a Microsoft product. So in other words, this fails to meet even a slight aspect of the mark advertised - hence the 3-stars.

I originally bought FI8905W cameras that crashed every few minutes following the first day of use then they stopped working all together - they got returned quickly. As this is only the 2nd day of use for this camera - only time will tell if this is better than the FI8905W's. I really hope so!

***UPDATE***

A tech support individual named \\"Zohaib\\" from Foscam emailed me today (only 2 days after submitting a support request - that was really fast) about not being able to get the audio to work while running Mozilla on a 10.8 Mac. His solution had NOTHING to do with Mozilla Firefox OR Mac. Their \\"help\\" only contained instructions on how to get it to work on Microsoft IE on Win 7 & 8. I do not think they even read the support email requests - they just respond by copying and pasting a random response probably from a grab bag of sorts. Maybe they throw darts at a board containing multiple solutions. Not happy Bob, not Happy.

I would return it because it is being sold under a completely false pretense of working with a Mac; however, the camera works great as a camera and it is the cheapest one I have been able to find. So, I will have to resign myself as voting 'for' their product in the current configuration and with the gross negligence in their marketing department by letting them keep my money - to my dismay. Because of their inability to even read my tech support request, I have downgraded my 3-star review to a 2 star review. Customer service should always play a very important role in any company's mission.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It does exactly what it's supposed to do, and does it well. I also use the motion and sound detection alarms to send me emails, and they work nicely as well. This is a great little device, and my only suggestion would be to allow upgrading firmware via WiFi (transfer and verify the firmware before loading it), so that it doesn't have to be direct connected to Ethernet to upgrade.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was introduced to this camera from a couple of co-workers. I bought it and the install wasn't quite as easy as I had initially thought. I'm not sure if it was me, my AT&T Uverse or just difficult. Either way, one phone call to the technical suport and I was up and running in no time. I now have it on my iPhone and can check on my home at any time. I can pan, tilt, etc. This is a really great product with a very resonable price and the customer service is great. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is the kind of product that makes me never want to buy consumer electronics again.  I write software for a living, so I know good or bad software when I see it.  These guys have done a TERRIBLE job with the software.  For example, want to change the admin password on your camera?  Better not, you'll get locked out and have to reset the camera to factory default settings, and redo all your settings.  Want to get the camera setup on your home network?  oh, dynamic IP address has to be manually enabled... but you get full instructions on how to hack around in subnet masks, so don't worry! ugh.  want to login to the camera with your browser?  oh, don't push THAT login button... it's only for internet explorer... use this OTHER special login button for other browsers.  Want to update the time and timezone on your camera?  No problem! Use the time sync via internet feature.  Oh by the way, that sets it wrong and you have to manually tick a box to do daylight savings... and then specify how much daylight savings you want, 0, 30 60, 90, or 120 minutes worth... no im not joking.  The software on this thing ruins the experience and they need to fire whoever wrote this crap and hire some better people.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We use a pair of these to watch the house (and cats) when we're on vacation.  They work extremely well for the price.  I wish they'd come out with an Android/iPhone app.  Right now you have to log in through the web and its a little cumbersome to navigate when on our phones.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I recently purchased one of these cameras for my brother because he had his bike stolen off of his porch.  He set the camera up and we are both able to access it via the Foscam iPhone app.  I thought it was pretty cool so I bought one too.  The setup is a bit tricky, as I was expecting from the other reviews on here.  I was able to follow the instructions that it came with to set it up and get it working wirelessly pretty easily.  I had a hard time getting it setup for remote access.  So I called Foscam's 24 hour customer support.  I didn't have to wait at all to talk to a representative and they were able to get me setup in just a few minutes.  Good customer support.  Camera works well.  Its not super high-res, but for the money I can't complain about it.  The voice feature is really cool, my brother and I can talk back and forth easily using the iPhone app.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Ordered two of these cameras a few weeks ago.  Using them pretty much as "nanny cams."  The Wi-fi set up was very easy. However, the port forwarding was a little complex for me. I'm pretty computer literate but it took me a while to find the right how to guide on line on how to set up port forwarding specific to my router company and computer (Mac).  Once I truly sat down with it I did figure it out and can now view the cam feeds from my iPhone.  Very happy so far with the quality of the images and overall performance of the cameras. The audio can be a little jumpy sometimes but it serves its purpose for instant communication.  I've shown the results to a few co-workers on my iPhone and several will be purchasing the cameras as well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have three and they work great. Some issues with the audible clicking from the infrared relay, but you can turn it off. The pan/tilt works smoothly and you can select an auto pan mode to scan a large room continuously. Wifi range is pretty good and setup is very easy. Tech support from Foscam is worth the extra money, since these cameras can fail occasionally. The included mounting bracket is nicely adjustable and the power adapter is compact. I wish these were available in a POE flavor or with power injectors. That would allow me to push power and network over a single cable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Little background - I've owned several different model Foscams, and set up some for family. We also use this as a baby monitor. I've worked with many different IP cameras, mainly 3-megapixel+ PoE security cams.
Setup is simple enough (although I am in IT field), plug this guy into your router - goto your router's arp table and match up the mac address from the bottom of the camera to figure out the IP. Pull up a webbrower, go configure your new camera, set a static IP if you want, and change your remote port, change login info etc. Go back to your router and setup port forwarding to that IP/port so you can view the camera remotely and you are done.

The camera is a decent quality camera, nothing crazy - although nice it now has a IR-cut filter and IR leds. Makes the colors better during the day. Works excellent in a pitch black room to watch the baby sleeping.

While the colors, accuracy and detail is not as good as some more expensive cameras, thats exactly the point - this is an inexpensive wireless IP camera that works.

It also supports two way audio and motion detection! The FosCam software shipped with the unit is easy to setup and internet access works fine. You can setup UserId and Password access. There are many camera applications available on the android applications market. I use TinyCam Pro. It work's fine for my implementation of the camera. Other software is available adding greater functionality and better support of multiple cameras (I. E. Blue Iris). I will be adding more of these cameras to my network in the future.

Thanks!
G.W.

review_body: Calvin gave excellent customer service, as he was very helpful and very patient in helping me with mobile and PC access directions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pan and tilt out of control
review_body:
I bought two of these and I have a problem that I cannot resolve through Foscam. What happens is that I use a home network that runs through coaxial cable and I use a converter box that Verizon provided to convert it to ethernet (cat 5e cable). The camera drops in and out of connection and tilts and pans constantly. I have to turn it off because it gets warm. It has no image and is useless.

I cannot recommend this product and also want to note that there's marginal support, it's by email only and takes at least a day or more to respond. They also have a policy of truncating their email so the question never is below in the email so you need to always retrieve the email you sent to them to review the answer.

While I tried resetting, firmware updates and the like, nothing works. FYI I use a Synology server with security station for software.

I understand that this may perhaps be an issue with the converter box Verizon furnished, and they are equally useless in their support.

Again, do not get this product, at least in the environment I use it for....with coax as cable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: okay hardware, buggy software with big security issue
review_body: I purchased from ebay but decided to write a review about this. The hardware is okay, however, the software is a huge disappointment. It's like written by a teenage. Due to a recent hack on the news, I decided to upgrade the firmware. After going through the upgrade instruction, I decided to give up. It's insanely complicated!!! Things like you have to find out what your existing version is, if it's before this version, you need to get this firmware, otherwise get that firmware. If you made a mistake, you will brick the device!!! You will also need to physically connect the device to a router through ethernet cable to do the upgrade. I finally decided to give up...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great value, picture is really good.
review_body:
I've been looking into getting a webcam to use as a child video monitor for a while. After some investigation, this Foscam was recommended. After a quick setup with my router (I did not use the included software), I had it up and running. The picture is great, and I finally got the audio to work. The only two issues I have with the camera are:
1. Apparently setting the IP as a static address was not successful - if the power goes out or the unit is unplugged, a new one is assigned when it reconnects. Not a big deal, I just find that new address via the router portal.
2. I can't seem to get the audio to play through my laptop. I've tried to download the plugins, etc....but I assume this is an issue on my end, since I can get audio through the phone/tablet app (IP Cam Viewer on Android).
2. I can't seem to get the microphone feature to work yet (me talking through the camera with my laptopm, phone or tablet.)

Overall, this camera is awesome and we'll be buying another for baby #2.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Worked great until new firmware update to fix security hole *UPDATE*
review_body:
I have been using this camera for about a month with no problems. I read all the bad reviews and made a list of all the features that people claimed didn't work and I tested everything on my camera and it all worked perfectly. For a non-HD camera the video quality over wireless was really good.

That is until about two weeks ago when I got an email from Foscam asking me to update to the newest Firmware to fix a security issue on the camera. (Apparently they had been receiving some bad press about it) So, I followed their instructions and updated to the newest firmware and now the camera no longer works using wireless. This makes the camera absolutely useless to me. I also found that you cannot downgrade the firmware. I'm still hoping that they will release another firmware soon to fix this.

I started with firmware version: 11.37.2.49
and updated to: 11.37.2.51

I found on the Foscam forums that there are two different firmwares for the FI8910W depending on the serial number. I verified that this is the correct version for my model camera.

Serial numbers with VNT in them should upgrade to firmware versions 11.22.2.xx
Serial numbers with FR in them should upgrade to firmware versions 11.37.2.xx

**Update**
I checked the Foscam support website again this weekend and found that there was another new firmware update for my camera. Version 11.37.2.52 was available so I downloaded it and updated the camera and now the wireless is working again. I added an extra star because this is a great camera when everything is working. If I hadn't had to wait 3 weeks for a firmware update to fix an issue with a previous firmware update, this camera would have received 5 stars easily.

review_body: I have been using this for a while now (about nine months) and the wireless feature works great.  The Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera works very well. I have mounted the camera under a dome (" 7" Outdoor Dome Encloser for Loftek Foscam) without the cover outside attached to my garage overlooking my driveway, front door and the side of my home. Even though the camera is I belive should be used inside I have used it outside this whole time in the rain and fog (again it is in a enclosure but extends out from the bottom about 7 inches in the elements. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I ordered this camera to be used as a baby monitor. Even though I my job entails me operating a CCTV system of almost 500 cameras, I have actually never set one up. So I bought this camera well before the baby was due so I could play with it and see how to set it up and operate it.

For the most part, it is exactly what I wanted. The picture is clear, but obviously not HD quality (I could not justify spending an extra $100 for the FI9821W which does 720P, when the video monitor end of this set-up is a non-retina screen iPod touch or our android phones). However it is very usable for our intended use.

For night viewing, you will need to use the IR lighting on the camera, which does put the camera in \\"Black & white\\" mode. Any camera that uses IR for night time viewing will do this.

The instructions that come with the camera (10 page, 3” X 5” booklet) are about as worthless as possible. Instead of calling Foscam, I used the instructions on this website: [...] so that made things MUCH easier.

I also am not using the “Blue Iris” program to access the camera. Once you figure out the IP address of the camera you access the camera through a web browser, there is an on screen interface you can use. It is about a 1 second delay from moving the camera (via web interface) to the camera actually moving. I know the camera works with Chrome and IE. With Chrome you can basically move the camera, and that is about it. With IE, you can configure the camera just about any way you want, including setting up various log-in’s and what access they have to the camera. The access levels are “Admin”, which gives that person complete control over everything the camera is capable of. “Second level is “User,” which allows someone to control the camera (but not change settings). The last is “Guest,” which only allows someone to see the video feed. Each user has their own sign-in and password that someone with “Admin” privileges can set.

The bad thing is the camera has “reset” it self about once every 3 weeks. When this happens, the camera goes back to the factory default home position and sets the IR filter to “auto” (IR comes on when the light levels are low). It has not wiped any of the preset positions I set, or any of the users.

On the home WiFi, we are getting about 45 Frames per second day time, and 60 at night with the IR. If we access the camera with our cell phones (using LTE cell data, not wifi) we get 20 FPS day time and 25 FPS at night.

Overall I am happy with the camera, and would suggest it as a baby monitor.

I did knock a star off for the random resets, and the lack of abilities you have with Crome

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: product is fair, support technician was devious and admitted using fake name
review_body:
Ok, I had quite an experience last night with Foscam technical support. I have very limited experience with surveillance cameras, I operate a small restaurant and have tested a Dropcam (which works very well) and now this Foscam. My goal is to eventually have a nine or ten camera system for monitoring staff and customer activity and for security.

Product: Camera works very well but does not have built-in recording capability. Foscam provides software that enables you to use your own dedicated PC to record. Foscam's product description doesn't mention that you need a PC for this.

Customer support: During install I was able to get all the way to the final step of turning up the camera from my laptop, thus my call for support. The rep with a Fillipino accent told me his name is 'Irish' but later admitted it was a fake name. The phone connection was poor, he was on a wireless phone, and it seemed like a difficult language barrier so I didn't mind when he suggested I allow him to remotely access my computer although looking back now I feel like it was his goal to act confused in order to gain access. 'Irish' turned up the camera so quickly I barely followed and he didn't try to explain the process. When I asked how to record he quickly suggested that I should open my email, which I did but with discomfort that he was remotely attached while I entered my username and password. The end result was that he showed me how the system could send snapshots to my email, which was not really a solution to my need for recording and I started to wonder what was really going on here. I decided to end the call but then he insisted that I open my Amazon account while he was still attached and he insisted I write a review right then. I told him I preferred to write a review after some time to use the product but he started offering me discounts to purchase additional equipment in exchange for a favorable review, so I went along with it at that moment. He ended the call very shortly after he got his review and didn't even bother to make sure I had the correct info to restart the camera on my own. Fortunately I was able to figure that out because I wasn't about to call back. After realizing I had just let a stranger on the phone remotely access my computer and watch me log on to email and my Amazon account I went back into both accounts and changed my passwords. This was a lesson for me. If in the future I have problems with this camera I will use email and online support and not let them log on to my computer again.

Update 8-30-13 I've looked into options for continuous recording and realize that this is not the product for me even though they list recording as a feature of this camera. I plan to return the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

There are quite a few iOS/Android Apps to help you get going to monitor your place. The instructions to set this up is quite easy. Its straight forward and to the point. The only thing i can point out is that you should update the firmware on these cameras because they do not come updated at all.

Theres also an issue with the camera resetting when it points outside with reflective light. Not sure what the issue is, my camera reset once in the garage because light was reflected on it. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
At first I thought this was a great product, but it falls short, way short.

Pros:
- Well built
- Great picture
- Price
- Built-in DDNS
- The very bad broken English and mispronouncements in the video, on the CD, were very entertaining.

Cons:
- Although email is set up and tested and email alert set for motion detection, I do not get an alert when motion is detected, even though it shows motion detection in the log.
- Most functionality is lost without Windows IE and active-x control. No ability to record video without it. I failed to get it working with active-x via two different PC's, even though the active-x control is installed. The FAQ wants you to basically drop all security you have against malicious active-x, which is something you don't want to do.
- The only means to upload an image is with FTP, yet another major security risk. Some sort of cloud based storage compatibility would have been nice.
- The preset function never worked.

All I have right now is a camera I can log in to at the house or remotely, via non-IE browsers, and move it around live. With none of the functionalities listed above, this is pretty much useless to me.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: easy steps if you are patient
review_body:
this is a fantastic product for its price. i bought this product since to monitor my house remotely when i am away.

It took me 30mins to set it up. It comes with quick installation manual which I read to see if I understood all the steps or not and then followed it. If you are patient enough to go through these you will be streaming video with audio in 30mins.
First - it takes you step by step on how to set it up with wired connection to your router.
Second - it shows you how to set up the wireless connection.
Third - all the fun stuff about recording and installing multi camera, etc.

For me, I stopped on second. I am probably need another to dedicate another 30mins of time and figure out how much I want to record, format, etc. but I have no intention of doing it now.

For the picture quality and audio it is an excellent camera for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: After I bought this camera, I was so concerned that the setup might be so incredibly complicated so I read many reviews and discussion on the foscam forum. However, I got my self even more confused so I decided just to follow the instructions provided in the enclosed booklet.  I have an Apple Extreme Airport and a Macbook.  It turned out to be quite easy at the end.  I followed their instructions using ip camera tool and set up the wireless connection.  I then used the ip camera tool to change the port # and used the airport utility to port-forward the camera.  Bingo! I found the camera on the web.  I deducted 1 star because Foscam doesn't provide a decent iphone app.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
[[VIDEOID:mo2NAKLNYTU6N12]]I'm amazed at how good this product is for the money.

I tried for days to snap a photo of whatever animals in our rear yard were tearing up the soil. Our yard is flat but then drops off into a small canyon where we know there are mountain lions, and deer regularly come into the yard during the day. But some other creature is making a mess of the lawn (besides the gophers that is). I used my DSLR camera but had to leave the light on in the yard for that to take photos. I took 900 photos over three nights, one per minute, but caught nothing. I thought about getting an IR camera but expected them to be well into the multiple hundred dollars. This one surprised me.

I received the Foscam F18910W today, took it out of the box, connected it to the router and it came right up working. The documentation gives quite a few steps to get it working but much of it was automatic on my computer. It didn't take more than a couple of minutes to get the WiFi working too. It also showed up on my iPod Touch browser easily as soon as I entered the IP address of the camera. My setup time from box to working on the WiFi was less than 10 minutes but then I'm tech savvy.

Tonight I set the camera up on a small tripod under the covered patio and aimed it at the area I wanted to watch all night. I'm quite pleased that the IR lights up the area quite well. I can easily see 30 feet of the back yard clearly.

For a camera with built in WiFi, that can be tilted and panned from the computer, that lights up the yard at night on the video, I'm quite pleased.

Of course it would be nice to have HD video but the 0.3MP image is quite enough for us to see what animals come into the yard.

The only problem I had was when I tried to record the video on my desktop computer the recorded files were not in the designated folder. It took me a couple of hours to get it working with the help of some Google searches. The problem was solved by running the 32 bit version of IE on my 64 bit system. Strange and a bit of a pain but at least it works.

I have it configured to alarm when something moves in the yard, and to send me email with photos when it does. Fortunately there is no wind tonight so it won't be sending me photos all night long.

The feature I wish it had would be if I could limit the horizontal scan. That is: there is a button to have the camera do a Horizontal Patrol but it swings from end to end, an arc of something like 270 degrees. I would like to limit both ends so it only swings about 150 degrees. But I can't find any controls for that desirable feature.

I expect soon we'll know what animal is tearing up our yard.

8/30/13 We discovered it has been a raccoon tearing up our grass. I'll add a short video.

I'm very pleased with the operation of the camera. It has not dropped the WiFi connection after 3 days. It also automatically switches from IR to non-IR as the sun comes up and visa-versa at night.

UPDATE 9/11/2013
This camera did exactly what we needed it to do. We were able to watch video of 4 skunks and a raccoon being caught in the traps placed by a professional trapper over a five night period. However I did find some bugs.

1) The alarm feature has a time setting to disable alarms during the periods selected. It never worked for me. I would get alarms no matter how I set up that time control. The alarms would send me email, with photos, day or night even though I tried to disable daytime alarms. I got so many alarms that I had to disable them.

2) Alarms would be triggered by the wind blowing the trees and bushes which is understood. But even on a calm night with the alarm sensitivity set to 7 or 8 it completely missed the large raccoon 8 to 10' from the camera.

3) I think there is supposed to be a feature to capture video when an alarm goes off. I was capturing video24/7 so that may override the alarm video feature. But in any case it never recorded a video on an alarm.

4) I set the date and time in the camera but all video files, showing the date and time within the video frame, were totally wrong in date and time. Not even this decade.

Otherwise it did the trick. If I had it to do over again I'd buy the HD version so I could see more detail.24/7 so that may override the alarm video feature. But in any case it never recorded a video on an alarm.

4) I set the date and time in the camera but all video files, showing the date and time within the video frame, were totally wrong in date and time. Not even this decade.

Otherwise it did the trick. If I had it to do over again I'd buy the HD version so I could see more detail.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The features are very plentiful on this model, and the price vs a dropcam is wonderful.  The pan-tilt works very well, and the wireless signal is great.  The software to view is exceptional on any platform - the app for android is great, and even viewing from any we browser is fully functional.  The setup is what brings the rating down for me.  Getting the camera on my local network was simple, but the DDNS server setup does not like to work with every router.  So to view from my phone or from work without paying for one of the supported DDNS options, I had to use port forwarding on my router.  This is fine unless you're like me and have a dynamic IP address, which means I will have to update how I access the camera away from home.  The dropcam handles this much better.  If you are decently tech savy, or at least patient enough to read how to setup the camera for port forwarding and don't mind having to update your remote settings every few months, this camera is a bargain.

review_headline: Frequently drops off network, requires power cycle! Bad design or just inferior product?
review_body:
I purchased 2 of these cameras to use in my home (one for security, one as a baby monitor). The instructions to set this up were reasonable easy to follow. However, the problems on both cameras started very early on. The camera would drop off the network, and would not reconnect. So I am realistic and I know that network drops on even the best WiFi networks can happen. But the device would literally not reconnect. You had to power cycle it (i.e. unplug it) to get it back on the network. Not an easy proposition if you've placed the camera in a hard to reach place, or if you have to go into your sleeping childs room at night if you're using this as a baby monitor and wake him up fiddling with power cords in the dark.

I worked with Foscam support for weeks...they tried all the usual suggestions (update firmware, check and verify no other wifi networks using same channel nearby, etc). Nothing panned out. They also tried the "maybe this is interference from an appliance" excuse...except all the other devices on the same network DO NOT DROP. Also, I even tried placing a d-link camera in the same room in the same location to test that theory, and it never dropped (when the others continued to do so).

Foscam support finally recommended I exchange the cameras, but the chance of both cameras being bad were pretty slim. Thus, I will return both for a refund. i cannot recommend this product.

PS: They advertise that this camera works with iPhone and iPad, but people should be aware that they do not make their own app. Without a 3rd party app (most of which you must pay for) you will not get sound on iPhone or iPad. That seemed a bit deceptive to me.

review_headline: video is fine, on-board speaker stopped working
review_body:
This IP camera works great as a video and audio feed, but the on-board speaker stopped working on all 3 cameras I've purchased. My current two cameras have been through 4 months of continuous, daily use. I returned one of these, a refurbished one I got on sale, because of the speaker problem - only to have the new unit and the old unit crap out on me at nearly the same time (about 2 months into use)

I'm giving this item 3 stars because the video is cool and so is the on-board microphone. We did not have any of the microphone issues others have commented on. 2 points off for advertising a product as two-way, then not performing as such.

As an aside, I'm using the iPhone foscam software and my wife is using the android version - the speaker does not work for either phone on either ip camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If your intended purpose is to view the camera’s video on your internal wireless network, this camera is fine. It is very easy to install and to accomplish such a task. The Foscam website has good instruction videos.

However, if you want to access the camera from the internet when you are away from home, it will be difficult to nearly impossible to accomplish. Direct streaming via HTTP for remote access requires “port forwarding.” After spending a week trying, I gave up. I do not believe it is the fault of Foscam, I think this problem exists with all IP cameras requiring port forwarding for direct streaming. I highly suspect that my ISP (Comcast) has control of all my ports. I called Comcast many times; they have mysteriously hanged up my phone during several of these sessions, exactly when I asked them about the ports.

I called Foscam three times; their technicians were courteous and willing to help. From their end’s examination, my port forwarding setting is set up correctly. They tried and I also tried, using my phone’s mobile network, to remotely access my camera – but without success.

Regarding the software – the ip camera tool is very difficult to set up for recording on your hard drive. It appears to be recording using avi file format, but if you go to the path where you saved the file, nothing existed. I am using IE8, and the live video only can be viewed on 32-bit, not with a 64-bit IE8 browser. Google’s Chrome also works, and actually it is easier to take a snap shot from there.
Another issue I discovered, regarding the ip camera tool, is that I was unable to successfully add another Foscam on the multi-device setting, so I can view both my cameras on the same page.

The only internet access that I managed to make work is using the FTP setting on the camera. The host website I use is Mangocam. However, with this method you cannot control the camera, so there is no pan and tilt. Also, the frame rate is poor. The free subscription on Mangocam is one camera with 1fps. You can also schedule video recordings with the free subscription, which works pretty good. Higher frame rates are available with paid subscriptions.

I would like to know which ISPs will allow the customers to control some of the ports for personal IP camera monitoring purposes. It seems that security cameras now the day are everywhere. I assumed it would be a breeze to connect an IP camera to my existing ISP broadband connection. But I was shocked to discover that many ISPs will not allow this function.

review_body:
Don't expect a really great camera but it does get the job done. I've had it for almost a year now and its worked well. No issues except that 6 months into the life of mine, the IR cut just decided to turn off by itself. I didn't know this until i needed to see a room at night and didn't understand why i didn't see the low green glow of the room. Foscam has come a long way with their products and software.

Love the motion and sound sensor, but it really is too sensitive for what number its selected for. But i think thats a software problem. Other than software, this is a great pan/tilt security camera and has a speaker in case you need to speak to someone on the other side of the camera. Their software also allow for preset locations for your camera to remember.

TIP: for you mobile phone users, find the mobile app "IP cam viewer" and you'll have more peace of mind being able to see your cameras on the go.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've been using about 7 of these cameras for 4 years.  They are reliable, all still running fine.  One is still running fine even after 2 years in a humid high heat environment, i.e. a garage in Florida.  The other great feature is that the Foscam is more secure than many other brands. Some cameras have an "easy" setup, but require that you use the manufacturer's website to set the camera password.  How smart is that?  (... as in "I'm sure the employees of the firm will never look" or "the company doesn't have any foreign ownership.")  When you set this camera up, there is no intermediary organization.  It's just you, the camera, and your router.  It's as secure as you are, or at least, as secure as these things get.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this camera, after finding that someone had been in my home. It's a little more reassuring that I can check on my home anytime I feel the need. The live feed is great, and the installation wasn't too bad. If you're tech savvy, you should have no problem (and even if you're not - the manual and online assistance is great!). The sound quality is great, as well as the night vision! You can set up a schedule for the times during the day/week that it should alarm you for motions and sounds detected. You can also adjust the sensitivity, so if you have animals, it doesn't go off every 3 seconds. I'd recommend this camera to anyone looking for a quality IP camera. Its definitely worth the buck, and it has an app for androids and iphones which comes in handy when you're not on your home network.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

It turns to a certain spot then you have to go back the other way.  Don't get me wrong it's like 340 degrees so it's not bad just note that.  It was really easy to set up and the email feature is really neat too.  Two way audio is ehhhh but you aren't ordering it for the audio.

review_headline: needed help? call Derrick at foscam us.
review_body:
I purchased this camera, went step by step with the install; could only view while on my network even after setting up port forwarding. I called support spoke with Derrick which was about two minutes before end of day. He was very helpful, he took control of my PC and checked the settings; while I was on the phone with him I lost the connection.... he opened up a notepad and asked if I was still here. I was able to still communicate with him, and he said that he had fixed the Thank you so much Derrick was almost ready to send it back. He went the EXTRA mile Thanks again Derrick!!!!!!!!!!!

Stephen Crossett

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I needed help with setting up the cameras remotely to access it from outside my network. Ralph Mendez. He did an excellent job in helping with my issue. The product is very good and am looking to purchase another.
