product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I purchased this camera to setup surveillance around my garage and the patio area.  I needed help setting up wireless remote and port forwarding, so I called Foscam tech support.  I was able to get hold off, Irish, who was able to help me setup wireless remote and port forward after 30 minutes or so.  Irish was a great help and I wouldn't be able setup myself.  Thank you Irish for all your help, you're great!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: These cameras are as addictive as alcohol or drugs
review_body:
These cameras are as addictive as alcohol or drugs. Once you set them up and can see what you need to see, you will find they become a part of your life like the doors or windows. If they turn off for some reason you will feel anxious and want to immediately restore them to functional condition.

I have a battery of these cameras covering the house. The monitor seriously feels like one of the windows. But instead of having to go to the window, move the curtains, and then look out, I just glance at the monitor. It is impossible to describe how life changing it is to be able to see what is going on outside of the house without having to look out a window or go outside.

The neighbor's cats are always crawling around outside. If I hear a noise I can just look at the monitor to see if it is them or a person instead of having to go outside. Racoons are also always making a racket I always had to check on. Now I sit and watch them on the monitor while they snoop around.

The cameras are a fantastic help with the delivery guys. Since I put one up on the doorway all of my packages are laid very carefully on the steps instead of being hurled up there like they used to be. The delivery guys are always polite and smiling when they see the camera looking at them.

I even ended up putting a monitor in every room to watch them. If I am cooking I can see who is at the door or out front. If I am in bed I can see what is going on. If I am in the dining room or living room I don't have to move a muscle to see who is knocking.

I would not install them in the interior of a house though. The hacking threat is too great.

You will find a million and one uses for these cameras and you will never be able to stop watching them once they are installed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Had a problem setting up the camera. Called customer support and a gentleman named Calvin walked my through everything from email setup to port forwarding. He did it all remotely.
The camera works wonderfully. Going on vacation and now I will be able to view everything in color. I can even talk into the camera from my iPhone.
Awesome!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good camera for a great price.  Michelle from tech support did a great job helping with the setup.  Very happy with my purchase

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased three of these cameras for home and office and I am impressed with the quality of video and sound.
The setup was a bit difficult but the 24 hour tech support was able to login into my computer and setup quickly.
I recommend that you pay the $5.00 for the Ipad program Foscam Pro to fully use all the options on these cameras.

I plan on buying two more of these cameras-
I haven't figured out how to use the built in Microphone yet.
Great overall product and great tech support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Love the camera, use 2 in our home to keep an eye remotely on our dog who has separation anxiety.
the service I got from Kate at foscam in configuring remotely the camera was outstanding,she is a real professional and knows her stuff.I would highly recommend this camera to anyone needing security or baby cam type camera. Dr. Lewis Beddall

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: 100 % Satisfied with the product. And it is excaty as advertised and even comes with a free dydns service. Thanks

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Returned the Wansview camera because it wasn't showing green colors at all. But never got it to work with external access either.

Bought the Foscam to replace it because of the IR filter and the report that Foscam had better tech support than the non-existant support of Wansview.

Well. #1, green worked! Yay! Nice to have green in your pictures after all!

#2. While I had no problem getting the camera going wireless on our home network, and felt pretty good I'd done port forwarding correctly on my Netgear R6300 router. . . still no joy on external access.

So I called Foscam Tech support. They were able to do a remote session, sign on to my computer, determine that my Comcast business internet ISP was the issue (it had a separate firewall setting that also needed port forwarding set in it), log into that and do it. . . and now my camera is viewable remotely from the public internet on my wife's smartphone and everybody is happy.

I never, ever would have figured that out on my own, particularly since I actually called Comcast *first* to see if they might be the issue, and they claimed it was nothing to do with them! So I believed them!

So thanks, Foscam, you made a very happy customer!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I own three of the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Cameras. I did a considerable amount of research prior to purchasing this and found it provided capabilities better than cameras costing hundreds more.

My criteria was I needed something 100% reliable that I could access from anywhere in the world with a web browser. (I have had no issues with the cameras dropping off line due to network issues. They have excellent reliability so I can be gone for an extended period of time and still monitor my home.)

I needed a camera that did not use much internet bandwidth (this camera achieves that by only using bandwidth when you actually are asking it to send video plus you can record video locally without using outside bandwidth.)

I needed something that could sense motion and/or sound and send me photos of the activity.

I didn't want to upgrade my home network. I have a 12 year old wireless router. All three cameras work quite well and even work with my old G wireless router even when all three are sending video at once and someone else is using our network as well.

The last nice thing is the setup was easy. I set it up using the CD (no issue there) and with DDNS but found I didn't really need to use that at all. The fact the camera will send me an email if my IP should change covers that. So far my Comcast based IP has never changed (in two years).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you are technical (know networking) this is a great product to use.

The setup can be very difficult. If you are not comfortable with router/networking technology. Dont even bother.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was having an issue with port forwarding.  I called Andrew at Foscam and he was very helpful.  They set up everything for me while on the phone in a matter of minutes.  The camera works flawlessly day and night.  Will purchase more from Foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Yhe camera wworks good and have good tec support. It has a real good pic. and turns a a good speed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is impossible to set up without having access to the router. None of this information was present on the add. Expected plug and play and instead got a camera that is useless to me.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This works great to check on my senior age cats when away from home. I love that I can pan and tilt to look for them if not sleeping in their usual places as their food bowls are their second favorite place. I was also pleased to find third party software that will allow me to zoom digitally if I need to. I have used the microphone too, but there is seldom anything to hear.

Being wireless, it is easy to move if I want to also. I had it on our DRY front porch to watch a nest of baby birds until they fledged this summer.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Bad quality and even worse customer service
review_body:
I ordered this camera from amazon and was good for few months then got very faded image colors.

I emailed Foscam customer service and they said they can replace it. However I have to pay the shipping for both ways because it was not ordered from Foscam directly. After I paid and I got a replaced camera, only camera and cable, nothing else, which makes it like a refurbished one.

The replaced one works for only two weeks and the same problem happened again, faded colors. I was very frustrated and emailed Foscam customer service, no response. Then I called the customer service, and I was told I need to pay shipping for both ways again if I want it to be replaced. I'm not happy with this answer since I don't want to keep paying for something without quality control. and then I was given someone's name and was told if I email her directly, my problem will be solved. Then I emailed, no response again. Then I emailed customer service again, still no response.

Now I don't know what I should do. I won't recommend this camera to anyone, especially for this worst customer service I have ever experienced.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I did not like the Internet security aspects of this device so I am returning it. Their DDNS site is enabled by default even though it says it is Disabled by default. Once that site gets your IP address it is latched on to it just like any DNS site so even once you turn off the DDNS it will still resolve to your IP address. If you have a static IP I don't know if there is anyway to disassociate the address.

I ran a one of the built in cgi scripts get_params.cgi and this will show your unencrypted WiFi password if you have already set that up.
I was not too happy with that feature. I am looking for a security camera that has better built in Internet security.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works well, easy to setup, quality is right for the price
review_body: For the money this is fantastic.  I was able to easily set it up (minutes) and it works well.  You really need to use Internet Explorer to get the most from it (recording)  I haven't been able to find 3rd party software that works with it.  It would be nice if there were support outside of the browser capabilities but again for what it costs it's worked well and has a lot of cool features. (scanning, recording, nightvision)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam will not stand by product if purchased on Amazon
review_body: The camera only worked for nine months.  It's still under warranty but Foscam is giving me the run-around because I bought the camera from Amazon.com.  I'm very unhappy with this company. BEWARE!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this camera when it had a promotion for under $70. My expectations were mid-range to low, but I have been pleasantly surprised. Nice work Foscam! It is a lot of fun to check up on the family when I am away from the house. I can't convince the wife that I need more than one of these toys but I hope to invest in the outdoor camera soon.

Getting it to work through the router might be a little advanced for may users. Luckily, it worked like a charm after I set up port forwarding.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this as a reasonably priced solution to a monitor in our baby's room - there's a reason it's cheaper than the other video monitors we were looking at.  We really wanted to be able to view the "live feed" on our iPhones, but I could hardly get it set up to work on the computer.  If you're IT savvy, you may be just fine, but I struggled to set it up and eventually gave up and returned it.  Even tried a tutorial online and maybe I just don't know the jargon well, but it was a pain in the butt to set up.  Looking into just getting an app that costs $60 less and works the same with less set up!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buyer Beware - No Support If You Buy From Amazon
review_body:
This is not a product review, but a review of buying this product from Amazon. On Foscam's website is this:

\\"Please Note: In order to receive free telephone based technical support as well as our domestic (US/Canada/UK) 1 year replacement warranty, you must purchase your camera directly from Foscam.us using the online checkout system on this website. Please select your quantity and click \\"Add to Cart\\" below\\"

Therefore no tech support if you do not buy directly from them.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It is a very neat and clear two-way camera. It also captures sounds quite well. You can also pan and tilt it remotely. I wish it had easier setup for, for instance recording videos to a computer. I am sure I will figure that out soon, that and port-forwarding for remote monitoring.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is the 2nd one I had to return due to not being able to get it/them to connect wirelessly.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Foscam service had me up and running in five minutes.  Andrew the service tech was excellent.  I cannot say enough about their tech service.  I'll let you know about the camera after I have worked with for a while.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: i had a little trouble with installation, so I called Irish at the Foscam customer support and got fast accurate help!! I highly reccommend this camera for the price / customer service / and usefulness!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: i have bought many cameras and by far this is one of the best ones works great you should buy it

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
product was very good, but installation manual wasn't quite right. I had to call foscam and wait almost 2 hours to get thru. After that everything was smooth.
If manual was right in first place I would give 5 star.
Wasted my valuable time to talk to service rep. Overall I am happy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Quality of Video not what I expected
review_body: When first connected by wire I was able to view the video and move the camera.  I had some trouble getting the wireless to work but after a dozen tries it finally worked.  It works in all the rooms inside my 1,100 square foot home.  Trying to take video of the outside with the camera inside was a problem at night.  The window reflected the IR light ring and you could not see outside.  I expected a higher resolution from the color video.  It is an OK camera.  I have not yet set it up for viewing outside my home wireless.  It seems time consuming to do it so I have put it off for a later date.  If you don't have any experience setting up wireless systems I don't recommend it.  I purchased it to get familiar with using a wireless camera.  For that purpose the cost is reasonable.  Storing images takes a lot of memory and I would recommend using a separate computer solely for this purpose.  Works better with Internet Explorer for me.  Firefox seemed to have some setup issues more that Internet Explorer.  It appears that different version of IE and Firefox respond differently to the Foscam camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: As other reviewers have stated, these are not the easiest buggers to get connected. I did finally figure it out, but it was a frustrating process of looking up youtube videos and googling other information. Finally got it, but it did take awhile. Still, now that that part is done, I really like them.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera and great customer service
review_body:
We bought this camera to keep an eye on dog and her newborn puppies, and to share the view with family, friends, and prospective adopters. Puppy Cam was up and running wirelessly in less than an hour--the initial setup is pretty straightforward for an advanced amateur computer user, but novices may find it a bit trickier. Features we love are the ability to pan and tilt remotely and the night vision.

I did run into the problem of my home wireless network changing the IP address of the camera slightly; I hadn't installed the included IP Camera Tool software, which I should have done, bc it shows you the camera's current IP address (you can also see this from your wireless router's control panel). Andrew and Judy with Foscam technical support were very helpful over the phone, helped me set a static IP address for the camera and get the camera live and running again in just a few minutes.

In short, a great product with great features, and great technical support from Foscam when needed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: the motor stopped going up and down after only a couple of months. Only goes from side to side now.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: These are great cameras for the price. It's a very difficult setup for remote access for any novice computer user. Foscam's tech support was great. I called and they set the whole thing up for me remotely. Derrick was very helpful. I will buy more of these cameras and I recommend the product and company to anyone.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: After buying the Motorola Blink1 Wi-Fi Video Camera for Remote Viewing with iPhone and Android Smartphones and Tablets from my local baby store, I was dissatisfied.  More accurately, my computer engineer husband was dissatisfied.  It required that you use their website and go through their network and the thing was really expensive.  So, after doing some research we purchased the Foscam.  We are very pleased with this purchace!  It is a third of the price of the other camera, you can put it on your own home network and download the app you wish to use on your phone or tablet.  The only features this camera is lacking from the other is the ability to play lullabies and tell me the temp in the baby's room, these are things I don't really care about anyway.  I love that this camera pans and tilts and has infrared.  I can even see my baby breathing at night, his chest rising and falling, the picture quality is so great!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: YouTube setup videos and it is easy to get this camera set up to access anywhere.  It does help having some networking knowledge though.  The only thing I have to complain is that I still have issues getting it to send alarms to my gmail.  There is a suggested email provider for this but I have not tried to get it to work with that yet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This IP camera works just as hoped it would. It took just a few minutes to get it running and connected to my wireless network. Once that was done, controlling the camera from my laptop, phone, and tablet was very easy. I can move the camera to different locations in my house, and within seconds of plugging it in, it is back on my wireless network and visible from my computer and other devices.

I have used this mostly for monitoring my 2-year-old daughter, who just transitioned from a crib to a toddler bed. We initially wanted to keep an eye on her due to her newly discovered ability to get out of bed. That is no longer a problem, but we still keep the camera in her room for piece of mind.

My only complaints/issues:
I haven't figured out how to get audio to work on a Macbook Pro or Windows PC. I have used different browsers with no luck. That's not much of a problem, though, as I use my iPad to monitor the live video, and the app I use has perfect two-way audio. That brings me to my only other complaint...the lack of an iOS and/or Android app provided by Foscam. When I purchased this cameral, I assumed the manufacturer would have their own app and that it would be free to use. I assumed wrong. You have to use third-party apps, some of which are free. However, the free ones, as you would expect, have very few features. Most, if not all, do not allow two-way audio. To get full functionality, plan on spending $3 to $6 for a good iOS app.

Despite those issues, I still love the camera, and I will probably get another one in the near future.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I needed help adding a second Foscam FI8910W camera.  Calvin was great. He got the extra camera working very quickly and everything is working fine.  Thank you.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Our preferred baby-cam paired with iOS viewing device
review_body:
We bought this after trying out a few baby cams for our newbown... what we found is that most baby cams are cheaply built, are feature poor and the last one we had actually crippled our 2.4GHz wifi.

The night vision is really cool, pan/tilt works great, and it is very feature rich with things such as mirror/flip if you have to mount it upside-down such as we had to.

The interface is a really neat web UI directly on the camera... you'd be well advised to plug it on via ethernet to program it, then move it to wifi afterward.

Ours has been rock steady, no issues to report. We like to use it on our iPhones/iPad with the FoscamPro paid software available on the apple store. You'll get several hours of viewing time, but it'll wear out your phone rapidly, similar to watching a movie or such, the iPad will go for a LONG time tho.

Recommended!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We bought this to use as a baby monitor.  The baby has not arrived yet so I can't speak to how well it works for that but I'm extremely impressed with the functionality of this camera so far. Some of my favorite features are that you can save multiple preset positions, so you don't have to scan all over, so I have set presets on the crib, rocking chair, door, etc.  The receiving audio seems to work well, I'm not sure how consistent the transmitting audio works yet, and I also have not had a chance to play around too much with the motion detection feature.  Considering how well the wireless works, and the multitude of great features, this camera is an unbelievable deal.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great camera for the amount of money spent. Software just needs to be updated so it makes it easier to install and manage.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This has been a great way to watch our little one. The IR view is perfect at night. The image is by no means HD, and there's no zoom feature, but for the price I don't mind at all.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: irish is very helpful from Foscam customer support
review_body:
Love this cam clear and can be useful for my family.....
Best security system so far, I have Dlink cam which is not comparable to Foscam at all...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Ma'am is happy with her CAM
review_body: I bought this camera after reading all the reviews. I was scared to get it because I never bought something like this before and after reading some reviews, some say Don't install the CD it comes with (I thought oh darn there goes the easy of it) and some nice reviewers even gave what they call pretty easy instructions (I thought I can do this) but they were right!!  Don't try it on your own if you have only a little knowledge. Knowing your router# is not enough lol! Anyway I ended up calling Sarah @ Foscam and she hooked it right up for me. I'm up and running and this is the best buy I ever did for home security, it tilts, it pans your perimeter, you have the control to stop and go and it's clear not fuzzy like some might say...I only have it for the day so my best review at the moment is I'm not disappointed and I would buy another one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Will keep it simple. Overall good camera. Well built.
Con: zoom would be nice, and software needs improvement
That being said, it's a bit overpriced and could use some more features before deserving 5 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased two Foscam from amazon back in June. But I was not able to set up the remote
access. Two cams worked fine in sending in alarm emails. After about two month, I found
one cam stopped sending alarm email, which the other continues to work fine. I called
the customer service, Alen Smith helped me fix the problem and also he helped me set up
the remote control. He's very professional and very patient. The customer service
was great, much better than some other big companies. I only give four start because
one of the cam suddenly stopped working for now reason ( I didn't change any settings).
That was kind of weird. The other cam, which was set in identical way, however, never
failed. Overall Foscam is a very decent option.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had to contact support for help setting up the camera. Felix had me up and going very quickly! So far the camera and features are just what I expected.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I needed help setting up my new foscam camera for remote viewing, and Irish Cena was extremely helpful in accomplishing this. He was able to remotely access my computer (with my permission of course) and I was able to sit back and watch him set it up for me in minutes, what would have taken me hours! Excellent service! very polite and knowledgeable! Great Job Foscam!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good luck if you buy this product. Setting the camera up to connect with your internal router is very easy. But configuring it to be accessible from the internet is like trying to learn German from a French textbook. A round robin of websites, control panels that don't match the ones shown and "easy" steps that just don't work. I'm pretty tech savvy and this process was ridiculously complex. Count on another $100 to get a tech guru to set it up for you. Camera works great, but seeing my living room from my office across the hall is not the remote camera access I had in mind.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Camera works, but the software is buggy.  It "alarms" on motion detected, but being able to record and send an email/txt to your mobile does not work as described.  The software that comes with the camera allows for these settings, but they don't work.  I am looking for something else to meet my needs

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this to monitor our house when we are away. The setup video is very confusing, and the woman narrating is not proficient in English. After some difficultly, I managed to set it up on my home network. I can watch it from another room, and it works fine. Viewing over the Internet is another matter. I have spent hours trying to figure this out, watching Foscam's setup video, as well as third party videos on YouTube. It's hopeless.

Unless you are an IT professional or an avid computer hobbyist, or want to hire one, you can forget about viewing this thing remotely.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: A little hard to set up for a novice user. But after it IS set up it is Flawless! Picture quality, sound even the application on Iphone, Ipad, Android is amazing. For the price you cant go wrong for quality, and value. A great product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Have a few of these already. They are very reliable and serve its purpose as a basic security camera. The video is pretty clear however the motion detect could be a bit better as its flaky with lighting changes. You can't expect more for the price of these units.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased two Axis 207W cameras a few years ago - they work really well, but I needed tilt feature,
and higher end axis models are really expensive.
I read a bunch of review of foscam - many warned about quality issues, but I have not had any problem.
I have 2 foscams now - both works perfectly. Night vision feature is very useful indoors.

The only minor issue is the software is pretty basic, not very well designed, but works ok.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is awesome.  I have another one and it so easy to use wirelessly.  I would definately recommend it to anyone.  Also,  if you need help setting it up, the customer service reps are very helpful, kind and speedy!

review_body:
Hello....
This is a great product. The gentleman that helped me set this up did a great job I could not have done this by my self. Thank you

review_body: I really love the product. Allen and Cristina helped me a lot in setting the camera. Great customer service. Camera view is great in all directions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: the biggest problem we have with it is the darn power cord is only like 3 feet long and where we want to place it there isn't an outlet close enough.  It would be nice if they would think of things like this.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera
review_body: This is an amazingly inexpensive wireless IP camera. In addition to infrared capability, it also has two way audio to listen and speak. Although I consider myself somewhat tech savvy, I find some of the wifi configuration settings to be confusing ... lots of DDNS, IP and wireless router settings -- to my great surprise, I called the 1-800 customer support number and a representative (probably at a call center in India) walked me through it step by step. He did a nice job and it works great. I recommend the product.

review_body: Technical support took a very complex install and made it extremely easy. Great product and support, Will definitely recommend to friends!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've spent hours of my own time and hours of Foscam time trying to set all of these cameras up.  I wouldn't take these cameras if they were FREE!  It's not worth the time and headaches trying to set this up.  Don't let the others fool you on this.  This is not easy to use at all!!!!

He was able to professionally and quickly resolve all my issues with setup of camera as well as wifi and stayed after his shift to help.  I would give 6 stars (on scale of 0-5) if I could!!  He represents Foscam extremely well and I am delighted with my experience with Calvin and Foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I own several brands of ip cameras, and all of them works as expected. This one too. No more and no less. Simply follow their instructions and everything's fine.

Image is quite good, video is good. Color is nice. Night time viewing is adequate. Only the viewing angle is a bit narrower than the I'd prefer, but no big deal because of its ability to pan. Software works on all devices that I am using, including cell phones.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very impressed. Good price, all the good features I needed. Some network experience and Port forwarding needed for outside internet access.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this camera to use in conjunction with a [[ASIN:B003MP93BW Skylink SC-1000 Complete Wireless Alarm System, White]]. The alarm system is setup to call my cell phone whenever there is an activation. I then use the Foscam Viewer Lite app on my Android phone to connect to the camera and determine what activated the alarm. Worked well during our recent vacation, even though we had no alarms, I still checked in on the house every so often. Gave me some peace of mind.

The setup instructions may be a bit too much for some people. I worked for many years in the computer & networking field, so even though the instructions were a bit confused I had the camera setup on my network in about 20 minutes. I use a static IP for the camera inside my LAN. I suggest you first configure it with a dynamic LAN IP and test it out, then use the static IP if necessary. I used the static IP as it was easier to configure my broadband router to do port forwarding with an IP rather than a MAC address. Your configuration may be different. The port forwarding option combined with a dynamic DNS service such as DynDNS or No-IP will let you connect to a public server within your LAN from the internet. In this case the public server is the HTTP (web) server built into the Foscam FI8910W. Once you get this setup you do not need your computer on; just have the cable/DSL modem and router powered and the camera of course.

A couple of tips: remember to change the default user name and password in the device; second - don't connect to the camera as administrator from outside your LAN. I setup a viewer account and an operator account. The viewer can only see what the camera is pointing at (they can't move it), the operator can move the camera, but can't change the settings. The admin can do anything.

Anyway worked good for me and my use, though a bit over complex to setup & configure for internet access (but the good thing is that it can be adapted to just about any network configuration or use). I only had one problem with connecting to it during vacation and that was after exiting the phone app without using the exit button in the app. This seemed to hang the camera, but a few hours later I tried it again and it was working. I was using the myfoscam.org dynamic DNS service they might have had an issue as I could not connect to the camera from a laptop either until some time passed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: easy set up, performs as expected
review_body: We use this to check in on the dogs when at work. For this purpose the item works very well. It was easy to set up, does what it says it will. We use a free iPhone app to check in at home when we are working( the website is blocked at work). We were pleased with the app options as well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera was very easy to set-up.  It was a very good value for $75.  I now have a home security camera.  I would recommend downloading an app for your phone to use because using a browser can be diffcult to view on your phone.  I would have liked the camera to zoom and be a little clearer; however the overall value makes this camera very viable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works great when you get it working, but it only works wirelessly when used in DHCP mode. Had to call tech support to figure it out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: GREAT CAMERA, EASE OF USE. WELL BUILT, IMPRESSED HOW QUIET IT IS. TECH SUPPORT WAS GREAT. HAD PROBLEM WITH REMOTE CONNECTION. TECH SUPPORT LOGGED ON MY PC TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM. GREAT SERVICE...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good picture. No audio unless using Explorer
review_body: The setup was relatively easy. If you've had any experience programming your router you shouldn't have any problems. I followed the instructions and set up the service with DynDNS and everything worked as expected. (I did have one small hiccup. Although I did not see any mention of this in the printed or online manual, there is evidently a max number of characters that can be used for a password. I exceeded that limit and had to do a factory reset of the camera and enter new passwords.) I will say this, despite their instructions, I was not able to get audio to work in Firefox. I tried both 32bit and 64 bit versions of VLC, but kept getting the same error while logged into the camera. I searched high and low for a solution, but after reading numerous forum posts from around the web, determined that it won't work. Audio does work with Internet Explorer, though, via ActiveX. As a matter of fact, the camera interface is much nicer via the ActiveX plugin. So, if you want to hear through the camera (and the sound quality is poor), you'll have to use Internet Explorer (the horror). As for me, I'd rather not ever use IE and audio is not important, so I'm fine with Firefox. That said, the Foscam folks need to get to work and do a better job of creating a nice interface for Firefox or Chrome.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I ordered the Foscam for a little added security. I wanted something that I could view remotely from my desktop at work and my iPhone4. I had done quite a bit of searching around for a solid IP camera before I settled on this. I had looked at d-link, tenvis, wanscam, and others. However, none of those had the number of views that Foscam had or the number of helpful setup tips. Soo after long deliberation I decided this was reasonable to get even after I had some concerns related to reviews and security. To break it down further -

What I like:
+Price
+Size of the camera (It is not an extremely large camera by any means. Good to keep \\"hidden\\" in a tight location)
+IR cut (Adds a more realistic color. Not washed out. Take a look at AwkwardHamster's youtube video comparing other foscam models)
+Accessing the camera remotely (It's good once you get pass the setup portion, which I explain in my comments)
+Picture quality - Good (Don't expect it to be the sharpest quality. You are not going to see a hair on the ground 5 feet away. If you are expecting long distance use with this camera don't expect amazing quality images)
+Wide variety of settings

What I didn't like:
-Power cord (~3ft, who does that?)
-Reviews, a bit off topic but I want to make a comment about all of them. Now I didn't like that so many reviews on Amazon start off by saying \\"I couldn't get my camera to connect so I contacted 'insert name here' from Foscam. They connected the cameras in no time and were extremely helpful'. At the time of this review 703 similar statements. Now I find this somewhat fishy that 703 comments are similar. It seems to me that it is a modified template for comments. I can't say whether these statements are true or not but just keep it in mind that some if not all may be false comments. Just my 2 cents.
-Minimal information on remote DNS providers. DNS provider - used to access camera outside ofyour home network.
-Security encryption. From what I have read in other comments this camera has no security when you try and remotely access this camera. If you attempt to access it remotely your username/password is sent in \\"Plain Text\\". This means if you use public wifi your password can be \\"sniffed\\" out. Now this might of concern to some and others it's no big deal. So I suggest for some to do more research on how to access your camera securely. I personally plan on setting up the camera for viewing through a VPN (virtual private network). I haven't done it yet but the goal is to purchase a router that has VPN capability and install tomato or dd-wrt.

Stuck between like/don't like:
>Camera setup. This is a tough one. Many people say turn away from this camera unless you have a degree in computer science because it is almost impossible to setup. This is not necessarily true if you find the right steps online. I didn't follow the owners manual for the setup or use the CD the camera came with. I followed one reviewers steps and I got the camera up and running in no time.

Camera Setup:
I followed \\"R. Tickle's\\" instructions from March 29, 2012 to set the camera up. Here is what he used with slight modifications and explanations that may make it easier for some.

1) Do NOT install the software on the CD. The CD is used to try and find the camera. On my first attempt to access my camera I did toss the CD in and install the software, but unfortunately I was left with a blank text box with no camera IP. The manual said I should reinstall the software so I did. That didn't work so I decided to find it using my router web login explained below.

2) Connect the camera by Cat-5 wire to your router. My camera came with a coiled up cat-5 cable. You shouldn't have to go searching for one.

3) Login to your router (via browser, for linksys it is 192.168.1.1) and find the IP address assigned to your camera. This should be fairly easy to do especially if you have the Linksys smart router. Navigate to your connected devices and copy the cameras IP address.

4) Login to the camera at that IP address (via browser) and IMMEDIATELY turn OFF the DHCP. Copy and Paste the IP address for the camera into a new blank tab and hit enter. This should take you to the foscam page that shows activex, server push mode, and mobile phone. If you use IE select activex, firefox/chrome use server push mode. Selecting one of those will give you a pop-up for username/password. The default username/password is : Username-admin, there is no password. Once you get in you can navigate to \\"Basic Network Settings\\" and uncheck DHCP.

5) Give your camera a fixed IP address on your network and fill in the subnet mask with what you normally use. This step is pretty simple. You can assign your camera an IP address. I used the IP it was initially assigned except I changed the last three numbers xxx.xxx.x.151. Next you want to fill in the subnet mask, which can be found in your router settings or I believe it mostly is 255.255.255.0 (per google search of course). Enter in your gateway IP and DNS server IP (you will use the same IP address for both of these. you can find this IP address from your router login page in maybe a \\"local networks\\" tab it should be the IP address of your router). The last thing you can fill in is the HTTP port. Select a four digit number such as \\"5252\\". Remember this because it will be used to setup port forwarding. Now hit SUBMIT and wait for the camera to reboot. Now that you have your IP address for your camera nailed down you may wish to go into your router and assign the IP camera a static IP address. This ensures another device will not accidentally take your foscam IP address.

6) Fill in the SSID, encryption type, and share key used by your wireless network. Hit SUBMIT, this will reboot the camera. Now you youcan unplug the camera from your router. ***NOTE*** I have found that once you enable wireless on the camera it may take some time to actually connect to your wifi network. So if you reboot your camera be patient (more than 1 minute patient). Watch the camera for the green LED to have a steady and consistent blink. Any hesitation in blinking means it has not connected yet.

7) Re-login to the camera at the new fixed IP address to verify that everything's working and your settings have stayed.

8) Login to your router and set a port-forwarding entry to map to the fixed IP address and HTTP port you gave your camera. You will also have to enter in the device IP address, the one you just gave the camera.

9) Now in order to access the camera remotely you will need a DDNS service. Foscam now recommends \\"no-ip\\" for free DNS instead of dydns. Do a google search for it. Create an account. Foscam has their own service free for 3 years but after that you will have to pony up some money. No-ip is free but and has one downfall, every 30 days you will need to say you will keep the DNS assigned to you. I haven't had the service for more than 30 days, but from what I have found online you receive an email and have to navigate to a link that is in the email. I guess this is the price you pay for a free service.

10) Go back to your camera settings. Select DDNS Service Settings then Select third party DDNS drop down and find no-ip. Enter your username and password. This is the information you used on the no-ip site to create an account. Finally you will want to enter in the ddns host. This is what you set up to be your camera website/host. Example: mycamera01(dot)no-ip(dot)biz. Sorry about the dots, trying to avoid having information blocked. Now click SUBMIT and wait for the camera to reboot.

11) Now try and access your camera using your new host. You can try this from 3G/4G to make sure you can connect outside your home network. Open browser tab and enter in all the host information. Using my example: mycamera01(dot)no-ip(dot)biz:5252. If you notice I entered :5252 after the host name. This is because we changed it earlier in step 5.

12) You now should be able to connect remotely. Since the hard part is done go and change your username and password to the camera if you haven't done that yet.

I hope these steps help lower the frustration of setting up this camera.

My final comment!!
IP Camera APPS. I mentioned earlier that I had an iPhone and wanted to access the cameras for remote viewing. After much searching I decided to download \\"LiveCams Pro\\" right now $3.99 in the appstore. I selected it after seeing others recommend it and seeing all the cameras they support. I may or may not want a different camera manufacturer such as d-link and the app supports them. However, this is not the only app available, Foscam has an app (not free) that you can download. From what I have found it works well but other than that I haven't had experience with it.

I will update with my opinion of the camera as time goes on. Feel free to check back in a few months.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had a problem stetting it up. called them on phone a guy name calvin helped me and now the camera works

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I cannot even remember how many hours and many times we've called customer service on this product.  We send them back and have to wait literally months and months, many calls later to get another one.  We wait for days to get a representative to call us back.  They sort of work if you're in the home but away from the house (which is the point) ...you can forget it.  Buyer beware.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very good baby monitor for the price!
review_body: We bought this to use it as a baby monitor, and it is surprisingly good.  Why spend $300 on a true baby monitor when you can buy this camera and use your cell phone or tablet?  Most people carry something with them at all times, and this makes it easy.  I will preface with, it does take some setup and isn't absolutely the easiest thing to get working.  If you are tech savy or have someone in the family who is, buy it!  Once it is setup, it is dead simple to use.  You will need a stable network (wired or wireless) to use it, but I have had no problems.  If it dies, it will automatically reconnect so you don't really miss a beat.  Last, watch the prices on these.  You can get great deals on them from time to time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Got this unit to add to my Linksys wvc54gca cameras. This one is way cooler. Picture seems sharper, and of course the pan functions are kick-ass fun to have. I only give it 4 stars because the first unit I got was a total dud. Thankfully Amazon's easy return saved me from any harm. As for sound, on mine listening in on the camera works well, and has better sensitivity than my Linksys units. I haven't really tried its speaker function. The IR vision is very impressive, fully lighting even large rooms-although the red glow of the LEDs is very visible. Another person wrote up how to add it to your network, I'd advise doing it the way they suggested.
Good luck

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera works exceptionally well. The Android app only cost an additional $4.99 which allows me to monitor my new dog wherever I am. The set up of this camera was too difficult for me. I had to have an IT expert come to my house (colleague from work), and she had to call Foscam for help with the configuration. Once they got it working, it has been working well. It allows me to scan, listen and speak from my smart phone. I originally put in a return request, but with the help from my colleague I canceled the return and have been quite pleased.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Not easy to configure. Tech support is not very helpful. Once configured, quality is good. I got it for 65, so it's a good deal.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Purchased this product, and despite negative reviews, found it very useful and well worth the price. I just set it up last night, and yes, it did take awhile, but I just watched 3 different how-to guides on You Tube which made it a lot easier. If you are novice at fooling with your router, I would recommend getting help, as I would have been very frustrated if I didn't already know how to adjust my settings and figure out how to find the IP information. Picture isn't HD quality, but for under $70, I wasn't expecting much. I really like that I with the pan and tilt function I can scan my whole living room/dining room area. I am using this as a critter cam to watch my cats during the day to see what they are getting up to. I would definitely purchase more, as I would like to set this up as a multi view system throughout my house. The audio feature isn't that great, as there is an echo and it is too loud and you cannot adjust the settings, but I most likely wouldn't use this feature much anyway. I would recommend buying this product, but just make sure you have the time to properly set it up, and be patient as it can get a little frustrating.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Looks great but instructions to create the interest connect option leave much to be desired.
review_body:
I ordered this product because it appeared to just the thing I was looking for. As it turned out, I have a camera that works wirelessly within my net work but does nothing else. I have spent many hours rereading instructions, watching videos narrated by a Japanese gal who is doing her best but it just doesn't come through for me (To her, a router is a "rooter"....being a plumber, I should know how to open gateways on a rooter but, here I am ).

I would appear that my only alternative is to spend an additional 40 bucks to have a technical guru figure this thing out. On a positive note, the camera takes excellent resolution video. It wouldbe great if I could see it on my iPhone!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased the foscam fi8910w direct from foscam.us and was very pleased to see the box arrive in 2 days. Upon inspection I found the camera to be well constructed. I began the set up and it went well -> until I tried to plug the camera in.. The camera did its initial pan and tilt then would never hook to the Pc (via the software).

I went to the foscam.us website and clicked on the support tab.. Then noticed they have a \\"chat\\" system in the lower right corner.. So I opened a chat and had a tech working on my issue within 2min. (TWO min)

After we couldn't get it going I called a tech and was issued an RMA no questions asked.

The Camera wasn't working that's a solid 1 star

The support was EPIC (Web chat support & Phone support).. Solid 5 stars

Average 3 stars (Until I get the replacement set up and tested.. At which time I will update this review!)

_______
_______

For now all I can say is that's exactly what I would expect when receiving a broken item (NOT sure about other complaints but my experience has been more then fine up to this point)

Will update ASAP, thanks for viewing!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Personally, I thought it was going to be more difficult to setup from what I've read, but It was actually a breeze despite not being very intuitive. Had everything working, connected wireless, and accessible over the internet with Foscam's free DDNS in less than 15 minutes. Granted, I'm somewhat tech savvy and knew a thing or two about setting up stuff like this. Someone else might have a difficult time with it though.

Also, it doesn't make sense why they disable presets by default. Had to enable them in PT Settings.

Overall I'm very satisfied.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: We could never figure it out.
review_body: Although we tried and tried, we could never get this to communicate with our computer.  It's been so long that I can't even remember what wouldn't work.  The camera turns on and we could see the results if we were looking right at our computer, but that is not the point.  We wanted to be at work or vacation and see remotely.  Three fairly tech smart people tried and we all failed.  Camera just sits on the desk useless.  Great idea if we could have ever figured it out.  I sure wish we could have.  Having a security camera was/is very important to us and we are disappointed that this didn't work out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Quick and easy to set up. Great Baby Monitor
review_body: These were super simple to set up. Almost plug and play. They work nicely with various third party application for monitoring and control via smartphone or tablet. Once you figure out port forwarding on your router you will have access to these from any internet connection.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: i just got this foscam and needed help setting it up. i had a real human on the phone within 20mins which is amazing in itself. he logged on to my machine and fixed the problem. very impressed. much different than the experience i had when i bought a wansview. they have zero tech support, the instructions were crap. do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on the foscam!!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Stopped working after my room temp exceeded 90 F when ac failed...Watch it.  Keep it ventilated especially when mounted inverted.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is my second Foscam. It was a lightning deal so I decided to upgrade from my older one. They are easy to set up and dont cost you anything to view them. You can see them from anywhere with an internet connection. If you want to buy a $5 app on your phone you can view it there too. If you want to buy $50 software you can put it on your computer and record as much video from it as you want. It even has a motion detection feature to only record when it senses motion. This is a great camera for the money!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I looked at this several times but held off as the install sounded difficult.
Ran into a question during install and called support.
Within 10-15 minutes Derrick had me up and running wirelessly and connected to my Android!
That made it extremely easy as it was set up for me remotely.
Very happy as I now have remote home security for under $100!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Amazon delivered it quickly, I am not a computer guy so I had trouble setting it up.  I called Foscam and their customer service is outstanding, they took the time to setup everything for me.  This camera will move side to side and up and done remotely.  It is well designed and is durable.  I am view the real-time footage outside my network - on the road.  I recommend this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to install and pretty good support
review_body:
I installed this device twice (first in home # 1 and needed to move it to home # 2). Each house has a different Router, IP, etc. but with a little help from their support people I was able to get it working and sending me emails both times. There were a few agents in India who I couldn't understand and I had to keep calling back until I got someone who could speak better English, but we got it done and tested.

Works on my Android phone, I-Pad, I-Pod Touch and over my windows PC. I'm buying more for other locations in my homes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great product. But for these interior cameras hiw do we know someone else doesnt have unauthorized access to view camera?
I realized late that the admin password is BLANK that means anyone who knows my IP and port can view the camera.
What should we do to enable security?

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had very high hopes for this camera.  The picture quality is great.  I bought this to monitor a stationary subject.  Therefore I don't want/need a unit that pans.  The panning is great though because remotely I can adjust the angle just the way I want without having to run back and forth from the camera to my PC to get it just right.  The problem with this unit is that it won't stop rebooting.  Everytime it reboots, it will cycle through it's entire range by panning around (up, right, down, left, up).  This kept happening despite setting a preset to have it stay on a fixed position after reboot, which would be fine if it only rebooted once a day.  Sometimes this would reboot many times throughout the day. I searched the internet and found some \\"work arounds\\" which didn't work for me.  You can do your own search and see that this is a problem.  I'm returning this unit as I am just going to go with one that does not have the ability to pan.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I am returning this camera.

I was looking for a camera to view my house from an external access point. It is IMPOSSIBLE to set up this functionality. Instructions are cryptic, grammatically silly, and just do not work. The font on the graphics is so small you need a microscope to read it.

Connected for a local view in 2 minutes. It was incredibly easy.

For an external view it's totally useless and I will be looking for something else.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
So I recently installed these cameras for my sister-in-law, we actually got a deal off groupon but I have to say, I am surprised by many of the negative reviews on here. Makes me wonder how much of it is a case of user error, rather than hardware issues. The Web GUI is moderate at best, but once you can work through the kinks and get everything set up, its not that bad. Too be honest, i've seen a lot worse. I saw a few reviews saying to avoid using the installation cd that came with the camera but it has some nice features which let you change camera settings without the need for the GUI. making some setting changes a breeze. Also, the Foscam Pro app is a MUST HAVE, well worth the 5.99 as it takes the camera's to a whole new level in terms of stability, functionality.

The multi-cam set up was a bit flaky in terms of loading all the cameras on to 1 screen but again, most of the issues were because of the web GUI. The two way audio is nothing crazy but it wasnt high on her priority list. The pan/tilt feature works great, and has adjustable speed for the rate of motion. The motion sensor works as described and I've set her up with a second hard drive to store all the recordings. If you've never set up port forwarding and changed settings on your router, it may be difficult at first. Seeing as i have done this numerous times, everything worked like a charm. I recommend use DHCP, but once your router assigns the camera(s) an IP address, make it static so it is linked with that mac address. so no matter what happens to the camera, when it reconnects, no other device will take its IP address. Wireless signal seemed fine, but she has a small place with a very open floor plan so i never had any concerns on that being an issue. The quality was as expected since its only 640x480, having a 720p resolution would have been nice but since the main purpose of the cameras are to be a \\"nanny cam\\", its fine. For those who download the app, one feature whichis great, is you can zoom in on the image at the time, and if you choose snap-shot or record it will keep the recording/image on your phone. So hypothetically if you witness a robbery in progress through your cameras, they can steal your computer but you still have the recording handy on your phone/tablet.

I liked the cameras so much that I am actually looking to ditch the cameras that came with my home security system and put these in instead!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Best baby monitor money can buy
review_body: This cam is a great baby monitor! It works exactly as described with no hardware issues in the months past that I've had it. It is still reliable and the setup was easy. I read a lot of reviews claiming that it was really difficult to set up so after I purchased it I researched the setup on youtube and google until it arrived. I didn't really need to go through the research effort it was pretty basic if you have ever set anything up port forwarding.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bradley from foscam digital technologies was very patient in answering all my questions and with helping me with set up my foscam. I am very pleased with foscams remote assistance and customer service.
