product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy to set up.  Power cord could be longer but that's minor.  For the tech people out there, there is a way to use a hidden SSID.  You unhide your SSID, connect to the Wi-Fi network, set up a static IP or add the MAC address to your MAC filter(LAN and WLAN MAC are different), and then rehide the SSID.  Worked just fine for me and the static IP is a better option for natting the camera.  Im also a huge fan of the fact that you can turn off or on the night vision which is a great feature.  I wish it was compatible with 5ghz wireless n and not 2ghz but that's a minor issue as well.  If I need more in the future, I will likely buy from foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've had this camera up and running for about a month now. I don't think that you can purchase a surveillance camera that does all that this one reliably does for the price.

I'm giving this only 4 stars because of the documentation. It could be better for sure. I found a couple videos on YouTube that basically showed me how to get it up and running (settings, port forwarding, email/text notifications, Third Party DDNS, etc).

So far, it does as advertised. It has reliable motion detection but I am not seeing that it records a steady video stream to your computer or DVR. It can record short video clips (if you use IE for your browser) but you have to leave the application up and running to do so. Not too useful in my case. So if you need or want a video recording, you would likely want a different camera system.

One last thing.... the camera requires power so there has to be an outlet close by to plug it into.

All in all, I'm happy. I can view the feed from any computer or from my Android app at any time. I get texts and emails with multiple pictures when motion is detected... and no monthly fees from a monitoring company. It does what I need. After experiencing this first camera, I plan to purchase additional cameras to add to my network.

The IP cams are an excellent value.  When the cameras are purchased directly from FOSCAM the tech support is free.  I purchased some of them directly from FOSCAM and some from Amazon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Don't be scared. Tech help sets it up for you.
review_body:
Like the title says. I am by no means a whiz but capable in dealing with set up of the Wi-Fi home entertainment gear, printers, etc. That allowed me to get the camera working wireless from my PC. I was totally lost when looking at the set up for connecting via the web. Called tech support and Andrew had me log into Foscam for remote access to my PC. At that point it was just a matter of kicking back and listening to Andrew explain each of the steps as he executed them on my screen. Andrew tested the camera and showed me the web address for logging into the camera. He was kind enough to type up a notes page with that information along with instructions on setting up my iPhone after installing the app and put it on my desktop. Andrew was also so helpful as to open this page for my review which he asked that I include his name. So here I am and this will deserve a follow up because.. I want to see about the motion detector function with an alert sent to my phone. sure other questions will arise.

Pros: Don't be silly and worry about set up. They very efficiently do it for you without making you feel like an idiot as some jackass we all know from IT support at work.

Cons: Will let you know...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I have 4 and will buy more
review_body:
This is great if you need to keep an eye on your home, cars, kids, pets, etc.

The camera takes some time to set up but if you follow the directions and you have set up a WiFi router in the past, you should be able to configure this IP camera. Just make sure you connect the IP camera to your router with a Ethernet cable. Once you have it configured, you can configure the camera to use your home WiFi.

I love the alarm feature. You can set up a motion detection alarm where the IP camera will snap 5 pictures of the viewing area and send them to your email for review. This is great if you are traveling and you are only interested in looking at your IP camera when there is someone moving around your home when they aren't supposed to be!!

Also, if you want the ability to monitor your IP cameras from outside of your home WiFi you will need pay close attention to the setup instructions. You will also need to enable Port Forwarding on your WiFi router. It is not rocket science and if you haven't done it before check out your manufactures' web site and look up Port forwarding. It is a breeze to setup once you have an understanding on how it works.

Pros: Inexpensive, easy to set up basic features, tons of features
Cons: Could be tricky to set up if you don’t have a basic understanding of WiFi routers

Love them!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
After reading the various helpful comments on Amazon I expected a complicated setup. This camera is indeed not for people without patience and basic router set-up experience. However I was surprised that by following the booklet instructions I was able to set up the camera (including remote viewing) within about 90 minutes.... Then suddenly the camera went back to factory settings without touching anything ! I went through the setup again (this time in 20 minutes) and everything works fine. The image quality is good, pan and tilt work fine, but there is no zoom.
Anyway, unless the zoom is actually the lens zooming in instead of a digital zoom, zoom is highly overrated .
I tried a few Ipad and android apps and I like Foscam pro best, though the free app is good as well.

I am going to use my Foscam for a while and see if there are any more hiccups and if I am still happy in a few weeks then I will buy two more of these canmeras for the house.

Now I am interested in what dvr system others recommment so that I can make god use of the motion detecting tools of the camera !

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

It is a very cool baby monitor alone if that's all you wanna use it for. Foscam's customer support is good, I was able to speak to someone in tech support with-in 2 minutes. very helpful and set up everything for me (port forwarding related) via remote access to my computer. Ask to speak to Hayden Taylor, he is the one who helped me and was very generous with his time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Setting up this IP camera was simple, as IP cameras go. The only problem I encountered was getting the camera to recognize my wireless network - you might have to try it 2 or 3 times, after that it's connected.

Another thing to be aware of, IF YOU UNPLUG YOUR MODEM OR ROUTER AFTER YOU HAVE SET THE CAMERA IP ADDRESS in your viewing app , your IP address will change and the new one will have to be entered into the viewing software to see video.

If you have any problems setting these cameras up, go to YouTube and do a search, most problems are minor and should be able to be resolved from there.

Picture is clear, colors are accurate. I'm using mine behind a glass window and turn the infrared feature off to avoid glare on the glass at night. Shoots well through glass.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not dependable for use as a baby monitor in nursery
review_body: I bought this to use in my toddlers nursery. The first one failed within Amazon's return window. The replacement failed within a couple of weeks. The IR LEDs started going out then the speaker stopped working. I also had problems with the camera moving (pan/tilt) on its own. I called Foscam and was given the runaround the first 3 times I called. After I insisted on calling they agreed to replace the camera but I would have to pay return shipping and send the broken camera in first before they would ship out the replacement. I even offered to give credit card information for an advance replacement but they wouldn't budge even after I told them I couldn't be without the camera because it's a nursery cam. Awful customer service.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is absolute trash.  Image quality was as expected for the price, but... It worked reasonably well until I took it more than 5 feet from the router, then it began randomly losing signal and rebooting.  It appears that most of the positive reviews for this camera are fakes, and not "Verified Purchased".  It hasn't been out of the box for more than three hours and I am returning it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is very well-made and is an incredible value - highly recommended! I have another system that has security cameras worth thousands of dollars, yet this camera is actually better in many regards. The night vision is perfect. The image is extremely clear and is very impressive.

Foscam has its own app which is by far the easiest one to set up and use. You can rotate the camera on the app which is very useful.

The downfall to this camera is that setup wasn't necessarily easy. I have very limited experience with security camera setup in the first place, but I had a hard time getting around the static versus dynamic IP address. The good thing is that Foscam has exceptional customer service. They have many resources online that were helpful.

This camera performs like an expensive security camera and is a great value!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: DON'T BUY THIS ITEM if you want wireless operation
review_body: Before I bought this camera I noticed a number of reviewers mentioned how difficult it was to set up the camera wirelessly but I was prepared to risk a couple of hours figuring out a work around. I have spent the equivalent of days trying every possible option without success. I have read every discussion I could find online and they are full of complaints about this problem. I've found a few (very few) detailed suggestions on what to do but they involve playing around with router settings and other technically sophisticated steps. I've tried all that I felt comfortable with without success. It's also noticeable that the company itself is not participating in these threads, so what you see is request after request for help and no practical advice in response. I don't think I've ever encountered a product where so many people have the same problem and nobody seems to be able to fix it. What makes it so frustrating is that wired set-up is so easy and the camera woks as advertised. I can even see the camera being recognized by my router but when I disconnect the ethernet cable nothing happens. So my advice is to read the reviews that mention this problem and take them seriously.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
With the camera on, my home network slowed to a crawl or altogether stopped. I went to a local tech store and they told me I needed a dual band modem/router to handle all my wireless traffic because the one I had couldn't keep up with the demand. So I bought a new Netgear dual band modem/router and installed it yesterday.

Results are the same. Camera on, network slows to dial-up speed and eventually freezes and I can't even pull up Google's home page. Camera off, network speeds IMMEDIATELY restore and everything is fine. No other wireless device I own has this kind of negative impact to my network.

I'm going to try and return it for a refund.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice features but built-in wifi very frustrating
review_body:
I've had this camera for a few months now. There is much to like, but I hesitate to recommend it if you intend to use the wifi any significant distance from your home router. It only works for me if it has essentially line-of-site and no further than 30 feet. No other device on my Linksys E4200v2 wireless network I own is affected by household obstructions like this camera, so it really limits its usefulness. I have not tried the 9db antenna sold aftermarket, but am considering buying it since it is not too expensive. It is disappointing that Foscam had to produce such an item in the first place since they can't get their wireless act together. If you have cat5 in your house, then by all means, go for this camera.

If you have an iPhone, try the free Baby Monitor app and consider the $5 audio upgrade to support the dev. The app supports local IP address and the Foscam generated http address. Pretty slick.

review_headline: Some good features but possibly marginal wireless use
review_body:
[[ASIN:B006ZP8UOW Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black)]]

After reading many many wireless IP camera reviews I ordered this one thinking it appeared to be the best for the money. I am connecting it wirelessly to an Asus N-66U router which is fairly new and at very close range it works well enough, but seems to have a very limited range before the FPS drops to around 2-3 frames per second.

At first I just assumed the one I got was broken or defective and I exchanged it for another one of the same model. Unfortunately I see no difference in the replacement. Right now I can get around 25' from my router before the signals fails entirely and my various tests are in locations where I have perfectly solid connections on a laptop and my wifi enabled phone.

I don't know whether they accidentally released a batch of them with marginal radios or if this is pretty well what I would expect from any maker of IP cameras since I have no other ones on hand to compare it to. I am still debating returning it for a refund because I bought it for wireless use but at the range it is useful I could easily just hard wire it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
bought the camera to test out and see how everything functions to my liking

i know my way around my network, routers and firewall; so setting this up for external viewing was not hard at all. i did not look at the instructions but based on others, the instructions are not clear at all to get this up and going.

pros:
- great build quality. love the black finish
- camera motor while panning and tilting is smooth and quiet
- wifi strength is good. placed on the opposite side of house through 4 rooms and only had about a .5 second - 1 second lag
- this supports wireless n although description says b/g

cons:
- the video quality kind of fuzzy/grainy at a distance further than 3 feet
- foscam android app (use IP Cam Viewer from the play store, much much better)

product is getting 4 stars

- video quality. quality looks good when in front but backing away past 5-6 feet, the quality gets noisy and grainy. you can still make out what everything is, it just lacks in detail ...where it doesnt when you are up close to it.

all in all, this is a good camera for the price. i didnt expect the quality to be the best since it was only $87 i would recommend this if you are looking to invest in a small, cost saving security camera for a small room

I am actually returning this product ONLY because the room it is in is very large and I would like to see clearly to the other side with more detail than this model allows. I am replacing this unit with the FI9821w

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to use and works great!
review_body:
I'll start by saying if you are looking for hand holding and slick looking software interfaces then perhaps you should look elsewhere. But if you want an inexpensive solution that works, is easy to install if you have at least a little bit of tech saavy, and provides a fantastic web cam experience that offers TOP NOTCH infrared night viewing along with complete remote control of side to side and up and down panning, then this is the camera to get!

The software that comes with the camera is no frills, granted, but it allows you to do what you need to do to get it setup. Setup was no more than connecting the camera to my router via an ethernet cable, running the software on my computer which found the camera immediately, configuring the camera as needed, then disconnecting the camera from the router, and it ran wirelessly no problem. I could access it internally on my network via Web browser and via their FREE Android app. I eventually paid $4 for an app called \\"IP Cam\\" which works fantastic with this cam and allowed me to setup my tablets around the house as additional nanny cams. So lots of viewing options.

You have to know a little bit about how to configure your router to enable viewing from outside of your network, but since FosCam doesn't TRY to make things idiot proof (like other cam solutions that fail miserably) there is no lame interface to fight through to get what you need done, done. I was able to set up port forwarding on my router to my cams, and Viola! Access from anywhere protected by non-standard port allocation (choose a port number, don't go with the default), user name, and password.

Now I'm viewing my cam from literally anywhere (even on my phone while driving I can have the cam on and hear everything that goes on).

Their tech is quick to respond as well, and answered my questions to the point and accurately.

Here is a list of reasons why I like this cam:
1) The Night Vision is OUTSTANDING! Literally clear as day, in pitch black.
2) FosCam had a free app for our phones allowing us to view the camera from as many monitors as needed.
3) There is a paid app ($4) from a third party developer out there that give you all kinds of functionality not available in the free app that we purchased.
4) We have the viewing app on Multiple Devices, allowing me, the wife, and the nanny to view the cam at the same time from different locales in the house. Have it on a tablet too, and can view from the computer.
5) The app supports MANY cams so you can purchase as many as you need and view them all at the same time. We have two to monitor the play area and the sleep area.
6) If you have a little networking know-how you can set up the cam to be viewable (safely and securely) from outside the home. Both me and the wife check in on our tots while we are at work.
7) The paid app has a background monitoring feature so that you can continue to monitor the baby with Audio as you do other things on your phone, or just sleep with the phone near the bed and the screen off.
8) The app alerts you with a sound of your choosing when your little one starts moving around, giving you a little advance notice of the pending AWAKENING!
9) Two way audio.

And most all of these features are also available via a web browser if needed.

Setting the camera up on the local network is a breeze. Setting it up for safe secure viewing outside of the home takes a little bit more know-how, but is obviously very doable. And there are directions, and good support. You can also assign different passwords for different people so that you can always revoke access at anytime, for any specific viewer (such as if you need to fire a nanny).

The BIGGEST advantage is that you can use any smartphone, tablet, or computer as your viewing device and they can ALL be used at the same time.

Very happy with this purchase.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buyer Beware - Check the Hardware Version when it arrives to see if it has Wireless N or WPA2 Encryption Capability.
review_body:
Let me start by saying that I own 2 of these cameras in white already. I have never had any big issues that took any real amount of troubleshooting. For $70 a camera, I have found real value in these models. That is until the last camera that I purchased.

I have these perched in my window sills, so there is a bit of reflection from the white camera, and I noticed that it was alot less with the black model so I bit. The last month I have went through the RMA process with Foscam and after hours of troubleshooting finally a return of the camera back to Amazon.

I hope this review will help others in similar situation. The value in these cameras (for me) was the ability for them to do Wireless N and WPA2 Encryption. Both the product page and the box packaging advertise both of these features. For the first 2 white cameras, they did indeed support them, but for the last black camera, I was having major issues getting the thing up and working properly.

That is when Foscam Support informed me that there were 2 versions of the camera being sold, with 2 different Hardware Architectures supporting 2 different Firmwares. The older of the two not supporting wireless N or WPA2 encryption.

To check this, if you look on the bottom of the camera, there should be 2 stickers with MAC ID's. The smaller sticker is for the wireless. If it is VNT it is the older wireless G hardware. If it is FR it is the newer wireless N.

This might not be an important feature for some, but for me I would have to run my network in G wireless mode which would effectively bring the speed down for all my wirelss clients.

The bottom line is that Foscam should not be selling old Hardware as the Newer stuff. Was this a one time mistake or is this widespread is my question. I hope my experience is the exception and not the norm. Check those stickers.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I read all the bad reviews after buying and attempting to install the unit. I am a computer person and I was rather frustrated.
I finally contacted a security person I know locally and he told me to buy a Dropcam since I did not want to spend too much money.

I got the Dropcam from them directly and saved on tax and got FREE two-day shipping.
I opened the box, hooked up the unit to my computer and was LIVE in under 5 mins. The Visual and Audio is impressive for $149. They offer a 14 day FREE DVR trail. I have gone in and viewed previous video. The night vision is impressive!
I can mute the mic on my end and hear everything that's going on in my home from all my APPLE devices on the FREE App.

For $149 and being hassle free... who can complain! I called customer service one time and they were quick to educate me and gave me and email to rate them after the call.

Overall, I am VERY impressed!!! I have had less than products in the past and poor customer service too. I'm a regular Amazon customer and have always shopped on here many times. PLEASE READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE buying anything.

Enjoy life and each other!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It is just OK...Has Value but not a Baby Monitor
review_body:
I got this to replace my baby monitor. The audio is terrible and there is significant lag (Running on a separate N wireless network) between real time and the video playback. I would say it is 95% stable and you have to worry about the camera being operable since it can and does crash or lose connection from time to time. I use the internet connection using the service that the MFG recommends. It is easy to set up and works well. Again significant lag and that affects the controls and the operating the camera. This can cause the camera to lose connection and this is where most of my issues have been. The audio over the internet is worse than terrible due to the lag.

The video quality is decent I would not call it excellent quality. You can tell that it is better than my baby video monitor.

I would buy this item again for a security camera or monitor but not a baby monitor for a baby under two. The camera has value and it is from my research one of the better cameras. I give it the 3 stars cause of the issues and not being able to depend on it as a replacement for my baby monitor.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: IP Cam Central is the best!
review_body:
So I have to say, these cameras are basically impossible to set up on your own unless you are very dialed in to what needs to be done to set up your router. I contacted IP Cam Central and David K is simply the best there is!!

I called Foscam directly and they are the WORST!!! The phone connection is awful and they take forever...not to mention you cant understand a word they say (myst be calling China)

Pay the few dollars extra and call David at IP Cam Central. It takes a very stressful setup and makes it a breeze.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Don't buy it if you are not a geek. The UI is not very simple to use. Sound and MIC are not plug and play. It took me some time to make it work well, specially the router configuration.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Does all that it says it will do
review_body:
Bought this camera for basic home security. Setup was quick and easy. Able to move it from area to area with the only requirement being an outlet to plug in to.
i would and have recommended this camera to others.
My only complaint is the detail of the image could be better. it's still more than clear enough to tell whats going on but for long shots the image is abit muddled.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: These units don't cost much, and they have decent video and good features for the money.  The config tool is not great, limited initial setup, had to follow the opposite of the  instructions to access the camera with IE.  The WiFi was working for a week, then stopped.  All settings checked, it's the unit itself.  Decided to use wired Ethernet as that works fine.  Decided to not send it back, contact support, etc., It's too much time to do so and easier to use a wired Ethernet connection at this point.  Regarding the setup tool, it is what it is:  limited.  It's not at the level of an airport express airport utility for example.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Software is pretty buggy - was shipped with 11.37.2.49. We used chrome to monitor, video froze after one day.
Hardware looked promising and feature rich. However software, especially wireless connectivity was very buggy (chrome monitoring froze, moving camera caused device to reboot). Returning it after 2 days of troubleshooting. We happened to be a hands on networking specialist. This is not worth your time. Need to hire a new PM and a few good QA engineers FosCam!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This webcam is a great device to monitor your loved ones and pets. I purchased it to keep an eye out on my German Shepherd puppy in the backyard of my house while I'm at work. Since I'm gone for a long time all day I can see when he's being mischievous and naughty and I can speak to him through it to calm him down so he feels I'm near.  You can set it up inside or outside the house; you can hang it upside down from the ceiling and adjust the picture accordingly. It has 360 degree rotation capability with internet connection to access from your smart phone and computer. Infra-red technology for night time use, motion sensors that can capture, record and email you instantly any motion it detects while you're away from home. Foscam also allows you to listen and speak through the cam. You can also setup accounts for family and friends to access the Foscam for monitoring while you are traveling. Easy to set up and install, the Foscam is just an awesome investment. I love it and strongly recommend it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: As a simple camera with pan/tilt and the ability to capture images based on movement detection, this camera works pretty well. It can upload periodic images via FTP but won't capture video clips on its own. If you use Blue Iris software you can setup a DVR on your PC to capture captioned video clips. I'm still playing with this setup but its been working well so far.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: NO PROBLEMS WHAT SO EVER!  FOR ONCE CUSTOMERS ARE GETTING WHAT THEY ARE SUPPOSE TO GET; A GOOD PRODUCT THAT WORKS!  "IMAGINE THAT!"

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Don't let anyone tell you this is not a good camera. The picture is what I would expect and the controls (when logged in over IP) work great. That is where this stops being a great camera. The installation software that you can set up to record when the camera senses motion is insanely confusing, and no combination of varied settings can even get the software to find my camera.

If you want this camera to do what you want (other than send you 500 emails a day if you are actually able to set up a DYDNS account with a compatible email) you have to buy another software suite. I already spent $80 on the camera and software it comes with. On the Foscam site, instead of links to in-depth tutorials on proper setup, they simply have links to buy Blue Iris.

This is a crock. Do not buy this camera because of the price, it is not worth it. There are many other options for cameras that will work out of the box and don't take a week of frustration to set up properly, only to fail when the wifi stops working or your DYDNS expires, or you get booted from your email server because of your insane amount of incoming email.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: First off: this is a totally legit review--this is my first review ever but Scott at Foscam encouraged me to write.  I bought 5 foscams (3 inside, 2 outdoor) and was stumped on how to see them over the internet.  Scott not only got all 5 working over the net (WITH AUDIO), but also got them set up on my Foscam Blue Iris software so I can record video with my PC.  We have our first baby coming in about a week and we are going to use Foscams for baby monitoring, nanny watching, and home security.  Everything working perfectly now thanks to the awesome support from Scott at Foscam.  Over an hour and twenty minutes on the phone but worth every minute and EVERY PENNY!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: IR Stopped working / Horrible Tech Support
review_body:
The IR functionality on this camera stopped after 3 days. I called the 800 number on the foscam.us website to try to troubleshoot it, but the guy who answered the phone did not have any desire to help troubleshoot or do anything useful. Before he hung up on me, he told me that if I still had problems (duh--he didn't actually fix anything in the 3 minutes he talked to me), I could file a request for RMA from the website. I've done that, and now I'm waiting.

The product failed in the first week out of the box. The tech support is not only worthless but rude. I would never buy anything from foscom again. I only wish I would've returned the product in the first 30 days to get a refund to buy something else.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had some older cameras that stopped working after comcast did an upgrade.  Found this new one via Groupon, and decided to buy it in order to get some tech support.  After several minutes with tech support(60+) and this great tech finding his way through my comcast router we got the cameras to work.  Don't waste your time trying to set this thing up, call the tech's and have them help.  I love the camera and it will help me see what is going on at my restaurant when I am out.  The best thing is the tech said he would help me set up my old cameras when i pull them out of my junk drawer.  Not junk any more!  Thanks Foscam I love the new tech support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Quality Control seems to be an issue with Foscam
review_body:
I loved the product - It's full of cool features that really work and for the price it's a great deal.
I'm giving it 2 stars right now because I bought 3 of these cameras and in less than a week I returned 2 that went down with different symptoms: One of them died completely and the other entered in a cyclic start up mode - It just never ended starting up, as soon as the startup procedure ended the camera started it all over resetting itself.

Their customer service seems to be good - It did not take me long to talk to a human in the other side :) But I really did not spend much time with them since I was not going to rely on those cameras even if they could guide on how to fix them by resetting to manufactory defaults or something like this. I just returned them and Amazon, as usual, was great and shipped me replacements overnight! Thank you once again Amazon! Your customer service is by far the best I have ever had the opportunity to deal with.

I have a friend who has 2 of these cameras too and he never had any issue so I might have been out of luck here - I will give it sometime and will correct this review in case the new ones don't die too.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great customer service. Great product. Very helpful technical support received from Leo. Reasonable price for security camera. We have some trouble setting the camera via IP camera tool but with the technical support line. the issue solved.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Several months ago I purchased a Foscam FI8910W and was quite satisfied with its performance. On the strength of that, I recently purchased a 3 pack, that also came with the (surprisingly large) 9 dB antennas. The new cameras (using either antenna) would not work in network conditions that the old camera found acceptable. To make a long debugging story short, I put one of the new cameras adjacent to the old camera and called Foscam support. They did a reasonable job of remote debugging, including copying the setup parameters from the working camera to the new camera, but had to admit defeat. (Both of my tech support calls were promptly handled by competent personnel, but were problematic for connection quality: background noise in one case, combined with pronounced Indian accent in another.) My opinion is that this batch of FI8910W's had some manufacturing defect. Interestingly, when packing to return the cameras, I found my old camera's box was a millimeter or so larger than the new ones.

For the geeks among you, the problem was associated with network bandwidth, but not in a simple way. The new cameras worked OK when deep inside the house, but would fail when put on a windowsill. It was not simply signal strength, since my Airport Utility would be reporting \\"Excellent\\" signal strength for the connection to the camera. I even purchased an Airport Express device to extend the network, and, while within a few feet of that device, the camera would work OK away from the window yet fail when on the sill. To explain what I mean by \\"failure\\", if after a reboot of the camera, it was put in a lateral pan mode from the web browser interface, it would cease showing video before it had completed the lateral scan, and would subsequently reboot itself. These symptoms were not as prominent if the camera was put in QVGA mode (320x240) or the low-light IR exposure mode was in force. The old camera would work OK in all these conditions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have purchased over a dozen of these cameras and used them in some easy and also somewhat complicated scenarios such as direct to router, wireless to router, wireless to WAP on the same network. I did have to call the first time and Foscam not only remoted into my PC, they showed me what I did wrong.  6 months later, I had some problems and Kate in customer service was excellent.  She not only fixed it, she also showed me what happened and then showed me how to use the ai1343.myfoscam.org address to avoid the problems of a dynamic IP address. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera is unreliable. It reboots constantly, and for no good reason - one day it works perfectly, another day it works for 20 minutes at a time. There is a reason this camera is so cheap.

If you'd like a camera for entertainment purposes only, then this might be fine. If you need it for safety or security reasons, look elsewhere. If you need a camera as a baby monitor and you typically suspend your baby from the ceiling, this camera would be perfect since that's where the camera points to when it reboots.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Junk is the word for this product
review_body: Had it 3 days and stopped working,  this is the third FOSCAM product I have purchase and none of them lasted over a month,  I would not ever recommend FOSCAM for nothing..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I had trouble getting the camera to work wirelessly but Peter in customer service had everything up and running in 30 minutes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: For the price, it's hard to beat.
review_body:
The only thing keeping me from rating this a little higher is that it doesn't come with any kind of standalone recording capability. It can't stream to a remote server, and it can't store images. If you're going to record, you need a computer to just sit around and do that. Five years ago, I always had a computer up and online, but now I only use my laptop -- which is sometimes online and sometimes not. All the solutions I've found have been slightly impractical.

However, as far as the camera goes, it's great. I can get to it from anywhere, from any device, and I can watch what's going on in my home in real time -- even if the lights are off. It's very convenient for watching our detached garage and it's a nice peace of mind when the alarm company contacts us -- we can quickly see if it's a false alarm or if there are people in our home. The resolution is fantastic for a camera of this price, and it's got a good range of motion. The night vision works pretty well, though you can tell it's in use as the lights around the camera faintly glow red even though they're supposed to be invisible.

It's not weatherproof either, but it seems to work just fine outdoors provided you don't keep it in direct rain or where it might get submerged.

Setup was easy, wireless range is very good, I really have no complaints about this device.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Camera is terrific and very easy to set up. Ran into a small snag during the port forwarding process but was assisted by the warm & personable Ralph Mendez in tech support. Thanks dude! I'll definitely relax now that I can keep an eye on my puppy while I'm at work.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Support was excellent. Scott was good. Haven't gotten a chance to use the camera yet. Will update when I use the camera for a few days

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera has the features that I needed to monitor my home and the property for the times when we are away.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I accidentally bought the wired Foscam first but put it to good use by having it setup in my home office.  I went ahead and bought this wireless version and placed it where I wanted it originally - in my living room.  I was expecting a lot of conflicts and issues, but to my surprise they both work together perfectly!  You may have a problem if you are not computer illiterate, but that is what their free online and phone support is for.  Luckily I have networking knowledge from back in the day when I setup videogame servers, so assigning ports and IPs was simple and I got these cameras up and running within 10 minutes.  I love all of the options and I never would have imagined night vision to work so great!  I thought only military type devices costing hundreds of thousands of dollars can produce such a great image in complete darkness!  I plan on getting some outdoor foscams now just because it is great to view everything around my house for a low price in high quality.  I won't even bother experimenting with other brands in the future, I will stick with Foscam from now on regarding my video surveillance needs.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is fantastic!  We are currently using it to monitor the house, but it was purchased as a baby monitor.  It works fantastically as a baby monitor!  The sound and motion alerts in the software we use on the iPad are fantastic!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
My new Fi8910W would re-boot when pointed at something in bright sunlight. Foscam support was available by phone with a 2 minute wait. After the initial screening questions the suggestions were do not use an extension cord, its is not an outdoor camera (true, it is not built for outdoor weather, but the web browser tool does have an 'outdoor' setting for viewing outdoors), your router must broadcast its SSID, and this will work only on wireless. After this, Calvin took control of my system, changed my router to broadcast SSID and the camera worked. He was helpful and courteous. He was a pleasure to work with. He even took my browser to Amazon so I could do a feedback.

The reason the SSID change fixed the problem was that it was getting dark and the IR cut filter no longer was being invoked and the camera was not re-booting.

What finally fixed the problem was I simply rotated the lense 1/8 of a turn. This must have loosened something (perhaps the mechanical IR cut filter) and the camera started working fine.

I am now very pleased with its function, clarity and for keeping watch for critters in my garden the vivid colors are very helpful. This camera is much better for viewing outdoors than prior Foscam camers without the IR cut filters.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works as promised, Nice picture quality and sound.
review_body: I have 4 Astak Mole cameras and this one Foscam.  I access the Mole cameras via Yoics and the Foscam directly using both its remote IP address and port as well as the Foscam address provided through the domain service that is initially free.  It is a very fast connect remotely and both sound and video work fine.  I had difficulty on initial setup going from the assigned IP to fixed IP as I would keep losing the camera and as I had to leave my remote location, I left the camera on router assigned IP, no problem to date.  I changed the port to 8090 as suggested and works fine.  I have alarms set for sound and video and have received several false alarm photos with sensitivity on 4 or 5, not sure why.  Overall an excellent product, relatively easy setup, excellent price compared to the more pricey Astak Mole.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: With the help of Ron Jacob (Foscam Rep) I have my camera up and working.  It is great.  I recommend this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It has reasonable price, not bad resolution. panning and tilting is very useful. wireless connection is a little complicate. There're many application on variaty platform for this product.(PC, Android, iOS, HTML...)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this for a specific reason, to record some backyard renovations. My experience has been a like/hate for the last 3 days.

First, the camera is not exactly tiny, so discreet it does not do. But I knew that going in. The camera itself functions nicely. It does all the pan and tilt, but like other reviews say, it does not zoom. The IR also works well. So all in all the camera operates well except for one issue. Once a day it will reset itself and return to the 'center', what it considers its starting point. If you want it to always point to one place make sure it's the center.

Now the real issue. The software is the worst piece of garbage ever created. I could go into detail but I would be writing a small book. Save yourself some aggravation. Toss it immediately. Find other software that works with the camera. I tried Vitamin D. It works ok, but had issues. First, it does not control pan/tilt. It would lose connection on a 10-15 minute basis. This would create many mp4 files. For some reason the software would create 8-10 processes that I would have to kill. I also had problems panning the camera with the Foscam software. The camera would pan or tilt so far, then freeze. If I hit center fast enough it would move and I could try to re-adjust. Otherwise it would go thru a reboot and go back to center a few minutes later.

I then tried WabCamXP 5 which worked great. It does control pan and tilt. I had no issues with the camera freezing when moving. It never lost connect and I ended up with one large avi which is what I wanted. Only thing I missed from Vitamin D was the feature that detects movement so you can go right to that point in the video. Since I was recording constant motion it was not an issue.

So in summary the camera works fine. Your mission will be to find the right software to use with it. If you are looking for an easy install and use this will leave you pulling your hair out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought the Foscam F18910W about 6 months ago because I wanted to know what's going on in front of my house, near my front door and inside my living area when I leave my home for extended periods. This camera was an easy set up. I used Foscam's remote setup service to get me wireless from anywhere in the world on my 3G smart phone and wi-fi laptop. It has worked perfectly since day one. It sits in a front window, rotates, captures a crystal clear picture of the front of my house (daylight only) and inside the house with infrared night vision beautifully. Today I decided to change the password on my home's wireless router to something easier to remember than the original 25 character behemoth. Foscam telephone support walked me thru the password changing process on the camera in a couple of minutes. I am extremely happy with Foscam product and support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very good service answered my questions, and they set up my camera remotely both wireless and network, short wait time

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I use this camera to watch my dogs during the day. Often I use the two-way audio to give them commands. The original setup was not that difficult if you follow the instructions. On my network it has a static IP and port mapping allows me to make it available over the Internet.

The night vision works well, but does tend to see-through certain thin clothing. This isn't a big issue, but it is worth noting that it may not be appropriate in some use cases. During the day the color tends to falter leaving it a little washed out.

My experience is that at 12 feet in darkness you can no longer distinguish between objects 1-2 inches in size. To frame this, if you put a $1 bill on the floor next to a $20 bill you would struggle to identify which is which. At 20 feet in darkness you will lose edge definition on items. Anything beyond tends to reach the limit of the infrared range.

In bright light you will add a couple of feet to each of the measures above. The reason for mentioning this is that you may not want to locate the camera in a ceiling where it is inherently 10-12 feet away from any relevant objects. Also, the camera as pictured with the product has the base pointed down. To gain the most range of freedom you will want to mount the camera upside-down and flip the rotational axis. This is supported in the software.

The video recording features do not appear to work on my firmware. The snapshot features require you to login before they work. I had planned to have the stills grabbed every couple of minutes available to the public and the pan/tilt adjustments requiring a password. To get around this I had to setup a PHP script to authenticate and store the images on a server. Then people can access the images without logging in.

The audio quality of the microphone is reasonable. The speaker on the camera is poor and I highly recommend that when mounting the camera you add a set of powered speakers available on Amazon for cheap.

The only downside is that there is an upper limit on concurrent viewers on the camera. After five concurrent viewers the camera tends to become non-responsive to commands through the GUI. The second camera of the same model with the newer firmware does not have this same issue. Regardless, I highly recommend this camera and have recommended it to friends.

When it finally goes up to 1080p or 720p my goal is to upgrade these units.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to use, really quiet, can listen and talk through it...
review_body:
This thing was pretty easy to set up. Follow the instructions you see in the reviews - forget most of what you read in the actual instructions. Yes, you need to know a bit about how to set up WiFi networks and all that. But it's easy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this camera for the purpose of security of my house. The first camera worked out so nicely, a second one was bought. The night vision feature and the iPhone interface were two of the most important features that I needed. Accessing my cameras through the web is as easy as can be.

Any time I've needed technical support......the support staff has answered all my questions and solve any issues that I experienced. Everyone seems to be well versed in the technical issues of the camera and the different interfaces that are available. Kudos to FOSCAM's support staff.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good product with a few short-comings
review_body: Just bought my second FI8910 for home security and house monitoring while traveling.  The first one took a while to get working as there are a lot of parameters to set, but once working it's been very reliable.  I simply copied the parameters from my first install to the second camera, except for items that have to be unique like IP address, and it came up immediately.  I also updated the firmware on both cameras as there is a reported vulnerability to hacking your wi-fi network without the latest firmware.  The only issue I have is blurry photos during motion detect usage.  The camera detects motion OK but the captured photos are typically blurry, especially if the movement is across the field of view. Try to position the camera head-on to the route of movement to minimize this problem.  For the price though this is really a pretty good little camera with a lot of function.  I may buy a third one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is my sixth Foscam purchase, and fourth model FI8910W camera.  All cameras were extremely easy to setup, and worked perfectly right out of the box.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works great and good quality for the money. My kids and I play with it and other wireless cameras for fun. We recommend this for the price. It really is a good quality product for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought two of these and have been happy overall so far. There are a few things that could be better, but these are also sub-$100 cameras, so it's hard to be too critical.

Pros:
- Relatively easy setup
- Low price
- Basic web interface works well

Cons:
- Relatively short range; at close range I can get around 15 fps over WiFi using iSpy Connect, but once I'm halfway across the house it drops to 2-5 fps. The antennas do detach, and I've already ordered some stronger antennas to hopefully extend the range and maintain 15 fps.
- No "real" software included. There is software for configuring your camera and a web interface to allow you to view a live stream, but you'll have to use third-party software if you want to record the camera streams or view multiple cameras at once.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Setup Tip: Each camera has two unique addresses
review_body:
Quite pleased with the cameras, but access to the camera wasn't working until I realized that when you switch from wired to wireless, the IP address of the camera changes.

Here's what I learned:

Attach the camera to your home network via the wired connector and the address that shows up in your router/modem's setup will be "X". Enable wireless access, disconnect the wired connection, look in your router/modem's setup and there's another address ("Y"). This is the one you need to use if you plan to access these things remotely via their wireless interface.

You may be saying "Well, duh," but everything that you attach to your network shows up in the router/modem's setup and in my case there was no information provided that let me determine which address belonged to which device, so I didn't notice the change/new address at first.

Bottom line is that it would be best to write down all the addresses shown in your router/modem's setup and, as you add each camera, write down the new address that appears when you attach it wired, and then the new address that shows up when you switch it to wireless access. This last address is the one you will use when you open the ports on your modem/router to allow remote access.

I recall reading complaints about the noise that the camera makes when it turns on the IR LEDs, and it does, indeed, click quite loudly. When I first started using mine, it would automatically turn on the IR when the sun set, which is not what I wanted (mine are looking out windows for daytime monitoring, and the IR just bounces off the glass and blinds the camera), but once I started using the Android version of IP Cam Viewer by Robert Chou and manually shut off the IR, they now stay off. Cool.

Resolution isn't great, but it seems most IP video cameras are 640x480 (unless you're willing to spend a lot more money). Still good enough to monitor the condition of my lawn whileI'm on vacation.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've had 3 of these cameras.  The first one worked great and was easy to set up,  until I accidentally dropped it and the power plug snapped.  I tried to repair that myself, but got frustrated and just bought a 2nd one.  That's when I *really* got frustrated, because the new camera wouldn't connect to my wifi.  I'm very technically savvy, and spent hours troubleshooting but could not get it to work.  I decided to return it and when the replacement camera came, I had the same issue again.  I don't think it's "user error"... it seems to me like the wifi radios are hit-and-miss with these cameras.  If you get a good one and can get it on your wifi, paired with good software, this camera can be pretty great.  I used "iSpy" for motion detection recording, and an IP Camera Viewer app on my phone to access it remotely.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Needed help with accessing the cameras remotely to be view from my phone and computer away from home.

Great: Versatile, standalone, fairly easy setup, great App for iPhone(Foscam Pro)Browser control You can set it down and, with some technical tweaking on the router, have it operational (some router and DNS understanding is helpful, but the installation book gives details). Have it email you when it detects motion, or have 2-way conversations from your iPad, iPhone, or PC. Excellent iPad app allows full control. Pan, tilt, but no zoom. Remote zoom and focus would make this perfect. Night vision works great. Keep an eye on your place when you're out of town. Get emails if there's motion when you don't expect there to be. Browser controls vary with the browser. IE will give you the most versatility, but FireFox and Chrome also work, with varying degrees of success. The iPad app is the best. Intuitive controls and speakerphone. This product has...great tech support I was a bit confused on the requirement for DDNS support and called the 800 number and the tech wanted to remote in and assist. I was unable at the time because I was away from home and computer. We setup an appointment for 5:30 pm central time and the tech (ralph.mendez@foscam.us) was on time. He answered all my questions and configured both my indoor cameras for the free remote control service provided by foscam. I am somewhat technology savvy and I would recommend this to my friends! Looking forward to purchasing a couple of outdoor cameras to compliment my configuration.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera was difficult to configure through the network. After spending 2 hours I got it to work wirelessy with my router using a DMZ port. I ended up purchasing an app to view the camera remotley since it was impossible to use the \\"free\\" service.
One day my wife came home and the garage door was open. She called the police and the police swept the house, no one was inside, nothing was disturbed. I moved the camera to the garage to monitor when and if the garage door would open again.
Next morning I couldn't open my garage door at all from inside the garage using my transmitter. I unplugged the camera and was instanlty able to control the garage door again. I ran an emissions scan on this device and it is 7 dB over FCC Class B at multiple frequencies!!! The spectrum is so noisy it overloaded the analyzer during quasi peak measurements.
I would not reccomend this device or other Foscam devices made in China based on their lack of FCC compliance.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Don't Buy if you Want Wirelss
review_body:
First the good: This is a very nice looking, well designed camera that is very quiet in operation. While it would be nice to have a little higher resolution, the image is quite good. The infrared works impressively well in total darkness and has a good range. No problems at all connecting with ethernet cable. If you don't need wireless and want to only use an ethernet cable, for the price this would be a four-star.

Now the bad: I returned it. I am computer saavy and despite spending about three hours trying to get it to recognize/connect with my Airport Extreme I could not, even after following the outstanding step-by-step instructions at this website (while it is for a slightly different model should have worked for this camera):

[...]

This website is essential, because the manual is useless. However, despite how well written the website instructions are, I repeated them three times, and again could not connect. Even if it had worked, the setup is so cumbersome, detailed, and so full of pitfalls that it is frustrating and time-consuming. Also, you have to be extremely comfortable changing IP addresses, gateway addresses, subnet masks, etc. to even attempt setting this camera up for wireless. I didn't even attempt to learn more advanced setups that are theoretically possible for this camera. The overall software is so-so.

Related to the above, as mentioned the manual is awful: lacking detail, poorly written and poorly translated and of little help. Whoever wrote the above website instructions should be hired by Foscam. There has just got to be a simpler, more straightforward way to hook this up to wireless.

review_body:
I love having this mounted over our baby's crib. I bought tinyCam Monitor Pro for 4 bucks and use that instead of the web interface.

Camera setup was simple for home wifi, but a nightmare to get it working over remote so that I could see it on my phone from work. I have lots of experience with port forwarding and such, but the AT&T U-Verse router was a real challenge, and finally I wasn't able to get it truly solid until I followed the instructions on the company's website for setting up a free dns server (using no-ip.com). Even then, if you don't want to pay $15/year for the DNS, you have to log in once every 30 days or they'll cancel your free account.

AT&T U-verse router hint: if you get to the point that the camera is remote viewable when plugged into the router, but doesn't work when in wifi mode, reboot your router! A few hours were wasted figuring out that little bit...

Update: after working great for 4 weeks, today I once again can't reach my camera. I think it's a DNS issue again, but I hate the fact that this is such a tedious device.

review_body: I purchased the Foscam Fl8910W from Home Depot due to their internet sale of the item to see if I liked the product prior to purchasing more camera's.  I received the item on Friday afternoon and I installed the item and was able to get it working wireless quickly from the internet at my home.  I did have some trouble getting it to work from my Iphone and trouble shoot the camera for most of the weekend. I called the Foscam tech support on Monday morning and worked with Ryan.  Ryan was very pleasent to work with and he remotely entered my computer and got the camera working in no time.  He also was able to walk me through the Iphone portion of the hookup and got that working also. I do think the camera responds rather slowly on the movement of the remote access but, for the most part it still will be worth the cost for what I'm wanting out of it's performance where I can monitor my home when I'm away on vacation or on the weekends when I'm out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I own 3 of these as well as the FI9821W
review_body:
This camera relies on your PC/MAC to be the DVR for any VIDEO recording, so you'll have to leave the software on your pc (Internet Explorer/Firefox with associated plugin) running. If you're using IE be sure to read the manual concerning browser security and ActiveX security problems with this FOSCAM. If you use wireless MAC filtering, look on the back of the camera for the MAC address, it has BOTH the Ethernet and wireless addresses on it. For motion-detected video, it will mean the camera(s) will be streaming constantly over your network, so your bandwidth will be limited for any other use. If you're using Blue Iris software, in essence a pc application which functions as a DVR (better than the included software), the same applies-you're basically monitoring a non-stop stream of video for motion detection. All this streaming really loads up your home/business network.

All the above references video. For picture taking, the 8910W will NOT save to an on-board sd card, but WILL email you or upload (ftp) to an internet server of your choice (not video.)

My suggestion to you is to bite the bullet and get the FI9821W, which in essence, is a mini-DVR/pc/camera in one. It will monitor and record to an SD card on the camera(not included), and (once set up) can be operated completely independent of any pc (if you choose.)

One last thing-the USERNAMES as well as the passwords are CASE SENSITIVE in Blue Iris (PC and mobile.)

review_headline: I love my foscam cameras!! FI8910
review_body: I love my cameras!! I have 2 of them! If you have any problems setting it up just call the toll free number and they can access your computer and they do all the work!! They dont set up the email settings to get notified so let me help you with that if i can, it works for me....go to MAIL SETTING SERVICES on the ip camera tool on your computer....Francis Stevens  SENDER=  YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS@YAHOO.COM RECIEVER 1 (AGAIN PUT) YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS@YAHOO.COM  SMTP SERVER= smtp.mail.yahoo.com  (type this as is) small caps SMPT PORT= 25, ( if that number 25 doesnt work, try 465 and 587 to see which one work) transport layer security  (none) need authentication (check box)  SMTP USER = your email address @yahoo.com SMTP PASSWORD = your email password that you use for your email address  hit test, it should say SUCCEEDED , IT WORKS FOR ME  Let me tell you what apps i use for the ipad...foscampro when you add the camera, put your name, the remote camera address is your email ****  myfoscam.org can be found under the camera,(starting with 2 letters...( do not put in the http thingy just the email)  put in your port,(2or 4 digit number) your local camera address which is 192...., then put in port number again ( some have a 2 digit some have 4 digit port number) than USER NAME is admin no password and hit done at the top.. good luck  For ANDROID i use IP CAM REMOTE go to connection settings, your name, your camera email address( which is located under the ipcamera) ****myfoscam.org  or your ip address which is 192....try either one, put in your port number, user name is admin no password and hit ok, I hope i am explaining myself, lol Note it works for me, just giving you my input...Thanks

Ryan Michael was the support wizard that easily took me through the entire set-up procedure.  He was very helpful AND very patient with me.  The support given would make me purchase a Foscam camera. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Poor quality (you get what you pay for)
review_body: I picked up a Foscam a couple of years ago and it worked great, so when I saw a sale on this newer model I snatched it up as a no-brainer. Unfortunately the quality of this unit was junk. After configuring the unit and having it run well for about an hour, it suddenly began to freeze and reboot constantly. To the point of being unusable. Another issue I have is with the horrible quality of the documentation. As others have noted, it's as if it was either written by a non-native English speaker, or translated poorly. I also hate the web interface and the fact that it doesn't offer an SSL login option so all your credentials are sent in clear text over the network. Foscam could easily add a self-signed SSL certificate which would close that security hole. I hope to pickup another camera in the future that actually was QC tested because you can't beat these for the price...when they work.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

This thing is a piece of junk. Received it today and it installed fine, just like my older FosCam, but this only has TWO working IR LED's. I guess Foscam has absolutely no quality control at all.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I received mine yesterday.  It took about 2 hours to setup and figure out the wireless connection and port forwarding.  The iPhone app works well for checking up on your camera during the day, but I'm not impressed with the motion detection.  The motion detection pictures are usually pretty blurry, unless the person stands fairly still during the photo, but it'll at least notify you that something is going on.  You can set it up to email several addresses, so you can use "@txt.att.net" or "@vtext.com" if you want to receive text messages when somebody walks by your cam.  Video recording isn't as easy as getting pictures.  It appears to only work with Internet Explorer, and you have to allow all ActiveX activity to make it work correctly, which seems like it could cause a security issue.
