product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Pros: This is a very inexpensive, high quality camera. The night vision and auto-light adjustments are great. It responds to controls well. It's attractive, non-descript, and works the way it's supposed to work with no hiccups. I followed the instructions (though they were rather complicated) and it worked on the first try. While it took me over an hour to set up (and I am a very confident computer user) I didn't hit any frustrating points, nor did I feel compelled to call tech support--this is a HUGE plus for me.

Cons: The problem is that viewing away from home is a difficult set-up that, in most home environments, requires the use of a program on a computer that IS RUNNING the entire time you want to be able to view the camera. So, if I want to leave home and be able to check in on the camera, I have to leave my computer AT HOME, ON, and RUNNING A THIRD PARTY PROGRAM. This is frustrating. Also, it's virtually impossible to get the sound to work unless you use additional equipment (i.e. speakers). There is no iPhone or Android app, it's just a mobile website that loads slowly and works slowly.

My Use: I'm monitoring my dog's activity in her crate while I'm out of the house. It works well for that, though I can't take advantage of the auditory features to hear if she's crying or to talk to her to calm her down. I can see if she needs me home to change her food/water/wee wee pad or if she's freaking out. The night vision works REALLY well - I can see her moving around even when I only have a lamp on in the house while I'm away.

Conclusion: If sound doesn't matter to you and you're looking for a high-quality video home monitoring system, this is the cheapest way to go that will still work well. I would love to have a native app for the camera and I'd love for it to have an easier set-up. (That said, the directions were thorough and relatively easy to follow if you have any sort of idea of what you're doing.)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
My first IP camera was the EasyN FS-613A-M136, which I bought because it was cheap and I was just experimenting. My research showed that the EasyN was either a clone or somewhat generic version of a Foscam device, so when the Foscam FI8910W went on sale I got one, thinking I was buying a better device -- after all, the SALE price for the Foscam is higher than the REGULAR price for the EasyN...

The Foscam has the ability to turn the IR emitters on and off, both automatically, and/or on demand. The EasyN is superior in EVERY OTHER WAY.

Both cameras offer 640x480 images, but the Foscam image looks like something 1/4 that size that was digitally zoomed and makes the somewhat blurry EasyN image look like crystal clear HD in comparison.

The Foscam's camera housing is only loosely connected to the base -- it will wobble relative to the base. The EasyN is solidly constructed.

Both are easy to use and their browser interfaces are almost identical, so nothing special there.

All-in-all, I think I paid an extra $20 (an extra $35 at regular price) for the IR Cut Filter and a name. The trade-off in image quality for the IR Cut is absolutely not worth it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
We bought this as an alternative to the much more expensive baby cameras available for twice the price. We set this up in the nursery using this mount ([[ASIN:B00B5A33YO Pedco Ultra Clamp Assembly 360 Swivel Mount for Cameras and Optic Devices]]) to attach it directly to the side of the crib. We use an old iPhone as the dedicated screen. I downloaded and paid for an app called \\"FoscamPro\\" that utilizes all the features of the camera, such as two way audio.

The set-up features of the app allow you to access the camera over the LAN, which facilitates much faster operation, less delay, and higher update rates. It also works over the internet using your IP address (but you have to be able to set up port forwarding). One nice feature is that the camera comes with its own dedicated URL valid for 3 years, which means you don't need to have a static IP.

I've played around with some of the other features, like motion detection, email notification, and uploading directly to FTP. I set up my Windows Home Server with an FTP client, and played with the settings in the camera until I got it to upload files directly to a directory on the home server.

So far, this camera has worked exactly as advertised and was totally worth the money. However, you need to be a little bit tech savvy to really take advantage of all the features.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Camera works great!  Really good picture quality.  Pretty easy to set up, just make sure all of your firewall settings and router settings are correct to allow for it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I just setup a second one of these Foscam cameras today for my other son's room. They are simple to setup, if you know what you're doing. I can't stress that enough. If you aren't familiar with computers, networking, etc... You aren't going to have much fun setting this camera up. That being said, if you do know what you're doing, this camera can be up in running with at least just basic viewing within minutes. I can't speak much to the features of the camera such as the FTP and email alerts and so on. I have both of these cameras feeding into a server running Blue Iris software. So have I haven't really explored any of the additional features. So far they the original one has been up without issue for a few months now. Both of mine are running over wifi and the video quality is just fine. The pan and tilt functionality seems to work just fine. I am pretty impressed with how well you can see in pitch black rooms with this camera. Unfortunately, I don't know exactly what the effective distance of night time viewing is because the bedrooms I have these setup in are only about 12-15 feet at their longest but I have no issues seeing the entire room with them.

For those who are under the impression that you get a free ddns account with one of these cameras, you technically do. The DDNS service is bound to the actual device. It's labeled right on the box that it's bound to the individual camera, and the DDNS URL is right on the bottom. That doesn't mean that you can go to a 3rd party companies website and expect them to give you free DDNS service they otherwise charge for.

Overall for the money I'm pretty happy with my purchase. I wish they had zoom functionality, but I understand that would come with a higher price tag. I do appreciate the fact that these are actually 802.11n, just wish they supported 5ghz. 2.4ghz can get awful crowded real quick, and in my experience 5ghz isn't very common.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_headline: Don't Update the Firmware, It will Brick your Camera!
review_body: On the first day that I got the camera I updated the firmware and it became bricked. I am very careful about these things and have much experience programming and dealing with electronics. I carefully followed the provided instructions, made sure I had the correct firmware, and updated through the its Web UI. Now my camera cannot be found by the IP Camera tool through Ethernet or WiFi and it cannot even be detected by my router. I had plans of buying many Foscams, but now I will not do so anymore. I had such high hopes for my Foscam FI8910W. On the plus side, it was an easy return since I have Amazon Prime.

review_headline: Do not expect too much for this camera
review_body:
My biggest gripe is that it takes about 3 seconds before this camera can detect motion and start recording. In many cases, this is too slow for that warm and fuzzy secure feeling I want in a security camera. The control and image are OK. It is just a cheap little caamera after all. The furnished software barely works. And the sensitivity setting is not very good. DO n ot buy this if you are looking for a security solution for less. It is not going to work. review_headline: Horrid customer service and not a great product
review_body: We bought this to use as a baby monitor and at first we really liked it.  But then the camera would only work some of the time and the sound quality was always horrid and then the camera started showing a green line blocking most of the screen.  We contacted foscam as it was still under warranty and less than a year old.  First they instructed us to take apart the camera and try to fix it ourselves.  Fail.  Then they said send it back and they would look at it.  They did NOT pay for the shipping.  Once they fixed it they contacted us and told us to pay for return shipping as well!!  Their product was faulty and we had to pay shipping to replace it?!  That is not right! When we brought this up with them they told us they don't care about us and we  could either pay the shipping to get it back or they just wouldn't send it back.  The worst customer service ever.  BEWARE!!!!  Don't give these jerks your money!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
First off, I love the Foscam cameras, especially since they added the cut filter that compensates for the infra-red night vision. The colors are great now, not washed out. They are good, inexpensive Pan/Tilt ( no zoom ), night vision, with audio IP cameras.

That said, this particular camera has issues. I updated to the latest firmware and set it up. At first I thought is was a power/power-supply issue. The darn thing rebooted about a dozen times when first turned on. Later I set it up and left it on. Again, it rebooted over a dozen times in about an hour but then stabilized over night. However, at dawn ( I think it is when it switched to day mode versus night vision ), it started rebooting again. After a little over an hour, it stabilized.

I have since ordered a replacement and am returning the defective unit.

Thank you Amazon for your no hassle return policy, including paying for return shipping.

review_body:
The camera came out a lot better than I expected. There are free iPhone apps that allow you to watch the camera from anywhere. You can't hear sound or record from the app, but for a monitoring perspective, it does the job. Additionally, AwkwardHamster on YouTube has step-by-step on how to set up your camera to view from any computer, as well as goes into some free video recording software.

I haven't mounted the camera yet, but the pan aspect lets me capture both my living room and sitting room. I bought my camera from Warehouse Deals, so I don't know if it is supposed to look more yellow than normal, but I don't mind it. The video comes out crystal clear on my iPhone 5 and I can now watch my LO wherever I go! Great for the travelling man/woman.

I will update once I get the video recording option set up. I think it would be great for security, as well as a baby monitor! I wish I would have bought this instead of my AngelCare, as we barely use that anymore. I can imagine I will use this camera for the rest of my son's life. Recommend based on functionality, wireless capability, and PRICE!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you need a reliable & somewhat easy to install online camera for your home, you should consider buying this product.
- You can view your camera online using your iPhone, iPad or Laptop
- You can set it on a motion detector mode and have it send an email to you with the picture

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have three of these cameras up and running now and have had no problems at all with any of them. As long as you are comfortable with changing setting on your router getting these cameras setup with port forwarding was very easy and works very well. The cameras have MUCH better low light non-IR ability than the two other cameras I have used (d-link and axis) and with the IR lights turned on the image is very good in my opinion. While there may be better quality cameras available as far as the image is concerned, the price on those cameras is much higher and streaming that higher quality is difficult over the net for most home users.

I really like the ability to move the camera around remotely. While the built in microphone and speaker aren't the best they do work. All-in-all I find that for the money this camera is hard to beat and I would buy another if needed. I can also recommend using tinyCam Monitor Pro for viewing and controlling these cameras on your phone. The program works great and can control all of the camera functions.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I hope I can be of help to others who are undecided on their purchase.

I am 54 and I'm not an IT, I am a civil engineer, and before ordering the camera I read everything I could find on the internet and youtube.
I have an old router D Link DI 624, with 9 dbi antenna to further strengthen the signal.
Bought a Foscam FI8910W, used, on Amazon Warehousedeals, as always excellent service and a guarantee A, the camera arrived before the expected time, and extremely well protected. I recommend it.
The experience of connecting the camera was not traumatic, just followed the steps in the manual.
In about 15 minutes I had the camera running both my intranet, such as the internet and wireless throughout.
The camera is very stable when it detects movement or sound is detected when the house alarm is triggered, proceeds to send the photos attached in the email.
The image quality is not the best in the world, but for the price is quite acceptable.
It is very important to test the camera location provisionally, as this greatly influences the quality of the image, at different times of day and night, and you also have to take into account the bulbs that may be in the viewing angle of the camera, and everything I read, only in a post referred to this. Once we are satisfied with the results, we can proceed to fix it.
For mobile phone, mine is a Samsung, I recommend IP Cam Viewer application is excellent.
Now I'm trying other recording software, such as the Blue Iris, and Vitamin D, then tell you that I prefer.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was having trouble with connecting to WIFI with this cam.  I was able to remote in to the cam and set it up connected to my modem.  Unfortunely telling my wifi abilities were not working.  SO I contacted Tech Support and had a gentlemen help me by connecting with teamviewer ( a program I was familiar with).  My setup is Win 7 Linksys e2000 router and DD-wrt custom firmware.  He came in and fixed my issue.  My issue was I had my setting like my router.  WPA2 tkip+aes and correct pw.  Only thing my computer picked it up as AES, he switched the mode to AES and boom it worked.  Also helped me with my remote settings even though I had it setup initially.  Overall great feedback and did'nt start from beginning like I didn't know a thing or two about computers and trusted what I did up until that point.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam PT Camera: Easy to use; Easy to access away from home!
review_body:
[Tech: Scott]
Foscam has updated their pan-tilt [PT] camera [FI8910w] and instructions to make it MUCH easier to install and use. They established a secure site to look at it from \\"off-site\\"...frankly it was awful before, but they obviously have worked-out the kinks in this version of hardware, software, and instructions, and it's great!! I only needed tech support because of \\"port forwarding\\" issues with my modem/router.
It has easy-to-use PT features and it's easy to pre-set multiple positions, and now is also easy to use when I am away from home. It finally makes it easy for me to keep tabs on my elderly father and keep him safe!

At the end of our call she directed me to this site to leave a review again. I was not able to continue the call, so she was not giving the opportunity to coach me in my review. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I purchased this to monitor our remote vacation home. Unless you have some basic networking knowledge you may need some help with setting this up. There are many settings to configure in your router, camera, and possibly modem. This is not a simple plug and play. I have to say that the two times I called customer support I was promptly connected to a technical support person. They set up a remote link to your pc and they configure all of the settings and will get the camera up and running. The camera has a built in mic and speaker for remote monitoring and communication. The picture is good in daylight and at night. Don't expect a high def picture. Just a good quality which is all I need. I set up the motion detection which works very well. Setting up the unit to send e-mails was a little tricky because I could not find all of the settings for my Yahoo account. For reference the setting for yahoo and sbcglobal.net are smtp.mail.yahoo.com port # is 465 select TLS from drop down menu. Check the box under the TLS menu as well. There are also several you tube videos with detailed set up instructions. There is a good gmail one from the manufacturer. I also purchased the Foscam pro app from the App Store for my ipad and iphone. I highly recommend this app. It works great and was easy to set up. I tried some of the free apps but could not get it to work. The app lets you change some settings on the cam remotely. I would have given it 5 start but any product where you need to call support should not get 5 stars. I was really impressed with the customer support.

review_headline: It works! and so does their tech support at an unbeatable price
review_body:
All the features you get at this price, using these for a network of security cams is a \\"no-brainer\\". I was reluctant at first but now that I've used 2 of them with success, I would definitely purchase more.

The cams were straight forward as far as setting them up locally (LAN). They were up and runnning in no time. To access them remotely requires some basic port forwarding. I kept running into an error when customizing my settings on the cam which prompted me to contact tech support to see what the deal might be (plus I was curious about how my experience would be with their support team).

Fortunately, I got Harry Foster on the line after about a 15 min wait during business hours and he was knew the product well. He was quite knowledgable and got me through my issues. I had a surprisingly pleasant, good first experience with Foscam tech support (minus the hold time so I'd suggest to try shooting them an email).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've had the camera for about 7 months now:
I'm pretty tech savvy and it was easy to set up at first.... I did have a problem with the port forwarding having never done it before. After many google attempts to get it right I called Tech support and they walked me through it. Used the camera for many months, no problems and good quality images. I have this mounted inside on a window ledge and did have to put up a black sheet to prevent window glare back when the sun is shining directly at the window (which is only from about 2-4pm for me) I have a huge tree in the yard, so shade is my friend in this case.
Remote viewing is great too, especially when you're not home. Love the features and easy to use.

On 4-15-13 I had to get a new router which didn't recognize the camera. I did everything I thought I was supposed to such as adding the new router password codes, etc...the camera did work when plugged into the Ethernet, just not wirelessly, again contacted tech support and Ron Jacob fixed what was wrong. My IR went out after 3 months of use, wasn't a big deal to me since I have motion lights in the yard. I did mention it to Ron Jacob and he said to watch it for a few days since we had to reboot the camera itself and that should fix the IR problem. No clue why the IR went out in the first place, working fine one night, then not....I was told that if the IR didn't work a replacement would be sent out. Overall, very happy with the camera, great images, even the night ones (when the IR works) the price is great for what you get and the customer service can't be beat! Highly recommend it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy setup but only 1/2 of a security system
review_body:
The camera was a breeze to setup if you follow the instructions included in the box. Everything worked like it was supposed to and I didn't have any problems removing the CAT5 and making it Wi-Fi, just be sure you give it a few seconds. The WebUI was fine and had the basic controls you'd expect: up/down, left/right, diagonal. It even had a flip/invert image in case you mount the camera upside-down. In terms of a security system, this product is only half of what you need. It would be fine if you are constantly looking at the camera and are there to point it in the right direction when needed, but the automation and recording features are not as accessible as the other features. In fact, for full recording functionality additional software is recommended. I understand that the software is not bundled because you might only need 1 copy of the software but 12 cameras - bundling would be redundant. Lastly, I tried messing with the mic/sound on the camera but that was a bit frustrating as it required a VLC plugin and even then I never got the speaker option to work, however, that was not a feature I wanted so I'm not too worried about it. The picture quality of the camera would not be featured in the Iron Man movie but features and clothing are identifiable.

TL;DR: Great camera but you need additional software to record the video

review_body: After reviewing a few alternatives we decided to purchase this camera.  We recently had our garage broken into & an $ 1100.00 dirt bike stolen.  We have an alarm system inside the house but not in the garage.  After receiving the camera I was able to load the software and get the camera image via ethernet cable connection to my pc within 5 mins.  However, I was not able to get the wireless connection to work.  I seemed to be following all of the directions but the camera would not show up.  I then called FOSCAM tech support, the 800# in the manual that comes with the camera.  After pressing 2 for customer service I almost immediately was talking to someone.  The technician took control of my computer with team viewer and had the wireless working in less than a minute.  I was like, wow.  Then she moved on, at my request, to configure the camera to take pictures upon motion detection & email those to mine & my wife's Iphone.  Just what we wanted.  Great product & excellent customer service!

The two way audio from the phone app is perfect. I have this in my sons room to monitor him when he's sleeping/waking up and also to just see him playing while I'm working. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Ok, but calls home on internet.
review_body:
I bought this camera because it claims to have two-way audio support. I have 5 other network cameras
from trendnet, panasonic, and dlink so I figured this would be easy.

The features are not nearly as extensive as the panasonic cameras but this falls into the 'cheap'
catagory so I guess that is expected.

---

Privacy problems.

This webcam accesses the internet every minute without permission and you can not turn it off as far as I can tell.

Your webcam will automatically set up "Manufacturer's DDNS" (ie they are tracking all their
cameras).

ddns.myfoscam.org

01:46:07.928172 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11
01:47:08.649235 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11
01:48:09.214181 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11
01:49:10.004308 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11
01:50:10.643388 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11
01:51:11.384625 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11

If you try to set ddns.myfoscam.org to another IP locally so it can not call home this thing CRASHES and REBOOTS continiously and is unusable.

If you set the webcam gateway and dns to something that is unreachable it will continuously spew arp packets on your network trying to call home.
If you firewall port 53 to it can not do dns queries it will continuously spew DNS packets on your network

---

Android App.

They have one. There are no instructions and it requires you to login to use the app but they dont give you
the login info to do it !

If you can search enough to figure out how to get the app running, if you dont get all the parameters correct when setting up a camera the app just crashes. The app appears to be designed for phones not tablets and scales badly when run on andnexus 7.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera is ok but the tech support is awful
review_body:
These cameras work well and are easy enough to set up if you are familiar with electronics and computers. For the average lay person it is a challenge. The tech support is terrible. Getting through to someone is a long drawn out process and the knowledge of the person you get is not great. It took over 3 hours to get the two camera I purchased on line and functioning properly and the tech had to do it remotely.

One of the cameras stopped working and I returned it for a replacement camera. Amazon's replacement service was spot on. The new camera arrived within two days. Tech support, again, was less than helpful and I finally told them to forget it, I'd figure it out myself.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Camera works just as advertised, had to have a little help setting up. We use it to watch the dogs when away from the house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Purchased this product in January, 2013. Was very difficult to set up by myself. Had the foscam team help me set up remotely which was a lifesaver. Worked great until I had to get a new wireless router and the team had to help me again which was great. Having to sit on the phone for 1/2 hour waiting to talk to someone sucks but it beats pulling my hair out. On my third router now and you guessed it. This time the ip camera tool page wouldn't find the cameras so we had to reconnect and reinstall all the cameras. UGH. I love the cameras, great night vision with good clarity. Thanks to Ron Jacobs for his help on the latest round. I wish Foscam had a live chat support 24/7 where it was quick and easy for them to fix problems remotely. They do have a chat but it seems like it's rarely available, even during working hours?

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Harry Foster is  best. He was able to tactfully help me through my problem and diagnose it and promptly fix the problem! Will buy again!

review_body:

I am not computer savvy, but Scott did a very good job of navigating through several different technical menus and helped me setup my camera correctly. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Does what it's supposed to do.
review_body:
For only $70, it's a pretty good IP cam - quality is good, image is good, and features are good with the exceptions of lacking zoom and some other small nits.

Initial setup for viewing on the computer using the supplied cat5 cable is easy - following the instructions on the manual.

However once you attempt to jump over to wireless, if you're limited to a WEP router this is as tricky as any other IP device. I ended up having to call Foscam and wait online for a full hour before a tech named Kalvin picked up but who efficiently finished the wireless setup for me.

In any case, thanks to Kalvin it's working quite nicely.

If Foscam had more tech support/less waiting time, this review would have been 5 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body:

Well worth the purchase so far!!

Thank you Ron Jacob for getting my audio up and running!!!

Naomi

review_headline: Great camera/baby monitor and easy to set up
review_body: I bought this to work as a baby monitor with my iPhone and iPad. I read a lot of reviews that said it worked well, but it was very difficult to set up. I decided to give it a try, and I am glad i did. The images it produce are great. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to setup. I've never done anything like this and had to google a few technical words, but I had it completely set up in about an hour. The hardest part about the whole thing was remembering how to log in to my router. So if you have a brain in your head and can use google you shouldn't have a problem setting it up.

review_body: Camera itself works great, BUT I have yet to get the darn thing to view on my phone or be able to sign and view from another location.  Maybe it's just me...I'm fairly computer literate, but I have given up.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I actually own two of these cameras.  They are perfect for keeping an eye on various areas.  You can adjust just how sensitive you want the motion detection capabilities to be and then when something has been detected, I have it send me an email along with up to 6 pictures so that I can see what is going on at home when I'm not there.  I also have the images FTP'd to my web server for backup.  You can also download standard IP Cam apps for your Droid phones and/or IPhones so that you can see live images from all of your cameras right on your cell phone.  This camera operates wirelessly so no need to run a cable from your router to the camera.  For the price, I don't think that you can beat this camera.  If I needed more than two of them, I'd have no hesitation in buying more of them.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Its hard to believe but there still are some great companies
review_body:
Throughout my many years I have dealt with several different companies and what they call support teams. I have had to wait from a reasonable 10 minutes up to an hour plus, only to get either forwarded to someone else or accidently get disconnected. Most of the time, I felt like I knew more than they did anyway. I am here to tell you that this is not the type of service you will receive when you call Foscom. From the moment I called and received the announcement that there would be a short wait and that is exactly what they meant. Within two minutes I was talking to a member of their support team. She was patient and knowledgeable as she took charge of my computer and explained everything she was doing and explained even more than I could understand. Without hesitation not only corrected my problem (which by the way was a combination of camera setup and incorrect settings on my wireless router) would not let me leave until we tried ever possible use of the cameras making sure they worked properly. Actually after all was running correctly I had to call back and got Simon (a completely different tech) who was just as nice as the first person who helped me and he helped correct another situation that I caused myself. Now a day with slipshod workmanship in building products and even worse support after you make your purchase. It was a pleasure to deal with a company such a Foscom. I was so happy with their product and support I ordered additional cameras right then and there even though I could have purchased the same product from their competitor for a few bucks less. Your company is a breath of fresh air in today's economy. Thank you again for your courtesy.

Respectfully,

Eric R.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Sarah--Was my tech help when I was setting up this camera.  Her expertise and talent was unsurpassed.  The camera was easy to install with her help and works wonderfully.  We use it as security in our home when not present and to keep an eye on our cats when out running errands.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
On April 10,2013 I worked with a Foscam representive Ron Jacob to install my two camera's. Ron was an excellent representive and he quickly took control of my computer and setup the camer's. If you are an average computer person and never worked on the install of these IP camera's you will need help. The camera's have an excellent picture and the price is more then fair.
I feel that it would be nice if a wizard type install was possible because it does take some good computer knowledge to progran the camera's to your liking.
But as long as they keep the tech suport help available and take control from their end, no one should complain because they are Excellent at helping, so your happy with your purchase of a Foscam. They aim to get customer satisfaction to a ten. I have no complains based on my experience.
Ralph

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to use, except for the wireless part
review_body: This was super easy to set up, until we were ready to go wireless.  We had to research that aspect, because the instructions alone didn't work.  We also continue to get IP conflicts occasionally.  But all in all it works great and we are able to monitor our home and pets when we aren't there.  GREAT deal for the price.  Also note that the audio capability is here, but the audio hardware is not - you must supply it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
After receiving this cam putting it into operation it didn't take long for me to return and read reviews for this cam to see what others were saying. Wish I had done that from the beginning instead of just looking at the star ratings.. This cam constantly would reboot at various times of the day for no reason at all. It appears to have something to do with the changing sun light. There are many people who complained about this in the reviews but they are buried in the multitude of reviews most of which appear to be from employees of foscam!

I also believe if foscam solves this problem it would be a good product worth purchasing but until this problem is solved don't buy it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I want to thank Judy for the wonderful support she gave me in setting FOSCAM camera for remote access....Judy took over my system remotely....and performed everything I needed...

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Worked great, right out of the box! Easy to set up, haven't had any problems with it. Decent video quality.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This has been a lot of fun to have. We use it as a security camera at the front door, but didn't mount it permanently. So, we can also use it as:
- during remodeling, I aimed it inside the house so family could watch the work going on
- during times I have my grandson, I gave a 'visitor' password to his mom so she could enjoy watching him.

Just using it as a baby monitor is useful because of the great picture (we normally don't turn on the audio). Then when I put it back as a security monitor, I also turn on the alarms again so it keeps pictures of who comes to our front door.

It's not difficult to configure, and configuring it to get through a home firewall and using a dynamic dns service is easy if you've ever done it before. This wasn't tricky. And there are easy apps to use on iphone and ipad rather than use the web browser interface.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: If I had Kate set up my system in the first place, I would be very happy, most techs are clueless.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Harry Foster helped me connect the camera remotely.  I'm still working some kinks out of it (like a loud ringing noise), but the help to get it set up was fast and efficient.  Thanks.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camer and Camera Support from Foscam
review_body:
I purchased this camera to have more security in my home.

Positive
It has great pictures and motion sensor works well.
Foscam Customer Support Harry Foster was very helpful in getting my camera set up and I did not have to wait long on the phone for the representative.
We tested the recording and it worked well.

Harry was most helpful in providing me the information to allow my cellphone to receive the images from the camera.
I will be checking on that soon.

Negative
Not easy to install the wireless and create a file.
The video instructions are very blurry and can't be easily seen.
The video instructions tell you to go to a DYN.com and get the DSNN which may or may not be needed. They DYN is something that needs to be paid for. It's not free.

Recommendation
I would recommend this camera then call the Foscam Customer Support and get help right away, to avoid the stress of installation and set up.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have bought 11 of these cameras over the past 6 months, and will continue to use these. The quality is very good, easy to use, definitely inexpensive for the quality.
The only thing I am disappointed in, is that one of these cameras failed after 3 months so I emailed support about warranty work, and after a week have not received any response at all. So when buying these cameras be aware that you probably do not have any warranty. If something changes, I will edit this review.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I know how to click a mouse, so I thought that I could get this thing working in no time.
If you want to spend time figuring-out how to get a camera working instead of having a camera work, perhaps this is a good choice for you. Mine does not work after following the instructions to the best of my ability -- given the 1 hour I was willing to commit to the undertaking.
Admittedly, I did not contact customer support -- I don't want to have to. I did not get enthusiastic about sleuthing-out the myriad potential reasons for its inability to function. I wasted my money on this.
I didn't rate it one star, because I suspect that the camera works fine if one has the time or experience required....

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bought the Foscam FI8910W camera to work as a baby monitoring/security camera several months ago and it was worked great. I especially like the fact that I can control the camera with either my iPhone or iPad. Overall I have been very satisfied with the camera and its featuers. The setup is a bit technical, and I still have not been able to get the camera to transmit the feed when not connected to the same wireless network, but I assume that is due more to a lack of time on my part than the camera's fault.
One thing I do have to mention however is how horrible Foscam customer service has been. As stated, I initially bought this camera as a baby monitor and security camera for my daughter. As she has gotten older it has become more viable to mount the camera up on the wall so as to get better coverage of her room so that I can check on her when she's playing. To my surprise, when i went back to mount the camera with the included mounting bracket, I find out that the included mount did not securely fasten the camera to the wall mount, which allows the camera to rotate freely on the horizontal axis. This makes the wall mount virtually unusable. If I wanted to mount the camera on a vertical wall, the camera swings around freely so that the heaviest part of the camera is closet to the ground, thus making the camera's Pan and Tilt functions useless.
After going to Foscams website I realize that the mount they included with the camera works ONLY with the FI8918W cameras, and does not seem to fit the FI8910W. Further evidence can be found on Foscam's website in that if you buy a 2-camera bundle of the FI8910W cameras, the bundle includes a completely different wall mount than the one that came with the camera I bought, which shows that they have obviously already found, and corrected this problem with new purchases. Thinking of course that this should be an easy fix, I emailed Foscam to notify them of the problem with the included mount, in hopes that I could geta replacement sent out that would work with my camera.
Here is the emailed reply:

we can send you a new standard wall mount.

you will have to pay for the universal mounting bracket.

Best Regards,
XXXXXXXX.

Abysmal customer service.

Camera - 4.5 stars; Customer service - 0 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good all-around pan & tilt day/night camera
review_body: The Foscam FI8910W is a good camera.  The product seems well built, the instructions are clear, and the web-based software is pretty straightforward and easy to understand.  The camera worked right out of the box with the typical configuration required for a device of this type. It works well from an iPhone or iPad without special software.  The manual focus ring is hard to adjust because the IR LEDs are right where you want your fingers to go - you need to move the focus ring using the face of the ring.  If you intend to use the IR night vision capability looking out a window or through a window screen, be aware that the IR light will likely reflect off those items making it difficult to see beyond.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice IP Cam for the money, but you'll need DVR software to record
review_body:
Nice camera. VERY good in low light except that the relay for the IR lights makes an annoyingly loud CLICK when it turns on or off, so around dusk I'll hear the camera click several times. Don't understand why this isn't a solid state switch instead of a relay.

No DVR software comes with it, although they will sell you one from their website. HOWEVER instead I downloaded a free open source DVR app called iSpy Connect which was recommended in another review here.

iSpy Connect was a little finicky to setup with the FOSCAM camera. If you use the default settings that the iSpy Connect wizard sets up for you, the framerate is horrible (less than 1 FPS). After digging through the forums what I found was that you need to use the optional VLC plugin as the video source (I think you need to have VLC installed, and I already had it installed as it's my primary media player app). Using the VLC plugin I'm now getting an average of 15 - 20 FPS. All I did was copy the URL from the FFMPG source tab and pasted it into VLC plugin tab as the source URL.

iSpy Connect has the ability to record based on sound levels or motion detection. It's quite sophisticated.

review_body:
I have to say this camera is almost perfect. I had never set up anything like this other than a wireless network. The included software worked fine for me. Between that and a few Youtube setup videos it wasn't all that difficult. I bought this to use as a baby monitor and I use my iPhone to view remotely.

The infrared quality indoors is great.

The one minor issue I have is the wireless interference. I have noticed a constant hiss/crackle when using it over wifi, which becomes rather annoying. Plug in the ethernet cable and it goes away. It's a minor issue for me but it makes me lean towards just running an ethernet cable. (this could be an issue with other wireless devices in the house)

Overall I definitely recommend this camera as an alternative to expensive video baby monitors.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera,  one potential security flaw
review_body:
I like this camera; as long as you follow the instructions closely setup wasn't that hard. It works well remotely (I use it to check in on an elderly parent in another state). I would rate it a 5 except for the this problem.

There is a security issue. The camera has two modes; and ActiveX mode for viewing with Internet Explorer, and a Server Push mode for viewing with other browsers. This security issue only affects the Server Push mode. The problem is, often when I have logged in once, it stops asking for passwords on subsequent logins. For example, this morning I logged in from home, and it asked me for the password. Later in the day I logged in from work and it did not ask for a password. I have the camera on a timer switch so that it powers down and restarts every morning, which clears the credentials. This doesn't happen every time, so there may be some caching going on.

This could be a problem if you log in as an administrator, then someone else stumbles across the URL and has full access to change passwords, etc.

There is no logout button in the interface, so if this does happen to you, you need to reboot the camera, which is available through the interface (although that seems a little heavy handed).

I have posted this concern to the Foscam forum as well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great surveillance camera, far exceeded my expectations
review_body:
Easy setup, although for a non-tech person I can see where it could get difficult, but it goes like this:
- Connect camera to power outlet
- Connect camera with provided ethernet cable to your internet router at home
- Check your router to see what IP was assigned to the camera
- Connect to the camera's web interface at the IP assigned by router
- Connect camera to wireless network, set it so that it is a fixed IP, configure port to port 88
- Disconnect camera from wired network, plug/unplug power cord so it reboots and attaches to network
- Configure router port forwarding per your manual
- Adjust camera settings, and prefixes.
- Download FoscamPro app from iTunes store if you have an iPhone. Works EXCELLENT.

The reason you might want to choose port 88, is that some internet service providers will block port 80 incoming to your account (to prevent web servers from running on a non-commercial account).

It's a good idea to set a fixed IP on the camera, and reserve that IP on the router, so that whenever your camera reboots and your DHCP IP lease expires, you might end up getting a whole new different IP and you might end up with connectivity issues. I believe with uPnP you don't have this issue, but I'd rather do it the static IP address way, it'll be more reliable.

Up and running in about 20 minutes. Indoor video is good enough quality, and I was impressed at how good quality the IR night vision is. Highly recommended and very satisfied. Pan and tilt speed are even adjustable! No zoom though, but it's fine. I love the motion detection that emails you snapshots when it detects movement.

Was able to access the camera from the internet using the FoscamPro app on my iPad and iPhone. Great App. Couldn't be happier with the entire package as a whole.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this because of the price and a desire for a wireless IP camera. First I found it very difficult to set up, had to watch a youtube video several times to get my router settings correct. Still only works sporadically on my home LAN and I haven't gotten it to work at all from my android phone using the Foscam App except when connected to my home Wifi. Even then it will work for a few hours and then just take off and start moving through its axis and comes to a stop centered horizontally and looking at the ceiling. Sometimes it just won't connect through my browser, just times out. The only way I've found to get is back is to reboot my main computer. Also the youtube videos show setup on  3rd party free severs that may not be free anymore so I set mine up on the Foscam server that is free for a limited time. Not a big  deal as I can't get it to work on any of them. Most of these problems are probably due to my lack of networking knowledge and if I put in more effort could probably be resolved, but I prefer things to setup and work out of the box. On the positive side It has a very good picture, excellent night vision range and the motion or sound activated capture with email alerts works great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
One of the best camera products i have ever had the privilege of owning. at $80 off the foscam site after a coupon, this product is a steal.

Functions phenomenally both during the day as well as at night. Clear images, sound is crisp to the tee. I can hear my dog breathing at night, sitting across the world. It's an unbelievable camera. And i wish i was paid to say that lol.

Highly recommended for home and even work use, setting these up is a breeze as well, as long as you can work your way around a router. Owned it for over a year now, no problems so far. I've had friends who've owned theirs for far long without any issues.

I wont lie, the first FI8910W i received had some manufacturing issues with night vision, i had that replaced without a problem.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This one star rating may well change after I send this product back and get a new one. That would not be the first time for this type of camera. It is my third of the type. I think my first was a Foscam knockoff. It's still in use at my vacation cottage and it outside under a protective overhang. It did not work well inside because the lights made seeing through a window at night impossible. The second was an earlier model Foscam. After 8 months of use, it ceased to by accessible from the Internet. But it still sends me email messages from the cottage when the motion detector spots something.

A bit of previous experience made this product only mildly annoying in the setup. I already had the camera tool on the computer. So I didn't bother with whatever was on the CD. So I hooked it to the Ethernet cable and had it operating wirelessly in about 2 minutes. Then I changed the port to 425 and put that in the router upnp setup. No luck adding 425 to my IP address for getting Internet access. But after messing around with the device management settings, I found what I needed under \\"Upnp settings.\\" I clicked on the box for \\"Using upnp to Map Port.\\" And voila. I could access the camera from the Internet.

The view is nice and sharp. But problems come up whenever I pan. I lose connections with the camera and have to connect again. Sometimes that is easy. Other times not. Not something I need to put up with and not something I will mention to the notorious Foscam customer support. Unless someone quickly tells me about a quick fix, the camera will go back to Amazon for an exchange.

At my cottage, I have a couple Panasonic network cameras. They have all sorts of bells and whistles. Zoom, microphones and speakers. But when they crash, they can only be reset by sticking a pin the the little reset hole. I have access to the cottage network via Logmein and was able to reset the Foscam knockoff from afar. But not the Panasonic cameras. I could not getthem going remotely following a crash caused by my ISP changing the IP address.

This latest purchase is for keeping an eye on things at my principal residence. I could do that with this camera, but there is no reason to put up with the flaws. Back to Amazon for an exchange unless someone tells me about a miracle cure for the flaws.

UPDATE: The camera went through a few hours of operating without crashes. But then it was back to crashes whenever I made it pan. So I have returned it. An exchange for a non defective model was not possible because the camera does not come directly from Amazon. But I have ordered a new one.

FURTHER UPDATE: The replacement came fast and it worked fine. I now have three of these. So setup has become almost routine. But sometimes setting up for Internet access can take a bit of time. I sometimes go through several port setting in the camera and the router before getting a port that will work. Ports in the low 400s seem to work best. Why some don't work is a mystery to me.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: previous cameras worked fine - this one, not so much
review_body: I've used many Foscams in the past without ANY problems on the same network setup(s) that these new cameras have problems with. The NEW firmware/UI on the 8910, or the camera itself, does NOT work in an Apple Airport Extreme environment. Camera will operate for a few minutes, then quickly drop it's wifi connection - requiring a complete restart (unplugging power) before it does the same, quick, crash. On and on. Already lost hours trying to patiently get them to work as older versions did without any hassle. Bottom line, don't buy this camera. Hopefully Foscam will hear about the issues and update the software in the cameras to work again. It's a shame, these used to work SO well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buyer Beware - Foscam will not support / replace this is purchased from Amazon.  No warranty at all.
review_body: Buyer beware.  Foscam will NOT support this product if purchased from Amazon.  The wireless portion of my camera died after 4 months -- Foscam will not support it.  Their argument is that Amazon is not an authorized distributor.  The camera is now useless to me as I needed it in a wireless location.  Contacting Amazon to see if they will assist.  I know what you're thinking.  You read the camera description and it reads, \\"2 year extended warranty, when bought from authorized retailers listed at foscam.us/where-to-buy.html\\"  When you visit that URL -- Amazon.com is one of the first vendors to show up.  I believed it was supported and warrantied -- would not have purchased it otherwise.

review_headline: Worked at first but died after a while
review_body: Updated review: I bought two and one no longer works, won't reset, won't respond. Poor quality.   I bought two of these, one for the front door and one for the back door. We have a Mac and Airport Express so it was a little tricky to figure out where to change the port numbers and enter the dynamic IP address--this requires some patience and testing. But after some trial and error (and about 5 resets of our airport express) along with careful reading of the poorly written user manual AND some google searches, we got it running in about 1 hour. Audio isn't great but we don't need it. Night vision works well. Also bought the iPhone app Foscam Surveillance Pro and after some more trial and error are able to see the camera images on our iPhones. Also set up email alerts through gmail when motion is detected. I recommend googling for youtube videos and other support forums to see how to set email and alerts--no issues there.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Lots of little things wrong with these.
review_body:
Some things to know about this line of cameras. They are very easy to access and use because they are IP cameras, but the software they provide is 100% browser based and lacks in functionality... ESPECIALLY if you don't run it in Internet explorer. If you attempt to access the camera in Chrome you will not be able to record to a file on the local machine, and will not have several other options available to you. Also there is no standalone software which means if you want to record you will be paying for a third party software, writing your own, or trying to remember to keep IE on and logged into the cameras.

The cameras I received were constantly rebooting so I had to send them back. I replaced them with 2 8910's from a another seller and while they work ok, they are not perfect...

Another thing to note these may be wireless but YOU STILL MUST PLUG THE POWER IN. The real problem with this is the cable they supply is a \\"wall wart\\" and is about 4 or 5 feet long. Meaning wherever you want to install this better have an outlet. Because these cameras run on 5 watts and 2.5 amps you cannot power them on the stock adapters if you attempt to run a line to them through a ceiling unless you are willing to run a real power line and install an outlet. You are not getting more than about ten feet of extension via splicing.

If I had this to do over again I'd have either paid for wired cameras (since I need to wire them anyway) or paid an extra 20-30$ for POE ready cameras.

One nice thing to mention is there is some programmatic access to the controls via CGI so if you are a programmer you can have some fun with these.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Beware...NOT a Wi-Fi Cam as noted in Product Description
review_body:
Awesome camera, excellent quality, and great Windows-based software that works like a charm when the camera is plugged directly into the router (smartphone software...not so great). But I spent the last few days trying to figure out the reason I could not get the camera to work via wi-fi. After searching numerous posts in various foscam forums, I happened upon a quote someone snagged from the foscam.com site (and my apologies...I closed iExplorer prior to the thought of copying and pasting the quote for posting a review) stating something to the affect that \\"that foscam 'now' guarantees that only FI8910W purchased directly from foscam.com will work with 802.11N\\". The discussion in the forum is that 'now' seems to be the operative word. That said, if you're looking to use the Foscam FI8910W via a wireless connection, you might want to explore other options.

Admittedly, it begs the question re Foscam's corporate integrity. Regardless of the seller, if the brand was built and advertised to be a wireless device, Foscam should be willing to make nice on legitimate purchases from legitimate sellers such as Amazon.

Aside from returning the item, I contacted Amazon and spoke to a representative to apprise them of the \\"non-wireless\\" issue that makes the advertisement not so truthful.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I suppose value is a good word. It puts out an ok image at 640. To me, at 640, it has a rather sluggish frame rate. In the world of tech we live in, I would expect better. This is likely why this camera isn't a HD item. If they can't get 640 frame rates very high, then HD would be unusable. I found some of the setup to be a bit tedious; however, that is because using IE would cause the camera software to hang up the entire computer. Once setup, it works good. User note: there is no need to use the hosting sites to see images on your portable devices (iphone, android phone, ipad, etc). Just give the camera a static ip, use port forwarding on your router and then point your camera software to your external IP and voila; your done.

In summary, I am happy enough with this, but had a bit higher expectations. I would prefer better frame rates and higher resolution. Smoother movement and better app that didn't lock up on 64 bit OS / IE. This would be a better value at about 60% of the cost.

I probably buy another and would still recommend. But it could be a whole lot better.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The installation of the camera is easy but it does take us a while to get it online . Fortunately the technical support with Foscam is very helpful.  Now The good thing about these camera is I can look in through the camera anytime I like with my cell phone or computer anywhere I go. At one time I was out of the country but I have access to the camera anytime I want to see what's going on in my house. The camera also comes with a speaker which  I can speak through the speaker or I can listen to what TV show my son is watching in the house. Also you can remotely turn to into another angles that you want to see in the house  It has  features that it can take photos or videos,   I can set it to the motion sensitive note that whenever it detects motion or movement it will notify me through my cell phone/ email. It is a very good product to monitor babysitters or teenagers at home or even burglars breaking into your house.  My only complaint is the resolution of the pictures that is taken it's not really that clear. I hope Foscam can work on the resolution of the pictures and the video and that would be a perfect device  for the price you spent.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I wanted to like this camera, it's inexpensive, and has a lot of features. It comes short of what I needed.

I turned on motion capture/alert. When it gets dark, the photoresistor on the unit activates the IR for night mode. When this happens, it triggers a false alert. So basically, you are guaranteed 2 alerts every day, 1 at dawn and 1 at dusk. This is extremely annoying. There is no software fix for this, as Foscam wired the photoresistor completely independent of the programming logic, so this is really a hardware bug.

My fix for this was to put tape over the photoresistor, this is the only way around this.

If Foscam could fix this feature for me, I would give it 5 stars.

The user interface is a little user unfriendly, and leaves something to be desired. I'm an advanced user, but I can imagine the interface being quite daunting for a novice user.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pretty decent cameras for the price.
review_body:
You would be hard pressed to find cameras with this viewing angle and these sets of features for much less.

Only a couple things to mention though, be careful when running firmware updates. There are 2 different hardware revisions of these cameras and the only way to tell is by the shipped firmware version. Just make sure to follow the instructions and you will be fine.

Also, wire them in. Wireless works, but to be honest the frame rate bottoms out to around 5-8 fps, even on Wireless N. Wire it up and you will get much higher FPS, in the 10 - 15 fps range.

Also, for a couple more bucks you can turn these into a POE unit but purchasing a couple adapters. I bought 24V Wall Plug power over ethernet which are on amazon for $9 and then i got WS-POE-5v (dont buy from amazon, its cheaper from the manufacturer) which split the poe back to a lan cable and barrel connector for power. You can get 12V poe injectors for cheaper from the WS-POE-5V guys but if you have to do a run over 50 Feet get the higher voltage so you don't have to worry about power loss over distance.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Although this camera does NOT perform at the same level Foscam touts it to be, it's still a very good IP-camera setup nonetheless. I've had two of these camera's in place for just over a year now and have been very happy with them. I use them at my home with one covering the front entrance and the second one covering the rear porch/yard area. Both camera's perform well for both day and night operation. Unlike older model camera's, these have an infrared filter that moves into place when it gets dark. Daytime operation is full color while night time operation is black & white only, which is normal for any infrared type camera system. Video is a standard MPEG4 with embedded audio capability if desired. This model can be used either CAT-5 wired or wireless operation using 802.11g with all current encryption methods. It is NOT \\"n\\" capable but obviously will work on an \\"n\\" router if the router is set to allow such connections. Can be a pain to set up initially but once set up it works great. One thing I've notice about both camera's is they reset at random times for no apparent reason. They come with a 5-volt \\"wall wart\\" style DC power supply that usually requires the use of an extension cord because the power supply cable is rather short. Some have suggested the use of an extension cable causes random reboots because of a drop in the 5-volts required for proper operation. However, only one of my two camera's use an extension cord, yet both have this random reboot issue just the same. Have never figured out why they do this so I just live with it, as a full reboot takes about 45 seconds before the camera returns to the predefined position you set up in advance. For me it's not a major issue but for some it might be, as it could occur just when you need video evidence the most!

Recently there was a newer model (FI9820W) that came out which offers 720p HD video, H.264 compression and an incorporated SD slot (not sure if it's standard SD, mini or micro) for on-board storage if desired and I believe 802.11n wireless capable instead of g-only wireless. I'm thinking about upgrading to this model but I understand through that particular model's reviews it has it's own set of issues as well. I guess \\"we'll see\\" :)

If I had to buy this camera over again I'd do it again I think because for what it is it's still a decent camera for the price, and now it's even cheaper than it was a year ago when I purchased mine so they're an even better deal now :)

Please comment if you've got any questions about this camera and I'll be happy to get back to you, as I'll receive an email anytime someone comments here.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good, But The New Foscam is Better - Kicks Logitech's Arse
review_body:
I'm a longtime Wilife user, and they're ok, but have some serious quirks and limitations. I've been wanting to upgrade to a more modern and reliable system for a while. The other day we were in Target and happened to come across this Foscam FI8910W on clearance for half off. Yup, I was shocked too. It was a store return, but we couldn't pass up the deal. Maybe someone got it for Xmas and didn't know what to do with it cuz nothing looked like it had even been removed from the box. This great bargain got us thinking about getting another one, and that's when we ran across this newly upgraded model, the [[ASIN:B008OYAL26 Foscam FI8916W with a Better Housing and the Newest Model]]

The biggest difference between the 2 is the new housing; it's sleeker and has a ball and socket lens atop a swooped arm. Other than that, the basic footprint is the same to this model. The entire swooped arm rotates during pan, and just the ball on top tilts. It's actually pretty cool. Other than that, it seems to be exactly the same as this older tried and true model.

Paint it Yellow and You Got a Minion

This Foscam FI8910W looks like a one-eyed minion from the movie [[ASIN:B003UL4GOW Despicable Me -- Deluxe Plush Minion]]. It's cute and I like the shape and look of it. It's cool, but the new model is cooler.

Velvety Feel

Really like the matte finish, and nice rubberized kinda texture feels really great to the touch. Makes the cam look and feel like a top notch, quality product.

Easy Setup

I've read some of the problems others have had setting this up, but all went smooth as silk for me. I used the included setup disk and just went step by step, barely glancing at the instructions. If you have any experience setting up WiFi devices, then you'll have no problem with this. If you've never done anything like this before, then it's a good time to learn. It's basically just an SSID and password, and a user interface accessed via an IP address and your favorite web browser. I was up and running and viewing my cam within 10 minutes on my Win 7 laptops.

Compatible Browsers

I don't use iE for anything, so no words of wisdom there. But for me, the included software seems to play nicer with Firefox than Chrome. But overall, both worked fine for me. I'm considering the Foscam Blue Iris Pro. Seems like it might be worthwhile. I downloaded the 15 day trial and am still playing with it.

Mounting Bracket

Nice touch! Just mount with a couple screws, and a hand-twist camera mount screw. Screws and anchors are included, but I used my own self-drilling screws; much easier to work with and more secure.

Port Forwarding

I have a pretty tight firewall, so I had to setup some custom ports and forwarding rules. Again, if you have experience with it, no biggie; if not, it's only a couple paragraphs of reading and you'll be up to speed.

Wireless Simplicity

Once the initial setup is done via a wired connection, just enter the setup menu and input your SSID and password, and you're set for wireless. This is where this cam excels over Logitech Wilife. No electrical wiring network communication = no time delays or surge protector interference. Definitely getting more of these Foscam's over time and fazing out this old Wilife crap!

Pan & Tilt

Like budduh! No more blind spots! Sure, I have my fave happy place for the angles, but love the option of pan & tilt. Especially handy to get that perfect viewing angle, but also very nice to have the mobility if I want it. Commands from the software to camera are very snappy and on the dot. Precise, responsive and a huge convenience and security enhancement.

Auto Pan

Setup a motion path for the lens to follow. Very nice way to expand and automate the viewable coverage area.

Easy-Peasy Smartphone Integration

Watchyour cams on your cell phone and tablet. I actually prefer connecting via a remote viewing app, like Splashtop or TeamViewer. It's just easier, but you do need to have an accessible computer on site. Otherwise, just connect to these cams directly via the Foscam app. Worked well on my Android tab.

Bottom Line -- this is a really nice security cam setup. I think I'll upgrade our whole system and just add more of these cams over time. Easy to use. Nice image quality. Pan and tilt. Decent price. I'm partial to the newer model's design, but still like this one and glad to have gotten such a great half-off deal on it at Target. Happy! ;oDyour cams on your cell phone and tablet. I actually prefer connecting via a remote viewing app, like Splashtop or TeamViewer. It's just easier, but you do need to have an accessible computer on site. Otherwise, just connect to these cams directly via the Foscam app. Worked well on my Android tab.

Bottom Line -- this is a really nice security cam setup. I think I'll upgrade our whole system and just add more of these cams over time. Easy to use. Nice image quality. Pan and tilt. Decent price. I'm partial to the newer model's design, but still like this one and glad to have gotten such a great half-off deal on it at Target. Happy! ;oD
