product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Read this BEFORE buying!!!  NO AUDIO!
review_body: I got this camera for basic monitoring of my home.  It was easy to setup, so even the most novice of computer users could do it.  The hardest part was reading the poorly translated English directions in the manual.  I downloaded the free IP Cam Lite app on my smart phone and was able to access the camera anywhere.  I was so impressed with this camera, I purchased another one.  While I waited for the second camera to arrive, I downloaded the $3.99 IP Cam Pro app on my smart phone, since the free Lite app version didn't include audio.  I tested the audio and right away I knew there was an issue.  I was able to listen, but I could not use the microphone.  The speaker on the cam is so distorted and at a low level, that I thought I must have a defected camera!  That is when I did some research, and discovered this camera is known for audio issues and Foscam is aware of the problem.  Their solution?  They will ship you a repair kit and instructions, in which you must open up the camera, switch the wires and then solder them together!!  But don't worry, Foscam support is only a phone call away....are you kidding me??!!  They are selling a defective camera and falsely advertising the audio features this camera obviously is incapable of producing. They need to stop selling this as a \\"two way audio\\" camera.  I will be shipping both cameras back.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Installation, tech support a nightmare, cameras not durable.
review_body:
After days attempting to do install myself, and hours upon hours of being on hold waiting for returned phone calls after getting an answering service repeatedly (after being on hold for hours) the cameras were installed, worked great for 3 days, then ceased to work, first one, then the other. Repeat days of phone tag with tech support (they call back HOURS or the next day after you wait at least a half an hour to get to their answering service that speaks very poor english) only to be told the camera is faulty, and to return them.

ALSO.. most of these raving reviews you're seeing? Foscam tech support takes control of your computer to fix the cameras. Then when they have fixed them, they bring you here, and WILL NOT let you off the phone until you write a review, WITH THEM STILL IN CONTROL OF YOUR COMPUTER. It is almost like having someone hold a gun to your head and tell you to write a review. It is borderline cyber bullying in my humble opinion. I mean hey, if you're not tech savvy and need help installing these cameras, and you have someone who IS tech savvy in full control of your computer, how likely are you going to be to write a bad review with them watching? I, personally, wondered what they would do while in control of my computer at that point, so i terminated the team viewer and hung up on the tech person rather than be forced to write a raving review I DID NOT MEAN.

Bottom line: If you're not an expert in port forwarding and networking, steer clear. If you plan on putting these cameras up somewhere that it is difficult to get to them to fix them, remove them, replace them, etc. STEER CLEAR. The features of the camera are awesome.. IF THEY WILL WORK and IF YOU ARE AN EXPERT AND CAN ACTUALLY FIGURE IT OUT WITHOUT NEEDING A MANUAL.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Setup guide was rough, it is not written by an english speaking person so you must read between the lines to get certain details regarding the setup. It will not work wirelessly to certain PC's and ipads on my network. Others it works fine - sometimes. I just now tried to connect using a laptop that was working yesterday, but today it will not connect. When it does connect, I try to record video and it does not record using their GUI. It prompts for a filename, but will not save to file. I am very disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a well made piece of equipment that delivers all that it promises at a price point that is very reasonable. The key thing to remember is price here. You get what you pay for, but I felt this camera does more for the price. I have used it for 3 months and no issues so far. The video quality is obviously not the best out there, but purely as a cheap monitoring device it delivers. The pan and tilt works well, and with the installed camera pro app on android, you can control it remotely. The night vision capabilities are average. From what I have read somewhere, security of this camera is a cause of concern. Apparently, the camera can be easily hacked into. Dont have any hard evidence, but if you would like to use it as a supporting system that you turn on and off, it shouldnt be a huge concern.

Very few cons I can think of
1. Security of this camera is average
2. The video feed can be stuttering or not fluid. Must be a problem of the camera or the wifi speeds causing it. But frame rate is not the best out there.
3. Video quality is not the best, but for this price hard to expect more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: works with ubuntu linux and zoneminder
review_body:
works with ubuntu linux and zoneminder.
I used chrome to web into the FI8910W to configure it.

followed the setup suggested by others here on the reviews:
- lan/wired/ ethernet to get intial ip address.
- web into the FI8910W to set all parms like ip address/passwords/etc.
turned on wifi on FI8910W.
- unplug power on FI8910W.
- unplug wired ethernet.
- plug power back in.
- confirm web browser can still get to FI8910W.

to use FI8910W with zoneminder, zoneminder has config info on their website for the FI8910W.
I did not do the section for zoneminder controlling camera movement.
I just use the FI8910W's web interface if I want to move it, flip it, etc.
zoneminder display's the FI8910W just like a wired bnc camera.
zoneminder captures alarms as normal for the FI8910W.

range: I have the FI8910W outside, but protected from the elements, not in an enclosure, it's about 125feet from the wifi router in the house. Signal strength is -67dbm from the FI8910W at that distance. The wifi router shows an up/down speed of 24M/24Mbps at that signal level.
The FI8910W seems to take very little bandwidth ... 10's of kbs from I can see.
I'm getting 10fps through zoneminder which is about top end for my zoneminder capture card.

so far I think this is a great value as others have said.

review_headline: Groovy! Makes a great cat cam.
review_body: We got this to conduct super secret surveillance of our two cats as part of a strategy to figure out why one cat was always wailing and hungry. Mission accomplished. Camera is fun to use, was not difficult to install. I love being able to move it around remotely from the Foscam app on my phone (Android OS). It's slightly buggy (the interface of these programs) but works fine, lets you take still photos, lets you pretend to be the voice of God through the camera to your cats, etc.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
*** READ why 4 Stars ***

after a good deal of consideration, I purchased this to use as a baby monitor and to keep an check in on the baby when we are out at work. The camera was very easy to set up. I have not used the provided software, but did it manually.

The picture quality is good, 2-way audio works well.

DDNS works very well. Remember, you will still need to configure your home network to allow connections from outside, if it is desired.

It allows for you to add 10 users and control their access. Nice!

Here are the reasons why I gave only 4 stars:

1) 2-way audio uses the VLC plugin on non-internet explorer (IE) browsers. I could not get it to work on Mac, Linux, Windows using Firefox or Chrome. It ****works awesome**** using activex on IE. The other option is to use VLC and you can hear the audio but obviously you cannot talk back. They should have used some other plugin to provide two way audio.
2) The manufacturer has some control issues I think. To even download firmware updates, we have to provide them with email address, validate the email address and then they will send firmware download links by email. The email did not contain links to the latest firmware, actually the page had older version than the firmware that came with the camera. I had to search on Google and found a page that had newer firmware.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Easy to Setup IP Cam Fully Mac Compatible
review_body: My wife and I purchased this camera to use as a baby monitor. We decided to buy this one after initially purchasing a Wansview, lured by the slightly lower price, after using it for an hour on our network I returned it given its sluggishness on our network and very cheap feel. Before changing course, and purchasing a traditional video baby monitor system we decided to give one more IP camera a chance. I am glad we did!  Immediately upon opening the box I could tell the Foscam was a quality product. Thankfully the install confirmed my initial impression as it was easy to install and up and running within 10 minutes. Picture is crisp and clear, audio is near real time with slight delay, wireless antenna allows for strong reception. Now whether on my iPhone, iPad, or MacBook I can monitor our little guy without having to have an extra device to tote around. If you are looking for an IP camera stop right here and buy this one!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Could not - NOT - get this to work.
review_body:
I'm no slouch when it comes to IT, routers, NAT, etc. This camera is SO not user friendly that I had to turn to the internet to find ways to make it work. The directions that come with it are HORRIBLE. I'm not sure they are even written grammatically correct and I recall some spelling errors as well. Though I COULD get the camera working when just on my internal network, I wanted to be able to see it remotely, even bought and app for it and for the life of me, could not get it to work.

If you just want a simple in-home networked camera, awesome.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera to monitor a sliding glass window in our basement den. This window has been the source of two burglaries and we want to have evidence if we get another break-in. The pluses for the FI8910W is a good feature set, easy to set-up, a nice alarm feature that sends emails when motion is detected.

Unfortunately, there are two negatives that result in our rating of two starts. The biggest issue is the photo's are too blurry to recognize anyone. For the motion it has detected so far, its been my daughter who uses the den a lot. While I know it is her, there is no way from the photo's the FI8910W sends to us that we could recognize her. The faces in the photo are way to blurry. We have the unit set to the maximum 640X480 mode and to be fair, perhaps at this resolution any camera will not allow faces to be displayed. But we did expect more out of the unit,

The seond negative is once a day, the unit changes position and points at the ceiling. This makes the motion detection and photo's useless. We can log in to the unit and go to a preset to get it positioned correctly, but not something we want to do daily.

If you are lookign for a security camera, would suggest you look elsewhere. Find one with a better camera resolution which will allow for positive identification.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Pro: Price $69.99 amazon price reduction yeye(keep your eyes alert), no monthly fees, night vision, pan/tilt, email alerts & more.
Cons: No zoom, requires knowledge of wireless LAN set-up, DNS, port forwarding.

Alright ppL, this is a great camera!! Initially, I was researching the Logitech Security Camera system due to their easy setup & convenience. However, Logitech cameras cost a lot more, and the homeplug feature seemed too bulky. As I did further research via amazon reviews, there were customer reports that Logitech cameras failed within 2 years of usage and there were also hidden fees for remote access! Logitech also prevents backwards compatibility, so newer models can result in new software rendering your existing Logitech security system obsolete. The Logitech was both pricey & not reliable, so I continued the search for something more affordable which led to the Foscam. Most of the negative reviews regarding the Foscam are due to the wireless LAN setup, it took me about 3 days to understand and setup the camera because I had no prior experience regarding port routing, DNS, etc.

I would definitely look up on youtube and search \\"awkward hamster foscam\\" view the tutorials 1) basic setup 2)how to access camera via android,web, etc. After viewing this tutorial, you will figure out whether or not you are ready to meet this challenge. Also, since we are buying from amazon.com some reviews noted we will not get technical support from Foscam. I didn't try that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Camera works great, but support could use some improvements.
First off, the included software looks like an antique that's been passed down for generations, and the method of updating the software is even more antiquated than the software itself. There is no automation to the update process, and there are plenty of opportunities for error (good luck finding the right model number).
But in the end, it works.
Took me a while to figure everything out when I first set it up, but it works fine now. A quick Google search revealed some very helpful videos to set up the wifi and adjust port and firewall settings.

The only additional feature I wish the camera had is a zoom, but other than that, no real problems with the camera. Sometimes the night vision will flash in and out in low light situations (like sunset); dim enough that it needs the night vision, but bright enough to wash out the image and turn it back to regular mode.

review_body:
I never thought I would be giving something a one star review, well here I am.

It worked for the first couple weeks and I was fairly happy with it although I did purchases a 3rd party application to use against it as in my opinion their software is trash.

Now more then half the time it is a paper weight. If you plan on having it hard wired then maybe it will work well, however I bought it for it's wireless capability which now drops and makes it unusable day in and day out. Before someone points me to this or that, I am very technical. I have searched the internet and the forums and tried everything. So many hours wasted trying to get this thing working from switching channels on the wireless, verifying the firmware, etc... I have tried it all.

Do your research, there are many people having the same issues... look elsewhere for a camera, there is a reason this thing is cheap. Live and learn I guess.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Did not at all perform as intended. The person who this was purchased for was not at all happy. The labeling isn't particularly clear, and they were under the impression that it did things that it did not. There is zero on board storage, so the video captured cannot be transmitted anywhere - unless you use the software that comes with it. Unfortunately, for security while away, depending on a computer also being on and undisturbed is not the best of ideas.

It took average snapshots on motion detect. After optimizing the light in the room (meaning leaving lights on and arranged) we are confident that it will get a recognizable shot on perhaps 1 out of 5 shots (of a person). The rest, or perhaps even more than that, are too blurry with motion, or too hazy even if the subject is still.

All in all... not that spectacular.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Foscam FI8910W Wireless IP Camera Black for $69.99
review_body:
I purchased this camera to watch my living room and my other security camera monitor which is not connected to the internet.
Setup was easy, do not use the CD that accompanies it, just simply connect the wireless antenna, connect the power cord and RJ45 network cable to your router. Type the IP address of your wireless router to login e.g. [...] then look for ipcam and write down the corresponding IP address. Then paste that IP address into your browser and login (default is admin as username no password, ensure you change that in future). Go under Wireless LAN settings and enter your router SSID, security type, password, you need to ensure your router is visible under scan, then the camera will reboot. Then go ahead and change system date/ time, adjust camera position, color, brightness, etc. The network lamp is the light on the back of the camera. Disconnect the RJ45 cable and then test by logging into your camera via your phone, tablet or PC using its IP address. If you search google for whats my ip address that will be your external address outside your home, don't forget to add the port number. No zoom feature, 4 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Easy to set up and the picture is excellent. I can view it on my desktop and laptop computers using Explorer, Firefox, or Chrome. And I can view it on my Android tablet or my wife's iPhone using IP Cam. The camera reliablity responds to pan and/or tilt commands and the connection to my Linksys E1000 router is extremely reliable. The infared feature doesn't work well at night but I suspect that's because there is too much light behind and in front of the camera.

Setting it up was not difficult as I'm familar with configuring webcams and routers. But, if you've never set up a webcam and don't understand routers, any webcam could be difficult to install.

I happen to have a north-facing green house window where I've placed the camera so I don't have to worry about direct sunlight but it's not clear from the instructions if direct sunlight will damage the camera.

Overall for about $100, this is a great camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works great, inexpensive, good tech support.
review_body: I had purchased the previous model of this camera about a year ago (Christmas 2011) and ended up returning it because we could not get it to work. (and it was driving my husband bonkers)  My husband still wanted a webcam so he could see what he's missing when he goes on business trips. It was with great trepidation that I purchased this for him for Valentines Day 2013.  The first day he tried to set it up on his own and it was a no-go. On day two, I convinced him to call Foscam tech support and they were able to help him. He was just a few small settings off of making it work on his own but, as you know, a few small settings can kill a tech project in no time. Foscam support was of no help to us in 2011 but it was totally different this time around.  We are not dummies when it comes to computers, we set up our own home network and have wireless printers, etc.  It is just the nit picky settings that will get you.  I would recommend this camera. If it doesn't work for you right away, call Foscam tech and they will help you in no time.

Low resolution
Limited 3 years for online access and viewing, need to pay for year 4 and on ward

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Look the item works but if you're purchasing it to remotely view your house/dog/cheating wife/whatever from work or a remote location, don't.  The software is very very very basic.  They don't even make the Iphone/Android software... independent software manufacturers do.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: My 16 year old son installed this camera on our home wifi network in a couple of hours  --opening the router port was the only challenge for him.  The picture quality is very good and the overall feature set for the money is outstanding.  The pan and tilt functionality is really cool and IR works well at night.  I downloaded the Foscam Pro app for my iPhone which gives me flawless control of the camera from anywhere.  I'm very pleased and have already ordered a Fosam outdoor camera to complement my setup.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this camera just to keep and eye on things to make sure things are ok at home. I'm a little paranoid about the crime in my area, so this gives me great peace of mind knowing it has the alarm function. It works exactly as it should and was very easy to set up. I just purchased anther one to get a second perspective of my home, as well as to spy on the dog to see what he does while im at work. Makes my work day better to see him lounging around on the couch or running to the door when I get home.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I wanted to love it but....
review_body:
I really wanted to love this product because the price is right and the picture quality is at pair with the price. The feature set for the software is also great but...

The WiFi radio is bad. It worked for about 2 days and then stopped working. I had to spend a lot of time trying to configure it and nothing worked. It would connect to my network sporadically then it stopped connecting all together. Their service department was unable to help me.

There is a big delay between the time it detects motion and the time it takes the picture. I had the camera pointing at the entrance door in a fairly standard sized living room and each time somebody would enter, the camera would send me an email with meaningless pictures. The person managed to enter and get out of the frame almost each time.

The browser viewing page regularly display a dialog saying that it lost the connection to the camera and stopping the picture both when the camera was wired and wireless. Dismissing the dialog would start the streaming just fine but it does require user input and, if you don't realize the dialog is up, you are basically not listening/viewing the area. This makes it useless as a baby monitor because if you keep it on the background waiting to ear noise you will be missing the action.

Sadly I had to return the camera. I would not recommend this one but I look forward to upgrades.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Camera's were easy to set up but i came across an issue that customer service was able to resolve in minutes. Very Pleased. Bill was wonderful! Camera seems great so far.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera is great.  The picture is superb.  The controls are easy to use.  The technical support, which I needed, fop remote access was terrific.  It took no time at all for the technician to correct what I had missed.  I have a DLink camera too, and it does not compare in picture quality or internet reliability.  Would definitely recommend.  Good value. Great price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pretty nice camera for the money
review_body:
Although a little bit quirky, these give you a lot for the money. If you have never messed with wireless cameras and such before, it takes a little effort to get started. Foscam has a pretty decent website with videos to help walk you through it. My opinion is that they have gotten better and more helpful over time. They also put out firmware updates and appear to address issues that users have had.

The user interface isn't great, but it isn't bad either. It will work with Android although it behaves and functions a bit differently. I have experienced the occassional difficulty connecting to a camera, that usually sorts itself out after repeated attempts. But I will also say that I've seen that kind of thing with a Linksys at more than 3 times the price and I think the video is better with the Foscam.

I know some people have had some issues, but I'll just add that there are a number of things you can do wrong. It pays to watch their videos before trying to set one up. The oldest one I have, I've had for quite awhile, and it still works fine. I have since bought more.

These are pretty nice cameras for the money and they have some nice features. If you are a novice with this sort of thing, take your time and follow the directions and I'd recommend watching their videos first. There is a lot going on to make wireless PC cameras work and as far as I know, no one offers one that is quite "plug and play". You can spend a lot more money to get less.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Not so easy to set up using the instruction manual...it's obvious the writers aren't native speakers of the English language. I had to go to the Foscam web site for technical support. I was on hold for almost a half hour and then they took my name and had a tech call me back an hour later. However, once I finally got ahold of tech support had me up and running in only a few minutes (thanks Albert!) My rating?
Camera: five stars all the way.
Albert: five stars for his fast and knowledgeable help
Foscam technical support line: three stars (which is why my review has four stars instead of five.)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Excellent camera!
It does everything I need it to.
The setup was performed seamlessly thanks to Customer Service.
Highly recommended.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I gave it 5 stars because this camera really delivers top quality for it's price.  The camera's clarity is great & the Pan & Tilt operation is a bonus feature over the competitors that offer only fixed units.  Even the audio works as advertised!  I purchased this camera for security reasons as I travel a lot for business.  It's motion detector coupled with email push notification works flawlessly.  I purchased their app so it would work with my phone.  And that's where this system shines.  I can instantly see what's happening in my home from anywhere in the world.  But a word of warning.  Unless your an IT pro or Al Gore, your going to suffer miserably getting this camera set-up.  It's manual is horrid & brief.  And there are so many variables (port forwarding, IP address issues depending on your router set-up & so on) to getting this camera up & running.  But fortunately Foscam has a very nice & knowledgeable tech staff that will walk you patiently through the set-up process.  I'm obviously kinda slow because I had to call them seven times.  But in the end....  success!  So what are you waiting for?  Buy this camera.....  you'll love it!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Foscam camera has excellent definition. Set up has a few hitches but Technical Support can help you through the process easily.
Highly recommended

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this to replace our current baby monitor, because I liked the idea that we can monitor on our computer or smartphones.  The wired setup is so simple and easy.  The wifi setup took a little bit of patience.  I'm just talking about getting it to pick up an ip address and be seen by the network.  Once that was fixed tho, it worked pretty well.  It's not the best video camera out there, but for the price and value it's a good deal, and I'd strongly recommend it to any parents who want to monitor their baby.  It is even good to use when you go away for vacation to keep an eye on your house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I recommend the Foscam FI8910W ip camera to anyone who wants to set up a remote monitoring webcam. We put it at our cottage to check the weather and see any people or traffic going by. Since it rotates 300 degrees we can scan inside as well. We placed it in the front window.

You don't need a PC after initial setup. Only a wireless router that the camera can use.

Setup took about two hours but that includes everything to the point I could view it and control it from my iphone over the internet. Setup is not for a novice. But if you've ever set up a router and a wireless network at home you can handle this task. There are some excellent videos on YouTube that made the setup process easy. From box to viewing on my LAN took 10 minutes. Setting up wireless operation another 10. Getting it to work on the internet and then my phone took about a half hour of configuring and playing.....all with the help of the YouTube videos. Last I set up email motion settings which emails you one or a series of photos if motion is detected. This took about an hour of playing with the settings. Motion sensitivity is adjustable 1 to 10 from a leaf blowing across the snow on setting 2 to where it takes a delivery truck driving by on setting 9 to set it off.

The infrared is nice. Our cottage is black dark at night but we can see the whole room fine even the objects 25-30 feet away. However if the camera is rotated toward the window with the IR lights on, you just see glare reflected back so the IR must be turned off to view the street at night. Simple toggle on/off switch.

Notes on internet use:
1. You must have a host domain setup through a domain service. There are free ones. I used DynDns. This is the \\"website\\" that your camera resides on. Again, refer to the YouTube videos. They talked me through it.

2. The settings can be changed from hundreds of miles away over the internet once setup is complete. You can assign multiple usernames and passwords, at least 6, for administrators (full control and change settings), operators (view, pan and tilt control) or visitors who can only view without control. Very Nice feature.

3. Only Internet Explorer supports multiple cameras. If you use Firefox or Safari you can only view one camera. Two or more cameras on your system would simply require opening Firefox twice, no big deal. I like Firefox better.

Summary: High quality and excellent functionality! I am buying a second camera for my cottage rear window so we can watch the deer and wildlife while not there. And to see if anyone is snooping around. The camera will email me photos. The FI8910W is highly recommended.

Update April 14, 2013. Loved it so much I added a second identical unit. After 6 weeks they are both running flawless. I can see what's going on at my cottage 200 miles away. I have them in the windows so I can pan and tilt to see inside or out. Daytime color and contrast is very nice. Night vision works great too. I take a peek every morning. I still love and recommend this camera! I really like the motion detection alarm that emails me snapshots of people and vehicles going by. Sensitivity is adjustable so I don't get everything that moves, just people on the front yard or porch. Also I highly recommend checking the setting \\"email ip address\\". Should your dynamic ip change, you can't access your camera. But the camera will email you the new ip address within a few minutes and you can redirect your URL to view remotely. My ip has changes twice already and this saved the day!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: WE used this to monitor Mom's activity at night as she suffered from Alzheimers and would awaken often and stray between rooms. THis alerted us to her movements so we could keep her safe. I was amazed at the ability to record and alert about movement in a room and its capability for seeing in a very dark room. Pretty easy set up and very easy to operate remotely.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I would like to preface this by saying that I rarely leave reviews for products that I buy; however, I put a lot of stock in the reviews of others before I purchase a product.  With that said, I felt compelled to write something about this little gem.  This is by far the coolest electronic gadget I have ever purchased for under $100.  It does everything as advertised and was extremely simple to set up on your home network.  I had absolutely no prior experience with remote domain name hosting and/or port forwarding from my home router, but using a combination of the included directions and a few youtube videos searching those keywords, I was able to set up this camera to view from any interent connection through a web browser as well as through a free IP Camera viewer app on my iPhone4 while on 3G.  It is so cool to be able to quickly check my phone to see what my golden retriever is up to at home.  This camera will also work extremely well as a baby monitor down the road.  Thanks for such a great product at an afforadable price!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I needed a quick setup to use while on vacation.  I used dyndns to connect back to it but had mixed results actually connecting to it outside of my network.  Once I was on vacation I could not connect back to it at all even though it was working before I left.  The main issues I had was with dyndns not working.  As for the camera itself it did seem to work pretty good for the short amount of time I used it.  Low light use was pretty good although it does have the ring of lights so there is no hiding its use in the dark.  I also downloaded an iPad app which while clunky did control the camera.  For the money it's not bad I could have probably spent more time on it and got it to work more reliably but it did not work for the purpose I purchased it for so I returned it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: A little difficult to set up but Tech support (Tim Mores ) was patient with me and super helpful . Camera works as described and the clarity is better than other cameras I have seen .

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great for the function, set-up on a MAC was ok.
review_body:
To everyone his own, I set these cameras (2) up on a Mac air with a mac airpots router and ATT uverse internet service with a 3wire gateway. My steps to getting access outside of the house was:

-Get the camera connected to your wifi network
-Set the camera's IP and port you want to forward.
-Enter this information into the airport (utube vids however with the new airports the menu's are a little different)
-Allow the port open on the 3wire uverse gateway (this was the part i was always missing, google and you will find what to do)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The setup process was not easy and took several hours of tinkering. But at the end, I got exactly what I wanted -- an wireless camera that will notify me by e-mail (with screen captures) when it detects motion. Now I can vacation in (more) peace. Despite the longish process to get there, I've been looking for a solution just like this for under $100 with no monthly fees for a while, and this fits the bill perfectly! I'm about to buy my second unit to give my property better coverage.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This write up is for an installation using a PC with Windows 7 64 bit.

I have 3 Panasonic's in my house along with 2 D-Links I use to watch my pets while I am gone.

My Fiancee wanted to get on board with this concept for her pets and selected the FOSCAM F18910W.

I read the reviews and was less than impressed with what seemed a very problematic camera, but I agreed to get her one; after all there were plenty of good write-ups.

I unpacked the camera from its very very nice box. All the parts I would need for a set-up were included......it even had an Ethernet wire on a small cleverly designed reel. I followed the directions exactly. (The directions could have used a little better English, but getting the idea is not difficult.) INSTALL the software!!

The installation went without a hitch. The camera came to life. I created a password, left the username as 'admin', then unplugged the Ethernet wire and pushed the reset button underneath the camera and then the reset button on my Linksys router and within a minute all was good; camera and router had 'shaken hands' and agreed to work with each other.

To access the camera on WiFi, you have to know your computer IP address, which is easy to obtain from your router. If you don't have any other cameras, the default port is 80. Using a browser: type in to the address your computers IP address followed by the camera port number XX.XXX.XX.XX:80 and the camera comes up with pan and tilt features, among others.

This is the easiest camera I have set up.

I DO NOT work for FOSCAM......I don't even know where their headquarters is. I am an academics instructor teaching instrument flight training at Ft. Rucker, AL.a MAC!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Love this thing! Can't wait to set it up
review_body: The camera arrived right away in good condition. Set up was easy outside of my own user error. On first try, all of the features came through crisp. The web interface is pretty intuitive and easy to use. I forgot to log in to the router and set everything up but the Foscam support team helped me every step of the way through that process as well and even set up remote viewing from outside of my network as well (saved me a good few hours of youtube videos). I thoroughly recommend this product and plan to buy a few more for other portions of the house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great unit, could do with a longer power cord
review_body: We have this unit as a nursery camera mounted at about 6 1/2 feet high, the power cord is only 3 feet long so we had to run an extension cable behind a dresser to get this to reach, cord lenth limits the placement somewhat.  The functionality of the device itself is great though.  Easy to set up and easy enough for grandparents to use.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a great camera for the price (I paid $75). As other users have said setup can be challenging. It took me a week to figure out, but now it is working smoothly. I have set up motion detect alarm, e-mail setup, dns set up (really not needed, but I will explain later), port forwarding and iphone app set up. I was disappointed initally because the set up cd came broken. However, I was able to download the application from foscam website. Once the software is loaded and the camera is connected to the PC, the IP address for the camera will pop-up. Please note the IP number. I think most users get confused with the IP numbers. For a typical home with a router, there will be a Router that assigns a LAN IP number, most likely 198.168.1.1. Once the camera is connected the IP address for the camera will pop 198.168.1.3 (in my case). The last number after the dot will be different for each device connected to the LAN. Keep in mind you cannot access the camera from the outside using this IP address. For that you need to find your WAN IP address. You can use the site whatsmyip.com and search for your WAN address. In my case it was 68.199.xx.xxx. This WAN IP address is important if you want to connect to your camera from the internet. Don't be fooled when you are able to connect within your wifi using the 198.168.. IP address. You are within the network and will be able to connect easily. Typing the camera's IP address (198.168.1.3 in my case)you can access the camera's set up menu. In User setting, you can change the login name and password from the default provided by foscam. You can create administrator and visitor privileges also. Please set the image recording path. Keep in mind recording will take place only if the PC or an USB external drive is always on. In Basic Network setting, enter the IP address. For me 198.168.1.3, Subnet mask 255.255.255.0 could be the same for all (otherwise check the router administration page). Gateway & DNS server is the IP address of router 198.168.1.1. I have read lot of issues in using port 80, so enter a new port. I used 5656. If you have a Netgear router provided by Optimum online. You can enter the routers IP address on main address bar and a login page will pop up. For optimum online the login name is admin and password is optimum. Sorry for going off track. In the Wireless LAN settings, enter your wireless ID and password. If you press the scan button it will display your network also. You can skip the other menu option. If you want to access your camera with a domain name like [...] instead of[...]
you will need to set a DNS host/redirect. You can get a free DNS redirect option at[...] The problem with free account is you will have to renew by email every month. I think paid option is $20 for a year. I have set up a free account. In the camera's DDNS settings menu, you will have to enter the details of your DDNS Service, user name and password used to access the service and the domain you have with the provider. In mail service the sender and receiver will be your e-mail address. For yahoo, the SMTP server will be smtp.mail.yahoo.com and port is 465. For your mail provider you can find the details of the server and port by doing an internet search. SMTP user and pasword will by e-mail address before the @ and the password. This mail service is to send you e-mail with attachment of the photos when a motion detect alarm is triggered. Please check the boxes, you don't have to test it now. in the Alarm Service settings menu, check all the boxes and keep sensitivity at 5. Duration to record as 60 secs or less. You can select the time for the motion detect to work and hit submit. Basically the camera set-up is over. Now go to your router administration page as explained earlier. Make sure your camera shows up in the devices connected menu. Remember camera is connecting wirelessly, no need to connect with ethernet cable after the initial set up is over. In the Port Forwarding menu add the camera with its IP address (198.162.1.3 for me). Enter starting and ending port at 5656. While setting up domain name in noip.org use the WAN address (68.199.xx.xxx) with port 5656 to point to the domain name. It might take a few minutes to register. Now you can access your camera either by your domain name [...]or [...] from inside and outside of your network. The[...]can only be used to access within the wifi network. I also used a free iphone app CamViewer and entered the domain name to see the camera from outside the network. You can test the app and domain name by turning off the wifi in your phone. Good Luck!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Excelent IP camera for a very reasonable price. The wireless setup was easy, though making it accessible through Internet (DDNS and Port Forwarding) requires intermediate knowledge of your router and network stuff. Also, have some problems trying to set the email notification alarm with my gmail account. I ended using my hotmail account with no problems. I have no idea what the problem was. Scheduling alarm is very easy by selecting days an hours for the camera motion detection. It sends me a set of photos to my email whenever motion is detected on the scheduled time. I can access the camera via my Galaxy S III phone, Galaxy Note 10.1 and from my desktop PC. The pan and tilt response of the camera is great. The video and photo resolution is very good including at night with IR vision. I bought a Samsung DVR and 4 cameras set for like $599.00 that I returned, because poor resolution, difficult setup and it was wired. With the Foscam, I record video from my office. I receive a photo of my kids when they arrive from school, I can monitor my home whenever I get a false alarm activation. It is wirelessly connected, so I can move it to wherever I want it, of course with power access. I'm extremely pleased with this camera and I recommend it.  I'll be buying the Foscam FI8905W for outdoor.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Im very please with this camera not only the futures like nite vision, or tilting, talking and many more, but that im able to use my iphone at work and check on it. The costumer support was amazing since you dont have to do anything by your self tim morris did the work and it was really hassle free. thank you very much and i would defenely suggest to a friend or any body.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Review for set up of camera recording path.  Customer support representative was very helpful in resolving issue (Sandra Williams) and should be commended for her support.  Cameras are great and clear but hard to set up for novice computer user.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
First things first. If you're planning to purchase one to see how well it works before getting additional devices, I'd suggest just getting all of them. I'll be purchasing two more along with the Blue Iris software.

I got this camera to watch my dog. I have a rescue dog that's very timid and loves to pee in my house ONLY whenever I'm not looking. I never catch her in the act. So I picked up one of these cameras to give it a try.

PROS:
+ Image quality is acceptable. HD would be nicer but I seriously don't need it.
+ Sound goes both ways. You can enable the mic and listen to audio on the camera side, plus speak in the mic on your side to project the audio to the camera side.
+ Night vision works very well.
+ WiFi support.
+ Can be setup to be accessed from anywhere with various levels of access (admin, operator, visitor).

CONS:
- Enabling audio introduces a 3 seconds delay between when the event occurred and when you see it.
- Setup was more difficult than it needed to be.
- No DVR feature out of box.

OTHER:
+ I bought the iPad app and that works great.
+ It supports alerts. I've used the motion detection through the iPad app, but haven't tried the face detection since I only care about motion.

The setup instructions are simple... provided that you don't run into any issues. I connected the antenna, network cable, and power. The device moved and then stopped. On my Win 7 PC I installed the IP Camera Tool, launched it and saw Anonymous and a message about the subnet being different. Double clicking the name showed a dialog window where almost every label were question signs. I ended up reading further in the manual and found the similar looking dialog window with the correct labels. Matching up the position of the controls, I set a static IP address and a different port number, accepted the changes, and stop the IP Camera Tool. After a minute I launched the IP Camera Tool and saw the camera listed as expected. I then accessed my router and forward the port to the IP address for the camera, and was able to access it remotely.

The things that annoyed me was the dialog window having only question signs (??????) for all of the labels. What kind of software bug was that? Was it not localized properly? The labels resolved themselves only after I figured out and entered the values. Furthermore, despite connecting the camera to my router, I still do not see the camera listed as being connected via a wired connection (all other devices are displayed). Other than that, the router configuration was simple since I've done this type of setup many times.

Now that I know what to expect from this camera, I'll be getting two more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: So far so good... Great tech support!  Tim was patient and took his time showing me the features.  Looking forward to using the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great, reliable camera.. Once latest firmware is loaded.
review_body:
I've been ordering these \\"used\\" from amazon at a steal price. You know why? The OLD firmware on these cameras is very poor, and riddled with bugs than make the camera unreliable for security use.

Once the unit is loaded with the latest firmware, it runs for days, weeks + without restarting or repositioning. Oh, and after loading the new firmware, when I press \\"IR OFF\\" in the web user interface, it stays off for good.
Also, I can confirm that the color and contrast is slightly more accurate than that of the FI8918 version.

My Recommendation:
Buy this Camera, and immediately update to the latest firmware. Make sure to download the correct firmware for the firmware version you are updating FROM. There is more information out there, just look it up.
Here's the best place to get the files: [...]

So.. until I can't, I'll continue buying these cameras used from the warehouse, and load to the latest firmware.
-Cheers

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy to read instructions, installation and setup... performs better than I expected.  Looking to purchase additional cameras to complete my security needs.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Pros: Easy web GUI interface (forget the included CD; you don't need it), easy web GUI monitoring, free fantastic Android and iPhone monitoring applications (I use "IP Cam Viewer" on Android), free built-in and pre-configured DDNS service, good resolution, very good pan and tilt range, very QUIET pan and tilt, very low cost.

Cons: audible "click" when the monitor shifts from day to IR mode or back; IR LEDs emit visible red light when on; LAN activity light flashes annoyingly. (I duct-taped over the LAN link light on mine.)

Verdict: buy one. Heck, buy several - they're cheap. (I did.)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Expensive baby monitor for half the price.
review_body: This camera is great. The reliability once the static Ip is set is second to none. Works flawlessly with my iphone for sound and video using the  provided software and or Cam Viewer in the app store. I think the only reason this camera has any negative marks is bc the manual is written for people with intermediate networking experience and at times hard to follow. this camera was sent to me promptly as a replacement, the first one delivered worked fine but the camera shorted out when the remote app was used, this one is flawless.  Set up was pretty easy. I am not a computer genius and I did run into a few problems other people who may have given negative feedback had. But after some careful reading and trial and error I discovered the issues myself and others were having were easily fixed, without negative remarks. I will buy many more, you should too.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I started with one, then got another 3 of these. For distances up to 100 feet, they work well to see what is happening. Under 10 feet, they can show who is doing it. They don't do well tracking motion, and they are bigger than I'd like, but for the money, they were easy to setup, easy to install, and with the Blue Iris software, work very well on any computer.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It's wonderful that one can have this much technology for this little money. I've configured the camera to email me photos when it senses motion (the sensitivity is adjustable), so that I can simply forward the photos (with embedded date- and time-stamp) to the local high school's principal when the usual suspects are smoking dope in our stairs ("Have you seen me?"). :)

The night vision is very good. The camera can save video onto a hard drive on one's local network, but it It would be valuable if the camera could also email short videos, and not just photos. The user's manual is not perfect, but I'd give it four stars out of five. The camera has audio in and out jacks, but I haven't tried using the audio. I've had the camera for several weeks now, and there have been some few occasions when its emails had undecipherable date- and time-stamps, but the problem corrects itself within a day or two.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera has a lot of nice features for the price.  I did not find the setup to be difficult but I do have a technical background.  I followed the advice of some of the other commenters and just logged into the camera and gave it a static IP.  I use it with iCam and it works well.  The video quality is a little low which is why I gave it only 4 stars.  There is an HD version of this camera that is quite a bit more expensive but it may be worth it to some. One nice feature that I wasn't expecting was the universal tripod mount.  I can put the camera almost anywhere with a portable tripod.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We use this camera mounted upside down in the back patio, under the overhang. everything worked as advertised. Easy to configure, either wired or wireless. The only thing to adjust is the sensitivity of the alarm triggered, need to take consideration of the spider web!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works very well so far, great picture quality even in night mode.  Moves very quietly.  Had to call technical support because my computer skills are lacking, and I was having trouble accessing the camera remotely.  I called Foscam support and they were able to get the camera working in a very timely manner.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love this camera. It allows me to view my pets remotely while I am working. This gives me peace of mind. I had some minor problems getting the camera connected to my network. I called the customer service line and they called back within 20 mins! The rep (Leo) was fantastic! He took control of my computer remotely and fixed the issues quickly so I was up and running. I recommend this for anyone with children, pets or if you wish to have security that you home is safe while you are on vacation.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great camera I have 5 Foscam cameras and they all are GREAT!
I had some issues with my technical abilities to access them remotely and called Foscam support. The support tech Leo was the best. He spent the time not only to fix and test the issue but to explain the process. I highly recommend Foscam.
Jim

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
First of all, I do not know where all the 5 star ratings come from. Apparently these reviewer simply put the Camera up and let it run. If you start to customize the device, soon you'll notice that the WebUI (Web User Interface the camera has a built in Website for viewing the cam image and configuration) seems to update your changed settings, but in reality did absolutely nothing that would make me think that it did. The alarm motion trigger setup is a nightmare, aside the fact that it doesn't update to the new settings, but you think it did. (meaning no error feedback)
A friend of mine owns the same model and one night we been ripping our hair (what hair?) out trying to set his up so it would only send a text message to his phone. Bad luck, whatever he configured, it would rapidly send 6 images along, even though it unchecked that option. This is bad, bad, bad since his Phone provider would bounce it back to the sender. The result, absolutely nothing. Well, sometimes at the pleasing of the Camera it would sneak through, but very unreliably. In my own case I don't need to have an alarm sent to a cell phone. So I went to check out how my motion trigger would perform. I am still working on figuring out what the heck happened. I would trigger the motion sensor, stand there for about 60 seconds and then go back to see if e-mail was sent properly. If the e-mail makes it, I see a series of images, but none has me in the picture.
I have a relatively fancy home network with public access to my web servers and e-mail server. This works fine for my everyday use and I have visitor coming from all over the world, although not millions but hundreds every week. I believe I know a little bit about the principle of networking.
The Camera / Web UI / Firmware has tough me otherwise because I have no idea what it does and what not. To make things a little worse, it may do it at random. Whoever programmed the Firmware / WebUI should go back to doing something easier.

Edit:
The review above is primarily about the build in web UI and not about the camera itself. The Camera is now working for a month and does produce exceptional images, even at night. If they only could get the User Interface right, I would give em 5 Stars./>

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: 2 Foscam Web Cams Ordered and Both Had Issues
review_body: The first Foscam F18910W Wireless Camera I ordered the wireless feature/component did not work. When wired it  was fine. I returned the camera and had Amazon send another one... The second one came in and kept rebooting/resetting itself. Could have been an issue with the power supply. None the less, I have hassled with 2 Foscam cameras and will not be attempting to order a third one.  Really disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I just got this yesterday and configured it. The step by step instructions from a previous reviewer \\"R. Tickle\\" were extremely helpful. I did have a few issues that I needed to sort out however. I use a Linksys WRT54G wireless router with HyperWRT firmware. Setting the static IP for the camera was tricky. I tried using the Gateway and DNS that was being reported in my router configuration screen and that gave me an \\"illegal parameter\\" error message in the camera configuration. Turns out I needed to use the typical http address I use to log into my router i.e. [...] for the gateway and DNS server. Changing the port from 80 (which is a public port that everyone uses) to one of the ports that Foscam recommends caused me to lose connection with the camera. Initially, I thought I did something wrong in the configuration and I kept resetting the camera. In fact, if you lose connection, you did it correctly. You are no longer connecting to the camera through port 80 (duh). I reconnected to the camera by typing in the static IP address I assigned to the camera followed by the port i.e. [...]=new port number you assigned to the camera. I also had a small issue with wireless connectivity. I use a MAC filter on my router. The camera had two stickers on the bottom with two different MAC addresses. I used the one I thought to be the correct one. Turns out it was the other one. Port forwarding on a Linksys is pretty straightforward so there were no issues there. Once configured, the camera works great. I use a web browser to connect to the camera from my work computer or iPhone. The picture quality is really good. The IR works well. Sound quality is OK but not great. There's a bit of lag when talking into a mic and hearing it on the other end. Not a show stopper though. Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera. I'm tempted to get a few more to put around the house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I found the Foscam online tutorials available through their support website very informative as was the full online manual.
Both gave me everything I needed to succesfully install the camera and the email and alarm recordings. It took me about 5 including playing with settings and making adjustments.
I wanted to be sure I could install this before ordering more. I just ordered one in white.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Set this up my daughter's nursery for monitoring. Image quality is good with both the infrared on and off. The motor system works great as well. There are numerous Android/iOS applications that interface well with this camera.

Setup was simple. I ignored the instructions it came with and pulled the latest off Foscam's website.

The web interface could be better. The image is streamed fine enough but the site is a bit difficult to navigate. The motor controls are a bit clunky if you're not using Internet Explorer.

Overall I'm very happy with this product. I'm able to quickly and easily monitor my daughter in any light.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love this camera, this is the second one I've bought. I now have one in both of my children's rooms. I also have the Foscam app on my iPhone and it's so easy to use, camera setup is simple and quick. I recommend this product to anyone who asks!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works great after struggling for the setup
review_body:
pro:
it works just as described. I can monitor my house during my one-month long vacation.

half pro/half con:
it is not that easy to setup for non-tech people. I am kind of a tech people but have limited knowledge in network. I followed the video tutorial and manual step by step and finally make it work. I actually learned some basic network stuff.

I think the majority of the customers need a product that we just need to plug in the power cable and it works right away:)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: For all the features this has and the overall good performance, you just can't beat it for the price. Remote viewing on iPhone/iPad devices, 2 Way Sound, Night Viewing, WiFi Capability, PC Access etc, etc, etc... the list goes on. I like almost ever aspect of this camera, and even when you set it up and want to move it somewhere else, just unplug power cable and move it where you want! it does not lose any settings and the capability of preset camera angles you can program is fantastic. I would highly recommend this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I just bought a Foscam FI8910W and ran into a technical problem not online or in the quick start guide, so I called tech support.  Tim picked up and had my camera up and running on the local and wireless networks pretty quickly.  I was glad that tech support used remote assistance software, \\"Team Viewer\\", so I could watch the troubleshooting steps.  Although, I did hesitate to let a remote user having access to my computer, but I guess the benefit of cool technology was worth the risk.  I think Tim could have been a little more vocal during the troubleshooting, but customer service at most companies has been trained to only provide solutions, not talk customers through the process, so I can't blame him.  I guess providing solutions is good for a significant number of customers, but I feel like I am pretty technical and like to be involved in troubleshooting.  On second thought, it is nice for a change to have someone else do the troubleshooting for me.  Otherwise, he was friendly and extremely professional, and I expect the rest of tech support would be trained in all the same manners I described above.  Overall, a likable experience.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera works great once it is configured.  The CS line is VERY helpful when you need to configure the product.  Call them unless you're a real tech person.  It's not as easy as the installation instructions make it seem.  I spoke to Leo and he walked me through the process with ease.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is amazing!! It surpassed my expectations.  We purchased it as a baby monitor and it's better than all the "baby monitors" out there, and a better price. My husband had no issues setting it up, and I love that I can tune in from anywhere, even if I'm away from home, to watch what's going on in some of the rooms of my house. The clarity is perfect, and you can control the tilt remotely using the apps or computer program. The tilt has a great range of vision. The night vision is also good. The audio is a great feature, and I can use it to hear my baby in the other room.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I love the camera and I am considering getting a second.  Great picture quality.  I really like being able to access it from both my iPad and my Android phone -- there are tons of compatible apps for it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great addition to my security system and easy to install.  Several of my friends are also going to buy one of these camera's for there homes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
