product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pleasantly surprised - Great value for the money
review_body: I was prepared for the worst when buying this IP cam. Some people complained that there may be many fake reviews of this camera posted by the manufacturer, so that made me a bit reluctant to buy this camera, but at the same time, there were so many reviews and it is pretty high on Amazon's popular sales list, surely some of these positive reviews were happy customers. It seemed people who liked it really liked it and those who disliked it, absolutely hated it and considered it as a worthless piece - o - crap. After unboxing the unit and going through a few help videos on Foscam's website (which by the way borders on looking unprofessional), the camera was up and running with full audio. It works as advertised for me with the exception of the camera preset locations, that feature doesn't seem to be working for me. I did have to pay close attention to setting up the port forwarding in order to view the cam on the internet but it was quite easy if you follow the video instructions on their website. The video quality is decent and audio is adequate. If there were a higher resolution model at a slightly higher price, I would pay the difference since these cameras are pretty cheap at $80.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice camera for the price, but beware
review_body:
I bought this camera because it seemed to have the functionality I needed (remote home monitoring) and was fairly cheap. Setting it up via wire to the router was fairly painless. However, chances are you're not going to run CAT 5 cable from your router to every camera in your home/office so you'll want to set it up on your wireless LAN. Beware, wireless setup was a pain in the rear. I found that it seems to take awhile for it (the camera) to wake up and join the wireless network so be patient and let it sit for awhile. There are also 2 MAC addresses for this camera (which they didn't have documented) so make sure you use the right one if you have MAC filtering turned on for your home network.

Buyers should also beware that this camera does NOT support SSL/HTTPS for logging in remotely!! This means your user name and password are sent across the internet in plain text (unencrypted). Which means anyone can sniff your username and password and log in to your camera. You can find some instructions online to stand up your own Apache Web Server as a reverse proxy, but that was a pain for me. In the end, I ended up installing Surveillance Station on my Synology NAS and downloading DS Cam from Google Play. This allows me to log in to Surveillance Station from my phone via HTTPS while away from home.

As long as you can find a method to log in securely (HTTPS) this camera is awesome!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: works great--but not for the faint of heart
review_body:
This ip camera works as advertised. I have it communicating wirelessly and am able to access it remotely. (I have not tested the audio.) That said, it is not for the faint of heart. Despite decent instructions,it would be fair to say that someone with absolutely no knowledge of networking, or even rudimentary knowledge, will have a very difficult time. This is not the fault of the product; it is the nature to the complexity of network architectures.

If hooking up a network printer at home is a daunting challenge, you will need help from someone knowledgeable to exploit the full capabilities of this camera.

I am not a software engineer or network administrator and have no formal education/training. I learn what I need to know as I encounter new technical challenges. It took me several hours to get everything working properly, but in the end I succeeded. The purpose of this review is just to alert the buyer that this is far from a \\"plug-and-play\\" device, BUT a patient, somewhat knowledgeable amateur can succeed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: THe is my first monitoring camera and It has worked without any problem for a while now. While upgrading the firmware of the camera, I had a minor issue and thought I had bricked the camera (as this process requires you to carefully read the instructions). Unable to resolve the situation, I called the foscam technical support number and was helped by Annie Watson. She was very knowledgable and was able to resolve my issue quickly and efficiently. I would definitely purchase another product from foscam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Foscam technical support called me back the same day and installed all steps for the camera to work.  Simon was very helpful and patient.  Their tech support is very busy so you might have to leave your contact info but they did get back to me in an hour and my camera works on my home network.  Simon also gave me information to install an app so i can view the camera from my iPhone.  Very helpful.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I was a little suspect at first given the myriad of what looked like fake reviews. I was pleasantly surprised at the product. I ordered 3 knowing I could return it if I wasn't happy.

Setup wasn't nearly as hard as I thought given all of the reviews I read. To prepare for the installation, I watched some of the videos on the Foscam website and I also read the manual. It was sometimes hard to follow but I got the general idea.

I'm not an IT expert or engineer but I am slightly familiar with a router and adept with computers. I googled any term I didn't understand. Overall, I had everything up and running in about 45 min without calling anybody for help. The only hiccup was getting the audio to work. you have to download some plugin (apparently it doesn't work on mac laptop). I have PC so the audio worked after I downloaded the plugin. the audio also works on the ipad and iphone apps (Foscam Pro is the one i bought for $4.99). i should clarify that it is 1 way audio that worked. I couldn't get the 2 way audio to work but I don't really use it so I didn't care. I only need 1 way audio to hear my baby cry. a lot of the installation was trial and error. everything seemed to work for me which was a surprise. I expected the worst given all of the bad reviews on installation problems.

I am going to buy a 4th camera now. you can't beat the price and I love having 4 cameras in my house to watch my kid when I'm not around. the app for the ipad rocks. you have like 4 mini screens and you can do a close up on each of the 4 screens.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It's easy to setup, has great night vision, and is easy enough to control.  I really don't have anything bad to say about it, it's a nice affordable camera.  Just remember its an indoor camera, this would not last long in the rain.

review_body: I'm using this camera to send timed pictures from an unheated cabin in a remote location over satellite Internet.  It's been very cold but the camera has worked flawlessly.  I initially struggled to get the wireless feature to work and I had purchased a "like new" used camera so I concluded I got what I paid for but I was wrong it was user error and the wireless works great.  I love the fact I can access the camera real time with my phone or iPad without any additional software.  Great little camera with lots of features at a very low price (even lower price if you buy one that has been returned like I did).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

If you could manually turn the IR on and off or change the sensitivity then I would give this camera 4 stars

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Pleased with the foscam customer service. The customer service representative , Judy , was very knowledgeable and helped me to resolve the set up issues very quickly. We love the remote access and we are eagerly looking to use it. We recommend this product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
With the number of bad reviews for this product I was nervous about buying it, but I'm really glad I did. For the price this camera simply rocks! Loaded with features it really could be priced much higher and still be a good buy. I found setup very simple if you just follow the instructions. It took almost no-time to get it setup, but yes, you MUST install the software on your computer first so that you can "find" the camera on your network. After that, boom, you are in!

One enormously great feature is the wide-angle lens. You have a great view through it and it's very clear. The automatic infrared lamps come on in the dark so even in a pitch black room you can see everything perfectly. I put my camera looking out the front window of the house and I can see when packages are delivered or when the mail came. And with the included ability to email or FTP on motion detect, I get emails with still-image attachments when someone comes to the door.

This camera is simple awesome. Can't recommend it enough!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very handy, but by no means perfect
review_body:
First, for those reading reviews and seeing people complaining about the lack of support for cameras purchased on amazon, the foxcam.us site clearly states that: \\"For sales on Amazon.com, support and warranty extend to those products sold by Amazon (Ships from and sold by Amazon.com) as well as from Foscam Digital Technologies LLC (Sold by Foscam Digital Technologies LLC and Fulfilled by Amazon)\\", so if you are buying from some other seller on Amazon, you may very well run into trouble, but there is definitely a \\"safe\\" way to buy it here on Amazon.

I bought the camera because our son moved from crib to bed, and we wanted to see how he was doing without having to disturb him.

Setting up to use the camera \\"in the house\\" was very easy. Setting it up to be viewed outside the home networ, was a bit more challenging. I'd say that if you don't know how to get into your router settings you will have a very difficult time in general setting this camera up. But, if you have the patience to watch the setup videos at the foscam.us website, you will muddle through it all and probably do so after an hour's worth of watching and tinkering.

It is a lot less expensive than a comparable baby monitor, and I have to say it is funny as heck to watch my son climb out of bed because he wants to avoid his nap, but I can shout (\\"Get back to bed, it is night night time\\" and see him immediately scoot around and get back into the bed. Of course, I have no idea what he is thinking when I catch him but he doesn't see me. That is what makes it funny. I haven't used the speaker because I don't want him looking at the camera ... if he hears a voice coming from it, I expect he will get out and yank it off the dresser where it sits.

It works well enough in the dark. For some reason I did not expect the IR lights to be visible, figuring we can't see theinfrared spectrum so why should there be any visible IR light? But all of those LEDs turn red when night vision mode is on, and it is quite visible in the dark as a result.

The \\"presets\\" don't work out of the box. Oddly enough, to set the presets will drive you mad if you read the instructions because deep in the menus the box to disable \\"presets\\" is checked and that must be unchecked. (Go to Device Management then to PT Settings, then uncheck the disable presets box). Without the presets you have to pan the camera by touching/clicking an arrow. With the preset I have 1 set to the bed, 2 set to the crib and 3 set to the door, so I can quickly move to where I wish to have the camera point.)

I don't know how baby monitors work but I am pretty sure they don't \\"sleep\\" the way this camera does. At times when I open up the App for viewing, it says the camera is not available and it takes 10-20 seconds to turn on. Not a big deal.

I have not yet set it up to e-mail me pictures, but like the feature more for security purposes when nobody is in the house than as a baby monitor when it would be sending me pictures all of the time as our son moves about the bed.

I would highly recommend buying it from Amazon (I did not) because the return policy is much better than when you buy at Foscam.us directly. Not that I intend to return it, but I can see many people getting frustrated with the setup and deciding to choose another branded camera.

Note, the website at foscom.us is very helpful. And the DVD has a manual on it that is much more detailed than the startup guide that comes with it (explaining what the network lamp is, for instance - you can turn off the blinking green and yellow lights that indicate you have a network connection -- in a dark room these blinking lights can be annoying. To turn off, go to device management, PT settings and uncheck network lamp). But all of that said, if you know nothing about IP Addresses, port forwarding, routers, etc., and are short on patience and time, you may want to either takea pass or be prepared to return this baby.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good alternative to traditional, dedicated baby monitors.
review_body:
Previously we had a Levana baby monitor which died 1.5 years into service.

The wife and I debated for a while on whether we should get this camera or a dedicated baby monitor like the Samsung SEW-3037W or Motorola MBP36.

After the Levana failed, we were both hesitant on plunking down a large amount of money on a dedicated monitor. But at the same time, we like the VOX feature which turned the monitor on automatically based on sound.

So why did we decide to get this?

First, we figured that if it didn't work out for us, we could still use it as a general security camera but if it did, we could save over $100 so we took the plunge and got this one.

Second, with this camera, we can have many, many more monitors instead of a single monitor. We even have retired Android smartphones sitting around that we've re-purposed as a dedicated monitor. With our laptops, tablets, and smartphones, we have 6 monitor-capable devices.

After sifting through the many, many reviews, I did have some concerns about the setup, but I have to say that for anyone that has any inkling of basic network setup, this thing is a snap to set up and install. A *snap*. If you have basic experience with networking, you're likely not going to need the manual, watch any tutorials, log into any forums, or call tech support for basic setup.

That said, I'm docking 1 star for three shortcomings:

1) The first issue is that the web interface looks terrible and unprofessional. Mostly cosmetic, but it's not that hard to write some decent CSS.

2) The second issue is that there's no way (at least that I've seen) that I can turn off the network activity lights. This is very annoying in a baby's bedroom and requires some duct tape to fix.

3) The mounting bracket requires you to drill into the wall. If it had a flat, plastic back, it would allow the usage of the included screws OR the usage of something like a 3M command strip (in fact, if the manufacturer is reading this, I would recommend revising the mounting bracket and including a 3M command strip).

A good piece of hardware and I would definitely recommend to other parents and will definitely consider purchasing additional units.like a 3M command strip (in fact, if the manufacturer is reading this, I would recommend revising the mounting bracket and including a 3M command strip).

A good piece of hardware and I would definitely recommend to other parents and will definitely consider purchasing additional units.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera's were easy and quick to set up. Tech support was great. Simon did most of the work for me and showed me everything I needed to know to set up and use the cameras. The cameras worked great and video came through very clear.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I couldn't get my Foscam to connect to my wireless router. In fact it was connecting, but for some reason, it wouldn't display the images after I disconnected the network cable. After about 5 hours of searching for solutions on the internet (and even returning one device because I was convinced it was defective), I decided to call Foscam US. After about 20 minutes or so of waiting to speak to someone, I was connected with Harry Foster to resolve the issue. He took over my computer (a little creepy, but it's much smoother than going through this \\"now click here and type this. Did that work?\\" sort of thing). My camera was working within about 5 minutes. Turns out that the camera needs to be at least 5 feet away from the router. I didn't realize that. Anyway, I'm very pleased with the customer service on the device and I would buy from Foscam again.

review_body: I haven't tried any of the other cheapo IP cams out there, this one works pretty good. I've had odd issues, one of my camera's the wifi simply quit working but the ethernet port still worked. Sometimes the green 'night' filter will stay stuck on, lending a green tint to the picture. The only way to fix is to power off/on the camera, since a software reboot does not fix. The picture is acceptable, keep in mind it's low resolution so reading plates or words probably won't happen. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: The jury is still out on this one...
review_body:
The first thing I noticed and liked about this camera was that it's wireless (sans the power cord - no camera can be good and 100% wireless unless it runs on a battery) and that it has audio.

PROS:

Set up is easy if you're checking the cameras from home; a simple process that doesn't take much time.

Decent price, although it keeps fluctuating on Amazon.

Viewing feed is good; although I had to remove it from a window box because at night time the glare from the glass made the whole thing pointless.

Night vision is better then I expected.

CONS:

Remote checking and smart phone use is another story; you have to configure settings to check it remotely; to date I am still having trouble configuring and there's no customer service to call and get help with just on-line forums. If someone can share a quick and easy way to configure this, I am all ears & eyes.

I purchased (and returned) outdoor wireless Foscam's - the set up was to frustrating and I couldn't merge viewing options with this camera.

The audio is terrible once you get it set up. It's advertised as two-way audio but you have to download a plugin that does not support this camera anymore. I found a few sites that had tips on how to get around this but once I did, I couldn't send audio to the camera (to the room) and the built-in microphone picks up rotation of the camera as well as EVERY sound so it's kind of half-way-there on the perfection level.

Again, the jury is still out on keeping this as it's not doing what I thought it would.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A fantastic camera, great quality and easy to use App
review_body:
This is a great product and we love using it as our baby monitor. Here are some of the reasons I love it...
1. Easy to install
2. Easy to control the settings through the device settings
3. 360 degree pan and tilt
4. Clear night vision
5. No to low noise when panning or tilting, hence does not disturb or wake the baby up.
6. Excellent App (bought separately) for iPads and iPhones
7. Can be used as home monitoring system- You can monitor remotely (outside the wifi) network too. It has built in motion detection for recording clips of videos.
8. Very stable
9. Two-way audio helps talk to my kid over the cam.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: i purchased a foscam 8910w after researching cams.  We needed it to use as a baby monitor and any decent baby monitor is $200+ which is crazy.  So this made sense as this has features some of the most expensive baby monitors have.  I read the reviews and seen that some people have trouble setting up the cam.  The setup for me was pretty straight forward. I used the directions the cam came with, no videos no extra support.  Its not that complicated to figure out unless you have no idea about routers.  I got the cam up and running both inside my network (home wifi) and outside of the network (4g on cell carrier) in about half an hour. All in all, great cam at a great value.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Cool Cams but motion sensor(s) not working?
review_body:
I found these IP Cams on Amazon. I have been looking for an affordable surveillance cams for a while but all I have found have been very - very expensive. I ordered 2 of these at the beginning of December. They initially worked well but now that I have added two more outdoor Foscam(s) the motion sensor part is not working. I have been over the instruction manual at least a dozen times. I have phoned and emailed Foscam.us and I have still not heard back from them about this problem. The live IP Cam part works great! The motion sensing thing which was one of the main selling points for me just stopped working and it hasn't been working since I installed the Foscam outdoor cams. What in the heck?

I realize the cams didn't cost a lot but crimany sakes, everything should work the way it is advertised to do. I have still not heard anything from Foscam and I guess I am going to have to bomb them with a ton of emails to get there attention. I want the motion sensing part to work like it is supposed to do. Other than that, I would have given the Foscam a 5 star rating.

I am very disappointed with Foscam at this time.

D. Brooks, Jr.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Second camera I purchase. Liked te first then bought a second one.
Easy enough to set it up.
Good control'.
Fair price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
set up is easy enough if you only want an in-home option that you can only view while on your wi-fi, but if you want to get it to broadcast, be ready to tinker with your router, the camera and an app if you want smartphone access. Easy enough to do if you like to do that stuff and know what you are doing, but definitely not a plug and play type solution. However, there are a TON of east to follow youtube videos which walk you through setup. Its not a Foscam problem, but rather the complexity of so many combos of routers, ISPs and network configs.

As for the camera, the controls, range and picture quality are great. Picture is good even in complete darkness. I didn't take pictures for comparison, but i set this up side by side with a $200 baby monitor and the Foscam blew it away. higher details, better frame rate, incredible quality difference in the dark.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I called to ask for help wi9th viewing my IP cameras from my iphone and the response was quick and extremely helpful.  They guided me step by step, I am incredibly satisfied and would recommend these cameras to anyone.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Easy to set up. Like a previous reviewer, I just used a browser to open the camera's config screens and did not use the install disk. This camera is used primarily to monitor a contruction site with an Android phone. Although Foscan does not have it's own Android app, there are plenty to choose from. I tried 2 free ones available on the Google Play store: tinycam and mobicam. Both apps streamed smooth, fast video and allowed basic controls like ptz, alarm on/off, etc.

The features I like the most are IR nightvision, good pan/tilt range, compatibility with Android. The only feature I miss is ability to control an I/O port to remotely turn lights on. But for the price and features I have to give it 5 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works as advertised, straightforward to set up and use. Good range on the wireless and doesn't bog down the network.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Received the first one. Configured it according the to instructions. The unit kept restarting on it's own. Sent it in for a replacement. New unit acted in a similar fashion. I spent a little more time with the second one. After reading the forums and tech support, did a firmware upgrade. Same issues. After spending two hours on it, I decided I didn't want to deal with the issues and sent it back to Amazon.

A co-worker purchased one. Had the same issues. He spent about four hours and tried several different firmware revisions to get it work properly. I think it would've been a perfect product if it worked properly out of the box.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: This is the one to get!
review_body:
Full featured (except for video zoom) and elegant. The setup was a bit complicated, requiring port forwarding through my FiOS router, but figuring it out was not overly complex. The payback is full Web access to this unit. The night vision is excellent and the online access is simple (iPhone. Android, Windows. I haven't tried AppleOSs other than iOS).

My only hesitation is that there is no zoom function, and the size of the unit makes it unsuitable for covert applications. I use this camera to monitor my home's family spaces to insure safety. So the obvious nature of this unit is not an issue. My family knows they are there and have been instructed that in the event of an emergency, get into view of the cameras. When we have family functions our distant family (cousins across the US, and in Singapore) can now interact through video and audio.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I wanted cameras that I could monitor with my iPhone.  These work well in that regard, but the interface for setting them up is really very unpolished and not intuitive to use.  I didn't like that you can't set them to record continuously to a hard drive (like normal surveillance cameras) without manually clicking the record and stop buttons.  If you want to pay another $45, however, you can buy their Blue Iris software that will do this and many other features that are not available otherwise.  I use the FoscamPro IPhone App and it works very well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very easy to install and the picture is very clear. The two way audio is fantastic. It works well in both light and darkness.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This was relatively easy to set up. I was concerned because many reviewers complained of how difficult set up was.
It took less than ten minutes to get it working and an additional 15 minutes to get it operational on my cell.
I iwll definitely get a few more of these.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I really wanted this to work, so much so that I gave it too many chances. I thought I could chalk it up to user error, but I have IT experience and ultimately had to return it. Amazon should take this item off the site, because from personal experience and reading from other reviews it clearly has issues.

What makes this unusable:
The wifi on it is terrible. (I have a $200 wireless router, not it's fault)
Ethernet doesn't help. It needs to be reset every time.
The software that comes with it is a hindrance, and altogether best avoided.
Setup is excruciating. Why you can't just plug it in and use it is baffling.

It's frustrating because, albeit the wifi, the camera's hardware is perfect. The camera is silent, and works well. The infrared is good too. Foscam needs to get their stuff together.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
'Got this one on Amazon Gold for $80 or so? 'Awesome camera. 'Cheap and works with lots of camera apps, including the camera app on my Synology NAS, so it can easily become a home-security device.

Night-view mode works perfectly as well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I received (2) Foscam FI8910W for Christmas to monitor my home when we are away.  Being in the IT field I usually look to see if there are any firmware or software updates.  There were, so I upgraded both.  When I entered the \\"Device Management\\" I noticed an odd entry in the  DDNS Service Settings:  Undefined with a DNS entry of aj7320.myfoscam.org on Camera_1 and DDNS Service Settings:  Undefined with a DNS entry of aj7265.myfoscam.org on Camera_2  so I decided to copy and paste both entries into a web browser to see what I would get and low in behold it was the login to my Foscam Camera.  I then looked to see who the DNS Name was registered to myfoscam.org is registered to a company in China, yes I know Foscam is a Chinese company but I'm having I HUGE problem with someone from China able to monitor my house.  Nowhere in any documentation can I find that there will be a company DNS entry in the camera.  Also what user name and password they are using to monitor???  I then did some research on the Foscam.us web address (URL)  found a phone number from Houston, TX  1-713-893-7869.  I proceeded to call said number they accept no voicemail and want you to call back Monday-Friday 9 am - 5 pm CST.  SEE Robert J. Mocca review for BBB rating or click here  [...]  This camera and the Foscam company has invasion of privacy issues that were not disclosed in any documentation I have read.  Needless to say the camera and accessories are going back to Amazon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: The camera is not useful as a wireless device
review_body: I started out really liking it, but that was when I had a direct connect to my PC. Since the point of a wireless camera is to be wireless, I relocated the camera after intial setup (I won't go into the problems with setting it up since so many others have done so). As long as the camera is in direct line of sight with my PC, it works fine. But if ANYTHING is in between the camera and the wireless router, then forget it (including my dog walking in front of it). No signal at all. It doesn't really matter how close the camera is. I have it right now in the next room at most 20 feet away. No signal. I even bought the extra big antenna...no difference. It is true that set up requires some work, but that only needs to be done once. Signal strength is forever and this unit fails on that particular front. You will be lucky to get a 10 foot range out of it. To be fair, I have had other cameras also fail on the signal strength front (e.g. Linksys). If you want a wireless solution, make sure the reviews say wireless is good.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: An inexpensive way to get into the wireless networked camera game. I bought it as a toy but found that it’s a nice way of monitoring my house while I’m gone.  I followed the setup instructions in other reviews on here to get it going.  Now it emails me a series of pictures when it detects motion on my front porch – so I see when the mailman comes each day.  I can also view and control the camera from my iPhone and iPad at any time (there are many free apps to try).  The IR (night vision) doesn’t work for me because I have the camera pointing out a window from the inside, and that reflects the light back at the camera so you can’t see anything.  I have that function turned off and just turn on my porch light instead and it works fine at night. I don’t think this camera would work well exposed to the elements outside – too fragile.  I saw that Foscam makes an outside version too – that would work with the IR function then.  Overall, I like it and will get another one for my back yard when they go on sale again.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good camera,  great clear pictures, I have not yet completely installed it, ie need to set up for remote monitoring, but I am happy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Very easy to use!! Great way to keep an eye on our home ;) we love the pre-settings on our phones

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We really like it and it does well.  Read other posts to get hints on the installation.  My problem has been with the the 2 way audio which I can't get on my cell phone but only have 3G so my control by phone is very slow.  Overall I like it and will buy more.  We have D Link which is OK but this is better.  We have bought & returned other brands which are much too complicated and with no customer support unless it is between 10 and 4 and the hold time is forever.  Overall I feel better when I can check in via Foscam to be sure all is fine when I am not around which is worth a lot to me.  Plus you can share log on info with your alarm company or relative or sitter when you are away so they can "check in".

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Geat camera for a great price
review_body: Camera shipped fast,it was a bit tricky setting up remote viewing, after trying countless ddns servers, I found that the foscam free ddns service worked best. Viewing angles were great, only real complaint is that the framerates are abit  low for 640x 480 resolution (15 fps). however I guess you can't complaint since it's a $100 camera. Very pleased would highly recommend

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We've been using this as a baby monitor for our new baby.  It works great!  Image quality is also much better than my older 8918 without the IR cut filter.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, especially for the price!
review_body:
This camera literally takes about ten minutes to set up. The way I did it was to plug the camera into my router via Ethernet cable and then setup the WPA password via cut & paste. Once thats done, you merely place the camera where you wish to operate it. Its that easy! The camera will set its own time, and open a port via PNP (if enabled on your router) and register with a Foscam DDNS so that you can connect via the Internet [...]etc. One thing I would NOT recommend is updating the WebUI or firmware. The device came with firmware 11.37.2.47 while the latest on Foscams website is 11.37.2.46. The latest WebUI 2.4.10.2 also seems to disable Foscams DDNS and the Audio alarm function. For the price you really can't beat the older Foscams. If/Once they get there support up to par they will get the fifth star from me.

Update 01/06/2013. Was browsing the Foscam website last night and noticed it had a "talk to us" button. I clicked it was speaking with a person in under a few minutes. It seems some of the camera's on Amazon have newer firmware & WebUI than the ones Foscam ships directly. This isnt a bad thing until you realize the versions of the software are misnumbered. Some of the versions on Foscam's website may or may not be older than what comes in your camera. This is an issue Foscam will really need to work out. The customer support was quick to respond and seemed knowledgeable. Until they get this worked out, I will continue holding the fifth star.

Update 01/11/2013. Found Foscam.com's download had updated firmware and webui. As with the earlier install, things updated quick and painlessly. Best of all, the WebUI has the alarm by sound options and the Foscam (free) DDNS options added back in. I am as happy with this camera as the day I bought it!

The camera has been working flawlessly since day 1 and I have even left it outside in a semi sheltered area more than once. I wouldn't leave these in the direct rain and snow but they work fine in extreme cold.

The user interface is very to use even if you have never used a PTZ camera before

I have seen others mentioning flying dots, insects or whatever in front of the camera from time to time. I think since the camera has IR led's surrounding the camera, when there is even a small speck of dust in front it shines brightly.

The bottom line is, you would be hard pressed to find a better deal than these little Foscam camera's. Even without using any PC software you can have it email, gmail, FTP etc. images when it detects an alarm or even set it to upload/email a picture after a certain amount of time to use in making a timelapse video.The user interface is very to use even if you have never used a PTZ camera before I have seen others mentioning flying dots, insects or whatever in front of the camera from time to time. I think since the camera has IR led's surrounding the camera, when there is even a small speck of dust in front it shines brightly. The bottom line is, you would be hard pressed to find a better deal than these little Foscam camera's. Even without using any PC software you can have it email, gmail, FTP etc. images when it detects an alarm or even set it to upload/email a picture after a certain amount of time to use in making a timelapse video.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I'm soooooooooooooooooo frustrated over how to properly set up the remote access!!! I am not tech savvy at all so the jargon that is included in the setup guide is like being dropped off in a whole new world.  I have spent several hours trying to read and comprehend what is in the booklet and after eeking my way past step 4 (wireless connection setting), I am ready to throw the thing out the window.  I've had it...it shouldn't be this tough!  Foscam should rework the booklet instead of having customers have to go online and research terminology.  I will ask my tekkie friend if he can hook it up for me but if he can't, this thing is going back!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Picture quality is very good.  It is a real pain to setup if you aren't familiar with all the computer terms and where to find needed information to get all the links to work together.  Had my son-in-law do it, an electrical engineer and computer whiz, and it took him about three hours.  You need to be able to forward the picture if you have changing IP addresses which means you will need to subscribe to a service to do it.  It says it is free and it is for 30 days at a time if you continually use the service every 30 days, otherwise it can cut you off.  I went ahead and paid for two years to avoid the hassle.  It is very sensitive to movement and light changes seem to activate the camera sometimes.  I used Foscam Pro to control it.  It needs a way to remotely turn it off and on so you don't have to get hundreds of emails while at home with the unit on. I ended up unplugging it when home.  I tried pointing it at the ceiling but it still tripped and sent emails.  Quality of the unit seems fine.  Remote audio works about 50 percent of the time but that is not a camera issue.  When it does work, it is very sensitive to any noise.  The speaker on the unit does a pretty good job of relaying you talking through it from your phone.  All in all, it seems to be a good value and may buy another.  I bought the refurbished model.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This IP Camera is great.
I bought it to be able to check on my dog while I am away.
The Pan and Tilt function is great and I can look around the whole room.
Setup was easy and the wireless connection is very stable, no issues.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: we love this as our baby monitor. We have two in common sleeping areas.  The support for the camera has been great, although i found it was easy to install even as a non-techie.  I love taking pictures of baby sleeping and the thought that I can watch her with a sitter.  We have the app and have even had great support from the app when our wireless went down!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I loaded the CD  - then fired up camera and within 30 seconds I had images on my Mac.  I took some time to understand the various settings and it was very straight forward...However, when it came to port forwarding I called Foscam Tech Support and Judy took the wheel and had everything working within 10 minutes of an joint web session.  Very simple and painless.  Thanks!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Worked fine tethered to computer. Could not get it to work remote to save my soul !!!! Sold it for half what I paid to friend who already had two of them, they got it to work.

Yes..... I was too stupid to get it working, even after calling customer service as they were no help at all.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great Delivery, package arrived on time with no problems.  I recommend this product to anyone who wish to have remote visual to their home or business. works great with iphone, android, and windows 8 phones

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: A very positive purchase.  The remote control works great and has precise movement and panning.  The audio from the remote site is a bit poor, but this was selected for the camera.  Audio from the camera is very good.  The infra-red work amazingly well in low to no-light situations.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Lots of features for the price
review_body:
I bought 2 of these cameras to monitor my home while away. One of them has worked perfectly since day 1, no issues. The other mysteriously reset itself just about every day, and occasionally did not seem to work at all. Since I bought it on Amazon, I was able to return it no-questions-asked for a replacement. I set up the new unit exactly as the one that did not function correctly, and I have not had any issues with it since. Hence, I can only conclude that the first camera was somehow defective. I did not attempt a firmware upgrade, due to published reviews from other purchasers where the firmware upgrade caused problems. My take is the camera should work correctly "out-of-the-box." If it weren't for the defective camera, I would give this product 5 stars. It seems very functional for the price. I like the fact that it is NOT high-def, so it doesn't consume a lot of bandwidth, and my wireless LAN supports it no problem.

The audio works fine in listen mode, I have yet to be able to have anyone acknowledge communication via the speaker. However, in all fairness, this is not important to me and I have not spent any time diagnosing or adjusting settings.

This product works well with Blue Iris software, which I believe is also owned by or associated with Foscam. I am using motion detection and email alerts, and it all works very well.

If you plan on monitoring remotely, you'll need to have some knowledge of how to do port forwarding on your router, which can be a struggle if you have never done it before. There are some excellent resources on the web.

I did contact Foscam support via email on this topic, and their response was timely and helpful.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Excellent service. Stayed with thru the entire set-up.
The system needed a static ip to keep it working overnight and they were able to set that for me.
Now I should be able to watch my home from anywhere.
Working great.
Will purchase additional cameras.
Thank you!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works as Described-Camera still Pics just SO SO
review_body: This camera has worked good for me, just be a little patient during set up for on line viewing, be sure a try a few differant port settings to get it to work when setting up port forwarding. If you have a current router, range will be no problem. Have tried it all over the house with no issues with range. Camera still pics could be better, but maybe its where i have it place and how far im trying to take pics.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: always find more ways to use it.
review_body:
This item popped up on the Deal of the Day. My 7 year old had been complaining of not getting any sleep at night for a few weeks. I just assumed that if my child wasn't sleeping then she would be in my room waking me up. But with her increased crabbiness and other behaviors it got me to wondering if she really was having trouble sleeping. We set it up in her room and sure enough, she tosses and turns ALL NIGHT LONG !!! We are getting her checked out by the doctors and were just amazed when we looked at the pictures.

Since then, we have set it up when we go out of town to check on the person who comes to care for our pets. I'm thinking of hooking it up to the bird feeder in the spring.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pretty Decent After a Firmware Upgrade
review_body:
I did my research and settled on this unit to keep an eye on my home while I was away overseas. It did a great job and I was very pleased with the results. The motion detect was great and the emailed photos I received let me know when my pet sitter came and went. I did not use any audio features, so cannot comment on that.

Many reviews here comment on the great features, so I won't repeat them here. I'll restrict my review to some issues I had and general comments about the product.

1. I work in IT so setting this unit up on my wireless network was no biggie. However, I can see how someone who doesn't understand (wireless) networking might get confused and frustrated. That said, many reviews comment on how good Foscam's customer/tech support is, so that's good. I didn't need to use it. For a great step-by-step method to setting up, see the review by R.Tickle from March 29, 2012.

2. I bought my first unit towards the end of October '12. After 8 or 9 days it dropped off my wireless network. The only way I could get it to re-connect was to reboot the camera AND reboot my wireless router. It would be OK for a day or so, then do it again. Rebooting my wireless router was getting old, so I returned the camera for a replacement. It has worked flawlessly ever since.

3. The replacement unit shipped with updated firmware and Foscam had made some changes. One was not for the better. Before, when I clicked IR mode, the camera went into IR mode irrespective of the amount of light. On the replacement unit, it did not. The camera decided for itself whether or not it thought there was enough light to justify IR mode. I find that annoying. To compensate, Foscam increased the range for the brightness setting. For example, at night a distant (20+ feet away) lamp in my living room provided sufficient light to prevent IR mode, even though the majority of that room was dark or in deep shadow. I had to jack up the brightness setting to be able to see the room. The original camera from October switched into IR mode when I told it to irrespective. I preferred that mode of operation.

4. Setting up email so you can receive emails when motion is detected is a pain. Foscam are upfront about the fact Hotmail won't work, so I setup a Gmail account specifically for this camera. After a few dozen emails (forwarded to my Hotmail account), everything stopped. No emails! Long story short, Google had decided that the email traffic via the gmail account I'd setup was spam and had suspended the account. Idiots! I setup an Outlook.com email account instead and after fiddling around with the settings, it has worked well ever since. Just be aware that the camera software doesn't tell you if there's an email problem per se. The Test button in the UI only tells you something failed and is invalid if the email account setup is wrong. It doesn't tell you what is wrong, why it is wrong or how to fix it. So expect to spend some time fiddling with this function. That said, there is some good reference material on the Foscam website and on Youtube as well.

5. Overall, for the price this is a great IP camera. I'd like to see HTTPS support and a zoom function, but apart from that it's a very good piece of kit.

Happy voyeuring!o see the room. The original camera from October switched into IR mode when I told it to irrespective. I preferred that mode of operation.

4. Setting up email so you can receive emails when motion is detected is a pain. Foscam are upfront about the fact Hotmail won't work, so I setup a Gmail account specifically for this camera. After a few dozen emails (forwarded to my Hotmail account), everything stopped. No emails! Long story short, Google had decided that the email traffic via the gmail account I'd setup was spam and had suspended the account. Idiots! I setup an Outlook.com email account instead and after fiddling around with the settings, it has worked well ever since. Just be aware that the camera software doesn't tell you if there's an email problem per se. The Test button in the UI only tells you something failed and is invalid if the email account setup is wrong. It doesn't tell you what is wrong, why it is wrong or how to fix it. So expect to spend some time fiddling with this function. That said, there is some good reference material on the Foscam website and on Youtube as well.

5. Overall, for the price this is a great IP camera. I'd like to see HTTPS support and a zoom function, but apart from that it's a very good piece of kit.

Happy voyeuring!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I ended up buying three of these cameras in a fire sale for about $62 apiece. Although there were negative reviews, I still bought them because of the features they offered (IR Full Night Vision, Pan/Tilt, 2 Way Audio) and because they were wireless. I use two of them at my vacation home and one at my regular house for surveillance, and though the first set up was confusing, the second and third only took about 15 minutes each. Word of advice, don't use YouTube or customer instructions, I used the pamphlet included and it made it so much easier to set up. (I tried with a YouTube video first and ended up having the factory restart the camera) The image quality is what I would have expected for a camera under $100, not amazing, but clear. I can see up to 20 feet and recognize faces fairly easily. The Pan/Tilt is amazing as it gives you so much more viewing power over what you're looking at (i.e Camera is pointed at front door but can still turn around and see rest of house). Audio is 7/10 with a good amount of clarity, but still some buzzing, however there is a port if you want to add your own microphone. (Only on Internet Explorer Windows Computers with \\"Acitive X\\" can you listen to audio, unless you use an iPhone App). The speaker in the camera, used to talk to the thing you're looking at it useful but overall just an added feature. You couldn't hear it if you were more than 6 or 7 ft. away. I use my cameras wirelessly, but I would bet that if you used a direct ethernet connection, the speed would be better (there is a 1-2 second lag if you go wirelessly, but not something that should deter you) If your computer is on the same network as the camera, you can use the Application that came on the CD to view your camera (Multiple Camera Viewing on 1 page is only available on Windows Internet Explorer), but once you leave the house, you have to set up Port Forwarding through your router. This is probably the most confusing part of the setup, but I thought the guide explained it well. With port forwarding, and the included web address attached to the bottom of your camera (three years free included), you can view your feed from anywhere in the world and through your smartphone. Do not use No-IP or DynDns, just use the included web address and save yourself the trouble. I personally shelled out the $6 and bought FosCam Pro on the iPhone App store and it was worth it. Not only do you get the audio (I'm a Mac user), but the app also included digital zoom features (not included on the Mac internet applications only PC Internet Explorer). All in all, I am thoroughly impressed with this product, and glad that I caught it at such a bargain. Shipping was quick and easy.ined it well. Do not use No-IP or DynDns, just use the included web address and save yourself the trouble. I personally shelled out the $6 and bought FosCam Pro on the iPhone App store and it was worth it. Not only do you get the audio (I'm a Mac user), but the app also included digital zoom features (not included on the Mac internet applications only PC Internet Explorer). All in all, I am thoroughly impressed with this product, and glad that I caught it at such a bargain. Shipping was quick and easy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: It's a good camera - except the audio
review_body:
Initial Review: January 1, 2013 (Default factory setting and software - no mods)

Quick Run Down for those skimming.

Pros:
Great picture quality
Wireless
Great range of motion

Cons:
Built-in microphone is very low
Built-in speakers are very low
Microphone input jack emits humming sounds while being wireless and thus deemed unusable unless you can deal with that loud humming sound

(Have not tested the speaker jack for this unit)

Now, honestly I haven't sat down to tinker with it much with the holidays, but from the short experience I've had with it and if you use the stuff right out of the box, you will have a very nice picture with the exception of audio. Wireless audio lags the entire system by about 2-3 seconds.Wireless video is delayed about 1/2 of a second and is barely noticeable. Wired seems to have very little lag and is practically unnoticeable.

Back to the audio. Even cranked up the audio will be VERY low with the built in microphone if you plan to use it as a baby monitor it might not matter too much, but in that aspect it could be improved.

Using a separate microphone and going wireless? I cannot say I can recommend this AT ALL as it gives a constant humming sound. I even went as far as removing the antenna and also tilting the antenna to be right above the power-supply cord - it had minimal affect on the noise and therefore cannot recommend this method right out of the box. There are supposedly mods that replace a resistor on it, but as stated before I've not had the time to tinker with it - I just messed with the default settings because of the lack of time.

One last thing, the night vision on this camera is really good, however, the red LEDs might be a problem if mounted within sight of a child at night as they are pretty bright and noticeable. Keep that in mind if you plan on using it as a baby monitor.

Once I figure it out and what's the best things to use with it I'll update this post (probably sometime within the month - time permitting). So as of right now, with JUST the out of box features and no modifications I can only give it a 4/5. Had the audio worked better it would be a 5/5 without a shadow of a doubt. I am a tinkerer so this review will probably go to 5/5 but with a warning indicating that this was indeed after modding and will include a guide on what I did to fix the audio problem as well as the apps used for mobile devices (I have both an Android Icecream OS and iOS) So I'll post those as well. Look for this between Jan 2, 2013 - Jan 8, 2013.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this camera as a a replacement for the Loftek camera (which was disappointing because the camera provided only a grainy image and black and white), but could not make it work.  I contacted the company and have yet to hear anything back.  So I returned the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
We bought several of these and a couple of the 7" waterproof domes listed on Amazon for our office. Even though they are 640x480 resolution they are very usable for general purpose monitoring of our property. The low-light performance is very good, even in their normal daytime mode without the IR turned on.

As reported by others, the IR cannot be used inside the weather domes, the reflection of the IR emitters blinds the camera. With our outdoor building lighting and a nearby streetlight the video is very usable at night. They have been totally reliable so far, zero downtime, no video glitches, no issues. We have used them wired and wireless and both are flawless. The pan/tilt speed is adjustable and smooth. The internal mic audio is very good and it's quite sensitive. The internal speaker is not loud enough to be useful.

The internal web servers work fine for basic access and configuration. They are popular and are supported by several software packages. I'm not fond of the apps on the included CD, the are a bit clunky IMO.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Fantastic baby monitor, great device support
review_body:
We're using this camera as a video baby monitor for our nursery (triplets due in June). I wanted something with more functionality than the video monitors we found at baby stores. These would often only support their specific devices, and we wanted to view the camera from our phones, PCs, and tablets. Remotely, and locally. The Foscam does this really well.

Setup was a breeze, I quickly realized that you'll really want a static IP address for the camera. The camera supports it onboard, but I opted to leave it DHCP and have my router simply assign a specific IP based on the MAC address (I do the same for a couple other devices on my network). I also set up port forwarding to a public address, so that I can access the camera when away from home (using appropriate security of course).

Device support for this camera is amazing. The protocol is open enough, that even on a new platform like Windows Phone and Windows8, there are multiple apps to choose from for the best viewing experience. We can view the feed from any of our devices (Windows7 PC, Windows8 PC, Surface tablet, iPad, Windows Phone 8).

We haven't had much reason to use it yet (until the babies come), but so far I've been very happy, and it has exceeded all of my expectations. My only complaint is that there should be a camera setting to invert the pan and tilt controls for ceiling mounting (there may be a setting, I just haven't found it).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Best buy, if you are looking for security/baby monitoring cam for an economic price.

Very easy to setup, they've put together a demo video on how to configure things.

Within 15 mins of unpacking you should be able to set everything up and be able to get an external URL that you can use to view control camera from remote computers (work etc).

Things that are not clear in this product description are

1. The package includes the wall mount too, you don't have to buy another one.
2. You get a free dynamic dns on myfoscam.org :)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: I plan on setting these up in my home I'm currently building.  I purchased 1 just to play with it and make sure it was what I wanted.  I have setup 8 wireless Netgear Camera's for a friend that owns an apartment complex.  I would pick the Foscam for features, picture quality, and price.  It does take a little networking knowledge to set these up, especially if you want to view the camera's remotely.  There are some great video tutorials online if you need some help.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Got my Foscam yesterday afternoon and in less than 2 hours had it up and running. Yes, it helps if you have some basic understanding about networks and routers. Even if you don't, the learning curve is very short with all the information available on the net.

I set it up myself without the need of tech support or excessive cursing. Actually, didn't curse at all, so I guess it was pretty straight forward.

The instructions are well written. Suggest you read them twice. Used a Windows Vista machine to set up the cam, then installed the software on my MacBook.

My only peeve is that the audio doesn't work on a Mac as it was designed to use ActiveX which is Windows based. However, it (audio) works great on my iPhone 4 with a program called LiveCams Pro. Audio also works with Windows Explorer of course.

Yes the cam does have its limitations, but it was after all only $100. I feel I got my moneys worth. Those who give poor reviews are pretty much computer illiterate, this is not after all rocket science by any means. For myself, the included documentation was enough to get me up and running. Can't comment on their customer service as I haven't had need for it.

He was fast and very knowledgeable!  I recommend this camera highly and I recommend it to every parent and business owner!  I will be buying two more today!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this little camera up and running quickly.  I was able to get it going internally (local network) in about 10 minutes.  However, the external part was a little tricky.  It seems my biggest issue was the port number.  Apparently the needed port is 8090.  I did a lot of digging between yutube and the foscam website and didn't see/read anything about the port number having to be specific.  Just FYI for folks who are on the fence and others that have had issues getting this setup.  Had I used this port initally I would have saved a few hours of frustration.  Anywho, camera is light, easy to use/adjust via the web interface and the foscam support from Sandra Williams was quick and cut right to the heart of my problem.  I'm very please with this purchase and I've even set up a FREE no-ip address.  I've seen other reviews stating this services costs money, THERE IS a free option.  Anyway, I would recommend and am considering adding more cams.  Happy buying!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: works great wirelessly.....having a problem to operate via internet ...will try contacting tech services again( gave up on hold waiting for a tech) therefore currently unable to use as wished

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Once set up I love this camera
review_body: Set up was easy until remote access. Mac users (and PC users for that matter) ensure you locate IP address from the tool ip camera launch screen when setting up port forwarding. To access while on your wireless network use the LAN IP address and when away from home use your web / router IP address, both followed by your port number. I love that from my cell phone or tablet I can view my house, control the camera and the night vision works amazingly well. For those with port forwarding (aka server access) issues they actually have a nice support video on their website (follow the male voice one on port forwarding). At least I can say I learned a lot about my routers, port forwarding and ip set up by installing this product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Camera for going on vacation and monitoring pets
review_body:
Like most shopping for an IP Camera, I did a lot of shopping and review searching before purchasing the FOSCAM. The FOSCAM was great and the IR feature is really nice for seeing at night - almost like it was day. Previously had a Cisco and was good. One thing the CISCO did was take images and send. This is the only thing that the FOSCAM lacks that I liked better about the CISCO, but was not a deal breaker.

Very great camera and the pan / tilt is a much better feature set vs. the image capture on the CISCO. If there was 4.5 stars I would have given it that, but hey its the holiday season and 5 seemed better than a 4 ;-)

Highly recommended.

I've had some trouble controlling it from my iPhone, but the trouble could be with the iPhone, or the network connection.  The picture is good.  The sound pickup is good.  It is unobtrusive. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: It's a bit tricky to set up but fortunately Foscam has step by step videos that take you through it. You just need to be comfortable going into your router setup but even then, they show exactly what to do for the most common brands of routers. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great product for what it is - a very cheap, easy-to-use camera
review_body:
I was wary buying the FI8910W after reading some of the reviews. There seemed to be a few common complaints that I saw in the reviews. First, the camera was difficult to setup. Second, some users reported sound problems (too low, humming from interference, two-way audio not working). Finally, there were a lot of complaints over the picture quality. Please note: I am a Mac user, so all of my testing has been with OSX Lion, Safari, and a few third-party apps.

Let me start with the first issue. If you include hunting around for a place to plug in the camera I had this up and running and was logged into the built-in web server in about 5 minutes. My major disclaimer is that I am a tech nerd with a networking background, so there's nothing in the setup that I found daunting. To be fair to the average user, I followed the quick start guide that was supplied in the box and found that it worked perfectly. The camera utility on the disk worked as advertised, and it got me right to the camera's web server without a hitch. Normally when I hear complaints about things not working I always ask, "did you read the manual?" Usually the answer is no. So at least for the Mac setup, the manual is good and will get you up and running in no time.

Second, the sound problems. This is where I docked the FI8910W a star, but it's actually a software issue, not a hardware issue. The built-in web server requires the VLC web plug-in for sound to work, but the VLC web plug-in for Safari does not work with 64-bit versions (the version a good number of people will have). The VLC web plug-in for Safari has not been updated for several years, and it's unlikely that it will be actively developed in the future. Basically that means sound from the built-in web server will not work for Mac users on 64-bit Safari. I understand why Foscam went with VLC (it's free). However, they screwed up big time when they didn't check to see if the VLC plug-in worked on current Macs.

To test the sound I had to go to third-party apps. I've tested the camera with EvoCam and SecuritySpy on the Mac, and FoscamPro on iOS. For all three the sound worked perfectly, and FoscamPro's 2-way audio worked as well. One of the complaints was interference in the audio feed, but I didn't notice any. The gain on the camera's mic is turned up pretty high, so you do get a little bit of an audible hiss, but that's to be expected. Any sound the camera did pick up was clear, and I could hear the TV show my wife was watching perfectly through all three of the apps. The two-way audio via the IOS app also worked very well. I had no issues with the sound being too soft as some users reported.

Finally, the picture quality. Here's where I stand firm and say, "you get what you pay for, so stop complaining." This is a sub-$100 camera, and considering all the features Foscam put into this product it makes sense that you don't have a 2- or 3-megapixel sensor in there. It just wouldn't be economically viable. The other side is that most people don't need that kind of resolution. If resolution is really that important then you should be willing to spend more money on a higher end camera that meets your needs. This camera is an entry-level camera, so don't expect it to compete with a $900 Mobotix M12.

I was also pleasantly surprised at how well this camera worked with third-party apps. The previously mentioned EvoCam, SecuritySpy, and Foscam Pro programs connected to the camera within a few seconds, and they were all able to control the PTZ and monitor audio. I also setup the camera with Sensr.net's free trial, and that also worked flawlessly.

Overall, this is a great camera for the price, and if you're looking for a starting point to dabble in IP cameras, or you're looking for a cheap monitoring solution in a non-mission critical environment, this is definitely the camera for you. In only a few minutes I had the camera up and running, and over the next few hours I mucked around with a bunch of different programs until I came up with the perfect (at least for me) security monitoring system that includes motion detection, online backup, local recording, and automatic notifications. Not bad for a night's work!
