The mic does pick up audio just fine, have not tested the sound coming from the unit
Not sure of there customer service as I did not need to call them.
The program they sent to find the IP Cam on my network worked just fine.
Also set it up on DDNS.org with out any cost to me

This is my 3rd one and the same goes with the other 2, and looking at getting a 4th one soon

Only thing is and would not say its a problem, the cable for power seems a little short for something that's going to be mounted on a wall

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Glad I rolled the dice, works great.
review_body:
I had some trepidation on buying these due to some of the negative reviews but I proceeded for two reasons: 1. I like to think I can figure out most tech things if given enough time and I have Google available to help troubleshoot my questions. 2. If it didn't work, I knew it would be an easy return to Amazon.

I ordered 3 cameras and also ordered Foscam Blue Iris software. I used the install disc that came with Camera #1. It was really simple. I followed the instructions and it worked both with my ethernet and with my wireless network. Changed the port settings per the instructions and no problems there either. My IP is static, so I didn't have to go through those issues.

My only cons were I could not get it to work with Chrome, which is my preferred browser. Worked fine with all three cams on IE. This won't really be an issue in the future as I'm using Blue Iris to monitor it from my PC and then IP Cam Viewer ($3.99) on my android applications. Blue Iris is not really that intuitive at first, but the help section really lays out all you need. Although this is not a review of that software, I bring it up because it is basically my interface, recording, viewing, etc., so it obviously is key to having a good experience with the cameras.

The video quality is good in both light and dark. You can adjust a lot of the settings for how choppy it will be, brightness, contrast, etc. It is more than enough for me considering the price. Maybe I got lucky, but I would give it a shot and see if you do too. I cannot comment on how helpful customer support may or may not be, as I fortunately set up everything this evening in a couple hours.

My wife is already rolling her eyes because I excitedly showed her an email alert with a motion triggered screenshot. :) My only major complaint: 2 days after I bought three of these the price dropped twenty bucks.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent Images - Zoom with Foscam iPhone App
review_body:
SET UP - Although I consider myself computer and router literate, I couldn't get the camera ($62.99 on lightening deal from Amazon) to set up to wireless. After trying to read their poor-grammar "quick set up" instructions for an hour, I gave up and called an expert. I did not try to call the company. It took my friend who is an IT manager 15 minutes to set the camera up to wireless and another 5 minutes to help me set up the Foscam App that I downloaded from itunes for $5.99. (There are tons of other IP camera apps out there for free but I just thought I should go with a product specific app.)

If you don't plan on using this product wirelessly, you will need to purchase a longer CAT5 cable. The one in the package is about 2 feet long and intended just for initial set up use. They make a version without the antenna if you don't want to go wireless.

THE CAMERA - it is very quiet, responds fairly quickly to remote commands (pan and tilt) and, so far, has never lost its wireless signal. I cannot find anywhere in the packaging that this product can be used outside. The power cord is very short (about three feet).

IMAGES - Infra Red - Can't shoot through a window at night, it just reflects the IR lights in the window, so I would suggest getting an infrared light and placing that outside your window if you want to monitor at night. This camera has the capability of turning the IR lights off manually. We have a street light in front of our house and you can see the light at night with the camera but you wouldn't be able to make out faces or car colors without the addition of an extra IR light outside.

Daylight images - Great and are better resolution than I expected. It has a built in adjustment for outside photographs and self-adjusts the contrast. From the monitor on your computer screen, you can only pan an tilt. But you can zoom with the ITunes Foscam app, and take pictures and video straight to your phone.

MICROPHONE AND MONITOR - Wow! I did not expect this feature. With the Foscam iPhone app, I can talk from my phone through the camera. I can also listen to the room through the monitor. I LOVE both of these features and did not see them listed when I purchased the camera.

***** I was originally going to rate this product four stars because it is so difficult to set up but after using the camera for a week, I just love it and I'm rating the camera, not the set up. The set up is difficult so if you don't know an IT person or can't figure out how to set up a static setting through your router after determining the camera's IP address, you're going to need to call technical support and I can't speak to that experience because I did not try it. One reviewer suggests skipping the included disk when setting up the camera, I tried that, it didn't work. Also, using the WSP feature will not work either because you have to make manual changes to your router.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: No Encryption? Are you !@#$ing kidding me?
review_body:
Let me start by saying that I am a software engineer. I also have a strong interest in computer security and keep up with a lot of the latest security tools and trends. I was interested in acquiring this camera for, you guessed it, security. I have some dog walkers/cleaning people/etc. that I want to keep tabs on. That is why I am shocked that this device features absolutely no inkling of security whatsoever. None. Zero. No SSL/HTTPS. Not even digest access auth (lulz).

This means that every time you log in to your camera, your username and password is sent CLEARTEXT over the wire. The username and password _to the video camera recording inside your house_. The most ridiculous part is that the manual is so nice to walk you through setting up access to your camera from the Internet. Great! Now you can check on your 50 cats at the Holiday Inn or Joe Schmo Coffee shop. Oh wait, a 12 year old with a TI-86 calculator just hacked your camera password and now the entire Intrawebs can watch you sleeping at night. Yeah, it's that easy. I won't even go in to the obvious lack of encrypting the video stream itself, or that the web interface inspires about as much confidence in its security as a lone rent-a-cop guarding the Pentagon.

Sure, I can connect to my internal VPN every time I want to view my camera. Sure, I can put the camera in its own VLAN and disallow all routing from the main LAN except for select IPs. But I bought this camera for added security. Instead, it is now a security liability requiring ridiculous countermeasures to protect against.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Have tried on several PC's with different OS, none work. Tried wired connection. Nope. Tried wireless connection. Nope. Tried accessing with my router. Nope.
Tried calling. HA HA HA HA HA! No answer! On hold for 2 hours. JUNK!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This camera worked right out of the box and Foscam actually provides live tech support that is pretty good.
The camera will allow you to view the area remotely, including in complete darkness as it has IR. It will also detect motion and email you pictures of the motion. Just be aware that motion also includes changes in light - sun up, sun down.
The wifi connection is a little strange to setup. You must connect via hardwire first, configure the WiFi and then disconnect from the hardwire Ethernet. Beware - the hardwire connection and Wifi must be the same router. It will not recognise a Wifi connection from a router that did not supply the initial hard wire connection.
I was trying to use the camera on a Truconnect wifi hotspot but it was impossible. But if you have broadband wifi or a hardwire Ethernet connection, this works great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Despite reading numerous reviews I was quite skeptical that a wireless pan/tilt camera at this price point would be much of a quality product. I'm skeptical no more.

The camera installation and setup was pretty smooth and easy. I would consider myself highly technical and would suspect that non-techy people will struggle with the configuration. My advice would be to make appropriate arrangements with either Foscam support or a trusted resource to help walk you through the setup/configuration.

I primarily use the camera to keep an eye on our dogs when traveling. I use both iOS and Android devices which both work very well on 3G and 802.11 networks. I highly recommend the IP Cam Viewer app from Robert Chou.

The camera software appears to work fine in both Internet Explorer and Google Chrome. Although with Chrome I find that I typically have to login to the device a second time before I'm redirected to the management console.

I'm very impressed with how clear and sharp the night vision images are. The pan and tilt functions are easy to control. I haven't tried experimenting with the two way audio and have only played around with the intrusion detection functionality.

My biggest legitimate complaint is that the pan/tilt motor seems awfully noisy. So if you're looking for whisper quiet surveillance, this probably won't fit the bill.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I got the camera to catch someone that is letting his dog take a crap on my lawn and not picking up after it.

Wired setup is very easy, I was hooked up in minutes. Trying to go wireless, I got stuck at the portforward section when I could not see my camera in IP Cam. I called Foscam, was on hold for about 10 minutes when a friendly lady informed me that all their agents were very busy and that they would call me back in an hour's time. An hour later they called but I was busy and asked them to call in another hour. Another hour later, they called back. Jees Jose, the rep on the phone, was VERY knowledgable. Made my life easy. Set everything up in a jiffy and answered all my questions.

My next purchase will probably be an outdoor Foscam.

The image quality in this is better than I expected for a camera of this price. The night vision is quite impressive to a newbie like me. I really wasn't expecting much from this camera, it certainly exceeded my expectations.

Those looking to purchase this, please be aware that it has Pan and Tilt only. There is no Zoom to this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Was facing difficulty in remotely accessing the camera. Contacted foscam technical support spoke to Felix he help me out quickly & fix my problem. I love the camera & would recommend to everyone. Especially The technical Support is Excellent.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I set this camera up to use as a baby monitor. I didn't want to spend $200+ on an actual video monitor, and this camera does exactly what I need. I downloaded the Foscam pro app so I can see the nursery right from my iPhone. Setup was very easy, although if you want to watch it outside of your wireless network you need to use DDNS and port forwarding. That's what I did anyway. The audio is great, and I am using the camera to watch my dogs when I'm not home since my baby hasn't been born yet. I love it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: excellent product and service, excellent tech support
review_body: I purchased 4 cameras,  very easy to use,  had to call tech support, they were great. I would highly recommend this product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Piece of junk!!! I wish I would have listened to the other reviewers here.
review_body:
This thing came out of the box with an unreleased system firmware 11.37.2.48 and an old web ui firmware.
The web ui kept crashing on all browsers (Firefox, Chrome, IE) and also crashing on Android app.
So decided to upgrade the web ui FW to latest released version (2.4.10.2.001.bin).
The FW was unable to be flashed in the camera.
Pull the power, then the Foscam software said no web ui FW.
Tried to flash web ui again, also cannot flash.
This is the replacement set, hence it's sure that this junk is consistently not working.
GIVE UP!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
For what this camera cost (got on lightning deal), I don't think it can be beat.

I followed the set-up instructions exactly as stated in the included printed manual and the camera was running via my wireless network in 10-15 minutes.

Port forwarding was no problem for me as my router set it up automatically (uPnP). I have Win7 PC and Fios Router.

I did update the camera web interface sfw, which improved accessing it via PC, but ruined accessing it via my blackberry. I completely lost access via my blackberry. So this was upsetting, but it was never that great anyway.

On my Kindle Fire (android device) I downloaded tinyCam Monitor and it works great for viewing the camera. Way better than the web interface included with the camera via Internet browser. I only have the free version right now, which is limiting, but I will be buying the full version.

The camera works great. The Night Vision works excellent - can see clearly in pitch black. The sound works great as well, much more clear than my baby monitor! I have not tried speaking to the camera yet. So I'm not sure how well this works.

Overall I'm very pleased with the camera and I ordered a second one that should arrive this week!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I would give this camera a good review if the wireless would connect to my network!  When wired, the camera works fine.  According to the documentation, you have to put in your wireless settings in the camera (which I did) and when it reboots, you have to wait til the countdown gets to 0 then pull the network cable. After that the camera doesn't work.  If I let the camera sit for about 2 hours, it will finally connect to my wireless network. The camera then works fine... that is until you unplug it. You'd think that once you have a successful connection, powering it off and placing it in it's location and powering on would work? of course not. The darn thing just won't connect. So I decided to return the 2x cameras I purchased thinking something was wrong.  Got 2 new ones today, same thing.  It will not connect to my wireless network!  These cameras are useless by all means. I'm returning my 2x Foscam FI8910W junk and finding another company.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good Camera for the price... If it works
review_body:
I picked up 3 of these on sale. 2 for me and 1 for a gift. One of the 2 for myself was defective. The nightvision mode did not always work properly. Apparently many other people have had an issue with the Infra Red filter not disengaging when the camera goes into night vision mode. That means that the camera cant see the IR light that gives you your night vision. The other camera works great. Amazon has a great return policy for replacements, so a new one is already on the way.
These cameras have a nice feature list and are very cheap compared to other comparable cameras. The wireless networking is a bit of a pain to set up, but it works. The instructions are surprisingly good. If you don't know how to forward ports on your router, you might want to get a tech-savvy friend to give you a hand.
For the price, hard to beat. And on sale for $20 off... impossible to beat.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works as expected, way better than the Foscam FI8918W model, and it's weird since this is an older model, but works great !

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is my first camera nad it works great!  For the price and ease of use, it is great! The included software is good and powerful and very easy to use.  I have connected this both wired and wirelessly and it works great.  THe camera works good and the angle and IR night vision works good as well.  I only wish they could be used for an outdoor camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is a great ip camera.  I had no problem setting it up on my network and turning it on.  The problem came when I tried to port it through my firewall and access it over the internet.  Still working on this issue and will update once I have figured it out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Nice price and does a good job
review_body:
For entrance level home security this camera is great. I can monitor my home while away and keep an eye on my office. It sends me e-mails when it notices movement in the house which I can adjust nicely. The photo quality is very good and I am happy with it. I have it set up wireless and it works fine. The networking was a bit tough but they have demo videos that make it a lot easier to understand. Over all I am very pleased with this camera. I wish it had the zoom feature but I am not complaining at all. The web site has great tech support answers too. I never had to call as I was able to find all the answers I needed from their FAQ's and tech manuals. I would certainly buy another one.

Tom

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, quick setup, lots of features! A great buy! So simple, an adult can install it!
review_body:
This is a great camera, took less than 10 minutes to set up! The only thing that I had a problem with is the CD that came with it was cracked, didn't matter though, Foscam has everything on their website that you would ever need to set this little guy up. Foscam even has an Android app that you can use with this camera. It seems to be built very nicely, and very quiet too, you can't hear this thing pan or tilt at all.
I've seen several reviews that stating that they couldn't get the connection to work, Foscam details the installation on their website step-by-step. They have the basic set up, the wireless set up, they even break it down step-by-step for 7 different routers! With screen shots! If anyone has a problem setting this up they really need to visit the website and go to the SUPPORT tab, it will help you a great deal. It really isn't difficult to set this up, just a few steps to follow.
The picture quality is really good compared to a lot of other cameras I've seen (for the money, it's great). The picture quality over the internet is very good and the IR quality is amazing! I couldn't believe how well this little thing lit up a room in complete darkness, I haven't tested exactly how far, but it's at least 30ft.
I am very glad I made this purchase, and will probably get a few more to use with our security system.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was somewhat put off this camera from the reviews stating how hard it was to install.  I had it up and running in no time.  I have it outside under my eave/overhang out of the weather and it works perfectly.  The infrared I was really pleasantly surprised the distance you could see in the dark.  I can view the camera from my touchpad at work and use the Vitamin D program (free) to record anyone crossing a line in my yard.  Works great.  I purchased the camera for $63 shipped and feel like I got a steal.  I will be replacing this camera w/ the true outdoor Foscam if it ever goes on sale and put this camera in the house.  If your on the fence I would definitely recommend purchasing.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: GREAT VALUE, WORKS WELL, GLAD I BOUGHT IT
review_body: A little tricky to set up, but once installed, up, and running, it has been much better than I expected.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I recently ordered 3 of these Foscams. All 3 of them intermittently reboot. I have 5 older Foscams (3 FI8910W & 2 FI8905W). The older Foscam's work fine. They never reboot on their own. These newest ones are useless for security. I will most likely send all 3 of these new ones back.

I did notice that the web GUI on these newer ones looks very much different from the older models. I checked for updated firmware on these new ones but did not find any updates.

NEXT DAY: I sent an email to Foscam about the rebooting problem. They answered my email within a couple of hours and attached the latest firmware to try. The firmware that they emailed to me was newer than what was available on their website. After updating the firmware on all 3 cams, everything seems to be working fine. It's been almost 24 hours without any reboots.

I changed my rating from one star to 5 stars due to the excellent support from Foscam. All 8 of my Foscam's are working fine now.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have worked with IP cameras for about 2 years. I had wanted one for my home to check on my pet dog. In the past I wanted to buy a Sony PTZ camera, but they are too expensive for my budget.
This Foscam is very well priced and has a good image with an easy to use interface. An added feature is the wireless connectivity. After configuring this on a wired connection I placed this on a wall with a power source and the device has worked very well so far. The image quality is the same as the wired connection. The refresh rate of the image also appears to be the same as when the connection is wired. This is my second week of ownership. The basic functionality of the camera meets by basic needs.
I found set up to be easy and the functionality and image offered by the camera to be well worth the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great product at a great value!  Very satisfied.
review_body:
After doing a good amount of online research, I chose this camera due to its popularity and generally good reviews and am very satisfied with the result. We are particularly impressed with the quality of the night vision of this camera.

The setup process was fairly straight-forward (for a technical person) and I almost got the remote camera access working on my own but chose to contact Foscam Technical Support, where Kate was most helpful. They can remote right into your computer to inspect the router and camera configuration and very swiftly resolve your issue. In a few painless minutes, Kate made the necessary corrections to the config and concluded the call with confirming she could remotely connect to the camera over the open internet and operate it.

For our application, our needs were fairly basic. Our primary need was the auto-generated emails in response to motion detection. Once this was properly set up, it works great. The one thing I did realize after a little frustration is that you need to first "Submit" your Mail Service Settings before doing the test.

The motion detection works great and we are only using a sensitivity of "5" (middle of the range). We are anticipating that we might get a few false positive email notifications on account of night vision toggling or lights on timers turning on/off, but we'll acclimate accordingly.

My wife is using the Foscam app (for purchase) on her iPhone and I am using the free "IP Cam Viewer Basic" app on my Android. Both apps seem to work great.

I'm not sure what is behind some of the negative reviews out there for this product. Works great and we're more than satisfied. This product is for real and meets all of the claims. And I AM NOT a Foscam employee. :)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Pro: The price is very good for this type of IP camera.

Con: Audio is not perfect, a little bit noise.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Setting up this camera is a challenge even though for me with medium IT knowledge, but their phone support is great. I called the 800 number and a technician name Albert is great and looks like an IT genius, very quickly and efficiently helping me configure the IP and firewall setting etc. So when you purchase this camera don't need to worry about the setting, If you do encounter the problem just call them and they will work on your computer remotely just like working beside you.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Lots of features for the buck..
review_body:
Bought this to check up on the house while away. I placed it in a position to view my main interior and pan to look out the window. Setup was relatively easy. Did have to port forward my wireless router for access by browser from anywhere on the Internet. But there are instruction for that found easily by googling.

Takes snaps of movement and emails them to my phone. Great picture, adjusts to outside light so I can even look out onto my driveway through a window. Can be placed anywhere your wireless signal reaches. Very cool.

Make sure you password protect it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you were a person doesn't like to deal with all the computer software settings, don't buy it. I bought it during Amazon's deal of the day to serve as a pet cam to watch and interact with our cat during vacation. It took my hubby 2 nights to figure out how to use the 2 way audio and recording, due to the unfriendly software. You have to go to the maker's website to dig into the forum to see how people like you solve their problems.

After two nights work(by hubby) on the settings, it's serving great as a surveillance camera-movement detect, alarm, auto-record and photo shots and email you the clips. Now I can look at my cat and hear her and talk to her when I am away (only watching live cam with downloaded free app from my 1st gen KindleFire). cheap yet good quality camera. But again, It's not for dummies (both menu and software)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Borderline useless as a wireless camera
review_body:
Was debaing whether to give this a 2 or 3 star review.

This camera is useless as a wireless camera, there is no sound recording on wireless only when connecting through ethernet.
I bought two of these and the setup was fairly paineless, then again i have an IT background.
The camera picks up and repeatedly drops the wireless signal in my apartment which is about 1000sq feet, meanwhile all other wireless devices work just fine. Unfortunately due to concrete walls in the apartment I don't have the luxury of running wires behind the walls and refuse to run them along the baseboards so now i'm stuck with a camera that somewhat works and constantly disconnects.

Cons:
1)power cord is waaaaay too short, foscam sells an extension for 15 bucks. Why not make the cable 5 feet longer from the begining? It doesn't reach any outlets when mounted to the ceiling
2) WIFI is useless and so is the wifi antena on the camera
3) Technical support is virtually non existant
4) questionable password storing and transmission
5) quality leaves more to be desired
6) recording software does not come with the camera, you can record directly to the hard drive however internet explorer has to be running on your computer constantly throughout the recording process.

Pros:
1) Does work when connected though an ehternet cable
2) straightforward setup
3) night vision
4) Price point

Conclusion: Do not buy this for the wireless function unless you have the camera in the same room as your router or access point.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Just got this and love it
review_body:
Bought two and have one running the first day. I am very impressed with image quality, better than I had expected reading the comments of other buyers. I have an older security system at my home and these provide a better picture. Considering the Pan/Tilt functions, this is a great deal. I set up using hard wire network connection but have already tested the wifi and again, picture quality is better than I expected. It wasn't clear on the Amazon listing, but they do come with the mounting bracket as well as the ethernet patch cable and power supply.

Considering the price I paid I think these are great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It's nice when it works. Setup is straightforward. I setup directly using the network because the DVD that came with the package was broken! The worst thing about this camera is the frequent disconnects which makes this camera very unreliable for security.
I am returning this product back to Amazon.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: This is a very nice product.
review_body:
I got two when there's some discount, and I like them very much. I had some problem setting them up initially, with my very complex home network. Without changes, it didn't work at the beginning, I could only receive alert emails.

So I simplified my home network, connected the wireless router directly to my cable modem, and setup the port forwarding, changed the cameras' ports and both of them work perfectly. I setup the email to send URL, and by click the URL, I can access my cameras from everywhere. After my home network changes, the setting for the camera is very easy to do.

Also, I had a 802.11b/g router which didn't work with WPA2-PSK, I had to change the security to WPA for the camera to connect, but when I setup my N router, it worked without any problem.

Also, the included camera setup software works great too. I had problem finding out the LAN address of the cameras without that software, and the software just helped to find those easily.

This should be the easiest, cheapest way to setup your own home surveillance system. Although the image resolution isn't so great, but I'm not using it for video conference, and the resolution is good enough for the purpose.

The whole camera quality is a bit low, all plastic, a bit shaky, that's why I'll give 4 stars, but for the price, it's good enough.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Not sure why people have issues with the setup
review_body:
Dear all, I saw all the BAD reviews of the camera (granted most of it is about service and support), but I cannot say a bad thing about the camera or the instructions how to set it up. I was initially thrown off by the comments but decided to buy two of these cameras. The arrived ASAP (thanks Amazon) and the setup was a breeze. I have a router a few switches and a multi private and guest wireless network. I am Microsoft based, but I have Apple and Android in the mix as well.

The stup too me about 30 min for the first webcam (just because I read the manuall and watched the video, because I was expecting to go bad). The second webcam took me maybe, just maybe 10 minutes.

I set the device name, the alarm, the mail delivery ... all, oh yes and multi camera view. I installed an app on my Android based HP touchpad.

I will buy more of the cameras if the positive experiance continous. I just got them yesterday evening!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

review_body: OK, I read about 50 reviews before buying this and finally decided to buy it. First off, the shipping was super fast. After I received the camera I began to set it up. After about 2 hours of setup I download the foscam app for my iphone and everything was setup. Guys, go out and buy this thing. This is better than $500 security camera setups that I'v seen.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great features, bad performance and even worse tech support.
review_body:
Let's face it, the features on this camera are great, but when applied, the great features are overshadowed by the poor performance and horrible tech support.

If you want a camera that generates a false alarm every time the light in the room changes, or, each time the camera switches between infrared and regular, then this camera is for you. One camera will generate between 4-30+ false alarms a day depending on how many times it switches in and out of infrared, how many times lights are turned on and off in the area and how quickly the light outside is effecting the light inside. ( sun behind trees for example ) Sure, you can lower the sensitivity to avoid changes in lighting, and also enable motion compensation, but the IR to regular and regular to IR switching will still generate a false alarm, and at lower sensitivities, the camera will only really pick up motion about 3 feet in front of the camera, beyond 3 feet there could be 100 people moving about and the camera will not pick it up.

Tech support at Foscam is the worst I have experienced, it is almost as if they grabbed a random person off the street to field my call. I literally knew more than they did after a few hours of working with this camera. The simplest of questions could not be answered. If they tell you they will call you back, don't bank on it, it wont happen.

Also, be prepared to stay on hold for at least 30 minutes before anyone picks up, once that person picks up, they will have you wait another 30mins to 2 hours for a callback while they find a random person off the street to field your call.

Stay far away from this camera, Foscam surely is aware of these false alarm issues and either does not have the desire to fix it, the ability to fix it, or both.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
When I bought this I read a ton of reviews and went back and forth about whether to purchase or not. When it came up as a lightning deal I jumped. This is an awesome product that does everything I want and more. The people having problems with setup are baffling because I followed the directions exactly and it worked. I read reviews that said not to use the installation CD that comes with it but I thought I'd try that first to see what the issues were. I plugged in the camera and plugged it into my router with the supplied ethernet cable. I popped the CD in the drive, navigated to IPCamSetup.exe and ran it. It immediately found the IP of the Camera and prompted me to login. The default username and password are in the manual. After I logged in, I selected which browser I wanted to use and POOF it's connected and the picture appears. This took maybe 3 minutes. The amount of control you have is amazing. From vertical and horizontal patrol to scheduling recording times to motion sensing, sound sensing, 2 way audio, email alerts... the list goes on and on. After it was setup as hard wired, I followed the directions to set it up wirelessly by going to the device manager and selecting the wireless LAN settings tab. (as the instructions tell you) Clicked scan (as the directions said) and it found the SSID of my router. (as the instructions said it would) I simply entered the share key and submit. The camera rebooted and once again... POOF, it's now working wirelessly. I mounted it on my front porch with the included mounting bracket and the entire ordeal took 10 minutes tops.

I understand that some may have a different setup than I do, but that doesn't mean the product is junk. Initial install was on windows XP SP2 and subsequently I installed it on a windows 7 machine. I also found the greatest app for my iPhone and iPad. It's the FoscamPro app and it's $5.99 but well worth it. It does absolutely everything you would want it to do. I have mine set to alert/record on motion. You can set the sensitivity and it's setup to email me and record the video to my dropbox folder so I can see the video remotely as well as monitor the camera. UPS delivered a package for me and it alerted me when they reached the front step. I used the 2 way audio and told them to leave it inside the porch area. How cool is that?

I'm buying more of these. I only wish they were water/weatherproof so I could mount them outside as well.
This is a really good product, fake reviews or not!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you understand how to open up ports and configure your router this cam is a piece of cake.

Awesome

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I was super nervous about buying these cameras with all the claims of \\"fake reviews\\". Not knowing whether or not that was true... I took a leap of faith and bought two of these cameras. I absolutely love them. No, they aren't HD. No, they aren't top of the line. YES, if you want to set up remote viewing, you have to be somewhat knowledgeable about router settings and DNS. (If you don't know what a router, IP, or DNS settings are.. don't expect to have remote viewing, just in-home viewing via the provided application) The IR only REALLY works for about 3-4 feet, so don't expect them to see in the dark. Given all that, show me a better camera for <100.00 that has a 300 degree pan/viewing angle! I don't regret this purchase for even a minute and plan to buy additional cameras including outdoor models. That \\"static\\" interference that some people have mentioned on the audio out is true. You have to keep the volume to a minimum effective range on the connected speakers to prevent a loud buzz. I imagine this is a grounding or interference problem with the wireless and there might be a work around.

All in all.... I love these!

*****Update: In the original review, I mentioned that the IR only worked for 3-4 feet. That is incorrect. When it's working correctly it illuminates the entire room! The trick is getting it to work correctly. One of the two cameras I have works fine all the time. The second one needs a little coaxing. When it turns on correctly, it makes an audible, distinctive, \\"click\\", presumably from the IR filter. When it doesn't fully engage, the click is a quieter, incomplete, click. I read on a forum that if you hold a relatively strong magnetic (speaker magnet, hard drive magnet) just above the camera, you will hear the click complete and the IR works great. I spent some time turning it off and on, coaxing with the magnet when needed, and it appears to have improved. Almost as if it just needed to wear in a bit. Regardless of the price, only shoes should need to be worn it! As such, I'll probably move the rating to a 4 for this. Still love the camera and don't regret the purchase!of the price, only shoes should need to be worn it! As such, I'll probably move the rating to a 4 for this. Still love the camera and don't regret the purchase!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: easy to use on any smart phone and view at home especially for small business owners. Easy to install and take advantage of the security camera system.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a great product. However, before you buy this thing, make sure that you have someone who has enough computer knowledge to tackle setting up port forwarding and to know what an IP is. Most homeowners do not have static IP and will need an account on no-ip.com to track the dynamic ip addressing. The Foscam website has very good step-by-step videos. However, these videos are not updated to the latest version of your browser or wifi router. So for a real amateur one can get thrown off track.

Well, owning a Foscam forced me to really learn about port forwarding and dynamic ip addressing. I am now savvier with computer network, and I have three great surveillance cameras that take pictures and sends them to my email account. I can also use my iphone to \\"see\\". I can track my cat, check what delivery has been made when, and even see how many cars have been passing in front of my house.

There is one \\"con\\": The camera sees more than what is displayed on the camera's field of view. So unwanted movement beyond the field of view on the camera can also trigger a set of photos.

I do not bother to use any video recording. That seems to be way too much memory storage to deal with.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Amazing camera, requires some ability to work with computers / network, or ability to watch youtube videos / read comments
review_body:
Update - Seems I have been screwed by Foscam warranty service.

At the direction of Foscam US, I mailed ObservEye (one of their official Foscam warranty providers) a defective Foscam FI8190W, with insurance and tracking, to your address in Monroe on 7/3/13. It was picked up by their employees at 7/15/13, per USPS tracking # 1311 0670 0000 6457 6216. Since then I have heard nothing from their company about my warranty service.

I have called multiple times to follow up, sent multiple emails using the \\"contact us\\" form on their site, and their agents just say they will get back to me. Nothing so far at all, it's been 3 months. It appears they have now removed their phone number from their public website as well.

A very shoddy way to do business.

******************************************original review below*************

I recently purchased one of these cameras during a lightning sale, and it worked so well that I purchased 4 more, for a total of 5 cameras for a couple of properties I own. These are bar none the most amazing, best cameras I have ever used. I have used closed circuit cameras, various earlier generation brand cameras (including a finicky Linksys cam that worked 50% of the time and cost twice as much).

The resolution of the cameras are amazing. I am able to watch from PC, iPhone / iPad, and my Android devices, anywhere, with near 100% reliability. As long as you have data, it should work flawlessly. Just amazing.

However, since these cameras rely on your home wireleness network working well, as well as a small amount of effort to set up a dynamic DNS (I used no-ip.com for free and it works great) so you can view the cameras outside your home - DO NOT BUY / INSTALL these cameras if you are: stupid, lazy, have no idea what WIFI is, what an IP Address is, OR even knew what the admin page of your router is. Many of the complaints here are due to people lacking some basic understanding / expertise around home networks / ip addresses. IF you fall into this group of people, either HIRE a TRUSTED person to do it for you (a close friend / family member who knows more about computers than you do), or outsource this to the Geek Squad (as much as I hate them).

Here are the steps I followed to install the cameras:

1. DO NOT install the software from the CD. I can find no good reason to do so. Instead, I plugged the camera into my router via ethernet cable, and plugged in the power cord.
1.a Once the camera is booted and on the network via ethernet, log into your router admin page (eg 192.168.0.1) or something like that - and look up the IP address of the camera (eg. 192.168.0.101)

2. On your browser - type in the IP address of the camera (eg: 192.168.0.101)
2.a This will bring up the camera view / set up page. It will ask for a user / password. The default is \\"admin\\" for user, with password field blank.

3. Once you get past the log in page, depending on the firmware, it will show the video immediately. You can pan, tilt, and scan (no zoom). You can also go to the settings page (Device management) and set the various parameters for your network.
3.a Turn on wireless settings if you are going to use this on wifi (most people will, since these cameras are going to be in remote locations away from a router / switch).
3.b set up users and passwords (recommended to add password to Admin, and create additional users for \\"operators\\" who can't change camera settings). Note - once you change password, the camera will reboot, and ask you for the password immediately!! Don't forget the passwords!!
3.c set up a unique HTTP Port (I recommend a single value 8000 - 8999). If you don't know what this is, please consult a friend who knows about port forwarding, or google it, watch Youtube videos, etc., about the camera set up.
3.c.1 Once you have set up a unique HTTP port, the camera will reboot. When you log back to the camera, you MUST add the port to the IP address - eg: 192.168.0.101:8000 . Without the PORT # to the IP address, you WILL NOT find the camera!!! I suspect a lot of people trying to set this up don't do this right and then come here and complain about the camera, when it's their own fault.

4. Go to No-ip.com, create an account, set up an alias (eg. myaddress.no-ip.org) that you will be using from outside the home to watch the camera. This is 100% free and works great. I recommend a small donation to no-ip.com if you like to thank them for their service.
4.a Once this is done, go to the DDNS service settings of your camera and enter it there. Camera will reboot and show either the DDNS settings were successful or failed.

5. Once wireless is turned on the camera, disconnect the ethernet cable.
5.a Log into the router, and look up the wireless IP Address (denoted by foscaxxxx_1 in the device name)
5.b log into the wirelss IP address with the PORT # - eg: 192.168.0.102:8080 (not the ethernet IP Address!!)

6. If you are successful thus far, then set a static IP address for your Foscam to guarantee reliability
6.a Using a linksys router, I set my static IP for the wireless FOScam as 192.168.0.199, for example.
6.b After this is done (saved the settings on router, etc), turn off the camera, router, and then turn everything back on to allow the static IP address to take effect.
6.c Log into the router to check that the static IP address is working. Test by going to the static IP on your browser - eg: 192.168.0.199:8000, and log into the camera to make sure it is working.

7. If everything looks good thus far, then log into the no-ip address to make sure everything works:
7.a Log into myaddress.no-ip.org:8000 (your alias and your port #) to make sure everything works. It should if you understand and have followed my directions above.

8. Voila - done, enjoy!!!

Some additional notes:

1. Internet Explorer sucks, don't use it (I have IE 9 and the active X control kept crashing my IE).
2. Install Chrome, and use it. To do so, use the \\"Server Push Mode\\" and everything works great. Use Chrome for everything if you can, ditch Internet Explorer (saying this as I have to use IE for work and I grudgingly do so).
3. If you own an iPhone / iPad, the free Cam Viewer app works great for this device. Many other cam apps work also.

If you were able to follow the very SIMPLE (yes simple) directions above, and get it to work, kudos. If what you read was gibberish, DO NOT buy this camera, or hire someone to install the camera for you!!!

One thing to keep in minde - who ever installs the camera for you with the network settings can view your camera if they want, any time, any where!! So if you do this, make sure you make them teach you how to log into the camera ADMIN page, and change the passwords for the admin user, and any other users that are set up, so only you can log in and view the camera.

This is pretty simple stuff, if you have any desire to learn about basic home networking, can watch some Youtube videos that go through this stuff, read some online forums, or just can RTFM!!!

This camera is amazing. I highly recommend it, but only if you're not stupid or lazy.ort, the camera will reboot. When you log back to the camera, you MUST add the port to the IP address - eg: 192.168.0.101:8000 . Without the PORT # to the IP address, you WILL NOT find the camera!!! I suspect a lot of people trying to set this up don't do this right and then come here and complain about the camera, when it's their own fault.

4. Go to No-ip.com, create an account, set up an alias (eg. myaddress.no-ip.org) that you will be using from outside the home to watch the camera. This is 100% free and works great. I recommend a small donation to no-ip.com if you like to thank them for their service.
4.a Once this is done, go to the DDNS service settings of your camera and enter it there. Camera will reboot and show either the DDNS settings were successful or failed.

5. Once wireless is turned on the camera, disconnect the ethernet cable.
5.a Log into the router, and look up the wireless IP Address (denoted by foscaxxxx_1 in the device name)
5.b log into the wirelss IP address with the PORT # - eg: 192.168.0.102:8080 (not the ethernet IP Address!!)

6. If you are successful thus far, then set a static IP address for your Foscam to guarantee reliability
6.a Using a linksys router, I set my static IP for the wireless FOScam as 192.168.0.199, for example.
6.b After this is done (saved the settings on router, etc), turn off the camera, router, and then turn everything back on to allow the static IP address to take effect.
6.c Log into the router to check that the static IP address is working. Test by going to the static IP on your browser - eg: 192.168.0.199:8000, and log into the camera to make sure it is working.

7. If everything looks good thus far, then log into the no-ip address to make sure everything works:
7.a Log into myaddress.no-ip.org:8000 (your alias and your port #) to make sure everything works. It should if you understand and have followed my directions above.

8. Voila - done, enjoy!!!

Some additional notes:

1. Internet Explorer sucks, don't use it (I have IE 9 and the active X control kept crashing my IE).
2. Install Chrome, and use it. To do so, use the \\"Server Push Mode\\" and everything works great. Use Chrome for everything if you can, ditch Internet Explorer (saying this as I have to use IE for work and I grudgingly do so).
3. If you own an iPhone / iPad, the free Cam Viewer app works great for this device. Many other cam apps work also.

If you were able to follow the very SIMPLE (yes simple) directions above, and get it to work, kudos. If what you read was gibberish, DO NOT buy this camera, or hire someone to install the camera for you!!!

One thing to keep in minde - who ever installs the camera for you with the network settings can view your camera if they want, any time, any where!! So if you do this, make sure you make them teach you how to log into the camera ADMIN page, and change the passwords for the admin user, and any other users that are set up, so only you can log in and view the camera.

This is pretty simple stuff, if you have any desire to learn about basic home networking, can watch some Youtube videos that go through this stuff, read some online forums, or just can RTFM!!!

This camera is amazing. I highly recommend it, but only if you're not stupid or lazy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this mainly for the schedule-driven motion detection.  I bought a cheaper cam earlier which works great, but you can't tell it WHEN you want it to motion detect.  Setup for this was easier than a lot of people here make it out to be.  The first review with the individual steps was very helpful.  There are also a couple of videos on youtube that are great for setup help.  One thing I thought may have been buggy was the email service.  I couldn't get it to work.  Finally, I realized that I had it scheduled to video capture at 3:00am, not 3:00pm.  This is because the scheduler is in military time!  I wish it had zoom.  Sound and other features seemed to be better tailored for IE.  Spring for the four dollar app. if you want to use the iPhone. It is really good.  One thing I find interesting is the amount of heat this thing generates in the base.  No idea what causes that.  Another thing I find interesting is the price continues to climb on these cams.  I believe it was $69.99 at some point in the past.  I bought mine for $79.99 days ago.  Now it is $96.49!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this camera despite all of the negative reviews claiming that there were "fake" 5-star reviews, and I'm glad I did.

When the camera arrived, it took about ten minutes to set up the camera completely (including my router). I got an app for my phone (tinyCam Monitor Pro) that lets me completely control the camera (two-way audio, Pan & Tilt, etc.). It's pretty awesome what this thing can do, and for the price, it beats buying another baby monitor.

I highly recommend this product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Works as advertized for what I have needed it for
review_body: Used two of these in my chicken coop and after a few hiccups with the initial setup (port forwarding and ddns services) these have been running constantly for over a month now.  Sometimes the color is off when the transition from night to day gets goofed up somehow, I think the mechanical IR filter was getting jammed.  This is less than 5% of the time though.  They are mounted outside in an area protected from the rain and haven't fogged or anything like that yet.  Update 7/27/15 Both of these cameras are still working great in their very dusty environment and I haven't had any issues with the IR filter in a long time.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Can't get it to work from outside network
review_body: I had no trouble setting up camera and getting both laptops on our home network to access the camera and see images. I ran into MAJOR problems trying to access from outside my network. I even set up an account with No-ip.com. Best I could do was find my modem. Can't get past the modem to the router. Further online searches showed lots of folks with same problem. I have CenturyLink as internet provider with ActionTec modem and Linksys router. I would recommend this camera as a baby monitor from within the home. But it fails terribly as a remote access camera. Foscam needs to do more work on this issue. Thanks for Amazon's great return policy. It goes back today.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Great camera, awesome tech assistance. I like that I can and search in and move the camera remotley. I highly recomend this product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was stoked to get this camera on lightning deal since I had already added it to my baby registry.  The day I got it I tried to set it up for fun even though baby isn't here yet, but after two hours came back to Amazon and started reading reviews hoping for help on troubleshooting setup.  I purchased this based on the high percentage of 5 star reviews, but see now I should have delved deeper and read the 1 star reviews as well.  Do not waste your time with this product.  First time I've ever returned anything to Amazon, thank goodness for their easy return process.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've been studying on getting some network cameras for a while. Amazon offered this one for ~45% off this past week. That got it down in a range I was OK with gambling on so I bought two of them.

First impression was very impressive. Packaging was good and the aux stuff was first class. The provide a short network cable for initial setup. Rather than sending a simple and inexpensive LAN cable, they sent a very nice retractable cable. Very classy.

Also, Foscam provides a dynamic IP resolver. When your camera boots up, it contacts the Foscam server with its IP. Actually, the NAT address of your router. Foscam then provides a static URL for your camera which you can use to access the camera. i.e. abcdef.myfoscam.org

Spent a couple of hours playing with it. Documentation is pretty good.

Net result? I can access the camera from the internet using any of the PC based browsers that I use as well as from my iPhone. Incidentally, access includes control to pan the camera and turn the IR on/off.

Additionally, I set the schedule for the camera to alarm on motion (will alarm on sound also). When alarmed, the camera emails the alarm information and photos to my work and personal emails, sends an MMS message with photos to my iPhone, and uploads the photos to my ftp site.

These are just some of the features that I've setup. There are still some things I haven't setup. It can start recording the video stream to your PC or other recording device when alarmed. I typically don't leave my PCs on all day so I didn't set that one up.

When I am ready for some additional units I will have no reservations at paying Amazon's low, regular price.

This is money well spent.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I was blown away by the clarity and features of this camera, especially having such a low price tag.
A year and a half ago I had a security camera system professionally installed at my house which cost me $3200 for four cameras and a DVR. Needless to say I didn't go with pro install when I moved because the camera quality on those doesn't have anything on the Foscam. If you put the professional cameras and the Foscam side by side you would always pick the Foscam image thinking it must be the more expensive of the two.

Setup was easy, took all of five minutes via WiFi. The picture clarity is amazing and the IR night function gives almost the same clarity as if it were daytime. Tilt/Zoom is great and there really isn't anywhere you can't see, pretty much no blind spots.
I can pull up and use all pan/tilt/record/snapshot from anywhere I am and have the FoscamPro app installed on my iPad,iPhone, and android devices.

Since they don't use a central receiver (they go off of wifi or hard wired) the range is as far as your home network extends which makes them even more dynamic. I currently have three up and running.

I found a very easy way to monitor these (if you don't want to keep it on your computer or device)-
I used the Logitech Revue, hooked it up to a small tv and now I have a central 24/7 Security monitoring screen.

These cameras really couldn't be any easier to set up/manage and monitor than they already are.
I have tried seven different brands and many cameras and none come close to the Foscam.

I suggest you try Foscam, if you don't like it send back , that simple. But I have a feeling if you have ever tried any other home cameras you will not only keep it but buy several more.

For the quality of images, quality of product itself, features and price- You can't go wrong.

I buy over 400 items a year from Amazon and always give an honest review in order to help those trying to make a purchase decision.
This product rates 5 stars for use-ability, construction and price.ng to make a purchase decision.
This product rates 5 stars for use-ability, construction and price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good performance, used on long distance and work as well. Night vision with good definition, poor audio quality but in my case wasn't the first priority

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Camera seems to work well, but the setup directions are terrible. You need a Philadelphia lawyer to figure it out.
Would be nice if the camera had zoom on it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works good for pc, android, and iOS.  Just started using it remotely and iOS won't let it work for some reason. But it works on the android. No major issues so far.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
There's not much I liked about this camera. I suppose I could say
* the build quality was good.
* the network was setup for DHCP out of the box.

I found the
* video clarity poor
* frames per second too low for much movement at all
* IR views poorly contrasted. I couldn't make out my own face.
* motor noise too loud
* software clunky. I liked the interface better before upgrading the firmware, although that's not saying much.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is the best IP camera I've ever owned. Quite motors, great picture quality, fast stream of video feed and also very fast responsiveness to tilt camera or turn on and off features remotely. Very nice flat finish to camera. Sturdy built. A really easy setup. (You will have to know a bit about port forwarding and assigning static ip's to it from your router). You won't be disappointed. It is better than the DLink and Nexia camera's. I've tried them both.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very easy setup and works great!
review_body:
This is first time for me to use IP camera without network background. I bought one at the first time since not sure if I can setup and thought it would take a lot time to get it work. Amazing, less than 10 minutes, thought manual I got it work. Then, I had ordered another 5 right after first one works.

All other 5's I spent around 5 minutes to setup for each and now I have 6 points at home I can monitor my store inside remotely. Also, I installed foscam app in my iPhone and display high clear screen.

Nice product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: For the price, it's hard to beat...setup is not too bad.
review_body:
I've been watching the price on this kind of camera for a while, and was shocked to see this one priced so low. I find that it lives up to its strong reviews.

I'm writing to give a few details about setup, since that seems to be the main issue that people are having. Some say that you need a PhD in order to set it up. I'd like to say that I'm PhD-free, and the setup went smoothly. BUT...I also consider myself fairly comfortable with adding a variety of network devices to my wi-fi network. Here's what you should know:

1) If you just want to be able to access the camera from elsewhere on the same network (say, for example, you want to set the camera up in one end of the house, and monitor it from the other end), then setup is pretty straightforward. The directions, though written in somewhat choppy English, walk you through the steps. First, you connect the camera to your router using a wired connection, install some software for managing it, and then just follow the steps.

2) ON THE OTHER HAND...if you want to be able to access the camera from outside of your network (say, you're away on vacation and want to monitor your house), the setup gets a little more technical. If you've never been in the "aministration area" of your router, and if you are not familiar with what "port triggering" is, then you might want to find a friend or family member who knows that side of things. The directions DO walk you through the process, but the process will vary depending on the router you have. I'd like to say that patience will prevail, but I'm quite certain I know some people who would NOT be able to get this set up on their own, simply because they are used to devices that just plug in and work.

3) One other point, for those who care about this: Most internet providers give most of their customers a "dynamic" IP address. Or, put another way, most of us have an IP address that changes periodically. This could make it tricky to access a device like this when you are away from home. To Foscam's credit, they give you what is needed to work around this limitation. My camera came with a 3-year unique domain that will allow me to access my camera, even though I have a regularly changing IP address. Basically, they give me an address of the form xxxxxxxx.myfoscam.org. The "xxxxxxxx" gets filled in with a domain identifier that is unique to my camera, and is stamped on the bottom of the camera. There are other workarounds when faced with a dynamic IP address, and I will change to one of those once the three years are up.

4) With the camera up and running (which took me about 15 minutes), I like how easy it is to access it. From anywhere I want, I can monitor the camera, move the camera around, and configure the camera's settings. The interface is a bit quirky sometimes (sometimes the controls don't work as expected, but mostly they do). But all in all, I really like it.

Be cautious about getting this camera if you are not comfortable learning to work with your router (unless you don't plan to access the camera when you are away from its network). However, if you don't mind a little network configuration, this is really a great deal.is could make it tricky to access a device like this when you are away from home.
