Basically, they give me an address of the form xxxxxxxx.myfoscam.org. The "xxxxxxxx" gets filled in with a domain identifier that is unique to my camera, and is stamped on the bottom of the camera. There are other workarounds when faced with a dynamic IP address, and I will change to one of those once the three years are up.

4) With the camera up and running (which took me about 15 minutes), I like how easy it is to access it. From anywhere I want, I can monitor the camera, move the camera around, and configure the camera's settings. The interface is a bit quirky sometimes (sometimes the controls don't work as expected, but mostly they do). But all in all, I really like it.

Be cautious about getting this camera if you are not comfortable learning to work with your router (unless you don't plan to access the camera when you are away from its network). However, if you don't mind a little network configuration, this is really a great deal.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Some features for Visitor and Operator seem to require installing a problematical ActiveX control but IE9 reports that \\"Windows has found a problem with this file: DVM_IPCam2.ocx\\". Neither the suggestions in User Manual 4.1.3 nor the ones on the Foscam.us site would help. Using Chrome can do most/all functions for Administrator but not all functions of Visitor or Operator.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, but mobile app is weak
review_body: The camera itself lives up to my expectations. However, it was difficult to set up unless you are quite computer literate and understand communication/network terminology. Once done, it's simple to use. the Foscam mobile app is useless, so I downloaded a free app, CamViewer that works fairly well. I had the camera on for a weekend trip recently, and it worked well except for a few false alarms. I'm still playing with the sensitivity setting to eliminate them, but it appears to be sensitive to light changes even with the \\"light sensitivity\\" box checked in the alarm settings. Alert messages are sent to my phone via email very quickly. In fact, when we got home, I received an alert (from my motion opening the door) before I was fully in the house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Fun and easy to use but difficult to install.
review_body:
Great product, but if you can't afford to hire an I/T or D/P expert, or aren't prepared to spend about a hundred hours online with an educated helper, don't even think of trying to hook one up for remote use via the internet. It can be done, and I did it, but even with the experience I now have, I still don't really know how it works, OR HOW TO DO IT. Bottom line, fine for home-network use, but rediculous for internet use.

Oh, and good service, and reasonable price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: OK IP Camera, Sound is Poor
review_body:
Purchased (2) FI8910W. One with new (11.37.2.47) firmware and one with an older version (11.37.2.46)

Firmware 11.37.2.47 works like it should, previous versions have the problems others describe with the wireless setup etc. You can't download the new (.47) from the website as of 12/8/12. It's coming 'soon' from some other posts I found. I suggest you wait until you can get the new firmware (11.37.2.47) from the website before you buy this camera just in case you get one with an older version like I did.

Just about everything else the other posts have said is true. Sound quality is poor, tech support non-existent and software interface kind of clumsy. No exposure auto-gain, no zoom and you can indeed see the network activity light through the white case BUT a surprisingly good picture via Wireless-N on a variety of devices, even the night vision picture is pretty good.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Despite reading many of the reviews here saying the installation is a pain, I find the camera a great buy if one is looking for an inexpensive wireless security camera for everyday use. I need one just to make sure my front door or the package left at my front door is safe.    The feature I was looking for: wireless connection, can be viewed via internet (no need to set up a server at home).    I highly recommend this product to any one who is looking for the same features as I do. This is not a fancy product, but it gets the job done.    BTW, the installation is a little bit tricky, but it took me less than an hour to get everything done. Follow the brochure just for the hardware installation, ignore the rest. Then go to their internet support page ---- [...] ----for all the necessary information.    This is not a fake review. It's lame that I have to mention this, but one of the 1-star review mentioned that there are a lot of fake 5-star reviews on amazon and I feel strongly that I have to do this nice product some justice.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very satisfied, affordable, easy to set up
review_body: Got the camera today, set it up in 15 minutes, instructions are clear and easy to follow even though they're not written in the best english. I was able to connect via Internet Explorer and Firefox. IE, through Active X, gives the possibility to use 2 way audio, which I haven't been able to use with firefox. I also connected with my android phone, using a free app. the IR nightvision works well. overall great quality. there is an android app that should work with 2 way audio, but I haven't tried it yet. Might post an update if I get to try it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Sarah gave me excellent technical support. She got my camera up and rung, enabled it wirelessly, and got it on the web. Thank you Sarah, and thank you Foscam!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was having problems connecting wirelessly and I contacted customer support and got Harry Foster. He was great. He set up my camera in about 5 minutes.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I've been looking for a camera to monitor my backyard and this one works great. It's an indoor camera but in southern California it should be okay under the eves. Very easy to setup and install. Instructions are fantastic and lead you through the steps to open a port for access from anywhere on the web. I have a strong security firewall (ESET) and Verizon Fios router and it went very smoothly (compared to that Dlink camera which I never could get to work). The wireless reception is strong and I can operate the camera from my Samsung Nexus Android phone. I love the ability to pan, I wish it had some ability for optical zoom - I'd be willing to pay more for that. The image resolution is pretty good, but I wish it were better so that I could digitally zoom in on the bird house or a license plate. Best thing of all is that the motion detection sensitivity works very good (blowing leaves do not set it off) and it emails the snapshots to my Gmail account nicely. Setup for all of this did take about two hours because it is complicated to make all of this work. If you are not computer savvy, you might want some help, but the instruction manual is very detailed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great price, inexpensive.
Requires a little technical knowledge, or one of your kids help, to set up.
The black has a nice rubberized finish to it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A great camera once you figure out how to get it all working
review_body:
I am now running 4 of these in my home. I wanted to jump in and write a review about all the discussion around this camera.

First, yes, there are some fake reviews in here - its pretty obvious. Shame on them and shame on Amazon for allowing it. HOWEVER.....

I got my first camera and it had a learning curve for installation. Getting the camera to work is the easy part, remote viewing from your iPhone when not connected to your home network is another story..... BUT ITS ACTUALLY EASY ONCE YOU FIGURE IT OUT.

I am dangerously tech savvy - but far from a pro, and now I could set up one of these cameras in 5 min.

I will say, Focam recently did some set-up videos on their website that are really quite good. If you follow that, you will be set-up in no time.

Everytime I see these cameras go on sale, I want to get another.... but for now 4 is enough.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I've had a couple of these wifi IP cams and this one has been the best so far. You can't beat it for price vs features. Picture is great, color very good, pan/tilt works fine, night vision is good, and the two-way audio really does work. FYI, the two way is not full duplex (i.e. you can't hear while your talking, like on a phone) and there is a delay. Not perfect, but does the job. I tried hooking up a small external speaker, one of those mini, rechargable ones made for a tablet, got a lot of feed back/static, so gave that up (minus 1 star).
You need to have some computer savy to set an IP camera up, it doesn't matter what brand you buy. If you don't know what an \\"IP\\" address is, or have trouble navigating router settings, you're going to need help.
Also should mention this works great using an Iphone/Ipad app. There are several that work, Webcam pro works for me on the Ipad and was easy to setup.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I called Foscam with an internet problem (windows Explorer). I was not able to connect to my camera. SANDRA with Foscam Tech Support solved my problem by taking over control of my computer.  The service she rendered was fast, accurate, and very satisfying to me. I highly recommend Foscam as a provider of quality products and also quality customer tech support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera iffy and Foscam sucks and doesn't honor warantees
review_body: Bought 2 of these in August. both worked until Dec. Now one doesn't go into IR mode and moves on it's own. The box says 2 year warantee but Foscam said one year and it's up to the reseller to honor. Knowing that wasn't true I still contacted reseller who confirmed it's Foscam's problem. After 2 more days of runaround I finally gave up. STAY AWAY FROM THIS SUCKASS CHINESE COMPANY.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Technical support. Very knowledgeable and helpful
review_body:
When using Clear Wire as my ISP. I was not able to access the camera remotely.
Contacted Ralph from Foscam and was able to trouble shoot the issue. Very satisfy.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Understand What your buying, and know you need to understand Networks.
review_body:
I am getting tired of all these reviewers bashing these foscam cameras. the prodcut works, and if you know nothing about the industry and cant tell the difference between analog cctv camera setups vs IP based setups dont bother buying this product.

I have installed approximately 100 fi8918's fi8905's, and these over the last year w/ minimal effort and issues. I do however understand static IP addressing, port forwarding, and other IP necessities to set these up. I also know the next closest camera in price range with this featureset is ~$400.

And the complaints about the built in web server. Again i have used linksys/cisco cameras, dinks, and vivotek (high end ip cameras) and the built in monitoring software all suck. If you are planning on using this as a security setup and viewing from a computer BUY BLUE IRIS software. I have this running security for several commercial security applications (and my customers love it). and for android and iphone us IP cam viewer (from robert chou) the best out there.

and if all of this makes no sense to you, hire someone to do the install for you. It takes a qualified profession about 4 minutes to configure each camera for your network...seriously, 4 minutes.

if you dont understand the technology needed to make this work, DONT BUY and if you do buy, DONT CRITICIZE the product (since you dont understand it)

Lastly, a baby monitor...seriously. buy a summer infant baby video monitor..its your baby's safety. I am an IT professional and would never dream of using any of these IP based systems as a dedicated baby monitor (you really need high quality audio for a baby monitor and alerts if the reciever loses connection from the remote device, IP cams offer none of that..)

Thanks for listening

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
DOA :( Wouldn't do anything until I tried replacing the power supply. Works fine with a 5V power supply I had on hand though. I may change this review after contacting the manufacturer; if they'll replace the power supply without having me ship the whole unit back.

I have one of their earlier cameras (FI8918W). That power supply also died after about a year.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased the FI8910W, FI8918W cameras from Amazon.com. The FI9820W purchase was from foscam.us

I have installed FI8910W, FI8918W cameras and now the FI9820W. I read the reviews here about poor low-light operations, they are somewhat misleading. This camera produces very DARK, minimal CONTRAST images in all but the BRIGHTEST light. You must turn on the IR capabilities to get a decent image in what I would call normal light. The 8910/8918 are both superior in this regard. The 8918 wins for good color representation.

Other disappointments (functions available in the 8910/18 but NOT the 9820)
* No ability to disable/change UserIDs
* No e-mail on \\"reboot\\" or external IP address change (they do provide 3-years of free DDNS, but that is not a feature I care to use)

On-going disappointment:
* As with all of the Foscam cameras I have used: NO SSL support for the connection to the camera

Related: tinyCam Monitor in the android market is an excellent viewer for all of my Foscam cameras (I have no relationship to tinyCam, just a customer/user)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I couldn't connect my FosCam  using WAN settings but received courteous and educational assistance from Ralph. The camera is great for the price with plenty of options. Goodbye Brinks lol

review_body:
The help at foxcam by Judy was excelent.

Thanks

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Camera Connection (wireless and remote connection). Ralph was great at helping me out with my product questions. I was having trouble connecting wirelessly. He confirmed that the products were working before getting off the phone. The wait times were okay and it was worth the wait because he was thorough. Thus far, I recommend this product.

As for those of you talking about fake reviews: It's unlikely that they're fake, but they do walk you to Amazon and coach you through what comment on your review about. :)

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Calvin Harris was awesome at helping to resolve my port forwarding issues quickly. I am a busy Mom and need all of the assistance I can get with our \\"nanny cam.\\" Thanks again Calvin!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a great security camera. Easy to set up. No need for customer service calls. The video is great, the audio is great and the movement of the camera is quiet during operation. Other cameras when you pan and tilt you can hear the gears move, but with the foscam FI8910w you do not hear anything. So this is an advantage is you are checking in on your house. You do see the red IR leds but that can not be help. It is the technology of the IR leds.
Great remote operation, I use it on the iphone and it works flawlessly. You do need to buy the foscam app from the app store but it is worth it. I was able to check on my house when I was 8,000 miles away on vacation and I can tell you it was cool and comforting to check in.
You will need to know how to port forward your ports with you broadband provider which is easy enough for an average computer user. Also some free advice, if you are a verizon DSL user IT IS FREE TO PORT FORWARD YOUR PORTS. Verizon DSL tried to charge me 50 dollars a month to have my ports forwarded. They are ripoffs. They use a third party customer service to maintain their dsl routers. Just google any issues you may have and you will get your answers for FREE.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent camera, using as baby monitor
review_body:
I spent a while trying to find a wireless ip camera to use as a baby monitor; the foscam 8910W seemed to have all the features I was looking for and tons of great reviews. They don't lie! This thing is great.
We have 2 iphones and an ipad, we use foscam pro to access the cameras from those devices (universal app). It gives full control of the pan and tilt and other settings on with the camera. It also transmits audio and allows you to talk through the camera; it doesn't have a great speaker, but our 2 year old seems to understand us well enough when talking through it. The app cost a few bucks (more than what I spend on most apps) but I knew how much a video baby monitoring system cost and we were still way under the cost of that route. As a side note, the app is a resource hog and will drain your battery. It will run in the background transmitting audio if you have it enabled. This really hasn't been an issue for me, it bugs my wife but she lets the app run forever.
The setup can be a little frustrating. Some things that help, assign it a static IP address so that if the router resets, it won't assign a different ip. We use port 8090 instead of 80; it seems to improve the reliability of our internet and its safer if you decide to set up port forwarding. I haven't gone through that step yet, but will get to it at some point. Follow the directions and it should go well. Be sure to give at least a minute (60 sec) if you are trying to have it list available networks.
The infrared is excellent, very clear in our baby's room. The glow of the red lights around the camera do not seem to bother her or prevent her from falling asleep. It is 10 times better than any baby monitoring system my friends use. As soon as I show them the clarity of the picture, they want to know exactly where to buy cause their sold. Happy monitoring!


I set up the port forwarding a week ago through my router - much easier than I expected it to be. On the port forwarding page on your router setup, you need to enter the port that it will be incoming on and type in the static ip address you have assigned to the camera. I used a random password generator to maximize the security of the password and changed it prior to setting up the port forwarding (hopefully this will increase the security). This now allows me to check in during nap time to see whats going on and we can move the camera to the main floor while away so we can check in on the house.
Really loving this camera, no it is not HD, but for our needs its great. I have now told several people about this camera who have purchased one for themselves including a friend whose wife just had a baby, a brother who has a one year old, and my parents who occasionally watch that one year old. All of them have had a similar positive experience.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great Camera to keep an eye on the house
review_body:
I had been looking around for a while and looking at various IP cameras and when this was on sale during a lightning deal, i decided to give it a shot.

Glad i did.

I deducted one star because set up is a little involved if you want it to run seamlessly but if you know how to route ports and work on router settings, it will run very smoothly. There are a few reviews on here that will help you with how to do all that, as well as a simple search on the Foscam site will also guide you through setup.

I am able to view this camera pretty much anywhere I have an internet connection including anywhere I have a good signal on my Android phone using an IP Camera app.

On a good connection, the camera is very responsive and can be controlled remotely to look around the room. It does work best if mounted upside down and up high if you are wanting to view an entire room. The night vision with IR lights works great at night and in dark rooms.

In the more advanced set up, you can set it so it will email you a series of pictures if movement is detected.

I do plan on purchasing at least one more for another part of the house when the price drops again and I am also looking at installing another Foscam branded camera outside to keep an eye on the front door.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this mainly as a baby(small child monitor). For the 69 dollar price i paid it is the best baby monitor i could ever imagine. Very easy to set up although the viewing away from home setup seems somewhat intimidating. But in its current setup the picture is clear even in the dark and while i think pc  viewing is somewhat clunky on ios devices its amazing. It can be viewed fullscreen on ipods, ipads, and phones and it works great on my wifes galaxy 3 as well. It even allows us to talk to our daughter thru our devices although with about a 1 to 2 sec delay which is totally acceptable. If you need a camera for your home for monitoring purposes there is no need to look for another ip camera.

review_body: I have one of these in the house behind a window and the other in my barn.  The IR doesn't work behind a window (of course) but the camera has good range and works well in the barn.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this product as a means to monitor our children's play-area from my iPad when having adult dinner gatherings. The product works perfectly and does exactly wh

Installation was incredibly fast and easy (less than 30 minutes), and everything functions exceptionally well. Getting the sound to work was somewhat tricky, but after downloading and installing VLC, the audio worked just fine. (I have not tried the 2-way audio). I've worked with setting up networks in the past, so I do have some background in networking. But I found the step-by-step instructions very straightforward and easy to understand.

The IR is fantastic. Turned it on when my kids were playing in the play-area in the dark, and I could see them clear as ever.

I'm actually considering purchasing a second camera to install outside for security.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Buggy security risk. Not a good product.
review_body:
I bought this product because it had the best reviews. Sadly, it also had a lot of bad reviews I should have heeded.

Out of the box, everything seemed to work pretty well, except the wifi did not get a valid DHCP lease. Wired, it got a lease, no problem, so I just set up the wireless with a static IP address. (BTW, I am using SonicWall pro appliances and Cisco, *not linksys, WAPs)
---Strike 1: no DHCP on wireless

OK - time to set it up and check night vision. OOPS! Guess what - these models suffer from sticky IR cut filters; just do a web search and you'll see what I mean. The \\"fix\\" is to either power cycle the unit a few times or to flash a light at the sensor repeatedly until the filter solenoid un-sticks. Great... So basically I need to post a sign:

\\"Hello potential burglar, this bouse is monitored by a security camera, but it's a bit crummy- could you please flash a flashlight 20 or so times at the light sensor until the solenoid clicks so we can make sure we are in night vision mode and can get a good picture of your face? Thanks, we really appreciate it.\\"

---Strike 2: night vision doesn't work reliably

Finally: Security. Oohhhh boy... This camera is not adequately securable. On an android phone (maybe other browsers, as well), connect to the camera, hit \\"cancel\\" twice, and voila! you can now see information about the camera such as mac address, camera name, etc. Why would I EVER want to broadcast to the world any of this information???
---Strike 3: Oops! out of strikes, guess it's going back to Amazon.

The ONLY reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the other features do work reasonably well. So yeah, if you can live with an unsecured camera with buggy wireless and a sticky IR cut filter, go for it, you'll be otherwise happy with it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Best wireless camera in market for less than $100
review_body:
Most of the bad reviews i read were for camera setup and I didn't want to base my purchase based on setup. So I plunged on purchase of this camera. Its been a month i had this camera, I can say the initial setup for "in-home" use took less than 10 min.

The second part is setting up for "remote use", this part took me one hour to setup. Most of the time was spend on creating a Remote host and configuring the "port forwarding" of the camera in wireless router. There are several videos in youtube,(to configure the foscam camera, creating a remote host and port forwarding) so watch videos before you proceed with remote installation.

I believe for less than $100, this camera has more pros than cons. I am buying 2 more camera's to monitor my kid.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Installation instructions are very poor. Search youtube for better examples.

Wireless function did not work on my Camera. Make sure it works as soon as you get the Camera. You only have 14 days to return or file a claim.

I took 2 weeks of trying to get it set-up before hiring Geek Squad for help. Wireless card did not work and I can not return Camera now.

A to Z claim is denied since past 14 day mark. Seller is non responsive and Foscam will not take return or repair without seller iniating RMA process. No support from Amazon to resolve issue with seller or Foscam.

Good luck.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased this item after an incident where a party was thrown at my home, without my knowledge. I have average networking knowledge and it took me about 2 hours to setup this unit where I was able to view the images over my iphone and ipad. The directions seemed straighforward but it did not fully help me through the process. There was some great help on the foscam blogs and also on youtube I found a few videos that were a big help, especially the one with the Asian fellow. He gave great step by step instructions. There was a lot of trial and error involved as well.

All in all the product is great for what i need it for, security and piece of mind. Being able to view and move the camera over my iphone and ipad is amazing! I haven't used the sound feature yet as its an additional cost over the iphone app. I was able to set up the motion sensor and get emails of the images when something trips the sensor but have yet to figure out how to get video emailed to me.

I haven't called foscam customer service yet so I can't comment on that but I loved the product so much I just purchased another one! Installing should be easier as I would think I can just copy most of the information to the new foscam. Wish me luck!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pain to set up. No customer support
review_body:
I purchased this camera after reading a number of reviews, both positive and negative. Decided to give it a shot.
Setup was easy for the wired connection part of the setup but could not get it to work wirelesslesy. Tried foscam's website forum, googled extensively, used tips from other reviews on amazon. Could not get it to connect wirelessly.
There is no customer support. The instructions in the manual say to contact the seller first ! This is absurd.
When i called amazon, the representative was shocked to hear this.
Amazon should not sell such a product where the manufacturer explicity says not to contact them !
Returned product !

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I bought this to keep an eye on my two new kittens while I am away from home.
It was very easy to install on our home network; my son had it up and running in less than an hour.
Getting the remote access wireless to work was another story.
My son gave up and gave the task to my husband.
My husband finally succeeded after much research.
Apparently we have a Verizon router with some firewall issue...
If you use Verizon, I recommend you Google \\"Foscam Verizon router setup\\".
Picture quality is very good; night infrared vision is impressive; price of unit is great.
Recommended if you know a nerd who can set up the remote wireless for you.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works like a charm. If they updated the login screen so it made more sense it would be perfect. It is confusing having two login buttons. I get why, but there has to be a better layout to explain it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I used this during the day while my dog is out.  It works great and simple to use.  Highly recommend it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: There are a number of bugs related to Foscam. For example, it will continually reset the timestamp on the video camera system to 1970 and you can't change it back. Schedule doesn't work and the camera just isn't there. Very disappointed with this product line. I would not recommend this for anyone looking for a wireless camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The wireless setup was a bit difficult. The instructions in the product reviews on Amazon were helpful and got me through it in minutes.  The camera does have two way audio but if you have a Mac you will not be able to run the audio through your internet browser.  The camera's movements are quiet even when you are standing close to it. I tried a D-Link 942L but the wireless range did not compare to this Foscam.  I was able to connect wirelessly through three walls to my courtyard and the connection was steady. For the money, this is a great camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I am currently using it for the nursery for our first baby.

As soon as I pulled it out of the box I was impressed with the overall look. Assembly was very quick (30sec. tops). Now for those who do not have any computer experience it might be a little difficult to setup the port fowarding but its SOOOOO worth it. It took me an hour for the install and wireless set up. The port fowarding took a littel bit of research but I youtube'ed it and got it working very quickly. Now my father-in-law and mother in Oklahoma, and sister in Cali can see him all day if they would like. The online part is awesome! The admin can set up visitor accounts so that way you can restrict their capabilities, you can change the way you view the video, adjust sound and voice, and many many more things. The camera is very quiet when moving, my wife was right next to it holding the baby and she had no idea that I pointed it at her. The IR is amazing, we can see the picture perfectlly and I also love how it automatically swaps from regular to IR when the light reduces past a certain point in the room.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Same as the $50 cameras for twice the price
review_body: Ok, so this camera actually deserves a 5-star rating for operation, but I just couldn't rate it that high because the $50 WANSVIEW camera I purchased after buying two of these works just as well and for half the price. So, other than price this thing is pretty much perfect and does exactly what it's advertised to do. One small advantage it has over the $50 unit is that the audio is quite a bit better, so if you're planning to use that feature a lot it might be worth springing for the FOSCAM, otherwise, I'd go with the WANSVIEW for half as much.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pretty good camera for the price, built in web software junk
review_body: The camera itself works pretty well, but the web based software is junk.  It has very few configuration options in the web interface and the access options are limited.  It works, but I would suggest other options for viewing the camera.  Foscam's iPhone and iPad applications are FAR better than the built in web server's capabilities.  I'd also recommend using DVR software like the free \\"iSpy\\" to do recording with.  Overall, pretty happy with the camera's quality and performance.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have been using at home and at the office, so far it works great, could not be happier with the purchase. using as security camera's at the office and a baby/security monitor at home

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The Camera worked as described.  Really like the IR Cut and night viewing.  Had some issues with viewing on a windows 7 machine, but could have been the computer.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Works as expected. Can't comment on long-term reliability, but it was quick and easy to get working. I didn't use any of the provided software. I followed the recommendation of another reviewer that said to plug it in, the find the IP address as reported by your DHCP server, and then connect to the camera in the browser and configure it from there. Very simple once you are in via the browser.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great performance at a great price
review_body:
After checking the boxed video monitoring solutions at Babies R' Us and not wanting to pay $300+ for limited functionality, I decided to go the ip cam route. From unboxing to full installation and Internet availability of the feed, it took approximately 30 minutes. The level of technical skill required is moderate, but if you are at all comfortable with port forwarding and DDNS, you will have no problem here. If you are not familiar with either of those areas, spend an hour researching them online and you will probably be able to muddle through fairly well.

The video quality is excellent and I was pleasantly surprised by the night vision using the infrared LEDs. Probably a bit of overkill for a nursery monitor but the price is so much better than boxed solutions. Foscam also offers an iOS app that fully supports two way audio as well, which is nice for calming a fussy baby. Overall, a great product!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: We purchased this camera to use as a video monitor for our toddler (and have used as a security camera for the house when we travel).  It is easy to use and control from a computer, but we have found several other apps for our smart phones that work just as well at 3am.  The only issue we did have was getting it set up.  The disc that came with the product was cracked and damaged and did not work.  Easy enough to resolve as they have the software available online.  The view itself is great and love the night vision view as well.  My only complaint is that we will probably have to mount it to get the best view of the tot bc it does not move low enough from the spot we have it sitting currently... not a camera issue, but a small room with lots of furniture issue.  Over all, it is a great camera and has many uses!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Only for the sophisticated programer or network tech
review_body:
Having just spent my entire Saturday learning more than I wanted to know about remote dns servers, I have finally managed to get two Foscam FI8910W cameras minimally functional. I still can't view on handheld despite downloading both Foscam's software ($4.99) and an independent viewer product (another $4.99)
I think the hardware here is going to be just great; right now they are humming away in a dark room and show really clear infra-red images. But it took a huge amount of time and had I known that I likely would've hired someone to do this.
I think the packaging and promotion could be much clearer that this is a product only for the sophisticated power user. If it were not for a helpful youtube production I never would've been able to get as far as I did.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Can't beat what you get for the price
review_body: Received the product a couple of days ago, arrived just as described with all listed accessories included.  Set up did take some time, especially the configuration to access the camera outside of my home network.  Being able to view the camera while still within my home network was pretty easy to set up, just takes some basic understanding of how a home network works and also how to modify settings on your wireless router.  Camera is suprisingly sharp compared to what I expected and the night vision with the IR on is very good.  I was able to see everything in a 30x30 room off of my house without a single light on.  I purchased this camera for the purpose of keeping an eye on our new puppy while she is home alone for short periods of time, but think I may be purchasing a couple more to add to the network to allow me to keep an eye on the house when nobody is home.  The mounting bracket allows easy placement and I've actually retrofit mine with magnets so that I can stick it to any metal drywall corner in the house without drilling any holes.  The remote access works well too, although you have to be patient with the pan/tilt controls as there is a lag.  I was able to use a free ip cam viewer app for my android phone to remotely view the camera and have no trouble connecting to it.  All in all, a really nice camera for the price you pay.  Sure you can pay more for a higher quality unit, but for a basic setup that lets you keep an eye on your home this sure provides peace of mind.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Excellent product.suggest watching you tube video \\"How to Setup & Configure Foscam FI8910W Wireless IP Camera\\".HERE'S THE LINK:
[...]

The video helped tremendously and I was up and running within an hour.There is a Part 2 & 3 video for setting up DNS. WARNING!! If you do not understand Computer Terminology ,then I suggest you get someone who does to install it for you.Otherwise, the camera is a bargain for under a hundred dollars. I can view my house anytime of the day or night and hear whats going on also from anywhere in the world. I can also 2-way talk which is really cool.The nightvision is very clear and bright.I also like the motion activation. When I first set the camera up,it was emailing me every 2 minutes with pictures of my cats wondering around.So needless to say,I had to adjust the degree of camera angle to \\"not\\" point to close to the floor. I can also view my house and control the camera on my smartphone. Download the app \\"foscam lite\\" to do this. YUP,, 5 stars for this camera...indeed!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera works fine if you are using a PC with IE.  If you are using a Mac, several of the features do not work.  You cannot set up multiple cameras with a Mac.  You cannot use the audio feature with a Mac.  There may be more but that is what I have found so far.  When you look at the website it looks like they have all of the set up tools for Macs but when you try to use it, the firmware will not enable these features unless you are using a PC with Internet Explorer.  Foscam should be updating their firmware for Mac compatibility or be honest about the features available for Mac users.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good camera but challenging to set up

Spent a lot of hours trying to figure it out and finally had to have someone from the help desk set it up for me.  Once I was able to reach someone (which took some effort, make sure to call early in the day), Judy, the woman who helped me was able to set it up for me quickly.  She was polite and easy to work with.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Look elsewhere if you want a wireless webcam
review_body:
We purchased this camera to keep an eye on our pets while at work. The setup on the camera while wired to our home router was a breeze. It worked perfectly. Once you unhook the camera from the network cable and try to set it up remotely, that's when all the problems begin. The wireless feature on the camera is a joke... I was tempted to ask the dear boyfriend to drill holes into the floor so we could just hard wire the damn thing to the ceiling in our downstairs bedroom, but that was way too much work for a stupid webcam.

My home network includes MAC address filtering so I included the MAC address on the NIC and the wireless MAC address(sticker on the bottom of the camera). It had problems connecting just about everyday so I decided to just remove all the security measures on my router except a password. I thought that would resolve the issue but I have concluded since that it's not my router. I have to unplug the camera just about everyday and have it reconnect to my unsecure(in my eyes) network to get it to work. If I forget to reset the camera, it will be just for show. Maybe I'll be lucky and someone will come by and steal it.

I would not recommend this camera to anyone else unless you want to waste a whole day trying to configure something that just won't cooperate.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to install, great price, I own FOUR now.
review_body:
I have owned several IP cameras. Linksys, and more recently Panasonic. I wanted another camera for some outdoor monitoring, but the Panasonic had gone up to $299. I was a little skeptical about a camera that only cost $88 but what the heck. Well, it is a great little camera. It pans and tilts further than the Panasonic, it has the IR night vision feature that the Panasonic does NOT have, and it was a breeze to install. Basically, I installed it just fine without installing any software on my PC. If you know how to determine the IP address that your router assigns, then that's all you need. Plug it into your router (cable included) then find it's IP address. Put that IP into your browser, and up pops the user interface. The only thing you need is the default user and password which they give you in the quick-start guide. After that you can configure it for wireless, disconnect it, reboot, and it comes up on your wireless net. If that fails, just plug it back in and correct whatever mistake you may have made in the wireless setup. Simple, cheap, feature packed. What more can you ask?

UPDATE: Due to my good experience with this camera, I just bought another one (same model) at an even better price. It dropped to $79, so I had to buy it. The new one came with updated and better firmware and UI. It was equally easy to install and set up for multi-camera mode so I can monitor and control both cameras from one browser tab. My only issue was it kept rebooting. I discovered it was due to the DDNS settings. I think it was trying to contact a DDNS server, my firewall blocked it, and so the camera would reboot and try again. It was annoying, but I just set the DDNS to No-IP and now the problem is gone. I love the IR night vision feature which has good range.

UPDATE2: I just bought my third camera. I discovered that the price changes and varies from $99 to $79. I just drop one in my \\"Save For Later\\" area and wait until I see the price drop. The third camera installed in under 5 minutes. No software installed on my PC, just plug camera into the router, find the IP address that the router assigns it, HTTP to that address, and set it up. It's the easiest, best price, and most features of any IP camera I've owned. I will buy a fourth soon.

UPDATE3: I bought my fourth camera. I waited until the price dropped to $69.99 and now I have a network of 4 cameras outside on each side of my house. It was equally easy to install without any software, and came with the latest firmware and UI. I have owned multiple IP cameras by Linksys, Panasonic, etc. Nothing has the features of the FosCam at this price. I may buy more in the future.ce drop. The third camera installed in under 5 minutes. No software installed on my PC, just plug camera into the router, find the IP address that the router assigns it, HTTP to that address, and set it up. It's the easiest, best price, and most features of any IP camera I've owned. I will buy a fourth soon.

UPDATE3: I bought my fourth camera. I waited until the price dropped to $69.99 and now I have a network of 4 cameras outside on each side of my house. It was equally easy to install without any software, and came with the latest firmware and UI. I have owned multiple IP cameras by Linksys, Panasonic, etc. Nothing has the features of the FosCam at this price. I may buy more in the future.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: great camera for live remote viewing
review_body:
i was looking for a networked video camera system to put in my bar, but i didn't want to go through the hassle of setting up a dvr and hardwiring in cameras all over the place. i also didn't want to spend a bunch of money in the process. i had been eyeing this foscam camera for a few weeks, and when it popped up in the gold box for $70, i jumped on it. simply put, it's the best decision i could have made!

setup was a bit involved (i took a similar path as reviewer \\"r. tickle\\" and manually set up the camera on the router, and purchased a dyndns.org account to use in conjunction with my bar modem's dynamic ip address to gain access over the web) but i had the camera up and running in less than an hour. taking r. tickle's advice, i installed the android app \\"ip cam viewer\\" and it is great for interacting with the foscam.

now for the camera itself. first off, i have to say i was blown away with the quality of the video over the network. the framerate is slower than i had hoped over the internet (about 3-5 fps), but this is a function of the low up speed at the source. when connected on the same local network, this issue goes away. the pan and tilt speed is not the fastest, but it can be adjusted inside the web interface. i have the camera mounted high in a central location, and i can view the entire bar very well and identify faces of individuals as far as 40 feet away.

(paragraph added as update 10/21/13) after pushing a firmware update into the camera, i have also set the motion detection to email me stills from the live feed if it sees anyone moving around in the bar after hours. this is great, because it removes the need to hook the camera up to a dvr or to buy software that will record video, and i still get hard evidence if someone breaks in overnight!

i haven't tried the ir-cut, because it's never dark enough inside the bar to need it. the audio on the foscam is weak, but i don't use it anyway. but for all the things i do need this camera for, it performs exceptionally well. i'm considering buying another one to set up as a baby monitor in the nursery. i would suggest anyone looking into basic surveillance options start with this inexpensive, yet very versatile foscam camera.do need this camera for, it performs exceptionally well. i'm considering buying another one to set up as a baby monitor in the nursery. i would suggest anyone looking into basic surveillance options start with this inexpensive, yet very versatile foscam camera.

review_headline: Camera works fine, web software intuitive
review_body:
Camera works as described, using mine as a wi-fi camera at home while away. Using this with Google Chrome browser, connects and works fine. Haven't tried this on Internet Exploder, I avoid it like the plague.

Two annoyances which is why it's only 4/5 stars: to get sound from the camera, I had to download third-party software (using VLC) for this. To get a firmware upgrade for the camera (which was available when I bought the camera, but not on the camera), I had to provide an email address and agree to have the manufacturer (Foscam) send me marketing emails as well. Not very impressed with that part. But the upgrade is an improvement over the the pre-installed firmware.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very nice camera but one drawback
review_body:
I bought this camera to replace my old DLink 930L which was being used to view out to my front porch remotely. This camera is superior to the D-Link (which currently still sells for $70 on Amazon) in almost every way. The picture quality is great, has a good lens viewing width, the ability to remotely control pan/tilt is a big plus, the \\"night vision\\" works well, the motion capture alarming works well, & the wireless connectivity is solid and fast.

The biggest negative for this camera is that the cameras webserver does not support HTTPS/SSL. When accessing this camera from inside your network or the internet, your credentials will be passed in clear text. Also being that this camera connects to my home network wirelessly, someone sniffing my wireless traffic locally could get the credentials while I'm logging in as well. There is the ability to change the default port/tcp80 that the webserver listens on. With all the features that this camera includes, no SSL is very surprising...the Dlink 930L did have this. Hopefully a future firmware update will address this issue.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I am definitely not an expert on the computer, but usually manage to get things installed with few problems. I had no problems with the initial set up with ethernet able and then with moving on to wireless. However when it came to setting it up for remote online viewing I spent many, many hours without success. I did the router configuration , port forwarding and all the rest of that good stuff, and by the end of it I felt completely inadequate. I was never able to get around the port 80 blocking and forwarding, so I just decided to do the other forwarding....ie return it for a refund. I did enjoy the other functions of the camera but to me it was useless not being able to have access by connecting to it online via another computer when I am away from home, which is basically why I bought it.

I think that Foscam has to make some improvements to their software and make it more of a plug and play device similar to other products on the market. Had I to do it over again, I would gladly pay another $50 and get a plug & play camera to start off with, rather than going through all this hassle.
So if you are not a computer whizz, I would not recommend this camera.
