DO NOT BUY FOSCAM. There customer service is the worst I have seen in years. They never answer the phone! They sell the blue iris recording softwear but it doesn't work and when I called to report it they just ignored me. Lastly, you can't really monitor the cameras on your iPhone.

One of the worst purchases I have ever made.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Ordered the Foscam and absolutely loved it but had problems connecting remotely. I called Foscam's customer support and the problem was resolved quickly by Calvin Harris. I ordered this camera because of all the great reviews and after having my issue resolved will consider buying more!

Just received my second camera. As I am technically challenged I had to call Foscam again because I was unable to connect the camera remotely. Once again their customer service was excellent. My call was answered immediately by Sandra Williams and she was able to get my camera remotely connected in no time.

The technicians did ask if I was satisfied with their service and I was - very happy. No waiting and quick resolution - heck yes I was! They did ask that I mention them in my review and I certainly do not have a problem doing so.

Love the camera and along with my experience with their techinical support would recommend the cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Keeping this brief. After using 2 of these cameras on my home network for the past 4 months, I have grown to hate them. The image is good and the sound works well in both directions.  However, every couple of weeks they just drop all connectivity to the network (wireless) and I have to do a factory reset and then figure out all over again how to get them to play nicely over wifi.  Foscam support says to give the cameras a static ip. I have done this and the problem persists.  The firmware for networking is just terrible and having to use the clunky software to get it on wifi every couple weeks is the end of the line for me.  I'll be looking for something else.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Got a deal on Amazon, wish I had bought more at the low price. This camera works very well. Color reproduction is pretty accurate and the night vision works well too. The pan and tilt is smooth and quiet when using the audio feature. The speaker could be louder but can plug in a remote speaker to increase the volume. Be aware that you will need a static IP address if you want to view over the Internet. Was super easy to setup, took all of 5 minutes to have working in my local LAN. A bit more work to see on Internet but worth the trouble. I plan to by more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Originally purchased one of these cameras which I use at home.  It operated for one week but then went out.  I thought it was the camera.  It wasn't.  It was my internet server.  Anyway, I ordered a replacement, it arrived and I ended up keeping both cameras.  The remote works like a charm which is what I need when away from home, the infrared gives me the ability to see the rooms at night in the dark and overall, the price is terrific for what you get.  I would highly recommend it.  I believe the key is to find the free application for nanny cams that would work best with this unit, at no additional fee.  Again, I would highly recommend it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Third cameras a charm hopefully as baby camera!!!
review_body:
We bought this camera for use as an alternative baby camera monitor for use with our Ipods and Ipads and Pcs so we could monitor the baby from everywhere. The camera itself is a great concept, its easy to install the basics for this purpose and get it up and running. Wi-Fi is a piece of cake to setup and the assembly is just plugging in and screwing he antenna in and mounting where desired.

The infrared aspect of this camera is crucial because babies need dark rooms to sleep in and \\"night vision\\" of other cameras always leaves a lot to be desired. One tip is that you must have a very dark room with no bright spots for this to activate the IR lamps and so black outs on windows is a must. The image is very clear though once activated. Very happy with this aspect.

The controls on this are a snap to use and very responsive and you can aim it anywhere and invert the image and controls etc incase you have it mounted upside down on the ceiling like we do.

For actual monitoring we use Live Cam Pro from the iTunes app store on the Ipods and Ipads and the camera has instructions for a web based utility for use on Pc's. Live Cam Pro is a great App to use.

So you ask, having said all that, why 2 stars **. Well there have been some problems with the cameras. We are actually on our third replacement camera. They are a great concept with great features but they are still very buggy even the latest version as of this review and customer service is a bit of a bear. Here's some of the problems we have had with them.

The audio is not great, there is a constant feedback humming which occurs on all devices, Ipods, Ipads and Pcs. We spoke to Foscam about this and replaced the camera but the new one had the exact same problem and actually so does this third camera so I am not sure what they are achieving by having me get the camera replaced. So the audio is not usable unfortunately especially when your trying to hear smallsubtle noises from a dozing baby. Don't even consider the talk back feature as it results in an unstoppable squelch.

The bigger problem was that the cameras were constantly rebooting themselves like there was a power outage. I put them on different circuits and even connected it to a UPS battery backup to ensure it wasn't a power glitch here and it wasn't. Half the time after reboots, it would have a new IP address which required reconfiguring the apps on a daily basis (sometimes in the middle of the night when baby is crying). This requires you turning your pc on in the middle of the night to use the camera app to find the new IP address of the camera. The other problem was that I would have to pan the camera etc to reposition back to where it was watching the baby before and this woke up the baby. Sometimes on a reboot the camera would become stuck in the up position clicking trying to to go more up and I would have to enter the nursery to power cycle it to stop this and the clicking also wakes the baby.

The biggest problem though was customer service. There answer was always return the camera. Now after 60 days from the initial purchase, you have to pay for shipping every time which has to be traceable like UPS and hence about $12. So your paying $12 a pop for this. Secondly I had to buy a replacement camera before returning the original camera so that I had a camera at all times and the replacement camera was more expensive. Now you would think Foscam would refund the cost of the replacement camera, but no they refunded $11 less than the cost of the original camera resulting on me being another $23 out so I am $35 total out for every replacement. Add that into your purchase price!!! Subsequent to the replacements which still had the same problems, I did my own research and found some solutions myself which if Foscam had bothered to tell me would have saved them the replacement and me $35 a pop. (audio still no good unfortunately and I have the latest rehash of the camera)

So here I am with camera #3 hoping third times a charm but for much more than the original purchase price. If I wasn't already invested in this camera (ITunes apps purchase etc) I would wish to have gone with a different camera or at least a different company.

Good luck.

Update 12/9/12:

Well third time is not a charm. After a month of \\"ok\\" use it has started resetting itself constantly like all the rest of the cameras. This means I have to keep switching on my laptop to use the IP tool to see what the new IP address is of the camera before I can use it on the iPad and iPod. A real pain at bedtime. I don't feel like wasting more money returning this for an obviously defective product line. Very dissappointed. Given my experiences with these cameras and the unscrupulous customer service, I would be very wary of the good reviews this has received as possibly self written etc.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Perfect baby monitor, visible from work, abroad etc and from most devices including i-anything, android, PCs etc.
I strongly recommend the product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It's a tricky install but a very promising product from what I've seen so far! I had a hard time figuring out port-forwarding for Apple Time Capsule with the current Airport Utility 6.x but called Foscam's Customer Service and Judy Rose did a fantastic job of getting it set-up quickly for me!

Especially nice so far is the super-easy sync with the Foscam iPad app.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I purchased three of these camera's at a great price on Amazon. I had mediocre expectations based on the price, but after using them for several weeks I could not be happier. I use them on my iPhone to monitor the house when we are away, and one is setup in the baby's room as a monitor. We just login to the web interface and leave it running for great video and audio quality while the baby is sleeping. The IR is outstanding, and turns a completely dark room into a room that is well illuminated on video, with only the dim red glow of the LED's which is barely noticeable.

I downloaded free software, Camera Viewer Pro, which will run in the background of my computer and records video (constantly or motion detected) to the hard drive. I have it set to record for 5 days and then overwrite old footage, so I can always review what is happening at the house later.

I could not be happier with the camera's and intend to order several more. Based on my experience, I will likely also purchase a couple of Foscam's outdoor camera's.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pretty good wireless camera, at least for now.
review_body:
10/27/12

To sum it up, this wireless camera is pretty clear/smooth and comes with plenty of features. The hardware is a breeze to setup but adjusting the wireless network/port forwarding and such is somewhat difficult if you do not know what port forwarding is. There are step by step video guides on foscam's main website to help ease the software setup. One problem I had was trying to view the camera through Internet Explorer. There was a problem with ActiveX not being able to download, but had that fixed from googling for troubleshoot guides online. This may not be the case for you but it can happen. Overall, I am happy with the camera for now.. So here is a list of what the camera provides, from what I can remember.

Features:
-Theres an android app to view your camera from anywhere
-Pan/tilt from a click of your mouse (view distance is almost 360)
-Record function(Voice is recordable but the mic is not that great. Based on using the cameras program, you need to leave your computer on and you can only record when you view the camera through Internet Explorer. For some reason Internet Explorer have a few more options to mess with than running the camera through Chrome/Firefox/etc)
-IR bright enough
-Motion detector (Theres a Email function to send you photos/videos when triggered - You can also set the amount of secs the camera will record once the motion detector is triggered. There is also another function where the camera will save the video to a specific location in your computer once the motion detector is triggered)
-Horizontal/Vertical patrol (You are able to set how long the camera will pan left/right and tilt up/down throughout the whole time camera is active)
-Flip/Mirror
-Brightness/Contrast
-Able to set multiple users to view camera
-Audio (not that great though, there is an in/output on the back of the camera where you can place a better mic/speaker I am assuming, have not tried itthough)
-Speaker (You can speak in to your computer's mic and hear it on the camera. Only works when you run the camera program through Internet Explorer)
-Third party programs to run the camera (I have not tried this but you may have to pay for some of them after a trial, the programs are listed on their main website)

I am going to purchase another and add on to this another review if any problems come up.

Good luck with your purchases!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I am new to the iPhone and a friend's comments about how he could monitor his house from his phone initiated my interest about this product. I was nervous at first given some the reviewer comments about how difficult this can be to set up. While I consider myself quite good with computers, I quickly develop a thousand yard stare when people start getting too far in to networks or router settings. Despite the misgivings I ordered this model and it arrived in good order. It took me about 15 minutes to be able to view it on my computer (within my own network). Viewing it remotely on the Internet and my phone took about another 45 minutes. Most of that time was wasted on trying to remember how to get back in to my router settings. Once I got in to the settings, everything else was pretty much a breeze (despite having a less than desirable dynamic IP). The two way audio didn't work right initially. I could monitor the audio in the room but nobody could hear me on the other end. This issue sort of just fixed itself after restarting my phone and rebooting the camera.

No, I'm not a Foscam employee giving a fake 5 star review, as one previous reviewer claimed all five star raters were. The video quality is a bit fuzzier than I expected, there's no zoom function, and the internal speaker for the two way audio stinks because the volume is so low. If there is anyone talking in the room or a television is on, don't expect them to be able to hear you. Despite that I'm still willing to give it a 5 star rating because it's a heck of a lot of \\"bang for the buck.\\" If I wanted something that was perfect I'd probably have had to spend a lot more money so I can't complain. My recommendations for set up are to simply follow the instructions line by line. That's what I did and outside of the audio problem at the beginning, it worked fine. I definitely recommend this if you've got some decent computer proficiency. If you've never opened your router settings before or don't understand IP settings, I can easily see someone spending hours banging their head against the wall trying to get it to work. Best get a friend to help you out.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have the model one step higher than this...I do not think that amazon sells it. Excellent customer/tech support. I had some challenges installing the camera, but they helped me set it up and finalize the installation in a few minutes after remotely logging into my computer. You do have to wait on hold for quite a while until you are connected to a person however.  The image quality for the camera is great and I can recommend this camera for anyone who is interested in monitoring what is going on inside the house while you are away. It would also make for an outstanding baby monitor.  I love how you can pan left and right and up and down...it can cover a very wide area.  However, it does not always \\"connect\\" the first time when trying to view it from your computer...you get a connection \\"failed\\" notification.  It can take multiple attempts to log-in to view the camera at times which can be very frustrating.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: There is no getting around it, the tech support provided by Foscam is unsurpassed by any company.  I have three cameras and called with multiple questions/problems on two of them.  Julian Parks patiently spent several minutes on-line addressing each and every one of them until everything was fixed.  How could anyone ask for better than that.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got this to monitor my koi pond because a bird was eating my fish.  Works great and I suggest installing the Vitamin D software as it records your video and tells you when things moved in the camera's viewing range.  Get product.  Easy to set up, although I did have trouble installing the wireless part.  After an hour, all it took was for me to close and reopen the camera software on my computer.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
It used to be great. Quiet operations, not the cheap noisy movement like some other brands. Night vision is very good.... until recently. I didn't use it for about 2 to 3 months. When I plug it back, the screen becomes unclear. it's like a white mask or piece of very thin paper across it. I think the lens coating or lens sensor becomes bad

I emailed the manufacturer, see if they are willing to help..

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The Foscam FI8910W has both good points and bad. The quality of the color and the night-time performace meet expectations. The pan and tilt work reasonably well. However, because the lens has a very wide field of view there is noticable barrel distortion in the images.

The biggest disappointment is that the bi-directional audio is absolutely useless.

The best part of the system, however, is that it comes with an ActiveX code module that allows me to write my own code for the camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I used the Quick Installation Guide and software installation CD that came with the camera and installation videos on You Tube. I found that between the two I was able to have a painless installation. The F19910W is quite bulky and I purchased the Black one which seem to be very well made and sturdy (and weighty) in construction. This is not a web cam that you will easily hide and you need to think along the lines of disguising it's profile somehow.

The cameras performance is very good and pans and tilts to the software commands very well.You can also listen to sound in it's vicinity and it has a small speaker in which you can speak through, although the level of sound is quite low.I downloaded and installed IP Cam Viewer Pro by Robert Chou both on my Ipad and also on my Android Nook. This is the icing on the cake as the software enables you to control the Web Cam very well and i highly recommend it.

The price has gone up $10 since I purchased the web cam which is rather annoying as I was considering purchasing another but will wait until they are on sale.Overall a good purchase and allows us the ability to view our home when we are away and also to get email alarms if we arm the motion sensing. There is also the ability to take a snapshot and record video too. Just bear in mind this is a web cam and not a professional high quality surveillance camera. For value for money it is pretty good but it would seem they are pushing up the price.

Unfortunately mine had or developed a sound problem where the sound was distorted and weak. A call to Amazon and the item was replaced. All is well with the replacement camera though it's software was not the same as that which comes with the \\"white model\\" hoping that Foscam has released the software update for the camera's UI as they said it would be available in Jan 2013. I have yet to check as yet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Received camera 2 weeks ago, setup and installed software.  I was able to login to the camera no problem.  The web interface seemed to work well and seemed simple to use but I could not see any video from the camera. I tried the troubleshooting tips from the Foscam forum and other places.  The camera came defective.  I returned, will probably buy something else.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
When we were trying to pick a baby monitor with video, we found this exact model camera for $159.99, until we did our research. After price-checking, I went home with this camera for $75, and free shipping. It's the best bang for the buck. It took a while to set up, since I had to call tech support over the missing Mac version of the setup manual, and incompatibility with the VLC plugin. The camera can be seen directly IN VLC, however. Be sure to write down your home IP address, and the port you're using.
The support line was very quick, almost no time before I was talking to a human being (albeit with a pronounced indian accent).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: When I recieved the Foscam FI8910W I was excited to have found an IP camera with all these features and for such a great price. The software for the camera works great and it has all the features I needed. The only problem is the IR-CUT (the camera's ability to switch between night and day mode) is flawed. There seems to be some mechanical piece in there that changes around when things go dark to allow the camera to see in IR. My camera worked fine for about a week then stopped responding to the light in the room, permanently staying in \\"day\\" mode. I could manually switch it if I went into the software but that was about it. I went online in hopes of solving my own problem but found many people were having the same issue. It would appear this is a factory defect and not some sort of user error. I contacted Foscam's tech support and got the usual power cycle talk but that didn't fix anything. I really wish this camera fully functioned as it is a great cam except for this one flaw. If you play on keeping it in an always lit or always dark room it should work for you!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I got this camera as a video baby monitor. It's very easy to set-up, took about 5 minutes following the included instructions. The default web interface is easy to use, though some of the menu options are not well-explained, but easy to figure out.

For night vision, keeping an eye on our sleeping baby, it works great. We use the IP Cam Viewer app and it gives us easy access to all the controls. The red network status light and the green power adapter light are not too bright, neither are the infrared emitters around the lens, so it doesn't bother the baby. The movements of the camera are nearly noiseless, which was something I was worrying about since our baby is very sensitive to sound.

Overall, very happy with the value and performance of this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Pleased with this cool camera. F8910W
review_body: I've had other cameras, both analog and IP for years. What sets this apart is ease of deployment. Once the setup is done, it's a breeze to unplug from the wall and carry to anywhere in the facility where you are in range of Wi-fi. Plug it back in and you are good to go. I like being able to set on a shelf or use the standard screw mount on the base. You can also mount upside down. I view using Chrome browser, IP Cam Viewer app on Android with pan/tilt controls, and via the free version of WebcamXP with recording. I'm surprised that there isn't an official Android app, but there are plenty of third party solutions. I didn't use any of the included software so I can't speak to it's quality. The hardware seems great so far. Pan and tilt are silent by the way. Only sound is a single soft click when the cam enters IR mode.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The big problems for me as as follows:

1) It does not support wireles n routers unless you are able (and willing) to run your router at a lower (b or g) setting. Consequently, for me, it is not a wireless camera.
2) The security mode is garbage. It does not allow you to choose to email video. It doesn't even allow you to select the frequency of or the number of photos it takes. In testing it, I found that you often miss what you really want to see. In my case, I allow people from a doggie day care place to access my apartment to drop my dog off and I want to make sure I know what they are up to. Unless I am logged in and actively watching, this camera won't do that for me.

I thought long and hard about how many stars to give this camera. I would have given it 2 stars if it supported wireless n routers as advertised. But since it doesn't, and because of the many reports of fake reviews and other shady business practices, I've decided to give it 1 star. I will most likely return the camera and try something else from a more reputable manufacturer.

This camera is basically just a baby monitor... with bad software.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Got this via an Amazon Deal of the Day. I'm a bit of a techy, so set up wasn't too hard, particularly following R. Tickle's instructions (note the correction about plugging the camera into your ROUTER during the first steps, not your computer). Also, I spent about 10 minutes trying to figure out why the camera wouldn't take my router's IP address in the Gateway/DNS fields. Finally realized it needs your router's local network address (one that usually starts with 192.x.x.x.) not your router's internet IP address.

Other than that the camera works as advertised. I've accessed it via a web browser and my Android phone using the previously mentioned IP Cam Viewer app by Robert Chou. With that I can remotely control the camera and hear audio as well as speak through the camera. Infrared works well, and makes the image appear like it's in daylight.

All and all, better than I expected.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: After reading other had to write one...
review_body: Ok so I have this model foscam and have been using it for about 2 months. I read all of these peoples complaints on here and these are my thoughts. First let me say for -100. dollars you cant go wrong with this camera. As far as people stating that foscam has no support, im sure they dont because they are nothing more than some chinese teenagers making really cheap cameras and selling them on the internet. Dont expect support. Also people complain they are to hard to set up. This is true if you have no knowledge of routers, ip addresses, or port forwarding. Some people write these reviews using the correct terminology but they still dont have a clue what they are doing. I see them saying that the wifi doesnt work on them. Thats because they were to stupid to find the button in the gui to turn it on. One guy said you have to get a subscription to a dns service. You dont. he doesnt know what he is doing either. You could call your isp and get static ip's for less than 20 a month or just deal with it when your ip changes. If you have at&t uverse it never does unless a tech changes equipment. Finally I will wrap this up by saying that you dont check into a motel 6 and expect a mini bar with 5 star room service. If you want a 5 hundred dollar camera, than go buy one. If you want a -100. dollar camera that does almost all the same stuff as the 5 hundred dollar camera than buy this one.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The good
you can access your cam online, once installed it is very easy to use, the program that comes with it great, night vision is great too, can add multiple camaras without problem, customer service is nice, you have two way voice to talk to the people by using the camara, there are several free apps to acess your camara on i phone or android device.
the bad

picture quality is bad but good enough just to monitor, two way voice is good but has lot of back ground noise.
you need some level of technical understanding to install it, esp when you want to access it over the internet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This was a hesitant purchase after reading reviews about being difficult to set-up. I have some computer literacy but am not an expert or an IT person. I set this camera up through my wireless router in less than an hour. And that includes creating a No-IP account since my IP address is not static. Maybe I was just lucky but set-up/installation was zero hassle.

As for the camera, it is definitely a good value. My only real complaint is alarm/recording sensitivty. The camera is aimed at a door from a distance of maybe 10 feet. It starts recording about the time people are passing through the door, not when they first trigger motion. I tried to adjust this through alarm sensitivty but that only creates more \\"false\\" alarms and does not start recording any sooner after motion is detected.

Overall, a good product and value.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I was disappointed with this camera.  The hardware is not bad and appears to be reasonably well made.  The device is relatively large and difficult to conceal because of the silver bezel around the lens and the IR illuminator.  The software is the real problem.  The software is primarily written for Internet Exlporer and does not work well with Chrome or other browsers.  For remote access you need to set up port forwarding and run software that will convert your dynamic Internet address into a static address. If you want to record, you need to have a FTP server available.  What a pain! The Foscam F18910W camera requires a really difficult software setup, and even after it is setup you can never be 100% certain that you will be able access it remotely.  If you are only interested in real time viewing and local access, the Foscam may be good a choice.  I was interested in a concealable camera with remote access and both real time and recorded viewing.  Accordingly, I returned the Foscam and ordered a Dropcam which I really like.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is my first IP cam purchase and I have to say I'm more than satisfied. I initially had a problem setting it up but after carefully reading the instructions from a reviewer on here I was able to set it up the camera for wireless operation. The email setup was slightly harder. A quick google search and I was able to find some info from the foscam user community. If you have comcast and the outlook email program then you can get emails directly to your phone if you choose to activate the motion detection. It is an awesome feature! When it detects something moving it will take pictures in intervals of zero through whatever seconds you want it to and send them to your phone. I can now say that I have a sense of security and no longer have to worry when I'm just going to run a few errands during the day. Thank you Amazon and Foscam.

P.S. I would also like to add that if you wanted to view it outside of your wireless network that you would need to set up a ddns account. no-ip.com(you will need to update your firmware/webui) or dlinkddns.com are the best options since they're free. The only other thing to do is make your camera's ip a static one that's is outside the range of your DHCP server then forward the ports to that camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Bought this camera as a backup baby monitor and it's fab!  Piece of cake setup, lots of cool options, solid construction, great night vision, and works with many iOS (iPhone and iPad apps).  The Foscam Pro app ($5.99 in the Apple App Store) is probably the best app and worth the 6 bucks for its simplicity and seamless setup with the camera.  It allows 2-way audio (half duplex, meaning it works like a walkie-talkie -- press a button in the app to transmit, then release the button to hear regular audio.  Microphone on the camera is super sensitive and great for monitoring the baby from any room in the house.  Allowing outside access through a home firewall might be tricky for the some users, but with phone support (which I've read is good but haven't used myself) and a little practice it should be pretty easy (we configured it through an Apple Airport Extreme in about 10 minutes).

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera is what I was looking for. For the price you can't beat it. The pan/tilt  is cool and would be nicer with zoom. The night vision really impressed me it lights up everything in total darkness at a great distance. Set up wasn't to difficult, I got everything working through my computer and Android HTC EVO 4G LTE phone which is pretty cool.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Issue: Port Forwarding.
Ricky/Foscam Support provided invaluable assistance setting up my new Foscam F18910W. He provided the same, or better, level of support as Apple, which I consider the gold Standard of Technical Support. I will be purchasing another Foscam Camera knowing knowledgeable Support is a phone call away.

Secondly, the camera itself is bulky and the quality isn't that great. I should have spent the extra $80 and gotten a DropCam immediately- which is what I will do now.

I called the Foscam support and Ralph  Mendez of their technical support team provided great assistance. It took about 15 min on call with him but now the product works well wirelessly. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This is a first class product with outstanding tech support.  Written instruction are missing some important information such as the Share Key is the password to your router.  I had to call their support to find that out, however they answered immediately and gave me the answer.  When I asked for help setting up iPhone & iPad access, they very politely asked if another tech could call me back in less than 1 hour.  Call back was less than 5 minutes later.  If you want iPad access to the camera you will have to let them remote access your computer.  Steve Jobs could not do it on his own.  It took about 20 minutes with remote access to link my ipad and phone, plus a $6 optional app download to make it work.  It was worth the effort and a 5 star effort by Foscam. I am buying more which is the best recommendation I can give.  I  run 16 Panasonic IP cameras that are very good, but I like this Foscam 3 times better because it cost 3 times less than the Panasonics and is actually more flexable.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is NOT a wireless cam!! It may say it is but it's not!! I got home at 7:20 pm and started setting the camera it is 1AM and it will still not connect wirelessly ! I got all the rest to work. I got a No-Ip domain that works, i added the cam to MAC,did port forwarding and still nothing. plug to the router,connect do all the bullcrap, wait 10 seconds, disconnect, wait 1 minute turn cam on and it will not connect. My router still says it is connected as ethernet!
It is a hassle that you dont want to go through. It has software issues if using windows 7, on a Mac you will need plug-ins to get audio. So much extra work to do for something that should have been simple.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I have this camera in a small condo on top of my frig (it seems like a weird spot but its perfect for my space) I use the Android apps on my tablet and PC and have 5 programed views. 1 is my Front Door from the inside. 2 is my Dining Room 3. is my kitchen 4. is my Living Room and 5 Looks at my Wine rack atop my frig. This camera works great. Two-way Audio, Pan, Tilt, Zoom. I can even hook it into a larger audio system using the headphone port to \\"bitch\\" at my roommate while I am 10 miles away on campus or at the cigar shop. It's a great way to keep a constant eye on things. I love it. I am trying to get my condo to put them everywhere on the property where any Condo owner can PTZ control the camera to check on the pool, the mailbox, the dumpster, and entryway. Quality Construction. I previously had a Logitech Alert Master Alarm System with a couple cameras but I took them back and replaced both of those fixed angle cameras for this and I get even more coverage. My only con on this is the picture quality is Standard Definition, I knew this before I switch and I am fine with it but it is a major difference to go from High Definition cameras to SD. This probably helps me be able to quickly view and control the camera on the slowest internet connections while out and about. Buy It!! You should really enjoy it!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: cool gadget that put a smile on my girlfriends face
review_body:
I'm happy with my purchase. Caught a good lightning deal on it yesterday. Wired setup wasn't that difficult using advice from other reviewers. Didn't even use the cd. Have not tried wireless yet so can't report on that although I hear alot of people having problems with it. Still didn't deter me from buying. Using IP Cam viewer on android phone
to view remotely. Had to do a couple force stops but still not a concern for me. Will investigate to find cause. All in all I don't think there is anything out there that has this many features for the buck. Another plus was learning some basic networking so I don't fear it anymore. Very few and simple changes to router and camera to make it reliable i.e static lan ip, take lan ip out of pool, have camera email you new wan if it changes. Infrared shuts off when lights come on. Remote control from phone. May step up to the paid app which adds audio down the road. Cool toy for me to tinker with and learn.

Update 1: Just be forewarned that the audio is distorted and pretty much unusable. Still not a show stopper for me but figured I'd pass this on for someone using it as a baby monitor. I had the same issue on a $125 cisco/linksys ip camera i tried a year or 2 ago. Heard it could be several causes which i'll investigate but even if it doesn't work i'll still keep it. Heard i may not have this issue using the android app but you have to pay for that feature. Report back if I discover a fix.

Update 2:Thanks for the heads up on the audio. I just discovered the same thing this morning - \\"enable and disable the mic like a walkie talkie\\". Think it's probably software related. Maybe why they sell the blue iris software as an accessory. See if I can find some reports about if using the blue iris software eliminates the problem. You saved me some time by testing with external mics and speakers. Thank You. Have not tried the audio on my phone yet as it would require me to pay for the app - IP Cam viewer by Robert Chou. Please report back if you come up with a solution and I'll do the same.

Posted the above comment to another reviewer who delved deeper. Appears all is not lost for the audio. May take this into the discussion section. I tested this morning from my pc at work. The camera is right next to my pc at home so I think that is why i have more issues at home with feedback.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: After reading all the positive reviews, I went ahead and ordered this camera. It took about 30-45 minutes to setup and configure the camera to be able to work on the WAN. The iphone app is great too! It has so many great features such as auto email on motion detection, color and auto switch to infrared, built in speaker and mic, pan and tilt. For the price I don't think you can find a better product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: A pretty good IP camera for the price
review_body:
I bought one of these cameras, set it up in my den, and later bought three more to provide coverage for other areas in my house. Is it a great camera in terms of resolution and frame rate? Not really. But is it a great camera in terms of its price? Absolutely. You won't find better \\"bang for the buck\\" at this price point.

First the good:
(1) It is very inexpensive; you'll be hard-pressed to find so many features at this price in other low-end cameras.
(2) Construction quality is very good; the camera seems sturdy and well-built.
(3) WiFi range is excellent - I am having no problems getting a good image anywhere in my house.
(4) PTZ gives you almost 360 degrees of view if you rotate from one extreme to the other.
(5) The built-in infrared diodes are bright enough to easily illuminate an entire room for nighttime viewing.
(6) You get a nice screw-in mount and a convenient retractable Ethernet cable bundled with the camera.

Now the not-so-good:
(1) The camera lens has significant \\"fish eye\\" distortion.
(2) With a 640 x 480 pixel resolution, you're not going to be getting a good picture of an intruder's face unless he gets fairly near the camera in good lighting conditions. If you need a higher-resolution image, you're going to have to spend more money on a better camera.
(3) The effective frame rate is not that high - maybe 3 to 5 fps if you're watching an image from outside your home network.
(4) The audio quality from the built-in speaker and microphone is adequate, but not very impressive. You can hear what's going on through the camera, and be understood at the other end, but it's like talking through a long stovepipe. On the other hand, it is more than adequate for a baby monitor.
(5) It is a pain to set up unless you know what you're doing.

Fortunately, at least for Mac users, it's not that hard to configure it once you know the trick. Here is what to do, assuming you have a Mac laptop and a wireless home router with at least one free Ethernet port:

(1) Copy over FOSCAM's \\"IP Camera Tool\\" app onto your Mac. You can either copy it from the bundled CD, or download it from the FOSCAM site.

(2) Now open System Preferences on your Mac, and click on the Network icon. When the network window opens, click on the Wi-Fi tab (if it's not already selected) and click the \\"Advanced\\" button in the lower right hand corner of the window.

(3) In the new window that appears, click the \\"TCP/IP\\" tab. Write down the Subnet Mask and Router IP addresses, and then close System Preferences window.

(4) Now here's the tricky part: you have to decide which IP address on your router you want to reserve for the camera. For example, if your Router IP address is 10.0.1.1, you'll want to change the last number to use as your camera IP address, e.g. 10.0.1.61 or 10.0.1.100 for the camera. However, you don't want to re-use an existing address that the router has already allocated. You have two choices: either log in to your router and check which addresses are being currently allocated, or just pick a number between 2 and 255 at random, e.g. 10.0.1.61, and see if it works. Obviously these numbers may be different depending on the router. For example, if your Router IP address is 192.68.2.1, then you can try 192.68.2.61 or 196.68.2.100 for the camera.

(5) Turn off your Mac's Wi-Fi connection. Plug the camera into your Mac's Ethernet port using the supplied cable, but don't connect the camera's AC adapter yet.

(6) Start the IP Camera Tool app. An empty window will open on your desktop. Now turn on the camera by plugging in its AC adapter. After about 20 seconds, the camera will begin to rotate through its start-up sequence. At that point, you'll get several socket error warnings from the IP Camera Tool. Click through these errors, and you'll finally get back to the IPCamera Tool window, which will show an Anonymous device (this is the camera) with an incorrect subnet error message, asking you to double-click to fix it.

(7) When you double-click the message in the window, a small window will open. For the IP address, fill in the address you've chosen for your camera. For the Subnet Mask, use the same number you wrote down earlier. For Gateway and DNS Server, fill in the Router IP address you wrote down earlier.

(8) Leave the password field blank, with user \\"admin\\". Click OK.

(9) The camera will restart. After it has restarted, you'll start getting socket error warnings again. Ignore them, unplug the camera, and quit the IP Camera Tool app.

(10) Now use the Ethernet cable to plug the camera into an unused Ethernet port on your router. Plug in the AC adapter and wait for the camera to restart.

(11) Turn on your laptop's WiFi again. Open the Safari browser and type in the IP address you chose for the camera, e.g. the http prefix followed by 10.0.1.61.

(12) If you did everything right, you'll be able to log in to the camera's built-in web server and configure it using the Device Management tab. Specifically, you can scan for a wireless network list under \\"Wireless LAN Settings\\", select your own home network, enter the password, and click the box labeled \\"Using Wireless LAN\\". Click Submit and the camera will restart again.

(13) Now unplug the camera from the router. Again, use your Safari browser to access the IP address of the camera (you may have to close and re-open the Safari window). If your wireless connection is working, you'll be able to log in to the camera again, and make any other configuration changes that you want.

If you want to use your camera outside of your home network, you'll need to learn about port forwarding. I won't go into that, because it is dependent on the router, but for my cameras I use port 80 for the internal port of each camera, and ports 8101 through 8104 for my external ports, respectively. It works fine, and I can watch my home over my iPhone without any difficulty.

As a final note, I strongly recommend that you buy the Foscam Pro app for your iPhone / iPad. The same app will work for both (you only need to buy it once), and it will give you complete control over the camera, including access to the audio features.Camera Tool window, which will show an Anonymous device (this is the camera) with an incorrect subnet error message, asking you to double-click to fix it.

(7) When you double-click the message in the window, a small window will open. For the IP address, fill in the address you've chosen for your camera. For the Subnet Mask, use the same number you wrote down earlier. For Gateway and DNS Server, fill in the Router IP address you wrote down earlier.

(8) Leave the password field blank, with user \\"admin\\". Click OK.

(9) The camera will restart. After it has restarted, you'll start getting socket error warnings again. Ignore them, unplug the camera, and quit the IP Camera Tool app.

(10) Now use the Ethernet cable to plug the camera into an unused Ethernet port on your router. Plug in the AC adapter and wait for the camera to restart.

(11) Turn on your laptop's WiFi again. Open the Safari browser and type in the IP address you chose for the camera, e.g. the http prefix followed by 10.0.1.61.

(12) If you did everything right, you'll be able to log in to the camera's built-in web server and configure it using the Device Management tab. Specifically, you can scan for a wireless network list under \\"Wireless LAN Settings\\", select your own home network, enter the password, and click the box labeled \\"Using Wireless LAN\\". Click Submit and the camera will restart again.

(13) Now unplug the camera from the router. Again, use your Safari browser to access the IP address of the camera (you may have to close and re-open the Safari window). If your wireless connection is working, you'll be able to log in to the camera again, and make any other configuration changes that you want.

If you want to use your camera outside of your home network, you'll need to learn about port forwarding. I won't go into that, because it is dependent on the router, but for my cameras I use port 80 for the internal port of each camera, and ports 8101 through 8104 for my external ports, respectively. It works fine, and I can watch my home over my iPhone without any difficulty.

As a final note, I strongly recommend that you buy the Foscam Pro app for your iPhone / iPad. The same app will work for both (you only need to buy it once), and it will give you complete control over the camera, including access to the audio features.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Could not be more satisfied about this product. I view my house from my iPad or anywhere on the internet. Setup is SOoooo Easy! If you are still sitting on the fence thinking of which camera to buy, then you need to jump into the Foscam side!

I bought 3 of these! 1 in the front, 1 in the back and 1 in the living room. I can literally monitor my whole house. And because you do not need a DVR, I have these cameras sending me emails when motion is detected. This is even compatible with my Diskstation NAS. you can FTP pictures to anywhere and give anyone access to view or even remote control the camera.

I drilled holes into the attic and bought 50 foot extention cords, since it's the best and cheapest solution, to connect all the cameras to the attic power outlet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The Foscam FI8910W does a good job of simple monitoring. Not for critical applications, but for monitoring a grandmother or baby - it's great! I am using two of these cameras right now.

Setup

Not easy to set the camera up to the WiFi and get all the settings right. Honestly I don't think ANY WiFi camera would be easy given all that you ask it, but don't think it will be easy for the novice. I wanted to access the camera from the open internet so needed to fix it's IP address and do some Port Mapping with my router - don't know what that means? Not the fault of the camera, it's just complicated and the software of the camera doesn't help. Once it is set up, it seems stable.

Ease of Use

The camera has a built in web interface. Really bad and simplistic. I think another reviewer said it was made in 1989. Probably right ;) HOWEVER, I access it with an iPad app (Foscan Pro: Two Way Audio and Recording) and it is great! Has motion sensing, control, audio, etc. The app is not great, but better than the other ones I have tried. That plus the camera and I've got a system that we use 24/7 with two or more cameras. Sort of (read about stability).

Stability

One reason I don't think the Foscam is for professional monitoring is that it gets lost every-so-often. It acts like it goes through a reset and a boot up. So if you are in the room and watching or listening to the motion sensing, then you will catch it and re-aim it. If not, you come back and the camera is staring at the ceiling.

I have one camera that takes it one step further and crashes. It crashes about once a day - no response at all and I need to go and unplug and replug it in to get it back to normal. The warrantee claims two years and I am going to send it back for a replacement - but when you go to the Foscam website they offer no support if you didn't buy it from them - correction, the Foscam website was also built in 1989 and by folks that don't know about customer service, so maybe you can get help - I gave up.

Amazon has issues me an RMA so I will be a happy camper.

All-in-all I would buy again. I like the audio monitoring that comes free. MUCH better with the iPad/iPhone app.

review_body: I called Foscam to get help setting up my wifi connection. I was connected with Ralph Mendez and he was AMAZING he help me set up my wifi on my computer and my mobile device. I will be buying more items for this great company all service all the time.If you are looking for a great quality camera that is very user friendly i would highly recommend this company. THANKS Foscam!!!

review_body: I thought this camera would be easy to setup and use because of it's high rating, but was not what i experienced. This camera is difficult to setup unless you are an IT professional. Also, to be able to use it via the web, you need to sign up with a service to get a static IP address. This was not disclosed in the description and I think it should had been. You also have to buy an App to use it with your iPhone or iPad. The App is also not easy to use. I think the Izon Camera is much much easier to use and access with your iPhone with a free App that stores motion activated videos for free. Don't be filled by the high rating on this camera.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Spy on the baby?  Yes, please!
review_body:
I bought this specifically to use as a baby monitor, so if that's not your intention for it, you don't need to read further.

I spent a lot of time researching baby monitors when I started to come across wireless network cameras. Brilliant! The idea of being able to view from my computer/smartphone/iPad was appealing since one of these things is usually near. That means I don't have to carry around a video monitor unit that I have to worry about being charged or losing or whatever. Plus, it means my husband can spy on the baby from work, too :)

The Foscam seemed to have pretty good reviews overall, so we decided to give it a shot. The price far beats some of the top-rated video baby monitors and offers viewing flexibility that a technologically savvy family can appreciate.

Without further adieu, here's my quick break-down:

Pros:
- Love the ability to view baby from multiple devices. There are several options for apps on both IOS and Android for viewing on this camera.
- Infrared works GREAT. I can get clear views of my daughter from her nearly-pitch-black bedroom.
- Infrared lights are very dim and not too distracting (though I don't have experience with other infrared lights...just saying that they're not super-bright or an issue in a baby's room)
- Totally silent adjusting. Yes, this camera is all ninja when you're panning around the room. The only times it makes noises is when the infrared goes on/off, it makes a quiet clicking sound. Otherwise, it's quiet enough to give you the confidence that it will NOT wake a baby when you adjust it.
- Wireless feature allows for you to use without being hooked up to a computer--something a regular webcam cannot deliver in this situation.

Cons:
- Set up (as many have mentioned) can be a PAIN. If you are not familiar with tinkering with your router settings and all that, I'd say get help from someone who does. I consider myself to be intermediate with technology, and when following the instruction manual, I got frustrated. My husband finished the job quickly. Though, when we got a new internet service provider, he had a more difficult time when a new modem/router came into play and it took him quite a while longer to get that figured out.
- It's big and ugly. I can't lie, it's not the prettiest thing to have in your baby's room and certainly much bulkier and less aesthetically pleasing than a lot of baby video cameras...but you sacrifice beauty for functionality. You'll soon forget about that when you're giggling at your ridiculous baby's antics in clear view.
- I'm not sure why, but we have issues with it regularly resetting. (You know this because when it resets, it runs through a series of panning around and will finally stop at a pre-designated position which is always pointing away from the baby's crib). Sometimes this happens multiple times a day, sometimes we go days without it happening. I'm not sure if the camera is to blame or if it's my ISP/modem/router.e intermediate with technology, and when following the instruction manual, I got frustrated. My husband finished the job quickly. Though, when we got a new internet service provider, he had a more difficult time when a new modem/router came into play and it took him quite a while longer to get that figured out.
- It's big and ugly. I can't lie, it's not the prettiest thing to have in your baby's room and certainly much bulkier and less aesthetically pleasing than a lot of baby video cameras...but you sacrifice beauty for functionality. You'll soon forget about that when you're giggling at your ridiculous baby's antics in clear view.
- I'm not sure why, but we have issues with it regularly resetting. (You know this because when it resets, it runs through a series of panning around and will finally stop at a pre-designated position which is always pointing away from the baby's crib). Sometimes this happens multiple times a day, sometimes we go days without it happening. I'm not sure if the camera is to blame or if it's my ISP/modem/router.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera but buy from Foscam.us to simply the RMA process
review_body: Received the camera as a gift to use as a baby monitor.  Works great with a multitude of different IP software applications (video and sound).  Had an issue with the motor that controls left-to-right movement so had to get an RMA.  Missed vendor/distributor's warranty (vendor on Amazon) by a few days, so had to contact Foscam direct (via email or call via international number) to redeem manufacturer's warranty.  Found out that if gift giver had used Foscam.us' store front on Amazon, the manufacturer's warranty can be processed through them for replacements and greatly simplify the process.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Excellent Baby Monitor if U have iPad or iPhone!!!
review_body:
I bought this camera to use as a baby monitor. All the actual \\"video baby monitors\\" I thought were way overpriced and most had poor/mixed reviews. I have had this camera for a week now and I absolutely LOVE it as a baby monitor. It was a piece of cake to set up; only took me about about 15 minutes. I'm not a computer genius but I'm no dummy either. I installed the camera program (from the included disk) on my laptop and then downloaded an app to my iPad. (In the App Store I searched \\"foscam\\" and several baby monitor apps were available.) I put the camera right above the top of my son's crib. The camera captures the entire crib space and gives a nice, clear picture. The night vision is also perfectly clear. The color quality is good. When viewing on my iPad, I can see my 5 month old son's back rising and falling as he breathes (sleeps on his tummy).

I have not tried to do the remote/internet viewing but would like to try that soon. I'm afraid it will be difficult to do.

The only drawback is the power cord to the camera is too short (I just use a small extension cord). There is no zoom either, but you definitely don't need it if you are using it as a baby monitor. If you could spend $10 more and get one with zoom and maybe more megapixels then I would do it.

Fantastic camera for a baby monitor. I will recommend it to anyone looking for a \\"video baby monitor\\" for a fraction of the price. I was initially afraid to buy this because I thought it would be too difficult for me to figure out, but I am so happy I got it. It was so easy to set up and use.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Wow! I cannot believe I waited so long to order this. Simple setup and works perfectly... I have access to pan and tilt, view, and take snapshots from my Android!

It was also easy to setup auto emailing anytime motion is detected!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
