Great product so far, just need my extended antennas that were promised in the order.

Dan

FOSCAM continues to impress me, Felix Anderson did a super job setting up my static IP address and I will certainly purchase more of these cameras in the future!!

Dan 18APR13

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: IP Camera for your Computer/Android/Iphone devices
review_body:
Says what it does, does what it says. What more do I need to say. I never even opened the instructions, thats how easy it was. Most devices these days use similar credentials.

As long as port forwarding is already on your router, this is a breeze. Finding apps that automatically work fine with this was probably toughest part (for sharing w/ Android/Iphones). I have IP Cam Viewer for Android, and Baby Monitor for Iphones. I'd write down how to share, but its different from either app. From IP Cam Viewer you right click the app (FREE), click MORE, click Share, and enter the phone number. Youd need to give them your credentials as well.

I knocked a star off as i had to FIND apps it worked with, then its GUI is far from intuitive. I should knock off another star for their horrible, err non existing support, not that I needed it. Its the way it is these days, they knock out support, while keeping their price up. Not only that, but they justify it. Everyone cuts service out of the budget. You know what, rather than just talking about it, I knocked another star off and hope someone, or some businesses actually see this: stop justifying no service/support. Dont give me your \\"In Todays Economy\\" speel. Dont sell product if you cant support it.

Besides no fully functioning apps (all demos, missing controls/sounds or the likes), and a not so good resolution (640x480 @ 20fps), thats easily minus 2 stars. But if you can make compromises (read: $99), ease of setup (with limitations), then youve got a minus sign on your face, youve neither won nor lost; you didnt pay for the best and shouldve known better, on the other hand you saved a pretty penny.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Product arrived very quickly and was failrly easy to get set up.  I contacted the tech support for Foscam and talked with Sandra who did the final configurations on the wireless setup, remote access and sound.  Using this as a pet-cam to see what the dog actually does during the day and the cost of this is great.  Good product for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I thought I was buying something really good here. I am a little bit tech savvy but not a whole lot. Spent more than 5-6 hours on this camera set up, I think it is just a waste of time. My by a Ph.D computer scientist can get this working but then that person can make his own camera as well. This is not a camera for anbody who works in a non-IT industry. I am having serious issues connecting to the camera for outside the network; that was the whole reason that I bought it for. The instructions are very poor and do not elaborate on some of the biggest internet providers like Verizon, Comcast etc.

Just been a very frustrating weekend. If Foscam is listening, they should do somthing about the set up.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
After reading all the reviews, I was very skeptical about getting these. In fact I looked around for a few months before finally deciding to give these a try.

All of the people saying they work in IT and still can't figure these cameras out.. get a new job, or don't lie (I really do work in IT). I went the wired route, but I don't think I'd have any more trouble with the wireless.

To set these up, I do recommend knowing about router and port forwarding (if you plan on viewing these on the go.) To get the basics up.. just plug the camera into your router (or I used a switch.) The cd foscam package's with the camera comes with a tool that will detect the IP address of the camera. Or, like I did, went to my router to find it. Then simply type the address into your browser (I will warn IE often is finicky about typing in IP addresses, so try chrome if you have problems.) The camera has a built-in web-server, once you type in the address and install the active x plugin (for IE, but you can use other browsers) everything you need is there.

I bought two of these to use in the kids' room. They work perfectly for this. Night vision works well.

In regards to using this from outside your network.. the instructions come with a so-so guide on how to use port forwarding. Its really not all that difficult, my router has instructions on the port forwarding page as well. As for dynamic IP addresses, well for that you do need no-ip or some other service. However, I have cable internet.. and I can't tell you the last time my IP changed so for me it isn't an issue. But don't be too afraid of those services, there are reputable companies out there that have no relations with foscam and don't care to spy on your cameras.

Edit: For the people claiming the 5 star reviews are fake, I can assure you this one is not. Unless these cameras suddenly die, I am very happy with them. I think a lot of people get frustrated because they cannot set them up and unfairly rate this product down and assume all the good reviews are fake.

UPDATE: 1-29-13 Dropped rating from 5 star to 1 :(
I bought two more of these cameras a couple days ago because I loved the first two so much. Well the two new ones came with new firmware YAY! (NOT!). While the cameras still seem to work just fine, Foscam has included a new \\"feature\\". They have their own DDNS service built into the camera now. Which, this would be fine and dandy except its very difficult to disable. There is no option to do this ANYWHERE in the admin panel. The only way is to issue a cgi command via the browser (there is a post how to do this on the foscam forums.) However, if you don't disable this before connecting it to your network.. too late because foscam already has your ip and has the DDNS service set-up. You can change the port and then the myfoscam url won't be able to access it directly, but if someone wanted to try and guess your port, presto. Why? Because UPnP is turned on by default now, which forwards the port automatically.

I'm not feeding into the conspiracy theories about Foscam wanting to spy on you, rather, I think they made these changes to make things easier to set-up and manage. But for me, I knew how to set-up and use these so it creates an unnecessary security risk.

Foscam: MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO DISABLE THE DDNS SERVICE AND TO REMOVE MY IP FROM YOUR SERVICE AND I'LL CHANGE MY RATING BACK TO FIVE STARS.

Edit: 5-1-13 Back to 4 stars
Foscam has made it possible to disable their DDNS service. I decided not to change my review back to 5 stars because of the hassle this has caused. Plus, I think their DDNS service is still enabled by default, which I don't like.
All 4 cameras are still going strong.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I'll list the problems I've had with this camera and then go into the details:

1. Low image quality. Further than 25ft, faces can't be distinguished . Maybe a focus problem?
2. Software only allows recording with Windows Internet Explorer (viewing and controlling still work with other browsers)
3. IR LEDs are visible to the naked eye as glowing red. So this camera can't be hidden
4. No option to turn the IR LEDs and keep the IR filter off.
5. Software glitches, Admin password couldn't be changed and static IP address couldn't be used

In detail:
1. There is no auto focus on this camera, so maybe I have to manually screw the lens to focus on objects further than 25 feet. But if something comes closes then it will be out of focus again, so why bother. Or maybe the camera is low quality. It does state .3 mega pixels on the camera lens.

2. While you can't record without IE, you can set the camera to send 6 images to your email if it senses motion.

3. The IR LEDs work great!!! But they're visible and I'm trying to be sneaky and catch someone who keeps letting their dog shit on my yard at night. IR (infrared light) is suppose to be invisible to the naked eye.

4. The camera has a light sensor that turns the IR LEDs and disengages the IR filter. For your info, IR filters need to be removed for \\"night vision\\" to work. Cameras come with IR filters to block out IR light which ruin color photos and videos. In fact most cameras can be turned into night vision cameras by opening them up and removing the IR filter. If you turn the IR LEDs off, the camera thinks it's daylight and engages the IR filter, preventing from working at night. You can put tape over the LEDs, but I have my camera behind tint, and the IR LEDs still managed to \\"leak\\" and cause a reflection off the tint in recorded video (not to the naked eye though). So I had to take the camera apart and remove the LEDs and unplug the IR filter actuator.

5. When I change the Admin password, I can never log back into my camera. I talked to some people who had this problem and some that haven't. Random problem? I also can't assign a static ip address in my router for this camera. If I do, the camera never connects to my router.IR filter actuator.

5. When I change the Admin password, I can never log back into my camera. I talked to some people who had this problem and some that haven't. Random problem? I also can't assign a static ip address in my router for this camera. If I do, the camera never connects to my router.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Awesome Camera... more than just a toy
review_body:
So much drama about this product so let me set the records straight. If you need an IP cam with video streaming to Android and iproducts, this is your best non-professional product. And I am not a Foscam employee, although I am a former IT/electronics engineer (some 15 years ago).

It took me 30-40 minutes to set up the product through cable and wireless, including the no-ip.org hosting (which in contrary to what was said earlier, it is FREE). And that was done using Foscam guide.

The only problem I had was setting-up the Port Forwarding, and that was because of my own internal network, which includes Vonage modem prior to my Linksys router. And this issue was fixed in 15 mins by Foscam technical team.

Don't get biased by other comments regarding technical set-ups. Just use the guide, and you will be fine.

And cut the drama regarding technical specs. READ the product specification and you will not what you get before you buy it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Do not count on any support
review_body: Purchased two cameras.  Following the poorly written instructions that came with the cameras, the web instructions, and multiple YouTube videos the first camera was not able to connect wirelessly.  Following the exact same steps, the second camera connected on the first try.  Again following the poorly written instructions, the web instructions, and multiple YouTube on port-forwarding, I was unable to set up the cameras to view remotely.  I contacted technical support from my office (technical support is advertised on their website as only available 9-6 cst m-f) just to ask some basic questions (translating my routers terminology to the terminology they used in the manual/instructions).  After waiting on hold for 20+ minutes the heavy accented woman asked a few questions and said that she would need to connect me to a technician and that I would need to call back when I was in front of my computer.  I asked for any other options, because I work 7:30-6:00 every day and live 40 mins from my office.  No other option. The next day I took a long lunch, cam home and called.  Again after a 20 min wait on hold, heavily accented person ask the same questions and then he said that he needed my phone number to have the technician call me within the next two hours.  Told him that I would be boxing these cameras back up and sending them back, because this was not right.  He asked if he could schedule a call back to me first thing Saturday morning, because they are open 9-6 for support on Saturdays. I told him that would be fine.  No call as of 1pm on Saturday.  I called tech support and they are closed.  Neat product, but poor support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Good for the price.    Cons I have encountered so far:  I haven't gotten the sound to work (on Mac Safari -- I may have also tried Mac Firefox, but nothing else), so the features and where these features are supported could be clearer.  No https (SSL) over the world wide web.  (I confirmed with Foscam).  Amazonian 2082 said, \\"Anyone else have a sneaky suspicion that someone in (guess where?) is looking at what I'm looking at?\\".  Without https, more people than you think could be looking.  The work around I have yet to try is to use additional hardware to setup a secure SSL https connection over the www to indirectly connect to the camera inside the LAN, rather than port forwarding the camera directly.  No ability to turn off \\"infrared in use\\" lamps, so that could draw unwanted attention to the camera.  Significant click noise when you switch to/from infrared.    Pros:  Pretty quiet when rotating.  Another reviewer supplied a link to the SDK.  Infrared picked up dust particles floating in my home which I did not see in color mode nor with my naked eye, so that prompted me to improve my home air quality.    NOTE:  I have not yet tested significant features such as the Mail Service, MSN, FTP, Alarm, nor Scheduler settings.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: camera works great. sandra was amazing got my camera up n working on wireless in no time. cantwaitto use this for watching the baby when we areaway from home. buy this camera for your home or any survallience usage!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I know people have been suspicious of the overwhelming positive feedbacks and maybe perhaps some were from the manufacture itself but I'm just an ordinary guy who is expecting a newborn and was throwing the idea around of using this as a baby monitor. I finally decided to give it a try and made the purchase last week. Now, I'm no network guru nor am I totally new to logging in to my router and making some adjustments. I also played with my network and got it to where I can share and view all of my 4 laptops and 1 HTPC in the house and that's the extent of my network knowledge.

I started my adventure at 7pm by hooking up the camera to the router and immediately found the IP address using my router login (I have uVerse all in one). The CD software simply acquires cam IP address for you so it's definitely not needed if you know how to look around your router. The issue I had was that I don't know if it was my network or my macbook or dell laptop but it was extremely slow. I had to play around the adjustments, rebooting this and that and couldn't get anything. But eventually, after taking a break and trying a different port, it finally came up! I was then able to enter my wireless information and port forwarding. I was able to view this camera using my home IP address, which is very cool! Now another issue came when I unplugged the camera - for whatever reason, it would not work just on my wireless network! Very frustrating. This is where I am right now, trying to troubleshoot this issue. Even with all this issue, I think this camera is definitely worth it. Night vision is simply mind blowing. Having said that, I'll probably get two more and place them around the house. I'm probably going to build a home surveillance system using few of these cameras and two USB web cams that I have which will make it a very effective at a minimal cost.

**EDIT** **10/26/2012**
The reason why I had such difficult time to get this camera connected wifi was because I have MAC filtering on my network and the Foscam cameras come with two MAC addresses of which both are on the bottom of the device. Make sure you get those two MAC addresses entered if you have MAC filtering. This setup would have taken me minutes if it wasn't for that. Also, I'm using iCam and ipCam viwer and have it set up on no-ip.org. I simply love this camera, I'm going to have another one to use as my baby monitor. I also have two USB cameras (Logitech and Microsoft) connected to my HTPC and they work pretty well when there's light but the Foscam works especially well when even it's pitch dark with the IR.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Overrated product - don't fall for the fake ?? positive reviews

I do not have a degree in computer sciences but was always able to repair my computers myself (e.g. replace displays in laptops) and setup wireless sharing between two or more computers. However, I gave up on this product. If you are looking for a wired camera that is standing next to your modem (given the range of the included cord), then this is ok. product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
pros- it's small and has a cute design

cons- doesn't zoom, hard to set-up, break up recordings (not continuous), was on the phone waiting for customer service to pick up 45 mins later. when i hung up, they immediately called me- think they have caller id

i had to call customer service many times to get this set-up. i followed the instructions exactly but still didn't get it to work. their customer service dept had to make an appointment with me to do it for me. they linked it and set it up for me. still there is no continuous recording so i need to call them back. it's a very basic camera and doesn't have any special features or programs. you can't manipulate the camera very much other than moving the lens up, down, left and right. night vision doesn't work very well either. if i had to do it over, i wouldn't buy this. take the time to research and see other cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great IP web camera for the price
review_body: I first bought this camera for indoor surveillance to try it out. The initial setup was difficult and required different steps than what the manual explained. But I reached out to Foscam support team and they e-mailed me a very helpful document that explained step by step how to properly setup the IP address to a new camera out of the box. I also viewed some YouTube videos for more detailed setup of this camera, once the setup got completed; I have been able to view this camera remotely through 3G service from anywhere on my IPHONE. The foscam camera has never lost service with my WI-FI, I was so happy with this product that I ordered 2 more for my outdoor patios. Although they do not specify they are outdoor cameras, I installed the other 2 outdoors; so far they have handled the outdoor weather very good. I strongly recommend this product to anyone looking for an affordable IP web camera. If you encounter any issues with the setup, don't get discouraged, call or e-mail the foscam tech support team and they will help you out. Now when I go on vacations, I feel relaxed knowing that I can check out my home anytime I want. The IR light works GREAT for night vision too.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The positives: resolution of the camera, ability to rotate, easy to access via the Net.  The negatives: the installation instructions are awful, so I had to spend 2 hours with a technical representative.  Also the ability to control via a Mac or iPhone is suspect.  You can view fine, but it's very difficult to get the controls to respond.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Great Customer Support!!!

Called in with an issue about trying to set my camera to view remote(not on the network). Called the Foscam helpline and was immediately helped by Ralph Mendez. He took his time explaining everything and helped to correct the work that I had already started. Although it took sometime he stayed patient and committed to get the job done. Very happy with the service and camera is working great. Going to purchase another camera soon!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The camera arrived quickly and was easy to set up on the wireless network, but getting it working for remote viewing over the internet took me 2 days! I am pretty good with computers, but the instructions aren't great. Once I figured out the port forwarding I was able to get it to work.

I liked it enough to order another and the setup went much better. Only problem I have now is that when trying to view in multi-device it says it can't connect to the 2nd camera. It has worked before, so I don't know what the problem is now.

The camera's defintely serve their purpose. I wanted to be able to check on the house, kids and dogs when at work. It's obvoiously not very discreet looking, but that's ok for me.

I like the motion sensor features so that I don't have to stare at the cameras all the time. I get an email notification when it detects movement.

One disappointment is that I can't view through the front windows with the camera, it just looks all white and washed out from the sun. I suppose that's an issue with most cameras. I tried the outdoor settings, but it didn't help.

For the price, these cameras are great. Great quality, clear pictures, motion detection, night viewing and internet remote viewing all make this camera a great buy for the price.

I may buy more. I don't think you can go wrong with these. But Good luck with the initial setup!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great IP cam for the money
review_body:
This is hands down the best IP camera on the market.
It is easy to set up locally and works with macs and iphone through safari browser or apps. However it is difficult to set up to use outside you home network. You have to search though tens of different tutorials and how to's.
I managed to set it up with apple extreme router but when it broke and i bought belkin router i could not do it again... So if you know how to set up port forwarding and DNS you will be fine and if you have no clue good luck!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The camera itself works fine and has great features for wired connection or static IP use. If you get the mobile app (on iPhone for $6.99), you'll supposedly be able to control and record directly into your phone, which is awesome. That being said, I'm having  a terrible time going through installation. Camera loses connectivity all the time because its IP keeps changing and the permanent IP setting just won't work. Without that I have no remote access to the camera (on computer, phone, tablet, etc), and I see no point on accessing the camera only when I'm home.  I'm in contact with support by email (they work only Mon-Fri and during business hours) but we haven't moved forward an inch, at least they reply. I have been in contact with them for 5 days now. I'll update this review if the issue ever gets solved.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
such great customer service. Calvin Harris hooked my remote acees up in minutes
I can recommend this camera for its pan/tilt

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Based on the reviews, I thought I would give this a shot.  I can't help but compare it to the Sharx SCNC2607 because I also own that.  I primarily use these as toddler cams.  The Foscam graphical user interface is not that great.  In fact, it requires significant reductions in IE security to run the Active X controls.  I am viewing it on my desktop with either Chrome or Firefox and it works reasonably well.  The ability to move the camera is a nice feature but there is no zoom function. The audio is completely useless.  There is tremendous feedback.  The Sharx is a much more expensive camera but has very good audio and a zoom feature.  The IR on both is very good.  For the price (roughly a third of the Sharx) it is a reasonable purchase.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera Very Good at beginning- Tech Support Not so a year later.............
review_body:
I have had this camera for quite some time. I recently had a computer crash and bought a new PC- I could not locate the software nor user manual to set up my camera on the new PC. I wrote Tech Support. They responded very quickly but only with, \\"The best bet would be to look underneath this page:
[...]

I did, but I was not very enlightened. I wrote back and received this, \\"We have the user manuals for the cameras under that site, the software is also there, which model did you have?\\"

I had already gave them the model number and told them my problem. Now I am being run around and tossed back and forth between two different people. Still no fix. I downloaded the so called user manual which only opens the first page in PDF (?) and the I can't figure out how to log into the software as the password doesn't work.
WARNING!!! Keep your software and manual close!
I am buying another camera.
Buy a different camera!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The software on this product was a total joke. It would not work. I ended up having to send it back. Total disappointment.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: What a Disaster and Chat support is a JOKE
review_body:
I have installed several wireless devices on my router and this one is a Disaster. The Chat support is also a JOKE.

One thing I learned from this is NEVER believe the RATINGS !!!!!!! I dont think this even deserve a One Star.

Dont Buy this camera !!!!!!! You are better off with the Dlink.

RP

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
This is a great camera for the money. I access the camera from my phone to see if my garage doors are open/shut.
Configuring it was pretty straight forward. Only issues will be in configuring your providers port forwarding. I've only
used it \\"wired\\" mode so can't comment on wireless config. Image quality in good light (accessed over the web) is really good,
better than some far more expensive webcams.

I'm getting a few more. Great cameras!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I recently purchased the Foscam 8910W but have little knowledge about computers in general.  Luckily, Foscam has a helpful staff of tech support people.  My support person was Calvin (I believe his last name was Harris) and he literally breezed me through the setup so that my camera is now completely functional on my wireless network.  It is difficult to find REAL customer support these days but I was impressed by Calvin's patience (I'm somewhat hearing impaired).  Thanks to Foscam (which needs to give Calvin a raise, as he has been a good ambassador for the company.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The Foscam FI8910W IP Camera, although amazingly priced, was a nightmare to get working. Two problems I encountered while setting my Foscam up (on a windows computer): (1) If you use Internet Explorer, be prepared to disable your security settings, ie. Firewall, Anti-Virus, etc.; because you will need to install ActiveX for your camera work; for my windows computer, it would not allow me to install ActiveX no matter what I did. (2)If you use Mozilla Firefox you will not need to install ActiveX, but you will not be able to record; an outside software would need to be installed on your computer; I would recommend using Vitamin-d.com, but that wouldn't work on my computer either.  Another problem I had with Foscam was there Customer Support; DO NOT BOTHER CALLING THEM, they will NOT pick up.  Your best bet would be to email them; this is due to the fact that they are in India.  Not to say they aren't helpful, but it takes a while to get in contact with them.  The last problem I had with the Foscam is the night vision setting, if you plan on installing the Foscam inside your home, office, etc. pointing outside your window, the lights on the front of the Foscam will reflect; so the image you will see on your Foscam will be a circle of small lights.  If you do decide to buy this product and return it back to Amazon.com, they will charge you to return the product, so make sure this is what you want.  Thank you.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Camera works really well, Support is fabulous
review_body:
This camera works well. The software is upgraded and easy to use.
Tcechnical support is great, Ricky was quick to understand the required setup and just did it.
I bought also EasyN camera, but the support was not good. Foscam figured out what customers need and setup excellent support.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I love this camera and the support from Foscam was outstanding!
review_body: I love this camera and the support from Calvin Harris at Foscam was outstanding!  I had an issue accessing the camera remotely, and Calvin did an amazing job of helping me.  I can view the camera now and am very happy with my purchase!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: solid camera so far, good price
review_body:
We got this to use as a baby monitor because we could use a web browser, tablet app, or iPhone app to monitor the camera (with audio) and save close to $100 over anything decent in the video baby monitor world, and get a bigger screen while we're at it. I don't regret that so far.

PROS:
Set up was easier than some reviews led me to believe. From a Mac OS perspective, the included CD only had a very simple utility that finds the IP address of the camera. There are plenty of other ways for the computer-savvy to find that address as well. Plug the camera into your router, type that IP into your web browser and you get full controls. From there, you can enable the wireless, turn on the motion alarm, etc.

- The quality is surprisingly good. I generally leave it at the 320px resolution because the motion is smoother.
- When the camera moves and tilts, it's very quiet. Since like I said we're using it for a baby monitor, that's important.
- There are numerous iOS and Android apps out there. Even searching \\"Foscam\\" in the store will bring up plenty of results.
- I haven't had to deal with support yet, but Foscam's website has a lot of good information in their user forums. It's a popular enough camera that there are a lot of other forums out there with people talking about them and working through issues.

CONS:
I can't get audio to work through a web browser, unless you're using Windows with Internet Explorer. This is due to Foscam (for some reason) using Videolan's lapsed web plugins which I just can't get to work. Streaming the camera directly from Videolan's open-source VLC app will give you sound though on Mac, Windows, or Linux. Since I don't normally need to use the controls for the camera, I usually just stream it that way. I also downloaded a couple iOS apps that have both sound and controls.

- There is a delay with audio of about a second. How you feel about that probably depends on how you're going to use the camera.

Overall, I haven't had it for too awfully long but my impression is very good.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Easy to setup and use if you are a bit savvy
review_body: Overall I'd say the camera is easy to use and setup if you are a bit tech savvy and know what to do with it.  There are endless options to configure and works well with no-ip.org for outside access using the DDNS service.  The instructions do not go over every configuration option so it'll take a bit of time to route through everything, most of the options are not needed for the average user.  I recommend getting [...] for the iphone, there is also an ipad app.  Overall great camera for the price and the endless options that are available with it's setup and functionality.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: great ip camera for the price
review_body:
For the price, I think it's a great-value camera. I was able to successfully setup the camera wired and wireless without any problems. I don't have any background with networking configuration at all but I do admit, the instructions included need to be a little bit more detailed. I assigned a permanent ip through my router (I have AT&T U-verse/2wire) and had to reboot my router after connecting the camera through ethernet for setting up wireless since the wireless ip address did not show automatically in my devices list-the foscam camera has two different ip addresses for the wired and wireless, important to note that). And I was able to remotely access the camera in my ipad and iphone through the $5 app as well as hosting it through No-ip for free after updating the firmware to the latest. To access outside of my local network like when I'm at work, all I need to do is type my external ip address with the opened port on the browser to access the camera. I'm thinking of upgrading my no-ip membership to the $9.95 a year one for a more-hassle free dynamic dns.

For port-forwarding, I created a rule to host port 8090 through my router and so far no problems. I created usernames and password for family members who are overseas and assigned them as \\"visitors\\" in the user settings and they were able to access the camera using my external ip address and port just fine.

Quality of the image is alright for the price. Two-way audio needs improvement. We had to be close to the camera to hear the sound coming from the speaker.

Over-all, it's a really good ip camera for the price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The video quality is very good. The night vision is amazing. The microphone is very sensitive - maybe too much so, as I have to turn the volume down a click or two on my iphone so I don't hear the background noise. We're using a foscam app on the iphone and we use it as the monitor. You can pan the camera, speak through the camera and record video through it. You can also set it up to run in the background like a phone call, so you can use it as an audio monitor (and it doesn't suck the battery life of the phone as quickly). You can still receive a phone call (it just kills the app). So far it looks like just under an hour of constant audio and video up on the iphone screen used about 25% of my battery. When I put it in the background so I just heard the audio constantly (the screen was off) for over an hour and a half it used about about 15% of my battery. You can use your browser to monitor the video, as well, but on the mac, there is an issue of the audio not working in the browser. When on the computer I use the application VLC to monitor the audio and video. It works well, but of course, you can't use the camera controls (move the camera) or speak through the camera.
So, it has its flaws, but for what we're using it for, it is pretty awesome and much cheaper than a lot of the better video baby monitors.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have received a broken wireless camera, cannot be recognize the ip address by windows OS vista or 7 !!!!!!!!
I have tried all kind of tricks with my modem without resolution, and I'm an IT pro with 12 years of experience !
Bad seller !!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I had only used Axis cameras before purchasing this item. Although the reviews here are very positive, the comments led me to believe this was a cheaply made product, albeit at a good price point. My take is a bit different... I am very impressed with the build quality and the performance of this camera. Just for reference, an Axis PTZ camera will set you back about $1200 dollars (12 times the price). While the Foscam camera lacks a zoom feature, it has self contained invisible night illumination and the Axis does not.

If you are using the camera for home or office where the distances are reasonable (as opposed to a warehouse or big box store where you need to zoom in on a shoplifters hands), this is your camera. The 24 hour ir illumination will cover a room or hallway nicely at night when the room lights are out.

The product came nicely protected and included a CD with mac and pc instructions, a paper easy start guide, a sturdy adjustable bracket for wall ceiling or tabletop mounting, and a neat retractable spool ethernet cable. The camera body has a nice matte finish. The instructions are clear and thorough, although setting up any wireless network camera with internet access could throw a newbie into a tailspin. Very impressed.

I have the camera hooked up to a Synology network server for motion recording on a wireless LAN, and VPN in for mobile and mac-based access. I have no use for the two-way audio and have not tested it. I have already ordered more cameras.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I almost considered this a waste of $100. I got it set up wirelessly OK, and could see the video feed on Mac Firefox and Safari, but the quality was just terrible. Huge lags, frozen video, low framerate - I thought I had bought a piece of junk. By chance I tried an iPhone webcam viewer and found out quickly the camera is fine; it's the software that's the problem. Web browsers just don't work well with this camera. On the Mac, Vitamin D viewer shows a really good framerate. Foscam needs to include a native cam viewer with this hardware to avoid problems like this.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Issue: Port Forwarding
On 9-15-2015 I contacted Ricky at Foscam tech support for help with this issue. He fixed my problem with the proper settings.
My camera is now working with my Iphone 4 using 3G network.
He was great to work with.
This camera is amazing and the price is right. I am going to order one for out door use.
Ricky suggested the 8904W. Thanks to Foscam and Ricky for all their help.

On 9-17-2012 I talked to Calvin on another issue. The IP address I use to access my camera on my Iphone 4 3G network keeps changing.
Calvin set me up with a IP address with NO-IP.com. (it's free) Using that address I can now use my phone to view my camera anywhere with my 3G network.
Foscam tech support is excellent.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I love this camera and the applicable app for my cell phone. The camera display is very clear and colors are true. Being able to see a live view of my home via my cell phone is a comfort. I bought two cams, and they are a nice compliment to my entire home security system of alarms and outside surveillance cams.
The setup was easy, though you do have to have knowledge of routing through your modem and setting up email forwarding for alerts. If I can get through it successfully, anyone can because I am not that techincally savvy. The guide book was very helpful and whoever did the technical writing for the manual had us ordinary and not so technical people in mind. Great product FOSCAM!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great hardware, horrible software and instructions
review_body:
Clearly, the Foscam deserves five stars for the hardware- great picture quality, wide range of movements, quiet motor. Setting up the camera on my home network was relatively easy, but the pain starts if you want to view the picture outside of your home network. Not being an IT expert, i quickly hit the bottom of my knowledge and instruction manual and website were of ZERO help...let me try few more times and if I do not succeed, the camera goes back....

Ok no luck after a week of intermittent trying - thus sending the cam back this week....

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
First of all, we decided to go with this less expensive option as our baby cam, mainly because it would come in handy for other uses later in time when we don't need it as a baby monitor. Mounting the holding bracket was fast (two screws) and with the vertical flip option, we chose the upper corner and did an upside down installation. This gives us much more coverage and viewing angle of the whole room, so we can even see the baby and follow him around when he's playing outside the crib.

Image quality decent, it gives 320x240 and 640x480 resolution, which is enough to be used as a monitor. The management section of the Real-Time Camera Monitoring System offers many more options than what we need so I can't comment on those characteristics.
The night vision capabilities and quality of IR are nothing short of AMAZING (I realized this as in the monitor the image was incredibly clear and lit, but when I stepped into the room it was completely pitch dark, I couldn't see my own hands). The IR light do make a clicking sound when they come on or off, but nothing that would be disturbing. We have the camera connected with Ethernet cable (we tried the wireless option and worked great also) but on the flip side for us, the connectivity lights behind the base unit create little distraction at night for the baby. As it's not intended to be a silent Baby monitor, we can't really complain about this, just a note.

Overall, this was an excellent purchase, we even have set it to broadcast outside our LAN, so image can be shared with others through a web address. We are even considering purchasing more of this model or it's subsequent upgrades in the future, to serve as a security system for our house.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The camera hardware is pretty good and gives surprisingly good quality video, including night vision mode. I have tried it in a virtually dark room and it is possible to make out people moving in detail. Any decent light gives good color and smooth motion that is better than the average youtube video.

The cons have all to do with software, which has a school project feel to it at best. The video monitoring requires signing up for third party websites and leaves me wondering about the privacy and security of the feed. The documentation is written in poor english and requires the user to have a pretty solid technical background. Novices should stay away. There are a few iOS apps which make accessing the feed from an iphone much easier (I tried the free \\"baby monitor for ip camera\\" and so far I would recommend it, although it has some issues in controlling the camera movement/panning).

Overall, this is an ok solution if you are tech savvy but it clearly is a fail in user experience.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this to monitor our newborn downstairs.  The picture quality is excellent and allows me to watch tv while watching my son with my ipad concurrently.  I highly recommend.  It'd be five stars but I had some trouble during the setup but it's definitely worth the cost.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: good camera, two way audio terrible, audio just keep echoing,to speak you have to turn on the mike and shut off the speaker.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
As someone who's on the road for business 18-22 days a month, I wanted a way to keep an eye on my house while I'm gone. Until I purchased this camera, I'd simply have no idea if my house was broken into, flooded, etc. until I'd return home and find out for myself. The peace of mind is easily worth the $100 price tag. I've got it set to show the entryway, with the motion alarm armed. So far, it's worked as advertised. Initially I got a few false motion alarms, but I've enabled motion compensation and reduced the sensitivity slightly. Seems to be working fine.

Yes, setup is kind of a beast if you're not familiar with networking. I didn't have to contact tech support over it, but I'm fairly tech savvy and know how my router operates. If I can offer two suggestions that may or may not work for every router:

1. Change the camera's default port. It defaults to 80, which is the standard HTTP port used for websites. For some reason, no matter how much I worked at it, my router would not accept inbound connections on port 80 to the camera. I changed it to a random port, and it works fine. This can be done under the \\"Basic Network Settings\\" menu. That leads me to the next point...

2. Enable UPnP in the camera settings. For me, I didn't have to set up any type of port forwarding once the router recognized the camera.

My IP address is static, which reduces the complexity. No DNS issues to deal with.

Overall, pretty much exactly what I expected for the cost. 4 stars only for the difficult setup.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Decent low-cost option, but not perfect
review_body: Updated review 11/15  I purchased another unit on sale direct from Foscam as I needed a different color. This unit had newer firmware, but I still needed to update it to the current version on the Foscam website. The web ui still does not work correctly on Chrome (three years and no changes?) and I could only use IE 8 on WinXP or IE10/11 on Win8.1 to properly get the active-x plugin to install. IE11 on Windows 10 did not work for me.   On top of that, the picture quality of this newer version of the FI8910W is not as sharp as the older model I have (which still works as I don't have it plugged in all the time so it hasn't had a chance to burn out). They kinda went backwards in quality and lowered the price a little.    I knocked my review another star for lack of update to this model for browser support and for poor picture quality. You wouldn't know the picture was bad unless you had another unit to compare it to. Now for my use, I just needed a way to see if I had a package outside my door or if someone was knocking or ringing door bells while I was upstairs. I have it installed under an eave that is dry. For that purpose it is ok. Forget trying to grab screen shots or clips with any detail for security use as everything is pretty much blurry or choppy (frame rate issue). For that you might want to try the 960p FI9821W or the Amcrest 1080p model at twice the price of this unit.    Note: I used the Foscam software on the CD to find the camera on my DHCP network and immediately set a static IP and turned on wireless for all other configuration. Using a LAN cable directly to the unit is the best way to get it up and running and configured before power down and placement/install. (I used a powerline ethernet adapter to make life easy as I have powerline in the house).   -------------------------- original review from 2012  I've had the FI8910W for one week. In that time it has lost its set position three times while hosted on iSpyConnect. I don't know why. Maybe it isresetting itself? The product came with the latest firmware so I was happy about that. Maybe the camera is supposed to be mounted with the camera in its default position pointing where you want it? Don't know. I am not going to mount it yet. One star off.  The second issue I had was with the browser setup. I didn't want to connect the camera to a router and then figure out the IP so I decided to use a cross-over cable and static IPs. The Foscam software found the unit and allowed me to set the static IP without going onto the web page. This is a plus. However, the camera does not look like it will support IE9. I tried two PCs and nada. I had to install Firefox before I could log into the camera and set the wireless settings and change the user password. Another star off.  Even so, the picture is great, night vision is decent, and it is supported by iSpyConnect. Although the power cable is too short (aren't we expected to mount these on the ceiling?) I won't knock another star off. I would only use this for situations that might require panning and tilting (there is no zoom). For fixed positions such as doorways and entryways, I will test out the Foscam FI8909W.  As for wireless reception my maximum test distance was 20-25 feet.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I'm really pleased with this camera. Good quality, lots of features. FInally got everything working with my Mac. Took me a while though, which is why I'm only giving it four stars. If it had a better Mac interface, it would be 5 stars.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: The wireless camera works great as long as it remains within 20 feet of the router.  Beyond that the camera does not work.  The camera I purchased came with the 9dbi antenna.  The sofware does not work on IE11.  There support department is awful.   I am left with a camera that has limited functionality

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Only negative is I only bought one
review_body: This is a great camera, setup was OK, directions are a little confusing if you don't have basic knowledge of networking.  Setup up statics for both the Ethernet and wireless MACs and pick a different random port than 80. Purchased IP cam viewer from the app market and it worked right away.  Wish the resolution and frame rate were a little better, but that is what the H.264 and HD models are for.  Overall great IP cam, will be picking up more when they go on sale.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: I know lots more about networking now!
review_body:
I am a noephite network user and intermediate computer user. The camera works well once all hurdles have been overcome. It is not easy as it seems that the instructions were translated from chinese to maybe german and finally english. They are not crystal clear.

The included software CD will install the \\"IP Camera Tool\\". This helps you locate the camera on your local network (LAN).

Before double-clicking on your \\"discovered\\" camera, if you are using Internet Explorer, you will need to go into the internet tools section of IE and enable \\"download and run unsigned active X\\". If you are using IE, the camera has to install an unsigned active X to run correctly. This is the first real pain as there are about three locations in tools that have to be enabled before IE will allow this active X to be installed. Double click the camera location in the IP camera tool, and the camera will install the active X and then you will be looking at the camera's log in page. I made a short cut in favorites to get to this page. Log in information is actually in the instructions. At this point you will be able to use the camera on your LAN.

To make it available on the world wide web, it is necessary to enable port forwarding in the router. My router and modem are all-in-one device supplied by ISP. The camera ships with port 80 enabled. Called tech support at ISP and they walked me through setting up port forwarding in the router. Once that has been accomplished, you can access the camera via the wide area network IP of your modem. Problem is this IP changes every day so I signed up with DynDNS.org to keep track of this constantly (dynamic) changing WAN IP. DynDns actually had software built into my modem/router that enabled DynDns to track the IP and link it to a web address. Now I just go to the web address and it takes me to the log in page of the camera. This is the best tutorial I found is the DNS wizard at DynDns.org.

The active X thing wasthe most difficult to solve as there are I think three diffent boxes that have to be enabled in the security section/custom settings of Tools/Internet Options/ in XP version of IE8. Reviewing the downloaded PDF instructions from Foscam, section 4.1.3 outlines setting up IE to accept the active X. Once that was solved, everything else was accomplished with the software that resides in the router. (port forwarding) and (dynamic DNS) I have not tried the sound yet. Picture is good. Camera IR reflects off of window at night and blinds the camera. Controls take a little practice but work fine. Presets work well to. I like having three levels of access to camera so the guest have restricted control of pan/tilt. This is a lot of technology for the money and a lot of fun when finally working.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
The reviews are bogus!

If you are very technical savvy and understand port forwarding and setting up your own IP address go for it, however these cameras do not stay online, you have to constantly fix them and call technical support to do it often waiting on hold for 30 minutes or more.

I dont have that kind of time or patience, I want something that works once you set it up and continues to work... And not spend $200 on something that is a huge pain in the ass and a piece of junk!

Also, foscam has a 14 day return policy with a 15% restocking fee.

You may as well throw them in the garbage!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Good cam, very bad account managment
review_body: This is my first ip cam and so far its not bad. I've created two accounts so that my wife and I can log it to view it. What I notice that it will allow you to log in as any name you want with out a password! If foscam can't fix this ASAP, I might have to create my own secured website and redirect the camera traffic through it.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Bought 3 as an intro to wireless IP Cameras to my network. I was a bit apprehensive at first, but setup was very intuitive and quick. Nice quality all around. Linking this through a dyndns server was a bit of a pain, but I eventually figured it out. One drawback on the camera is that everytime certain parameters are re-set the camera must re-boot which takes up time and becomes a bit annoying and repetitive. An unexpected glitch occurred when I placed the camera at the front window to watch the yard and driveway. This worked beautifully during the day, but when infrared kicks on at night, the reflection of the infrared is bounced back by the glass. If you need to monitor outside, then the camera must be placed outside to avoid this. Not sure if this model is weather proof, so I may have to acquire one that is.

Got online and bought the Foscam app, I highly suggest that you do the same. It's worth the $6+ as it offers full functionality through your tablet. Setting up the app is easier than the actual camera setup itself.

It will be nice to travel and keep an eye on things from far away. Next challenge is having the cameras record to my network drive or to a remote cloud.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Very cool - watch YouTube installation first
review_body:
Got this up and running and viewable via my iPad and iPhone in about an hour or so.

VERY helpful to watch YouTube video from \\"Awkward Hamster\\" who has a couple of step-by-step videos. The small installation booklet they send is very minimal and makes more sense once you watch someone else do it and explain it.

NOTE: the dyndns.org Dynamic IP address forwarding that is specified in the installation is NOT FREE. (or at least I couldn't find a way to not give it my credit card)

The YouTube video shows how to set this up using no-ip.com for free. It is working well for me.

I'm ready to buy my outdoor model now. I love being able to watch my stay-at-home dog-cam during the day.

Great product and price.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Fantastic support.
Could not figure wireless setup out.
Called them. Instant resolution from Harry Foster!
Really great and fast. Knowledgable. Resolved the problem.
Camera works great!!
Will buy more of these and install at my rental property!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I have one FI8918W and I LOVE IT! Perfectly reliable and always gets the job done. I've also heard that these FI8910W's are great.
I was on Amazon tonight to buy a few more of them (or these FI8910W's) but noticed that the Foscam website now has a new model, the FI9820W (not yet available on Amazon). It has 720p resolution, H.264 compression, and and onboard SD card slot (all three are GREAT FEATURES), but I haven't had a chance to check it out any more than that. I'll definitely be considering the NEW new model. Just a heads-up.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: Easy to set up for local viewing...slightly longer for Over the Internet viewing using DDNS.  That took about 20 minutes. Using an iPad app to view. Quality of image is pretty good and remote commands responsive.  Would love to have the ability to rotate the camera a full 360 and zero in on objects but for the price I can't complain.  I was so happy with my first 2 cameras I bought 4 more.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
[[ASIN:B006ZP8UOW Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - Black NEWEST MODEL]]

The Foscam FI8910W is the successor to the original FI8918W camera which is a fine camera for the price. The FI8910W however, while billed as an improvement, does not live up to it's claims. The FI8910W adds an Automatic IR-Cut Filter which filters out IR light from normal daytime pictures which greatly enhances the color quality over that of the FI8918W. When in almost total darkness, the IR-Cut Filter drops out, and you get the typical grey/green picture of the darkend room like all other IR cameras. The problem with the FI8910W is that the automatic IR-Cut Filter is so sensitive that with only a very small amount light in the room, either low light, or a small point source in an otherwise dark room, it IR-Cut Filter doesn't drop out. So even though the IR lights are illuminating the room, the IR-Cut Filter, filters all the IR light out, and the room appears the same as if the IR lights were not on. There is no way to either adjust the sensitivity of this feature, or to disengage it all together. This is a serious shortcoming which makes this camera inferior to it's predicessor for about twice the price. Until Foscam can fix the sensitivity issue, Avoid this camera at any price. You WILL be disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I wanted to like this product. I tried to like this. I've heard nothing but good reviews from other moms. I loved it for the first few days. I hated the installation process. It wouldn't cooperate with my computer. Now, three days after installing it, it has failed. I can't access it from my computer or my iPhone. I'm really disappointed.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: My wife wanted a video baby monitor, but I was unhappy with the quality and price of video baby monitors. I purchased this camera and it is amazing. The video quality is awesome and we can view it from our iPhones and iPads (free Apps available). This was the best choice by a long shot. However, I can see how setup can be difficult if you have never configured devices over a home wireless network.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
If you own a Mac and are using an Airport Express router, you cannot set up this camera. The camera requires that it be connected via Ethernet cable to your router for setup. The Airport Express has a single Ethernet port meaning that you have to disconnect your modem to plug in the camera, thereby losing Internet access and making setup impossible.

Additionally, the accompanying installation guide is a Windows .doc file that is only partially compatible with Pages, Preview, and TextEdit. Hard copy documentation is included.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: This camera will be used to monitor a sick room.  Sean -technical support - did a wonderful job setting the camera up and he made it wireless so that I can peek in using the web.  I am very pleased with the camera and will probably purchase another to monitor my front door.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I'm impressed with the image quality, ease of use. Not impressed with control software. Had to return the first one because the reset button broke off. Overall, a solid 4 star product.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I bought this camera with the anticipation that the picture quality was going to be so so and the software set-up wasn't going to go easily.  WAS I WRONG!! After getting so far with the software installation, I hit a brick wall, as the expression goes. So I called technical support and spoke to Sean. Within a few minutes after he got into my computer, everything was working GREAT!! The IPhone app works in 3G seamlessly (I use my PC to view over my LAN) and the clarity and vibrant colors of the picture are beyond what I expected! Sean was great to deal with to the point that I would ask him a question (which even I didn't understand what the heck I was trying to say) and immediately he made it happen!!  I would have given the product & support 10 stars if I could have!!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I got the two pack of these cameras. They were very simple to set up even using a Mac. It came with a program to scan for the camera's IP and then connect to configure them. At first the IE Active-X login wouldn't work. Then they came out with a firmware update. Once this was applied, the IE logon allowed the control to install and enabled many more features than just the \\"Push\\" Firefox type viewing. In addition, I found a great IOS program that runs on the Iphone and Ipad and allows me total control AND two way audio. The night vision works great too. At least up to about 10 feet or so. Only problem appears to be that moths can see the infrared and love to perform acrobatics to show off and it causes the motion detect to go off. But overall, for the price they are hard to beat (with the latest firmware). I love the ability to move in almost any direction too. It also allows FTP and Email notification of alarm conditions so I can instantly know when something is there. The only complaint I would have is that I can't set a motion detect zone or zones like my old D-Link camera could. I'd like to be able to just monitor a portion of the field of view for motion instead of the apparent averaging of overall frame motion, so I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5, but still for the low cost, it's great.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
Amazon - Speedy Service. I ordered two cameras on Saturday, 8/25 and received them today 8/28. 3 days, free delivery, FAST. THANKS

When I opened my packaging, I immediately decided to install the cameras myself, proving everyone who made a review and claimed that this was difficult to install was wrong. However, that didn't work, I did not place the cord in the correct place and it could not find the ip adress, so I called FOSCAM Customer service and \\"Smith\\" helped me. I must give him a 10 out of 10 for customer service. He displayed patience and helped me to navigate through the system to install two cameras. After 30-45 minutes, he installed both cameras, set it up to be viewed from a DDNS (free one), and made my cameras email me when it detects a motion. His help was worth the aggrevation. So if you are not good at computer software installation, call customer service. You will save yourself a headache, becaue I could not have done all that he did.

I am so thankful to \\"Smith\\" for helping me, as I would have been lost installing it by myself.

I am continuing to learn how to navigate my new \\"security system\\", which is a better option for me than paying an alarm company hundred of dollars for their cameras and system equipment.

For all the people who are looking to by this product, I believe that this was a great purchase and you will be pleased and happy as I am.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: great product and exceptional customer support
review_body:
I received this camera today. Initial set-up was easy. Unfortunately, my lack of technical expertise stopped me from completing the complete installation and eventual wireless monitoring of the camera. I called FOSCAM and talked to ANZAN. He immediately took control and my computer and camera. He is a miracle worker. He set my camera up for my home network and also configured it for remote access. This entire technical customer service took him less than 15 minutes. With his help. I
am very pleased with the FOSCAM camera system. I will recommend it to friends and business associates. Thanks again, ANZAN!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Great camera, very slow control over the net
review_body: This is a nice little camera.  It's a bit bulky to install, and the power adapter requires a power plug very near wherever it is mounted.  I found the responsiveness of the camera to be very poor - it takes 30 seconds or more for the image to reflect the positioning commands you send.  It's faster over a local network, but not real-time.  Good quality and good resolution.  Night vision is good as well.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body: I purchased this camera to use as a baby monitor after reading previous customer reviews (and a lower cost option than Y-cam and other baby monitor cameras).  The wi-fi set up was easy.  I was up and going in no time.  I had a little trouble setting up 3G mainly because I'm not familiar with port forwarding and creating host sites for dynamic IP.  I eventually got it set up after searching the web for my router's settings and Foscam web support links.  I use my iphone and ipad to monitor the baby and the SunshineApps Baby Monitor app.  I turned off the alerts since they beep sometimes without the baby making the noise and the sound is on for me to hear anyway.  SunshineApps also has a NetCam2Go app where you can use the two way audio but doesn't have the alerts. This app would have suited me since I don't care for the alerts. Wish I had this camera with my first child!

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Lots of features for a great price
review_body:
I was a little bit skeptical to but these cameras, they were too cheap, but buying through amazon is most of the times a good experience. I have owned some wireless trendnet cameras and I was expecting to get a nice upgrade, so I found the opportunity. Sp this is my experience:

The good:
1. The cameras look solid, nice package and the material looks pretty decent and sturdy
2. Good image quality, 2 way sound which works great. The movement is good.
3. Lots of additional features, like motion detection, email notification, etc.
4. Easy to setup. I just changed the name, time zone and enabled wireless mode.
5. PC and iphone/ipad applications. They work great. You can move the camera, talk 2 ways, record video and pictures, configure motion detection, etc.
6. Night vision works pretty good

The bad
1. iOS app is not free, but not that expensive. It is worth it.
2. Changing some configuration settings requires to reboot the camera, not a big deal, but took me around 1 hr to configure 4 cameras.
3. Bulky. It is hard to keep them out of sight
4. Short power cables. They also have a green light, which is kind of useless
5. Configuration issues with IE active X
6. PC application is not very intuitive
7. Mic picks some noise
Configuration was easy, but it may require some technical knowledge. Some people complain about configuration issues. Visit the web site for technical support. I was able to solve my issue with the active X in internet explorer. Configuring the cameras for internet access is a router configuration, so don't complain about the cameras configuration

So far I love these cameras. They are way better than the trednet and they were less expensive. I have only a few days of ownership, so durability is a big IF, but that's a risk with most electronics.
I highly recommend these cameras

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_body:
I love the functionality of this camera, but unfortunately have now gone through THREE that all have the same issue... it takes \\"ghost\\" images (images of nothing).

Not sure if it's something with a short in the IR bulbs or what, but it basically will have one frame green or purple and then the next set with nothing. It's a light controlled room so it's not a car passing by or something like that.

I keep getting this camera, thinking that it's just a glitch with one but seems to be pretty consistent so far.

product_title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Couldn't get it to work; instructions are atrocious
review_body:
I'm usually pretty tech-savvy and have a lot of experience with unorthodox networking solutions, but I'm not a professional. I could not get this to work at all. My setup wasn't totally straightforward - I needed the camera hooked up to a router connected to a powerline adapter. Maybe if the setup had been more straightforward it would've worked. Regardless, the instructions are horribly written and unclear.

I was bummed, because it is really a nifty piece of hardware and I would've loved to be able to access the video stream from my Blackberry. Hopefully they'll figure out a way to improve their instructions and streamline the setup process a bit - then I'll try again.
